description: When you are as good as Mario Andretti the bidding for your services is brisk and the accompanying numbers are tempting. Andretti, the defending driving champion of the United States Auto Club, is in a quandary these days because of his standing commitment to the USAC

title: Ickx Gains Pole for German Grand Prix Today
description: HOCKENHEIM, Germany Aug. 1 (AP)Jackie Ickx of Belgium in a Ferrari was the first of three Formula One drivers today to stay under two minutes in final training for the 32d German Grand Prix at Hockenheim Motodrom.

title: News of the Realty Trade
In The Nation: The Television Presidency
description: WASHINGTON  The man who lost the first of the 1960 campaign debates to John Kennedy has become an expert manager of the television Presidency. Not only is Richard Nixon making astute and politically profitable use of prime time to explain his policies and ideas to the American voter; he also is demonstrating the substantive value of television to his office.

title: Small Oil Concerns Tackle Giants
description: Looking for oil, like football, is a game for giants. But, also like football, there is room for the little guy if he is just a little bit faster, tougher and smarteror luckier.

title: WESTCOTT SCORES IN ENSIGN SAILING
description: NOROTON, Conn., Aug. 1C. Raymond Westcott of the Greenwich Cove Racing Association sailed Eaglet to a 50yard victory off Noroton Yacht Club today in the only race that could be held on the opening day of the Long Island Sound Ensign Class championship regatta.

title: Frank Sullivan Through The Looking Glass
description: After a short glance around this summer's day, there is a temptation to say that humor, like God, is dead. Not to belabor the point, there certainly have been changes. Let the theologians determine what may be happening at home plate. Out in the sun field, traditional conditions are bad. A case could be made by any working sentimentalist that only one true humorist remains, and he nestling with other departing glories in upstate Saratoga. His name is Frank Sullivan.

title: Grand Funk Railroad Pleases A Full House at Fillmore East
description: Grand Funk Railroad is known largely for being the first rock group to rent, for $100,000 they say, a huge billboard in Times Square.

title: Five Patients
description: Five Patients is a guide to the modern teaching hospital written for intelligent readers. The Massachusetts General Hospital, one of the nation's best, is described. Here Michael Crichton, author of the Andromeda Strain, studied and worked as a Harvard medical student. Crichton's observations emphasize not only negative aspects such as haste, crowding, impersonality of work (particularly in emergency rooms) but also the intellectual honesty that makes teaching hospitals superior places for the diagnosis and treatment of the most complex and difficult medical problems.

title: Miss Evert Captures Final In U.S. Girls Tennis Play
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., Aug. 1 (AP)Chris Evert, 15 years old, of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., broke a fouryear jinx today in the United States Lawn Tennis Association girls 16andunder tournament. She defeated Laurie Tenney, 14, of Los Angeles, 62, 61.

title: The Governor Listeth
description: William F. Buckley Jr. lost something when Eleanor Roosevelt died: his favorite target. And The Governor Listeth, his latest collection of essays, columns, revelations, forgettabilia, etc. is the poorer for it. For instance, only once does he tell us the story about how Mrs. Roosevelt said that she would not cross picket line under any circumstances, a proclamation which gave rise to the most ineluctably rationalist reply Mr. Buckley has ever known, namely, the callit having been ascertained that she was in residencefor volunteers to picket round the clock all the exits from Hyde Park.

title: Renewed Session Of Congress Seen As Almost Certain
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1 (UPI) Senator Mike Mansfield, the majority leader, said today that a postelection session of Congress to deal with electoral reform and the defense budget was almost certain.

title: Time and Again
description: Next time you go browsing along bookstore counters your glance will fall on the jacket of this novela picture of a New York City intersection that hasn't been seen for decades: an old elevated station with one of those breathtaking, backbreaking flights of stairs up to the platform, and in the foreground a horsecar. On the back of the jacket is a photo of a horrendous fire from page 1 of Frank Leslie's Illustrated Newspaper for Feb. 11, 1882it was the catastrophe at the World Building. Inside among other fascinating pictures are sleighs speeding through Central Park and the old reservoir at Fifth Avenue and 42nd Street where the Public Library now stands.

title: Britain Revising Plans for Defense of Malaysia and Singapore, With 5Nation Commitment Envisioned
description: SINGAPORE, Aug. 1  Several points about the new British Government's defense policy have emerged during the recent visit of Lord Carrington, the British Defense Minister.

title: Laird Reported to Favor Plan To Cut Power of Joint Chiefs
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird favors a proposal by blue ribbon defense panel to deprive the Joint Chiefs of Staff Of much of their power by removing them from involvement in military operations, his associates say.

title: Article 3  No Title
FINKLE MOVES AHEAD IN MARINER SERIES
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I., Aug. 1Bill Finkle of Wantagh, L. I., opened defense of the title by posting finishes of third, fifth and first in today's three races and took the lead in the Mariner Class National Championship series.

title: FRANCES FARMER, ACTRESS, 56, DIES
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 1Frances Farmer, a leading figure on the stage and screen in the 1930's, died in the Community Hospital here this afternoon, of cancer of the esophagus. She was 56 years old, and lived on a farm in northwest Indianapolis.

title: CHINESE PRODUCE PRIMITIVE TOOLS
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 1Communist China's success in nuclear weaponry and missile development attest to the high level of its technical knowledge. But the extent to which this knowledge has found practical application is reflected in the development in Shantung of a new stove and other primitive innovations.

title: Israelis Drafting Formal Acceptance Of U.S. Proposal for Mideast Peace
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 1An Israeli ministerial committee tonight began drafting the formal terms of acceptance of the United States peace initiative, staking out its procedural positions for negotiations with the United Arab Republic.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: TodayHunterdon Hills K.C. allbread and obedience; Flemington Fairgrounds, Route 31, Flemington, N. J.; 1,075 entries; 10 A.M.

title: American Notebook
description: Perhaps it's Conglomerate Backlash that's inducing the epidemic of new, small publishing housesStraight Arrow in San Francisco; Library Press in Freeport, Li; Third Press, Emerson Hall, Winter House, Arbor House in New York.

title: U.S. JUDGES GIVE DATA ON INCOMES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1For the first time in history, Federal judges except the nine on the Supreme Court have made public reports on their outside earned income, gifts, associations and potential conflicts of interest on the bench.

title: Greenwich Team Leading Sunfish Sail for Conklin Cup
description: WESTHAMPTON BEACH, L.I., Aug. 1The Captains Harbor Racing Association of Greenwich, led after the first of two days of competition today in the invitation Sunfish team races for the Conklin Cup at the Aspatuck Y. C.

title: Lockheed Closes Georgia Facility
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Aug. (UPI)The LockheedGeorgia Company has announced it is closing its nuclear research laboratory in Dawsonville, which employs 150 persons because of a severe reduction in work available.

title: Peking 2d Largest Donor To Peru Quake Victims
description: GENEVA, Aug 1 (Reuters) Communist China was the second largest contributor of aid for victims of the Peruvian earthquakes that killed thousands of people in May, the League of Red Cross Societies has announced.

title: Walking the Walls Of Old Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEMThe walls of this ancient city have seen much over the centuries. They have witnessed the travail of Jerusalem's 16 wars, more than a dozen of which virtually destroyed the city. And now, three years after the last declared war, the walls are becoming means of seeing the city as it has never been seen before.

title: August Ripeness
description: The ripeness that is August begins to mark the land, forerunner of the autumn harvest and reminder that harvest never is a quick and readily completed seasonal achievement. It begins with the first cutting of hay in early June and it continues until the corn all picked, sometimes as late as November. It begins with the garden's radishes and scallions and peas and leaf lettuce, and it doesn't end until the last winter squash is taken in before hard frost.

title: Trucking Industry Faces Troubled Times
description: James K. Seymour, president of Trucking Employers, Inc., the labor bargaining arm of the nation's trucking industry, senses some bad news coming up. Whether it will be bad news for shippers, for the industry, or for both in varying proportions, he wishes he knew.

title: FINE DOES NOT END DELIVERERS STRIKE
description: The strike by 4,000 United Parcel Service drivers continued yesterday despite a $25,000aday fine imposed on the union by a Federal court on Friday.

title: Israeli Planes Raid Across Suez Canal; Heavy Guns Battle
description: CAIRO, Aug. 1 (Reuters)Fighting flared across the Suez Canal today with heavy artillery exchanges and raids by Israeli planes on Egyptian positions, a military spokesman here said.

title: POWER PLANT HELD HAZARD IN QUEENS
description: Federal air pollutioncontrol officials have opposed a pending Consolidated Edison Company proposal to build a major new power plant in Astoria, Queens, asserting that the city already suffers health hazards from excessive pollutants.

title: Van Nostrand and Cranis Gain Final of 35er Tennis
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Aug. 1 King Van Nostrand of Brightwaters, L. I., seeded first, and Paul Cranis of New York, seeded sixth, gained the final of the United States Men's 35 years and over clay court tennis championships as rain chased the matches indoors today at the Shelter Rock Tennis Club.

title: U. S. Business
description: BLUEFIELD, W. Va., Aug. 1The Norfolk and Western Railway Company has begun an extensive reforestation program on part of the 350,000 acres it owns in West Virginia, Virginia and Kentucky.

title: William Block Jr. Weds Miss Carol P. Zurheide
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 1Miss Carol Pauline Zurheide, a 1969 alumna of Chatham College, was married in a garden ceremony on the campus here today to William K. Block Jr., who returned in April from service in Vietnam with the First Cavalry Division.

title: Colorado Negroes Aroused by Slaying
description: DENVER, Aug. 1The slaying of a black educator July 14 in a Colorado Springs service station, in a case now declared closed by the Colorado Springs District Attorney, has opened a deep wound in the blackwhite relationships in this state.

title: Joplin Paper to Close
description: JOPLIN, Mo., Aug 1 (AP)The afternoon Joplin News Herald will cease publication Aug. 28 after 93 years of operation.

title: BUCKS GET INTO ACT ON HOCKEY BILL, TOO
description: MILWAUKEE (UPI)The Milwaukee Bucks have scheduled a roundrobin exhibitiongame tournament in Hawaii and an unusual basketballhockey doubleheader this year.

title: Miss Percy to Be Bride in Capital
description: Mrs. Joseph Percy of New York and Rockville, Md., has announced the engagement of her daughter. Miss Constance Percy, to Laurence Aaronson of Silver Spring, Md. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. S. Harold Aaronson of King of Prussia, Pa.

title: Advertising:
description: A series of events lately has been enough to make a person wonder if advertising, called a cyclical business by some of its practitioners, has entered still another cycle.

title: Kansas Primary Tuesday
description: TOPEKA, Kan., Aug. 1 (UPI) Rick Harman who was the Republican candidate for Governor in 1968, and State Attorny General Kent Frizzell face each other for the Republican gubernatorial nomination Tuesday in the key race in the Kansas primaries.

title: Soviet Ships Said to Train Guns on Buzzing U.S. Jets
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 1 (Reuters) United States Phantom jets buzzing only 60 feet over the masthead provide useful aiming Practice for Soviet naval gunners, according to a Leningrad newspaper.

title: The Fire Screen
description: No American poet since Wallace Stevens has created a world as elegant and cosmopolitan as that in James Merrill's poems. But where Stevens's baroque effects represent reality after imagination has transformed it, in Merrill's work the observed life itself is decorative, sumptuous, tinged with worldweariness. Yet, whey imaginatively conceived, it is rendered with deep understanding andfeeling. At its least intense, his world yields brightly colored postcards recording an observant man's foreign travels and visits to the opera. At its most intense, Mr. Merrill's rarefied manner yields some of the most memorable poems of this decade.

title: What's Up, Doc? Murder!
MICHIGAN TO VOTE ON 2 G.O.P. RIVALS
description: LANSING, Mich., Aug. 1Michigan Republicans will decide Tuesday whether to pit Mrs. Lenore Romney or a conservative industrialist against Philip A. Hart, a Democrat, in Mr. Hart's bid for a third term in the United States Senate.

title: FOE PENETRATES 3 CAMBODIA TOWNS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 1Communist forces were reported to have fought their way yesterday and today into the centers of three towns north of Pnompenhincluding one provincial capitaland were said to have repulsed Government efforts to dislodge them.

title: Hoving's Art Guide To Europe: Getting The Picture Straight
Gretel II Crew Arrives in U.S. to Prepare for America's Cup Trials
description: A towering athlete in a blue blazer and gray slacks climbed off a Qantas jet at Kennedy Airport yesterday morning and led the way to the customs counter.

title: Yankee Stars to Hold Party
description: John Ellis and Jerry Kenney, rising stars with the New York Yankees, will conduct a free baseball party at John F. Kennedy Stadium in Bridgeport, Conn., at 1 P. M. Aug. 12.

title: A Sad Week for Music
description: It was a sad week that saw the almost simultaneous deaths of two such overpowering musicians as Sir John Barbirolli and George Szell. As conductors they represented different ideals, but they were as one their dedication to music and their determination illuminate the message left by the great composers of the past.

title: Virginia Forsell Plans To Marry Next Spring
description: PHOENIXVILLE, Pa. Aug. 1  The engagement of Miss Virginia C. Forsell to Michael Wayne Rayden, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold M. Rayden of BalaCynwyd, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. John R. Forsell. The wedding is planned for next spring.

title: Democratic Coalition Backs Ottinger Despite Goodell's Plea
description: The New Democratic Coalition endorsed Representative Richard L. Ottinger for United States Senator yesterday after a dramatic attempt by Senator Charles E. Goodell, the RepublicanLiberal candidate, to block the move.

title: Observer: Sometime After 1984
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 1Attendon! Attention! May I have your attention, please! Due to the temporarily permanent breakdown, elevators, airconditioners, artmovie houses and refrigerator bulbs will not be working between the hours of 11 A.M. and 7 P.M. for the remainder of this week. These shutdowns are for your convenience and should not be interpreted in any way whatsoever. Stand by for further uptotheminute warnings.

title: PIRATES'
Glen CoveManhattan WaterJet Commuter Service Is Proposed
Marsha Troum Is Wed in Suburbs
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Aug. 2 In the Jewish Community Center here this evening, Miss Marsha Troum, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Max Troum, of New Rochelle, was married to Leonard J. Charney.

title: TV: Changing News Face
description: Times have changed in television newscasting When David Brinkley and Chet Huntley first attracted attention during the 1956 political conventions with their jokes and banter on the National Broadcasting Company, they severely rattled the Columbia Broadcasting System with its heavier and more serious mien. The chemistry between the two men carried the day.

title: Face Graebner and Ralston in First Round at Brookline
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 2In what is certain to be sudden death for some of the world's top tennis players, John Newcombe drew Clark Graebner, Tony Roche will play Dennis Ralston, Cliff Richey meets Marty Riessen and Ken Rosewall plays Roger Taylor in the first round of the $50,000 United States professional championships.

title: New Bedford Police Charge Young Man in Sniping Case
description: NEW BEDFORD, Mass., Aug. 2 (UPI)The police arrested a 25yearold resident early today and charged him with two counts of assault with intent to kill in what they said was the latest sniper incident in this troubled seaport city.

title: CapronScores 33 Points To Win Star Class Series
description: CENTERPORT, L.I., Aug. 2Paul Capron of Sea Cliff, L.I., added a fifth place today to pair of second placa finishes to win the First District Novice Star Class championship.

title: OKKER CAPTURES DUTCH NET FINAL
description: HILVERSUM, The Netherlands, Aug. 2 (AP)Tom Okker of the Netherlands won the Dutch open tennis championship today by defeating secondseeded Roger Taylor of Britain, 46, 60, 61, 63, in the final. Okker earned $3,000, Taylor $1.300.

title: BOLIVIA SAYS ARMY KILLED 8 GUERRILLAS
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Aug. 2Light guerrillas belonging to the socalled Bolivian National Liberation Army were killed in a clash last week in the Northern part of the country, the Bolivian high command said in a statement here this weekend. One soldier was reported killed.

title: Personal Finance: Auto Insurance Pool
description: You may think you're a pretty good driver. But insurance companies are becoming so particular about whom they'll take, that your chances of buying automobile coverage in the normal market are deteriorating rapidly.

title: Finland Revives the Court
description: Finland has initiated action at the United Nations that should have two worthwhile results: clarifying the legal status of SouthWest Africa and reactivating an idle International Court of Justice.

title: Miss Diana Marjorie Preston Betrothed to Peter W. Gonzalez
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Aug. 2Mr. and Mrs. Ord Preston Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Diana Marjorie Preston, to Peter William Gonzalez, who became a member of the New York Stock Exchange last Thursday. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Edward William Gonzalez of Sands Point, L. I.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
Moro Sees Lebanese Chief
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 2 (AP)Foreign Minister Aldo Moro of Italy and President Charles Helou of Lebanon met for 45 minutes today to discuss the United States plan for peace in the Middle East and relations between the two Mediterranean countries. Mr. Moro conferred here yesterday with the Libyan Foreign Minister, Saleh Massaud Buysir, about Libya's confiscation of Italian property.

title: Supplementary OverCounter List
Texas Coast Braces For Hurricane Celia; 3 Towns Evacuated
description: GALVESTON, Tex., Aug. 2 (UPI)  Hurricane Celia, its peak winds slightly diminished, advanced steadily toward a major Southern population center today. The showery fringes of the storm moved inland across parts of Louisiana and Texas.

title: Mormon Worship Service Closes Pageant Upstate
description: PALMYRA, N. Y., Aug. 3Members of the Mormon Church led by Elder Spencer W. Kimball met today on Hill Cumorah for a worship service marking the end of the 1970 Hill Cumorah pageant. An estimated 26,000 persons gathered last night near this town in the Finger Lakes region to watch the last of the annual festival's six performances.

title: A Correction
description: Due to a typographical error in a letter entitled Hunting From Planes which appeared in yesterday's Times, Representative John Saylor of Pennsylvania was described as a conservative leader in Congress. It sholuld have read conservation leader. We regret this mistake.

title: European Executives Find Many Blocks Along Road to the Top
description: PARIS, Aug. 2  European executives complain about the long time it takes them to reach the top, their comparatively low pay and the determinism of social origins under which the best jobs go to those born in the highest social caste.

title: MILS WIN IN 9TH ON A GRAND SLAM
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 2 (UPI)  Tony Taylor greeted Mike Davison, relief pitcher, with grand slam homer witn none out in the ninth inning today to give the Philadelphia Phillies a 76 victory over the San Francisco Giants.

title: ISADORE RUBIN, 58, WROTE SEX TEXTS
description: Dr. Isadore Rubin, editor of Sexology and Luz magazines, author and editor of several books and pamphlets on sex education, died Friday in an automobile accident near Middletown, N. Y. He was 58 years old and lived at 651 Vanderbilt Street, Brooklyn.

title: CON ED EXPANSION IN ASTORIA SPLITS CITY COMMITTEE
49,373 FANS SEE 30, 42 DEFEATS
description: In prose and poetry on 4,136 banners and bedsheets, the New York Mets were lionized by their fans yesterday. But the Mets responded by losing doubleheader to the San Diego Padres and by losing first place to the Pittsburgh Pirates.

title: Pilots Report an Impasse In Negotiations With United
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 2 (UPI)The Air Line Pilots Association announced tonight that contract negotiations with United Ait Lines had reached an impasse and that the pilots would circulate a strike ballot.

title: Donohue Wins Auto Race
description: MONT TREBLANT, Quebec, Aug. 2 (AP)Mark Donohue, driving a Javelin, won the TransAmerica 5liter car race today over the twisting 2.65mile Le Circuit course. It was Donohue's third victory this year in the Sports Car Club of America TransAm series. George Follmer of Arcadia, Calif., was second, with Parnelli Jones of Torrance, Calif., third.

title: Lucky Filters'
description: The Peace ad for Lucky Filters cigarettes that appeared in two New York newspapers last week has obviously stirred up more comment than American Brands expected.

title: U.S. Fuel Worth Millions Stolen In Asia, Two Senators Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (Reuters)Millions of dollars worth of American fuel is being stolen in Southeast Asia because new system designed to prevent thefts was never put into effect, two Democratic Senators charged today.The two Senators, William Proxmire of Wisconsin and Joseph M. Montoya of New Mexico, said the system was supposed to have been introduced by the Defense Department after a report 18 months ago showed that 52 per cent of gasoline shipped to American installations in Thailand was missing.

title: RARE PARALYSIS HELPED BY DRUG
description: Attacks of muscle weakness in many patients with a rare genetic disease called periodic paralysis can now be relieved and prevented with a drug that physicians have used for 20 years to treat commoner conditions, according to a team of researchers at the National Institutes of Health.

title: Sealyham, British Import, Takes Top Honors at Flemington Show
description: FLEMINGTON, N. J., Aug. 2 Ch. Jenmist Dougal a Sealyham who was imported from England 14 months ago by Mrs. Henry Sutliff Jr., of Richmond, gained his second best in show in six weeks when he was named for the top award in field of 1,075 dogs at the Hunterdon Hills event at the fairgrounds today.

title: HARTFORD SNIPING BRINGS 7 ARRESTS
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 2Charging that much of the sniper fire reported in the North End of this city has been traced to Black Panthers, the police early this morning arrested seven men at the building housing the organization's headquarters.

title: M'BREEN BETTERS MEET SWIM MARK
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 2 (AP) Tom McBreen of the Golden Gate Swim Club in San Mateo, Calif., outdueled Hans Fassnacht of West Germany to set a meet record of 16 minutes 31.82 seconds in the 1,500meter race today as the 12th annual Los Angeles invitational meet ended.

title: Flyer About Peace Symbol Disturbs Many
description: WHITE PLAINS. Aug. 1The belief among some adherents of the political right that the peace symbol represents a broken cross or a Communist inspired anti Christian device has begun to worry both Christians and Jews here who have seen literature expressing that theory.

title: Family Happiness Is Randalls Island
description: In the flickering shadows of lowflying jets roaring toward La Guardia Airport, hundreds of New York families picnicked, played softball and dominoes or took their midday siestas yesterday on Randalls Island, where the Harlem and East Rivers meet.

title: Big Banks in City Increase Hiring in Minority Groups
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (UPI)The six largest banks in New York City have increased their employment of minoritygroup members by 10 per cent in three years, the Labor Department reported today.

title: Plants Serenaded Every DayTo Aid Growth
description: Mr. Congreve passed on in 1729, but Dr. Milstein is still very much alive and living in a plantfilled apartment in Long Island City, Queens.

title: Israelis Attack Positions Of Arabs Along 3 Fronts
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 2While the talk in world capitals was of the possibility of peace in the Middle East, Israeli and Arab forces have clashed on three fronts since yesterday. Israeli jets today attacked Egyptian positions along the Suez Canal and staged what were described as retaliatory raids against army positions in Jordan, and Israeli artillery has attacked guerrilla positions in southern Lebanon.

title: Angels Triumph, 83
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Aug. 2 (UPI)Ken McMullen: cMullen: drove in three runs with a homer and a triple and Torn Bradley earned his first majorleague victory today as the California Angels beat the Boston Red Sox, 83, to snap a fivegame losing streak.

title: Nickel Names Committee To Study Power Problems
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 (AP) Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel announced today the appointment of an industry committee to study national energy needs and the environmental impact involved in the production of power.

title: Task of Replacing Broken Club Goes To Crampton Fans
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Aug. 2 A group of Bruce Crampton fans flew in from Grand Bahama and later had to motor a few miles in search of a club in their efforts to encourage the 34yearold professional.

title: News Summary and Index
description: President Gamal Abdel Nasser yesterday sent a message to President Ahmed Hassan alBakr of Iraq in which the Egyptian leader sharply criticized the hardline attitude of Iraq against Cairo's acceptance of the U.S. proposal toward a peaceful settlement of the conflict with Israel. The message was made public by the official Middle East News Agency. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: FULBRIGHT WARNS ON SPANISH PACT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2Senator J. W. Fulbright, chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, announced today that he would seek through legislation to block a new agreement with Spain on United States miltiary bases unless it was submitted as treaty to the Senate.

title: 50 YOUTHS ATTACK HARLEM POLICEMAN,
description: An East Harlem patrolman; fought off 50 youths after arresting a 20 year old laborer on an assault charge early yesterday.

title: Noncrime Jobs Dominate Police Time
DR. JOHN E. GILLICK
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 2Dr. John E. Gillick, director of medical services at Adelphi University, died yesterday in Nassau Hospital, Mineola. He was 57 years old and lived at 204 Lexington Street.

title: 2 Leaders Meet in Algiers
description: ALGIERS, Aug. 2 (AP)President Houari Boumediene had a private twohour meeting here today with Bulgaria's Premier and Communist party chief, Todor Zhivkov, whose plane stopped here to ?? on ?? return to Sofia from a visit to Cuba.

title: 6 Die in Tennessee Collision
description: SELMER, Tenn., Aug. 2 (UPI) Six men were killed in headon collision between two automobiles here tonight, the McNairy County sheriff's office reported. They were identified as Wilbert H. Fowler, 43 years old. Bethel Springs, Tenn Jerry Melton, 17. Selmer and Terry Spencer, 17, William S. Holly, 16. Ernie Foy Jr., 22, and Dewitt Harris, 18, all of Booneville, Miss.

title: Rock Music Fans Leave Festival Site
description: MIDDLEFIELD, Conn., Aug. 2The winding roads leading away from the Powder Ridge ski area were filled today with young rock music fans heading home, tired and dirty after several days of frolic and heavy drug use.

title: Ahepa Acts to Save Acropolis From Smog
description: ATHENS, Aug. 2 (Reuters) A GreekAmerican organization is launching a worldwide campaign to save the ancient Acropolis from the ravages of twentieth century pollution a spokesman for the group said today.

title: EconomyConscious Vacationers Crowd Parks
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif.  The crowds of vacationers are pouring into Yosemite again this summer, but here and elsewhere across the country there is a discernible difference from previous years: The visitors are spending less.

title: Tires Speed and Driving Cited in Fatal Bus Plunge
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Aug. 2 (UPI)  A Pennsylvania States Department of Transportation official said today that speeding, erratic maneuvering and smooth tires had caused a bus crash that killed seven children from Long Island and Queens.

title: An Israeli Hawk
Campaign Infighting
description: In August, when candidates turn to vacations, the attention of many politicians turns to the internal feuding that plagues almost every major campaign.

title: WOMAN IS RELEASED IN COAST ABDUCTION
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 2 (UPI) The wife of a manufacturing company executive was kidnapped and released 19 hours later after her husband paid the abductors $10,000 in ransom, the police reported last night.

title: Worcester Skipper Takes U.S. Mariner Class Title
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I., Aug. 2Czajkowski of Worcester, Mass., captured the Mariner Class national championship today, scoring victories in the last three events of the sixrace series. The performance gave him four triumphs and a fourthplace finish, with a 12th place showing in the second contest of the series being used as throwout race.

title: Henry Bruckner, Lawyer, Son of Bronx President
description: Henry Bruckner, a lawyer and the son and namesake of the Bronx Borough President for whom the Bruckner. Expressway, was named, died at his home Thursday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 64 years old and lived at 51 East 236th Street in the Bronx.

title: TUNNELS CHECKED IN WAKE OF FIRE
description: Seventyseven Transit Authority supervisors and employes trooped through underwater subway tunnels this weekend to check circuit breakers, cables, signals and switches and to spot and eliminate conditions that might cause train accidents.

title: Scheel and Gromyko Hold An Unscheduled Meeting;
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 2 (Reuters) West Germany's Foreign Minister, Walter Scheel, today met with the Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko to iron out outstanding problems in the nonaggression treaty they are negotiating.

title: FILIPINOS SUFFER IN MONEY CHANGE
description: MANILADevaluation of the peso, undertaken last February by permitting the currency to float, has brought hardship to 81 per cent of Filipinos, according to a survey made public a few days ago. It is the first such study since devaluation.

title: 6 JAPANESE HELP TO MARK BOMBINGS
description: Six Japanese who survived tile atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki 25 years ago participated in a worship service of repentance and reconciliation here yesterday.

title: 3 WORLD TITLES GO TO SOVIET CANOEISTS
description: LAKE BAGSVAERD, Denmar. Aug. 2 (AP)Eastern Europeans dominated the third and last day of the world canoe and kayak championships today on Lake Bagsvaerd, near Copenhagen, by winning five of the eight titles at stake. The Soviet Union captured three, Hungary and Rumania one each.

title: Excerpts From Reports on Power Plant Expansion
description: Following are excerpts from the majority report of Mayor Lindsay's interdepartmental Committee on Public Utilities recommending that Consolidated Edison enlarge its Astoria plant and from the committee's minority report opposing expansion of the plant:

title: BULLISH OUTLOOK PREVAILS IN BONDS
description: The credit markets, pleased with the way the Treasury financing got started and impressed with their own ability to hold firm after the big JuneJuly advance, appear ready to handle this week's schedule of fixedincome securities without much strain.

title: SURVEY SEEKS TO AID JERSEY'S COMMUTERS
description: A study on easing the travel of New Jersey commuters to New York during rush hours was announced yesterday by the Tristate Transportation Commission.

title: Athletics Triumph Over Senators,10, After 62 Setback
description: OAKLAND. Calif.. Aug. 2 (UPI)Don Mincher's twoout ninthinning homer gave the Oakland A's a 10 victory and a split of their doubleheader today after the Washington Senators won the opener, 62, on the hitting of Ed Stroud and Aurelio Rodriclez.

title: FIVE CONSERVATIVES GOV. SARGENT VISITS SUE OVER VOTING ACT OILSOAKED CAPE COD
description: Five members of the Conservative party here have challenged the constitutionality of sections of the Federal Voting Rights Act on the basis that they represent an incursion by the Federal Government on the states.

title: Cut in U.S. Aid Retards Beirut Hospital
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 2 Financial problems growing out of United States fiscal policies are slowing the growth of the $20million American University medical center here.

title: Cambodians, in Retreat,Talk of Their Battle
description: CHILEA BRIDGE, Cambodia, Aug. 2For some 100 tired and hungry Cambodian soldiers huddled here, the muddy stream running beneath this whitewashed bridge is today's front line in the Cambodian war.

title: Detroit Man Will Sell Blood at $1,500 a Quart
description: DETROIT, Aug. 2 (UPI)A 34yearold assembly line worker will begin a new career next week, selling his rare blood at $1,500 a quart for a $12,000ayear income. The Detroit News has reported.

title: Canada Is Facing New Wheat Crop As Glut Remains
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 2  Canada has made substantial gains on its gigantic wheat surplus during the crop year now closing. However, before the new crop begins to come In she still has one billion bushels to dispose of.

title: RUTH A. PHILLIPS, 68, NOVELIST, REPORTER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2Ruth Alexandria Phillips, a novelist newspaperwoman and artist, died of cancer yesterday at Rogers Memorial Hospital here. She was 68 years old.

title: Drama: Most Inventive Shakespeare at the Shrine
description: England, Aug. 2Although in London the Royal Shakespeare Company ranges far and wide over world drama, both classic and contemporary, its Memorial Theater in ??uponAvon is kept as a sacred shrine to Shakespeare.

title: INDONESIANS SEE LITTLE PROGRESS
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 2 Indonesia is undergoing period of introspection, marked by a vague unhappiness with the present military rulers but an inability to replace them with any new leadership that could speed up the slow, pragmatic steps being taken by President Suharto's administration.

title: Youths Held in Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 2 (AP)Youths set off firecrackers and hurled bottles in this city's hippie district tonight, smashing windows at a new police precinct and at several nearby businesses. No injuries were reported. The police arrested small number of youths.

title: GATT ASKS ATTACK ON TRADE FETTERS
description: GENEVA, Aug. 2The international organization that oversees most of the world's trading relations called today on its 77 member states to counterattack rising protectionist tendencies by mounting a new assault on trade barriers.

title: America Thrives on Trade...
description: Business and labor groups that have been putting heavy pressure on Congress to pass extremely protectionist trade legislation argue that quotas are needed to save this country from inundation by foreign imports while American goods are banned abroad. In the vulgar phrase of Secretary of Commerce Stans, the United States is described as Uncle Sucker in its relations with the rest of the world.

title: On Irish Isle, Women Make the Hay
JOHN G. F. SPEIDEN, ARIZONA RANCHMAN
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Aug. 2John G. F. Speiden, rancher and political leader, drowned Thursday night in the swimming pool of his Tucson home. He was 70 years old.

title: French Combating Litter After Outbreak of Fires
description: LA PIOLINE, France, Aug. A rash of fires in town dumps has spurred French authorities to try to cope better with one of western Europe's most apparent environmental problems: the mourning masses of litter that scar the countryside.

title: CRITICISMS OF CURIA UNJUST, POPE SAYS
MERGER TALKS HELD AT PACIFIC EXPRESS
description: The International Utilities Corporation and the Pacific Intermountain Express Company announced yesterday that they had held discussions concerning the possible acquisition of Pacific by International.

title: Crampton Captures Westchester Golf
description: Bruce Crampton of Australia won the $250,000 Westchester Golf Classic yesterday by one stroke at the Westchester Country Club. The 34yearold pro shot a 67 for the final 18 holes for 72hole total of 273. Jack Nicklaus and Larry Hinson tied for second. Page 41.

title: $4.15 PAY RISE WON BY SHEETMETAL MEN
description: ALBANY, Aug. 2 (AP)A 13 weekold strike of sheetmeta workers that spanned 15 up state counties ended today when members voted to accept a contract calling for a $4.15 hourly wage increase over three years.

title: Mayor Seeks Guidance By Power Plant Debate
description: Mayor Lindsay has decided to allow competing forces in his administration to disagree publicly in an effort to help him make a critical choice between the need to protect the environment and the need to assure adequate electrical power for the city.

title: Tomahawk First Again
description: BAY SHORE, L.I., Aug. 2Fifteen skippers scored repeat victories today in the second day of activity of the Great South Bay Yacht Racing Association's annual cruise week championship. The series will not resume until Friday when the fleet gathers off Babylon for the last three days of racing.

title: FREDERICK OGILBY
description: Frederick D. Ogilby, who retired in 1962 as vice president for national sales of the Philco Corporation, manufacturer of electronic equipment, now the PhilcoFord Corporation, died Saturday in. Fort Lauderdale Fla. He was 67 years old.

title: Cranis Beats Van Nostrand
description: MANHASSET. L.I., Aug. 2Paul Cranis of New York, seeded sixth, defeated King Van Nostrand of Brightwaters, L.I., seeded first, 63, 62. in the final today of the United States men's 35yearsandover claycourt tennis championship at the Shelter Rock Tennis Club.

title: PANEL DENOUNCES BUSINESS TAX AID
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2 A new tax incentive for business that the Nixon Administration wants attached to the foreign trade bill has been denounced as discriminatory and probably ineffective by the nonpartisan staff of the Congressional Joint Committee on Taxation.

title: A MidIncome Unit In Queens Draws Wrath of Tenants
description: Tenants who pay $178 to $335 a month for their apartments in a Bayside, Queens, complex picketed the manager's office there yesterday to protest the lack of airconditioning in the last three weeks, holes in the tennis court at the country club, infrequent cleaning of hallway carpets and malfunctioning incinerators.

title: Soviet Plans Farm Settlements On River Islands Near China
description: MOSCOW. Aug. 2 (AP)The Soviet Union has embarked on a policy of island reclamation in Far Eastern rivers bordering Communist China. The announced purpose is agriculture.

title: Federal Drug Agency Plans a 3Phase Drive to Curb the Misuse of Pep Pills
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2The Food and Drug Administration is planning major changes in labeling and other actions to help bring abuse of amphetamines under control.

title: U.S. to Offer Detailed Proposal For Treaty on Control of Seabed
description: GENEVA, Aug. 2The United States will make a tentative proposal tomorrow for the establishment of a new international agency to take control over the exploitation of all mineral deposits in the bed of the hieh seas.

title: Soccer Puts Its Best Foot Forward Here
description: Women's liberation took long kick forward yesterday. Twentysix young women from France and Italy played soccerlong a man's game at Downing Stadium, Randalls Island, before 4,500 fans, who paid $4 apiece for a show worth the money.

title: Petty Breaks 500Mile Track Mark
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 1 (UPI)Richard Petty drove his blue sharknosed Plymouth to victory in the heatplagued Dixie 500 Classic for stock cars today in record time of 142.712 miles an hour over the highbanked 1 mile track.

title: ITALIAN IS HOPEFUL ON COALITION TALKS
description: ROME. Aug. 2Premierdes?? Emilio Colombo ended his first week of political consultations today and indicated that he had made progress toIward forming a new centerleft coalition cabinet. But a spokesman for one of the four parties with which Mr. Colombo has been negotiating said the fourweekold government crisis was as far from settlement as ever.

title: It Was a Banner Day And Yet It Wasn't a Banner Day For the Mets
Colombo's Challenge
description: The selection of Treasury. Minister Emilio Colombo to form a new government in. Italy hands a financial wizard the task of producing a political miracleholding together a CenterLeft coalition torn, after seven years of power, by bitter dissension within and among its four constituent parties.

title: A Correction
description: Fifth Avenue Coach Lines, Inc., and its subsidiary, Surface Transit, Inc., have agreed with the City of New York not to seek further review of a court order that placed the remaining compensation from the city to the companies for their going concern assets at $10,725,325 and interest expected to be in excess of $4.4million. The former figure was incorrectly reported in Saturday's editions.

title: RINDT CAPTURES GERMAN CAR RACE
description: HOCKENHEIM, Germany, Aug. 2 (AP)Jochen Rindt of Austria drove his Lotus Ford to victory over Jackie Ickx of Belgium by seventenths of a second and won the 32d German Grand Prix, today before crowd estimated at 190,000.

title: Article 1  No Title
NEW UNIT PLANNED BY ODYSSEY HOUSE
description: Odyssey House, which faces court action for trying to rehabilitate adolescent heroin addicts in a Bronx building that allegedly violates the Building Code, is planning a major expansion of its work in the purchase of the former Wiltwyck School at 208210 East 18th Street.

title: 125 Now Feared Dead in Sinking of Crowded Ferry in Caribbean
description: CHARLESTOWN. Nevis, Aug. 2 (AP)A Caribbean island ferry that sank in five minutes last night with an estimated toll of 125 dead was overcrowded, a Government official indicated today.

title: Boy Is Rescued After Fall Into Brooklyn Sand Hopper
description: An 11yearold Brooklyn boy was rescued from a 15footdeep sand hopper last night by two patrolmen who spent more than a half hour carefully scraping the sand away from the child's face and body.

title: Mississippi Allows a Mixed Marriage
150 POLICE EVICT SQUATTER GROUP
description: Four families of squatters were evicted by the police yes terday and eight persons arrested at apartment buildings at 210 and 214 East 19th Street.

title: 7 VESPER VICTORIES GAIN ROWING TITLE
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 2The Vesper Boat Club of Philadelphia won the team championship today in the 79th annual Middle States rowing regatta on the Schuylkill River.

title: City Bodegas Fill Many Roles
description: This is my house, said 77yearold Julio Diaz as he sat on a milk box, sunning himself outside Angelo's, a bodega at 940 Longwood Avenue in the Bronx. I have no job and nothing to do, so I come here every day and talk to people until closing time.

title: A BIRD SANCTUARY SET UP IN FLORIDA
description: An island near Tampa Bay, in Florida, has been leased for $1 a year by the National Audubon Society to provide a sanctuary for white ibises displaced by the new congestion of brown pelicans on their old nearby site.

title: Coast Automation Fund On Docks Near Bankruptcy
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 2 (UPI) A $63.5million automation fund to pay off West Coast dock workers unemployed by technology is near bankruptcy.

title: Soviet Role in Mideast
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 2Soviet authorities are telling anyone who wants to listen these days that the recent moves toward a settlement in the Middle East were due largely to Moscow's military and diplomatic efforts in the Arab world.

title: Orioles Vanquish Royals, 108, For Record Streak of 23 Games
Anne Brainard To Be Married
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Aug. 2The engagement of Miss Anne Richards Brainard to Ettore Celano, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gerardo Celano of Florence, Italy, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Charles Edwin Brainard.

title: Miss Robbins Bride Of James S. Sisler
description: Miss Linda Ann Robbins, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. David L. Robbins of New York and Larchmont, N. Y., was married at noon yesterday to James Stewart Sisler, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lloyd Stewart Sisler of Moraga, Calif. The ceremony was performed by New York State Supreme Court Justice Samuel Gold in the library of the St. RegisSheraton.

title: Oil Acquisition Planned
description: The BaruchFoster Corporation, Dallas, said yesterday it had agreed in principle to acquire all the stock of the Northern Petroleum Corporation and other properties. The deal involves 40 Oklahoma oil and gas wells.

title: ...But So Do Thieves
description: Crime seems always to have been endemic in busy seaports. It may be that the irregular hours and seasonal character of work on the piers have traditionally attracted drifters and the marginally criminal; it may be that the comparative poverty of the longshoremen and the wealth of cargoes which they unload create irresistible temptations. Whatever the reasons, a subculture of mean rackets and petty thievery envelops life on the waterfront like a persistent smog.

title: Buildings at Lascaux Caves Evacuated in Forest Fire
description: PERIGUEUX. France, Aug. 2 (AP)The administrative buildines at the entrance to the Lascaux Caves were hastily evacuated today after a fire burned more than 250 acres of nearby forest.The Lascaux Caves, discovered in 1940, contain the largest known complex of prehistoric paintings in the world, most of them more than 18,000 years old. The caves are currently closed to the public to prevent damage to the paintings from moisture and calcium deposits.

title: Spain and West Germany Gain Interzone Final in Cup Tennis
description: The United States defending champion Davis Cup squad will face either Spain or West Germany in the challenge round at Cleveland on Aug. 29 through 31.

title: Nelson, Kentucky Ace, Wins Olympic Camp Marathon
description: PULLMAN, Wash., Aug. 2 (AP)Dick Nelson of Ashtabula, Ohio, a University of Kentucky star, won the marathon today, closing event of a threeweek Olympic distance runners training camp at Washington State University.

title: A 747 Jet Is Hijacked, and Castro Meets It
description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico, Aug. 2  Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba got his first look at Boeing 747 jumbo jet plane early this morning after Pan American World Airways Flight 299 from New York to San Juan was hijacked to Havana with 379 people aboard.

title: Deaths of 12 Aged Patients Linked to Food Poisoning
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 2 (AP)Salmonella food poisoning figured in the deaths of 12 elderly patients and the illness of about 60 others at a Baltimore nursing home last week, Dr. Neil Solomon, the Maryland Health Secretary. said today.

title: Nixon Eludes Newsmen on Coast Trip
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Aug. 2President Nixon comes to the Western White House to escape what he calls the intellectual incest of the capital, and yesterday, for the first time, he managed to elude even the press.

title: Youth Communes Seek New Way of Life
description: TAOS, N. M.  Gretchen pulled a brush over her shiny black hair and talked about why she had fled a community college in Lansing, Mich., for the mountains of New ??.

title: VALIANT IS SECOND AMONG 12METERS
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 2Intrepid handed the rest of the I2meter fleet a severe drubbing today in winning the New York Yacht Club 1926 Cup on Rhode Island Sound.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Joe Pepitone has been a Chicago Cub for five days now (I feel real good about it's one of the best things that's hvppened to me in all my life. he said). He is the Cubs starting center fielder (I always liked the outfield better, he once said. at first base you don't have much time to think about your hitting). He got hits his first few games (Joe Pepitone, said Ted Williams last year, should of been a $100,000 ballplayer, with his talent). In 1962. when Joe Pepitone was a rookie with the Yankees, it was generally conceded that if he failed to become the new Joe DiMaggio he would at least be the new Lou Gehrig. But now, eight years and only a few minor records later, he is in danger of being remembered less for his entries in the record book than in Jim Bouton's book. Pepitone, according to Ball Four, has two wigs, one of which fits under his batting helmet.

title: Brewers Overcome 30 Lead and Halt Yankees Streak at 6 With 95 Victory
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 2 Hoping to extend their winning Streak to seven games, the Yankees started after Milwaukee today as though determined to stampede the Brewers.

title: Borst, Peterson and Kollish Among Bayside Y.C. Victors
description: Only two of the 36 starters were able to heat the 6:30 PAL deadline as the twoday Bayside Yacht Club invitation regatta came to a close yesterday on Little Neck Bay.

title: Dr. John Templeton Jr. Weds Dr. Josephine Joan Gargiulo
description: FORT LEE, N. J., Aug. 2Dr. Josephine Joan Gargiulo and Dr. John M. Templeton Jr., residents in pediatrics and surgery, respectively, at the Medical College of Virginia in Richmond, were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Paul Pesent performed the ceremony in the Madonna Roman Catholic Church.

title: Advertising: Supergirls Play Super Roles
description: East 67th Street between Fifth and Madison Avenues is one of those particularly genteel looking Manhattan blocks with its trees and townhouses. No. 23 has been converted into office space and on the doorjam little plaques tell you who's working there.

title: Chess:
description: According to the latest computerized ratings of the United States Chess Federation, Grandmaster Robert Byrne of Indianapolis is No. 7 on the list of active American chess players. Byrne, whose knack is positional virtuosity in any company, defeated Jan Hein Donner of the Netherlands by exploiting weak squares in the Dutchman's camp. This Sicilian Defense is from the recent Lugano, Switzerland, International

title: Gen. Loan Gets Defense Post
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 2 (AP)Maj. Gen. Nguyen Ngoc Loan, the former national police chief who startled the world when he was photographed executing Vietcong prisoner on a Saigon street during the 1968 Tet offensive, was named a special assistant in the South Vietnamese Defense Ministry today.

title: Fugitive Priest Speaks in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 2 (Reuters)The Rev. Daniel J. Berrigan, fugitive pacifist priest, made a surprise appearance here today to preach an antiwar sermon at the First United Methodist Church of Germantown, a section of this city.

description: Emily A. Fowler, formerly of New York, long a leader of volunteers working for the Grenfell Mission in Labrador, died Saturday in Salisbury, Conn., where she made her home. She was 90 years old.

C., in Division II, were sailing victors today. They triumphed in the Long Island Sound Yacht Racing Association's Eastern Connecticut Area championships for cruising yachts off Black Rock Yacht Club.

title: Books of The Times
description: If the name of Margaret Anderson is known to this generation at all, it is surely as editor of The Little Review, the magazine that flourished between 1914 and 1929, publishing those who were then the avantgarde writers. Its most memorable years were just after World War I when it nublished Joyce's Ulysses in installments

title: Mao Reported in Good Health
description: PARIS, Aug. 2 (Reuters) Planning Minister Andre Bettencourt said in an interview published here today that Chairman Mao Tsetung was alert and appeared to be in improved health when the two met in Peking last month.

title: Finding Cool Subway Cars Is a Tricky Job
description: The recent onset of warm humid weather has found thousands of New York subway riders returning to the summer sport of catching cool subway cars  a rushhour activity that requires a discerning eye, a certain amount of luck and fleetness of foot.

title: Environment Agency Fund Cut Deplored by Key Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2Members of Congress who had hoped that the Federal Government would play a much larger role in setting policy for environmental protection are disheartened over a onethird cut in a key appropriations bill.

title: 4 JUVENILES SEIZED IN ASBURY PARK FIRE
The Theater: Psychological Play From Nigeria

description: Thomas D. Barrow, a 45yearold geologist, has been elected president of the Humble Oil and Refining Company, the principal domestic subsidiary of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey).

title: 15HIT OFFENSIVE TOPS BRAVES, 107
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 2 (UPI)Bob Robertson and John Jeter drove in all of Pittsburgh's runs today as the Pirates, blistering Atlanta pitching for the second straight day, beat the Braves, 107.

title: 3 PARTNERS START INVESTMENT HOUSE
description: The formation of Delafield. Harvey, Tabeli, a new investment organization that will specialize in money management and investment research, was announced yesterday.

title: Fall Kills City Woman, 22
description: A 22yearold resident of Milbank House at 11 West 10th Street, Manhattan, was fatally injured shortly before noon! yesterday when she fell from a thirdfloor window of the residence for young women. The woman, Miss Jeanie James, who came to New York two years ago from Bismarck, N.D., was pronounced dead on arrival at St. Vincent's Hospital. Detectives of the Charles Street stationhouse said she fell when a rug she was leaning on slipped from under her.

title: Middlefield Divided on Festival, but Many Find Kids Not So Bad
description: MIDDLEFIELD, Conn., Aug. 2  This tiny town may never be the same. The nomadic rock music enthusiasts who gathered here from all parts of the country were leaving today. But they left behind enough memories some bad, mostly good to make instant history ina town where change used to be something you got back from a dollar bill.

title: NICKLAUS, HINSON TIE FOR 2D PLACE
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Aug. 2A driver he was using disintegrated as he swung at the fourth hole today but Bruce Crampton's golf game remained solid and intact and he won the Westchester Classic by stroke with a 72hole aggregate of 273.

title: SIDEROWF BEATS SPEARS FOR TITLE
description: CLIFTON, N. J., Aug. 2Dick Siderowf, the 33yearold stock broker from Westport, Conn., who thrives under the pressure of championhip play, won the Metropolitan Golf Association's amateur championship today for the third successive year.

title: Margo Wallace Becomes Bride Of J. B. Richman
description: DENVER, Aug. 2  Miss Charlotte Margaret Wallace, niece of Mrs. Harry S. Truman, was married today in the Evans Chapel of the University of Denver to Lieut. Jerome Bary Richman, U.S.A.F., son of Mr. and Mrs. Murray Richman of Odenton, Md. The wedding was performed by Rabbi Lester Bogage.

title: Tijuana Proposes Extending Airport To Terminal in U.S.
description: TIJUANA, Mexico, Aug. 2 (AP)  Mexican officials are suggesting that United Statesbound jetliners land in this country and roll down the runway for a mile to a terminal in the United States after the new $8million Tijuana International Airport becomes operational in September.

title: Poseidon Test Today
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Aug. 2 (AP)The Navy's new Poseidon missile will be tested from a submerged submarine for the first time tomorrow, although Russian trawlerswhich caused postponement a week agoare expected to be watching.

title: The MoscowBonn Treaty and a European Settlement
description: The first week of the new Moscow negotiations on a SovietWest German treaty reportedly has shown some progress. But, as expected, issues are proving very difficult to resolve. Ostensibly a pact renouncing the use of force to alter borders, the treaty and accompanying documents really are intended to lay the foundation, a quartercentury after World War II, for an interim EastWest settlement in Europe based on the territorial status quo.Accord on a draft treaty, including agreed language for its four operative articles, was reached on May 22 after forty hours of talks over four months between Mr. Gromyko and Egon Bahr, Chancellor Brandt's Special emissary. The outcome initially pleased both sides.

title: ABE GRUBER
description: Abe Gruber, a designer in the women's fashion field for Many years, died Thursday in Kings Highway Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived at 25 Tennis Court, Brooklyn.

title: Until They Found the Shelter, Their Home Was Danang's Streets
description: DANANG. South VietnamHe is a very different boy, even in this country Where not many children lead safe, childlike lives. Vo Van Be is too small. too solemn, too silent for a boy of 11 although he does not really know if that is his exact age.

title: REDS'
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 2 (UPI)Bobby Tolan's twoout single off Juan Pizzaro in the 11th inning drove in Ty Cline and gave the Cincinnati Reds a 43 victory over the Chicago Cubs today.

title: Ulster Raises Bomb Reward
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 2 The Northern Ireland Government increased its reward tonight for information leading to the arrest and conviction of bomb terrorists from $24,000 to $120,000. Robert Porter, Home Affairs Minister, announced the increase as the total number of gelignite explosions in North Ireland this year rose to more than 70.

title: 60 Choice of Johnson: Another Version

description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., July 31In the last decade, West Virginia has been the nation's leading exporter of coal and of people.

title: Bridge
description: A field of 70 teams, including many players with national reputations, was led into the final session of the Greater New York Bridge Association's Swiss Team tournament at the New York Hilton last night by the foursome of William Passel! of Hartsdale, N. Y., Dave Strasberg of Rockville Centre. L. I., and Peter Leventritt and Stan Turecki of New York. They totaled 139 victory points out of a possible 180.

title: Israeli Attack Reported
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 2Arab guerrilla headquarters reported today from Amman, Jordan, that an Israeli infantry company spearheaded by column of tanks penetrated into the Arkub district of southeastern Lebanon last night near the occupied Golan heights.

title: INDIANS LOSE, 87. AFTER 42 VICTORY
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 2 (UPI)Bill Melton's tworun homer with two out in the ninth inning lifted the Chicago White Sox to an 87 victory today after the Cleveland Indians won the first game, 42, as Duke Sims paced a 14hit attack with three hits.

title: Stabbing Death Upsets Job Corps Center in Utah
description: CLEARFIELD, Utah, Aug. 2D Dormitory is neat and airy, painted blue and brown. Its low cost and varnished wood closets help give the wartime built warehouse and its neighboring Job Corps structures a quasi military air.

title: Child Actors Are Still Taking Their Cues From Mom
description: Douglas Grant, a dimpled 11yearold with darting eyes, has a public face. You might see him almost anywhereon the stage, on television or movie screens or tending a newsstand near West 34th Street.

title: 122 Shopping Streets in Tokyo Get a Breather From Traffic Pollution
description: TOKYO, Aug. 2 (Reuters)Tokyo closed more than 100 of its busiest streets to cars today, and for a time part of the world's most populous city was free of the auto exhaust fumes that have plagued it recently. Four important shopping districts took on a carnival air as 122 thoroughfares were cleared of traffic and turned over to pedestrians for a few hours. The experiment, ordered by Tokyo's Governor, Ryokichi Minobe, is to be repeated every Sunday and holiday for an indefinite period. The improvement in the air was dramatic. Meters recording carbon monoxide levels registered zero for a few minutes in the west Tokyo area of Shinjuku. In the Ginza district, the pollution level dropped to two parts per millionabout half the normal Sunday reading. Although no recordings were made in the two other districts, Ikebukuro and Asakusa, the air was reported to be less polluted than usual. An estimated total of 750,000 people thronged the trafficfree streets. Business was reported better than usual. Governor Minobe said tonight that he hoped to extend the street closure to Saturdays and then perhaps to limited periods during the week.

title: Music: Brubeck Blending
description: Under a leaden, leaking sky with thunder rolling and lightning dancing overhead. Dave Bruheck's past met his present on Saturday night at the Schaefer Music Festival in Central Park.

title: RICHEY CAPTURES CLAY COURT TITLE
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 2 (AP) Cliff Richey of San Angelo, Tex., captured the national clay court tennis championship today by beating Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., 62, 108, 36, 61.

title: 2 TWINS HOMERS TRIP TIGERS, 4 TO 3
description: DETROIT, Aug. 2 (AP)Home runs by Harm on Killebrew and Tony Oliva paced the Minnesota Twins to a 43 victory over the Detroit Tigers today.

title: NASSER CRITICIZES IRAQ'S OBJECTIONS TO PEACE EFFORTS
description: CAIRO, Aug. 2President Gamal Abdel Nasser today sharply criticized the hardline attitude of Iraq against Cairo's acceptance of the United States proposals toward a peaceful settlement of the conflict with Israel.

title: Girl Decapitated in Subway In Suicide on Queens Line
description: A teenage girl was decapitated yesterday when she lay down on the subway tracks outside the Northern Boulevard IND station in Queens and was run over, police said.

title: Minority Police Unit Assigned to Decoy Taxi Duty
description: A special squad of young black and Puerto Rican policeman, announced last October as one answer to Harlem's crime problem, has been quietly reassigned to the task of reducing crimes against taxi drivers.

title: In Brazil, a Boom Overshadows Prophets of Doom
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 2There is a land where the stock market has been rising and taxes are going to fall, where the balance of payments is massively favorable and the gross national product is felt to be growing almost explosively.

title: Blood Donor Guidelines Seek a Curb on Hepatitis

description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 2 A major shift in product mix will soon produce a slight improvement in steel shipments.

title: Environment Goes to Court

The Legislature has passed, and Governor Milliken has signed, a measure that will allow a citizen to file suit against anyone, including the state itself, believed to be seriously contaminating the air, water or land resources belonging to all.

title: CICERO B. VEAL

description: The Dodge index of con structioncontract value jumped to 186 in June from 170 in May owing to a sharp increase in nonbuilding contracts for highway, utility, dam and mili tary installations, projects, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Sys terns Company reported yes terday.

title: Books of The Times
description: It is hard to decide who has exerted the more baneful influence on Christopher BookerMalcolm Muggeridge or C. G. Jung? The 33yearold, Cambridgeeducated Mr. Booker was the first editor of Private Eve. the English satirical magazine; a script writer on the origi nal British Broad casting Corpora tion version of That Was The Week That Was; and a columnist. for The Spectator. a sort of British Nat Hentoff writ ing about televi sion and the press. He has undertaken a breezy and opin ionated recapitula tion of the last 15 years in English history, from the Angry Young Men to Mick Jagger, and in that he is successful. But he also aspires to a Grand Scheme of Fantasy Cycles, in pursuit of which he psychologizes about culture, bor rowing from Jung the notions of myth, archetype, psychic epidemics and the racial unconscious; borrowing from Mr. Muggeridge a contempt for science, per missiveness, progressive intellectuals. antiwar demonstrations and the Labor party. Christ arrives on roller skates in the final chapter, as an example of the perfect man who went through the Fan tasy Cycle all the way past Death Wish and was reborn.

title: EGYPTIANS DOWN AN ISRAELI PLANE
description: CAIRO, Aug. 3A military spokesman said that an Israeli, supersonic Phantom fighter bomber was shot down today over the Suez Canal town of Ismailia and the two crewmen were captured.

title: Susan Minkoff Bride in Jersey
description: TENAFLY, N. J., Aug. 3The marriage of Miss Susan Helen Minkoff, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry Minkoff of New York, to David French Feingold, son of Mr. and Mrs. Abraham D. Feingold of Brooklyn, took place here this morning. Leonard Karp, Leader of the American Ethi cal Union, performed the ceremony at his home.

title: 91Day Bill Rate Up to 6.413% At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3Treasury bill rates rose at to day's auction compared with last week's levels, the Govern ment reported late this after noon.

title: Role of Orthodoxy Debated In Israel as Scholars Meet
description: REHGVOT, Israel, Aug. 3American Jewish and Israeli scholars debated today the question of the dominance of the Orthodox religious Estab lishment in Israel.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Participants in any of the three August bluefin tuna tournaments in Cape Cod waters will have an excellent chance of surpassing the world record rodandreel catch, officials of the Cape Cod Tuna Club, sponsor of one of the events, believe.

title: Canada's Eskimos Organize to Press Land Claims
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 3The re cent success of the Alaskan Eskimos in getting their ab original rights recognized by the United States Senate has raised the hopes of the 12,000 Eskimos in Canada that they will be able to win over an obstinate Government in Ottawa.

title: WALTER G. SEELY
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y., Aug. 3  Walter G. Seely, a lawyer who had been in practice here since 1924, died at his home here yesterday. He was 76 years old.

title: Radioactive Pieces Of Rocket U.S. Lost Found by Mexicans
description: DURANGO, Mexico, Aug. 3 (AP)adioactive pieces of a: United States research rocket that went awry on a test flight July 11 have been found in a Mexican meadow, military au thorities reported today.

title: Sunday Cruise Off Jersey Leads To Legislators'
description: The wives of two Staten Island legislators dangled their legs over the bow of a cabin cruiser Sunday afternoon landing their husbands in hot water.

title: TV: Horrors of Hiroshima Revisited
description: The horrors of the atomic destruction of Hiroshima and Nagasaki 25 years ago were shown for 16 minutes last night on the network of the Corporation for Public Broad casting (Channel 13). The film, made by Japanese cam eramen, was classified as se cret for 20 years but in the last two years had been widely shown on foreign tele vision systems and over 400 prints have been sold.

title: Leavenworth Strike Begun
description: LEAVENWORTH, Kan., Aug. 3 (AP)Inmates of the Federal Penitentiary here are on strike and refusing to work, Warden Robert I. Moseley said today. He said that hot weather ap peared to be the key reason for the strike but added there also were some little things in volved. The strike began at 7:30 today when the men re fused to go to work and were locked in their cells.

title: Martha Clare Wolf Is Betrothed
description: PORTLAND, Me., Aug. 3  The Right Rev. Freder ick B. Wolf, Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Maine, and Mrs. Wolf of Portland and Heath, Mass., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mar tha Clare Wolf, to John Ni gel Frederick Pepper, son of Dr. and Mrs. John J. Pepper of East Orange, N.J.

title: 500 Flee IRS Accident; Fire Delays Penn Central
description: More than 500 subway passengers, some described panicky, rushed from a West Side IRT local train that was involved in a minor accidentYesterday two days after a passenger died and 50 others were injured in another ac cident. In yesterday's incident two women suffered from smoke inhalation after the train stopped with a startling popping noise halfway out of the West 86th Street station and emitted a cloud of smoke.

title: Kate Trafford, Rev. A. D. Smith To Be Married
description: WEST HARTFORD, Conn., Aug. 3  Mr. and Mrs. Ber nard Walton Trafford Jr. have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Kate Carroll. Trafford, a sen ior at Skidmore, to the Rev. Andrew Dorman Smith, cu rate of Trinity Episcopal. Church in Hartford.

title: OREGON AND TEXAS TEST VOTING LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (AP) Petitions intended to lead to an early constitutional test of the vote for 18yearolds were filed with the Supreme Court today by Oregon and Texas.

title: Football Pact Puts Wives of TV Fans On the Defensive
description: Most wives watch football in selfdefense said Mrs. Lucille Waite of Chicago, but Mrs. Monie Pallats, an Atlan ta housewife, plans to play offense.

title: Foreman Risks Unbeaten String Against Chuvalo Here Tonight
description: George Foreman, the 21yearold heavyweight boxer who won an Olympic gold medal in 1968 and turned professional 13 months ago, will face the most formidable opponent of his career tonight when he squares off against George Chuvalo in a 10round bout at Madison Square Garden.

title: Counsel to Pennsy Trustees
description: Federal Judge John P. Fullam confirmed yesterday the ap pointment of Robert W. Balan chette as special counsel to the trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company. Mr. Balanchette served as a lawyer with the trustees of the New Haven Railroad before that company's transportation lines were acquired by Penn Central.

title: Monmouth Greets Displaced Big A Fans
description: OCEANPORT, Aug. 3 Welcoming hack old, well heeled friends, Herb Shaw greeted the train from New York that unloaded 800 fans at Monmouth Park today.

title: P.S.C HEAD URGES ELECTRICITY TAX
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3Joseph C. Swidler, chairman of the New York State Public Service Commission, suggested today that a 1 per cent Federal tax be imposed on all electric bills to finance research to make the technology of pro ducing energy more compatible with environmental needs.

title: 13,000 March in Belfast Funeral Cortege
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 3Three thousand people marched today in the funerat cortege of a 19yearold youth shot dead by a British Army marksman during rioting here early Friday.

title: Retail Business for July Hit Year's Lowest Level
description: The city's biggest retailers, after becoming accustomed to a reluctant consumer during the year's first six months, ex perienced their worst month of the year in July.

title: Ann and Eve, Sex at Yugoslav Spas
Conditional 8Length Victor At Tropical and Pays $19.60
description: MIAMI, Aug. 3 (AP)Condi tional, beaten in his as two starts, galloped to an eight length victory today at Tropical Park.

title: Foe Presses Drive on Kompong Thom
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 3Heavy fighting in the pro vincial capital of Kompong Thom entered its second day this morning as Vietcong and North Vietnamese troops pressed their apparent objec tive of occupying the town, 80 miles north of Pnompenh.

title: Saints Pick Ramsay to Sart
description: BOWLING GREEN, Ohio, Aug. 3 (AP)  Steve Ramsay, a fifthround draft choice from North Texas State, will open at quarterback for the New Or leans Saints Saturday against the Minnesota Vikings. Saints officials said today.

title: Herbert Arthur Morris Elects New President
description: Stanley Furness has been elected president and a direc tor of Herbert Arthur Morris Advertising, Inc., in a reor ganization move announced by Arthur Abravanel, chair man of the agency's board of directors. Mr. Furness re places Morris Brodis, who died recently.

title: SPANIARD ASSAILS SCORING SYSTEM
COWBOYS'
description: Bob Hayes, star receiver of the Dallas Cowboys, is no long er a reluctant pro football war rior. He had a sudden change of mind yesterday after the players strike was settled.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 3 (UPI) The Defense Department to day listed the names of the fol lowing servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in Southeast Asia:

title: SWAN TAKES LEAD IN TITLE SAILING
description: MORICHES, L.I., Aug. 3John Swan of the Babylon Yacht Club opened defense of the Picken Trophy, symbolic of the Great South Bay Yacht Racing Association's midget sailing title, in an impressive manner today. Swan captured the opening race of the seven race roundrobin series, then finished second in the next three events.

title: Top Ocean Layer Found High in Carbon Monoxide
description: BONN, Aug. 3The West. German research ship Meteor has returned from a North At, lantic expedition with test re sults indicating that carbon monoxide concentrations at a depth of a fathom or two were 10 to 30 times greater than the normal content of the gas in the earth's atmosphere.

title: GRAND JURY ON KENT IS ORDERED BY OHIO
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 3 (AP)  Gov. James A. Rhodes announced today the state would direct a special grand jury inquiry into dis orders at Kent State Univer sity last May.

title: 9 MOUTHWASHES HELD INEFFECTIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (UPI) The Food and Drug Adminis tration said today that a scien tific study had shown that mouthwash products did not bad breath, combat colds or cure sore throats.

title: Bears Get Defensive Back
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 3 (AP) The Chicago Bears obtained defensive back, Mike Johnson, from the Dallas Cowboys today for an undisclosed draft choice. Johnson intercepted eight passes and ran them back for 91 yards in his four seasons with Dallas.

title: JEAN DESSES, 65, FASHION DESIGNER
description: PARIS, Aug. 3Jean Desses, a dominant figure of Paris high fashion for two decades, died yesterday in Greece after a long illness and was buried there today. He was 65 years old.

title: REDMOND IS BURIED; YONKERS IN HOMAGE
description: YONKERS. Aug. 3 (AP) The ashes of Hugh Francis Red onond, former Yonkers resident who was held in a Communist Chinese jail for 19 years until his death several months agog were buried today in the fam ily plot in Oakland Cemetery.

title: AMERICAN NATURAL INCREASES EARNINGS
description: The American Natural Gas Company and subsidiaries have reported operating revenues of $553,469,570 for the 12 months ended June 30. This was up from $503,162,093 a year earlier. Net income rose to $54,304,358, or $3.48 a share. from $47,442,890, or $3.06 a share.

title: PAUL BIBEAULT
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 3 (AP) Paul Bibeault, a former profes sional hockey player died Sun day at a relative's home 30 miles west of here. He was 51 years old.

title: Nickel Prices Are Up
PATHET LAO PLANS GIVEN TO SOUVANNA
description: VIENTIANE, Loas, Aug. 2 (UPI)A representative of the proCommunist Pathet Lao forces handed new peace pro posals to Premier Souvanna Phouma today.

title: 5 Arrested Here in Protest Marking Hiroshima Bombing
description: As part of a planned four day demonstration in connec tion with the 25th anniversary of the atomic bombing of Hiro shima and Nagasaki, about 20 persons took part in a live lout yesterday at the head quartersof the Atomic Energy Commission here.

title: Roundup: McGinn Foils Pirates Again
description: Except for a few occasions, Dangerous Dan McGinn has been more dangerous to the Montreal Expos this season than to the teams he pitches against.

title: Castro Sees His First 747...
description: Fidel Castro got his first look at a Boeing 747 the other day when a Pan American airliner was diverted to Havana by a hijacker.

title: Deadly Detergents
description: In the 1950's, when nitratebased detergents were introduced, they produced huge quantities of suds which were not readily broken down. They bubbled up in the nation's lakes and streams and found their way into reservoirs. Dismayed housewives saw deter gent suds coming out of their kitchen tans.

title: Tight Pesticide Controls Proposed by Rockefeller
description: Governor Rockefeller, in one of the strongest antipollution statements he has made so far, said yesterday he thought people were ready to slow down the pace of economic progress to protect the environ ment.

title: Uruguay Delays Reply to Kidnappers
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 3 (AP)The Government refused today to give a yes or no to a leftist guerrilla demand that all political pris oners be released as ransom for two kidnapped foreign of ficials.

title: RICHARD F. BEMPORAD
description: DARIEN, Conn., Aug. 3 Richard Ferriccio Bemporad died yesterday at his home, Driftway Lane. His age was 80.

title: FIRE HALTS TRAINS UNDER PARK AVE.
description: Three citybound Penn Cen tral commuter trains had to be evacuated in the tunnel under Park Avenue near 72d Street last night after they were trapped because of a smoky thirdrail fire. No one was in jured.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President flew from his San Clemente, Calif., home to Washington, D. C., with a stop in Denver for a meeting with represent atives of the state planning agencies of the Law Enforce ment Assistance Administra tion.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Seven of the 12 doctors who walked out of Lincoln Hospital in the South Bronx two weeks ago have resigned, a hospital spokesman said yesterday.

title: Elizabeth Jones Plans Nuptials
description: FAR HILLS, N.J., Aug. 3Miss Elizabeth Macy Jones, a photographer for The Boston Globe, and Frank Landt Den nis Jr.. a correspondent with The Christian Science Moni tor's bureau in New York, plan to be married on Sept. 19.

title: Nixon's Remarks on Manson and Statement in Washington
description: DENVER, Aug. 3Follow ing is the official transcript of President Nixon's remarks to the press in the Federal Office Building here today:
