title: BRITISH BONDS UP ON LONDON BOARD
... and Gets a Lesson in Farming
description: Fidel Castro has unveiled a devastating picture Cuba's economic troubles. As he himself acknowl edged, the warnings of foreign observers about the inadequacy of his sugar program have come true.

title: 5 Supreme Court Justices File Income Reports
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3Five members of the Supreme Court have voluntarily filed declarations of their income from offthebench activities.

title: Janis Joplin and Her New Group Give Rousing Forest Hills Shou
description: If the concert on Sunday evening at the Forest Hills tennis stadium was any in dication, Janis Joplin finally has a backup band worthy of her.

title: STAMFORD Y.C. GAINS GIRLS'
description: NORWALK, Conn., Aug. 3 The Stamford yacht club crew, with Ellen Watts at the helm, held a 4point lead in the quali fying series of the 29th Long Island Sound girls champion ship regatta today after the first four races were sailed in Lightning Class sloops off Nor walk Yacht Club. After a fifth race tomorrow, the leading five crews in the field of 17 will sail a fiverace final round robin series, rotating the 19 foot centerboard yachts.

title: Plane's Loss Acknowledged
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 3 (AP) An Israeli warplane was shot down over Egyptian territory today during an Israeli attack on surfacetoair missile bases in the central sector of the Suez Canal, the military com mand announced. A spokesman raid the plane had been hit by ground fire  maybe a missile.

title: AIR POLLUTION LIST IS LED BY NEW YORK
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (AP) Preliminary air pollution rank ings for 1970 list Stuebenville, Ohio, as the dirtiest city of the United States and New York City as the most foulded with corrosive oxides.

title: MOBUTU BEGINS VISIT TO U.S. IN BALTIMORE
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 3 (Reu ters)  President Joseph D. Mobutu of the Congo arrived here today for a 12day visit to the United States, which will include discussions of foreign aid and African affairs.

title: University President Named
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 3 (AP)  Dr. John R. Hubbard was named president of the Univer sity of Southern California to day. He has been vice president and provost the last year. Dr. Hubbard, 51 years old, succeeds Dr. Norman Topping, 62, who is retiring for health reasons after serving as president for 12 years.

title: Houk's Confidence in Bull Pen Unshaken by Loss to Brewers
TROOP PLANS ISSUE IN HUMPHREY RACE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3The Administration's candor  or lack of it  in explaining its Vietnam troop withdrawal poli cies has become an issue in former Vice President Hubert H. Humphrey's campaign for a Senate seat from Minnesota.

title: BRITAIN TO PUSH AIRLINE MERGER
description: LONDON, Aug, 3The Brit, ish Government announced to day that it would help two, independent airline operators to amalgamate and go into com petition with the stateowned airlines. It said it wanted such a second force airline to be in operation next summer on major international routes.

title: Parcel Strike Is Spreading Into Jersey
description: A Teamsters' strike against the United Parcel Service spread to a portion of New Jersey yesterday as some drivers at the company's Secaucus, N. J., terminal walked off the job in sym pathy with Local 804, in New York.

title: Charles Ansel Mooers, 100; Tennessee U. Agronomist
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 3Charles Ansel Mooers, director emeritus of the University of Tennessee Agricultural Experi ment Station and nationally known as an agronomist, died at a nursing home yesterday. He was 100 years old.

title: Mrs. Chadsey Gains Medal In Women's Golf With 78
description: BEDFORD, N.Y., Aug. 3Mrs. Carl T. Chadsey Jr. of Round Hill won the medal in the 48th annual Women's West chester and Fairfield Golf Asso ciation championship tourna ment by two strokes today by scoring a 78 at the Bedford Golf and Tennis Club.

title: Lockheed's Profits Sag While Inco's Set Marks
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Cor poration reported yesterday sharply lower earnings for the second quarter and the first half of 1970. But the company said it was making progress toward restructuring two mili tary programs that would per mit a solution of major con tract differences with the Fed eral Government.

title: Westchester Girls Subdue Long Island in Cup Tennis
Screen: Performance
Realty Equities Forecasts Loss for the Fiscal Year
description: The Realty Equities Corpora tion of New York announced yesterday that it expects a loss of between $3.8million and $8.7million after tax credits in the fiscal year ending next March 31.

title: Senate Approves Rise In Savings Bond Rate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (Reuters)  The Senate ap proved today a bill raising the interest rate for Series E Savings Bonds from 5 to 5.5 per cent.

title: State Senator Sees L.I. Periled by Water Pollution
description: LYNBROOK, L. I., Aug. 3State Senator Norman F. Lent, chairman of Senate Health Committee, charged today that the state's water quality stand ards were no longer adequate or relevant to safeguarding hu man health.

title: '72 Candidates Are Off, In One Stage or Another
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 The political world needs a new vocabulary to deal with the various stages of in cipient candidacy for Presi dent  between the time when a man is merely men tioned and late 1971. at the earlier, when he will have announced.

title: A Trawler Just Misses Hitting U.S. Vessel
description: ABOARD THE U.S.S: OBSER VATION ISLAND, at Sea, Aug. 3  A Russian tracking ship stood three miles off today as the United States nuclear sub marine James Madison suc cessfully completed the first underwater firing of a Poseidon missile.

title: Ban on Throwaways Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (AP) Throwaway bottles and cans would be banned nationwide under a hill introduced today in the House. The sponsor, Rep resentative Joseph P. Vigorito, Democrat of Pennsylvania, said the volume of solid waste from packaging materials such as throwaways was growing faster than the population.

title: Fair Will Benefit Cancer Research
description: WOODBURY, L. L, Aug. 3 A Country Rock BarB Q, the sixth annual fair sponsored by the Friends of Waldemar to raise money for the Cancer Research Founda tion will be held on the grounds of the Woodbury In stitute on Sunday.

title: 20TH CENTURYFOX PLANS COST CUTTING
description: Directors of the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation have approved a costcutting program in an effort to reduce Operating expenses by $11mil lion a year by the end of this year, Darryl F. Zanuck, chair man, and Richard D. Zanuck, president, announced yesterday.

title: ROZELLE ASSUMES ROLE OF MEDIATOR
description: After 22 consecutive hours of negotiations mediated by Com missioner Pete Rozelle, the Na tional Football League Club owners and players settled their labor dispute yesterday in an unhappy but relieved atmos phere.

title: SENATORS CLASH ON BANKING CURB
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3  A fight has broken out within the Senate Banking and Currency Committee over a bill to com bat tax evasion, stock fraud and other forms of white collar crime committed under the cover of secret Swiss bank ac counts.

title: The New Dinah Shore
description: Dinah Shore, once a reign ing singer of evening tele vision, began a daily morn ing program for women at 10 o'clock yesterday on the National Broadcasting Com pany's network. If she ac complishes half of what she says she hopes to do in com ing weeks, it may not be necessary to watch other shows.

title: 8 Seeded Players Advance In National ClayCourt Net
description: ROCHESTER, Aug. 3 (UPI)All eight seeded players ad vanced to the second round in the men's United States national amateur claycourt champion ships at the Tennis Club of Rochester.

title: DEBT IS REFINANCED BY KING RESOURCES
description: The King Resources Company of Denver, which was reported to be under mounting financial pressure after its unsuccessful attempt to take over Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., re ported yesterday that it had succeeded in refinancing its shortterm debt.

title: U.S. Hints Fulbright Disclosed Secret Data on Spanish Accord
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3Without naming him, the State Department suggested today that Senator J. W. Fulbright, chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, had dis closed confidential information about a proposed new base agreement with Spain.

title: Japan Exports Set Record
description: TOKYO, Aug. 3 (AP)  The Ministry of International Trade and Industry said today Japa nese exports on a validated basis reached a monthly record of $1.8billion in July. The min istry said the total is 21.2 per cent over June and 7.3 per cent over July of 1969. The pre vious monthly record was $1.8 billion in March, M.I.T.I. said.

title: ARMY DISCLOSES NERVE GAS LEAKS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3Army witnesses told Congress today that lethal nerve gas had been leaking from many of the rockets scheduled to be dumped into the Atlantic this month.

title: Manson Trial Proceeds Despite Nixon Comments
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 3 (UPI) The defense asked that charges against Charles Man son and other defendants in the Sharon Tate murder case be dismissed on the ground that remarks earlier today by Pres ident Nixon about their guilt had made a fair trial impos sible.

title: GREEN SCORES 891 FOR LEAD IN SHOOT
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 3 (UPI)Maj. Frank Green of the Air Force tallied an 891 out of a possible 900 points in the four 22caliber matches today to take the lead in the national pistol championships.

title: Catering to Affluent Youth Market Found Profitable
ACTION CALLED OFF ON NEW FARM BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (UPI) House farm leaders abruptly called off floor action on a new !farm bill today. They said they wanted President's Nixon as surance that he would fight ef forts to lower a committeap proved limit on annual farm payments.

title: Governor Presses Treatment of Addicts
description: Governor Rockefeller, cam paigning for reelection, said yesterday that the addiction problem in the state had grown much bigger than he had ex pected four years ago.

title: 49 Dead in Pakistan Floods
description: KARACHI. Pakistan, Aug. 3 The number of deaths in the floods that have engulfed larger areas of East Pakistan for al week has risen to at least 491 with the death last night of 20 passengers when a bus plunged into a flooded ditch near Dacca.

title: In The Nation: The Conundrum of John Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3Ken O'Donnell, in an article in Life magazine, has shed inter esting but not conclusive light on two matters of large histori cal importancehow John F. Kennedy came to choose Lyn don B. Johnson as his running mate in 1960, and whether Mr. Kennedy, had he lived, would have pursued the war in Viet nam to the extent that Mr. Johnson ultimately did.

title: Balmain Injured in Italy
description: MILAN, Italy, Aug. 3 (Reu ters)  The fashion designer Pierre Balmain was injured dur ing the night when his car left a highway, broke through safety barrier and struck a tree, the police said today. He and his valet were taken to a nearby hospital, where doctors said Mr. Balmain would prob ably take a month to recover.

title: Police Band to Go to Dublin
description: The New York City Police Department's Emerald Society Pipe and Drum Band has ac cepted an invitation to play at the AllIreland Hurling Com petition final in Dublin on Sept. 6. The 35member band will fly to Ireland on Sept. 3. Inspector Pearse Meagher of the Detective Division is musi cal director of the band and Patrolman Ray McConville of the 42d Precinct is director.

title: Gahal Faction Resigns From Israeli Government Coalition Over Acceptance of U.S. Peace Proposal
description: TEL AVIV, Tuesday, Aug. Premier Golda Meir's Gov ernment of National Unity broke up early this morning, when, by a vote of 117 to 112. the Central Committee of the Gahal faction, a nationalist rightwing group, decided to withdraw its six ministers in protest against the Cabinet's acceptance of the United States MiddleEast peace initiative.

title: Bridge:
description: The Swiss team tourna ment that ended Sunday night at the New York Hil ton was won by Peter Lev entritt and Stan Turecki of New York, Bill Passell of Hartsdale, N. Y., and Dave Strasberg of Rockville Cen tre, L. I. They achieved the rare feat of leading through out the event, heading strong field of 70 teams with a final score of 173 victory points of a possible 240.

title: CITY OFFICIAL SEES POWER POLLUTION CURBED BY 1974
description: The chairman of Mayor Lind say's power committee ex pressed hope yesterday that the four years lead time needed to build a new electric power plant in Astoria, Queens, should be enough to allow break throughs on pollution controls with Federal help.

title: Blacks Take Charge, and Changes Follow in Eutaw, Ala.
HARTFORD QUIET; CURFEW IS LIFTED
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 3City officials lifted a 9 P. M.to 5 A. M. curfew today but a state of emergency continued in this state cepital after six days of street disorders.

title: Observer: Further Words on the Chet Huntley Affair
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3Yes, it was true. Chet Huntley had retired at a sacrifice of po tential future gross income of (perhaps) millions. At the peak of celebritude Chet Huntley had retired.

title: Apartheid Attacked on Economic Grounds
description: JOHANNESBURG  South Africa's policy of apartheid, long attacked on ideological grounds, is at last beginning to give way on economic grounds.

title: Iowa Sues Rock Festival
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Aug. 3 (UPI)Gov. Robert D. Ray and Attorney General Richard C. Turner, filed a $1million suit today against the Chicago pro moters of a weekend rock fes tival at wadena. The lawsuit alleges that the promoters, Sound Storm, Inc., knowingly violated state regulations in conducting the event and acted in open defiance of a court in junction banning the festival.

title: Dolan Takes Quebec Golf
description: QUEBEC, Aug. 3 (AP)Jay Dolan of Worcester, Mass., won $2,500 and the Royal Montreal Cup today with a 210 score in the 54hole Quebec open ?? ?? at ??

title: News Summary and Index
description: Secretary General Thant and his special ambassador to the Middle East, Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, met with Secretary of State Rogers yesterday to discuss new efforts for a negotiated settlement in the Middle East. Mr. Rogers said that now that the United States initiative for a ceasefire had been accepted, the issue was in the hands of the United Nations. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Job Growth Here Blamed for Greater Inflation
Police Try to Cope With Mob Attacks
description: A recent series of attacks on policemen has pointed up one continuing problemthere is aparently very little that the Police Department here can do about assaults by crowds on patrolmen making arrests.

title: BRAZIL SALVAGES DAVIS CUP SINGLES
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Aug. (AP)Thomas Koch of Brazil scored a technical victory to day over Spain's No. 1 tennis star, Manuel Santana, and salvaged Brazil's lone triumph in the Davis Cup interzone semifinals.

title: THANT AND ROGERS MEET TO INITIATE NEW MIDEAST PLAN
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 3Secretary General Thant took the first step today toward new peace efforts in the Middle East, conferring on the United States ceasefire pro posal with Secretary of State William P. Rogers and Dr. Gun nar V. Jarring, Mr. Thant's spe cial envoy in the Middle East.

title: GARBAGE BURNED IN EAST HARLEM
description: Residents of two East Har lem blocks twice threw rubbish and discarded furniture into the street yesterday, then set afire to protest what they said was a lack of garbage collec tion in the area.

title: Steel Exports Rose 138% and Imports Fell 17.7% in Half
description: Exports of steel from the United States soared by 138 per cent in the first half of 1970, compared with those of the 1969 period, while imports dropped 17.7 per cent, the American Iron and Steel Insti tute said yesterday in Wash ington.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: The Times's news article (July 11) on the slow pace of auto pollution control overempha sized the threat posed by the critics attack on the auto man ufacturers poor performance to date. Unfortunately for the air breathing public, the allied au tomotive and petroleum indus tries hold all the trump cards in this regulation game.

title: Army's Thumb Found On Induction Scale
description: The City's Department of Consumer Affairs has pasted two condemned stickers on a scale used to weigh draftees at the Armed Forces Induc tion Center on Whitehall Street.

title: PRICES OF BONDS DECLINE SLIGHTLY
Arabs Delay Libya Talks In Rift Over Peace Effort
description: CAIRO, Aug. 3A confer ence of the socalled Arab confrontation countries sched uled to open in Libya today has been postponed as a result of rift among the Arabs over ef forts toward a peaceful settle ment with Israel.

title: House Votes to Ban Mails To Unasked Salacious Ads
The Proceedings In the U. N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: CzechBorn Artist Depicts Suffering in Everyman
description: BERNETraveling through Eastern Europe as a cultural ambassador, John Updike, the novelist, wandered one evening into an apartment building in Prague. He chatted with a friendly, middleagea Czechoslovak named Vavro Oravec, who spoke passable English andas he talkedbegan drawing Mr. Updike.

title: West German Aide Voices Optimism on Soviet Accord
description: MOSCOW, Aug, 3An im portant Bonn official expressed strong optimism today about the chances for a favorable out come of the SovietWest Ger man treaty negotiations, which have entered their second week.

title: AMERICAN MOTORS HAS 3MONTH LOSS
description: DETROIT. Aug. 3 The American Motors Corporation today reported a loss of $14.1 million, or 57 cents a share, for the June quarter, the third! quarter in the auto maker's; fiscal year. This brought the ninemonth loss to $39.5mil lion. or $1.62 a share. The loss figures do not include tax credit benefits. A loss in the fiscal fourth quarter, ending Sept. 30, also is expected.

title: The Day the Hemlines Went Down at Bonwit's
description: It was D for Deadline Day at Bonwit Teller yesterday, and most of the female employes in the public eye bowed to the store's request that they wear the midilength skirt. Some did so against their wishes and did not hesitate say so.

title: How Livable the City?
description: The breezes stirred over New York City yesterday; the sun was out and the air could be breathed without choking, in welcome contrast to last week's unhealthy smog. But only the breezes have stirred. Underlying conditions remain much the same and, because they do, the smog may return. Other dangers, as yesterday's subway and Penn Central mishaps prove, also linger.

title: It's Mexican Cooking California Style
description: OXNARD, Calif.  Our food is not hot, just pleasant ly spicy. Mrs. John Ramirez said as she prepared enchi ladas. young cactus shoots, sopa seen or Spanish rice. and pinto beans in the kitchen of her ranch home here, 40 miles north of Los Angeles in lemon grove coun try.

title: MRS. DUNCAN W. FRASER
description: Mrs. Edna Hubley Fraser, ac tive for many years in the. wel fare work of the Madison Avenue Presbyterian Church, and the Canadian Club, of which she had been president, died at Roosevelt Hospital Sun; day of a stroke. Her husband, Duncan W. Fraser, chairman, of ,the hoard of the American Locomotive Company, died in 1954. Mrs. Fraser was 75 years, old and lived at 135 East 54th Street.

title: Boston Printers Champions
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 3 (AP)The Boston Typos are the Union Printers International baseball champions for the third straight year. The Boston printers won the title for the sixth time in eight years by beating Detroit, 21, Saturday. Boston won its five games in the weeklong tournament.

title: Rare Kind of Aphid Is Found in Jersey In Asparagus Crop
description: TRENTON, Aug. 3  The first known infestation in this country of a rare aphid that attacks asparagus has been reported here.

title: NEED OF CONTROLS HINTED BY MEANY
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 3George Meany, president of the A.F.L. C.I.O., said today that what he called the Nixon Administra tion's game plan for over coming inflation was not work ing and he warned that further rise in unemployment was likely.

title: GOODELL DISCOUNTS LACK OF SUPPORT
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 3 (UPI)Senator Charles E. Goodell ac knowledged today that he lacked the full support. of his Republican Congressional colleagues from New York but said he could win reelection without their help by running on his record as an independ ent.

title: Dr. Otto Warburg Dead at 86; Biochemist Won '31 Nobel Prize;
description: BERLIN. Aug. 3  Dr. Otto; Warburg, the Nobel Prizewin ning biochemist and leader cancer research, died in a West! Berlin hospital Saturday. He was 86 years old.

title: Holladay and Oates Lose In U.S. Junior Net Upsets
RamsBrowns Game Put Off
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 3 (UPI) The Los Angeles RamsCleve land Browns exhibition game has been rescheduled from Fri day night to Saturday night at Memorial Coliseum, the game director, Glenn Davis, an Inounced today. The Los An geles Times 25th annual charity was delayed a day to give players an additional day of practice.

title: Captain of Canadian Ferry Tells of a Futile Radio Call
description: VICTORIA, British Columbia, Aug. 3 (UPI)Capt. James Pol lack, master of a British Co lumbian ferry that was in collision yesterday with a So viet freighter at Active Pass, west of Vancouver, said today he had been unable to make contact with the freighter on an emergency radio channel before the collision.

title: SENATE, 577, BACKS NEW POSTAL SERVICE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (AP) The Senate passed a bill to day to create a corporation style United States Postal Serv ice that would take over man agement of the nation's mails. It also provides an 8 per cent postal pay rise.

title: RESERVE UNIT SET SPEEDIER GROWTH
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3  A divided Open Market Committee voted in early May, on the heels of the Cambodian campaign and general uncertainty in the mon ey markets, to aim at a some what faster pace of growth in the money supply. The Federal Reserve's Open Market Com mittee also decided at its meet ing of May 5, to give its agent in the Government securities markets more leeway than usual.

title: ROLLINS, INC., PLANS TO REBUY ITS NOTE
description: Rollins. Inc., disclosed yes terday plans to repurchase for $22.5million a $2.5million note it issued to the Prudential In surance Company of America in 1964 in connection with the purchase of the Orkin Exter minating Company.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX TAKE A BEATING
description: The American Stock Ex change took its first beating in nine sessions yesterday as de clines outnumbered advances by more than a twotoone ratio in very slow trading.

title: A Vietnamese Prostitute Sees the Future as Lonely and Grim
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, July 29Mai is not a good looking woman, in the eyes of some Vietnamese men, for her shoulders are too big and the bottoms of her heels are not pink or soft. There are still calluses on her hands, although the frosted pink fin gernails are long and curved now.

title: Cubs Down Mets, 61, on a ThreeHitter by Jenkins Before 50,669
description: The Chicago Cubs, who have had a history of retreating in the face of the enemy, were back in town last night for their midsummer skirmish with the New York Mets. But this time, before a crowd or 50,669 per in Shea Stadium, it was the Mets who gave ground.

title: Frequent Target of Commuters
description: When winter storms freeze switches on the Long Island Railroad tracks, when highly touted new cars break down, when subway trains collide, when passengers are trapped in smoky fires, when fares go up and tolls fail to go down, when anyone is late for workit's all his fault, the commuters say. The target of the criticism is Dr. William John Ronan. Dr. Ronan, the man commuters love to hate, is the chairman of the Metro politan Transportation Au thority  some call it the Wholly Ronan Empireand as such is responsible for the operations of the Long Island Railroad, the New York City Transit Authority, the Man hattan and Bronx Surface Transit Authority and the Triborough Bridge and Tun nel Authority.

title: Nassau Protests Move
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas, Aug. 3 (AP)The Bahamian Govern ment is seeking British help to keep the United States from dumping lethal nerve gas 150 miles off Abaco Island until it receives scientific proof that marine and human life in the area will not be harmed.

title: Nelson Asks Ban on Gas Engines By 1975 as Air Pollution Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3Senator Gaylord Nelson pro posod today that the automo bile industry stop making year ly style changes and devote the. $1.5billion that it would save annually to developing a motor that pollutes the atmosphere less.

title: DDT Found to Cause Mutations in Rats
description: The insecticide DDT causes mutations in rat genes, a Food and Drug Administration gene ticist has reported. This is the first time that DDT has been found to cause mutations in an intact mammalian system.

title: Veronica Delaney Prospective Bride
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., Aug. 3Thomas J. Delaney, Commissioner of Public Safe ty here, and Mrs. Delaney have announced the engage ment of their daughter. Miss Veronica Andrea Delaney to James Kearney, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Kearney of Brooklyn, New York.

title: 2 AMERICANS GAIN IN CANADIAN TENNIS
description: TORONTO, Aug. 3 (Canadian Press)  Three of the four seeded players  including two Americansadvanced in senior men's singles today as play opened in the Canadian closed tennis championships.

title: Jets and Giants Step Lively Preparing for Exhibitions on Saturday
description: HEMPSTEAD L. I., Aug. 3 Dave Herman didn't know all of the details of the agree ment between the National Football League Players As sociation and the owners when he reported to Hofstra for the first New York Jets regular camp today but he was sure everything was in order.

title: TEACHERS'
description: Teachers aides and other paraprofessional school em ployes approved a threeyear contract with the Board of Edu cation yesterday that grants them a 140 per cent weekly wage increase plus substantial :fringe benefits.

title: Merck Ends Talks On Starch Merger
description: Merck & Co. and the National Starch and Chemical Corpora tion announced the termination last night of merger negotia tions between the two compa nies by mutual agreement.

title: U.S. Submits Seabed Plan
description: GENEVA, Aug. 3  The United States today submitted a plan for the internationaliza tion of the ocean floor to the United Nations Committee on the Peaceful Uses of the Sea bed.

title: Bills'
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y., Aug. 3 (AP)  Second Lieut. Robert Kaslu, an offensive guard with the Buffalo Bills, has been killed in action in Vietnam, the Bills reported today. Kaslu was killed by mortar fire July 21.

title: Rozelle: Cool Man in Long Night
description: All through the night the impasse re mained. Many of the National Football League clubowners, weary after more than 12 hours of debate, napped in the Com missioner's private office on the 13th floor at 410 Park Avenue. Some flopped on the couch or in chairs, others sprawled on the beige carpet.

title: Con Ed Is Still Mystified By Big Allis ShortCircuit
description: Consolidated Edison said yes terday that it was working around the clock on its dis abled millionkilowatt genera tor at Raventwood, Queens, but that it still had not found the source of the problem.

title: Wilson's Memoirs Due To Bring Him $250,000
description: LONDON, Aug. 3 (AP)Harold Wilson will receive almost $250,000 for the in side story of his six years as Prime Minister, The Sun re ported today.

title: Tentative Increase In '71 Truck Costs Is Set by Chrysler
description: The Chrysler Corporation an nounced yesterday that it had tentatively increased prices of 1971model trucks by an av erage of $98, or 3.8 per cent, over similarly equipped 1970 models.The increases range from $88, or 3 per cent, on the high volume eightcylinder D 100 halfton truck, to $143, or 4.3 per cent, on the D400 me diumduty truck. The company also disclosed that some op tional equipment on its 1970 model trucks would be stand ard on 1971 models.

title: South Africa Files Indictment Against 20 LongJailed Blacks
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Aug. 3A 58page indictment was filed here today against 20 black Africans who ap peared in court charged with terrorist activities intended to overthrow the South African Government.

title: Market Place
description: Will the public be served by the rise in brokerage fees now under consideration for smaller trades? Merrill Chap man thinks not.

title: 10 on Navy Plane Are Killed As Craft Explodes in Storm
description: SEARCHLIGHT, Nev., Aug. 3 (UPI)  Ten persons were killed today when a Navy anti submarine warfare plane ex ploded in flight during a light ning storm 10 miles northwest of this small desert community.

title: Hijacker of 747 Escaped Notice Despite Use of Detection Device
description: A gundetection instrument to foil potential hijackers was in operation at Kennedy Interna tional Airport Sunday when an armed man, who later comman deered a Boeing 747 to Havana, boarded the plane.

title: Times Square's Quiet Hours When MakeBelieve Stops
description: In the long, lonely hours of early morning, Times Square changes. It ceases for a while to play its practiced role as glamour girl of the Western world. Predawn visi tors see it in what amounts to its cold cream and curlers.

title: Advertising: Concerned Sponsors Sought
description: The American Broadcast ing Company is looking for four concerned corpora tions that are willing to co sponsor a new television series next year and to pay almost $2.5million each for the privilege.

title: POP FETE IN FRANCE RUNS UP BIG DEFICIT
description: AIXENPROVENCE, France, Aug. 3 (AP)  France's first openair popmusic festival went silent at dawn today, with the promoters left with a defi cit estimated at $200,000.

title: HAROLD D. SHATTUCK OF SCHRAFFT'S DIES
description: NAPLES, Fla., Aug. 3Harold D. Shattuck, a former executive of the Schrafft's res taurant chain, and a son of its founder, died in the Naples Community Hospital today. He was 80 years old.

title: Webster Is Expecting 2 Dozen Regulars at Workout Today
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Aug. 3  The cafeteria manager at C.W. Post College wanted to know how many players would be on hand for dinner tonight.

title: Kennedys Ride the U.S.S. Kennedy Into Boston
description: BOSTON, Aug. 3 (AP)Twentyfour members of the Kennedy family rode the air craft carrier John F. Kennedy into port today as the ship arrived for her first Boston visit.

title: BLUE CHIPS LEAD SHARP STOCK DROP
Flower Tubs Along Broadway Turning Into Midtown Eyesore
description: Sidewalk garden tubs on mid town Broadway are posing a special problem of environ mental pollution.

title: Youth Is Stabbed to Death; Chinatown Friction Blamed
description: A 14yearold youth was stabbed to death in Chinatown last night as a result of what the police said was apparently friction between Chinese youth gangs.

title: Nursing Home Inspection Called Lax
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 Representative David Pryor, Democrat of Arkansas, charged! today that Government super vision of nursing homes was! grossly ineffective despite the: fact that tax dollars paid for! almost three quarters of the! care the homes provide.

title: Nickerson Will Return To Practice of Law Here
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Aug. 3Eugene H. Nickerson. who will not seek reelection after serv ing three terms of three years each as Nassau County Execu tive, plans to return to the practice of law next year.

title: BROOKLYN JUDGES AID SUCCESSORS
description: Five Brooklyn Civil Court judges resigned yesterday to paVe the way for their nomina tion lo the State Supreme Court and to give Brooklyn Democratic and Republican leaders the opportunity to nom inate their Civil Court succes sors this year rather than next.

title: Critics of Douglas Call Inquiry A Whitewash and  Travesty
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3Leaders of a move to impeach Associate Justice William O. Douglas said today that an in vestigation being conducted by a special House judiciary sub committee was a whitewash and a travesty.

title: 15 ON BUS INJURED ON WAY TO CAMP
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, N. Y., Aug. 3A chartered bus carry ing 36 passengers  most of them children between 7 and 12 years old  to an upstate camp crashed into a car and a tree today after its brakes ap parently failed at an intersec tion.

title: Virologist Suspects Harm in Rubella Vaccine but Would Continue Its Use
description: A leading authority on virus infections suspects that the vaccine against rubella, or Ger man measles, as presently ad ministered may eventually do more harm than good.

title: Bruce Arrives in Paris
description: PARIS, Aug. 3 (Reuters)David K. E. Bruce arrived here today to assume his position as chief of the United States dele gation to the Vietnam peace talks. He said only that he would have board latitude in the negotiations.

title: Man Kidnaps Child, Shoots His Wife and MotherinLaw
description: A 34yearold man allegedly shot his wife and motherin law and then fled with his 4 monthold daughter late last night in Staten Island. The two women were in critical condi tion at Staten Island Hospital.

title: Output per ManHour Rose in Second Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 (Reu ters)Output per manhour rose by a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 3.1 per cent in the second quarter, the Bu reau of Labor Statistics said today.

title: Jane H. Canter To Be a Bride
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass. Aug. 3Miss Jane Helen Canter, who is completing studies in city planning at the Harvard Graduate School of Design, and Robert Hugh Loeffler, a magna cum laude graduate of Harvard, where he was president and editor of the yearbook, will be mar ried in September.

title: 7 Lincoln Hospital Doctors Reportedly Have Resigned
The Big Test in Ulster
description: Prime Minister ChichesterClark shod up once again to extremists in his Unionist party by banning public parades and demonstrations in Northern Ire land for six months. Three days later, however, his order was flouted by Orangemen in a County Tyrone village while troops and police stood by. A disciple the Protestant fanatic, the Rev. Ian Paisley, told crowd of 2,000: Remember this daythe day we broke the ban.

title: Sioux Adopt Modern Art Techniques
description: RAPID CITY, S. D.The American Indian is adopting the white man's ways in art as well as in life.

title: Dance: Where the Young Don't Yawn
description: SHEFFIELD, England, Aug. 3  Few thing in ballet seem more difficult that the entertainment of children. A few children presumably like any kind of ballet, but most dislike both complicated stories and pure dancing and have a dangerously short at tention span.

title: Registration for Voting at 18 Sought This Year by Governor
description: ALBANY, Aug. 3Governor Rockefeller today said he has directed his Secretary of State to prepare for voting registra tion this year of all persons between the ages of 18 and 21.

title: U.S. Is Phasing Out the Mothball Fleet on the Hudson
description: STONY POINT, N. Y., Aug. 3 The mothball fleet of gray troopships, submarine tenders and radar vessels anchored in the Hudson River here since the end of World War II is being phased out.

title: Nixon Calls Manson Guilty, Later Withdraws Remark
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 3 President Nixon asserted today that Charles Manson, a hippie cultist now on trial in Cali fornia, was guilty, directly or indirectly, of eight murders without reason.

title: Noise Drives the Cafe de la Paix Into a Rare Vacation
description: PARIS, Aug. 3The chairs are gone where Oscar Wilde was sitting when he thought he saw an angel on the Avenue de l'Opera.

title: U.S. JUDGE ORDERS CHARLOTTE BUSING
EAST SIDE DRIVE VICTOR IN JERSEY
description: BRANCHVILLE. N. J., Aug.  East Side Drive, an outsider in the field, captured the first junior jumper class today as the Sussex County horse show opened a sixday run.

title: India and East Germany To Establish Consular Ties
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 3India and East Germany have agreed to form consular ties, Swaran Singh, the External Affairs Minister, announced today in Parliament.

title: National Guardsman Killed
description: HUNTINGTON, Mass., Aug. 3 (AP)An apparent fight at a National Guard weekend drill left one man dead and another charged with manslaughter in the killing. The State Police. said that Paul L. Opitz, 21. ??ears old, of Springfield, was dead on arrival yesterday at Noble Hospital. Westfield. Hen ry A. Santaniello of Springfield was charged with manslaughter and released in $2,000 bail.

title: Ilka Suarez Knits: Not for the Pudgy
description: Ilka Suarez, whose shop is on 60th Street near Sec ond Avenue, says she does not do custom, but she does make knits to measure. She's a little particular about what those measurements are, though. They should be no more than a size 12, and while Miss Suarez will take on a 14 now and thenshe thinks no woman should let herself get bigger than that what she really prefers are the sizes below 12. For them, she is now turning out what she calls, along with a lot of other designers, gaucho pants. The real things, in Argentina, Chile and Uruguay, are worn bloused into boots. And while the Ilka Suarez pants do not blouse, they do have a wide, wide leg that makes them look as if they did.

title: SILVER FUTURES DECLINE SHARPLY
description: The sharp decline in stock prices on the New York and American Stock Exchanges cast a shadow over trading in silver futures yesterday.

title: Suharto Acts on Corruption
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 3 (Reuters)In a move to curb corruption. President Suharto today ordered all highranking Government and military offi cials to disclose their personal property. The order came dur ing a campaign by students against official corruption.

title: ELECTIONS BOARD TO CUT 16,000 JOBS
description: A Board of Elections official announced plans yesterday to eliminate 16,000 election inspec tor jobs by the end of the year. The jobs have traditional ly been given to housewives and elderly citizens as a form of of political patronage.

title: WELFARE REFORM IS DELAYED AGAIN
MARLU PRIDE SET FOR $25,000 TROT
description: YONKERS, Aug. 4  With 234 driving victories already in hand this year, the national driving champion, Herve Filion of Canada is well on his way to top his record of 407 win ners recorded last year.

title: DRIVER IN BUS CRASH IS SOUGHT BY POLICE
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, N. Y., Aug. 4A warrant was issued today for the arrest of the driver whose bus carrying 36 children and camp counselors crashed Sunday. The police said the driver had given a false name.

title: Gamble With the Climate
description: When the Senate considers putting up an additional $290 million for the supersonic transport plane, will have before it the warning of a scientific study group bluntly recommending that the entire program be delayed until scientists can determine the prob able effect of the SST on the world's atmosphere.

title: Many Subway Workers Believe System Is Safe
description: A random sampling of the men who operate and maintain the city's subways shows that they say that the system is safe, despite shoddy equipment, tooshort training programs and a lack of manpower.

title: Impulsive Nixon Action
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4President Nixon's comment on Charles Manson yesterday has given the White House the jit ters, aroused the legal fratern ity, and has Manson's lawyers demanding a mistrial. But what fascinates observers here is what the episode tells about Mr. Nixon's mood and behavior. and the light it sheds on the insti tution of the Presi dency itself. What it seems to say about Mr. Nixon is that, like most mortals, he is capable of indiscretions, even large ones, in moments of heat.

title: NEW LABEL ORDERED ON SHELL PESTICIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP) The Agriculture Department informed the Shell Oil Corpora tion today that it will cancel registration in 30 days for the concern's household pesticide, No Pest Strip, if the label is not changed.

title: INTEREST LAGS IN SILVER BUYING
description: There was only one success ful buyer at the Government's weekly silver auction yesterday. It turned out to be a persistent British firm, SharpsPixley & Co. of London, a large buyer over a period of time.

title: Clash in Delta Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 4 (AP)  Sharp fighting was reported today in the Me kong Delta 42 miles southwest of Saigon, where Government troops said they had killed 44 enemy soldiers in a daylong battle.

title: Free Press Beats Tillquest By a Nose at Liberty Bell
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 4The Fourth Estate Stable's Free Press won his second straight race at Liberty Bell Race Track today by defeating Mrs. W. R. Harris's 95 favorite, Tiliquest, by a nose in the feature race.

title: City Paying $85 a Day to Shelter Welfare Family
description: New York's apartment squeeze has forced the Depart ment of Social Services to house 40 per cent more welfare clients this summer in hotels, often at premium rates, a spokesman for the department said yesterday.

title: Volvo Sales in U.S. Rise
description: ROCKLEIGH, N. J., Aug. 4 (UPI)Volvo, Inc., reported to day a rise in its American car sales to 4,591 in July from 4,462 the month before and 3,762 in July, 1969.

title: Jersey Defeats Long Island At Junior Wightman Cup Net
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Aug. 4 New Jersey defeated Long Island, 54, at the Bronxville Field Club today in the second round of the Eastern Lawn Tennis Association's annual junior Wightman Cup matches for girls.

title: NEWCOMBE UPSET IN U.S. PRO TENNIS
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 4It was a cool, clear evening, but Clark Graebner seldom has been hotter.

title: OneSided Race in Idaho
description: BOISE, Idaho, Aug. 4 (AP)Gov. Don W. Samuelson easily won his bid for the Republican renomination in today's pri mary election, but a close race was in progress to determine his opponent in the November general election.

title: Kapp, Free Agent, Among 300 Pros Still Unsigned
description: Problems with their players are far from over for the pro football owners. They now must negotiate individual contracts with more than 300 of the 1,200 seasoned profes sionals who are in training camp but unsigned. Then there are players, such as Joe Kapp, Jim Nance and George Saimes. Who exercised the option clause in their old con tracts and be came free agents last May 1.

title: Ceremonial Entrance Used
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP) A new ceremonial entrance to the west wing of the White House was used today for the first time when President Nixon greeted General Mobutu.

title: A U. S. NEWSMAN IS MISSING IN WAR
description: PNOMPENH, Camhodia. Aug. 4Communist soldiers report edly captured Robert S. Anson. a 25yearold reporter for Time magazine, as he was driving alone late yesterday afternoon in the Cambodian countryside 34 miles north of Pnompenh.

title: VICTORY IS SEEN FOR MRS. ROMNEY
description: DETROIT, Wednesday, Aug. 5Mrs. George Romney scored an apparent primary election victory yesterday in her bid in become the Republican Senate candidate from Michigan.

title: A Bridal Registryfor Pots and Pans
description: SAN FRANCISCOJust as brides register for china and glass at Tiffany's, out here they register at Williams Sonoma for pots and pans. And cooksamateur and professional, including such experts as James Beardsend in orders by mail from around the world for kitchen utensils they can't find else where.

title: Sidney K. Lawrence, Lawyer In State Labor Department
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Aug 4Sidney K. Lawrence, a lawyer for the State Department of Labor, died of cancer yesterday at White Plains Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived here and in Chappaquiddick, Mass.

title: A Day You'd Like to See Forever
description: Yesterday was the sort of summer day that one remem bers from childhood, but it wasn't just nostalgia: It really was a nearly perfect speci men of the way a summer day ought to be.

title: Bell &
description: The Bell & Howell Company yesterday announced its plans to market a new 8mm. movie cassette for use in the home movie market and the audio visual market for schools and industry.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:The release of LDopa by the Federal Food and Drug Admin istration for use by physicians in the care of patients with Parkinson's Disease is a note worthy event. Similarly this same body recently released lithium for the treatment of the manic stage of manic de pressive psychoses.

title: ASSAULT TO HEAD SHAKES CANADIAN
description: George Foreman doesn't have to wave an American flag any more to be noticed. Waving his fists is enough.

title: School Chief Approves Swim Teacher's Bikini
description: ALBANY. Aug. 4  The State Education Commission: cc has ruled that a woman teacher may continue to wear a bikini bathing suit while giving swimming instructions to junior high school boys.

title: Railroad Defers Dividend
description: The North Pennsylvania Railroad, which leases 95 miles of its track In Pennsylvania to the Reading Company, de ferred action yesterday on the regular quarterly dividend of $1 a share.

title: MARSHALL BATS IN 3 WITH 2 DOUBLES
Douglas Lists $20,568 Income From His OffBench Activities
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 4Su preme Court Justice William O. Douglas filed a public re port t.,1 his offthebench ac tivities today, disclosing that he received $20,568.10 in the first six months of this year from his lectures, articles and books.

title: 2 Police Promotions Made
description: Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary announced the ap pointment of Philip A. Mahlkej as chief clerk to succeed Louis I.. Stutman, who recently was appointed a deputy commis sioner in charge of licenses. Mr. Mahlke had been first deputy chief clerk since 1961. Benjamin Lambert, the second deputy chief clerk, was named first deputy chief clerk.

title: STOCKS DECLINE ON LONDON BOARD
description: Stock prices moved lower in moderate trading on the Lon don Stock Exchange yesterday.

title: Two City Officials Clash On Need for Power Plant
description: The heads of two of the city's superagencies clashed yesterday over the proposed Astoria elec tric plantone holding it neces sary to assure power reliability for a goal of creating 300,000 jobs in a decade, the other charging it would create an asthma alley?

title: Austin Brown, ExPartner In Dean Witter &
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 4Austin Brown, a former partner in Dean Witter & Co., the bro kerage house died here Satur day. He was 73 years old, and lived in Walnut Creek, Calif.

title: JOHN W. A. KELLEY
description: John W. A. Kelley, a lawyer for nearly 65 years died yester day in his home at 155 East 76th Street. He was 90 years old.

title: LOSS RATE DROPS FOR STATE FARM
description: The world's largest auto in surer, the State Farm Mutual Automobile Insurance Com pany, reported yesterday substantial improvement in auto insurance business but an overall loss on investments.

title: Storm Landscape: Panorama of Debris
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Aug. 4The first sign that something is wrong shows up a full 50 miles north of her at a little farm town called Refugio.

title: Italian Sextuplets Born; Appear in Good Condition
description: ROME, Aug. 4 (AP)A 35yearold housewife, childless for 11 years of marriage, gave birth today to sextuplets. The three boys and three girls were put into incubators and doctors said all appeared in good con dition.

title: CHARLES H. KENDRICK OF SCHLAGE LOCK CO.
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 4 (UPI)  Charles H. Kendrick civic leader and former head of the Schlage Lock Company died last night. He was 93 years old.

title: Investment Aide Becomes Fiance Of Mrs. Gaines
description: Mrs. Randolph Franklin Hall of Southampton, L. I. and Henry Anthony Barclay of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mrs. Susan LeFevre Barclay Gaines, to Stephen Ely. He is the son of Mrs. Sterling Ely of Washington and Provincetown, Mass., and the late Mr. Ely.

title: Miss Anne L. Drake to Be Bride of Richard Koffey
description: FRAMINGHAM. Mass., Aug. 4Miss Anne Louise Drake. a buyer of radio and televi sion time with Batten. Bar ton, Durstine & Osborn. the advertising agency in New York, and Richard Stephan Koffey, a lawyer with Dewey. Ballantine, Bushby. Palmer & Wood, New York law firm, will be married here Sept. 27.

title: Washington: Making Things Worse Than They Are
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4Ever since President Jefferson an nounced that Aaron Burr was guilty of treason in the Gen. James Wilkinson conspiracy case (he was later acquitted), Presidents of the United States have been in trouble over care less or illconsidered public re marks.

title: NIXON BACKS $55,000 AS LIMIT FOR CROPS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (UPI) President Nixon made it known today that he preferred a limit of no less than $55,000 a crop annually on Government subsidies to farmers, and the House soon afterward began debate on a previously stalled farm bill.

title: Annual Actors Fund Appeal Draws 1,000 Blood Donors
description: More than 1,000 people each donated a pint of blood yes terday at the seventh annual Actors Fund Blood Donor Day at the Imperial and Golden Theaters on West 45th Street. Each donor received two tickets to a Broadway or Off Broadway show.

title: CONSUMER CREDIT ADVANCED IN JUNE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP) Consumer installment credit rose a seasonally adjusted $441 million in June, somewhat above the $415million May increase, the Federal Reserve Board re ported today.

title: MiniConglomerate Misses a Payment
description: Commonwealth United Over seas, N. V., the foreign financ ing arm of the Commonwealth United Corporation, the once glamourous miniconglomerate that has been trying to make a corporate comeback, failed this week to make an inter est payment of $862,500 on a $30million bond issue sold in Europe, the trustee for the issue said yesterday.

title: Gromyko Is Reported to Assure Scheel on German Reunification
description: MOSCOW. Aug. 4West German sources said today that Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union had assured Foreign Minister Walter Scheel that the Kremlin recognized the principle of eventual unification of Ger many by peaceful means.

title: MercedesBenz Sales Up
description: FORT LEE, N. J., Aug. 4 (UPI)MercedesBenz of North America, Inc., reported today rise in its American car sales for the first seven months of 1970 to 15,454 from 14,572 in the corresponding 1969 period Sales dipped to 2,805 in July from 2,866 the month before but topped the 2,738 sold here in July, 1969.

title: Books of The Times
description: Sexual Politics is a radical feminist's study of the infinite variety of man's ex ploitation of woman, and it should be said at once that the book is supremely enter taining to read, brilliantly conceived, over whelming in its arguments, breathtaking in its command of history and literature, filled with shards of wit and the dry ice SEXUAL POLITICS. By Kate Millett. 393 pages. Doubleday. $7.95. of logic, and writ ten with such f ier c e intensity that all vestiges of male chauvin ism ought by rights to melt and drip away like so much fat in the flame of a blow torch. (As it hap pens, I finished reading it just be fore embarking on that most arche typal of male bonding activities, an overnight fish ing trip. Kate Mil lett's arguments glowed in the flames of our campfire, and her scorn seemed mirrored on the surface of the most promising trout pools.)

title: Officials in Syracuse Take Issue With High Rating on Pollution
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 4City of ficials charged, and a Federal official confirmed today, that Syracuse had been named one of the 10 dirtiest cities in the nation on the basis of readings from a single measuring device set up 25 yards from a highway construction project.

title: CHARGES BY F.T.C. DENIED BY AAMCO
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP) AAMCO Automatic Transmis sions, Inc., denied today Fed eral Trade Commission charges that it had forced holders of its franchises to engage in de ceptive trade practices.

title: MRS. MEIR TELLS OF U. S. ASSURANCE ON PEACE FORMULA
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 4  Pre mier Golda Meir spelled out a firm Israeli position today for proposed peace talks with the United Arab Republic, but de clared that Israel's acceptance of the United States peace ini tiative was unconditional.

title: CABINET OF BOLIVIA RESIGNS AMID CRISIS
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Aug. 4 (AP)  President Alfredo Ovando Candia received the resignation of his Cabinet today after three weeks of nolitical crisis.

title: Bankruptcy Petition Filed By Charter Securities Co.
description: The Charter Securities Com pany, Ltd., an overthecounter brokerage house, filed a bank ruptcy petition in Federal Dis trict Court here yesterday, list ing liabilities of $363,281 and assets of $133,703.

title: White House Defends Air Raids In Cambodia as Interdiction
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4The White House insisted today that United States aircraft were flying only interdiction mis sions against enemy forces in Cambodia.

title: Yiddish Stage Era Ended in Britain
description: LONDON. Aug. 4  The Grand Palais was packed once. By 8 o'clock, the audi ence had swarmed through the mirrored lobby and was sitting noisily in the red plush seats.

title: Senate Votes to End Disclosure Of Contracts by Congressmen
description: WA SHINGTON, Aug. 4The Senate voted unanimously to day to put an end to the long standing and politically popular practice of permitting members of Congress to announce the award of defense contracts.

title: SLOW 1971 GROWTH IS SEEN FOR CANADA
description: PARIS, Wednesday, Aug. 5 (Reuters)The Organization for Economic Cooperation and De velopment said today that the rate of growth of the Canadian economy next year would prob ably be well below its potential and that undevelopment could rise to about 6 per cent by December. The 21nation or ganization was reporting on the outlook for the Canadian econ omy during the next 12 months.

title: Curb on Swiss Bank Accounts Voted by Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 4The Senate Banking and Currency Committee passed today a bill designed to stop the affluent from using secret Swiss bank accounts to commit tax eva sion, stock frauds and other white collar crimes.

title: Goldberg and Ottinger Gain Support of Eugene McCarthy
description: Senator Eugene J. McCarthy gave his endorsement yester day to Arthur J. Goldberg, DemocraticLiberal candidate for Governor, and Representa tive Richard L. Ottinger, Demo cratic candidate for United States Senator.

title: DE MURIAS WINS YACHTING CROWN
FAMILY OF 6 SUES TO HALT EVICTION
description: A couple with four children who were ordered evicted from a city housing project filed suit in Federal Court yesterday challenging the con stitutionality of the Housing Authority's eviction procedure.

title: Reserve's AntiInflation Strategy Is Set
description: The strategy of the Federal Reserve System for controlling inflation calls for holding the rate of growth in total demand for goods and services below the economy's overall growth potential through the end of 1971, an official spokesman for the Federal Reserve Bank of New York said here yester day.

title: PANTHERS LOSE BID TO BLOCK WITNESS
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 4Judge Harold M. Mulvey denied today a defense request that he bar George Sams Jr. from testify ing in the Lonnie McLucas trial on the ground that Sams was insane.

title: STOCKS ARE MIXED IN LIGHT TURNOVER
description: Working their way out of an early decline, stock prices closed mixed yesterday in another ses sion of relatively slow trading.

title: 4 Italian Parties Agree on Platform to Revive Coalition Cabinet
description: ROME, Aug. 4Italy's four centerleft parties agreed sepa rately tonight to revive their coalition, which has ruled the country for the last seven years.

title: STOCK WITHDRAWN AT HAYDEN, STONE
description: Another member of a group of Oklahoma businessmen who lent securities to bolster the capital of Hayden, Stone, Inc., has withdrawn the securities and substituted cash.

title: ROZELLE DECISION DRAWS CRITICISM
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 4 (AP)Paul Brown, coach and general manager of the Cincinnati Bengals, criticized today the National Football League com missioner, Pete Rozelle, for granting negotiators for the Players Association additional time to report to their teams.

title: New Showdown Near in Fatal Yonkers Fire Case
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 4The latest chapter in a tragic story that began with the death of 12 persons in a Yonkers fire in 1965 began to unfold in courtroom here last week.

title: Celler Panel Will Continue Investigation Into Douglas
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (UPI) Representative Emanuel Cel ler, Democrat of Brookls..n, chairman of the House Judi ciary Committee, said today that he would continue his in vestigation of Justice William O. Douglas but would not re spond to some Congressional critics who had called the in quiry a farce.

title: GARBAGE PICKUPS CUT TO 2 A WEEK IN PARTS OF CITY
description: Garbage collection is being reduced from a schedule of three times a week to twice a week for thousands of fam ilies in many sections of the city.

title: Braless Look: 2 Years Ago a Daring Fad, but Now It's a Trend
description: Two summers ago it was virtually un heard of. Last summer it was mainly confined to the Bethesda Fountain, the East Village and Washington Square Park. But now, as anybody who has been out walking on a warm summer day can plainly see, the braless look has established a beachhead in Man hattan.

title: Montgomery Smith Marries Miss Anne Bowler in Newport
description: NEWPORT, R. I. Aug. 4Miss Anne Fairchild Pendle ton Bowler and Montgomery Meigs Smith were married here this afternoon. The ceremony was performed by Canon Lockett F. Ballard in Trinity Episcopal Church, where the bride's greatgreat grandparents were married in 1750.

title: Passer Here on Business
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 4While the New York Jets slowly put together their roster today, Joe Namath, their star quarterback, wasn't to be found at the training camp and his whereabouts remained a mys tery to the club.

title: A DEALER DEFENDS BOMBBOOK SALES
description: WASHINGTON Aug 4 (AP) A distributor of books on explosives and guerrilla war fare told a Senate panel today that he felt no more respon sible for their misue than Gen eral Motors should if its cars were used by terrorists on the way to bombings.

title: TED BLACK
description: Ted Black a former band leader and music company ex ecutive, died at the Lutheran (Medical Center in Brooklyn on Friday of a heart attack. He was 70 years old and lived at 9511 Shore Road, Brooklyn.

title: France Relaxes Currency Curbs on Travel Abroad
description: PARIS, Aug. 4  Almost a year after France acknowl edged her critical financial con dition by devaluing the franc, the Government has virtually lifted exchange controls for in dividuals as one sign of recovery.

title: EXECUTIVE IS FINED OVER SALE OF NOTE
description: A Westchester man, formerly executive vice president of the Realty Equities Corporation, was fined $10,000 yesterday for having sold a note to a Boston financier in violation of the kickback section of the Investment Company Act.

title: Coach Limits Formations
description: BROOKVILLE L. I. Aug. 4We're football players, not negotiators, said Greg Larson, the player representative of the New York Giants. We're glad to be playing. This way, we can release our emotions.

title: France and Britain Present Proposals on Use of Seabed
description: GENEVA, Aug. 4 (Reuters)France and Britain today sug gested two alternatives to a United States proposal for ex ploiting mineral resources of international seabeds.

title: Kirk May Seek Injunction to Stop Dumping of Nerve Gas Off Florida
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP) Gov. Claude R. Kirk, Jr. of Florida said today that he would seek a court Injunction if necessary to stop the Army from dumping obsolete nerve gas rockets into the Atlantic Ocean some 280 miles off Cape Kennedy.

title: $405,000 Filly Third in Jersey Debut
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., Aug. 4 They called her Rain En chanteur as they hovered around the paddock area, four and five deep, trying to get a look at Reine Enchan teur, the world's most expen sive filly who was making her first start today at Mon mouth Park.

title: Mostly Mozart Serenades Off to a Promising Start
description: The Midsummer Serenades of Lincoln Center, operating this time under the cutesy title of A Mostly Mozart Festival, opened its August. series Monday night in Phil harmonic Hall. The opening program lived up to its title.

title: C.A.B. AIDE FAVORS DEAL BY AIRLINES
description: Robert L. Park, an examiner for the Civil Aeronautics Board, recommended yesterday in Washington the board's ap proval of the merger of North east Airlines into Northwest Airlines.

title: Sports of
description: It was a bad time to call Horse. I'm a little rushed right now, he said. Get what I mean?

title: FIVE CHICAGO BANKS NAMED IN TRUST SUIT
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 4 (AP)  A $3billion antitrust suit was filed today in United States Dis trict Court charging five major Chicago banks with conspiracy to fix the price of consumer credit in Illinois.

title: Foreign Affairs: Japan's Sun Also Rises
description: ASPEN, Colo.  The corning superpower is not China but Japan which, by late this cen tury or early ext one will possess the largest gross na tional product in the world. Such is the considered opinion of Herman Kahn futurologist and director of the Hudson In stitute in his forthcoming book, The Emerging Japanese Super state: Challenge and Response (PrenticeHall, publishers).

title: 12 Bids Received For Mothball Ships Anchored in Hudson
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4The Maritime Administration opened bids today on ships anchored in the Hudson River in a mothball fleet that is being phased out this year.

title: Negro 2d in Mississippi
description: WEST POINT, Miss., Aug. 4 A Negro ran second in a special election here today for Mayor. A runoff between the two leading candidates is slated for Aug. 18.

title: Truman, 86, Casts Vote in Primary
description: INDEPENDENCE, Mo., Aug. 4 (AP)  Former President Harry S. Truman, making one of his rare public appear ances, voted today in Mis souri's primary election.

title: RICHARD F. SELIG
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 4 Richard F. Selig, chairman of the board and president of Piser Furniture Company, at Third Avenue and 150th Street in the Bronx, died of a heart attack Sunday at White Plains Hospi tal. He was 61 years old and lived in Mamaroneck.

title: Egypt Appears Firm
description: CAIRO, Aug. 5Despite the clamor of Arab extremists against the United States initiative, there were indica tions here today that the Egyptian leadership would not allow itself to be intimidated into refusal.

title: MRS. LYNN H. HOUGH
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 4Mrs. Blanche Horton Hough the wife of Dr. Lynn Harold Hough a Methodist theologian died at a nursing home here yes terday. She was 91 years old, and lived at 1165 Fifth Avenue.

title: Selling by Phone Is Curbed
description: KARLSRUHE, West Germany, Aug. 4 (AP)The West German Supreme Court has ruled that use of the telephone for sales or advertising campaigns in vades privacy and is an unfair business practice. The court re jected a Dortmund newspaper's contention that any person who allows his name to he listed in t he telephone hook leaves him self and his home open to the world

title: FOE SAID TO YIELD CAMBODIAN CITY
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 4 (AP)The Cambodian com mand reported today that its troops drove hundreds of North Vietnamese and Vietcong sol diers out of the provincial cap ital Kompong Thom yesterday after three days of fighting.

title: AMEX STOCKS CUT MORNING LOSSES
description: The American Stock Ex change ended on the fence yes terday after steppedup buying in the afternoon erased earlier losses.

title: Harlem PoliceCareers Program Gets $164,000 Model Cities Aid
description: A program to train young Harlem residents, even those with mild police records, to take. Police Department en trance examinations was an nounced yesterday by the Har lemEast Harlem Model Cities Office.

title: '70 Chevrolet Station Wagon Recalled Because of Flaw
description: DETROIT, Aug. 4 (AP)The Chevrolet Division of the Gen eral Motors Corporation has announced the recall of about 3,300 1970 Chevrolet station wagons to replace a possibly defective load rest attachment in the bumper jack.

title: Algeria Indemnifies Phillips For Nationalized Holdings
description: ALGIERS, Aug. 4 (AP)Sonatrach, the Algerian na tional petroleum company, and the Phillips Petroleum Company said today that agreement had been reached on the indemnity to be paid to Phillips for the nationaliza tion of its Algerian holdings.

title: CHANTILLY CAPTURES PONY HUNTER TITLE
description: BRANCHVILLE, N.J., Aug. 5  Chantilly scored 15 points and won the small pony hunter championship tonight at the Sussex County Horse Show. That gave Sindy Paul a one, two finish.

title: Treasury Statement
Valentine E. Macy Jr., 72, Dead; Headed Macy Newspaper Chain
description: Valentine E. Macy Jr., phi lanthropist and former presi dent of the Macy newspapers in Westchester and Rockland Counties now part of the Gan nett chain, died yesterday in his apartment at 115 East 67th Street. He was 72 years old and maintained his main resi dence in East Hampton, L. I.

title: ExOfficials Expect Wide Defiance of Integration
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4Two former Federal officials said today that they foresaw in the South widespread defi ance of integration, flourishing private segregated schools for whites, increasing resegregation and violence as the result of desegregation policies of the Nixon Administration.

title: Knesset Disclosure Noted
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP) American sources say an aerial clash between Soviet and Israeli pilots was disclosed to the Israeli Knesset (Parliament) on July 27 but was hushed up by the Israeli Government.

title: New Books
description: Eagle in the Snow by Wallace Breem (Putnam $5.95) A Roman legion A.D. 406 holds the line along the Rhine.

title: INDICTMENTS NAME 2 U.M.W. OFFICIALS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP)  The president and the sec retarytreasurer of the United Mine Workers District 5 were indicted today on charges of conspiracy and the filing of false expense vouchers and fi nancial reports.

title: PARCEL WALKOUT ENDED IN JERSEY
description: The United Parcel Service prepared to resume deliveries in northern New Jersey yester day after members of Teamster Local 177, which struck the company's Secaucus terminal Monday. agreed to return to work with an assurance they could wear American flag pins on their uniforms.

title: Mrs. Jane Gutman Sachs,57, Active in Charitable Groups
description: Mrs. Jane Gutman Sachs, who was active in a number of charitable organizations, died of heart failure Monday night at her home, 875 Park Avenue, after a year's illness. She was 57 years old and was the wife of Henry N. Sachs, an insurance executive.

title: Elevens Picked for Charity Game
description: Southern University of Lou isiana and North Carolina Agricultural and Technical College, two football power houses among predominantly black schools, will meet in the third annual invitation game at Yankee Stadium Fri day night, Sept. 11.

title: Japan Moves to Regulate Dumping of Waste in Rivers
description: TOKYO, Aug. 4 (UPI)The Japanese Cabinet today issued a regulation requiring all fac tories dumping large amounts of waste into rivers to register with the Government.

title: 29th Session in Vienna
description: VIENNA, Aug. 4 (AP)American negotiators at the 29th session of the talks on limitations on strategic arms today outlined the United States suggestions for limiting nuclear missiles, a conference source said. He said the Soviet delegates asked questions about the suggestions.

title: Designers Sign Up On Pillows
description: Just when it appears that there is nothing else that could possibly take a designer signature, along conies Saks Fifth Avenue with a group of signed designs in needlepoint pillows. The signatures, wov en into the actual design, in clude the cream of Seventh Avenue, from Bill Blass and Mollie Parnis to Chester Weinberg and Jacques Tif feau. Bill Blass's idea in this area is an abstract swirl of camel and blue; Mol lie Parnis has used a Bessara bian rug in her library as her inspiration and Giorgio di Sant  Angelo chose an open mouthed gargoyle. Other de signs include Tiffeau's mod ern painting, Donald Brooks's leopard print and Adolfo's

title: Advertising: Golf Network Tees Up for TV
description: Robert Angelus caught a plane last night for Akron, Ohio, so he could be on tap early tomorrow for the open ing of the American Golf Clas sic. But he's not a profes sional on the tourhis 10 handicap is not quite good enoughnor is he merely a devoted fan of the sport.

title: Britain's Reserves Rose Again in July
description: LONDON, Aug. 4 (AP) Britain's monetary reserves rose by $4.8million in July, the first full month under the new Conservative Govern ment, the Treasury an nounced today.

title: Evangelism Updating That OldTime Religion
description: ASHEVILLE, N. C.  Billy Walker Jr. strode back and forth under his tent, a hand microphone close to his mouth, his face dripping with perspiration and his voice hoarse from two solid hours of singing and preaching.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Premier Golda Meir of Israel explained her country's firm position for the proposed peace talks with the United Arab Republic. However, she declared that Israeli accept ance of the Rogers peace plan for the Mid dle East was unconditional. She acknowl edged that she had been swayed from her opposition to the United States peace ini tiative by military and political assurances from President Nixon. [Page 1, Column 8; Text: 3:13.]

title: PATROL OF RHODESIA REPORTED NEAR END
description: LONDON, Wednesday, Aug. The Daily Telegraph reported today that a British naval patrol that has been enforcing trade sanctions against Rhodesia will be ended shortly.

title: JUDGE'S SON IS PUT IN YOUTH UNIT'S CARE
description: Theodore Rosenberg, the 17year old judge's son whose father arranged a special ar raignment for him and three friends after their arrest last June on drug charges. was ac cepted for counseling yesterday by the city's Youth Counsel Bureau.

title: I.R.S. INVESTIGATING 7 FRENKIL CONCERNS
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 4An in vestigation by the Internal Rev enue Service of Victor Frenkil, chief executive of Baltimore Contractors, Inc., was disclosed today in papers filed in Federal Court here.

title: Stamp Honors Eisenhower
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 4 (AP)The new 6cent stamp honoring former President Dwight D. Eisenhower will be presented to President Nixon at the White House tomorrow. Mrs. Nixon and General Eisenhower's widow will take part in the ceremony.

title: Portuguese Again Force Opposition Leader to Go
description: LISBON, Aug. 4The Portu guese opposition leader, Mario Soares, has been forced into exile once again. The author ities gave him eight hours to get out of the country, to which he had returned for his father's funeral, or face arrest.

title: Hiatus at State
description: For years the Under Secretary of State has been the dayin, dayout manager of the bulk of United States foreign policy business and the diplomatic establishment that carries it out. Fur nearly two months that job has been vacant.

title: ELECTIONS JOB CUTS UP FOR STUDY TODAY
description: The Board of Elections is scheduled to consider today proposal to eliminate 16,000 election inspector jobs during voter registration periods. Three of the four board members in dicated yesterday that they would support the proposed cut.

title: Western Union Recruiting
description: The Western Union Telegraph Company has begun the most extensive employe recruiting campaign in its history. The company is seeking about 1,500 workers to handle operations of the Bell System's teletypewriter exchange service, which it is acquiring early next year.

title: Catholic Theater Awards
description: The National Theater Arts Conference will make its annual awards this year to the American Shakespeare Festival Theater in Stratford, Conn., and to the Rev. Gilbert Hartke, a Roman Catholic priest who heads the theater department lid Catholic University in Wash ingto. The group, formerly the National Catholic Theater Con ference, will present the awards on Aug. 14 during its annual meeting, to be held at the Uni versity of Bridgeport.

title: Jersey, Citing Nine Plants, Opens Drive to Cut Odors
description: TRENTON, Aug. 4  State officials, announcing a new drive to eliminate foul odors over northern New Jersey's in dustrial heartland, charged nine industrial giants today with contributing to air pollution.

title: Columbia Gas Profit Rises
description: Net income of the Columbia Gas System, Inc., in the six months ended June 30 rose to record $58,876,000, or $1.90 a share, from the yearearlier $54,541,000, or $1.79 a share. Operating revenues rose to $472,583,000 from $439,126 000

title: Manson Displays to Jurors Headline on Nixon Remark
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 4Charles M. Manson held up be fore the jury today a newspaper with the headline Manson Guilty, Nixon Declares and forced a halt in testimony at the Tate murder trial.

title: Latest Teaching Hardware Shown
description: The latest in education and training equipment, much of it plugged in and faintly hum ming, was put on display yes terday at the sixth annual American Management Asso ciation conference on educa tion and training.

title: DWIGHT P. JOYCE
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 4 (AP)Dwight P. Joyce former presi dent and chairman of the board of the Glidden Company a paint manufacturer, died in suburban Lakewood yesterday. He was 70 years old.

title: Ballet: Bejart  on Adriatic
description: DUBROVNIK, Yugoslavia, Aug. 4There are a few Eu pean music and drama fes tivals that can match Dubrov nik for the sheer beauty and excitement of its settings, but none that can surpass it.

title: Again, U.N. Truce Supervisors Hear Talk of a Truce
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 4High on a hilltop, with breathtaking views of both Jerusalem and Bethlehem, is the headquarters of the United Nations Truce Supervision Organization.

title: CaliforniaWestern Life Elects a New President
description: The CaliforniaWestern States Life Insurance Company an nounced yesterday in Sacra mento that it had elected Harold S. Hook, 38 years old, as its president.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Israeli Reply to U.S. on Peace Proposal
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 4 (Reu ters)Following is the text of Israel's reply to the Ameri can proposal for peace in the Middle East, as forwarded to Washington today:

title: LABOR'S COUNCIL ASSAILS MITCHELL
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 4The ex ecutive council of the A.F.L. C.I.O. accused Attorney Gener al John N. Mitchell today of seeking to silence the American trade union movement for pure ly political purposes.

title: HURRICANE WANES AFTER KILLING 31
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Aug. 4  Hurricane Celia was dying in the mountains of Mex ico today after moving across Texas and leaving this resort City of 335,000 people without gas or electricity and heavily damaged.

title: City and Con Edison Disagree On Pollution by Projected Plant
description: How can the city's Environ mental Protection Administra tion say the projected new elec tric power plant at Astoria, Queens, would increase air pol lution while Consolidated Edi son contends pollution would be decreased?

title: Aer Lingus and Lennen Parting
description: Irish International Airlines (Aer Lingus) has come to a parting of the ways with Lennen & Newell, Inc. Toni Ken nedy, director of public relations and advertising for the airline, said that the decision, reached with real regret, was based on a conflict of interest with another current Lennen & Newell airlines clientWorld Airlines.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President greeted President Joseph D. Mobutu of the Congo and later gave a dinner in his honor. He saw Representa tive Charles W. Sandman Jr., with State Senator and Mrs. Robert Kay of New Jersey.

title: U.S. STEEL LIFTING TIN MILL PRICES
description: The United States Steel Cor poration on Oct. 1 will increase the price of tin mill products, widely used in the canning of food and beverages.

title: CanAm Race Sept. 13 Shifted From Long Island to Georgia
description: Motor racing has been characterized as a cruel sport. It also happens to be a rough business: Larry LoPatin is ousted from control of a chain of race tracks and is replaced by a man he had previously forced out; Bridge harapton (L. I.) loses its Can Am date and is fighting its landlord and the Sports Car Club of America; Dal las International Motor Speedway, a contender for the 1970 Hard Luck Cup, loses the American Road Race of Champions; Sears Point in California folds up, losing its CanAm and Trans American dates.

title: Market Place: Brilliant Future Forecast for Oil
description: If coal and gas production lose ground at a time when the nation's energy require ments are soaring, what's to fill the gap?

title: WILLIAM SADLER
description: BUFFALO Aug 4 (AP) William Sadler of suburban Hamburg, a Republican Assem blyman from 1951 to 1964, died at his home yesterday at the ge of 79.

title: The Voters and Mr. O'Rourke
description: The lukewarm to hostile reaction of party leaders to Election Commissioner Maurice O'Rourke's proposal for slashing the number of election inspectors in local registration this fall helps expose what is fundamen tally wrong with the electoral process. Especially New York City, that process remains too much the province of professional politicians and too little that of the ordinary voter. Partisan leaders continue to drag their heels at a time when the need for sweeping elec toral reforms has become painfully clear.

title: Hanoi Charges U.S. Raids
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 4 (Reut ers)North Vietnam today ac cused the United States of having attacked villages in the northern part of the demili tarized zone last Friday and Saturday. The North Vietnam ese press agency said American warplanes, including B52's, bombed Huong Lap and Vinh Son Villages.

title: HARGAN OF INDIANS TAKES 5TH IN ROW
