description: HYANNIS PORT, Mass., Aug. 5Robert F. Kennedy Jr., sec ond oldest son of the late Sen ator, and Robert Sargent Shri ver 3d, son of the former United States Ambassador to France, are scheduled to appear in Juve nile Court tomorrow on charges of possessing marijuana.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX DRIFT AIMLESSLY
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange drifted aimlessly yes terday and finished almost un changed in steppedup trading.

title: Radio
description: 11:05Noon, WNCN: Adventures in Good Music. Principal Chords or Harmonization.

title: Pan Am World Airways To Issue a Credit Card
description: Pan American World Air ways announced yesterday that it will introduce a new credit card, effective Sept. 1, to be known as the Take Off card.

title: Dr. Hans Molitor, 74, Founder Of Merck Research Unit. Dies
description: Dr. Hans Molitor, founder and first director of the Merck Institute for Therapeutic Re search, died yesterday at Point Pleasant (N.J.) General Hos pital. He was 74 years old and lived at 383 Iroquois Drive, Cedar Croft, Brick Township, N.J.

title: HARTFORD FIRE LISTS SHARP INCOME JUMP
description: The Hartford Fire Insurance Company, now owned by the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, reported yesterday that net operating in come in the second quarter had risen almost 29 per cent to $12.7million, or 59 cents share, from $9.9million, or 46 cents a share, in the yearear lier neriod.

title: Lesson of Hiroshima
description: An entire generation has been born and has grown to maturity since the atom bombing of Hiroshimajust 25 years ago todayyet the shock waves set off by that event still reverberate around the world. At Hiroshima and a few days later at Nagasaki the world received unforgettable glimpses of the disas trous perspectives modern military technology has opened up for all life on this planet.

title: 25 Years After Bomb, Hiroshima Bears Few Visible Scars
News Summary and Index
description: Israel and Egypt would police each other's observance of the proposed Middle East ceasefire under a plan reported yesterday to be favored by American officials. Israel has already said that she has no confidence in ceasefire supervision by the United Na tions. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: State Tax Receipts For First 4 Months Fail to Make Gains
description: ALBANY. Aug. 5  State tax receipts for the first four months of the current fiscal year have not reflected the an ticipated 10 per cent revenue increase predicted by Govern or Rockefeller's budget mak ers

title: ALEXANDER MUNRO, EXCON ED OFFICIAL
description: Alexander Robert Munro, public relations man and for mer president and board chair man of Knickerbocker Hospital, died Tuesday in his home at 325 Riverside Drive at the age of 85.

title: BRAZIL WILL CURB VIGILANTE GROUPS
description: BRASILIA, Aug. 5  The Brazilian military Government yesterday ordered swift action to halt the slaying of petty criminals by vigilante groups called death squads and also ordered faster police investi gations and trials for political crimes.

title: Bridge:
description: Tournament bridge enthu siasts will be crisscrossing the United States today and tomorrow. Some will no doubt pass each other unwit tingly in airport terminals.

title: Tittle's Tutoring Wisens a Rookie
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Aug. 5 If it hadn't been for that strike by the football players, Ed Baker's life would be a lot more simple today.

title: AGNEW CRITICAL OF 2 DEMOCRATS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5Vice President Agnew accused two prominent Democrats today of demeaning and deplorable conduct in their recent apprais als of the Vietnam war policies during the Kennedy and John son Administrations.

title: 5 Arab Countries Begin Delayed Parley in Libya
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Aug. 5 (Reuters)  The conference of the socalled Arab confronta tion countries opened here to day after a twoday delay dur ing which Premier Muammar elQaddafi of Libya tried unsuc cessfully to persuade the Iraqis to end their boycott of the meeting.

title: New PayPhone Unit
description: A small Philadelphia manu facturer of burglar alarms has found yet another legal way to cut into the once sacrosanct territory of the telephone company.

title: G.M. Opens Detroit's New Battle With MiniImports
description: DETROIT, Aug. 5  Once more into the breach go Detroit's auto makers with a new line of minicars aimed at stemming the millionayear flood of imported automobiles.

title: In West German Army, It's Again Herr General
description: BONN, Aug. 5  Follow ing strong opposition by both officers and soldiers, De fense Minister Helmut Schmidt today revoked a reform intended to democra tize etiquette in the armed forces by banning the use of Herr (Mister) when ad dressing higher ranks.

title: Driver Unlicensed, Bus Company Aide Is Held in Accident
CITY BEGINS WORK ON NEW HOSPITAL
description: Under strong pressure from Puerto Rican community lead ers in the South Bronx, the city formally started to clear the site yesterday for a new med ical and mental health center to replace the dilapidated Lin coln Hospital, founded in 1839.

title: Observer: Down at the American Seashore
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 5We went to the seashore and saw the strange things Americans do there. One evening in a lumi nous foggy twilight, for ex ample, there were several Amer icans standing at the ocean's edge holding long sticks.

title: Atkinson Retires From Jets, Criticizing Namath for His Absence From Camp
description: With an attack on the ab sence of Joe Namath from the New York Jets training camp, Al Atkinson, their dependable middle linebacker, announced his retirement yesterday from pro football.

title: NOROTON Y.C. GIRLS WIN SAILING CROWN
description: NORWALK, Conn., Aug. 5The Noroton Yacht Club crew, captained by Susie Crimmins, survived a disqualification in the first of today's three races off Norwalk Yacht Club and won the Long Island Sound girls championship regatta.

title: State Gives Group in Bronx InterestFree Housing Loan
description: Governor Rockefeller issued the first interestfree loan yes terday under a new slate pro gram to prevent decay or abandonment of structurally sound apartment buildings.

title: Miss Anne Burke, Student, Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Francis D. Burke of New York and Point Lookout, L. I., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Anne Patricia Burke, to Thomas J. Corridan Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Corridan of New York.

title: Draft Lowest Since 1964; 195 Likely Cutoff Number
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The Defense Department an nounced today a draft call of 39,000 for the last four months of 1970, which would bring the year's total to 163,500, the lowest since 1964.

title: Hartke Chides Pennsy's ExFinance Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 David C. Bevan, who was dis missed on June 8 by the Penn Central Transportation Com pany's directors as the rail road's chief financial officer, was sharply criticized here to day by Senator Vance Hartke, Democrat of Indiana, for lay ing the blame for the Penn Central's collapse at everyone ?? ??

title: ASIAN ACTORS ANGRY OVER MUSICAL ROLES
description: A group of OrientalAmerican lactors yesterday picketed the offices of Herman Levin, the theatrical producer, at 424 Madison Avenue, charging dis crimination in casting his forth coming new musical.

title: Strategy for Campus
description: It is now almost six years since the student rebellion be gan in this country. In that time very few colleges and universities  perhaps none have developed a specific, co herent strategy for coping with it. The usual pattern is for incidents to develop willy nilly. Student rebels press their assault. The administra tion responds in an essentialliy ad News hoc manner. Con Analysis fusion ensues, and cracked heads of ten follow. This central matter has so far been somewhat overshadowed as the President's Commission on Campus Unrest winds up the first phase of its investigative worka threeweeklong series of hearings that began in Washington July 15 and ended in Los Angeles this week.

title: John Jay Shown as an Early Militant
description: Fragments of a rare diary of John Jay, lost for almost two centuries, show that he procured guns from Connecti cut for the New York patriots in July, 1776, at a time when he was generally believed to have harbored hopes of con ciliation with the British.

title: U.S. Combat Deaths Stay Below 80 for Fifth Week
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug 6 (AP)The United States Com mand announced today that 78 Americans were killed in com bat last week, one more than, in the week before, and 6591 were wounded, 149 more than in the week before.

title: State Grants $3.6Million For City's Fight on Drugs
description: ALBANY, Aug. 6 (UPI)The State Narcotic Addiction Con trol Commission has approved grants of $3,690,391 to help fi nance New York City's battle against drug abuse, Governor Rockefeller announced today.

title: NEW YORK CLEARING HOUSE STATEMENT
State Building Union Backs Governor
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Aug. 6 The State Building and Con struction Trades Council en dorsed Governor Rockefeller for reelection at its annual con vention here today.

title: Theater: Boucicault Revival Becomes London Hit
description: LONDON, Aug. 6The London and New York thea ter worlds have many things in commonsuch as Fid dler on the Roof, tipup seats and Alexander Cohen. They also have the same touching belief that this sea son is a bad season. Just as all the summers of one's youth were impossibly hot, so each and every season, in soulful procession, is pro nounced the worst in years.

title: Souvanna Phouma Seems Optimistic on Laos Peace
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 6Premier Souvanna Phouma said in an interview today that he was more optimistic about the possibility of peace talks with his halfbrother, Prince Soupha nouvong, leader of the Pathet Lao.

title: ... but a Threat to the Sea
description: In proposing a new international regime for the seabed, President Nixon expressed apprehension about the ecological hazards of unregulated use of the oceans and seabeds. This laudable concern unfor tunately finds no adequate reflection in the Army's plan to dump 418 concrete coffins containing leaky nerve gas rockets into the sea off Florida.

title: MANSON WITNESS SHAKEN BY PHOTO
description: LOS ANGELES, AUG. 6 Linda Kasabian, the 20yearold key prosecution witness in the murder trial of Charles M. Manson and three young wom en codefendants, broke down in sobs today when defense counsel thrust in front of her a photograph of the mutilated body of Sharon Tate, the act ress.Near the end of her ninth day of testimony about the slayings of Miss testimony and six other persons last August, Mrs. Kasabian had started to weep when she was shown a picture of Steven Parent, 18, shot to death in an automobile in the Tate driveway.

title: Army and Engineer Corps Sued on Harbor Pollution
description: State Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz sued the Army and the Corps of Engineers yester day for allegedly not complying with Federal antipollution laws in granting permits to dump sewage sludge In the water! outside New York Harbor.

title: Kapp Decides Not to Return to Vikings
description: GLENBROOK, Nev., Aug. 6 (AP)  The Minnesota Vi kings are out of Joe Kapp's football future, the lawyer for the 1969 Vikings star said today.

title: Colombo Heads 4Party Cabinet Formed in Italy
description: ROME, Aug. 6The 32nd Cabinet since the fall of Fas cism in 1943 took charge in Italy tonight, but both the com position of the fourparty Gov ernment and its announced pol icies appeared nearly identical to those of its predecessor.

title: WALL ST. WARNED ON INSURANCE BILL
2 JERSEY RAILROADS SEEK RISE IN FARES
description: NEWARK, Aug. 6 (AP)The Penn Central and Jersey Cen tral Railroads are seeking in creases in commuter fares in an attempt to offset about $100million in claimed losses in New Jersey over the last 10 years.Both railroaas say the com muter fares, have not gone up since 1960. The increases would affect about 50,000 daily passengers on both lines.

title: Young White Army Rallies to Newton
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 6It took nearly two years, but they never lost their patience and they never stopped com ing.

title: Boating Outlook
description: The United States Weather Bureau issued this forecast at 6:30 P.M. yesterday for New York Harbor, Long Island and nearby coastal waters.

title: Nixon Picks Panel For FuelOil Study
description: President Nixon yesterday named a highlevel study group to investigate what could be done to alleviate the acute shortage of low sulphur fuel that could develop this winter.

title: George Brown and Jennie Lee Raised to Peerage
description: LONDON, Aug. 6  George Brown, deputy leader of the parliamentary Labor party un til he lost his House of Corn mons seat in the June election and a former Foreign Secretary, has been elevated to the peer age and will sit in the House of Lords.

title: Soviet Reported Easing Stand on PeaceKeeping
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 6Sec retary of State William P. Rogers informed a House sub committee today that the Soviet Union had shown increased in terst recently in United Nations peacekeeping operations. He voiced the hope that Moscow would relax its past opposition to supporting them financially.

title: HAUGHTON ENTRY FAVORED TONIGHT
description: YONKERS, Aug. 6 The $25,160 Hudson Filly Trot, stakes event that has been turned into just another race because the public will not be permitted to wager on the out come, is the nominal feature of tomorrow night's harness rac ing card at Yonkers Raceway.

title: News Broadcasts
description: Hourly on the Hour. WQXR (The New York Times News), WVNJ, WNBC, WNEW, WOR, WHN. WTFM WMCA.

title: Yonkers Results
SHACK DWELLERS WIN RESPITE NEAR SAIGON
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 6 (Reuters)South Viet namese war veterans prevented the destruction of their shantyH town dwellings today with a, violent attack on a Govern ment office and selfinflicted wounds.

title: Parisian Artists of Meat Scorn Work of U.S. Butchers
description: They poked their sturdy fingers into huge chunks of raw meat and leaned forward to scrutinize gristle and thick white fat. They measured, weighed, examined and probed and finally, with a triumphant air, about 160 French butchers on a tour of the city's meat plants ar rived at the only possible conclusion.

title: Services Restored At Corpus Christi In Wake of Storm
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Aug. 6 (AP)Essential services have been restored and profiteering has been quashed in this hur ricanedamaged city, the local authorities reported today.

title: Stage: Miss Darrieux Becomes Coco
description: Coco was so identified with Katherine Hepburn that it tended to obscure what might be called deficiencies if one were dealing with less of an institution. For all her artistry and force, and the memories she evokes. Miss Hepburn is neither French nor very musical, both of which would seem essential to the part.

title: LONG IS REBUFFED ON WELFARE IDEA
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The Nixon Administration rebuffed Senator Russell B. Long, the in fluential Senate Finance com mittee chairman, today on two major suggested revisions in the pending welfare reform pro gram.

title: Elliott Gould Will Star In New Bergman Film
description: Ingmar Bergman will direct and produce his first English language feature, an original screen drama that he has written under the title The Touch.

title: Protection for the Seabed..
description: United States proposals for an international author ity to control exploitation of the ocean floorsub mitted to the United Nations Seabed Committee now meeting at Geneva  substantially fulfill President Nixon's recent promise that the riches of the ocean floor should be the common heritage of mankind.

title: Thant May Report Today
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 6  Secretary General Thant is expected to report to the Security Council tomorrow on plans for renewing Middle East peace efforts through his special representative, Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, diplomatic sources said tonight.

title: AMEX PRICES DIP IN QUIET TRADING
description: It was another dreary session yesterday on the American Stock Exchange as prices moved lower in quiet trading.

title: R. J. Reynolds Is Seeking Oil Producer
description: R. J. Reynolds Industries, Inc., the nation's largest cigar ette manufacturer, announced plans yesterday to diversify into the oil business by agree ing to acquire the American Independent Oil Company for an undisclosed amount of cash.

title: Dianne Crawford To Be May Bride
description: WELLESLEY HILLS, Mass., Aug. 6  Mrs. Orme Craw ford has announced the en gagement of her daughter, Miss Dianne Marie Craw ford, to William Pope Ander son 5th, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Grenville Anderson of Sherborn. The wedding is planned for May.

title: $1aYear City Greeter Gets $20,000 Assistant
description: The city's $1ayear official greeter got a $20.000ayear assistant yesterday.

title: CONGRESS ADOPTS NEW POSTAL PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The House gave final Congressional approval today to a bill to turn the 181yearold Post Office Department over to an independent Government agency.

title: Dividends Announced
SEAVER'S STREAK ENDED AT 9 GAMES
description: ST. LOUIS. Aug. 6The other pitcher proved to be the over powering one tonight as Tom Seaver, seeking his 10th straight victory, suffered his first de feat in two months and the New York Mets lost ground in the National League pennant race. The St. Louis Cardinals won 30.

title: 100 in Los Alamos Observe Anniversary of Hiroshima
description: LOS ALAMOS. N.M., Aug. 6  More than 100 rainsoaked demonstrators marked the 25th anniversary of the destruction of Hiroshima today by planting a locust tree at the laboratory where the first atomic bomb! was created.

title: State Prisons Told To Make Changes In Discipline Rules
description: ALBANY, Aug. 6A protest by two prisoners over being ordered into solitary confine ment has resulted in an order from a Federal judge that the New York prison system must formalize its disciplinary rules. II One of the two, who said he had been thrown naked into a strip cell at Clinton State, Prison, Dannemora, also won a $1,500 cash judgment.

title: Monmouth Results
LODGE TELLS NIXON OF VATICAN TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6Henry Cabot Lodge, President Nixon's personal representative to the Vatican, voiced optimism today about assistance from Pope Paul VI in securing im proved treatment of American prisoners of war in North Vietnam.

title: SILVER FUTURES CONTINUE TO SAG
description: The silver futures market continued to soften yesterday in both price and volume of trading.

title: Kathy Harman, R L. Harding 3d Plan to Marry
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 6  The engagement of Miss Sara Katherine Har man to Ralph Lyman Hard ing 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harding Jr., has been an nounced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. John Robert Harman Jr. A winter wedding is planned.

title: Basic Reserve Position of 8 Major N. Y. Banks
Roundup Time at the New York Corral
description: High and deep in the empty balcony, a speck of sunlight gleamed through a window of Madison Square Garden and died against the orange plastic seats.

title: China Warmly Welcomes A Sudanese Delegation
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 6Com munist China extended a warm welcome today to a Sudanese delegation headed by President Gaafar Mohammed Nimeiry de spite policy differences between the two countries on the Mid dle East question.

title: Black Elite in South Africa Is Well Off but Resentful
description: PRETORIA. South AfricaWe're moving in the opposite direction from the rest of the world, declared Dr. William Nkomo, a widely respected civic leader of South Africa's black community. Our people are being increasingly robbed of their rights and the racial in equities are more and more en trenched.

title: CARLTON FLOYD BATES
description: DARIEN. Conn., Aug. 6Carlton Floyd Bates, assistant. controller of the accounting di vision of General Electric in New York died yesterday of a heart attack in his home at 67 Leeuwarden Road. His age was 49.

title: U.S. DENIES PLAN TO STUDY IRT FIRE
description: The National Transportatior Safety Board yesterday deniec Representative Richard L. Ot tinger's assertion that it was investigating last Saturday's subway accident.

title: BRAND OF GIANTS SNAPS AT CHANCE
description: BROOKVILLE, L.I., Aug. 6Only two days before their first exhibition game, the Giants were without an experienced center today.

title: MINE SAFETY LAW CALLED NEGLECTED
description: WASHINGTON Aug. 6Thel Federal Government's enforce ment of a new health and safety law for the nation's under ground coal mines was con demned today before a Senate subcommittee as a mockery and a fraud.

title: Yankees Defeat Tigers, 75, After 21 Setback
description: Second place in the American League's Eastern Division, which seems about the best the Yankees can hope for as the season enters its final eight weeks, was the stake last night as New York and the Detroit Tigers split a doubleheader be fore 22,434 fans at Yankee Stadium.

title: Charts of Races at Saratoga;  1970. by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Morning Telegraph); Thursday, Aug. 6. 4th day. Weather clear, track fast.
6% RAILRATE RISE FORMALLY GRANTED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) The Interstate Commerce Commission today made per manent an acrosstheboard 6 per cent increase in railroad freight rates it granted on an interim basis last Nov. 17.

title: Murtagh Upholds Proposal For Expanding U.N.Complex
description: State Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh yesterday upheld plans for the expansion of the United Nations complex in Manhattan.

title: Guard Patrolling in Lima, Ohio, After a Night of Racial Violence
description: LIMA, Ohio, Friday, Aug. 7National Guardsmen patrol led the relatively calm streets of this midOhio city this morn ing after the fatal shooting of a black woman by white po licemen Wednesday afternoon touched off a night of racial violence.

title: F.C.C. Backs TV Industry Over Right to Refuse Time
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6As Senate hearings continued on whether Congress had the right to free television time to ex plain its views, the Federal Communications Commission reasserted today the preemi nent right of the broadcasting industry to decide which spokesmen and which ideas could use its facilities.

title: LEFRAK ACCUSED OF RENTING BIAS IN FEDERAL SUIT
description: The Department of Justice charged yesterday that Samuel J. Lefrak, one of the nation's leading builders, and the Lef rak Organization had practiced racial discrimination in the renting of 21,000 apartments in 150 buildings in Brooklyn and Queens.

title: Texts of Pact's Defense Section and Rogers Letter
Paraphrase of Scriptures Begets Success
CARLOPACELLI, 66,  VATICAN OFFICIAL
description: ROME, Aug. 6Prince Carlo Pacelli, a nephew of Pope Pius Xll and for many years a legal adviser to the Vatican City administration, died here today of a heart ailment. He was 66 years old.

title: GAINS REPORTED BY SHELL GROUP
description: The Royal DutchShell Group of companies achieved record sales and earnings in the sec ond quarter, reflecting a firm ing of prices in European mar kets, according to the midyear report issued yesterday.

title: Merger Not Likely This Year, Kennedy Tells N.B. A. Owners
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 6  Walter Kennedy, commissioner of the National Basketball Association, said today that merger with the American Basketball As sociation could not he accom plished until next year.

title: Market Place:
description: Should the Chrysler Cor poration pay a dividend at time when the company has reported losses and has had to comb the nation's banks and financial capitals of Eu rope for working capital?

title: Dr. Jane Pascale Is the Bride Of Dr. Joseph Kite Jr. Upstate
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 6  The marriage of Dr. Jane Fay Pascale, clinical assistant professor of pathology at the Medical School of the State University of New York at Buffalo, to Dr. Joseph H. Kite Jr. took place here to day. The Rev. Richard Har rington performed the cere mony in Trinity United Meth odist Church, where the bride groom, associate professor of microbiology at the medical school, is the lay leader.

title: Giammalva, McEnroe Win Metropolitan Tennis Titles
description: Tony Giammalva of White Plains and John McEnroe of Douglaston, Queens, won singles titles yesterday in Me tropolitan boys tennis.

title: Washington: Fulbright,Rogers and Laird
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6You can hardly tune in the evening news these days without hear ing the low grumble of Senator Fulbright's voice. To hear him tell it, the world is in a terrible pickle, the State and Defense Departments are leading us to unimaginable disasters and the poor old Senate is helpless to save the Republic.

title: Twelve Federal Reserve Banks Combined
PARCEL TIEUP SPURS RISE IN USE OF MAILS
description: A Post Office Department spokesman said yesterday that parcel post volume had in creased 40 per cent since last Thursday, when Teamster Local S04 struck the United Parcel Service.

title: GENERATOR BACK IN USE AT CON ED
description: Despite temperatures that rose to a high of 85 degrees at 1:45 P.M. yesterday, Con solidated Edison eased through another summer day with power reserves that a spokesman de scribed as adequate.

title: ZAMBIAN DANCERS APPEAR AT HUNTER
description: Aside from a shaggy nat uralism and three of the most marvelous drummers I have ever heard, the Tribal Dancers of Zambia had little to hold the attention of a New York theater audience. The program, or what there was of it (they omitted three of the five listed numbers to introduce local of ficials and the promoter of the program), consisted of ad hoc conglomerations of performers doing their thing. The company appeared in its only New York performance last night at Hunter College.

title: Genesco Discontinues Units
description: Genesco, Inc., announced yes terday that it had discontinued all remaining activities in its Majestic Specialties and Major Blouse Company operations, which were formerly part of the company's Associated Sports wear division.

title: City Inquiry Is Set in Skyscraper Fire
description: The Department of Buildings set up a threeman special board of inquiry yesterday to investigate Wednesday night's fire at 1 New York Plaza in which two persons were killed and 35 others, 26 of them fire men, were injured.

title: AYCKBOURN PLAY OPENS IN LONDON
description: LONDON, Aug. 6  Alanl Ayckbourn is known as a vir tuoso in crosspurpose comedy, and the set for his new play, How the Other Half Loves, at the Lyric Theater, confronts you like a piece of juggling apparatus.

title: 7 INJURED AS FIRE RAVAGES A TANKER
description: CARTERET, N. J., Aug. 5Seven persons were injured, one critically, when an explosion and fire ravaged an tanker be ina loaded with gasoline here.

title: U.S. AND SPAIN SIGN ACCORD ON BASES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The Governments of the United States and Spain signed today an agreement providing for continuing American use of military bases in Spain.

title: FILLOL OF CHILE UPSETS GRAEBNER
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 6  What's happening here? Is it the psyche of sudden death or the slower synthetic plastic playing surface, or the uncom monly cool, clear weather?

title: Listing of Prices of Commodity Futures
Keogh, Guilty of Corruption, Loses Bid for a New Trial
description: Former State Supreme Court, Justice James Vincent Keogh, who asked for a Federal Court order to set aside his 1962 con viction for accepting bribes in connection with the sentencing of a defendant, was turned down by Judge Edward Wein feld.

title: ANTICRIME FUNDS CALLED MISSPENT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 Police expenditures of question able value in the reduction of crime consume most of the funds made available to slates under the Omnibus Crime Con trol and Safe Streets Act of 1968, according to a study by the National Urban Coalition.

title: Thorough Watchdog
description: Robert K. Ruskin, the city's Commissioner of In vestigations who asked yes terday that three policemen be jaiied on civil contempt charges, has spent much of his professional life turning over government stones to see what lies underneath, but he is nobody's stereotype of the crusading gangbuster. He is described by an associate as calm, thorough and businesslike in his approach to the problems of municipal corruption, with which he has been dealing, on and off, for more than 15 years and, for the last 20 months as the city's $37,500 ayear watchdog.

title: FOSSILS CLEANED BY SONIC DEVICE
description: George J. Miller was having a nerveracking time trying to, speed the recovery of intact. tiny fossils from the La Brea, tar pits in Los Angeles. At last, he made a few inquiries and came up with a solution that is proving to be a boon to paleontology.

title: DISNEYLAND CLOSED BY YIPPIES THREAT
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Aug. (AP)  Disneyland was closed for five hours tonight after amusement park officials said that more than 100 longhaired youths threatened destruction of property and violence.

title: Miss Blacker Wed To Publishing Aide
description: Miss Harriet Blacker di rector of publicity for Cow ardMcCann, Inc., publishers, was married here yesterday to Roland Algrant, who is executive vice president of Feffer & Simons, Inc., pub lishers representatives. The ceremony, performed by Jus tice Arthur Markewich of the Supreme Court, Appellate Division, in his chambers, was witnessed by Mrs. Bert ram Shapiro, sister of the bride and Dr. John Zabriskie.

title: SOVIET AND WEST GERMANY REACH ACCORD ON A TREATY TO FOSTER PEACE IN EUROPE
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 6  West Germany and the Soviet Un ion agreed today on a draft treaty renouncing the use of force and affirming the invio lability of the present Euro pean borders without ruling out the principle of eventual reuni fication of Germany.

title: Finch Will Portray Himself In NBCTV Name of Game
description: Robert H. Finch, a counselor to President Nixon, has agreed to portray himself in a segment of the National Broadcasting Company's TV adventure series The Name of the Game.

title: Advertising: Eyes on Thompson Agency, British Style
description: The creative director of J. Walter Thompson's London branch spent some time yes terday with the colonists at the home office and regaled them with stories about ad vertising, British style.

title: Men's Wear Chain Stores Seek To Draw Customers With Gifts
description: I'll take the threebutton vested suit, the doublebreasted overcoat, and the Hamilton Beach electric mixer, too! said a customer with a gleam in his eye yesterday at a Weber & Heilbroner men's store here.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Turmoil follows Joe Namath everywhere, as if it were an invisible member of his entourage. It's always there, lurking in corner of the dimly lighted nightspots or among the football equipment bags. Be cause of it, Joe Namath never has a quiet crisis. The headlines always are big.

title: Britain Voices Concern on Nerve Gas
description: LONDON. Aug. 6 AP)Brit ain has informed the United States of mounting concern about American plans to dis pose of lethal nerve gas in the Atlantic Ocean, the Foreign Office announced today.

title: RUSKIN ASKS JAIL FOR 3 POLICEMEN
description: Investigation Commissioner Robert K. Ruskin asked the State Supreme Court yesterday to send three New York City policemen to jail until they satisfactorily answer questions about a list they allegedly used to collect systematic payoffs from Manhattan businesses.

title: College Devoted to the Arts Being Built in Westchester
description: PURCHASE, N. Y.  The first fulltime students are still more than a year away, the first faculty member has yet to be hired, and of an eventual two dozen buildings, three are holes in the ground, one is a steel skeleton, and the others are only blueprints.

title: MRS. ARTHUR E. CORWITH
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 6Mrs. Caroline Hyde Corwith, wife of Dr. Arthur E. Corwith, died yesterday at her home on Hildredth Road. She was 67 years old.

title: City Power Debate
description: Ordinarily, this does not represent the way to solve problems, Milton Musicus, the Municipal Services Administra tor, said yesterday of the in creasingly heated public debate between top Lindsay adminis tration officials over a pro jected power plant in Astoria, Queens. But this is an issue or national ana possibly interna tional concern, Mr. Musicus con tinued. There is such legitimacy to both sides that I believe the public should understand both sides of the issues, and partici pate in the decisionmaking.

title: If You Want to Go Out for HomeStyle Food...
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are ated four stars to none, oased on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: Books of The Times;Future: Tense
description: Striding toward the subway the other day, a copy of Future Shock, title out ward, under my arm. I was hailed by construction worker hanging around a new department store going up in my neighbor hood. Hey! he called. Future shocknow I gotta read that. He may have eth nocentrically assumed the book is about some forthcoming Armageddon be tween the hard hats and the hip pies, but I prefer to think he'd got the title's instan taneous message, i.e., tomorrow as karate chop. Any how, I hope he reads the book be cause it has some pulpy insights to offer on hippies, hardhats and the rest of us who are having enough trouble just trying to he Now people. In Future Shock, Alvin Toffler is primarily talking about change, and the mindjolting rapidity thereof in our times, which he chooses to dub the 800th lifetime because 800 life times have transpired during the last 50, 000 years of man's sojourn on the planet. When broken down into lifetimes, recent history assumes a frightening technolog ical acceleration: only the last six life times knew the printed word, the last two the electrical motor, and the present one the overwhelming majority of all the ma terial goods we use today.

title: Senator Gore Wins Tennessee Primary
description: NASHVILLE, Friday, Aug. 7Senator Albert Gore, the silver haired liberal who describes himself as the prime target of the Southern strategy, won renomination yesterday for a fourth term.

title: Beauty Care by the Experts and It's Free
description: A Manhattan housewife, just back from Florida with a deep sun tan, de cided her mediumblond hair was too dark for her skin and wanted to have lightened.

title: Golf Final Reached By Mrs. Chadsey And Mrs. Roesler
description: BEDFORD, N.Y., Aug. 6Mrs. M. Stuart Roesler of Stan wich defeated Mrs. Thomas J. Hory of Winged Foot, the de fending champion, 1 up, at Bedford Golf and Tennis Club today and will play Mrs. Carl T. Chadsey Jr. of Round Hill for the 48th annual women's Westchester and Fairfield Golf Association championship in 36hole match tomorrow.

title: Soldier Dies of Meningitis
description: FORT DIX, N. J., Aug. (UPI) A 22yearold Army private in his second week of basic training died of meningitis to day. 10 hours after having been admitted to Walson Army Hos pital for treatment of an upper respiratory infection, the Army said. The soldier was identified as Joel H. Kalatucka of West Bristol, Pa. He was the first person to die here this year from the disease, which has struck down 99 other soldiers.

title: Rail TonMileage Shows Decline of 4.9% for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage last week were both below the volume in the cor responding 1969 week.

title: SHOE CURBS HELD NO SPUR TO PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 The United States shoe indus try asserted today that, con trary to widespread belief, im port quotas on footwear would have only an insignificant ef fect in raising the price of shoes to the consumer.

title: TRADING IS SLOW IN LONDON STOCKS
description: Slow trading and fractional changes marked the London stock market yesterday.

title: Seniors Cup to Mrs Benenson
description: POUND RIDGE, N. Y., Aug.  Mrs. Charles Benenson of Fairview won the Women's Metropolitan Golf Association's fourth annual Class B Seniors Cup by three strokes today, scoring a 41, 4788 over the 6,157yard par 36, 3672 course at High Ridge Country Club.

title: SATELLITES TO GET URBAN PLANS ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 A high flying reconnaissances plane is cruising over 26 Amer ican cities this summer, taking photographs to help develop an early ?? system for urban change.

title: 20,000 Youths Attend Rock Festival for Peace Here
description: The banners that hung over the bleachers at Shea Stadium yesterday were peace signs as about 20,000 young people listened, clapped and danced to the resounding beat of rock music in a 12hour festival for beace.

title: Assets and Liabilities in Reserve Cities
NO RESERVE SHIFT ON MONEY IS SEEN
description: The rate of expansion in money and bank credit acceler ated rapidly in the last few weeks, banking data published yesterday showed.

title: Israelis Report Jet Attacks In Jordan and Suez Area
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 6 (Reuters) Israeli jets today attacked army positions in Jordan and Egyptian military targets along the Suez Canal, a military spokesman said.

title: DETECTIVE CLEARED OF PERJURY CHARGE
description: A 38yearold detective was acquitted yesterday of perjury charges arising out of a grand jury investigation into alleged protection payoffs to the po lice by numbers racketeers.

title: MARINE CORPS TEAM WINS PISTOL SHOOT
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 6 (AP)  The Marine Corps Red team won the National Trophy pistol team match today with a score of 1,149 points out of a possible 1,200. It was thee, second major title for the team.

title: 3 TRUCKS STOLEN AT GUNPOINT HERE
description: Five gunmen stole three trac tor and trailer trucks with a to tal value of $200,000 out of a Queens garage last night after they handcuffed three presons, including a night watchman, a mechanic and a friend of the mechanic.

title: Yonkers Appoints Controller
description: YONKERS, Aug. 6  City Manager Seymour Scher today announced the appointment of James J. Hauser Jr., as the new Controller of the City of Yon kers. The $23,640ayear post has been vacant since last Feb ruary when Cline B. Stephens, was suspended for alleged mis appropriation of city bonds. Mr. Hauser, who is 32 years old, is manager of financial op erations of the LemmingPac quinCoty division of Pfizer, Inc.

title: Cloisters to Test PayasYouWish Plan
description: Starting Tuesday, you may pay anything from a cent to a Cnote to get into the Cloisters, the Metropolitan Museum's medieval outpost in Fort Tryon Park, but you must pay something. The slid ingscale entrance fee is part of an experimental discre tionary admission policy that has already been in effect for four weeks for special exhibi tions at the museum's main building on Fifth Avenue.

title: Bridge:
description: BOSTON, Aug. 6  The Spingold Knockout Team Championship will attract most attention at the Ameri can Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals, which be gin here tomorrow afternoon, for this event will help de termine American represen tation in the 1971 World Championship.

title: Akron Golf Leaders
Bridal Planned by Ann Bailinson
description: Mrs. Jean Paaswell Bailin son of New York has an nounced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Ann E. Bailinson, to Jerome Alan Kleinman. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Kleinman of Beachwood, Ohio.

title: Ford Prods Celler to Hold Hearings in Douglas Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (UPI)  Representative Gerald R. Ford of Michigan, the House minority leader, took issue to day with a contention by the chairman of a special subcom mittee considering the im peachment of Associate Justice William 0. Douglas of the Su ; preme Court that its investiga tion has been hobbled by a lack of cooperation from Federal agencies.

title: Demand Remains Sharp For TaxExempt Bonds
description: The market for taxexempt bonds continued to surge ahead yesterday as large banks, in surance companies, individual investors and Wall Street pro fessionals purchased large amounts of securities in the be lief that interest rates are head ed still lower.

title: ...Or If You're Planning to Cook at Home
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: NEW BIRACIAL BANK GRANTED A CHARTER
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 6The Vanguard National Bank, one of the first fully integrated ;banks in the state, has received a provisional charter from the Controller of the Currency, the bank announced today.

title: Employes Capture Suspect
description: Three bank employes pur sued a suspected robber yes terday and caught him a short distance from the Chase Man hattan branch at 711 Third Avenue, at 44th Street. They recovered the $2.275 he had allegedly had in his possession. According to the police, the suspect. Guadaloupe Pena, 27 years old, of the Rutledge Hotel, 161 Lexington Avenue at 30th Street, was chased by the threeJesse Stone, Maurice Rosenband and Gerald Sullivan after a woman teller shouted an alarm.

title: DR. CRAWFORD, 79, EXYALE AIDE, DIES
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 6Dr Albert Beecher Crawford, di rector of counseling and place ment at Yale University for almost 40 years died yes terday at YaleNew Haven Hos pital at the age of 79.

title: Delaney '
description: Delaney & Bonnie and Friends, a joyous soulrock gospel ensemble, played a long concert Wednesday evening at Wollman Rink in Central Park.

title: Ralph Junker, Mrs. Heaver Are Married
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Aug. 6 Mrs. Connie Heaver and Dr. Ralph D. Junker were married this evening at the Hitchcock Presbyterian Church by the Rev. David 0. Kendall.

title: EVERETT S. OSBORN
description: SPRINGFIELD, III., Aug. 6Everett Stanley Osborn, a har ness horse trainer and driver who won many races from coast to coast, died today. He was 82 years old.

title: BETHLEHEM STEEL PLANS PRICE RISES
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corpora tion yesterday announced that effective Oct. 1 it will in crease prices on tinplate and tinfree sheet steel used by the can industries by 65 cents per base box.

title: Delp's Rare Day at Monmouth: No Trip to the Winner's Circle
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., Aug. Grover G. (Buddy) Delp was in unusual company at Monmouth Park todayhe didn't have a winner. He saddled three horses, and the best he could do was a fourth place with his wife's filly, Honzie, in the sixth race.

title: DR. JOSEPH L. KUNZ, WRITER ON LAW, 80
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Aug. 6Dr. Joseph L. Kunz, an Austrian born authority on international law who taught 20 years in Europe and in 1934 helped to found the University of Toledo Law School, died here yester day. He was 80 years old.

title: Wednesday's Fight
description: TokyoHiroshi Shoji, 133 pounds Japan outpointed Uyh WhaRyong 133, South Korea, 10 rounds.

title: POLLUTION RANKING TERMED INADEQUATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (UPI) The Federal Clean Air Agency conceded today that its prelimi nary ranking of American cities for two types of air pollution had been based on information from a single sampler for each pollutant in each city.

title: Rubin Would Visit Cuba
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 6 (AP) Jerry C. Rubin, one of five per sons convicted in February of promoting rioting at the Demo cratic National Convention in 1968, asked a Federal court to day to allow him to travel to Havana, Cuba, to do research on a book on youth culture. The Yippie leader filed the motion in the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit. All five are free on bond pending appeal.

title: UFO'S RALLY TAKES JUNIOR JUMPING
description: BRANCHVILLE, N.J., Aug. 6 UFO, under a strong ride by Conrad Homfeld, rallied to win the junior jumper champion ship today at the Sussex County horse show.

title: Market Summary
N.I.C.B. DESIGNATES A PRESIDENTELECT
description: Alexander B. Trowbridge former Secretary of Commerce and until May president of the American Management Associ ation, has been named presi dentelect of the National Indus trial Conference Board.

title: LAIRD DENIES U.S. ORDERS AIR RAIDS TO AID CAMBODIANS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird reiterated today the Nix on Administration's contention that American planes were not giving close air support to Cam bodian troops despite eyewit ness press reports to the con trary.

title: End of Youth Gang Seen In Arrest of 15 in Bronx
description: Fifteen arrests have broken up a youthful gang calling it self Intercrime that terrorized merchants and residents in the northeast Bronx, according to Burton B. Roberts, the Bronx District Attorney.

title: U.S. Girls Win in Track
description: VIENNA, Aug. 6 (UPI) including four double victories, including four doubt victories, today to score a 6863 triumph over Rumania in a track and field meet in Bucharest. The Americans, trailing 3822, at the end of competition yesterday, captured the 100meters, 100 meter hurdles, 400meters. I,500meters, javelin throw and the 108meter relay.

title: Roundup: Giants, Pirates Discover Pitching Wealth
description: For most of this season, the San Francisco Giants and the Pittsburgh Pirates have been pitchingpaupers. Sud denly, however, their pitch ers arc making them wealthy.

title: Maturity Distribution of Loans and Securities
French Flutist Will Join Juilliard String Concerts
Miss Messerschmitt Is Fiancee Of Peter Y. Bennett a Student
description: PLANDOME, L. I., Aug. 6Miss Pamela Ann Messer schmitt and Peter Yearsley Bennett plan to be married next May in Manhasset.

title: Moscow Reports Cholera In Region of Volga Delta
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 6  The Soviet Union tonight an nounced an outbreak of chol era in the region of Astrakhan, a city in the Volga River delta, 60 miles from the Caspian Sea.

title: EGYPT DISCOUNTS PALESTINIAN ROLE
description: CAIRO, Friday, Aug. 7 (Reu ters)  Mohammed Hassanein Heykal, the Acting Foreign Minister of the United Arab Republic, said today it would be folly to believe that the Palestinian guerrillas alone could succeed in a war of lib eration against Israel.

title: Fireboat Alfred E. Smith, Victim of Progress, to Be Retired
description: The changing needs of fire fighting along the city's wa terfront will send a 105 foot fireboat, the Gov. Alfred E. Smith into honorable retirement at midnight to morrow.

title: Introducing Lindsay, PinchHit Copter Pilot
description: Mayor Lindsay, it seems, has been learning to fly a helicopter during his four and a half years at City Hall.

title: Kennedy, Shriver Boys on Probation
description: BARNSTABLE, Mass., Aug. Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., and Robert Sargent Shriver 3d were, in effect, placed on year's probation after a private hearing in Juvenile Court here today on charges of possessing marijuana.

title: CONFEREES APPROVE PAYPRICE CONTROLS
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 6 Senate and House negotiators; agreed today to give President Nixon standby authority he has said he would not use to impose wage, price and rent controls.

title: CashDispensing Machine
description: The First New Jersey Bank said yesterday it would install a moneydispensing machine at its main office in Union. N. J., in October. The ma chine, in operation 24 hours day, will dispense $50 in cash when a Master Charge card is inserted.

title: Modernizing Railway Labor
description: The ancient dispute over locomotive firemen, grand father of all railroad featherbedding controversies, will be settled once and for all if rail management and labor have the good sense to accept the recom mendations made yesterday by President Nixon's emergency factfinders.

title: CLYDE HALL, SERVED SCIENCE FOUNDATION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6Clyde C. Hall, former public in formation director of the Na tional Science Foundation, died yesterday of a heart attack or a Maryland golf course. He was 68 years old.

title: BAR OWNER LINKS PAYOFFS TO RULES
description: A bar owner in the midtown area where police payoffs are suspected of being made con ceded yesterday that such prac tices were 'a sore spot for those involved in dispensing al coholic beverages.

title: Sir Richard Peirse Dead at 77; Commanded British Bombers
description: LONDON, Aug. 6  Air Chief Marshal Sir Richard E. C. Peirse who headed the Bomber Command of the Royal Air Force from 1940 to 1942, died yesterday. He was 77 years old.

title: City Joins in Fight for CATV Control
description: The question of control over cable television in New York City is heading for a show down decision by the Federal Communications Commission.

title: Executive Changes
description: Herbert P. Patterson has been elected to the board of directors of the Standard Oil Company (Indiana).

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: The storm of controversy surrounding President Nixon's comments upon the guilt of Charles Manson in the Tate murder trial and the possible prejudicial impact these com ments may have on the jurors is, I submit, grossly overplayed and misunderstood by the gen eral public.

title: Cotton Market
MANDO RAMOS WINS DECISION ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 6 (AP)Mando Ramos of Long Beach, Calif., former lightweight cham pion, his face a gory mess of blood from the third round on, battered his way back into the I35pound division title picture !tonight by gaining a split 10round decision over Sugar Ramos of Mexico city before crowd of 10,000 at Olympic Auditorium.

title: Federal Reserve System Statistics
Aide Named in Kent Inquiry
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 6 (UPI)A former Allen County prosecutor was appointed to day to plan and direct the state's special grand jury in vestigation into the killing of four Kent State University stu dents by National Guard troops. He was Robert L. Balyeat. 41 years old, of Lima.

title: Namath Indicates Retirement Is Imminent, Saying I Don't Want to Play
description: Joe Namath indicated yester day that his retirement from pro football was imminent.

title: Canadian Bill Rate Rise
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 6 (Canadian Press)The Government today auctioned $150million of new 91day Treasury bills at an av erage price of 98.583 and aver age yield of 5.77 per cent. compared with last week's 98.600 and 5.70 per cent.

title: City to Salute Stengel With a Flourish Today
description: Casey Stengel, who will be the guest of honor tomorrow during the annual OldTim ers Day festivities at Yankee Stadium, will receive some preparatory acclaim today at City Hall.

title: SALES ARE MIXED AT CHAIN STORES
description: Sales of the country's larg est chain stores showed a mixed trend in July, but most of the merchandising organiza tions managed to show gains for the month. All of the large companies are ahead for the first six months of their fiscal years which began Feb. 1. ed July 31 totaled $89million. a gain of 4.9 per cent. Sales for the six month fiscal period irose to $538.6million, an in crease of 3.9 per cent.

title: GOODELL SEEKING $25,000 CAMPAIGNS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6With a thinly disguised attack on his Democratic opponent, Senator Charles E. Goodell pro posed today a $25,000 limit on the amount of money a can didate can spend on his own behalf for nomination or elec tion to Congress.

title: Slow Start in Paris
description: David Bruce began his Vietnam peace mission Paris yesterday voicing hope that we can avoid propa ganda and harsh language and settle down to business like discussion of the issues. It was a shortlived hope so far as the 78th session of these fateful negotiations was concerned.

title: Fishing Report
description: AREA AHeavy seaweed has tangled surfcasting ac tion along some of the New Jersey beaches, but boats are taking blues and school tuna. From Asbury Park to Sea Bright, charter boats work ing two or three miles off shore are doing best of all, with trolling for blues up to 12 pounds described as ter rific. Point Pleasant reports good quantities of blues and some fluke. Near Manasquan, the headboats are scoring well on diamond jigs.

title: SAMS TAKES STAND IN PANTHER TRIAL
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 6George Sams Jr., the prosecu tion's star witness against Bob by G. Seale, testified today that he was authorized by the Black Panther party to pop that is, shootthe two men who accompanied him the night Alex Rackley was slain.

title: STOCKS CONTINUE DOWNWARD DRIFT
description: Stock prices drifted down ward yesterday as trading ac tivity continued to hover around the lowest levels of the year.

title: Panel in Rail Strike Urges New Diesel Job Category
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6A Presidential emergency board recommended today that the 33yearold dispute over use of firemen in railroad locomotives be settled by creating a new job classification.

title: Princess Roycraft and Hunnemania Take Divisions of Test Stakes at Spa
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y. Aug. 6  Princess Roycraft, the favorite, and Hunnemania, a hesitantly backed contestant, shared the divisions of the Test Stakes today. Larry Adams steered Princess Royuaft and Eddie Belmonte guided Hanne mania in the respective divisions of the sevenfurlong sprint for 3yearold fillies.

title: Store Sales Increase
Speno Urges Volpe to Set Up Safety Standard for All Buses
description: EAST MEADOW, L.I., Aug. 6  State Senator Edward J. Speno, chairman of the Na tional Motor Vehicle Safety Advisory Council, asked the Secretary of Transportation to day to halt all buses in the country until they meet stand ards of safety now lacking in their window design.

title: Clown Week Urged in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6 (AP) Nine clowns paraded to Capi tol Hill today to urge procla mation of a national clown week. The small group as sembled a few blocks away and then marched to the new Senate Office Building to con fer with Sen. John L. McClel lan, Democrat of Arkansas, who heads a judiciary subcom mittee on national holidays.

title: URUGUAY REBELS SET DEADLINE FOR TODAY
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 6 (AP)  A statement from leftist urban guerrillas today set a deadline for midnight to morrow for the release of Ur uguay's political prisoners.

title: H.E.W. Ends Fund Cutoffs In Pupil Integration Fight
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6The Department of Health, Ed ucation and Welfare has ceased cutting off Federal funds and is supporting court action in stead in dealing with the re maining hardcore holdouts on school integration, Secretary Elliot L. Richardson said today.

title: Bruce Rebuffed in His First Session at Peace Talks
description: PARIS, Aug. 6  The new chief American negotiator at tended his first session of the peace talks on Vietnam today and proposed a renewed effort at settlement of the war. But the Communist side declared at this 78th meeting that he had nothing new to offer.

title: Archer's 67 Paces Akron Golf by Shot
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 6 George Archer, the 1969 Mas ters champion, sailed by the treacherous 16th hole at the Firestone Country Club with a par 5 today and finished with a 67 to lead the opening round of the $150,000 American Golf Classic.

title: 5Nation Arab Talks End; Lack of Unity Is Still Seen
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Aug. 6Five Arab countries ended a conference today that was of ficially described as having improved military cooperation in the war against Israel and as having ignored the effort now under way to negotiate settlement under a 90 day ceasefire.

title: The Skyscraper Fire
description: The skyscraper fire that claimed the lives of two workmen and injured dozens of others high in one New York City's glistening office towers requires the thorough investigation promised by Mayor Lindsay and Acting Buildings Commissioner Ferro.

title: Lorenzo Elected by Group
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 6 (UPI) Secretary of State John P. Lomenzo of New York today was elected president of the National Association of Secre taries of State. He has served as vice president of the group for the last year.

title: WALL ST. WARNED ON INSURANCE BILL; Muskie Says Panel Awaits Data on Ailing Firms
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 6A key Senator has warned the securities industry that the in surance legislation the industry urgently wants may receive no further Congressional consider ation unless the New York Stock Exchange provides more information about the broker age firms that are currently in financial difficulty.

title: Burger to Speak on State of Judiciary
description: ST. LOUIS, Mo., Aug. 5A trial balloon for an annual state of the judiciary address to Congress by the Chief Justice will be launched here on Monday when Warren E. Burger will deliver a nation ally televised speech before the American Bar Association convention.

title: Wanda June Opens Oct. 7
description: Kurt Vonnegut Jr.'s new play. 'Happy Birthday, Wanda June, will begin rehearsals at the Theater de Lys on Aug. 31. The play, which is being produced by Lester M. Goldsmith and di rected by Michael J. Kane, will begin previews on Sept. 25 and will open on Oct. 7.

title: Downtown Fire Hampers Three Brokerage Firms
description: The three alarm fire Wednesday night in the up per floors of One New York Plaza, a brandnew showcase office tower in the financial district, forced three New York Stock Exchange firms yesterday to take emergency measures to stay in business and caused the Chase Man hattan Bank to fall behind schedule in clearing checks.

title: ROAN BACKS ZAMBIA ON NATIONALIZATION
5 ARMY OFFICERS HEAR CADET'S PLEA
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Aug. 6 A fiveman hoard of colonels and majors conducted a four andahalf hour hearing today on the request of a cadet at the United States Military Aca demy here for a discharge as a conscientious objector.

title: Treasury Statement
Washington: For the Record
description: Appointment. President Nixon appointed David J. Mahoney, president of Nor ton Simon, Inc., as chairman of the American Revolution Bicentennial Commission. He succeeds J. E. Wallace Ster ling.

title: Tewfik  Bouattoura, 34, Is Dead; Former Algerian Envoy to U.N.
description: ALGIERS, Algeria, Aug. 6 (Reuters)Tewfik Bouattoura, former Algerian Ambassador to the United Nations, died last night after spending 19 months in a coma, the Algerian News Agency reported today. He was 34 years old.

title: Swede Hanson, Star Back Of Philadelphia Eagles. 62
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 6 (UPI)  Thomas (Swede) Hanson, a former Temple University foot ball star who played profession ally for eight years with the Philadelphia Eagles, Pittsburgh Steelers and Brooklyn Dodgers, died yesterday at Einstein Med ical Center here. He was 62 years old.

title: A Touch of Suede And a Bit of Cork
description: Anyone who thinks today's youth unimaginative filled with ennui should drop by Scarabocchio, a boutique that opened at 344 East 72d Street recently. Scarabocchio is a bit of timely exotica put together by Richard Capalbo, an actor turned entrepreneur; his wife, Anastasia, who, in her spare time, designs for Aqua nala, a division of Originala, and Elaine Brandt, a young designer for Kimberly Knitwear, Inc. The venture has given all three an opportunity to try their skills at working with leathers and suedes. And the Capalbos devoted a year be fore the boutique's opening to collecting a variety of items from North Africa, Italy and Spain to include among the handmade offer ings.

title: Pub May Be a Busy Place, but Menu Is Not Too Much
description: LONDON, Aug. 6  The pub, a national institution as sturdy as the crown, cricket and the cup of tea, has been quietly struck in its oak beamed, beerbarreled foun dation.

title: MRS. KILLINGSWORTH
description: DETROIT, Aug. 6Mrs. Bev erly Kritzman Killingsworth, wife of Dr. Charles C. Killings worth, University Professor of labor and industrial relations at Michigan State University and a member of the National Man power Task Force, died of cancer yesterday. She was 49 years old and lived in Okemos, Mich.

title: Market Summary
Cornfeld Plan Due Today
description: GENEVA, Aug. 6Bernard Cornfeld, the deposed chairman of Investors Overseas Services, will present his program for pumping new life into the ail ing company tomorrow. The board of Ltd., the Canadianregistered parent company of the financial con glomerate, agreed today to Mr. Cornfeld's request for a hear ing.

title: Huntley Voices Regret To Nixon Over Article
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. (UPI)Chet Huntley, the for mer newscaster, has told President Nixon he is sorry and terribly embarrassed about remarks attributed to him in a recent issue of Life magazine.

title: Open Interest
CINDY FERRO WINS JUNIOR GIRLS GOLF
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Aug. 6Cindy Ferro of the Forest Hill Field Club won the 48th annual Metropolitan junior girls golf championship today over the 5,748yard, par74 hilly North Hempstead Country Club course. She carded a 39, 4079 and was the only one of the 16 contestants to break 80.

title: Poet's 3 Plays Set for Fall
description: Three by Ferlinghetti, short works by Lawrence Ferling ihetti, poet and playwright, which had a successful off Broadway tryout last April at the Cubiculo Theater, will open at the Jan Hus Theater on Sept. 22. The plays are being pro duced by David Winters and Bert Rosen.

title: Commonwealth United Meets With U.S. Trust
description: Representatives of the Commonwealth United Corpo ration, which is in default on two bond issues and has not met the Aug. 1 interest pay ment on a third, met yester day with the United States Trust Company, the trustee, to provide additional data on its finances. No immediate decision is expected on whether the trust company will seek a voluntary arrange ment or a Bankruptcy Act reorganization for the ailing

title: Blount Presents 6Cent Eisenhower Stamp to Widow at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. (UPI)A sixcent stamp hon oring former President Dwight D. Eisenhower was presented to his widow to day in White House ceremo nies.

title: BIG BOARD NAMED IN INVESTOR SUIT
description: An investor has charged that he lost $150,000 because the New York Stock Exchange was negligent and careless in its supervision of Baerwald & De Boer, a member firm that failed and went into liquida tion.

title: City's 9YearOld Busing Plan Misses Its Goal
description: A nineyearold city plan that] permits black students to transfer to predominantly white schools to achieve racial integration has fallen short of its goal because of the de parture of whites from the school system, a Board of Edu cation report said yesterday.

title: Money
News Summary and Index
description: West German and Soviet officials agreed yesterday on the text of a treaty that opens the way to a significant improvement in relations between Bonn and the Communist nations of Eastern Europe. The treaty, which will be initialed today, affirms the inviola bility of European borders but does not close the door on a peaceful reunification of Ger many. [Page 1, Columns 68.]

title: 2 CEREAL CRITICS TO PUSH EFFORTS
Jones's Aim: Get Last Laugh on Giants
description: HIRAM, Ohio, Aug. 6 Homer Jones, late of the New York Giants and now of the Cleveland Browns, said today that he never could under stand why he was made out to be a dumb fool back in New York.

title: COMMON MARKET ISSUES LABOR PLEA
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 7 (AP)The European Economic Com munity urged member nations today to increase efforts to relieve the community's labor shortage.

title: Summer Students Trade Bullhorns for Books at Colleges Here
State Awards $150,000 To Saratoga Art Center
description: A state grant of $150,000 for the Saratoga Performing Arts Center was announced last night.

title: Judge Opens an Integration Hearing in Richmond
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 7 (UPI)Amid tight security, a Federal judge began hearing arguments today on a second school de segregation plan submitted by Virginia's capital city.

title: William E. Brady, 80, Dies; ExUpstate Assemblyman
description: COXSACKIE, N. Y., Aug. 7William E. Brady, Greene Coun ty Assemblyman from 1939 to 1962 and former director of the Brady Funeral Home here, died Wednseday. His age was 80.

title: EUGENE BARNETT, EXY.M. C.A. AIDE
description: ARLINGTON, Va., Aug. 7Eugene Epperson Barnett, leading figure in the Young Men's Christian Association for more than 40 years, died today at Arlington Hospital after fall at his home. He was 82 years old.

title: The Boom in Nostalgia Turns Junk Into Junque
description: In New York, dealers call the items cultural antiques in northern California, the favorite word is collecta bles, in Dallas, new an tiques. In Memphis, Tenn and Madison, Wis., they simply call the stuff junkbut they spell it, with verbal pinkie extended, junqu.e.

title: Massachusetts Clears a No Fault Bill for Autos
description: BOSTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  A nofault auto insurance reform bill cleared the last major legis lative hurdle early today and Aetna Casualty and Surety Company, the state's third largest insurer of motor ve hicles promptly ordered its agents not to sell any new policies in the state.

title: Bridge:
description: BOSTON, Aug. 7  The Summer National Champion ships of the American Con tract Bridge League opened here today with attention fo cused on the Master Mixed Team Championship.

title: 2 Poverty Aides Seized at Jersey Migrants Camp
description: BRIDGETON, N. J., Aug 7Two antipoverty officials, a lawyer and a caseworker, were, arrested today on trespass charges after they refused an order to leave a migrant farm workers camp that they were trying to inspect.

title: Susan Byrne Married on L.I. To John F. Picciano, Lawyer
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 7Miss Susan Mary Byrne, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William F. X. Byrne, was married in St. Brigid's Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon to John Francis Picciano, a lawyer with the Justice Department in Miami.

title: 55 More Naval Vessels To Be Retired in 6 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) The Navy, in a continuing drive to meet Administration budget cuts, announced today that it would retire 55 ships in the next six months.

title: John's Is Changing Name
description: Shareholders of the John's Bargain Stores Corporation ap proved yesterday a change in name of the company to Strat ton Group, Ltd., David Cohen, president, said that the new name reflects the diversification of John's through purchase last April of Sprayregen & Co., New York investmentbanking house.

title: New Leader in Bogota
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Aug. 7 Twentythree years ago, Jesuit priest teaching at Roman Catholic boys school in Bogota that the Colombian political Mite traditionally at tended was lecturing a lazy pupil on his lack of a sense of life's tragedy. For ex ample, the priest said, as the former stu Man dent recalled it in the recently, we had someone here sev News eral years ago who personally learned a sense of tragedy. His name was Misael Pas trana and he's going to be president of the republic someday.

title: Rookies to Carry Ball Today in Hall of Fame Game
Chief Executive Selection Deferred by Rock Island
description: Directors of the Chicago. Rock Island & Pacific Railroad yester day deferred selection of a new chief executive officer.

title: Books of The Times
P.B.A. FIGHTS PLEA TO JAIL 3 POLICE
description: The President of the Patrol men's Benevolent Association yesterday denounced an Inves tigation Department move to send three policemen to jail until they testify more fully about their alleged involvement in the collection of payoffs from Manhattan businessmen.

title: Bob Lewis, Cubs'
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 7 CAP)Bob Lewis traveling secretary for the Chicago Cubs baseball team for 33 years, died in a hospital here yesterday. He was 72 years old.

title: JERSEY SWAMP GAS DISTURBS WIDE AREA
description: Large parts of New York City and an area of New Jersey stretching from northern Ho boken to the North Bergen area was covered with a blanket of swamp gas for several hours early today.

title: O'BRIEN SEES SMEAR IN AGNEW CRITICISM
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  Lawrence F. O'Brien, the Democratic national chairman, has accused Vice President Ag new of making an attack on me designed purposely as a smear filled with characteristic innuendo and insinuation.

title: Canada to Continue Her Gold Subsidies
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 7  The Canadian Government an nounced today it would contin ue paying subsidies to high cost gold producers for anoth er two and onehalf years.

title: William Titon, Master Taster At Macy's for 72 Years, Dead
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Aug. 7 William Titon, for many years Macy's master taster, died at his home here yesterday, at 72 Skyline Drive. He had retired last year, and was 90 years old.

title: Sales Show Advance
Soldier Dies of Meningitis
description: FORT DIX, N. J., Aug. (UPI) A 22yearold Army private in his second week of basic training died of meningitis to day, 10 hours after having been admitted to Walson Army Hos pital for treatment of an upper respiratory infection: the Army said. The soldier was identified as Joel H. Kalatucka of West Bristol, Pa. He was the first person to die here this year from the disease, which has struck down 94 other soldiers.

title: Treaty Initialed by Moscow and Bonn
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 7Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union and Walter Scheel, the West German For eign Minister, ended 12 days of negotiations today by ini tialing a treaty both sides hope will lead to improved West GermanSoviet and EastWest relations.

title: Firemen Call for Protection
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 7 (AP) The International Association of Firefighters called on local, state and Federal governments today for protection of firemen from mob attacks, snipers and rock throwers. The hazardous nature of the fire fighting pro fession produces unendurable conditions when compounded by harassment of the men, said a resolution of the 150,000 member union.

title: Favorites Advance on Clay
description: ROCHESTER, Aug. 7 (UPI)Two of the first three seeded men gained the singles semi finals of the United States na tional amateur claycourt cham pionships today at the Tennis Club of Rochester.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President announced the appointment of Frank Borman, a former astronaut, as his special rep resentative on prisoners of war in Vietnam. The Presi dent met with members of the National Commission on Productivity and later gav? a reception in their honor. He saw Senator Jacob J. Javits, Republican of New York, and later met with officials of the National As sociation of Real Estate Boards.

title: TwoWay Test for the President
TOBY HARDWICK
description: Toby Hardwick, a former saxophonist with Duke Elling ton's band, died Wednesday in Washington. He was 66 years old.

title: FORMER PANTHER TELLS OF DISPUTE
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 7George Sams Jr. testified today that he had an argument with Bobby G. Seale the day he ar rived in Oakland, Calif., to en list as a Black Panther.

title: U.S. WOMEN GAIN CURTIS CUP LEAD
description: NEWTON, Mass., Aug. 8 (AP) Jane Bastanchury, the former national intercollegiate cham pion, and Mrs. Paul Dye set the tempo today as the United States took a 5Y231/2 lead over the British at the halfway mark of the 16th Curtis Cup golf matches.

title: Housing Police Aide Sworn
description: Robert Ledeo was sworn in as deputy chief of the city Housing Authority's police force yesterday in ceremonies City Hall Plaza where Mayor Lindsay delivered the principal address.

title: Court Says Landlords Must Protect Tenants
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI)The United States Court of Appeals for the Dis trict of Columbia has ruled that apartment landlords have a responsibility to help protect their tenants from crime.

title: TRANSIT AUTHORITY IS ACCUSED OF BIAS
Former Astronaut On Mission to Free U.S. War Prisoners
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) President Nixon said today that he was sending the former astronaut Frank Borman on mission abroad to try to seek the release of United States prisoners of war in Southeast Asia and obtain humane treat ment for those who remain in enemy hands.

title: HOOVER CLASHES WITH OHIO EDITOR
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 7  J. Edgar Hoover and the Knight newspapers editorial chairman, John. S. Knight, traded sharp rebukes in letters published to day on the front page of The Beacon Journal.

title: Music: Rebroff in Recital
description: The Germanborn basso of Russian descent, Ivan Reb roff, took over the stage of Philharmonic Hall on Thurs day night. He changed cos tumes, he bantered with the audience, he raised the lid of the piano for his accom panist, he discussed the songs, and he made himself throughly at home. Indeed, he did everything but sing well.

title: MICHAEL J. SALAMO
description: Michael J. Salamo, an assist ant professor of English and former public relations director for Brooklyn College, died Thursday of a heart attack in Methodist Hospital. He was 55 years old and had lived in Brooklyn all his life.

title: ROCHE ROUTS ASHE AT LONGWOOD NET
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 7Hobbled by a growth on the back of his left foot and men tally tired from too much tennis, Arthur Ashe was crushed, 61, 64, by Tony ?? today in a quarterfinal round match of the $50,000 United States professional champion ships.

title: Donna Lee Bennett Affianced To Lieut. Stanley R. Seltzer
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Aug. 7Col. George Wilton Ben nett, U.S.A.F., and Mrs. Bennett have announced plans for the Aug. 30 marriage of their daughter, Miss Donna Lee Bennett, to Lieut. Stanley Richard Seltzer, U.S.A.F., son of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley L. Seltzer of New York.

title: CEASEFIRE IN EFFECT ALONG SUEZ; ISRAEL AND EGYPT TO POLICE ZONE; INITIAL TALKS BEGINNING AT U. N.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7A ceasefire went into effect to night on the EgyptianIsraeli front along the Suez Canal, and the preliminary phase of a new round of negotiations on peace in the Middle East was under way at the United Nations.

title: Second American Is Seized by Uruguayan Guerrillas
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 7  Urban guerrillas who are threatening to kill a United States adviser and a Brazilian consul they kidnapped a week ago seized another United States adviser today.

title: Lefkowitz Obtains Order Against Art Exhibit Here
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lef kowitz moved yesterday against the New York International Art Show, which opened July 31 at the Coliseum, and its executive director, Richard A. Lersch.

title: Antiques: A Rural Family's Cabinetry
description: American country furni ture at its best is shown in the newly opened exhibition of work by the cabinetmak ing Dunlap family of New Hampshire at the Currier Gallery of Art in Manchester.

title: Wholesale Price Index Advanced Last Month
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The wholesale price index, on the basis of complete figures, rose sixtenths of one per cent in July, the Labor De partment reported today.

title: Jarring Mission Is Reactivated For Middle East Peace Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 7  Secretary General Thant announced today that the Jarring mission for peace in the Middle East is now re activated.

title: Sports of Vie Mulcts
description: Boxing and horse racing are the only important sports directly regulated by government. Events must be sanc tioned, licenses are issued, medical examinations are man datory. Boxing and racing are generally considered the sports most vulnerable to corruption, on a number of levels. While the crude fixed match, in which a fighter agrees to take a dive in the fourth, or in which the jockeys hold an election is unusual these days, fights and races in which unequals compete or in which one participant saving strength for the future, is neither uncommon nor considered particularly crooked by insiders.

title: A Bad Day for Gore
description: NASHVILLE, Aug. 7Yes terday was not one of Senator Albert Gore's best days. True, he was not defeated. True, he was not humiliated by a victory so narrow as to be meaning less. But it can hardly be con sidered a triumph when a man like Senator Gore, with almost 32 years on Capitol Hill be hind him, man ages to defeat primary opponent making his first, try for public of fice by just 30,000 votes. That was Mr. Gore's margin yesterday over Hudley, Crockett, a former television, commentator, in the Tennessee Democratic primary.

title: GOVERNOR TO GET 2D LINE ON BALLOT
description: Governor Rockefeller and Lieut. Gov. Malcolm Wilson who have been elected three limes on the Republicap line alone, have agreed to accept a second line offered them by the Civil ServiceInuependents par ty.

title: Son of Rep. Wyman Held on Drug Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) Louis E. Wyman 2d, 19yearold son of Representa tive Louis C. Wyman, Repub lican of New Hampshire, is being held at the Montgom ery County Detention Center on a celong charge of pos sion of marijuana, the police said today.

title: Burger Finds Courts Imperiled By Breaches of Civility at Trials
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 7The Chief Justice of the United States, Warren E. Burger, told the chief justices of the states to day that unseemly, outrageous episodes in courtrooms and overly long trials were under mining some of the public con fidence in the entire system.

title: 3 Arrested in Police Raid On 58th St. Drug Factory
description: A man and two women were arrested on the West Side early yesterday morning in a raid on what the police described as narcotics factory.

title: Tempted by a Carved Apple, Playwright Builds a Barn Around
description: OAKLAND, N. J.It looked like 17century lumber yardthousands of feet of ancient lumber stacked every where on the floor, recalled Sidney Kingsley as he spoke of the elaborately carved paneled room that he has been puzzling and laboring over for six years.

title: Gretel II, Aussie Yacht, Arrives at Providence
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Aug. 7 (AP)Gretel II, Australia's contender for the America's Cup next month arrived here today aboard the freighter New York Star, completing 14,000mile, twomonth jour ney from Sydney.

title: $26,460 TROT WON BY SWEET FREIGHT
description: YONKERS. Aug. 7Chalk players among the 26,308 fans who attended Yonkers Race way tonight owed management a vote of thanks for having made the Hudson Filly Trot nonbetting race.

title: POLICEMAN AND WIFE SEIZED IN DRUG RAID
description: A young New York City pe trolman and his wife were ar rested yesterday in their Brook lyn home, where members of a narcotics squad raiding party allegedly found mariujana, hypodermic needle and heroin, which the police said the couple attempted to sell.

title: East Aids West in Berlin Construction
description: BERLIN, Aug. 7  Eastern European countries have begun to lease manpower and ma chines to West Germany's ex panding building industry in new form of EastWest cooper ation that appears to bring prof its to both sides.

title: 745 Bags of Heroin Slated as Evidence Are Stolen in Court
