description: A policeman reported that 745 bags of heroin were stolen from between his feet yester day in a Criminal Court room, in Manhattan while he was waiting to present them as evi dence.

title: Justice Denies Marine's Plea
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Su preme Court Justice Hugo L. Black today denied without comment an appeal to stay courtmartial proceedings filed by a young Oklahoma marine accused of murder in South Vietnam. Pfc. Randall D. Her rod, of Calvin, Okla., had asked the Court to stay Army pro ceedings against him until his attorneys could file a petition for a writ of prohibition.

title: J. Sidney Johnson, 80, Dead; Consultant for Food Makers
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 7 J. Sidney Johnson, a market consultant for food manufac turers died yesterday appar ently of a heart attack, while swimming at the Devon Yacht Club. He was 80 years old and lived at 26 Courseview Road.

title: Data on Lefrak Said to Come From Urban League
description: The Justice Department's case against Samuel J. Lefrak, of the nation's leading build ers, for allegedly discrimi nating against blacks in rent ing apartments, is apparently based largely on investigative work done by the New York Urban League's Operation Open City, a fairhousing organiza tion financed by the Federal antipoverty program.

title: Pam Barnett Paces Lady Carling Golf By Stroke With 70
description: ATLANTA. Aug. 8 (UPI)  Pam Barnett shot a three underpar 70 today and took a twostroke lead in the open ing round of the 54hole Lady Carling open.

title: Guns Quiet as Filipinos Marry
description: BARRIO BANUBO, the PhilippinesWhen Miss Sa lama Engkong and Salud Tino were married in this Mindanao village of 450 Moslems, an allday gala tem porarily turned the drab col lection of houses into a ham let filled with song.

title: LOMAS IS SEEKING 3 MORTGAGE UNITS
description: The Lomas & Nettleton Fi nancial Corporation of Dallas, the nation's largest mortgage banker, announced yesterday that it agreed in principle to acquire all of the stock of three mortgage servicing subsidiaries of the U.I.P. Corporation, Milwaukee.

title: CIVIC GROUPS JOIN TO OPPOSE CON ED
description: Fifteen organizations of the Astoria, Long Island City and Ravenswood communities in North Queens that oppose the Consolidated Edison Company's plans to expand its Astoria power plant joined yesterday in a petition to the Board of Estimate for public hearings on the project.

title: GROVE TO REHIRE FOUR IT DISMISSED
description: Grove Press has accepted, at least technically, a labor arbi trator's ruling ordering the avant garde publishing house to rehire, with full back pay, four women dismissed last April during a dispute over union or Eanizing.

title: Architect to Wed Diana Dennison
description: Mr. and Mrs. E. Allen Den nison of Riverdale, the Bronx, have made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Diana Mansfield Denni son, to Colin Louis Melville Smith of Cambridge, Mass. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. H. Melville Smith of Leam ington Spa, England. A wed ding next month is planned.

title: South Vietnam to Tighten Visa Rules for Americans
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 7 (AP)The South Viet namese Government announced stricter visa requirements for. Americans today. The move was believed aimed at keeping out antiwar groups and other per sons the Government regards as potential troublemakers or un desirables.

title: Accord Held No Breach
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Official United States analysts of LatinAmerican affairs said today that the signing of the CubanChilean cultural agree ment was not a breach of the letter of the 1964 boycott of Cuba, which does not cover cultural agreements. One called, the agreement small beans.

title: Pleasure Seeker and Dewan Head Field in Today's $62,400 Whitney Stakes
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 7  The Whitney Stakes will occupy the feature spot today on the first Saturday card of the current Saratoga meeting. Although it is to have only its 43d running, compara tively young in this venerable land of the thoroughbred, it is one of the most important events in the caldendar, and this year's entry list attests to that popularity.

title: Lapchick Convalescing After a Heart Attack
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., Aug. 7Joe Lapchick, the long time basketball coach, was convalescing from a heart condition today. He is the sports coordinator for Kut sher's Country Club here.

title: RISE IN LEAD IN AIR TIED TO GASOLINE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) New evidence of increasing concentrations of lead in the atmosphere  ascribed mostly to gasoline additiveswas re ported today by two California scientists. They said the situa tion might cause global health hazards if unchecked.

title: Rams Brown Weighs 350
Union Scores Postal Shift
description: Morris Biller, president of the 26,000 member Manhattan Bronx Postal Union, criticized the newly adopted postal re form legislation yesterday and warned that the members of his union would continue to fight against what he called the injustices of the measure.

title: Elizabeth B. Edgerton To Marry on Sept. 12
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 7 Miss Elizabeth Brown Ed gerton and Timothy J. Cullen will be married here Sept. 12 at the home of the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm J. Edgerton Jr., who have announced the engage ment of the couple.

title: Article 1  No Title
R. S. O'Hara Jr., Isabelle Douglas Engaged to Wed
description: WEST ISLIP, L. I., Aug. 7Mrs. Zimmerman Douglas has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Isabelle Frothingham Douglas, to Robert Sidney O'Hara Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. O'Hara of Old Lyme, Conn. The wed ding is planned for next month.

title: Casey Stengel's Cantata Gives City Hall a Tip: Don't Fight LongHairs
description: Casey Stengel, who man aged the New York Mets when the Amazins were earning their descriptive ad jective by dropping balls all over the field, came to City Hall yesterday and among other things defended long haired athletes.

title: Resigns Board Seat at Kentucky Fried Remains Aide
description: Harland Sanders, founder of the Kentucky Fried Chicken Corporation, and two other di rectors of the franchise organi zation, have resigned from the board.

title: Accord Soon on Strategic Arms Doubted
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The current round of American Soviet negotiations on limiting strategic arms will end with the cautiously optimistic forecast that future sessions could reach an eventual agreement, informed diplomatic sources said today.

title: New Role for Raquel Welch
description: Raquel Welch and Richard Johnson will costar in The Beloved, a contemporary drama to be filmed, beginning Aug. 17, on the island of Cyprus, with other key roles played by Dame Flora Robson and Jack Hawkins. George Pan Cosmatos will direct the pro ject, which is being produced by Patrick Curtis, Miss Welch's husband.

title: Volgograd Closed to Tours
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 7Soviet authorities have closed the city of Volgograd, known until 1961 as Stalingrad, to tourists apparently because of an out break of cholera further down the Volga River at Astrakhan,??

title: 1 Dies, 5 Are Hurt As Taxi Hits Crowd From Central Park
description: One man was killed and his daughter and four other per sons seriously injured last night when a taxi went out of control at Central Park West and 81st Street and plowed into a crowd leaving a canceled Shakespeare in the Park performance.

title: Fishbachs Win Tennis Final
description: GREAT NECK, L. T., Aug. 7Mrs. Mae Fishbach and her son, Peter, from Great Neck, L 1., won the Eastern clay court mixed doubles tennis cham pionship today by defeating Mimi Kanarek and Suad Riz vanbegovic, the topseededstor, 61, 61, in the final at the Great Neck Country Club.

title: DR. SCHWARZSCHILD
description: Dr. Ludwig Schwarzschild, a dermatologist and professor died in a hospital in the Nether lands last Monday, after suffer ing a heart attack while on vacation. He was 71 years old and lived at 200 West 86th Street,

title: Egyptian Gans Active On Eve of CeaseFire
description: CAIRO, Aug. 7In a fare well communiqu, for the time being at least, Cairo's military spokesman reported tonight that Egyptian artil lery had opened fire along the length of the Suez Canal against Israeli positions in the Sinai Peninsula.

title: Asarco Cuts Price
description: American Smelting & Refin; ing Co., for the second time a month, announced yesterday; a price reduction in lead. The new price, effective immedi ately, is 15 cents a pound.

title: McLean Sees Gains
description: The McLean Trucking Com pany, one of the largest in its industry, has projected earnings for the year ending June 30, 1971, of $6,733,000, or $4.84 share, up from $3,783,030, or $2.72 a share, in fiscal 1970.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX SHOW AN UPSWING
description: A brief midafternoon up swing enabled most issues to end in the plus column by narrow margin yesterday on the American Stock Exchange.

title: Screen: Indians Rescue a Black Man
News Summary and Index
description: The fighting between Israel and her Arab neighbors stopped late yesterday as an Americanproposed ceasefire went into ef fect. Washington officials said Jordan, Syria and Lebanon would observe the 90day ceasefire as well as Egypt. Israel and Egypt are to police each other's lines to make sure no military gain results from the halt hostilities. [Page 1, Columns 58; Text. P. 2.]

title: Ceylon's Export Earnings Declined in the Quarter
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Aug. 7Ceylon's foreign exchange earnings from major exportstea, rubber and coconut prod uctswhich is the lifeblood of this countrydropped in the first quarter of this year. Tea which brought in about $48 million in the first quarter of last year fetched $39million this year.

title: Boycott of RCA Products Is Urged by Striking Union
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI). The International Union of Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers called a nationwide boycott against RCA Corpora tion products today after con tract negotiations broke off the 10th week of a strike.

title: NIXON AIDES ISSUE INFLATION ALERT CITING PRICE RISES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Nixon Administration's first inflation alert, issued today, identified several recent price increases, some accompanied by large wage increases, that it said had been important in rais ing the price level. It pointed no finger of blame, however.

title: Vesper, Litchfield Place 4 Crews in Rowing Finals
description: IONNINA, Greece, Aug. 7 (AP)The Vesper Boat Club of Philadelphia qualified two boats today for the finals in the world junior rowing championships, giving the United States four entries for tomorrow's title events.

title: Palestinians Vow to Undermine Truce
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 7Arab commando spokesmen said tonight that they would not observe the Middle East ceasefire and would work to undermine it.

title: How to Keep Cool in the City: Swim or Skate on the Rooftop
description: Keeping cool in the city requires some imagination and, for those who would avoid the obvious, a bit of capital. One of the offbeat ways that is becoming in creasingly popular is swim ming, skyscraper style.

title: Hoffman Rules Bugging Record On Seale Goes to Appeals Court
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 7  Feder al Judge Julius J. Hoffman ruled today that logs of elec tronic surveillance of Bobby G. Seale chairman of the Black Panther party should be turned over to the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit.

title: 7 Skippers Remain Unbeaten In Great South Bay Regatta
Soviet Satellite Launched
description: MOSCOW. Aug. 7 (AP)The Soviet Union launched another satellite in the Intercosmos se ries today and said it was de signed to aid in the study of radiation conditions in space.

title: MARSHALS STRIVE TO FIND FIRE CLUES
description: After a fire is out, but often before the fire fiehters have left the scene, the city's fire marshais move in on the ruin.

title: A Rare Opera at Newport
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 7  Joseph Michael Xavier Francis John Poniatowski, Prince of Monte Rotondo and grand nephew of Stanislas II, last king of Poland, sounds like a comic role in an oper etta. He was, in fact, a diplo mat, a tenor and the com poser of several operas pro duced in Italy, Paris and Lon don. Last night, as part of its 19thcentury revivals, the Newport Music Festival gave the American premiere of his Au travers du mur in the great hall of The Breakers here.

title: Goodyear Tire Files Suit Over Use of a Trademark
Thousands of Rock Concert Fans Are Refused Entry Into Canada
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N. Y., Aug. 7Thousands of youths bound for a rock music festival near Toronto have been refused entry into Canada at border crossings here and elsewhere because they could not produce enough money to support them selves during their stay.

title: Bills to Oppose Jets
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Aug. 7 Weeb Ewbank, the New York Jets general manager and coach, expressed interest today in Joe Kapp, now in exile from the Minnesota Vikings, but not at Kapp's reported $1.25mil lion demand for a fiveyear contract.

title: BRIDGEPORT POLICE SEIZE 15 IN RIOTING
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Aug. 7  Eighteen persons were ar raigned today on breach of the peace charges after a night of rioting in two of the city's low income housing projects.A dozen policemen were in jured at the Father Panik Vil lage project on the East Side, after a Learn of detectives en tered the area to apprehend lames Murphy, 22 years old a local Black Panther leader, in connection with a shooting on Wednesday. The police said Mr. Murphy fired a semiautomatic rine into the housing project.

title: Charts of Races at Saratoga
Puerto Rican Theater Group To Open Free Park Season
description: For the fourth consecutive summer, the Puerto Rican Traveling Theater, presented by Miriam Colon, will give a series of free performances in both English and Spanish in parks and playgrounds in Manhattan, the Bronx, Brook lyn and Queens.

title: Waiver Is Revoked for Tanker That Involved White House Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 The Treasury Department re voked today a special shipping privilege that Congressional critics had asserted would pro duce a multimilliondollar windfall for a tanker concern once headed by Peter M. Flani gan. White House aide.

title: Army Is Shortening Active Duty For Half of R. O. T.C. Graduates
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Army is reverting to a pre Vietnam war policy that will allow a large number of col lege graduates in the Reserve Officer Training Corps to spend only three to six months on active duty instead of two years.

title: U.S.TRAINED TROOPS AID CAMBODIAN DRIVE
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 7 (AP)Three battalions of Cambodians trained by the United States Special Forces to day reinforced Government troops besieging the crossroads, town of Skoun 40 miles north, east of Pnompenh.

title: Columbia Journalism Dean Appointed to Cabot Chair
description: Columbia University an nounced today the appointment of Elie Abel, dean of the uni versity's Graduate School of Journalism, as Godfrey Lowell Cabot Professor of Journalism at the school.

title: Trains Loaded for Nerve Gas Shipment
description: ANNISTON, Ala., Aug.7 (UPI)  The loading of two ?? with 12.540 nerve gas rockets, destined for disposal in the Atlantic Ocean, was completed today in preparation for a slow, cautious trip that will involve helicopters, special communications cars and caged rabbits.

title: CITY TRIES BUSES TO ENROLL VOTERS
description: The city's first attempt to register voters in a summer campaign from votemobiles got under way in Harlem yester day with an endorsement from City Council President Sanford D. Garelik.

title: Wedding Planned By Carol Braslow
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., Aug. 7Mr. and Mrs. Abra ham Braslow have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carol Braslow, to Herbert Edward Richter, son of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert H. Richter of Boston. The wedding is set for Nov. 29.

title: Actress on Panel for Deaf
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI) Nanette Fabray, actress who has been partially deaf since childhood, was appointed today to the National Advisory Com mission for the Deaf of the De partment of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: SEVER FUTURES HANG ONTO GAINS
description: Still playing follow the lead er, the silver futures market wok a jump yesterday in pur suit of the stock market. Stock prices spurted ahead on news of the ceasefire between Is raeli and Arab forces.

title: CAMP QUARANTINED AFTER A SCOUT DIES
description: SANTA FE, N.M., Aug. 7 (AP)The New Mexico Health and Social Services Department said today that the Philmont Scout Ranch in northeast New Mexico has been quarantined because the death of a young Boy Scout yesterday may have resulted from a communicable disease.

title: Finney Weds Anouk Aimee In Quiet London Ceremony
description: LONDON, Aug. 7 (Reuters)Albert Finney, the British actor, married Anoul: Aimee, the French actress, here today.

title: Briton Says Anna Was Awful in Siam
description: LONDON. Aug. 7One of Britain's most endearing heroines, Anna Leonowens, was toppled off her pedestal tonight.

title: Eugenia F. Lombard To Become a Bride
description: Mrs. E. Frothingham Lom bard of Cambridge, Mass., and Percival H. Lombard of Shirley, Mass., have an nounced here the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eu genia Frothingham Lombard of Glen Ellyn, Ill., to H. Scot Monaghan. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Mon aghan of Wheaton, Ill.

title: CHAPOT IS VICTOR ON CORN PLANTER
description: BRANCHVILLE, N.J., Aug. 7  Frank Chapot, the United States Equestrian Team star, rode Corn Planter to victory in the preliminary jumper class today at the Sussex County horse show.

title: Radio
Mrs. Chadsey Wins, 1 Up
description: BEDFORD, N. Y. Aug. 7Mrs. Carl T. Chadsey Jr. of Round Hill, the medalist with a 78, rallied to win the 48th annual Women's Westchester Fairfield Golf Association cham pionship on the last hole today. She defeated Mrs. M. Stuart Roesler of Stanwich, 1 up, in a 36hole match at Bedford Golf and Tennis Club.

title: ANTIPOLLUTION BILL PASSES IN MICHIGAN
description: LANSING, Mich., Aug. 7A truth pollution bill passed the State Legislature today as Michigan continued to react to mercury contamination of bor dering Great Lakes waters.

title: Will of Mrs. Reid Filed for Probate; Barnard Will Gain
description: Mrs. Helen Rogers Reid, former president of The New York Herald Tribune, who died in her Fifth Avenue home July 27 at the age of 87, bequeathed $200,000 to her alma mater, Barnard College.

title: Lost Subway Train Finds Its Home Is in Brooklyn
description: In addition to its other problems, the Transit Author ity had to cope this week with complaints from irate BMT riders who got on a Manhattanbound D train in Brooklyn Thursday morning and wound up an hour later back in Brooklyn.

title: Gunman Allowed Coast Cameraman To Take Pictures;
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Aug 7 (AP)You take all the pic tures you want. We are the revolutionaries, a gunman told Jim Kean, waving two revolv ers in the photographer's face.

title: Nixon Flies to Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., Aug. 7 (UPI)President Nixon flew to Camp David in the Maryland mountains today. Mrs. Nixon and their daughter Tricia made the helicopter trip with the President, as did his aides H. R. Haldeman. Ronald Ziegler. John D. Ehrlichman and Dwight Chapin.

title: Indoor Antenna for FM Devised
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7A New York electronics en gineer believes he has just the thing for apartment house tenants who want to receive frequen cy modulation stereo broadcast but whose land lords forbid out door antennas. William S. Halstead, who was one of the pioneers in multiplex broadcasting 20 years ago, was granted Pat ent 3.523.251 this week for Ins compact indoor antenna.

title: Auto Industry Struggling to Stop Lag in Productivity
description: DETROIT, Aug. 7  At Chry sler's Mound Road engine plant here they are trying green stamps. At the General Motors plant in Lordstown, Ohio, they are trying robots. The aim is the same: To cut costs, improve Quality and raise productivity.

title: BUS ROUTE CHANGE PLANNED FOR TODAY
description: Six bus routes will be changed today and on the three following Saturdays because of the closing of Lexington Ave nue and Eighth Street as ex perimental pedestrian malls.

title: Interior Agency Defends Effort Under New Mine Safety Law
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7Interior Department officials told a Senate subcommittee to day that the harsh criticism and protest strikes that have marked their management of a new Federal law to protect the health and safety of coal min ers had resulted from a com munication gap that had left them badly misunderstood.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Baltimore Orioles, Old Timer's Day, at Yankee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 2 P.M.

title: Lima, Ohio, Alert Continued After Violence Is Renewed
description: LIMA, Ohio, Aug. 7 (AP)National Guardsmen, policemen and firemen remained on alert today in an effort to check fur ther outbreaks of firebombings and other vandalism in this ra cially troubled, industrial city.

title: Italian Wins Wills Ski Cup; Palmer of U.S. Finishes 4th
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 7 (AP)  Carlo Demetz, Italy's skiing sculptor, won Australia's top skiing eventthe Wills In ternational Cup  at Thredbo today.

title: NEW ISSUES FIND LACKLUSTER WEEK
description: Ferronics, Inc., a Fairport, N.Y., producer of magnetic materials used in the electron ics industry, sold its shares publicly for the first time this week. Investors quickly bid them up to a handsome premium.

title: 10 Contests on Slate
description: The National Football League exhibition season gets under way today with many stars scheduled to be on the side lines.

title: Egypt Emphasizes Security
description: CAIRO, Aug. 7The United Arab Republic agreed today to reinstate the ceasefire along the Suez Canal. It linked the agreement to Israeli acceptance of a timetable for withdrawal from the lands seized in the war of June, 1967.

title: Sihanouk Regime Warns Reporters in Cambodia
description: TOKYO, Aug. 7 (AP)Prince Norodom Sihanouk's exile gov ernment in Peking has warned foreign newsmen covering the war in Cambodia that unless they obtain its permission, it will not be responsible for their safety. It asserted that its rebel army controlled the whole country.

title: AUSTRALIA'S BOOM IN NICKEL TRACED
description: An Australian official said here yesterday that his Gov ernment definitely didn't like but couldn't do a great deal about the stockmarket gyra tions that have followed the mining boom of the last decade.

title: Parochial Bus Law Upheld
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 7 (AP)The Minnesota Supreme Court unanimously upheld today 1969 state law requiring pub lic school districts to provide free bus rides for parochial school pupils.

title: ELSIE HILL, 86, DIES; LED SUFFRAGETTES
description: NORWALK, Conn., Aug. 7 (AP)Elsie Hill, leader in the fight for woman suffrage in the United States, who once went to jail for her beliefs, died last night in her home after a heart attack. She was 86 years old.

title: Borgnine, Davis to CoStar
description: Ernest Borgnine will rejoin Bette Davis, with whom he ap peared in The Catered Af fair, in the new comedy Bet ty and Claude, which Ameri canInternational will produce late this month in New Mexico. The stars will portray middle aged bank robbers who help rebellious youths.

title: F.T.C. ASKS LISTING OF CIGARETTE TARS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) Thwarted by Congress in at tempts to require stronger health warnings on packages of cigarettes, the Federal Trade Commission has moved to re quire disclosure in cigarette advertising of tar and nicotine content.

title: Reagan Orders Inquiry
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 7 (UPI)Gov. Ronald Reagan or dered today an immediate in vestigation into the kidnapping, and shootings at asn Rafael.

title: Chief Is Resigning At Penn Central
description: Paul A. Gorman, chairman and president of the Penn Central Company and its railroadoperating subsidiary, the Penn Central Transporta tion Company, is quitting his $250,000ayear job on Tues day.

title: Nigeria, Battling Bribery, Tries to Educate Public
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Aug. 7In a television commercial that is being broadcast frequently: in Nigeria these days, a young, couple approach a Government office to get a license. Appre hensively, they speculate in whispers: Will they have to bribe anyone?

title: Muddy Waters Returns
description: Still suffering the effects of a recent automobile acci dent, Muddy Waters was leaning on a crutch as he limped onto the performing area in the garden of the Museum of Modern Art on Thursday night. The blues singer sat down stiffly in a chair and took his guitar in his lap. From then on, every thing rockedhis sevenpiece blues band, the enthusiastic audience of 2,500 that peered from every vantage point in the garden, even the trees and the statues seemed to vibrate with the driving beat his group turned out.

title: TREASURY ISSUES FINANCING DATA
General Aviation's Use Of Stewart Is Increasing
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., Aug. 7  Metropolitan Transporta tion Authority officials, under heavy fire recently for their supervision of the New York City subways and the Long Island Railroad are able to smile when they talk about their most recent acquisition a general aviation airport near this city.

title: Soyinka Play Going Indoors
description: Because of staging require ments, Wole Soyinka's new play, Madmen and Special ists, performed by the Theater Arts Company from the Uni versity of Ibandan in Nigeria, has been moved from outdoor performances in Tompkins Park and Mount Morris Park to the AfroAmerican Studio, 15 West 126th Street. Free performances will be given to night at 8:30 and tomorrow at 2:30 P.M. and 8:30.

title: The Games'
WASLEWSKI HALTS TIGERS IN RELIEF
description: Fifteen Detroit Tigers reached base on seven hits and eight walks last night at Yankee Sta dium, but only one found his !way across home plate.

title: Texas Sued by U.S. On Desegregation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Justice Department filed suits today against the State of Texas and 26 school districts, seeking to compel desegrega tion for the coming school year in the last large group of hold outs not already under litiga tion.

title: Amman Quiet and Tense At CeaseFire Report
description: AMMAN. Jordan, Aug. 7Amman was subdued but tense tonight as the first re port came, by radio, that Middle Eastern ceasefire had been agreed upon and would come into force tonight.

title: TRUCE IN MIDEAST IS 4TH SINCE 1949
description: The ceasefire between the United Arab Republic and Is rael that went into effect last night is the fourthMiddle East ern truce in the 22 years of Israel's existence.

title: 4Year Term in Drug Case
description: CANANDAIGUA, N.Y., Aug. 7 (AP)A young man who, according to the police, was found carrying 12 pounds of marijuana in a suitcase last October, was sentenced today to serve up to four years in the Attica Correctional Facility. J. Christopher Glenn, 21 years old, of Canandaigua, was sen tenced by Judge Robert Ken nedy in Ontario County Court. Glenn had pleaded guilty to criminal possession of a danger ous drug.

title: Mrs. Lyonel Feininger Dies; Widow of the Artist Was 89
description: SYOSSET, L. I., Aug. 7Mrs. Julia Feininger, widow of Ly onel Feininger, the artist, died at Syosset Hospital today after a long illness. She was 89 years old and lived until a year ago at 235 East 22d Street in New York City. Her husband died in 1956.

title: Supervisor of Queens Zoo Says Electric Losses Peril Animals
description: The supervisor of the Queens Zoo charged yesterday it was the benighted stepchild of the Parks Department where animals sometimes sicken and die because of power failures.

title: Text of U.S., Israeli, U.A.R. and Thant Statements
description: We have just been informed by the Governments of the United Arab Republic and Is rael of their acceptance of the United States proposal for standstill ceasefire to come into effect at 2200 hours Greenwich Mean Time today, Friday, Aug. 7.

title: COWBOYS'
description: DALLAS, Aug. 7 (UPI)George Andrie, the Dallas Cow boys 6foot6inch 250pound defensive end, announced his retirement today in an emo tional statement that said he would not compromise my principles in order to settle contract dispute with the Cow boys.

title: Apartments Are Evacuated As Paint Factory Burns
description: Firemen cleared a sixstory apartment building in the Bronx last night after a threealarm fire engulfed a paint factory at Jackson Avenue and 142d Street.

title: Topics: New York CityCourtesy of Albany
Urban Overview
She Doesn't Mind When Her Husband Is Careful Not to Praise Her Meals
description: SONOMA, Calif.  August Sebastiani represents the sec ond generation of European vignerons who started the wine business in California, and he still prefers eating such Italian delicacies as cap retto, which is kid, chicken feet soup and batterfried zucchini blossoms.

title: PAINE, WEBBER ENDS TALKS WITH WITTER
description: Merger negotiations between Dean Witter & Co. and Paine. Webber, Jackson & Curtis were called off yesterday.

title: Securities Office Switch
description: The New York Securities Company, Inc., which occupied the 34th floor at 1 New York Plaza, the new office tower damaged by fire last Wednes day night, will temporarily use facilities of Delafield & Dela field at 140 Broadway, Craig Severance, chairman of the dis located firm, said yesterday.

title: Suez CeaseFire
description: The extraordinary rapidity with which Egypt and Israel have put their standstill ceasefire into effect contributes to the growing hope that both sides have finally decided to make a serious effort to negotiate a settlement.

title: Market Place:
description: It was just the thing for the jaded investor with a penchant for something dif ferent. The offer took the form of an ad in the com mercial notices section of a Sunday issue of The New York Times. It was placed by an Englishman and it said, in effect: For sale: Lord of the Manor titles, $2,400 (El,000) and up.

title: STOCKS ARE MIXED ON LONDON BOARD; F??actionai Changes Posted in Both Directions
description: Stock prices in London mov ?? in a narrow range with frac tional changes on both sides of the previous day's level.

title: Howard Reinheimer, 71, Dead; Theater and Copyright Lawyer
description: Howard E. Reinheimer, leading specialist in theater and copyright law, died yesterday in Lenox Hill Hospital, after short illness. He was 71 years old and lived at 35 East 76th Street. He also had homes in Beverly Hills, Calif., and Sun Valley, Idaho.

title: Caterpillar Invasion Fought
description: Parks Department crews were active here yesterday, es pecially in Brooklyn and Queens, spraying trees and shrubs seeking to stem a widespread infestation of cat erpillars. A spokesman said that the condition was not as bad as last year but that the invasion would continue through this month.

title: Pirates Down Mets, 61, and Raise Lead to 3 Games,. Yankees Win,
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 7The New York Mets fell farther off the pace than at any time since the first day of summer by los ing to the Pittsburgh Pirates to night, 61, before a crowd of 37,556 in Three Rivers Stadium.

title: Shaw and Archer Lead Akron Golf by Shot on 136's as jacklin Misses Cutoff
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 7Tom Shaw hurried home to Portland. Ore., for advice last week, after missing the cut in the West chester Classic, to consult with his golf teacher. This afternoon the 27yearold blond scored a 66 and tied for the 36hole lead at 136 with George Archer in the $150,000 American Golf Classic.

title: Giants at Green Bay
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Aug. 7  Here they come, ready or not.

title: Triplets on Police Force
description: JERSEY CITY. Aug. 7The Jersey City Police Department will have the first set of trip lets in its history as patrolmen when Joseph Koralja, a type writer repairman, joins the force Aug. 24. His brothers, Robert and Andrew Koralja, joined the police force in 1967. The three were born in Jersey City in 1941.

title: Tearful Manson Witness Unyielding When Shown Death Photos
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7 Linda Kasabian, her face con torted from crying as she was being shown a series of bloody photographs at the murder trial of Charles M. Manson today, turned suddenly to the hippie leader and three young mem bers of his band and asked, How could you do that?

title: MODEL CHANGEOVER CUTS AUTO OUTPUT
A SLEEPY MARKET WAKES UP BRIEFLY
description: A sleepy stock market burst to life for a brief period yes terday afternoon in response to the announcement of a 90day ceasefire in the Middle East. Trading was heavy during the upsurge and the New York Stock exchange's ticker tape at times lagged behind trans actions.

title: Church Group Aids Korean Ventures
description: The United Presbyterian Church has agreed to invest more than $100,000 in a factory in Seoul Korea that makes ar tificial limbs.

title: TRAILER A FAILURE AS SHOPPING LURE
description: Coordination between the Economic Development Admin istration and the city's other major agencies is supposed to be the keynote of Operation Main Street, Mayor Lindsay's effort to rehabilitate 15 mar ginal shopping areas here.

title: Plane Whose Jets All Failed at Once Mystifies Eastern
description: MIAMI, Aug. 7 (UPI)  Doz ens of engineers and mechan ics swarmed over an Eastern Airlines DC8 today trying to learn what caused two mal functions in which all four of the plane's jet engines lost power simultaneously.

title: Travelers Corp. Increased Earnings in the First Half
description: The Travelers Corporation reported yesterday that ad justed earnings in this year's first six months rose to $40, 229,000, or 85 cents a share, from $33.14million, or 69 cents a share, a year earlier. Earn ings for the 12 months ended June 30 climbed to $1.91 share from $1.61 a share a year ago. Figures exclude capital gains.

title: Colombia Inaugurates President as Soldiers Stand By
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Aug. 7 Misael Pastrana Borrero, 46 years old, was sworn in tonight as the President of this fourth most populous LatinAmerican republic.

title: She Looks to Other Fronts
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 7Pre mier Golda Meir expressed hope tonight that the cease fire with the United Arab Re public would spread to other fighting fronts and that the truce would have no limit in time.

title: Cuba and Chileans Will Exchange TV
STARK, 75, PLANS TO RETIRE SEPT. 8
description: Abe Stark, longing for some rest and solitude, said yester day that he would retire as Brooklyn Borough President on Sept. 8.

title: F. C. C. Rejects Abzug Appeal To Match Farber's WOR Time
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 7The Federal Communications Com mission turned down an appeal today for equal radio time by a woman whose opponent for a House seat runs a radio talk show in New York City.

title: Stiffer Cargo Rules Get Backing of the Airlines
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8, (AP) The nation's scheduled airlines asked the Customs Bureau to day to make effective as soon as possible its proposed tighter security measures in the han dling of international air cargo.

title: Executive Changes
description: Robert L. Gibson formerly a vice president the General Electric Company, has been elected a director of the Rogers Corporation.

title: F.B.I. ARRESTS 21 IN GAMBLING RAID
description: An earlymorning raid by Federal lawenforcement au thorities yesterday halted what they described as a $100,000 anight gambling operation al legedly run by a member of the Mafia family of Carlo Gambino.

title: Roundup: Ted Abernathy Is Royals'
description: Ted Abernathy has earned his livelihood throwing a baseball since 1952. He dosen't do it in the orthodox way, though. Instead, he throws it underhand. Some call it submarining. Aber nathy calls it, coming straight under.

title: SUBWAY WORKERS QUESTION SAFETY
description: The Subway Supervisors As sociation said yesterday that additional serious accidents were likely on the lines be cause of a shortage of experi enced personnel and an alleged deemphasis of equipment main tenance by transit officials.

title: SAMUEL WEINBERG OF INVESTMENT FIRM
description: Samuel Weinberg, who re tired recently as president of the investment securities firm of S. Weinberg, Grossman & Co., Inc., 40 Exchange Place died yesterday in Parkway Hospital Forest Hills Queens after a long illness. He was 68 years old and lived at 7031 108th Street, Forest Hills.

title: Milestone in Moscow
description: West Germany and the Soviet Union have taken long first step toward a fruitful new era for Europe. The draft initialed in Moscow yesterday is not a sub stitute for a definitive peace treaty formally ending World War II. It can serve, however, as an interim settlement on which a more satisfactory EastWest relationship can be built in Europeone that could lead in turn, to genuine rapprochement and peace.

title: Demands I.O.S. Give Him Executive Job or Face a Fight
description: GENEVA, Aug. 7Bernard Cornfeld today told the new management of the Investors Overseas Serviees mutual fund empire that he founded that it had the alternative of restoring him to an executive role or ousting him in a proxy fight.

title: Dust Commander Runs Today; Derby Winner Out 12 Weeks
description: OCEANPORT. N. J., Aug. 7 Dust Commander snatched a mouthful of hay this morn ing and chewed it furiously, going back for more before he was finished.

title: Two Drown as Disabled Cruiser Sinks After Coast Guard's Towline Breaks
description: Two persons drowned and three others were rescued from the choppy Atlantic Ocean yes terday as their cabin cruiser foundered and sank while being towed by a Coast Guard cutter 31 miles southeast of Cape May N.J.

title: Thievas Discard Dynamite
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 7 (AP)A gang of juveniles stopped freight train in a South Side switching yard last night and stole 16 cases of dynamite. Later, however, they discarded the explosives apparently dis appointed that their loot was not more marketable. These were juveniles who raid trains for merchandise, a police of ficer said. They definitely weren't after dynamite.

title: PENTAGON FEARS DRAFTEE SURPLUS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  The Selective Service Sys tem is already drafting men with lottery numbers up to 195 but it now suspects a lower number would have sufficed.

title: Jersey Toll Collector Saves a Baby's Life
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Aug. 7 (AP)A toll collector on the New Jersey Turnpike saved the life of a 10monthold baby today after she turned blue and stopped breathing in her parents car here.

title: John Moffett, Ad Director Of Pavers in Minneapolis
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 8 (AP) John W. Moffett, vice presi dent and advertising director of the Minneapolis Star and Trib une Company, died here today after a brief illness. He was 64 years old.

title: Along the Straw Hat Trail
description: CENTRAL PARKThe New York Shake spears Festival. Today, Tues., King Henry VI, Part 2; Wed., Thurs., Richard III; Fri., King Henry VI, Part 1.

title: BRANDT WILL VISIT SOVIET THIS WEEK
description: BONN, Aug. 8  Chancellor Willy Brandt will fly next week to Moscow to, sign the treaty negotiated between West Ger many and the Soviet Union, it was announced tonight.

title: House Vote Expected Tomorrow on Amendment for Equal Rights for Women
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8On Monday, for the first time, the House of Representatives is expected to vote on a constitu tional amendment that would prohibit any form of discrimi nation on the basis of sex.

title: Chambers Is Golf Captain
description: PRINCETON, NJ., Aug. 8Patrick W. Chambers of Del Mar, Calif., has been elected captain of the 1971 Princeton University varsity golf team. He has a twoyear varsity record of 27 victories and four defeats.

title: Lockheed Closes Georgia Facility
description: MARIETTA, Ga., Aug. 8 (UPI)The LockheedGeorgia Company has announced it is closing its nuclear research laboratory in Dawsonville, which employs 150 persons, because of a severe reduc tion in work available.

title: Nets Stars to Hold Clinic, Play P.A.L. Five Wednesday
description: A basketball game featur ing three players of the New York Nets of the American Bas ketball Association against a squad of youngsters fiom the 60th Precinct Police Athletic League will highlight a Meet the Nets Day at Nathan's Coney Island store this Wednes day at noon.

title: Top English Angler Hooked on Sport
description: When you're young, Capt Terence (Terry) Thomas was dying, you want to empty the lake or river where you'll fishtng.

title: PreRetirement Counseling Gains in Popularity
description: A lot of things float around in the back of your mind, but until you get a central place where you can look at it all, you won't do it, says George Fairhurst, a 61yearold employe of Bur lington Industries, Inc.

title: New York
description: On Oct. 27, 1904, August Belmont handed to Mayor. George B. McClellan a mahog any box containing the con trols for New York City's first subway train, saying, I give you this controller, Mr. Mayor, with the request that you put into operation this great road, and start it on his [sic] course to success and, I hope, safety.

title: Confusion Over Vote For the 18yearolds
description: During the first few weeks of 1971 more than 400 com munities in Oregon will vote on proposed municipal bond issues.

title: Questions On Efficacy Of the Rubella Vaccine
description: Tens of thousands of Ameri cans are deaf, blind, handi capped by defective hearts or mentally retarded because their mothers, during early pregnan cy (sometimes without even knowing it), experienced a mild ailment known as rubella, or German measles.

title: Roger Dickerson Percy Weds Miss Chambers
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., Aug. 8The marriage of Miss Penelope Chambers to Roger Dickerson Percy, son of Sen ator Charles H. Percy of Illi nois, took place in the Menlo Park Presbyterian Church this evening. The ceremony, performed by the Rev. Cary N. Weisiger, was followed by a reception at the Atherton home of Mr. and Mrs. Robert L. Chambers, parents of the bride.

title: Fund Shortages and Dissension Plague King Memorial Center
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 8A star tling sightMrs. Martin Luther King Jr. being picketed by blacksserved notice last week that all was not well with the Martin Luther King Jr. Memo rial Center.

title: 9 RESERVISTS GUILTY OF HAVING LONG HAIR
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 8 (AP)A special courtmartial con victed nine Marine Corps re servists today of refusing to obey a lawful order to cut their hair.

title: Spain Says U.S. Bases Accord Links Her to NATO
description: MADRID, Aug. 8 (AP)For eign Minister Gregorio Lpez Bravo said today that the new United StatesSpanish bases agreement linked Spain militari ly with the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

title: Miss Gail Thomas. Is Bride in Darien
description: DARIEN, Conn., Aug. 8Miss Gail Marcia Thomas and Sidney Bishop Congdon 3d were married here today in St. Luke's Episcopal Church by the Rev. Dr. Robert Nelson Back. He was assisted by the Rev. Harold Garbarino:

title: OCEAN HILL CHIEF FIRM ON OPENING
description: The chairman of the new Community School District 23 in Brooklyn said yesterday that nothing would be allowed to block the orderly resumption of classes next month in the eight schools of the former Ocean HillBrownsville demon stration unit.

title: Invading the Courtroom
description: The weird gun battle that took the lives of a Cali fornia judge, two convicts and a man seeking to free them has provided terrifying validation of the con demnation which, by bizarre coincidence, Chief Justice Burger was delivering that same day of unseemly, outrageous episodes in courtrooms.

title: Fiery Run, Va.: The Ethics of the Land
description: FIERY RUN, Va., Aug. 8In this lovely corner of Virginia, men are changing their ideas about the landnot much but some. A generation ago, they plowed the foothills of the Blue Ridge to plant corn and the gullywashing rains carried the red earth down the Rappahan nock River to the sea.

title: Lucinda A. Post Is Bride in Rye Of E. C. Palmer
description: RYE, N. Y., Aug. 8Miss Lucinda Ann Post, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Goadby Post, and Edward Carleton Palmer, son of Mr. and Mrs. William D. Palmer of Little Compton, R. I., were married here today in a ceremony straight out of Emily Post. The etiquette authority, the late Mrs. Edwin M. Post, was the bride's greatgrandmother; and her mother, Elizabeth L. Post, is the editor of the revised edi tion.

title: AGEE GETS 5 HITS
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 8Har rowing was the word for the 129 victory the New York Mets scored over the Pittsburgh Pirates in 3 hours 44 minutes at Three Rivers Stadium today.

title: Susan Butterworth. Is Bride Of Alexander Stewart Lord
description: RYE, N. Y., Aug. 8Miss Susan Elizabeth Butterworth, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John Frederick Butterworth of Madison, N. J. was mar ried here this afternoon to Alexander Stewart Lord, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Galey Lord 2d of Irvington onHudson.

title: Negro's Aides Optimistic on House Race in WhiteDominated District in Atlanta
description: ATLANTAAmong Negroes and whites here there is a growing feeling that Georgia's Fifth Congressional District may elect a black man to Congress.

title: Why a President Must Watch His Words
description: WASHINGTON  The report ers who trooped into the con ference room in Denver's Unit ed States Court Building last Monday were tired by the flight from San Clemente, and some of them had already told their home offices not to expect much news. Certainly nothing the President said in his opening comments changed this progno sis; but then, after a routine plea for Congressional action on his anticrime bills, he raised the question of the press's role in the. American system of justice, and he began to talk about John Wayne and Western mov ies and the simple code of jus tice of the old frontier.

title: LU DUBLE IS DEAD; SCULPTOR WAS 74
description: Lu Duble, a sculptor and teacher, who , won awards for her expressionist, stylized art, died Thursday in Woodstock, N. Y., where she had a summer home. She was 74 years old and lived at 17 East Ninth Street.

title: GOTTFRIED, KING GAIN AT KALAMAZOO NET
description: KALAMAZOO. Mich, Aug. 8 (AP)The favorites in both age divisions were upset today in emifinals of the national junior and boys tennis championships.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It may come as a setback to the pickle industry of America to learn that Nolan Ryan no longer soaks his fingers in brine. He now uses the juice of olives to toughen them.

title: Nature's Botanical Oddity
description: MOST flowering plants of the moist woodlands prudently bear their blooms in early spring be fore a dense canopy of tree foliage shuts off direct sunlight. An ex ception to this floral race against leaf ing trees is Indian pipe, which flowers when the woods are darkest in July and August. It may not even be recognized as a flowering plant.

title: Sonny and Gunner back from Korea
description: As one of our very best journalists in the past decade, Dan Wakefield has been conspicuous for two vir tues: a novelist's instinct for the right detail, the gesture or glance which can tell more than a thousand words of interpretation; and then something even rarer, an intimate, yet never merely egocentric, scale of observa tion. He has always tried to main tain the tone of a personal deposi

title: Bridge
description: HAROLD STIRLING VANDER BILT, who died early last month, was accustomed to making headlines, whether as the energetic chairman of the New York Central Railroad, as the international yachtsman who thrice defended the America's Cup and modernized the rightofway rules, or as a multi millionaire member of a famous family.

title: FUND FOR DOCKERS PLAGUED ON COAST
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 8A pioneering effort to ease the transition to automation in the West Coast shipping Industry has run into financial trouble.

title: Huey Newton Is Free
description: Early on Oct. 28, 1967, in the Oakland, Calif., black ghetto, two police officers flagged down a car driven by Huey p. Newton, Defense Minister of the Black Panthers and one of the party's founders. Gunfire erupted; Mr. Newton was shot in the stomach, one police officer was wounded and another policeman was killed.

title: Conservatives Plan to Thwart Campus Disruptions
description: A group of student conserva tives said yesterday that they planned to use injunctions and other legal devices in the com ing school year to reduce the number and extent of college disruptions.

title: Goldberg Marks 62d Year
description: Arthur J. Goldberg, Demo craticLiberal candidate fot Governor, observed his 62d birthday yesterday with his wife, son, daughter and four grandchidren at his farm in Marshall, Va. Governor Rocke feller, his Republican rival who Is just a month older than Mr. Goldberg, also took a day of rest from campaigning.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: KANSAS CITYOntioned Don 0'12Iley, pitcher, to Omaha of the American Association to make room for Tom Matchick, Infielder, who has returned from two weeks of mili tary duty.

title: 6 in Family From ,Oklahoma Die in Nebraska Air Crash
description: PIERCE, Neb., Aug. 8 (AP)A couple from Miami, Okla., and their four children were killed today when their light plane crashed into a field near Pierce in. northeast Nebraska.

title: Tiriac of Rumania Upsets Hewitt in Bavarian Tennis
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Aug. 8 (Reuters)Ion Tiriac of Rumania today upset second seeded Bob Hewitt of South Africa, 75, 62, 64, today in a quarterfinal match of the Bavarian tennis championships.

title: Mideast 1: Tough Road After CeaseFire
description: WASHINGTON  For nearly three years, the pace of rearma ment and military escalation in the Middle East had steadily outrun diplomacy until, this summer, the crescendo of com bat seemed to move inexorably toward a new explosion of all out war.

title: Relocation Issue Sharpens In Construction Efforts
description: A mood of nervous uncertainty has taken hold of many residents in the low 50's with the sudden appearance of a few large and seemingly ominous signs on 53d Street east of Third Avenue. Farther uptown in Yorkville, that mood has already turned to anger among other tenants whose nerves have been rubbed raw after weeks of seeing that sign in their midst.

title: Education
description: BERKELEY, Calif.After more than five years of labor, the university reform movement has brought forth mountains of com mittee reports but only little ac tual change. This is the essence of a report by the Carnegie Com mission on Higher Education, made public here last week.

title: COLLEGE RETAINS CHICAGO SUSPECT
description: EUGENE, Ore., Aug. SDr. John R. Froines, who was ac quitted of conspiracy at the Chicago 7 trial, has been re instated to the University of Oregon faculty in a decision that is likely to become a major issue as next year's session of the Oregon Legislature.

title: 2 Attacks in Yellowstone Linked to Different Bears
description: WEST YELLOWSTONE, Mont., Aug. 8 (AP)An investigation shows that two bears mauled visitors to Yellowstone Na tional Park in separate inci dents.

title: Lawyers Elect President
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 8 (AP) Richard M. Markus, of Cleve land, was elected president of the American Trial Lawyers Association during the organ ization's 24th annual conven tion here this week.

title: Among Their Lordships
description: It is difficult to envision Jennie Lee or George Brown in the House of Lords. Their willingness to accept even life peerages is something of a commentary on time and inevitable change. Either would have voted cheerfully to abolish the House of Lords altogether not too many years ago.

title: Hitchhikers Held in Berkeley Raids
description: BERKELEY, Calif. Aug. 8Anyone accustomed to the scene along Telegraph Avenue in Berkeley can feel it almost immediatelytension.

title: Move to Curb the Widespread. Use of Pep Pills
description: WASHINGTONA few years ago, a truck collided with a bus on a highway. Nine people were killed and many were injured. Investigators found that the truck driver had been heavily dosed with amphetamine and that he had not slept for 49 hours; possibly, he had simply blacked out when the drug's ef fect wore off.

title: Four Soviet Cities Closed To Tourists in Epidemic
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8 (AP) Four cities have been closed to foreign tourists as Soviet health authorities continue efforts to localize an outbreak of cholera.

title: Lamb's Warrior
description: The whole of it is thisthe Bible requires us to love our neighbors as well as ourselves, and Friend Isaac loved them better. So argued a sup porter of Isaac Hopper (17711852) when the tempestuous, devoted, fear less little tailor for the first of three times was disowned by his Quaker Meeting. Isaac's lifelong difficulties with the Society of Friends that he loved were the backwash of a straightahead, comewhatmay in volvement with the most wretched of his Philadelphia and New York neigh borsthe escaped slave, the prisoner, the fallen woman, the poor. Personal debts, public controversies and other unQuakerly happenstances faithfully followed.

title: Sally Sheffer Gains 2d Title In Eastern Diving Events
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 8 (AP) Sally Sheffer of the Philadel phia Aquatic Club gained her second Eastern diving cham pionship today as she won the onemeter board title with 379.95 points at Kelly Pool in Fairmount Park.

title: REUBEN A. BARSHAY, LAWYER, DEAD AT 61
description: Reuben A. Barshay, a lawyer and community leader, died Friday of a heart attack at his Home at 107 Bayside Drive, Atlantic Beach, L. I. His age was 61 and his office was at 521 Fifth Avenue.

title: House Group Urges U.S. to Press Saigon for Devaluation of Piaster to a More Realistic Exchange Rate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  A House watchdog group told Secretary of State William P. Rogers today that the United States was paying three times more than it should to finance the war and the civilian econ omy in South Vietnam and de manded that he press for a de valuation of the South Vietna mese cur rency from 118 piasters to the dollar to at least 300 piasters.

title: Q. B. Moseley Weds Rita Godfrey.
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 8Miss Rita Ann God frey and Quentin Brown Moseley were married here today in the Val H. Wilson Memorial Chapel of Skidmore College, where the bride groom's father is provost and dean of faculty. The Episcopal ceremony was per formed by the college chap lain, the Rev. Dr. Thomas R. Davis.

title: A Yankee barn with a Gallic accent
description: It is not surprising that Susan Mason's 200yearold barn in ? Westchester County meadow looks French outside and in. Mrs. Mason came to love the mcmoirs of France as a child and had lived abroad fore 20 years before marrying and settling in Cross River, N. Y., 35 fecErs ago.At that time she had stuccoed and halftimberedthe barn and used it for a greyhound kennel. Six years ago with her five children grown, she converted it for use as; her home. Bedrooms were devised in the hayloft and horse stalls The main barn areabecame asoaringliving dining roorn with Gothic tapes tries in the rafters and on a walt. The Renaisscaicestyle fireplace was designed, to be generous enough to warm the outsized room. Twoyears ago a silolike kitchen was installed in the shade of the sugar maple.

title: Building Owners Pay Dearly for Oil
description: It will probably cost the Archdiocese of New York between $300,000 and $400,000 more to heat its schools and hospitals this year than last.

title: Met Games This Week
description: TodayAt Pittsburgh.

title: BRIDGEPORT YOUTHS BURNED BY FIRE BOMB
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Aug. 8 (UPI)Three boys and a girl were burned by an exploding fire bomb Friday night in the wake of disturbances at two housing projects in this indus trial city.

title: NASCAR Race Postponed
description: WINSTON SALEM,. N. C., Aug. 8 (AP) Myers Broth ers Memorial stock car race for NASCAR Grand National driv ers was postponed today be cause of rain. It was tentatively rescheduled for Aug. 28.

title: Staten Island Draws
description: The Staten Island Cricket Club was held to a draw by Slambeau yesterday at Walker Park, Staten Island. Slambeau had 111 runs and Staten Islatid 58 for 6.

title: Airliner Crash in Acapulco Injures 8 From New York
description: A Convair charter airliner flying from Mexico City to Acapulco to pick up a group of American tourists crashed short of the runway at Acapulco Airport early yesterday, injur ing, the eight crew members aboard.

title: I.O.S. BOARD BARS CORNFELD RETURN
description: GENEVA, Aug. 8  Bernard Cornfeld, the American mutual fund organizer, lost an attempt to regain control of the Inves tors Overseas Services financial empire he founded 14 years ago.

title: Goodyear Tire and Rubber and Blue Bell Appoint Officers
description: The Goodyear Tire & Rub ber Company has announced the election of Donald R. Kronenberger as treasurer, succeeding John F. Bennett, who retired after a 40year career with the company;

title: JOINT ATOM FORCE WEIGHED BY ALLIES
description: LONDON, Aug. 8Author itative British defense sources regard as inevitable eventual creation of a joint British French nuclear force, perhaps by around 1975.

title: City Gets More Pedestrian Malls
description: Midtown Lexington Avenue and Eighth Street in dreenwich, Village became pedestrian Malls yesterday, and almost every body  including many mer chantsseemed to enjoy the experiment.

title: Deborah Barry Bride Of John Gano Prentice
description: DARIEN, Conn., Aug. 8Miss Deborah Ann Barry, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Kinnard Barry of Stamford, was married here today to John Gano Prentice, son of Dr. and Mrs. Stanley E. Prentice of Tenafly and Mantoloking, N. J. The cere mony was performed in the First Congregational Church of Darien by the Rev. Samuel Fogal.

title: Nigerian Oilfield Sealed
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Aug. 8 (Agence FrancePresse)  Ni gerian policemen have sealed off part of an oilfield in Rivers. State where escaping gas and oil from a well have ruined farms within a threemile radi us. Nearby villagers were forced lo evacuate when thel well erupted in flames and caused a mild earth tremor.

title: SUIT CHALLENGES DATA ON YOUTHS
description: The police practice of amass ing unsubstantiated informa tion about juveniles and then giving it to welfare authorities, the courts and schools has been temporarily halted be cause of a suit challenging the constitutionality of the system.

title: Eileen M. Denari Wed in Suburbs
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Aug. 8  Miss Eileen Mary Denari, a former buyer for Saks Fifth Avenue in New York, and James J. Ludwig, a vice president of the com pany and manager of its San Francisco store, were mar ried here this afternoon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Mitch ell Jelline. The ceremony was performed by Family Court Judge Alvin R. Ruskin, form er Mayor of New Rochelle.

title: British Links Record Set,
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 8 (UPI)John Lister, a 23yearold New Zealander won the $12,000 Ulster open golf championship today with a par 70 fo ra 72hole total of 264. His 54hole total of 194 set a British record.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: TodaySports Car Club of America, New England Region races at Thompson, Conn., at noon.

title: Red Hot and Redford
description: ACTORS with their own production companies are getting to be as common as actors with their own swimming pools. And Robert Redford is no exception to Hollywood's latest golden rule. The redhot star of Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid has just purchased two properties for his very own Wildwood Productions. The first is Fa mous Long Ago, the recent book by Raymond Mungo de scribing his disenchantment with the leftist, underground Liberation News Service.

title: Braves Pick Niagara Site
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 8 (AP) The Buffalo Braves of the National Basketball Association will open their first fall training camp Sept. 8 at Niagara University, just outside Niagara Falls, club officials announced today.

title: INDIANS WIN, 42, ON PINCH HOMER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Chuck Hinton crashed a two run pinchhit homer in the ninth inning today to give the Cleve land Indians a 42 victory over the Washington Senators.

title: A Growing Museum Of Early American Agricultural Life
description: ACCOKEEK, Md.  George Washington was a skillful farmer who believed in experimental agriculture. At one point he grew tobacco, but abandoned most of its production when he realized that the crop was exhausting the soil. Sub stituting wheat, corn and flax, he de veloped a system of crop rotation. But instead of reading about his estate at Mount Vernon, or seeing how some artist saw and painted it, why not visit the National Colonial Farm, which, agriculturally, at least, is trying to duplicate Washington's efforts.

title: Timing Considered Key to Mideast Truce
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 worked ceasefire wouldn't have worked six months ago, one United States official remarked today about the Middle Eastern truce. But the situation be came so dangerous this summer that; psychologically, everyone was looking for someone to provide an alternative to more fighting.

title: BAYH LISTS INCOME, URGES DISCLOSURES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Senator Birch Bayh, Demo crat of Indiana, opened his per sonal finances to public inspec tion today and disclosed he had a total income last year of $105,646.

title: LongHaired Policeman's Removal Is Urged by His Colleagues
description: Nearly all the policemen reg ularly assigned to the Central Park Precinct have signed a petition calling for the removal from the precinct of a patrol man who has accused the Po lice Department of harassing him because he has long hair.

title: Pop
description: THE RILL THING: Little Richard (Reprise RS 6404). I defy anyone under the age of 102 to sit still when Little Rich ard starts to get it on. He is, of course, the very em bodiment of fifties rock n roll, and an absolutely pri mal figure in the music that has dominated American pop culture for the last decade and a half. With Elvis Pres ley, Chuck Berry, Fats Dom ino (and many, many oth ers), Richard produced a cat alytic blend of blues, gospel and jazz that set the mori bund feet of the Eisenhower generation dancing again.

title: Loan to Zambia Set
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (Reuters)The United States ExportImport Bank has an nounced authorization of a $4.3million loan to Zambian Railways for purchase of equipment from the General Electric Company. The money will be used to buy 23 diesel electric locomotives, spare parts and tools. The loan is at 6 per cent and is repay able over 10 years.

title: the traveler's world
description: STATE ATTORNEY General Louis J. Lefkowitz really wants a licensing law requiring New York State travel agents to post substantial bonds so he can protect, their customers against mal feasance, incompetence and fraud. He has not had much luck getting such a bill through the State Legislature, al though following the stranding of 3,000 student travelers in Europe last month, Lefkowitz announced he was going to have his licensing bill introduced once again into the Legislative session next January.

title: 41 HORSES ON LIST FOR CAMDEN CHASE
description: CAMDEN, S. C., Aug. 8 (AP) Foreign nominations to the Colonial Cup, a $100,000 inter national steeplechase event to be held here Nov. 14, haye closed with 41 nominees from 10 na tions.

title: Star Wanted For Musical: Voice Unnecessary
description: WE can now add Broadway musicals to that ever lengthening list of things they sure don't make like they used to. Our theater has lowered its standards so much that a star can qualify as a singer without having to meet even the minimum vocal requirement of audibilitythanks to those thickets of mikes now sprouting along footlights over which Jolson, Cantor and Merman once hurled gloriously unamplified voices. Whilesinging has been electronically boosted, dancing has been artistically reduced to fit the minimal choreographic skills of the star. Technology may yet come to the aid of the lead foot as it has the tinny voice, but if this past season is any portent, a musical comedy so enhanced will be neither very musical nor much of a laughing matter.

title: Franklin Delano Roosevelt; By the Editors of American Heritage and Wilson Sullivan. Illustrated. 153 pp. New York: American Heritage Publishing Com pany. Distributed by Harper & Row. $5.95. (Ages 11 to 15)
description: The evocative pictures al most overwhelm the prose in this lovingly produced biography of F.D.R. Almost, because Wilson Sulli van, who must be adept at sending 10word telegrams, holds his own with quicksilver but economic prose that captures the charisma and char acter of our 32d President. Sullivan shows how this silkpants heir of famous fortune  familydoted. Groton and Harvardcoddled  was changed by tragedy into the trium phant figure, passionately loved and hated, who led the nation from the depths of a Depression through the tumult of a war that engulfed the globe.

title: Sand And Sea Club Has 5 Specialties At Its Show Today
description: Entries at allbreed fix tures have shown a steady uptrend for the last half dozen years. Show chair man, planning for the cur rent shows, figures on an in crease of 10 per cent over last year. Some events are doing even better. Perkio men to he held two weeks from today, has jumped more than 300 to 916, and Mispillion, the same weekend, is up 176 to 706 However, few can boast of the same progress as that made by the Sand and Sea Kennel Club which is hold ing its fifth show today. A benefit for the Cornell Re search Laboratory for Dis eases of Dogs, the event is taking place at Ocean Coun ty Park, Ocean Avenue, Route 88, Lakewood, N. J., one of the most scenic sites on the Eastern circuit.

title: Nuptials Here For Miss Booth
description: Miss Gracemary Booth, doughter of Mr. and Mrs. John E. Booth, was married in Calvary Episcopal Church here yesterday afternoon to Henry Delmore James, son of rs. William Oral James and the late Mr. James of the Bronx. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Sam uel R. Todd Jr.

title: DOLPHINS SUBDUE STEELERS, 16 TO 10
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. Aug. 8 (AP)  Bob Griese's accurate passing in the rain set up a quick Miami touchdown to night and the Dolphins scored a 1610 preseason victory over the Pittsburgh Steelers in the Gator Bowl.

title: JUDGABLE TAKES $60,400 WHITNEY
Radio
description: 7:307:55, WABC: Message of Israel. Tishe B'ab, program about the Jewish festival com memorating the destruction of the Temple by the Babylonians and laterby the Romans.

title: SKOUN IS RETAKEN WITH JET SUPPORT, CAMBODIA REPORTS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 8  Cambodian Government forces fought their way to the marketplace at Skoun yester day and retook the small road side community just one week after it was first occupied by Communist troops, the military command announced here to day.

title: SAINTS TURN BACK VIKINGS, 14 TO 13
description: CANTON, Ohio, Aug. 8 (AP) Doug Wyatt, a rookie safety, ran back a fumble recovery 50 yards for a touchdown with four seconds remaining and Tom Dempsey kicked the extra point today to give the New Orleans Saints a 1413 presea son victory over the Minnesota Vikings in a game played al most completely by rookies.

title: Nicholsen and Shane Take Sea Cliff Sailing Honors
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., Aug. 8John Nicholsen's Phenonenon in the Snipe Class and Dale Shane's Southerly in the Eng lish Class took the honors today in an abbreviated regatta on Hempstead Harbor conducted by the Sea Cliff Yacht Club. Light winds marred the event.

title: Shipping Newcomer Is 200 Years Old
description: When a company called Cunard Brocklebank, Ltd., was formed in 1967 to take over the cargo operations of Cunard SteamShip Com pany, Ltd., there were those in this country who won dered who the newcomer was. But the name of Brock lebank happens to be the old est of any British shipping company: it completed its second century this summer.

title: And NowAn Evening With Nichols and Hellman
description: IDON'T ever like to go backstage, a kind of parade ground, but on the night I saw Nichols and May, in 1960, there I was saying things to a lady who understandably didn't care what I thought and to a young man who did. That doesn't always make for friendship but there it was that night, and is, and this interview does not wish to hide the prejudices of the interviewer,

title: Miss Amy P. Patterson Becomes Bride
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 8Miss Amy Partridge Patterson and James William Isaacs were married here this afternoon. The Right Rev. Richard H. Baker, retired Bishop of North Carolina, performed the ceremony in the Episco pal Church of the Redeemer.

title: Robert Frost
description: Only an obtuse biographer could have subtitled this volume The Years of Triumph. True, Robert Frost be came, between 1915 and 1938, well known and maybeeven, in a Willy Lomandreamcometrue, wellliked, at least by adoring students and the larger academic public. It was, granted, a public triumph. If a biography were only a public docu ment, the title might be justified: we could read about the volume of sales, the successful barnstorming, the honors, the applause.

title: 3 Athletes to Study in U.S.
description: PARIS, Aug. 8 (AP) Three French track and field men will go to the United States in Sep tember to begin college. Fran cois Tracanelli, a polevaulter. and Pierre Corval will attend the University of California, Los Angeles. Jacques Accambray, a hammer thrower, will go to kent State in Ohio.

title: Business Index Rises in Week
Yonkers Drivers
RIOT CURB BACKED BY U. S. COLLEGES
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Aug. 8Relatively few institutions of higher education throughout the nation have balked at executing an agreement with the Penn sylvania Higher. Education As sistance Agency to report to it the names of students expelled or convicted as campus rioters.

title: Here Nothing Is Forbidden
description: STRATFORD, ONT.

title: SCHMID CAPTURES RHODES19 RACE
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Aug. 8 Fred Schmid of Marblehead, Mass., sailing Big Beauty, won the first race of the Rhodes19 Class East Coast championship of Larchmont Yacht Club to day. Only one of three sched uled races, began after a three hour wait for sufficient air, was completed in a light south easterly breeze on Long Island Sound. The series ends tomor row.

title: Dennis Murray Marries Miss Maureen J. Fitzgerald
description: Miss Maureen Jane Fitz gerald and. Dennis James Murray, who baked the bread used for communion at the nuptial mass, were married in St. Benedict's Roman Catho lic Church in the Bronx yes terday afternoon.

title: U.S. Business:
description: DALLAS  One sure way for a visitor to Dallas to start a conversation with a native is to talk about how much, the skyline has changed since his last visit.

title: Computer Lifts the Face of American Patents
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8With the aid of the comput er, the American patent is having its face lifted. The traditional form of this im portant document is being changed by the adoption of a front page summarizing essentials of the invention that is being protected.

title: The Russian system has profoundly changed since Pushkin's day, or has it?; Involuntary Journey To Siberia; By Andrei Amalrik.; Translated from the Russian by Manya Harari and Max Hayward. Introduction by Max Hayward. 297 pp. New York: A Helen and Kurt Wolff Book.; Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. $6.95.; Will the Soviet Union Survive Until 1984?; By Andrei Amairik.; Preface by Henry Kamm. Commentary by Sidney Monas. 93 pp. New York: Harper & Row. $4.95.
description: Oh Lord, Alexander Pushkin ex claimed after reading Dead Souls, how wretched our Russia is!

title: U.S. ProAmateur Golf To Return to Cincinnati
description: The bestball tournment al ways has attracted some of the top pros and amateurs and among those who have indicat ed they will play this year is Lee Trevino, former United States Open champion.

title: Directive on U.S. Air Role
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 8The United States mili tary command here has issued a confidential set of instruc tions to all unit commanders on what to say when asked about American air operations in Cambodia.

title: REBELS STARVING, SARAWAK REPORTS
description: KUCHING, Sarawak, Aug. 8 (Reuters)The remnants of a Chinese Communist insurgent force are starving to death in the jungles of Sarawak, the Malaysian state in northwest ern Borneo, Government offi cials here say.

title: Mary Anderson Wed to Donald Maday
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Aug. 8  Miss Mary.Anne Anderson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward F. Ander son, and Donald T. Maday, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albin T. Maday of Winter Park, Fla., were married here this after noon in St. Cassian Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. John J. Brown, the pastor.

title: Negro Aide Says Nixon Concern With Black Problems Is Growing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Robert J. Brown, the only black aide in the White House, said today that President Nixon was becoming much more sensitive to the problems of blacks.

title: Photography
description: WHAT is this, pho tography? said one startled lady to another as they entered the photographic gal lery of the Philadelphia Mu seum of Art one recent Sun day afternoon. Then, when she had gotten a grip on herself and taken a second look, she said, That's some kind of technique there. And she was right, both times.

title: SALT MINES AWE AMAZON INDIANS
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, July 27 Paul and Max visited the stateowned salt mines at nearby Zipaquira the other day, and thereby realized a cen turiesold dream. For salt is the one vital commodity that their people, the primitive Amazonian Indian of the Vau pes Department of Southeast Colombia, cannot obtain them selves from the dense jungles in which they dwell.

title: In The Nation: There Is No Law
description: During a hot Manhattan noon this week, hundreds of persons were taking what air they could find around the outdoor plaza of Rockefeller Center. Some, finding all the benches occu pied, were sitting comfortably on a retaining wall. A uni formed guard passed, telling them in a disinterested voice that they were not allowed to sit there. But he did nothing about it, and no one paid any, attention to him.

title: Get Serious, Bubbela, Or Get Lost
description: DURING a recent heated debate on a television talk show between Jane Fonda and the Archbishop of Canterbury, host Dick Cavett mused nos talgically, Whatever hap pened to lighthearted show folk?

title: 11 Rue Scribe Remains A Familiar U.S. Address
description: PARIS, Aug. 8The flatiron shaped building gleams in a triangle of honeycolored stone beside the Opera at what, for thousands of American tourists at least, is one of the most fa mous addresses in the world, 11 Rue Scribe.

title: BERTRAND CRACKS 2 MEET RECORDS.
description: Cliff Bertrand, former New York University star, set two meet records yesterday in the Eastern Masters track and field championships.

title: Oh!. What a Lovely Spy.
description: THERE are perhaps two chief types of underground movies. By un derground, I don't mean what used to play at the Cinematheque on Wooster Street, and was called The New American Cinema, and is still championed by Jonas Mekas, whether it is the geometry of Michael Snow, the pleasures of Walter Gutman or the emergence of some new, subteenage Mozart of the 8millimeter movie cam era. By underground, Imean what everybody else thinks is above ground, and you, because you are brighter, more sensitive, or possessor of some private knowledge, understand in a secret underground way.

title: In the Ghettos of Chicago, Policemen Are Targets
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 8  The Chicago police have become al most daily targets for bottles, bricks and bullets from the city's ghettos.

title: Alberto de Aguilar, Manager Of Excelsior in Mexico City
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 8 (AP) Alberto Ramirez de Aguilar, general, manager of Mexico's largest newspaper, Excelsior, died last night at the age of 42.

title: Savings Bond Lag Continues
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) For the 20th straight month, Americans redeemed more Unit ed States Savings Bonds in July than they bought. Bonds worth $402million were purchased last month while $458million worth were cashed, the Treas ury Department said.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
Best Seller List
description: This analysis is based on reports obtained front more than 125 book stores in 64 communities of the United States. The figures in the right hand column do not necessarily represent. consecutive appearances.

title: Dallas Financier Makes A Business of Bridge
description: DALLAS, Aug. 8Ira G. Corn Jr. is a Dallas financier who believes there is money to be made from the game of bridge, and he is quietly and methodically exploiting this idea.

title: Rossini's Upstate Trip Follows an Old Pattern
description: A decade ago, the New York University basketball coach, Lou Rossini, visited Schenectady, N. Y., to see Barry Kramer, then one of the top schoolboy prospects in the nation. Kramer was star ring for Linton High School.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Baltimore Orioles, dou bleheader, at Yankee Stadiuni, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 1 P.M.

title: Marijuana Turning Some Youths Away From Beer
description: Stroh's Brewery in Detroit has embarked on a crusade. It wants, an executive said, to bring young people back to beer.

title: John Klein Marries Susan Jane Verklin
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 8The marriage of Miss Susan Jane Verklin to John Eddy Klein took place here this after noon in the Beulah Presbyte rian Church. The Rev. Dale K. Milligan performed the ceremony. He was assisted by the Rev. Hubert Brom.

title: Star Class Sailing Off
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., Aug. 8The start of the Atlantic Coast Star Class championship regatta was postponed today because of lack of wind. The host Sea Cliff fleet plans to conduct three races tomorrow.

title: Vietnamese Quit Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 8 (Reuters)Several hundred Vietnamese refugees left here for saigon today in a 100car convoy essorted by Cambodian and South Vietnamese troups.

title: Ghana to Name President
description: ACCRA, Ghaina, Aug. 8 (Reu ters)The electoral college will meet Aug. 31 to choose the country's first president since the 1966 coup that ousted Kwame Nkrumah, it was an nounced today. The Speaker of the National Assembly, Justice Nii Amaa 011enu, was sworn in as acting president yesterday following the dissolution of the threeman Presidential Commis sion.

title: Cambodia : Heavy Pressure On Lon No 1 Regime
