description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia  The Cambodian Government did not report the news until Friday, but light sleepers in Pnompenh knew right away on Wednesday night what it meantthe distant rattle of gunfire and the thump of roc kets carried in the still air told them the Communists were get tine closer.

title: Rep. Blatnik Says Minnesota Would Sicken Hiawatha Now
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Representative John A. Blat nik says that if Hiawatha came back to see Minnesota's Land of the Skyblue Waters, he would be sickened at What we have done to them in a cen tury of pollution.

title: POLL FINDS F.B.I. LOSING SUPPORT
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Aug. 8The Federal Bureau of Investi gation has declined in public esteem since 1965, particularly among younger adults, Eastern ers and persons with a college background, according to the Gallup Poll.

title: JERSEY TIGERS PLAY FIREBIRDS SATURDAY
description: The Atlantic Coast Football League, featuring four new teams and four new coaches, begins its exhibition season next Saturday night with 10 of its 11 teams in action.

title: BLUE BELLE WINS IN SHIELDS EVENT
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 8 James B. Grant, sailing his Shields Class sloop, Blue Belle, and Souther (Chick) Whittelsey, with Interlude in the annual singlehanded race of the Luders16 Class, were winners on Long Island Sound today during the Belle Haven Club's regatta.

title: Pam Barnett Cards 3OverPar 76 but Keeps Lady Carling Lead by a Stroke
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 8 (UPI)Pam Barnett suffered a double bogey en route to a threeover par 76 today, but still held on to a stroke lead at the end of the second round of the Lady Carling open with a 146.

title: Sparkman Bids President Back a WagePrice Policy
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Aug. 8 (Reuters)  Senator John S. Sparkman, of the Senate Bank ing Committee, urged President Nixon today to vigorously back a price and incomes policy to halt inflation.

title: FESTIVAL BACKERS TOLD TO PAY TAXES
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Aug. 8 (UPI)The Internal Revenue Service has notified the pro moters of the abortive Powder Ridge Festival that they owe $200,000 in Federal corporate income taxes.

title: Japanese Take High Jump, Pole Vault at British Meet
description: LONDON, Aug. 8 (UPI)Jap anese athletes swept the high jump and pole vault and fin ished second and third in the long jump today at the British amateur athletic track and field championships in White City stadium.

title: Counter And Amex End Lower
description: Most issues on the Ameri can Stock Exchange and on the overthecounter market ended lower last week in quiet trading.

title: MEN IN M'SORLEY'S TOAST STATUS QUO
description: Walter Rice, who has been a customer at McSorley's bar for the last decade, sipped a stein of beer there yesterday afternoon and considered the possibly that, as of Monday, the place might have to admit women.

title: Grandpa Jim Trot Victor; Fresh Yankee Is Second
description: TORONTO, Aug. 8 (Canadian Press)Grandpa Jim shattered Greenwood's track record for the second straight year while streaking to an upset victory over Fresh Yankee tonight in the 19th edition of the $49,500 avilable Leaf Trot.

title: PARALYSIS IS EASED BY SHOCKING BRAIN
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., Aug. 8 (AP)A Stanford scientist is using computerregulated electricity, carried into dam aged brain tisue on tiny wires, to make a monkey lift food to its mouth with a paralyzed right arm.
