title: URUGUAY RESISTS REBELS DEMANDS
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 8With only hours remaining until the threatened execution by Marxist terrorists of an American hostage, the Uru guayan Government tonight re iterated its refusal to offer anv kind of ransom.

title: Karen Patricia Adair Is Wed at West Point
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Aug. 8 Miss Karen Patricia Adair, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore Adair of Larch mont, was married here this morning in the Roman Cath olic Chapel of the Most Holy Trinity to Capt. WilliaM Richard Kyzer, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Horace Kyzer of Santa Ana, Calif. The Rev. Joseph Moore of Bronxville performed the ceremony.

title: Benefit Fun Match Today
description: A fun match dog show will he held at Dietz Stadium, King ston, N.Y., today for the benefit of the Ulster County Chapter of the New York State Associ ation for Retarded Children. Barton Emanuel of Salisbury, Rhodesia, and Alice Sinclair of Toronto will serve as judges. The ribbons and trophies have been made by the youngsters. Judging starts at 11 A.M.

title: 2 HOTEL CHAINS HERE FACE STATE INQUIRY

title: S. C. Meigher 3d Weds Miss Tebbutt

title: The Rebel in Armagh Jail, The Hater in the Pulpit
description: The extremism of a young Catholic martyr and an anti papist Protestant apostle has polarized most of Northern Ireland's 1million population. The time of the moderates is over.

title: They Took Almost Opposing Paths To Parnassus
description: WITHIN the space of two days, two great conductors diedSir John Barbirolli, and then George Szell. Both had been active until a short time ago, and there was no hint that they would be taken from us. Szell was 73, but he was trim, athleticlooking and energetic. He al Ways took good care of himself, and seldom did illness of any kind force him to cancel a concert. Barbirolli, who was 70 years old when he died, always was more the bon vivant than Szell, but he too appeared to be a bounding indestructible.

title: CHARTER AIRLINES
description: Aviation Charter Corporation, 224 East 38th Street, 9865080 (agents for various charter com panies).

title: SUSSEX TITLE WON, BY THE IRISHMAN
description: BRANCHVILLE, N. J., Aug. 8 Melanie Smith's The Irish man, who could do no better than fourth place in the final class, captured the amateur owner jumper championship after a threehorse jumpoff to day as the Sussex County Horse Show ended a sixday run.

title: Maud,Ky.,Residents Find $563 Can Buy New Route to Town
description: MAUD, Ky. Aug. 8 (AP)When the state said it could not afford to build a $17,000 detour while a bridge was being replaced, the people of Maud built their own $563.02 version.

description: The sinking feeling started about a week after we returned to the United States.

title: Police Force Strikes
description: DRACUT, Mass., Aug. 8 (AP) State troopers were brought in today to replace local police men here who walked off the job in a dispute about overtime pay.

title: The Canadian Arctic: Nature in the Raw Is Both Barrier and Lure
description: EDMONTON, AlbertaThe Mackenzie Highway, land route to Canada's Arctic, is not the Matterhorn, but it is a chal lenee. Although it is advertised as an alweather, allseasons route to Yellow knife, it is not. The mighty Mackenzie River sees to that.

title: Army and Navy Eye Specialists Are Puzzled by Retina Disorders
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 Army and Navy doctors are in vestigating a mysterious, blind ing eye disorder that has af flicted more than 300 young Americans, most of them re cruits in the armed services, during the last three years.

title: Decline Cited In Boston
description: BOSTON, Aug. 8Output and employment in New Eng land started slowing in late 1969 in advance of the drop for the nation, a Federal Re serve Bank of Boston study of the region's economy re ports.

title: Fire Razes 500Foot Barn Used for Hambletonian Trot
description: DU QUOIN, Ill., Aug. 8 (AP) Fire early today destroyed the 500footlong barn used for quartering horses during the $100,000 Hambletonian Trot at the Du Quoin State Fair Grounds.

title: Faith B. Mason Becomes Bride

title: Eisenhower Design From Tames Photo
description: IN August, 1953, George Tames, New York Times photographer in Wash ington, and other news paper cameramen, took a number of photographs of President Dwight David Ei senhower as he was pre paring to make a radio and television report to the nation. Mr. Tames took about a dozen pictures, which, eventually were forwarded to the New York news room, but arrived too late for use in papers of the next morn ing. (Later it was the cover picture for The New York Times Sunday Magazine).

title: Insurance Often Not Sold
description: Many insurers are not yet willing to admit it, but evi dence is mounting rapidly that the American consumer is facing severe hardship in buying almost every kind of insurance coverage except life insurance.

title: Personality:
description: For most major industrial companies last year was hard one in which to set or even to equal sales and earnings records. And 1970 promises to be even harder.

title: CADET TELLS WHY HE TRIES TO QUIT
description: Cary Emmet Donham, the cadet who is seeking an honor able discharge from the United States Military Academy at West Point as a conscientious objector, said yesterday that he would not refuse to carry out military duties while his appeal was being pursued in Federal courts.

title: Gen. Lee's Sword Stolen
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, Aug. 8 (AP)A preCivil War sword that once belonged to Gen. Robert E. Lee was stolen this Week from a display case at the Oklahoma Historical Society museum.

title: Point of View:
description: Some very learned and thoughtful people see the computer as facilitating a radical realignment of knowl edge, and therefore of power. This they regard as a very dangerous possibility, and so do I. But I don't regard it as inevitable.

title: 3 New York Skippers Gain Berths in Star Class Finals
description: PENN YAN, N.Y., Aug. 8 (AP)Three skippers from New. York State have won the right to compete in the world Star lass sailing championships in Sweden Aug. 14.

title: Religion
description: When Jesuit Father Daniel Berrigan went underground last April instead of into the arms of Federal authorities and into prison, the truest of Berrigan be lievers were hard put to see the action as much more than a ges ture of defiance which would only prejudice his chances for reduction of sentence and early parole.

title: The Crystal Cave
description: Mary Stewart's latest is a longdistance ramble through fifthcentury Btritain right up to the accouchement of Ygraine, the mother of King Arthur. The party responsible for bringing together Ygraine and Uther Pendragon, Arthur's dad, is Merlin the magician, who needs all his wizardry for this caper, since Ygraine has a jealoushusband with a private army. Little is known of Mer lin's early life (or later life, for that matter) so the author obligingly expands his myth into a firstperson history.

title: Kurmann, Swiss Star, Wins 4,000Meter Bicycle Race
description: LEICESTER, England, Aug. 8 (AP)Xavier Kurmann, a 21yearold Swiss star, dashed the hopes of British cycling fans tonight by outriding a local hero, Ian Hallam, to retain his world amateur 4,000meter pur suit title.

title: Veterans Honor Pilots Who Overcame Hijacker
description: The Legion of Valor, an organization of military vet erans holding the nation's highest awards, has pre sented two of its Silver Crosses  one posthumously to the Eastern Airline pi lots who overcame an armed assailant March 17 on a flight to Boston.

title: N.F.L. Reject Tries Canada
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Aug. 8 (AP)Billy Main, an offensive halfback recently cut by Pitts burgh Stealers of the National Football League, joined the Cal gary Stampeders of the Can adian League today on a five day trial basis.

title: Perahia and Streich Are Soloists In Mostly Mozart Festival Bill
description: Murray Perahia and Rita Streich were soloists in the Mostly Mozart Festival con certs played at Philharmonic Hall on Friday and Saturday nights by the New York Cham ber Orchestra under the direc tion of Alexander Schneider.

title: Soviet Press Gives Favorable Display To. the CeaseFire
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8The So viet Union today gave wide and favorable publicity to the tem porary ceasefire between Egypt and Israel that went into effect early this morning Moscow time.

title: An Uptrend Indicated In Survey
description: The monthly survey of business activity for July by the National Association of Purchasing Management in dicates promising trends in new orders, production, and prices.

title: The Secret Woman
description: When did you last read a novel pegged on a pair of in fants switched at birth? thought so. If you have been rummaging about for a bit of kindergarten gothic, here it This time round, however, Miss Holt's large public will wish she'd used a less slapdash man ner to go with the Victorian subject matter. (Did Victorians really refer to this Victorian Age?)

title: Dissent Over U. S. Accord With Spain
description: WASHINGTON  While Sen ator J. W. Fulbright fumed on Capitol Hill, Secretary of State William P. Rogers and Spanish Foreign Minister Gregorio Lopez Bravo sat down smilingly at a table on the eighth floor of the State Department last week to sign an agreement giving the United States another fiveyear lease on air and naval bases in Spain.

title: Hnupilings
description: COHENSOL. Beloved husband of Sylvia. devoted father of Suzanne & Sheldon & devot. ed grandfather. Sunday August 16. at 10:30 a.m. at Elmont Cemetery, Beth David, El. moot Road, Elmont, L.I., N.Y. Section 4. No postponement.

title: Du Pont to Expand
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co., Inc., plans to double the capacity to make Dacron polyester staple fiber at its plant in Wilmington, N. C., from the present more than 100 million pounds a year. The facility is one of three at which du Pont produces staple.

title: His gifts as a Senator rendered him unfit to lead in times of crisis
description: The halfdecade of Lyndon John son's Presidency is a watershed in American history, like the Louisiana Purchase or the first transcontinental railroad or the Great Crash. Long after the immediate effects of his Administration have been absorbed, historians will puzzle over, speculate on and dogmatize about the over whelming Texan who for a moment was Paul Bunyan in the White House.

title: Congress's Right to Know
description: WASHINGTON.

title: A Cooled Economy Vacation
description: IT WAS A glance at my bankroll (no rubber band needed) and a heavyheart ed review of several current indices of our sagging economy that abruptly raised the question: Could I afford a relatively free spending vacation this summer, or would it perhaps be wiser to treat myself to one styled after va cations taken back in those bad old days when Herbert Hoover was cool ing off the nation's overheated econ omy with such astounding dexterity? How, I wondered, had the Depression generation vacationed themselves? What had they done, where had they goneif anywhere? I decided to take the trip to the New York Public Library to find out.

title: Wadkins Cards 67, Leads Porter Cup Golf With 204
description: LEWISTON, N. Y., Aug. 8 (AP)  The leader, Wayne McDonald, soared to a four overpar 74 today, enabling Lanny Wadkins of Richmond to edge into the lead in the Porter Cun amateur Rolf tournament.

description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 8Mrs. Josephine Reeves and Michael S. Dingee of Old Greenwich, were mar ried here this afternoon in the Round Hill Community Church by the Rev. Jurjen J. Hoomans, the assistant pastor.

description: MONTROSE, Colo., Aug. 8Capt. Ernest L. Medina buttoned up his military blouse with its three rows of ribbons, Combat Infantryman's Badge and para troop insignia as the small private airplane made its ap proach to the Montrose Airport.

title: Home Improvement
description: HOME workshop enthu siasts and wood work ing hobbyists have long since learned the advantages of owning and us ing good quality stationary power tools such as table saws, radial arm saws, lathes and sanding or grinding ma chines. However, many still do not own one power tool that some experienced cabi netmakers and woodworking craftsman consider the most important of alla jointer.

title: Acoustics at RCA's Studio Music to Engineers Ears
description: Attached to the big new office building at 1133 Ave nue of the Americas, like a lowslung papoose on a squaw's back, is a seven story structure containing the RCA Records recording stu dios. The entrance is at 110 West 44th Street. Inside is the world of audio, a world of buss consoles and 16 track recorders, of frequency responses and infinite vari ables, of limiting and sup ression devices. sierialto noise ratio, mixes, reverbera tions, feedback, mike place ments, echo chambers, all built at a cost of $1.5mil lion for the building itself and nobody knows how much more for the equipment con tained therein.

title: Gross Assails the View From Newark Tower
description: NEWARK, Aug. 8 (UPI)Nelson G. Gross, the Repub lican Senate candidate in New Jersey, visited the tower at Newark Airport this week and came away telling news men it was somewhat of a frightening experience.

title: DOCTOR SUES N.Y.U. OVER LOSS OF JOB
description: A former employe of the New York University School of Medicine has sued the school and Dr. Severo Ochoa, his for mer supervisor and a Nobel Prize winner, for $250,000 puni tive damages, charging that he was summarily dismissed when he refused to put Dr. Ochoa's name on one of his own re search papers.

title: OFFICIAL CRITICAL OF CUBAN LABOR
description: MIAMI, Aug. 8A high Cu ban official says that the pro ductivity of the country's two million workers is extremely low and appears to be de clinine.

title: Italians Worry About Inflation As They Jam Roads on Holidays
description: MODENA, Italy, Aug. 8Italy's summer migration is more massive than evr this year, but the mood ofthe motorized holidaymakers seems subdued.

title: Jack's Return Home
description: The style is sideofthemouth crime novel American, but the milieu is the minor league Brit ish underworld: provincial gam bling halls, sleazy pubs, blue movies. The combination pro duces a sleeper with unexpected qualities, something like the gusto found in an Italian Western.

title: Two PinchRunners Find Going Tough
description: A couple of weeks ago Al Weis entered a game against Los Angeles as a pinchrun ner, and Jim Brewer promptly picked him Off second base. The Mets, however, went on to score a run in that inning, the 10th, and won the game.

description: The following information about today's television pro grams was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: MAJOR SHIFT SEEN IN G.O.P. CONGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI)Americans for Constitutional Action says that a Republican majority in the House and Sen ate would produce one of his tory's greatest changes in the political philosophy of Congres sional leadership.

title: Summer Book Crop
description: THOSE who yearn for delectable homegrown vegetables, yet feel in secure when spade and trowel are in hand, will find Professor Angelo M. Pellegrini an encouraging mentor. The Food Lover's Garden (Knopf, $6.95) is his romance with the world of edibles, which he blends with some practical guidance on earthy chores like planting seeds, tend ing them and harvest. An English litera ture professor at the University of Wash ington, the author is obviously a man who loves to work in the soil and enjoys gar den fresh cuisine. Men will be especially pleased to follow along with him.

title: Titular Black Mayor Deplores Such Titles
description: MIAMI, Aug. 8 (AP)The unofficial black Mayor of Miami has resigned and urged Negro neighborhoods to stop what he called the patroniz ing practice of selecting titu lar but powerless officials. T. Willard Fair, executive direc tor of the Urban League of Greater Miami, said, Only real power can stop the rav ages of hunger, joblessness, rotten housing and the daily humiliations of being black in America.

title: Don't Just Stand ThereRead!
description: WE have come a long way from the time when art was pop ularly supposed to be created from the gut, and a fierce inarticulateness was widely assumed to be the mark of a great talent. Nowadaysjudging from at least one of the two major museum shows this summer devoted to the highflying conceptual Art (or Informa tion) movementthe font of genius would seem to be the cerebral cortex exclusively, and a generation of young artists appears to have adopted lofty garrulity as its thing, splitting philosophical hairs with Thomistic vigor and swinging footnotes like flails. One used to visit art exhibitions to lock now one is increasingly obliged to read. And what one reads is increasingly likely to sound something like this: Tem poral topology may vary mu tad's mutandis (given suffi cent compensatory theoreti cal and discourse adjust ments) without jeopardizing the efficacy of discourse.

title: Ceylon Fires U.S. Company
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Aug. 8 (AP)Ceylon has canceled a $2million contract with United States engineering consultants for advisory work in the diver sion of the Mahaweli Ganga River. The Prime Minister, Mrs. Sirimavo Bandaranaike, said she could get the advice from Ceylon engineers to replace En gineering Consultants, Inc., of Denver.

title: GIL HANOVER WINS SU MAC LAD TROT
description: YONKERS. Aug. 8  For the second straight time, the favo rite in a nonbetting event fin ished second at Yonkers Race way tonight. The Marlu stable's Marlu Pride, who had streaked to six victories, was soundly beaten by Gil Hanover in the $24.660 Su Mac Lad Trot.

title: Houston Port to Increase Room for DeepSea Ships
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 8Deep sea ships are entitled to a little more elbow room than they are getting in this major inland port, according to the Harris County Naviga tion District, which operates the port.

title: Contraceptive Aid Urged For LowIncome Women
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) The president of Planned ParenthoodWorld Population says that present family plan ning services are reaching only about 15 per cent of the 5.4 million lowincome American women who want and need contraceptive advice.

description: BAUMAlex G. In memory of a beautiful human being. We will always miss you. Rest in peace. Edythe, Sons & Grandchildren

title: Singer Player of Month
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 8 (UPI)Bill Singer of the Los Angeles Dodgers, who made a spirited comeback after being stricken with hepatitis yester day was named player of the month for July in the National League. A panel of 60 base ball writers and broadcasters chose Singer after the tall righthander won five games, including a nohitter July 20 against Philadelphia.

title: Employes Capture Suspect
description: Three hank employes pur ?ued a suspected robber yes terday and caught him a short distance from the Chase Man hattan branch at 711 Third Avenue, at 44th Street. They recovered the $2,275 he. had allegedly had in his possession. According to the police, the suspect, Guadaloupe Pena, 27 years old, of the Rutledge Hotel. 161 Lexington Avenue at 30th Street, was chased by the threeJesse Stone. Maurice Rosenhand and Gerald Sullivan after a woman teller shouted an alarm.

description: TRUMBULL, Conn., Aug. 8Mr. and Mrs. Fred A. Vercini have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Melinda M. Vercini, to Brian Sean Noon an, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas P. Noonan of South port.

title: Hilary L. Rodd Bride of Stephen Loring, Research Fellow
description: PETERSHAM, Mass., Aug. 8Miss Hilary Ledlie Rodd and Stephen Hathaway Lor ing were married here this afternoon in a ceremony per formed at the home of the bride's stepfather and moth er, Mr. and Mrs. John Munro Woolsey Jr. The bridegroom's father, the Right Rev. Oliver Leland Loring, retired Epis copal Bishop of Maine offi ciated. He was assisted by the Rev. David Bolton, rector of St. John's Episcopal Church in nearby Athol.

title: Alcohol Withdrawal Called a Peril to Pilots
description: The airplane pilot who has not had a drink for a day or even more can be just as dangerous as a pilot under the direct influence of liquor, according to a physician pilot writing in the current issue of Private Pilot.

title: G.O.P. RACE IS DULL IN CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 8As Con necticut slips into the summer doldrums, Republican politi cians are trying to build en thusiasm for the first statewide primary election in history here.

title: TWO SISTERS FOUND SLAIN IN BROOKLYN
description: Two middleaged sisters were found slashed to death yester day in a Brooklyn apartment.

title: The Pledge
description: The literature, or at least the number of books, about Israel continues to grow: a reflection of an obsession with the phenomenon shared by Jew and Gentile alike. Even a fed ayeen, recently quoted in the newspapers, said, We are the Zionists of the Arab world.

title: 100 Madison Avenues Will Be of No Help'
description: I AM furious Black. Over the last year, in Harlem alone, over 100 teenagers died from overdoses of drugs. I also learned with horror that roughly four fifths of a major. American city's white population recently voted for a white can didate whose underworld connections are thought to be extensive, rather than see an honorable Black man attain that office. Thor Heyerdahl reports that during his Egyptianstyle crossing of the Atlantic, he encountered on the ocean the filth and garbage of what we are told is an ad vanced civilization. Tens of thousands of dollars are being paid individual American farmers not to produce surpluses that would feed starving people in America and the rest of the world. The summer riots are in gear, with promises that the nation's campuses will throw up more violence in the fall. After their second trip into space, a couple of astronauts have reported de tecting a progressive deterioration, due to pollution, of the earth's atmosphere. Oh, hell, the list is endless.

title: The Merchant's View:
description: There was a certain slug gish feeling in the retail trade last week brought about by hot, humid weather, and merchants were almost cer tain that they were falling behind in dollar aS well as unit sales. But results were better than anticipated and dollar volume held up well enough to push department store sales up by about 4 per cent. Total retail sales in the week ended August 1 showed a gain of 5 per cent.

title: Escaped Lion Killed in Maine
description: WARREN, Me. Aug. 8 (AP)A sixmonthold African lion was shot and killed here this week in woods near the old Knox Arboretum, where it had escaped four days earlier by jumping from a secondstory window.

title: Greek Orthodox Protest Encyclical On Use of English
description: Members of congregations of two Greek Orthodox churches interrupted services yesterday morning to protest the reading of an encyclical permitting the use of English instead of Greek in church services.

title: Week's Votes in Congress
description: The House

title: Turkey Devalues Her Currency And Raises Agricultural Prices
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Aug. 9 The Turkish Government an nounced today that it was de valuing the lira. The official exchange rate reportedly will be lowered from 9 lire to the dollar to 15 lire to the dollar, effective tomorrow.

title: INTERIOR AIRWAYS SUFFERS SETBACK
description: FAIRBANKS, Alaska, Aug. 9 The Alaskan who built a tiny bush flying service here into the world's largest fleet of Her cules C130 aircraft, to serve the North Slopes oil explora tion boom, said recently he had filed a petition for reor ganization proceedings under Federal law.

title: DEBATE SHARPENS ON BROKERS FEES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 The long hearings at the Se curities and Exchange Commis sion on what the sales commis sions should be on stock trans actions on the New York Stock Exchange finally came to an end Friday.

title: Booklet on Legal Abortions Is Available Across Nation
description: Planned Parenthood World Population announced yester day the publication of a 16 page booklet to help women in the United States obtain legal abortions.

title: Early Smog Warnings Are Planned by Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Aug. 9 (AP) Tokyo authorities plan to start tomnrrow a system of issuing warnings in the eve ning if heavy smog is expect ed the net day, and asking industry and car owners to cooperate to reduce smog.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The football season usually sort of sidles into summer, jostling baseball, who scowls and plays on. But football stomped in this time, and just as well. Men's souls melt in the second week of August with nothing more to look forward to than a baseball season in which three of the four divisional races seem locked up, and no new gossipy best sellers, Federal Court cases or gaffs by Commissioner Bowie Kuhn menacing the horizon. But football roared in with some real hammockrockers, the kind of ethical, religious, political and financial plays that make a man want to jump up and hit.

title: Schoonmaker Wins Sail
description: MARSTRAND, Sweden Aug. 9 (AP)James Schoonmaker of the United States, with Arne Aakerson of Sweden as his crewman, won the first race in the world Star Class yacht. racing championships today.

title: Swedish Yacht Is First
description: SANDEHAMN, Sweden, Aug. 9 (AP)Scandinavians took a step toward cup honors today, after Swedish Joker II finished first in a 10mile ocean race for halfton yachts, the third in the fiverace series. The leading American participants, Dick and John Carter of Cataumet, Mass were seventh and ninth, respec tivelv.

title: Laurie S. Menkes is Married To Leffrev L.Hollman, Teacher
description: TEANECK, N. J., Aug. 9 Miss Laurie Strenger Menkes, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sherwood Bradford Menkes, was married at the Ambassa dor here today to Jeffrey Lee Hollman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Hollman of Sea Cliff, L. I. The ceremony was per formed by Rabbi Kenneth Rivkin.

title: Gretel II in Test This Week As Damages Are Repaired
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 9 (UPI)The damage suffered by Australia's America's Cup chal lenger Gretel II on arrival here was minor in nature and the 12 meter yacht will have her first trials this week.

description: Julius Buchwald, a leading chessproblem composer, died yesterday of cancer in Elm hurst (Queens) General Hospi tal. He was 61 years old and lived at 2537 83d Street, Jack son Heights, Queens.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 9 (AP) Barry Lersch, making his first major league start, scattered eight hits today while pitching the Philadelphia Phillies to a 61 victory over the Chicago, Cubs for a split of their double header.

title: Customs Collections Up 1%
description: Customs collections amount ed to almost $3.3billion for the fiscal year ended last June 30, it was announced yesterday by Myles J. Am brose, United States Com missioner of Customs. The receipts totaled $3,299,790, 036, compared with $3,257 903,259 in 1969, represent ing an increase of 1 per cent.

title: ClosedEnd Funds
description: Following Is a weekly listing of the net asset value of closedend investment fund shares as reported by the companies through the Association of ClosedEnd Investment Companies at the close of business Friday.

title: Meadowbrook Poloists Beat Bethpage in Overtime, 76

title: 2 HUNTER EVENTS TO SECRET LEADER
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Aug. 9 Mrs. M. C. Lockhart, a seven time, grandmother, rode Secret Leader to both the green and amateurowner hunter cham pionships today at the Short Hills Farm Horse Show.

title: Instead of Breaking and Entering, They're Learning Art
description: When Lee Litt teaches art, she is locked into a room with 12 to 20 juvenile de linquents who are, awaiting a court hearing for anything from petty larceny to first degree murder.

description: PARIS, Aug. 9The French Government has suspended the construction of one multimil lion dollar project while the fate of a second remains in doubt.

title: Trains Loaded With Nerve Gas Start Journey Across the South Today
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP)Amid elaborate safety and security precautions, the Army has completed loading lethal nerve igas aboard trains in Annistctr, Ala., and. Rich mond, K34 It will send the trains through the South to morrow toward a disposal in the Atlantic.

title: Kenyan Bids U.S. Bar Skins of Two Animals
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 9 The Attorney General of Kenya, Charles Njonjo has asked the United States Gov ernment to ban imports of the skins of leopards and cheetahs.

title: Reform in the Wings
description: With Congress rushing toward a recess, there is some danger that an excellent House bill to regulate television campaign spending will give way to an inferior Senate bill with the same purpose.

title: HENRY GOODKIND, PHILATELIST, DIES
description: Henry M. Goodkind, an au thority on airmail stamps, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hos pital. He was 66 years old and lived at 1111 Park Avenue.

title: CORNFELD FORCES PROXY SHOWDOWN
description: GENEVA, Aug. 9Bernard Cornfeld announced today that he had taken action to force the calling of a special sharehold ers meeting that would restore him to control of the Investors Overseas Services mutualfund complex that he founded 14 years ago. The bearded former Brooklyn College student, who will be 43 years old this month, was deposed in May by a board room revolt.

title: SUYDAM, PFINGST WIN YACHT TITLES
description: BABYLON, L. I., Aug. 9The Great South Bay Yacht Racing Association's race week cham pionship came to a close today with only three skippers com pleting the fiverace series un defeated. They are Marc Mac Donell among the Cape Cod's, Bryce Suydam in the Sun Fish Class open division and Joe Pfingst in the SigneT Class open division.

title: Korn Wins Sailing Title
description: GENEVA, N.Y., Aug. 9 (AP) Sebald Korn of Auburn, N.Y., won the international Bantam sailing championship today on Seneca Lake.

title: Fowler and Saltz Triumph. In Sea Cliff Y.C. Regatta
description: SEA CLIFF, L. L, Aug. 9 Tom Fowler's Maru captured Ensign Class honors and Bob Saltz's AttaBoy II was the win ner of Snipe laurels in the Hempstead Harbor regatta con ducted by the Sea Cliff Yacht Club today.

title: Women's Liberation Gets Into the Long Island Swim
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 9Everything at the women's liberation party had gone pretty much according to plan. Then Representative Patsy Mink, Democrat of Hawaii, disappeared when she was supposed to speak, and a woman shed her blue jeans and dived into the swimming pool. After that, things were never quite the same.

title: Indians Fail, to Win With a Triple Play, Then Top Senators,
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) Tony Horton's tworun homer and a tworun double by Vada Pinson helped Cleveland post 63 victory over Washington to day for a split of their double header. The Senators beat Sam McDowell, 73, in the opener, despite a triple play by the Indians.

title: BRANDT TO DISCUSS TIES WITH KOSYGIN
description: BONN, Aug. 9Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany expects to confer at length on all aspects of EastWest re lations with Premier Aieksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet Union this week in Moscow, it was announced here today.

title: Peter, Paul and Mary Return In Concert of Peace and Protest
description: Peter, Paul and Mary played a long concert at the For est Hills Tennis Stadium on Saturday evening and showed that they have lost nothing in 10 years of popu larity.

title: BREWERS WIN, 4 TO 2, AS GIL STEALS HOME
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 9 (UPI) Gus Gil loped home with the tiebreaking run for Milwaukee today when the Kansas City Royals mishandled a double steal situation and the Brewers scored a 42 victory despite two home runs by Ed Kirkpat rick, the Royals catcher.

title: 10 Blocks Cordoned Off After Jersey City Looting
description: JERSEY CITY, Monday, Aug. 10 A 10block area in this city's downtown section was closed to traffic by the police last night after street disturb ances in which 12 persons were injured, none seriously.

title: Books of The Times
description: How often it happens that when one comes across a word for the first time and learns its meaning, one suddenly begins to see it everywhere. Here I had just finished reading and reviewing Kate Millett's Sexual Politics, and set it aside con vinced that I was free for a moment of the subject of woman's liberation, when, casu MRS. MUNCK. By Ella Leffland. 336 pages. Houghton Mifflin. $5.95. airy sampling a halfdozen or so first novels, I was suddenly caught up in the extraor dinary atmosphere of Ella Leffland's Mrs. Munck. And what does Mrs. Munck turn out to be but a power ful dramatization of an oppressed woman's plight and revenges a novel straight out of the tradition of the Bronts and Thomas Hardy. Or so it seemed to conditioned as I was by having learned my new word.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: PIERRE HARANG, 69, OF HOUBIGANT, INC.
description: Pierre Louis Harang, for mer vice president and director of Houbigant, Inc., perfumers, died Thursday at his home in New Ipswich, N.H., after a long illness. He was 69 years old.

title: Local School Boards and Central Administration Clash Over Funds
description: The new local school boards and the Board of Education will meet today in an attempt to resolve the first severe con troversy between them since decentralization began in earn ect in the city on July 1.

title: Mercury in Food: A Family Tragedy
description: ALAMOGORDO, N.M., Aug. 6Last October, when the Ernest Lee Huckleby family butchered a hog, stored the meat in their freezer and be gan eating it at meals, the cuts of pork on their plates resembled any others. They looked the same, smelled the same and tasted the same.

title: DualPupose Funds
description: Following is a wealth, listing of the un audited net asset value applicable to the capital shares of dual purpose Investment companies as prepared by Arthur Upper Corp. et the close of business Friday. Also shown are closing overthecounter dealertodealer asked prices on the New York Exchange for the capital shares of each company with the percentage lifferences (discount of premium) between the net asset value and the asked Price of the capital shares.

title: COLOMBIA SHAPES INVESTING RULES
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Aug. 9 Within 24 hours of taking of fice, President Misael Pastrana Borrero said he favors speeding the drawing up of rules of the game for private foreign in vestment in Colombia. These rulers may then apply through out the Latin American Free Trade Association, he said.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: GUERRILLAS BASES IN LEBANON ARE HIT BY ISRAELI PLANES
description: HEBRON, Israeli occupied Jordan, Aug. 9The Israeli Air Force bombed guerrilla bases in Lebanon today for nearly an hour, and an Israeli Army patrol fought in close combat with 10 guerrilla infiltrators from Syria for four and a half hours, a military spokes man said.

title: John McEwan Dead at 77
description: John J. McEwan, an all American center at Army in 1914 and later a coach at West Point, Holy Cross and Oregon, died yesterday at Veteran's Hospital in Man hattan. His age was 77. An obituary appears on Page 29.

title: $15Million is Given To Yale by Whitney
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 9John Hay Whitney has donated $ 15 million to Yale University for the construction of student housing to alleviate the over crowding that developed when the university became coedu cational last fall.

title: JOHN M'EWAN, 77, 14 ALLAMERICAN
description: John J. McEwan, 1914 All American center at Army who later was football coach at West Point, Holy Cross College and the University of Oregon, died yesterday at the Veteran's Hospital in Manhattan. He was 77 years old.

title: Steel Mills Facing Lack of Materials
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 9Steel producers are as much con cerned with supply as demand.

title: Dance: Early Graham Still Charms
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Aug. 9  Twentythree years ago, before most of this summer's students at Connecticut Col lege were born, Martha Gra ham opened the first season of the American Dance Festi val. Saturday evening at the Palmer Auditorium she closed this summer's festival with a lighthearted program of works including Diversion of Angels, which had its pre miere in that first year.

title: TV: A Noncommercial Sports Winner
description: Noncommercial television  specifically WGBHTV in Bostontakes the measure of commercial TV in the cov erage of at least one sport tennis. Reports and pictures of the United States Profes sional Tennis Championships at Brookline, Mass., were thoroughly professional and a sustained treat for tennis buffs. They were seen yes terday and on Saturday over Channel 13 via the Eastern Educational Television net work.

title: Plot Reported Halted in Togo
description: LOME, Togo, Aug. 9 (Reuters)  A Government communique, broadcast today by the Togolese radio, announced the thwarting of a plot to overthrow the To golese Government. It said groups of Ghanaians and Togo lese had planned to overthrow the Government by killing the chief of state, Etienne Eyadema.

title: Advertising: Agencies Profits Rose in '69
description: The profitability of ad agencies moved slightly high er again last year, according to the American Association of Advertising Agencies. But neither the association nor most knowledgeable admen expect this trend to continue in 1970.

title: U.S. Net Team Wins, 30
description: ROTTERDAM, the Netherlands, Aug. 9 (AP)American youth tennis players won an interna tional threeday tournament to day, defeating the Dutch first team, 30. The victors were Jeff Borowiak, Los Angeles; Erik Van Dillen, San Mateo, Calif., in singles, and Van Dillen and Paul Gerken, East Norwalk, Conn., in doubles.

title: DODGERS DEFEAT REDS, 73 AND 133
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 9 (UPI) Ted Sizemore drove in three runs in each game with seven hits today in pacing the Los Angeles Dodgers to a double victory over the Cincinnati Reds, 73 and 133.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Israeli jets attacked guerrilla bases in Lebanon yesterday and fought in the Golan heights with infiltrators from Syria. But along the Suez Canal the ceasefire with the United Arab Republic remained unbroken. [Page 1, Coluinn 3.]

title: Colonial Stores Offer Food at Late Hours
description: On the East Coast, about 10,000 small, convenience food stores, open from 7 a.m. to as late as 11 p.m., cater to the needs of lateshopping con sumers who discover they need packaged foods, dairy products or beverages when other stores are closed.

title: Browne Retains Net Title
description: TAMIMENT, Pa., Aug 9 Bailey Browne of Bronxville, N. Y., the defender and first seeded player, defeated Al Doyle of New York City, 60, 61, today and captured the fourth annual Tamiment invita tion tennis tournament at the Tamimentin thePoconos hotel.

title: RACING SWITCHES TO 2 JERSEY TRACKS
description: Racing will open at two New Jersey tracks today on the heels of a recordsetting season at Monmouth Park.

title: Westchester FosterHome Need Has Doubled in Last 5 Years
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 8 The numbers are smaller and the system is different, but, like New York City, West chester County is faced with rapidly increasing numbers of neglected or abandoned chil dren who need care.

title: U.S. Woman Is Suspect in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 9 Until she was 12 years old, Nancy Mangabeira Unger lived on Manhattan's upper East Side, played in Central Park and sometimes went to Satur day afternoon children's movies.

title: Abbey Troupe Ends London Season
description: LONDON, Aug. 9It has long been evident that most English playwrights were in fact IrishI am still expect ing some scholar to establish that Shakespeare himself was an Irishmanand the Dublin theater remains one of the glories of Europe, along with Dublin pubs.

title: MERRILL CAPTURES 420 CLASS SAILING
description: RED BANKS, N. J., Aug. 9 Ted Merrill, of Tappen Zee (N. Y.) Yacht Club won the 420 Class title with a threerace sweep today as the 22d na tional sweepstakes sailing re gatta ended on the Navesink River.

title: Television
Mincher Bats In 6 Runs
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 9 (UPI)  Don Mincher drove in two runs in the first game to back Chuck Dobson's four hit pitching and batted in four more in the second game with two homers as the Oakland A's1 swept a doubleheader from the Minnesota Twins, 30 and 63, today.

title: Digeon's Hydroplane Takes Calvert Cup in 70Mile Race
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 9 (AP)Sonny Digeon of Beau mont, Tex., drove his 7liter hydroplane TBird to victory today in the 24th annual Ma rine Derby Regatta on the Ohio River near JeffersonvIlle, Ind.

title: TITLE I ALLOCATIONS TO ELEMENTARY AND INTERMEDIATE SCHOOLS
description: The New York Times Aug. 10, 1970

title: Jack Fishberg, Violinist, Dead; With the Philharmonic 44 Years
description: LONDON, Aug. 9Jack Fish berg, who retired last year after 44 years as a violinist with the New York Philhar monic and its predecessors, died yesterday at the Middle sex Hospital here. He was 66 years old.

title: Nostalgia Is a Rubber Horseshoe
description: Would you believe that a 70yearold ad for rubber horseshoes, printed in the June issue of a magazine as a nostalgic harking back to the days of yesteryear, would draw a few hundred requests thus far for the product? And just about all of them, says the manufacturer and the publisher, were serious.

title: RED SOX SCORE, 74, WITH FIVERUN FIRST
description: BOSTON Aug. 9 (AP)The Boston Red Sox drove Mickey Lolich from the mound with seven consecutive hits in a five run first inning today and went on to a 74 victory over the Detroit Tigers.

title: Postmaster Exams Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) Postmaster General Winton B. Blount asked the Civil Serv ice Commission today to con duct competitive postmaster exams for 256 vacancies in 42 states and Puerto Rico as part of the program to remove such jobs from political influence. Competitive tests for post master are requested only when national and regional selection boards of the Post Office De partment are unable to identify a qualified postal employe for the position, Mr. Blount said.

title: For Openers:. Philbin of the jets Faces
lerusalem Paper Criticizes Foreign Press on Truce
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 9 (Reu ters)  The Englishlanguage Jerusalem Post criticized for eign newsmen and photogra phers today who it said invented a wave of rejoicing sweeping Israel at the an nouncement of the ceasefire in the Middle East on Friday.

title: Nixon Back at White House After Two Days in Maryland
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) President Nixon returned to the White House late this after noon after a weekend at Camp David, the Presidential retreat in Maryland.

title: .. Who Shall Decide?
description: To acknowledge Con Edison's recent willingness to Fee beyond its profitandloss figures, a pleasant con trast to earlier attitudes, is not to suggest that it should be entrusted with exclusive control over plant location, capacity, transmission lines and the like.

title: Article 1  No Title
POLICE IN WHITE END TERROR AT HOSPITAL
description: Five policemen disguised as doctors subdued a former mental patient early yesterday as he terrorized personnel at the New York Medical Center.

title: Shortage of Housing Here Expected to Grow Worse
description: The shortage of decent places to live is weighing heavily on the people of New York City, and it is expected to grow worse for at least the next two or three years.

title: BLUES PROVES KING IN ANN ARBOR FETE
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 9 The easiest way for a per former to win an introductory cheer at the Ann Arbor Blues Festival yesterday was to an nounce, I don't play no rock n roll.

title: Paying the Doctors to Keep You Healthy
description: OAKLAND, Calif.Is group medical practice based on a fixed annual payment by each family the answer to the na tion's need for an improved system of health care services? This question is likely to be hotly debated in the next few years as the advocates of na tional health insurancemany of whom believe that prepaid group practice is an essential accompaniment of national health insurance struggle to win Coneressional annroval.

title: Johnny Goodman, Golfer, Dies; Caddie Rose to Win U. S. Titles
description: SOUTH GATE, Calif., Aug. 9 (AP)  Johnny Goodman, the last amateur to win the United States Open Golf Tournament, died of a heart attack yester day at his home. He was 60 years old.

title: Giants Victors, 61, After 75 Setback By Astros in 10th
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 9 (UPI)Russ Gibson drove in three runs with a double and two singles and Gaylord Perry, helped by four double plays, gained his 16th victory today as the San Francisco Giants beat Houston,. 61, to gain a split of their doubleheader. The Astros won the opener, 75, on Joe Morgan's 2run homer in the 10th inning.

title: KUNSTLER IS BOOKED ON ASSAULT CHARGES
description: TORONTO, Aug. 9 (UPI) William Kunstler, the United States civil rights lawyer, was booked today on two charges of common assault stemming from a fracas during his last visit here.

title: STUART BRINKLEY, I NOTED PHYSICIST
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 9  Dr. Stuart R. Brinkley Jr., physicist and authority on combustion and detonation processes, died Friday at his summer home in South Bristol, Me. He was 54 vears old.

title: Moral ReArmament Cuts U.S. Operations
description: Moral ReArmamept, the late Frank N. D. Buchman's multi milliondollar religious move ment to reshape the world through absolute morality, is sharply curtailing its operations in the United States.

title: Pope Hails Mideast Truce
description: CASTEL GANDOLFO, Italy, Aug. 9 (AP)Pope Paul VI hailed the Middle East cease fire today and said he hoped a lasting peace could be founded on the belief in one God shared by Christians, Mos lems and Jews. The Vatican, meanwhile, denied that it had sent a note to Israel and Arab countries urging them to ac cept the United States peace initiative as was reported yes terday.

title: Isolated Outpost Is Home To Montagnard Families
description: DAKSEANG, South Vietnam, July 30  The women among the 260 montagnard families sharing the dark, stifling bunk ers here say that they would not leave their husbands.

title: CARDS TOP EXPOS AFTER LOSING, 76
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 9 (UPI) Jerry Reuss pitched a twohitter to give the St. Louis Cardinals a 40 victory today after the Montreal Expos won the first game, 76. Bobby Wine's double with the basesloaded capped a fourrun seventh inning rally in the opener.

title: .. Breath of a City..
description: Even in the face of his endorsement, we might remain highly skeptical of the. Astoria plant on the grounds of air pollution were it not for several miti gating factors. The committee majority would require Con Edison to rely exclusively on natural gas and lowsulphur coal and oil. These are now in short supply, but the company is buying all such fuels it can get in a tight market, and there is some reason to hope that with Federal help they will be more available by 1974. While expanding the plant should not be conditioned absolutely on the use of natural gas from the outset, both city and Federal Govern ments should be pressed into procuring that fuel, and its use should be made mandatory as far and as quickly as it becomes available.

title: SCHMID CAPTURES RHODES19 TITLE
description: LARCHMONT; N. Y., Aug. 9 Fred Schmid of Marblehead, Mass., who had won the open ing race off the Larchmont Yacht Club yesterday, also cap tured the third and last race of the series today for the Rhodes19 Class East Coast championship. Schmid won with Big Beauty by a split sec ond and six inches of her spin naker.

title: Heart Program Gets New Tasks But Little, if Any, New Money
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The Artificial Heart Branch of the National Heart and Lung Insti tute has a new name and new responsibilities but will get little if any new money.

title: Johnny Goodman Dies
description: Johnny Goodman, who rose from caddie to become the list mateur to win the United States Open golf tour nament in 1933, died of a heart. attack at his home in South Gate, Calif., last Satur day night. He was 60 years old. An obituary appears on Page 29.

title: The Count That Counts
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The most important set of political numbers produced this year will be not the election re turns but the census results.

title: Sykes Sails Dixie. To Shields Victory In Y.R.A. Regatta
description: RYE, N.Y. Aug. 9 James W. Sykes sailed Dixie to a Shields Class victory over Robert A. Bloomfield and his Chalet d'Ete in the last 100 yards today during the season's 25th Yacht Racing Association championship regatta. The Greenhaven Yacht Club staged the races in light and shifting breezes that were full of holes.

title: Soccer Fans Here Delay Game's Start, Then Prevent Finish
description: Barceiona of Ecuador Deportivo Call of Colombia, two of the strongest soccer teams in South America, bat tled to a 11 tie at Downing Stadium on Randalls Island yes Lerdav before 7.980 fans.

title: Miss St. Landau Planning Nuptials
description: BOUND BROOK, N.J., Aug. 9Miss Lorraine Ann St. Lan dau and Theodore Dilzer 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Dilzer 2d of Karlsruhe, Germany, plan to be married Dec. 14.

title: BENISCH CAPTURES RESOLUTE LAURELS
The NeverEnding Race
description: Being Mayor of New York City may be the second tough est job in America, as John V. Lindsay said a thousand times last year, but that doesn't stop an awful lot of men from want ing the job. The race for City lialf is a perpetual thing, and there are already at least a half dozen men who are considered canainates, even though the next mayoral election is not scheduled until 1973. City Hall fever is the reason that politicians this week will be watching Repre sentative Hugh L. Carey to see whether he decides to take the unglamorous job of Brooklyn Borough President, which will become vacant on Sept. 8 with the retirement of Abe Stark. Because if Mr. Carey leaves Congress for Borough Hall, he will almost certainly be the Brooklyn Democratic organiza tion's candidate for Mayor in three years.

title: THREE TITLES FALL IN POWERBOAT RACES
description: WILLARD, Utah, Aug. 9 (UPI)  Three new American Powerboat Association national champions were crowned today at Willard Bay State Park while a fourth successfully defended his title.

title: Pirates Sink Mets, 83, With 4 Runs in 7th and Hoist Lead to 3 Games
Andrie Signs Pact, Ending Retirement
description: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif., Aug. 9 (AP)George Andrie ended his twoday retire ment from professional foot ball today by showing up at the Dallas Cowboy training camp and signing a twoyear contract.

title: CARCRASH TESTS TO BE EXPANDED
description: The Cornell Aeronautical Lab oratory has won a new $1,048, 000 Federal contract to expand its research into designing autos that will give motorists a better cnance of surviving a crash.

title: 99 ON AIRLINER DIE IN CRASH IN PERU; 54 ARE FROM U.S.
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 9A Pe ruvian airliner crashed today shortly after taking off from Cuzco, killing 99 of 100 persons on board, including 54 United States citizens.

title: Bahama Refinery Stirs U.S. Oil Hopes
description: Like the cavalry to the res cue, four ships pulled in to the clear blue waters of Free port, the Bahama Islands, over the weekend carrying a cargo of crude oil that will set in motion a new refinery destined to play a major role In helping meet the critical United States shortage of low sulphur fuel oil. Freeport is located on Grand Bahama Is land.

title: Girl Wins Scholarship She Can't Take Without Going to Foster Home
description: She has lived in nine foster homes since she was 5 years old and been assigned to 23 different caseworkers by the Department of Social Services.

title: FOE IN CAMBODIA ATTACKS 4 TOWNS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 9Communist forces attacked three towns north and south of Pnompenh and another near the ancient temples of Angkor yes terday.

title: Harry A. Burgess, Lawyer For Bell Laboratories, Dies
description: CHATHAM, N. J., Aug. 9 Harry A. Burgess, who retired as general patent attorney and head of Bell Laboratories in 1955, died yesterday at his home. He was 80 years old and lived at 41 Coleman Avenue West.

title: Two Downtown Piers Converted for Parking
description: An enterprising parking concern, with an assist from City Hall, has given the Wall Street area a practical lesson in how to turn a liability into an asset.

title: ADDICTS UNMOVED BY HARLEM RALLY
description: Shortly before noon yester day the addicts began to gather on the corners of 114th Street at Eighth Avenue. Several leaned against the Happy Nik kis Restaurant on one corner. On another corner, a man stood limply in front of a shuttered cigar store, nodding.

title: Berlin's Mayor Approves
description: BERLIN, Aug. 9  Mayor Klaus Schatz of West Berlin gave his full support today to the treaty, but he demanded a satisfactory settlement for this isolated and divided city.

title: UNIT FORMED TO AID JEWISHNEGRO TIES
description: The American Jewish Con gress announced today the es tablishment of an Information Center on JewishNegro Rela tions.

title: TRIGGS TAKES LEAD. IN TITLE SHOOTING
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 9 (AP)A Marine and a civilian posted scores of 1,599 out of a possible 1,600 today at the end of the first day of individual shooting in the national small bore rifle prone championships.

title: 3 A.M. Subway Closing For Cleanup Is Urged
description: Dr. Paul L. Adams, Con servative candidate for Gov ernor, proposed yesterday that the city's subways be shut down for three hours daily to clean, them up.

title: Stolen Rifles Hunted
description: FORT ORD, Calif., Aug. 9 (UPI)  Military policemen searched today for seven M16 automatic rifles stolen outside A training classroom. While the theft, from a recruit training company, may have been a prank, the authorities were as suming it was carried out by someone who wanted the guns.

title: War Count Defeated
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Aug. 9 Midnight Flight, owned and ridden by Pat Gibson of Hun tington, L. I. won the amateur owner hunter championship at the Brookville Horse Show to day. In the process, he beat War Count, who had been un defeated on Long Island this year.

title: Hiiacked Czech Plane Returns
description: VIENNA, Aug. 9 (AP)  A Czechoslovak airliner, hijacked to Vienna by three Czecho slays yesterday was allowed to return to Prague last night. The three asked for political asylum and are in custody.

title: COL. CHARLES BRANHAIV
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Aug. 9 Col. Charles N. Branham, Army, retired, president of the West Point Alumni Foundation, died Friday in the post hospi tal. He was 71 years old and lived in Highland Falls.

title: WILLIAM G. ROSSITER JR.
description: William G. Rossiter Jr., director of budget for Thom McAn, a division of Melville Shoe Corporation, died Friday at his home in Westboro, Mass., after a long illness. His ace was 55.

title: Power for the People...
description: Mayor Lindsay should require no more time to decide whether or not to approve the proposed expan sion of the Consolidated Edison Company's power plant in Astoria. It is easy to be unenthusiastic about the project; it is hard to escape the view of such experts as David Lilienthal that there is now no woricanio alternative.

title: Roche Rallies to Defeat Layer in 5Set Final of $50,000 U.S. Tournament
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 9 No one knows what might have been: it was one of those once inathousand quirks, like shoe polish on a baseball, or fifth downs in football, or unsigned golf scorecards.

title: SINGAPORE SHOWS NEW CONFIDENCE
description: SINGAPORE, Aug. 9This island republic celebrated its fifth anniversary today demon strating aggressive selfconfi dence. A huge parade, involving almost 25,000 marchers, un veiled the nation's growing mili tary might.

title: Yanks Win on White's Homer in 11th, 64, Then Lose to Orioles in 11th, 129
description: In a wild afternoon (and early evening) of baseball, the Yan kees and Baltimore Orioles split a pair of 11inning games at Yankee Stadium yesterday.

title: Paschal, in Javelin, Wins Blue Hen at Dover Downs
description: DOVER, Del., Aug. 9 (UPI) Jim Paschal of High Point, N.C., driving a 1970 Javelin won the Blue Hen 200 at Dover Downs International Speedway today. His average speed was 102.462 miles an hour.

title: BATTLE GROWING ON BANKING BILL
description: An intense, behindthescenes battle is shaping up over a key provision in the bill to regulate onebank holding companies, which is currently awaiting ac tion by the Senate.

title: Miss Kenney Fiancee Of Tohn T. Gaherin Jr.
description: The engagement of Miss Carole Anne Kenney to John J. Gaherin Jr. has been an nounced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. William Kenney of Springfield Gardens, Queens. Her fianc is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Gaherin of West port, Conn. His father, former president of the Publishers Association of New York City, is adviser to the player rela tions Committee of the major league baseball clubs. Mr. Kenney, who is retired, was union representative of the Transport Workers Union.

title: Tokyo: Kabuki, Rock and the Twain
description: TOKYOShusaku Endo, a Roman Catholic novelist who has sometimes been called the Japanese Graham Greene, is working on a new novel, a life of Christ as seen through the eyes of a fictitious 13th disciple. The novel will shift back and forth between the Palestine of Christ's day and the Japan of to day as it explores Mr. Endo's favor lite theme  the great distance be tween East and West, the isolation and lone liness in which each dwells beneath a surface show of comprehension and good fel lowship.

title: Bridge:
description: BOSTON, Aug. 9The mas ter mixed team championship, the opening event of the 1970 summer nationals at the Sheraton Hotel here, was cap tured last night by two Cali fornia husbandandwife part nerships. Mr. and Mrs. Lew Mathe and Mr. and Mrs. Ger ald Bare, all of Los Angeles, posted a 71 per cent score in the final session to head the 52 expert teams that survived from the original entry of 152 teams. Mr. and Mrs. Mathe and Mr. and Mrs. Bare had 34.92 points. Mr. and Mrs. David Strasberg of Rockville Centre, L.I.; Mickey Rosenthal and William Daly of Boston and Ken Barbour of Stamford, Conn., had 33.21, technically tying with Mr. and Mrs. Ju lian Adler and Mr. and Mrs. David Sachs of Baltimore, who had 33.10.

title: Ron Field to Stage Sensations For Off Broadway Fall Opening
description: Ron Field, winner of two Tony Awards this year for his work as director and choreog rapher of the Broadway hit Applause, will start the new season as the director and choreographer of an Off Broadway musical.

title: OVERHAUL SOUGHT FOR U.S. AGENCIES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Presi dent Nixon's Advisory Council on Executive Organization has recommended an overhaul of six Federal regulatory agencies, but the White House so far appears cool to the advice.

title: SEALYHAM NAMED SAND AND SEA BEST
description: LAKEWOOD, N. J., Aug. 9 The Sealyham terrier is said to have been developed by Capt. John Edwards, on his estate, Sealyham, Haverford West, Wales in the 19th century. The little terrier was noted for his ability to hunt fox, otter and badger. To accomplish this he needed gameness and endur ance.

title: COLBERT HITS 25TH AS PADRES WIN, 42
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 9 (UPI) Solo home runs by Ed Spiezio and Nate Colbert marked San Diego's 11hit attack today as the Padres beat the Atlanta Braves, 42.

title: Governors to Open Parley Amid Signs of Chilly Relations With White House
description: OSAGE BEACH, Mo., Aug. 9  The nation's Governors nearly twothirds of them Re publicans, gathered today for their annual conference in this humid lake resort amid mount. ing complaints that their rela tions with the Nixon White House had sunk to a new low

title: U.S. Five Wins in Finland
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Aug. 9 (Reuters) The United States Olympic basketball training squad heat a Finnish team, 7361. tonight.

title: Con Ed Says It Can't Meet Pollution Rule and Expand
description: Consolidated Edison said yes terday it could not build the controversial addition to its As toria plant if it had to meet a key antipollution requirement laid down by the Mayor's Inter departmental Committee on Public Utilities.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
NADER ASKS INQUIRY ON PROPERTY TAXES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9  Ralph Nader said today that state and local governments were losing at least $6billion a year through the undertaxation of large property owners and of the owners of underground mineral deposits.

title: Mr. Colombo Sets Sail
description: Such an event would ordinarily be a cause for great relief, if not rejoicing. But Italy's centerleft coalition has been in almost constant crisis since the 1968 election; so it is natural this time to focus not on Mr. Colombo's considerable success in stitching it together but on the unresolved problems that could again rip it apart. The Social Democrats have accepted only grudg ingly the compromise under which the Socialist party may form alliances with the Communists in local and regional governments where the national centerleft formula is unworkable. The quarrel between the two Socialist factions is not settled, only papered over.

title: WALL ST. FEARFUL OF DOG DAYS BITE
description: The traditional summer dol drums have drifted into Wall Street once again, but this year the event has ominous impli cations.

title: Al Fatah Reports Doubling Of Its Attacks on Israelis
description: AMMAN, Jordan Aug. 9 An information officer of Al Fatah, the strongest Arab com mando group, asserted today that its men had staged 30 attacks on targets in Israel last nightmore than twice the average nightly number.

title: TANNER CAPTURES CROWN IN TENNIS
description: ROCHESTER, Aug. 9 (UPI) Roscoe Tanner rallied to cap ture the men's singles title to day in the final round of the United States national amateur clay court championship. Tan ner, of Lookout Mountain, Tenn., downed Haroum Rahim of Pak istan, 36, 26, 61, 66, 108.

title: MONDAY, AUGUST 10, 1970
U.S. Tried to Sell Troubled Jersey Bank
description: The United States Controller of the Currency  who regu lates all federally chartered bankstried unsuccessfully to arrange a sale of the Eaton town (N..1.) National Bank to other local banking interests before ordering the bank closed last week following reports of a multimillion dollar embezzle ment.

title: U.S.SOVIET POLICING OF SINAI SUGGESTED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Sen ator Jacob K. Javits raised the possibility today that United States and Soviet troops might be used to help police the ceasefire in the Sinai Penin sula.

title: ETHICS BOARD ASKS LINDSAY TO ALTER CONSULTANT PACTS
description: The city's Board of Ethics recommended yesterday that private consultant contracts, mostly awarded by the city without public knowledge or competitive biddings, be given publicity in the public in terest.

title: U.S. NEWSMAN SEEN IN VIETCONG HANDS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 9Refugees from Skoun report ed today that Robert S. Anson, an American correspondent for Time magazine, had been kept bound but unharmed by his Vietcong captors in that Cam bodian town on the night fol lowing his capture on Aug. 3. and was later led away to an enemycontrolled hamlet to the north.

title: Personal Finance
description: When the giant, apparently rich Penn Central Transpor tation Company went under not too long ago, people just couldn't believe it.

title: For Children: Indian Aprons and Handmade Mice
description: Children's Concepts is a bright new shop for children at 2295 Broadway (near 83d Street). The facade is painted white and splashed with big red polka dots, and the merry design is carried through in side. While the shop carries a lot of things from estab lished manufacturers, some mousers may rim the imported or handmade clothes the most intri guing items. For example, there are unusual dresses and other items made by a group of Seminole Indians. Small geo metric pieces of brightly col ored cotton march down the front of a dress or around the edge of an apron or band a pinafore bodice or the hem of a dirndl. Prices are about $10 for the dresses; the little half aprons are $1.75 and sizes range from 4 to 10.

title: Almost All AgreeWomen Marrying Should Know Their Rights
description: Almost no one likes alimony, and some of those who feel most strongly on the subject are recipients of it.

title: Schools in South Find Desegregation Brings an Increase in Insurance Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9  Some public schools that are desegregating in the South are running into trouble from an unexpected source  their in surance companies. Some have had their rates raised, some have had coverage reduced and some have had their policies canceled entirely

title: Surgery
Chicago Loses, 50, 63
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 9 (AP)Alex Johnson, just back from a two week tour of military duty, belted a home run and three singles today to pace the Cali fornia Angels to a 50, 63 sweep over the Chicago White Sox.

title: Osborne Wins Net Final
description: HAMPTON, Va., Aug. 9 (AP) Jim Osborne of Honolulu, the ninthranked United States ten nis player, captured his first tournament laurels this season today by defeating Milan Hole cek of Czechoslavakia, 75, 64, in the final of the Hampton International.

title: HAROLD J. WATERS
description: Harold J. Waters, former senior editor of Men's Wear magazine, died Saturday at the Manhasset (L.I.) Medical Cen ter. He was 81 years old and lived at 24056 42d Avenue, Douglaston, Queens.

title: BIG INCREASE DUE IN BOND ACTIVITY
description: The bond market is moving into a week that will be a harsh test of the view that interest rates are headed downward.

title: Bus Plunge in Spain Kills 7
description: SEVILLE, Spain, Aug. 9 (UPI)A bus carrying Dutch tourists plunged off a bridge and into a river near this city, killing 7 persons and injuring 17 others early today, the po lice reported.

title: MARCUS A. HEYMAN
description: Marcus A. Heyman, a former member of the Commodity Ex change and the inventor of Suva cloth, which started the meshfabric fashion in shoes, died Friday of a heart attack in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 340 Riverside Drive.

title: A PEACE DIVIDEND AT WAR'S END SEEN
description: A peace dividend amount ing to $20billion to $24billion should be realized at the end of the war in Vietnam, accord ing to the National Industrial Conference Board.

title: Van Duyne Victor
description: ATLANTIC HIGHLANDS, N. J. Aug. 9Carl Van Duyne, an economics instructor at the United States Naval Academy, won the Finn Class North American sailing championship today on Sandy Hook Bay.

title: UrbanRenewal Project in Moscow Stirs Controversy
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9Kalinin Prospekt, Moscow's major effort at modern inner city redevel opment and beautification, is a grand concourse of contro versy.

title: Yankee Rookie and an Old Pro Do Well Against Birds
Twitty Cards 276 to Win
description: LEWISTON, N.Y., Aug. 9 (AP)  Howard Twitty of Tempe, Ariz., fired a fourunder par 66 today to win the annual Porter Cup amateur tournament with a 72hole 276.

title: Colon Wins 5,000Meter Run In Record 15:43 Clocking
description: Tony Colon, unattached, from New York, won a 5,000 meter race for teenagers, spon sored by the Roadrunners Club of New York, at Van Cortlandt Park yesterday in a record time of 15 minutes 43 seconds.

title: 40 KILLED IN SPAIN IN RAILWAY CRASH
description: PLENCIA, Spain, Aug. 9 (AP) A train crowded with people returning from the beach crashed headon into an empty train late today, killing at least 40 persons and injuring 100.

title: Major Bills in Congress
description: Bank Holding CompaniesLimiting the nonbanking activities that onebank holding companies may engage in (HR 6778)

title: CRYOGENIC SHIPS AID DISTANT PORTS
description: A handsome profit is avail able to small ships hauling such oldfashioned commodities as tallow, palm oil and molas seseven in these days of gi gantic container liners.

title: OVERNIGHT CRUISE TO THUNDERHEAD
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Aug. 9Paul Hoffman's Thun derhead from the Larchmont Yacht Club was the first of three finishers in Manhasset [Bay Yacht Club's 105mile Falk Iner Island cruising race and first in overall standing in a race plagued by light winds.

title: Orthodox Church Canonizes Saint in Alaska
description: KODIAK, Alaska, Aug. 9 In colorful ceremonies pungent with incense and tradition, the first American saint in an Or thodox church was canonized here this weekend.

title: CARLING GOLF WON BY JANE BLALOCK
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 9 (UPI) Jane Blalock, a 24yearold blonde from Portsmouth, N. H., who was the 1969 rookie of the year in the Ladies Professional Golf Association capitalized on a holeinone today to win the Lady Carling open for her first tour victory.

title: AARON, NICKLAUS, CRAMPTON AT 278
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 9Frank Beard was somewhat apologetic as he won the American Golf Classic today. I won't say I'm ashamed but I didn't play that well, he said. My putter pick ed me up. I never dreamed I could shoot a 71 [one over par] and win by two strokes.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Party Bossism Issue

title: CAMBODIAN DRIVE HURT U.S. PRESTIGE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9An official opinion poll commis sioned by the United States Information Agency in Europe and Asia disclosed that confi dence in the United States declined significantly overseas after the United States sent troops into Cambodia.

title: FLYNN TAKES LEAD IN TITLE SAILING
description: SEA CLIFF, L.I., Aug. 9 Mike Flynn of the Niantic, Conn., fleet, second last year in the Atlantic Coast Star Class championship, moved into the lead after two races today on Hempstead Harbor. Flynn gained a first and third place for 34 points.

title: Police See All of Central Park's Faces
description: Without sirens, the police cars wove carefully among the bicyclists along the 72d Street. Transverse. At the Mall, the, cars stopped sud denly. As policemen rushed into a sundappled glade, other policemen arrived on scooters.

title: BEATTIE'S LUDERS16 EASTOFRYE VICTOR
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 9 Francis P. Beattie's Luders16 Class sloop, Galure; William E. Hegarty's and Richard B. Nye's Soling, Nebulous, and John E. Muhfeld's Quincy Adams 7, Ajax, won slow 6.4mile races today when half of the 60 starters in the Rocky Point Club's regatta failed to finish because a light easterly breeze died.

title: Play by Father Berrigan On DraftFile Case Bows
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 9 It is not every theater di rector who worries that his phone is being tapped by the Federal Bureau of Investiga tion. But then it is not every director who puts on plays written by fugitives from justice.

title: Dard of Thanks
description: ALTERMrs. MBO Alter, Wisnes to express her deep appreciation and thanks to all her friends for their many kindnesses and the beautiful tributes to her beloved hus band the late Bob Alter.

title: Egyptian Soldiers Maintain Vigilance In Town by Canal
description: SUEZ, United Arab Republic, Aug. 9Egyptian troops in this warshattered town were vigi lant and wary, today as the ceasefire with Israeli forces a few hundred yards away neared the end of its second day. No shooting incidents Were re ported.

title: Indian Rightist Leader Slain
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 9 (AP) Basant Singh, leader of the rightist Swatantra party in the Punjab state legislatilre, was shot fatally yesterday at his village farm near Patiala, 150 miles north of New Delhi, the police said. They said Mr. Singh had been shot three times in the head.

title: Chess:
Italy's New Premier
description: ROME, Aug. 9At 11:30 one night last week, when most Romans were finishing their afterdinner coffee and passing the time until it got cool enough to sleep, a well dressed man walked unhur riedly through the crowds in Piazza Navona to a small res taurant where he sat down with three others Except for the fact that the three men rose to greet him and that the waiters, slow witl other customers, quickly brought him a frugal meal, no one would have guessed that the diner was Italy's new Premier, Emilio Colombo.

title: Radio
description: Noon12:55 P.M., WNYCFM: Municipal Symphony. Festivo, Sibelius; Violin Concerto in A, Goldmark; Redemption, Franck.

title: Lawyers Being Enlisted to Spur Integration of Southern Schools,
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 9A law yers civil rights group is or ganizing a team of up to 100 volunteers to go to the South this fall to combat inschool segregation of black children within newly integrated school systems.

title: In Memoriam
description: FURGATCHSolomon H. In ever loving memory of our beloved darling father and grandfather.

title: Durbin of Missouri Takes World SkeetShooting Title
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Aug. 9 John Durbin., a 39yearold manufacturer's agent from Kirkwood, Mo., broke 865 straight targets to take the world 12gauge skeetshooting championship today.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Smoke From Train Fire Forces Evacuation of Biltmore's Lobby
description: A fire in a diesel electric locomotive sent thick clouds of smoke into Grand Central Ter minal yesterday forcing the evacuation of 20 people from the lobby of the Biltmore Hotel, which is directly above part of the terminal.

title: 26 Hours of Tension: 4,000 Scouts and a Plague Scare in a New Mexico Camp
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Aug. 9For 26 hours this weekend, Boy Scouts and their parents in all parts of the country knew that a 12yearold boy had died of what New Mexico health officials called a communi cable disease.

title: Moscow Hails CeaseFire as First Step
description: MOSCOW, Aug 9The So viet Union said today that the temporary ceasefire between Israel and the United Arab Re public was an important first step toward a lasting Middle Eastern settlement.

title: Defense and Rookies Share the Glory in Exhibitions
description: Nearly half a million spec tators  twice as many as baseball drewproved they were ready for the pro foot ball season by turning out for the first 10 preseason games on Saturday. The rookies and the defense also proved they were ready to play.

title: Abducted U.S. Aide Is Feared Killed By Uruguay Rebels
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 9A radio station re ceived an anonymous tele phone call this afternoon an nouncing that Dan A. Mitri one, chief United States po lice adviser to Uruguay, had been executed by guerrillas.

title: Five Die as Cars Lock Wheels And Ram Into Fans in Sweden
description: KARLSKOGA, Sweden, Aug. 9 (AP)Five spectators were killed and about 25 others in jured today when two cars plowed into the crowd at the start of a sports car race.

title: Anita Colby Is Engaged To Wed Palen Flagler
description: Miss Anita Catherine Counihan, better known as Anita Colby, the model turned actress turned business exec utive turned beauty expert and author, plans to be mar ried next month to Palen Flagler, a J. P. Stevens & Co. vice president she met at a business lunch last Novem ber.

title: Advertising: Socially Renovative Thrust
description: The man who set up his own agency a couple of months ago and decided to limit accounts to socially renovative products and pub lic issues got to talking yes terday about the role of such advertising and its relation ship to the agency world.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
BANK CLOSING GOES TO A JURY TODAY
description: EATONTOWN, N. J. Aug. 10 Frederick B. Lacey, the Unit ed States Attorney for New Jersey, said today that he would begin presenting evi dence to a grand jury tomor row in the case of the Eaton town. National Bank, which was closed Saturday.

title: August Oil Quotas Increased by Texas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Aug. 10 The pleas of oilpurchasing companies for more oil were heeded today when the Texas Railroad Commission increased August production by 88,750 barrels a day, lifting the allowed flows of wells to 70 per cent of their production capabilities.

title: Stock Exchange Checking on Eatontown Accounts
description: The New York Stock Ex change said yesterday that it was making a routine check of the possibility that some of its members might be in fi nancial trouble as a result of the insolvency of the Eaton town National Bank.

title: Landlords Assail Plans to Spur Housing in City
description: Two legislative proposals de signed to stimulate apartment house construction were de nounced as wasteful by land lords yesterday but praised as crucial by the city's housing chief, who pleaded for early passage.

title: Observer: Shakespeare, Rain Water and Man's Timidity
description: LONDON, Aug. 10At 10 P.M. in the Aldwych Theater the Royal Shakespeare Com pany is moving triumphantly into the final thirty minutes of its performance of Twelfth Night. Outside there is a thun derstorm worthy of Miami Beach on a summer afternoon. Heartstopping claps of thun der rend the entire Thames Val ley; rain hammers on the thea ter roof, high, high up above the front orchestra seats.

title: BOUTON RETIRES FROM BASEBALL
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 10 (AP) Jim Bouton, the author of Ball Four, the controversial base ball book, retired as a player today, saying he had lost his knuckleball pitch and didn't want to drag his family through the minor league life.

title: BIG BOARD PRICES AND VOLUME DROP
description: Stock prices drooped and volume dawdled yesterday in Wall Street as August, 1970, produced another of its spe cialtiesa soggy session.

title: Pierre Salinger Named To Post at Gramco, Ltd.
description: Pierre Salinger has been named deputy chairman of the board of directors of Gramco U.K., Ltd., with its headquart ers in London.

title: Investigative Group Hired By U.S. Trotting Association
description: The United States Trotting Association, the administrative body of harness racing in the United States, announced yes terday that it had contracted for the investigative services of Harness Tracks Security, an autonomus policing group that currently services 29 harness racing organizations.

title: Funds Trading Pattern Studied
description: Institutional investorspar ticularly mutual fundstended to make the shares of smaller, relatively spectaculative com panies more volatile during the last decade but in general did little to improve the efficiency of the stock market in allocat ing capital to areas of the econ omy that need it most, a major academic analysis concluded yesterday.

title: Why 7th Avenue Loves Galanos
description: When the Seventh Avenue boys are whooping it up at the Bar Anglaise in Paris or the Hilton pool in Rome dur ing the fashion showings, one of them is likely to brag, If we had a couple of our guys over here, like Donald Brooks or Geoffrey Beene, we'd really show them.

title: A's Triumph Over Twins, 73; Monday's 4 Hits Pace Attack
