Pres ident Mobutu, who is on a 10day tour of the United States, said that his meeting with Mr. Sarnoff was one of a series with American business men whom he hoped to interest in the development of his country.

title: $5MILLION FRAUD IS LAID TO BANKER
Screen: Search for Self Among Peers:Adolescents in 'Out of It' Sift Verities on L.I.
description: Paul Williams's "Out of It" opened yesterday at the Festival Theater, but it was made in 1967, according to the distributor, and it looks and feels just a bit oldersay 1963even allowing for South Shore cultural lag.A sort of teenage rites of passage in Bellmore, L. I., "Out of It" concerns one summer's misadventures among a group of kids who go to the beach, suffer football practice, neck and pet (the mere thought of "not going all the way" may secretly thrill the most determined overage immoralist), drive into the city at night, and hang around with a young man named Paul (Barry Gordon), mostly because he has the keys to his mother's car.Paul is a little awkward, physically inept, unpredictable, gauche, moody, deep (his companions keep asking one another: "Do you think Paul's deep?) and self-effacing. He reads Camus on the beach, but allows that "I'm really very ignorantlike Socrates." And like Socrates, perhaps; like many of us, his life may be seen as a searchfor an understanding soulmate (preferably 36-C) who Really Thinks About Things.The girl in question, an intellectual cheerleader named Christine (Lada Edmund Jr.), happens to belong to the high school football bully (Jon Voight; his first film), whose reactions precipitate the movie's climax and Paul's locker-room victory. Ultimately another girl (Gretchen Corbett) will understand Paul ("You're not deep; you're just horny"), but the taste of triumph remains."Out of It" has received some remarkable advance reviews, and it is easy to see how a movie critic, possibly trembling on the edge of modern maturity, might appreciatively long for the anxieties and frustrations of a simpler time. Indeed, the notion of a movie attuned to the rhythm of the station breaks on WMCA is appealing, and "Out of It" is very long on appeal, but short on achievement.Filmed in a style that might best be described as master's thesis modest, "Out of It" turns to ironic understatement as an all-purpose substitute for a controlling point of view. Too flat, too scattered, really, too dependent on the kind of sympathy a lot of people will give it, "Out of It" does pretty well as a young man's first feature (Williams, who has since made "The Revolutionary," was 23 years old when he directed it) but not well enough for its material, its glamorous locale, or its excellent cast.Both Jon Voight and Barry Gordon create the manner and matter of their time and placeto continue in yet another setting the endless opposition between tall, blond and muscular and short, dark and not muscular. Miss Corbett succeeds as the very type of the wise and warm girl next door.But Miss Edmund (or, Miss Edmund Jr.) succeeds as something else, and duty requires me to say that she is fantastically, overwhelmingly, heartbreakingly sexy. From the perfect curve of her well-tanned calves to the tips of her false eyelashes, she exemplifies what everyone must want the deep-thinking adolescent to be.And in the vigor of her stunning profile she is sufficient justification for the invention of the moving picture, for both parts of "War and Peace," for the screen career of Stanley Kramer, for the Film Industry in Crisis.

title: The Henpecked House

For 47 years that body regularly rejected out of hand all proposals for a women's rights amendment to the Constitution. Now it approves, without committee hearings and after only an hour's debate, a constitu tional change of almost mischievous ambiguity.

title: 'Barbara' Puts Emphasis on Sex
description: Toward the end of "Barbara," after a clutch of young hippies have spent the summer wallowing in sexual variations, one young man announces that next autumn he just might go out and get a job. A pall settles over the picture. It just isn't done.Just about everything else is attempted, at least sexually, in the picture that opened yesterday at the downtown Garrick Theater. Most of it is given over to copulation, with the camera explicitly trailing the young people as they stalk one another over a corner of a sand-dune resort(which turns out to be Fire Island).Occasionally they are heard railing against the Establishment, when the sound track clears up. They wear clothes about half the timeonce, rather astonishingly, when they elect to dip in the waves. In another sequence, gravely labeled "Tribute  Godard," they settle down for a picnic, pass around a long-stemmed pipe and scrape rice from bowls while discussing "the exploration of human behavior." If the esteemed French filmmaker ever sees this picture and digs that rice, he'll probably go to work for the Disney organization.The theme music of the picture, independently produced and presented by Druidstone-Hottentot Productions, is "Just a Little Bit of Love." That's "what the world needs," it says here. O.K. But where is it?Amid the insatiable twitching and writhing, there appears, as if by accident, a tastefully clipped little vignette involving one of the group's lustier males and an older housewife. For one fleeting, final second, it's almost moving.Josef Bush adapted the film from a novel by Frank Newman. Walter Burns directed. Among the young players are Jack Rader, Nancy Boyle, Robert McLane and a girl named Barbara who plays Barbara. The name to remember in the cast roster, that of the chunkiest female gymnast, is, so help us, Tequila Mockingbird.

title: BOY, 15, SHOT DEAD BY INTENDED VICTIM

I., Aug. 11 Mrs. Mimi Neff of the Seawan hakaCorinthian Yacht Club captured both races today to take the lead in the area semi finals of the North American women's sailing championship, with 8 Points. Mrs. Neff gained the semifinals by win ning the Yacht Racing Associa tion of Long Island Sound title.

title: Dee Turns Back Lettmann In Metropolitan Boys Golf
description: MANHASSET, L.1., Aug. 11 James Dee, Ridgewood Country Club, who won from Mark Lettman, Huntington Country Club, 4 and 3, will meet Tod Pike, Rye Golf Club, in one semifinal of the Metropolitan Golf Association boys cham pionship tomorrow at the Deep dale Golf Club course. Michael Occi, Orange Avenue Junior High School, will meet Gary Carlson, Knoll Golf Club, in the other semifinal.

title: Police and Negroes Clash

One 21yearold onlooker was acciden tally wounded by a police bullet and five other persons were injured, the police said. A com munity recreation center was firebombed. Ten persons were arrested.

title: Short Step Ahead in Greece...
description: Greece's military regime announces that it will release 500 political prisoners, held since the 1967 coup. It will also restore passports to 500 political leaders, forbidden until now to leave the country. These moves are commendable, even if there was never a valid reason to detain. or restrict many OF these individuals in the first place.

The wedding will take place in St. Mary's Chapel at the Episcopal Ca thedral of SS. Peter and Paul in Washineton.

Bud Moore's Mustang team of Parnelli Jones and George Foll mer got the sea son off to a smashing start by winning the first four races. Roger Penske's Sunoco Javelin team of Mark Donohue and Peter Revson has won three of the last four.

description: SAN DIEGO, Calif., Aug. 11 A remotely controlled ocean floor crawler has completed en gineering tests off the coast here and will begin this fall exploring the geology of nearby undersea canyons.

title: MICHAEL J. LACOPO
description: Michael J. Lacopo, an assist ant vice president of the Ameri can Electric Power System, died yesterday at the Columbia Pres byterian Medical Center. He was 61 years old and lived in Amherst, Mass.

title: Metropolitan's Expansion Into the Park Is Assailed
description: Strong opposition was voiced yesterday before the Landmarks Preservation Com mission over the Metropolitan Museum of Art's proposed expansion into Central Park.

title: ULSTER CITY TENSE ON EVE OF PROTEST
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Aug. 11The British Army moved reinforcements into Ulster's second city to right and prepared to seal it off all day tomorrow, when mili tant Protestants are scheduled to demonstrate.

title: County Is Split Over Permits To Squatters on Mitchel Field
description: MINEOLA, L. T., Aug. 11  Fourteen poor families that moved into former military barracks buildings at Mitchel Field will get Nassau County permits this week to legalize their action, at least in the eyes of the county's Democratic administration.

title: Abortion Law Upheld
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 11 (UPI)  A Federal court has up held Louisiana's centuryold abortion law. The court said it could rule only on the law's constitutionality, not on its moral or philosophical sound ness. The Louisiana law per mits abortion only when two doctors agree that continued pregnancy would cause the mother's death.

title: TALKS TO RESUME IN RAILS DISPUTE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 The United Transportation Union and the National Rail way Labor Conference agreed today to resume negotiations Aug. 25 in their long dispute over the use of firemen in diesel locomotives.

title: CHAPIN FORECASTS AUTO SALES GAINS
description: FONTANA, Wis., Aug. 11 Roy D. Chapin Jr., the chairman of the American Motors Corpo ration, predicted tonight that the rising demand for small cars would enable the automo bile industry to sell half a mil lion more cars in 1971 and bring it out of its present slump.

title: FISCHER GAINS TITLE IN ARGENTINE CHESS
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 11 Bobby Fischer, the 28yearold former United States champion, won his seventh consecutive in ternational chess tournament last night by clinching first place in the Buenos Aires inter national, with three rounds to go

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (UPI)Following is the text of President Nixon's statemnt to the House to Cay an nouncing that he was vetoing the education and inde pendent offices appropriation bills:

title: ROSE GAINS LEAD IN RIFLE SHOOTING
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 11 (AP)David Rose 3d, an Army Reserve captain from Wood bury, L. I., did not lose a point today and moved into the lead in the race for the national smallbore rifle prone cham pionship with a threeday score of 4,796 points of a possible 4,800.

title: JERSEY SETS INQUIRY ON MIGRANTS CAMPS
description: TRENTON, Aug. 11 (AP) State Labor Commissioner Charles Serraino ordered an in vestigation today into charges by Federal antipoverty offi cials that squalid conditions still Prevailed in migrant labor camps of South Jersey.

title: STOCKS OFF AGAIN IN LIGHT TRADING
description: A 1970 low for I.B.M., down ward drifting prices, slow vol ume, a lack of bids for stock by institutions. That was the story of the New York Stock Exchange yesterday.

title: Quake in West Virginia
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Aug. 11 (AP)Scientists at Virginia Polytechnic Institute reported today that a slight earth tremor was recorded at 2:15 A.M. 5 miles northwest of Charleston, W. Va. 4

title: Goodyear Recalls Tireo
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 11 (AP) The Goodyear Tire and Rob ber Company is recalling 1,523 travel trailer tires that officials said were produced with the wrong ply stock. The recall in volves the 7.0015 blackwall, nylon tubeless Travel Trailer HiMiler tire, load range D, with serial number beginning with WT5 and EU5.

title: ROCKEFELLER COOL TO NIXON'S HELP
description: OSAGE BEACH, Mo., Aug. 11 Governor Rockefeller said to day that he would not invite President Nixon or Vice Presi dent Agnew to New York State to help him in his reelection campaign this fall.

title: Chavez Goes on Fast And Assails Injunction
description: SALINAS, Calif., Aug. 11 (UPI)Cesar Chavez, leader of the California farm work ers union, began a hunger strike today and sought his own arrest in a dispute with the teamsters union and Sa linas Valley growers.

title: NewIssue Volume Rises As Bond Prices Advance
description: The bond market bulldozed its way into a huge volume of new financing yesterday, and it succeeded in moving an im pressively large amount of it.

title: Citation Is Dead at 25; Won Triple Crown in 48
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Aug. 11 (AP)Citation, the last horse to win racing's Triple Crown the Kentucky Derby, Preak ness and Belmont Stakes died Saturday at Calumet Farm at the age of 25.

title: Scholar Sees U.S. At a Turning Point
description: The world has begun to enterthe United States has already been thrust into the transition state between two ages.

title: Designing Venture For City's Greeter
description: Hmmmmm, how about Bud's Duds? mused the press agent, thinking up catchy phrases for his client's new line of men's wear. Or maybe, From Knicks to Knits.

title: Stokes, ExPro Star, Left $91,431 to St. Francis, Pa.
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 11 (UPI) Maurice Stokes, former pro fessional basketball star who died in April after having been crippled since 1958 by a brain disease, left $91,431 of his $194,862 estate to St. Francis College in Loretto, Pa.

title: Laos Reported Forgoing Drive on Reds This Year
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 8 ??ualified Laotian and American sources assert that Government troops will mount no major of fensive during this rainy sea son, contrary to the usual pat tern of the war.

title: United Nations: A Time to Fight, a Time to Talk
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 11The soldiers have been dominating world events for the last few years, but the diplomats are stirring again. They are always in the awk ward position of having to an ticipate the future, to foresee the coming age, but they are beginning to think they can at least talk about the world be yond the present wars.

title: Mrs. Nixon to Visit Camps
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (AP) Mrs. Richard M. Nixon will fly by helicopter to two recre ation camps Thursday to see how military volunteers are aiding poor children from their nearby communities. The camps are at Bainbridge, Md., and Scotland, Md.

title: Market Place
description: Preferred stocks seldom land on the lists of most active issues, so Kinney Na tional Services, Inc., scored an achievement of sorts yes terday when two of its pre ferred stocks led the active lists on bola the New York Stock Exchange and Ameri can Stock Exchange.

title: Two in Senate Seek Curbs on U.S. Aid Asked by Lockheed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (AP) Two Senators, fearing a rash of pleas for Federal funds to bail out cashstricken Government contractors, sought today to: draw legal boundaries around, the Lockheed Corporation's plea: for $200million in interim fi nancing to complete the C5 supertransport program.

title: Fairs Fair Scores by Six Lengths in Debut at Saratoga and Returns $23.40
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 11A sparkling debut by Fairs Fair,. a full sister to the redoubtable Arts and Letters, thrilled her owner, Paul Mellon, and other racegoers in the crowd of 5,602 at Saratoga to day. Overcoming an awkward start hi a sixfurlong sprint that attracted a dozen maiden 2yearold fillies, Fairs Fair came out of the pack in the stretch to score by six lengths over the runnerun. Love Locked Out.

title: Julia Kahn Is Married to Martin Shubik
description: Miss Julia Kahn, daughter of Mrs. George E. Sands of New York and the late Elliott M. Kahn, was mar ried here yesterday after noon to Martin Shubik, a professor of economics of organization at Yale Univer sity. The Rev. Dr. Ronald Sobel of Temple EmanuEl performed the ceremony at the Plaza.

title: Corn Crop Lower In a New Estimate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 (AP) The Agriculture Department estimated today that this year's corn crop would be 4,692,864, 000 bushels, a 3 per cent in crease over last year's 4,577, 864,000 bushels but a 3 per cent decline from its July fore cast. The Crop Reporting Board estimated the corn yield at 80.9 bushels an acre, compared with the record yield of 83.9 bushels an acre last year.

title: Baseball Transactions
description: LOS ANGELESPurchased Charles Hough, righthanded pitcher, from Spokane of the Pacific Coast League. Optioned Jose Pena, pitcher, to Spokane.

title: Psychologist Disputes Report on Smut
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11A psychologist described today as rigged the findings of a Presi dential panel investigating the relationship of pornography to antisocial behavior.

description: SARATOGA, SPRINGS, N. Y., Telegraph, scratch sheets, programsWe got cigars, top, bellowed the paunchy man hawking racing sheets in front of Baldy's news store in a voice an octave deeper than a growl.

title: MINTURN des. VERDI
description: SYOSSET, L. I., Aug. 11 Minturn deSuzzara Verdi, a re tired lawyer, died yesterday in Huntington Hospital of a heart attack. He would have been 83 years old tomorrow.

title: Pnompenh Silent on Seizure Of Its Embassy in Prague
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 11 (Reuters)The Cambodian Government today maintained silence on the seizure of its embassy in Prague by pro Sihanouk elements.

description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 11 (Reuters) The bodies of most of the 99 persons killed Sunday when a Peruvian airliner crashed near Cuzco were flown to Lima to day.

title: Jarring Seeks Early Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 11Ambassador Jarring was understood today to have urged Israel, the United Arab Republic and Jordan to provide speedy replies to his inquiries about arrangements for the start of ArabIsraeli talks on a peace settlement.

title: Hearnes to Head Conference
description: LAKE OF THE OZARKS, Mo., Aug. 11 (UPI)Demo cratic Governors voted Tues day to nominate Gov. Warren E. Hearnes of Missouri to serve as chairman of the National Governors Conference for the next year. The new chairman will be elected at tomorrow's closing business session of the 1970 annual meeting, The chairmanship rotates to a Dem ocrat this year to succeed Gov. John A. Love of Colorado, a Rentrblican.

description: Morning

title: Nebraska Judge Overrules New Law on SelfDefense
description: OMAHA, Aug. 11  A district court judge, ruling in case involving a contractor who is accused of shooting at an off duty policeman, held today that Nebraska's new selfdefense act was unconstitutional.

title: News Summary and Index
description: After his flight was delayed for two hours because of a bomb threat, Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany arrived in Moscow yesterday to sign a nonaggression and co operation treaty between his country and the Soviet Union. Mr. Brandt was greeted at the airport by Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin, who will sign the treaty for the Soviet Union. [Page 1, Column 4; Text, P. 2.]

title: Critic of Slow Justice
description: The name of Judge Irving R. Kaufman, one of the breakfast speakers yesterday at the annual convention of the American Bar Association in St. Louis, was a headline if not a household word in April, 1951, when he imposed the first peacetime death sen tences for espionage in United States his tory, on Ethel and Julius Rosen berg. Judge Kauf man, who is now 60 years old, spoke yesterday about the problems of judicial adminis tration. Magellan circum navigated the world in three years in a wooden boat, he said. It still takes that long to get a Federal civil jury trial in some metropolitan districts.

title: Pollution Closes Beach
description: LACONIA, N. H., Aug. 11 (AP)One of New Hampshire's bestknown summer resort swimming spots, Weirs Beach on Lake Winnipesaukee, has been ordered closed because of pollution.

title: Security Men Highly Visible at Talks
description: OSAGE BEACH, Mo., Aug. 11 One thing is indisputable: This is the most secure Gover nors conference ever.

title: MILTON S. COE
description: CALDWELL, N. J., Aug. 11 Milton S. Coe, formerly second vice president of the Chase Manhattan Bank, died yester day in Mountainside Hospital, Montclair. His age was 68 and his home was at 512 Bloomfield Avenue.

title: GOLDBERG TO CAMP IN UPSTATE FOREST
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., Aug. 11 Arthur J. Goldberg, the so phisticated urban lawyer, hiked four miles into the Adirondack Mountains near here this eve ning to find out if there's any thing left to the wilderness in New York State.

title: John Seidel Weds Andrea Mantell
description: QUIDNET, Mass., Aug. 11 Miss Andrea Mantell, daugh ter of Dr. and Mrs. Murray Mantell of Miami, was mar ried this afternoon to John Frederick Seidel, son of Dr. and Mrs. Reginald F. Seidel of Englewood, N..1. Charles Clark Coffin, Clerk of the Town of Nantucket, per formed the ceremony at the Seidels summer home here.

title: PROFIT IS REPORTED BY HALSEY, STUART
description: Halsey, Stuart & Co., Inc., a major investment banking con cern, reported yesterday that its earnings before taxes were $752,894 in the six months ended June 30. A year earlier it had a $164,481 loss.

title: Wrong Cure for Inflation
description: President Nixon has vetoed two big Federal appro priation bills for education, housing and other domes tic functions on the ground that they exceeded his budget request by nearly a billion dollars. Mr. Nixon maintained that if he were to sign the bills, he would be saying yes to a higher cost of living, higher interest rates and higher taxes.

title: B52's Help South Vietnamese Battle Foe at a Base Near Hue
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 11 (AP)  South Vietnamese troops supported by United States planes, battled today to repulse enemy soldiers threat ening an artillery and patrol camp near Laos.

title: 6 SEIZED IN SUFFOLK IN TEENAGER'S RAPE
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 11 (UPI)  Six Suffolk County youths were arrested today on charges of raping a Manhattan teenager outside Agwam Park here last night.

title: Joe Page in Cardiac Unit
description: Joe Page, baseball's premier reliefpitcher with the New York Yankees in the late nine teenforties, was in serious con dition in the cardiac unit of Lenox Hill hospital after suffer ing a heart attack last Friday.

title: Article 7  No Title

description: CHICAGO, Aug. 12 (AP) Joe Becker, 58yearold pitch ing coach for the Chicago Cubs, collapsed before the game with the San Francisco Giants today and was taken to Wesley Me morial Hospital, where prelim inary reports were that he had suffered a heart seizure.

title: CHAVEZ, TEAMSTERS IN ACCORD ON COAST
description: SALINAS, Calif., Aug. 12 (UPI)Cesar Chavez, leader of a union of farm workers, signed an accord today with the Inter national Brotherhood of Team sters, ending a jurisdictional dispute over which union would represent the nation's agricul tural workers.

title: British Soldiers Clash With Religious Extremists in Londonderry
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, Aug. 12  Protestant and Roman Catholic extremists fought with British soldiers in scattered clashes, but the army succeeded in staving off a repe tition of the wild riots that ex ploded here a year ago today.

title: American Motors Stresses Small Cars
description: BURLINGTON, Wis., Aug. 12American Motors empha sized small, sporty cars at the unveiling of its 1971 models today. They will be in dealers showrooms on Oct 6.

title: $39MILLION LOAN BLOCKED BY CITY
description: A $39million loan by the New York City Employes Re tirement Fund to the builder of the new. Department of Trans portation headquarters in Wash ington has been held up indefi nitely because the official who authorized it is now under in dictment.

title: OUTPOST NEAR HUE IS ATTACKED BY FOE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 12 (AP)Enemy troops attacked a South Vietnamese company manning an outpost 1,000 yards from a fire base today and hurled a teargas shell into the embattled camp 27 miles west of Hue. The at tack was repulsed.

title: LAWYERS TO MAKE A SPEEDY APPEAL
description: Curt Flood's legal challenge to major league baseball's re serve clause met an expected firstinning setback yesterday when Federal Judge Irving Ben Cooper ruled against his suit.

title: Thomas J. Meskill
description: Representative Thomas J. Meskill, who won yesterday's primary election to become the Republican candidate for Governor of Connecticut, has represented the state's Sixth Congressional District since 1966, when he emerged from the offyear elections to be come the party's major office holder in the state.

title: Philippine Tribes Struggle to Survive
description: MANILA  Some 60 tribal groups in the Philippines, many of them still living on prehis toric cultural levels, are waging a stark struggle for survival.

title: IMASUPER SCORES AT ATLANTIC CITY
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug, 12 (AP)Taking command at the halfmile pole under Mike Hole, Brookfield Farm's Imasuper charged to a fivelength tri umph in today's Decathlon Purse at six furlongs.

description: Ann Laughlin, Riverton, N.J., defeated Louise Bruce, La Mesa, Calif., 2 and 1; Elizabeth Pooley, Gainesville, Fla. defeated Paula Eger, Kirkwood, Mo., and 1; Laura Baugh, Long Beach, Calif., defeated Susan Lynn, River Vale, N.J., 5 and 3; Paula Wagasky, Odgenton, Md., defeated Dana Griswold, Lake Oswego, Ore., 6 and 5; Hollis Stacy, Savannah, Ga., defeated Molly Anderson, Morro Bay, Calif., 19 holes.

title: Defense Begins Case in Panther Trial
description: NEW HAVGN, Aug. 12 Judge Harold M. Mulvey denied today defense motions for the dismissal of the four charges on which Lonnie McLucas, a Black Panther, has been on trial here for nearly two months.

description: FORT MCPHERSON, Ga., Aug. 12 (AP)A military judge rejected today constitutional challenges to a military trial for Sgt. Esequiel Torres, one of 12 soldiers charged with slay ing South Vietnamese civilians at Songmy in 1968.

title: A Kidnapped Coed Rescued in Florida; Suspect Is Seized
description: OCHOPEE, Fla., Aug. 12 (AP) Policemen searching the Ev erglades tonight rescued a coed kidnapped last night from a lover's lane and captured a man suspected of abducting her.

title: Mary McBride Breaks Hip
description: WEST SHOKAN, N. Y., Aug. 12 (AP)Mary Margaret Mc Bride fell in her home today and broke her hip. The yearold radio personality was taken to Benedictine Hospital in Kingston for surgery.

title: Advertising: No. 1 and 2 Are Battling Again
description: The battle between No. 1 and No. 2 is on again, only this time they're squabbling mostly with telegrams.

title: Miss Budke Upsets Miss Hager In National Junior Girls Golf
description: RYE, N. Y., Aug. 12Upsets marked the first two rounds of the 22d annual United States Golf Association's junior girls championship today.

description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Aug. 12Norman I. Stone of Great Neck and Mrs. Harvey Poliakoff of Rockville Centre have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Nancy Ellen Stone, to Doug las Hugh Yoblon. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Marvin M. Yoblon of Searington.

title: FIGHTING IN COURT MARS CHICAGO TRIAL
description: CHICAGO, Aug, 12 (AP) The police and court officials battled defendants and specta tors today at the start of the trial of 11 University of Illinois students charged with causing a campus disturbance last May.

title: OneWay Tolls Confusing Some Drivers
description: Oneway toll collections went into effect yesterday on 12 Hudson River and New York New Jersey bridges and tun nels, causing moments of anger and confusion among car and truck drivers that led to delays of up to an hour during the morning rush.

title: An Airline Pays $25,000 To Man in Bomb Threat
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 12 (UPI) Western Airlines officials dis closed today that they paid $25,000 in cash to a man who had told them that he had put a bomb on an airliner and had set it to go off when the plane descended to 10.000 feet.

title: 19 PLAYERS LEFT IN U.S. CHESS OPEN
description: BOSTON, Aug. 12By a proc ess of elimination, 19 players remain who have swept through the first three games victorious ly in the 71st annual United States Open Championship at the Parker House here.

title: Young Harada Stops Foe
description: TOKYO, Aug. 12 (AP) Ushiwakamaru Harada, young er brother of the former fly weight and bantamweight champion, Fighting Harada, knocked out the Japanese featherweight champion, Ku washi Shimizu, in the ninth round of a nontitle fight to night. Harada weighed 123% Pounds to Shimizu's 125.

title: Witness Says She Stole $5,000 Before Joining Manson Family
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 12 Linda Kasabian, the chief state witness in the murder trial of Charles M. Manson, admitted today that she had stolen about $5,000 from a friend of her husband the day before she joined Manson's hippie family.

title: City Planners, by a Vote of 4 to 3, Approve Special 3d Ave. Zoning
description: Over protests against sell ing zoning and deforming the city physically and so cially, the City Planning Com mission yesterday approved a highdensity special zone for sa stretch of Third Avenue by a rare split vote of 4 to 3.

title: OPPOSITION IN BONN ASSAILS SOVIET PACT
description: BONN, Aug. 12 (AP)The SovietWest German treaty was assailed today by a leader Df the opposition Christian Democrats as the advance :anopener of a Pandora's box Df mischief.

title: Nicklaus Cards 64 in P.G.A. TuneUp
description: TULSA, Okla., Aug. 12Jack Nicklaus clicked off a 64 today in his final tuneup for tomor row's start of the Professional Golfers Association champion ship. His sixunderpar burst over the Southern Hills Coun try Club course firmly estab lished him as the favorite in the tourney he last won in 1963.

title: Mrs. Meir Rebuffs Critics
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 12Pre mier GoIda Meir, facing Opposi tion demands that Israel with draw from , diplomatic efforts toward a peace settlement, in sisted today that Israeli nego tiators would concede nothing in advance but that they would not state preconditions for peace talks with the Arab states.

title: Lin in the Cellar
Sheepshead Bay Blackout
description: Consolidated Edison Company repairmen were repairing a transformer in the Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn early this morning after a fire caused scattered power interruptions. Power failures were reported in a ninesquareblock area.

description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Aug. 12 (AP)The chairman of the largest steel maker in the United States predicted today that world steel production would reach one billion net tons by 1980.

title: Roundup: Twins Getting To Be Everyone's Target
description: Suddenly, everyone seems to be picking on what had appeared to be the invincible Minnesota Twins and there may yet be a close race in the Western Division of the American League.

title: Panel Told Mississippi Negroes Are Prepared for SelfDefense
description: JACKSON, Miss., Aug. 12 A Negro physician told the President's Commission on Cam pus Unrest today that Missis sippi Negroes are no longer afraid and are prepared to defend themselves against po lice repression.

title: De la Renta Minis at Bonwit's? Horrors, No
description: Oscar de la Renta strolled into Bonwit Teller yesterday morning as the showing of his first blouse collection was under way and looked aghast. He didn't scream, because the designer, who is society's pet on both sides of the Atlantic, is much too well bred for that. But in quiet, wellmodu lated tones he said, They should show the blouses with skirtsthey look like mini dresses. The truth is, they did. The mannequins wore panty hose and sometimes boots, and they looked pretty snappy in their reptile print, flowered velvet or black jer sey tops, which were like little tunics, ending just be low the hips.

title: Article 1  No Title
4 Women Undergraduates Stage SitIn at Yale Club
description: Four Yale undergraduate women staged a sitin in a maleonly section of the Yale Club lobby yesterday, as 10 policemen and six bellhops looked on in mild amusement at the outnumbered band.

title: SOYBEANS PRICES CLIMB BY 7 CENTS
description: The latest Government soy beanproduction estimates ex cited some vigorous specula tive buying yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. Prices zoomed about 7 cents a bushel, an unusually sharp rise.

title: FREDRIC KURZWEIL, MUSIC EDUCATOR, 57
description: Dr. Fredric Kurzweil, a con ductor, pianist, composer and music educator for 30 years, died Tuesday of a heart at tack at his home, 22128 Hart land Avenue, Queens Village, Queens. He was 57 years old.

title: Good News for Feldman.
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 12 (AP)Sports King, owned and trained by a Chicago sports writer, Dave Feldman, won the 1 116 mile, $15,000 feature race by half, a length today at Liberty Bell race track, return ing $13.40 straight.

title: Grooming Champions Is a Task For Everyone in Howe Family
description: Showing dogs is a family project with the Richard Howes. The very name of the kennel at Westfield, N. J. Clarihois an acronym formed by the first letters of the names of the four chil drenCharles, Laurie, Ricky and Holly.The Howes have English setters. Laurie and Holly were the first sister combination with the breed since Marsha and Beth ny Hall a dozen years ago. Marsha, now Mrs. Robert Brown, did much to get the Howes on the dog show trail. News trail. News of Dogs

title: Parsons Resigns Banking Post
description: DETROIT, Aug. 12  The bankempire dreams of Donald H. Parsons, Detroit lawyerfin ancier, were shattered today when he tendered his resigna tion as chairman of the Bank of the Commonwealth here and indicated that he might sell his stock interests.

title: TOKYO; (In Japanese yen)
Brooklyn Girl Wounded By Shotgun From Car
description: A 15yearold girl was seri ously wounded last night by shotgun pellets fired from a passing automobile while she was sitting on a stoop in Brook lyn.

Both sides said they thought the treaty, would open the way to closer ties between West Ger many and the nations of Eastern Europe. [Page 1, Column 5; Text, P. 2.]

description: LONDON, Aug. 12So many American mothers have written tearfully saying, While you are in Europe, will you look up my son, the student (or my daughter, the studentess), and make sure that he (she) is not suffering, that it is impossible to answer each person individ ually. The following, therefore, is directed to all worried mothers, wherever you may be:

title: Bridge
Anaconda Unit Cuts Its Published Prices On Copper and Lead
description: The Anaconda American Brass Company, a subsidiary of the Anaconda Corporation, an nounced yesterday a downward revision in its published base prices for copper and lead.

title: DEFENSE RESTS CASE IN SLAYING OF COED
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 12 (UPI)The defense rested its case today without bringing) John Norman Collins to the stand to testify at his murder trial in the slaying of an 18yearold coed.

title: President Signs Bill Replacing Post Office With Independent Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 President Nixon signed today a bill that will replace the 181yearold Post Office De partment with an independ ent Government agency. The President drove five blocks from the White House to the department this morning to sign the measure before about 150 persons, including six former Postmasters Gen eral. Mr. Nixon noted the bi partisan nature of the audi ence before him. He thanked all who had worked for postal reform, including President Johnson, and he declared that the act would insure smooth er operation of the postal service, faster delivery, and better pay for postal em ployes. Calling the act and the occasion historic, Mr. Nixon said: We have ac complished something that very few thought could be accomplished even 18 months ago. This is the American. system working in a way that we all like to see it work,. where we put the country above the party and where we put service to the people above any other in terest. The ceremony was the culmination of a long bi partisan struggle that began with a suggestion from form er Postmaster General Law rence 0"Briennow chairman of the Democratic National Committee. The drive received momentum from the recom mendations of a special com mission appointed by Presi dent Johnson and headed by Fredrick Kappel, and it moved to a conclusion after the Nixon Administration and the leaders of the postal unions agreed, after a strike last winter to a compromise measure providing for reform and higher pay.

title: Rockefeller Refers JailS Crisis to City
description: Governor Rockefeller and Mayor Lindsay called upon each other yesterday to solve the crisis in the city's jails.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: Mr. White met with police officials from Boston, Newton and Brookline in his office to day before announcing his de cision on the Eagle Rock Fes tival.

title: A Prodigiously Compound Lovers and Other Strangers
STOCK FIRM AIMS AT CONSOLIDATION
description: Brand, Qrumet & Seigel, Inc., a brokerage house that has been losing money in recent months, is negotiating a con solidation with Thomson & Mc Kinnon, Auchincloss, Inc., a concern that has been acquit ing other houses aggressively during the bear market.

title: Jordan and Egypt Reported to Favor Talks in New York
description: UNITED NATIONS, N Y., Aug. 12  Both Jordan and the United Arab Republic have in formed Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring that they would prefer start ing substantive political dis cussions on a Middle Eastern settlement in New York at the ambassadorial level, diplomatic sources reported today.

title: New England Regatta Slated
description: LOWELL, Mass., Aug. 12 (AP)  Fifteen fowing crews from the United States, Aus tralia and West Germany will compete Sunday in the New England Rowing Association regatta on the Merrimack River.

title: Expert Links Hepatitis With Pollution
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 A strong circumstantial case that hepatitis,., the sometimes fatal liver disease, is one of the hidden costs of environmental pollution and could become more widespread was presented today to the Third International Congress on Food Science and Technology.

title: THIEU URGES THAIS TO HELP CAMBODIA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug, 12  President Nguyen Van Thieu said today that only South Vietnam and Thailand could send troops to help Cam bodia and that the time to do so was now.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Auto Industry's Aug. 110 Sales Down by 4% From Year Earlier
description: DETROIT, Aug. 12Newcar sales in early August fell 4 per cent from a year ago with dealers reporting sales of 148,577 Americantype cars against 155,439 a year ago. The industry's early August sales rate was the lowest for the period since 1963. There are close to 1.5 million of the old 1970 models in inventory, but the 1971 models will not be on sale until the middle of next month and there is the possibility of a strike in the auto industry, which also would help reduce inventories.

title: New Chief Is Chosen for Penn Central
description: William H. Moore, executive vice presidentoperations of the Southern Railway System, has been picked as presi dent and chief executive officer of the Penn Central Trans portation Company. The an nouncement of his selection was made in Philadelphia yes terday by the four trustees of the Penn Central, which went into reorganization under Fed eral bankruptcy laws on June 21.

title: Senate Panel Calls Travel Study Plan Device for Tourism
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 The Senate Commerce Commit tee, studying the stranding of, students in Europe last month, will refer to the Department of Justice evidence presented in hearings on travel study tours, Senator Vance Hartke, Demo crat of Indiana, said today.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Commission. President Nixon appointed a 14member commission to undertake a thorough study of the Fed eral statistical system. W. Allen Wallis, president of the University of Rochester, will be chairman of the commis sion. Activities. The Presipent signed the postal reform bill and the bill increasing the veterans disability compensa tion rate. Later, he extended greetings to the Cabinet Com mittee on Education and the Arkansas State Advisory Committee on Public Educa tion.

title: CINCINNATI HELD TO FOUR SAFETIES
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 12Gary Gentry, giving the New York Mets exactly the kind of strong pitching they had been hoping for, defeated the powerful Cin cinnati Reds, 21, tonight, hold ing them to four hits.

title: Rogers Hails Treaty, but Looks To Tangible Results in Berlin
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 Submerging its skepticism, about the Soviet Union's inten tions, the United States today extended its official blessing to the SovietWest German treaty.

title: Italian Cabinet Wins Vote Of Confidence in Chamber
description: ROME, Aug. 12 (AP)Pre mier Emilio Colombo's center left Government today won its first parliamentary testa vote of confidence in the Chamber of Deputies.

title: YIELDS RISE A BIT IN BOND MARKETS
description: The bond market, after mov ing rather confidently toward lower interest rates Tuesday, found the going a little tougher yesterday.

title: Mimi Spencer to Be the Bride Of Brice Eldridge, Engineer
description: BLOOMFIELD, Conn., Aug. 12 Mr. and Mrs. Edgar Burton Spencer of Doncaster Farm have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss MargaretLeigh Spencer, to Brice Eldridge, son of Mr. and Mrs. Brice A. Eldridge of Naples, Fla., formerly of Saddle River, N. J.

title: 2 Sides Charge Subway Negligence
description: Leaders of two transit groups involved in defending workers against charges of negligence contend that many of the charges are brought by the Transit Authority to mask equipment failures caused by maintenance neglect.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Occi Defeats Dee, 2 and 1, In Boys Final at Deepdale
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Aug. 12  Michael Occi, from Orange Avenue Junior High School in Cranford, N.J., defeated James Dee, Ridgewood Country Club, 2 and 1, to win the Metro politan Golf Association's boys championship at the 6,207yard par 70 Deepdale Club course today.

title: Hussein Demands Pullback
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 12 King Hussein of Jordan said today that despite the opposi tion of the Palestinian com mandos, a majority of his subjects would support a just and durable peace as defined by the United Nations Security Council resolution on the Mid dle East of Nov. 22, 1967.

title: Rep. Rivers Is Honored As Ton Defense Advocate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. l2 Military and industrial leaders got together here today to honor Representative L. Mendel Rivers, the South Carolina Democrat who is chairman of the House Armed Services Committee and one of the de fense establishment's foremost advocates.

title: State Suspends Union's Dues. Withholding Right
description: The New York State Public Employment Relations Board suspended yesterday the dues deduction privilege of four locals of the American Feder ation of State, County and Municipal Employes because of a strike in November, 1968, at four state mental hospitals.

title: City Urged to Raise Its Court Security To Bar Intrusions
description: A State Senator and a court officers association joined here yesterday in urging greater courtroom security to prevent a repetition of the slaying last Friday of a San Rafael, Calif., judge.

title: ALFRED J. MAYER
description: Alfred J. Mayer, an invest ment banker and a security analyst, died Tuesday of a heart attack at Southampton (L. I.) Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 1215 Fifth Avenue. His summer home was at Mon tauk Point, L. I.

title: Cordero Rides Winners in Both Divisions of Baruch Handicap at Saratoga
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 12Angel Cordero, the Puerto Rican riding star, took care of both ends of the Ber nard Baruch Handicap today in recordbreaking time. The 1 116mile stakes on the turf had drawn so many entries that it was conducted in two divisions.

title: Boston U. Raises Tuition
description: BOSTON, Aug. 12 (AP) Boston University announced today a yearly tuition increase of $340, bringing tuition for a fulltime student to $2,090. The increase will be effective in September, 1971.

title: Now It's Moscow's Move
description: After he had signed the treaty with the Soviet Union in the Kremlin yesterday, Willy Brandt said: This the end of anepoch but, it seems to me, a very good beginning. The West German Chancellor was justified in his modest claim. It was not the time or place for him to add the obvious: Whether that good start now leads to genuine dtente in Europe depends almost entirely on the Kremlin.

title: Strike by Communist Unions Adds to West Bengal Unrest
description: CALCUTTA, India, Aug. 12 The industrial complex at Durgapur in West Bengal was paralyzed today by a strike by 50,000 workers belonging to unions led by Communists.

title: Beaths
description: Ackerman, Sophie R.

title: BUILDUP BY U.A.R. AT SUEZ REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, AUg. 12  The United States is assessing Israeli intelligence reports that Soviet lowaltitude missiles were installed on the Egyptian held side of the Suez Canal four hours after the Middle East ceasefire began last Fri day night.

title: Chess
description: Bernard Zuckerman, the international master and former champion of the Man hattan Chess Club, captured first place in the recent Man hattan masters invitation tournament without the loss of a game. In this five round Swiss event, which attracted 16 of the strong est players in the metropoli four games and drew one, scoring, 4.

title: PACT WITH SOVIET SIGNED BY BRANDT IN KREMLIN PALACE
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 12Chan cellor Willy Brandt of West Germany and Premier Aleksei N. Kosygin of the Soviet. Union signed a treaty today accepting the postwar European borders as inviolable and opening the way to and ties between Bonn and the Communist na tions of Eastern Europe.

title: UNILEVER LISTS RECORD PROFITS
Mondale Calls School Policy a Hoax
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12  Senator Walter F. Mondale, Democrat of Minnesota, charged today that the Nixon Administration was continuing to grant taxexempt status to white private schools in the South, contrary to previously announced policy.

title: Tribesmen's Mentor
description: MANILAIn the strongly conventional and conformist Filipino society, Manuel Eli zalde Jr. is an odd man out.

title: Jazz Horns Lose, Amplification Wins At the Village Gate
description: The theory that the addi tion of jazz horns can extend the scope of a rock group was placed in somewhat blurred perspective Tuesday night at the Village Gate by a new group called Dreams.

title: 14 Feared Killed in Taipei
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Aug. 12 (AP) Fourteen persons were be lieved to have been killed today when a China Airlines plane crashed into a mountainside outside of Taipei. The Japanese built plane, carrying 26 pas sengers and five crewmen, crashed in heavy fog and rain while trying to make a landing at Taipei International Airport after a flight from Hualien. Seven bodies were recovered and seven other persons, in cluding the pilot and copilot, were missing and feared dead.

title: IDA OPPENHEIMER, 74, EXSOCIAL WORKER
description: Ida Oppenheimer, a retired social worker who helped or ganize the Lower East Side Community Council in the 1920's and later headed the Jewish Vacation Association of the Federation of Jewish Philan thropies, died yesterday in her home at 235 West 22d Street. She was 74 years old.

title: Chief of Police Charges Interference
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Aug. 12Chief of Police Ralph C. Petrone today asked the State Attorney General to in vestigate political inter ference from City Hall that he said was causing a very serious breakdown in the morale of the city's policemen and creating situations that threaten the city's safety.

title: PARIS; (In French francs)
3 IN CONGRESS ASK END TO GAS RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 Three members of Congress from areas that produce nat ural gas announced plans to day to introduce legislation that would stop the Federal Government from regulating the prices that owners of gas wells can charee.

title: ... and Regulatory Overhaul
description: President Nixon has now received from his Advisory Council on Executive Organization a report recom mending just the kind of reform of regulatory com missions that Philip Elman is talking about.

title: PERU PANEL STUDIES CRASH FATAL TO 99
description: LIMA, Peru, Aug. 12The Peruvian Civil Aviation Corn mission is studying three pos sible causes for the plane crash Sunday that killed 99, among them 55 Americans. These, in clude mechanical trouble, over loading of the aircraft and air turbulence in the region.

title: ShirtSleeve Manner Marks Brandt Government
description: BONN, Aug. 12The other day Gerhard Schr6der, the conservative who served in every West Germany Govern ment from 1953 to 1969, de scribed the style of Chancel lor Willy Brandt's Administra tion as too loud and too os tentatious.

title: CAZENOVIA CREW WINS SAIL SERIES
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug 12 The Willow Bank Y.C. crew from Cazenovia, N. Y., cap tained by David Penfield and representing the Central New York Yacht Racing Associa tion, won the Area B semifinal series of the North American junior sailing championship by onehalf point off Riverside Y.C. today.

title: JOHANNESBURG; (In South African rands)
Bob McKinley Defeats Holmes, 64, 62, in National Grass Court Tennis
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L.I. Aug. 12The name on the score board was familiar. So was the shoat, stocky figure bouncing round the court, running down every ball within reach, scrambling for each point as if it were the last. So were the scores: 64, 62, McKinley.

title: Scout Aide Charged In Pornography Case
description: W HITE PLAINS, Aug. 12 The District Attorney's office here is investigating a busi ness office in the Town of Greenburgh that, according to District Attorney Carl. A. Vergari, operated as a clear ing house for sex and filth.

title: Nigerians Art Rewards a Pilgrimage
description: The Studio Museum in Har lem, at 2033 Fifth Avenue near 125th Street, has come up with an exhibition for which the most succinct rec ommendation may be that it is worth the safari to this cultural outpost. About 80 paintings, sculptures, graph ics, and works in such arts and crafts media as beads and handdyed fabric, all from artists working in the city of Oshogbo, Nigeria, have been assembled under the title Mbari Mbayo, the name of a club of writers and artists in that city who in 1962, 1963, and 1964 spon sored workshops for the en couragement of local talent.

title: Arms Talks End Tomorrow
description: VIENNA, Aug. 12 (UPI) The first round of the talks on the limitation of strategic arms will end Friday, the American delegation announced today.

title: GROUP SYNDICATES NORTHERN DANCER, 9
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 12  The long anticipated announcement ofthe syndica tion of the 9yearold Canadian bred Northern Dancer was made today and it revealed that the sire of the great performer, Nijinsky, had been syndicated at a value of $2.4million.

title: Basketball Players in MGM Pact
description: The latest entry into sports licensing and merchan dising was announced yesterday with the signing of con tracts between MetroGoldwynMayer, Inc., and both the American Basketball Association and the American Basket ball Association Players Association.

title: White Sox Rout Yankees, 51, With 3 Runs in Seventh
CHILE NATIONALIZES U.S.OWNED CONCERN
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 12 (AP)President Eduardo Frei today signed into law a bill to nationalize $1.6million worth of stock that the Boise Cascade Corporation of the United States holds in the largest privately owned electric power company in Chile.

title: Legal Aid Plans to Sue On Conditions at Tombs
description: The Legal Aid Society has prepared a suit charging that conditions in the Manhattan House of Detention are so shocking that they violate the constitutional bar against cruel and unusual punishment, Legal Aid lawyers and other sources said yesterday.

title: 2d Black Panther Is Freea On Bail in Jersey Shooting
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 12 The second member of the Jer sey City Black Panther party awaiting a possible retrial on charges of machinegunning a police station here has been freed in bail.

title: U.S. SUIT FOR MEN SEEKS EQUAL PAY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 The Labor Department filed today the first lawsuit ever brought to require that men be paid as much as women for the same work.

title: Cairo Opposes Direct Talks
description: CAIRO, Aug. 12 United Arab Republic is ready for peaceful settlement with Israel but not a formal peace treaty, Cairo's leading policy spokes man, Mohammed Hassanein Heykal, declared today.

title: Market Group Survey Puts Wage Rises at New Levels
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 12In its monthly statistical survey, the Executive Commission of the European Common Market said today that wages in the six member countries are rising at an unprecedented rate. This, together with a continuing ex pansion of demand, causes the price climate to remain unfavo rable.

title: The Chef Is 18, the Maitre d 13, and It's a Splendid Restaurant
description: HARVEY'S LAKE, Pa.It is a restau rant with a sophisticated, impressively professional kitchen. Guests dine there on snails bourguignonne, on fillet of beef barnaise and on breast of chicken cooked A blanc with a sauce made of pt de foie and cream.

title: Minimum Wage Rise Asked
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (AP) Jacob S. Potofsky, president of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America, urged to day that the Federal minimum wage be increased to $2.50 an hour. It is now $1.60. Mr. Potof sky testified before a House Labor subcommittee.

title: CHAMBER PLAYERS ACHIEVE INTIMACY
description: It takes a bit of doing to turn Philharmonic Hall into a cham ber, as that word is understood by music listeners, but it can be done. The Boston Symphony Chamber Playersfive first desk men from the orchestra, in this instancefound the problem surmountable on Tues day night, when they appeared in Lincoln Center's A Mostly Mozart Festival.

title: Wider Press Bills Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (UPI) Legislation designed to put daily newspapers under the Federal Communication Com mission's fairness doctrine was introduced today in the House by Representative Leon ard Farbstein, Democrat of Manhattan. He said companion bills would extend the F.C.C. doctrine, which requires the presentation of conflicting views on radio and television, to newspapers in communities of 25,000 or over that do not have two separately owned pa pers.

title: License for Rock Festival Is Denied by Boston Mayor
description: BOSTON, Aug. 12 (UPI) Mayor Kevin H. White refused to issue a license to Boston College for a threeday rock festival scheduled to start Fri day, saying that he could not guarantee sufficient police pro tection.

title: Meteor Shower Here Is Obscured by Smog
description: The annual Pereseids meteor shower reached its peak over New York just before midnight last night, but the shooting stars were obsecured by smog.

title: Message From the Tombs
description: From out of the Tombs has come an urgent plea for decency and change of the corrections and court system that equals in straightforward eloquence what many studies by attorneys and judicial organizations have been saying about criminal cases for years.

title: AMSTERDAM; (In Netherlands guilders)
Goldwater Sees. End to Draft
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (UPI) Senator Barry Goldwater, Republican of Arizona, pre dicted today that the Senate would vote next week to abolish the draft, a practice that has no place in our system of free dom except as a temporary expedient. He spoke at a symposium for aides o, Senators and Representative sponsored by the Young Ameri cans for Freedom.

title: Article 2  No Title
Army to Defer to Court on Nerve Gas
description: SUNNY POINT MILITARY TERMINAL, N. C., Aug. 12 Col. John Osick said today that if the courts enjoined the Army from dumping its shipment of deadly nerve gas in the ocean the court would have to tell the Army bow to dispose of the cargo.

title: Goldberg Campaigns in the Adirondacks
description: LONG LAKE, N.Y., Aug. 121 Arthur J. Goldberg learned about the Adirondack Forest Preserves the hard way today.

title: Courtland Smith, Film Executive For Early Newsreels, Is Dead
description: Courtland Smith, a former motionpicture executive, died Sunday at the ranch of his daughter, Mrs. John Barnes Mull, in Santa Fe, N.M. His age was 86.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: HALKIRK, Scotland, Aug. 12Heavy clouds sometimes obscured the sun, but the air was clear as we moved in a long line up the hill over heather, sedge and sphagnum moss and far below us the Thurso River gleamed in its green valley.

title: EGYPT PROMISES LESS CENSORSHIP
description: CAIRO, Aug. 12A suspen sion of all but military censor ship was promised today for foreign newsmen in the United Arab Republic by Mohammed Hassanein Heykal, the Minister of National Guidance.

title: MRS. HART REACHES SEMIFINALS IN GOLF
description: PLAINFIELD, N. J., Aug. 12 Mrs. A. Sherburne Hart of Essex County continued to set the pace in the 45th New Jer sey women's amateur cham pionship today by defeating Mrs. Henry Doubilet of Holly wood, 5 and 3, at the Plainfield Country Club.

title: The Cast
description: SOLDIER BLUE, directed by Ralph Nel. son; screenplay by John Gay, from the novel Arrow In the Sun by Theodore V. Olsen; cinematographer, Robert Hauser; music by Buffy Sainte Marie; produced by Gabriel Katzka and Harold Loeb; released by Avro Embassy Pictures. At the Ziegfeld Theater, Avenue of the Americas and 54th Street. Running time: 112 minutes. (The Motion Picture Association of America's Production Code and Rating Administration classifies this film: Rrestricted, persons under 17 re quire accompanying parent or adult guardian.)

title: Congress Approves a Rise In Savings Bond Interest
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (AP) The House passed and sent to President Nixon today a bill authorizing an increase in the interest rate on Series E sav ings bonds to 5 per cent from 5 per cent.

title: NERVE GAS SHIFT IN PACIFIC MAPPED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 The Pentagon has drawn up a plan to move the nerve gas it has stored on Okinawa 4,000 miles across the Pacific to Johnston Island, a tiny Amer icanowned atoll 700 miles southwest of Honolu lu.

title: SYDNEY; (la Australian dollars and cents)
Where Mothers Work Bankers Hours
description: PLAINVIEW, L. I.  I wouldn't want my wife to work if it meant our kids would be wandering around the streets until she got home.

title: James M. Brown, 49, Dies; Geophysics Adviser at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 12James M. Brown, the senior technical adviser in geo physics for the United Nations, died last night at his home, 411 East 53d Street. He was 49 years old.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
description: The New York and Ameri can Stock Exchanges have issued their reports on changes in stockholdings by major stockholders, directors and officers of listed corporations. The lists include the following:

title: John Savage Gets Ari Rolel
description: John Savage, a young actor in Fiddler on the Roof, has been signed to play the role of Dov Landau, in Ari, Ken Gaston's and Leonard Gold berg's musical adaptation of Leon Uris's Exodus. The musical will open on Broadway Jan. 17.

title: Yarmolinsky Named to Head Welfare Island Development
description: Prof. Adam Yarmolinsky of Harvard has been appointed chief executive officer of the Welfare Island Development Corporation, which is con structing the $250million com munity in the East River.

title: Post Office Has Inspired Love and Abuse Since It Began
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 The approaching transfor mation of the Post Office in to the Postal Service, what ever it augurs for efficiency and economy, dooms one of America's oldest and most cherished objects of both af fection and righteous scorn.

title: JET QUARTERBACK PRAISES PLAYERS
description: For the first time since The Trouble, Joe Namath spoke yesterday to his coach, Weeb Ewbank.

title: 38Acre Newark Meadow Site Sold for $8Million Toy Plant
description: NEWARK, Aug. 12  The Ideal Toy Corporation a yen tore that saw a Brooklyn. can dy store operator parlay a Ted dy Bear into the third largest independent toymaker, bought 3S acres of meadowland today for an $8million plant that will employ more than 1,600 work ers.

title: Hockey Signing
REV. PAUL J. HARNEY
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Aug. 12 (AP)The Rev. Paul J. Harney, chancellor of the University of San Francisco, died yesterday at the Montecito Jesuit retreat here. He Was 60 years old.

title: Article 6  No Title
Los Angeles Area Tops New York in Crime Tally
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 The crime rate in the New York metropolitan area was nearly twice as high as the national average last year, according to statistics reported today by the Federal Bureau of Investigation, but its citizens could take some comfort from the fact that the Los Angeles area rate was still higher.

title: Article 3  No Title
Big Board Names Officer For Clearing Corporation
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that Melvyn S. Klein had been appointed vice president for marketing and planning in the exchange's Stock Clearing Cor poration. The position is new. Mr. Klein, viz years mu, came to the exchange from Arthur D. Little, Inc., a consulting and research concern, where he was a senior staff consultant. Mr. Klein will be responsible for liaison with member firms, banks, transfer agents and other organizations involved, with the Stock Clearing Cor poration.

title: Article 4  No Title
President Approves Veterans Aid Bill Exceeding Request
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (UPI) President Nixon signed legis lation today raising payments to disabled veterans by about 1.1 per cent, even though it exceeded his request by $21$ million. He said he would off set the excess by making re ductions in four other Federal programs.

title: Lowell P. Weicker Jr.
description: Lowell P. Weicker Jr., the 39yearold lawyer who has represented Connecticut's Fourth Congressional District since 1968 and yesterday be came the Republican candi date for the United States Senate, began his political career in the Connecticut General Assembly.

title: 400 Attend Governor's Antidrug Forum
description: AMHERST, N. Y., Aug. 12 Governor Rockefeller urged to day the development of com munity leadership and total community involvement in the fight against narcotics addic tion.

title: City Bank Unit for Congo
description: The First National City Bank announced yesterday plans to establish a subsidiary in the Republic of the Congo in the near future.

title: Wedding Set By Miss Paine
description: Miss Linda Westall Paine and David Lawrence Langs ton, graduate students at Co lumbia University, will be married next month.

title: A.C.L.U. Says A.B.C. News Shows Bias Against Women
description: The American Civil Liberties Union announced today that it had filed a formal complaint against A.B.C. News charging it with discrimination against women in employment and pro motion.

title: Lombardo Restaurant Burns
description: FREEPORT, L. I., Thursday. Aug. 13A fire of suspicious origin, according to the police, destroyed the unoccupied East Point House on South Grove Street here early today. The restaurant, famous as Guy Lom bardo's Restaurant, had not been used for at least two years, the police said.

title: Robert Katz Weds Jane Lisman
description: Miss Jane Nan Lisman and Robert James Katz, a greatgrandson of the late David Shapiro, who was president of The Day, the Yiddishlanguage daily news paper, were married here last evening at the St. Regis Sheraton by Rabbi William Berkowitz.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Draft Directive

title: BOTH SIDES WANT END TO U.S. FRAY
description: GENEVA, Aug.. 12  The two sides fighting for control of Investors Overseas Services said today they would like to see a halt to the war that could destroy the already bod ly battered mutual fund ern pire.

title: 124 New Refuse Trucks Faulty And Await Repair, City Says
description: John J. De Lury, president of the Uniformed Sanitation men's Association, charged yeg terday that more than 200 new sanitation trucks scheduled for immediate service here were sitting idle in Jersey City be cause they had been improperly assembled.

title: Census Bureau Sees Declining Birth Rate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (AP)A striking decline in birth rates during the late nineteensixties will mean 100 million fewer Americans in the year 2000 than previously projected, the Census Bureau said today.

title: S.E.C. IS ENTERING JERSEY BANK CASE
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has entered the case involving the Eatontown National Bank to determine what impact, if any, the New Jersey bank's failure may have had on Wal Street. The bank's president has been charged with misapplying $5million in funds.

title: ROSS BREAKS MARK IN RIFLE SHOOTING
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 12 (AP)David Ross 3d, a captain in the Army Reserves from Woodbury, L. I., smasged the national match record today. to win the national smallbore rifle prone championship with a fourday score of 6,396 points of a possible 6,400.

title: Austin Revamping Lombardi's Methods
description: CARLISLE, Pa., Aug. 12 Speaking of Vince Lombardi, Bill Austin said today, At least I know 1 can yell as loud as he can. Austin is in the unenviable position of being Lombardi's successor as head coach of the Wash ington Redskins. It is the toughest act to follow in pro football. Ask Phil Bengtson at Green Bay. While. Lom bardi, seriously ill, remains in Georgetown Hos pital in Washington, the Red skins move onward. Today they were working hard in advance of their second pre season game, on Sunday in Boston against the Patriots. They lost their first last Saturday to Cincinnati. Aus tin spoke of his position. About Pro Football

title: Candice Bergen Stars in Violent Western
description: Film critics who admire the Western for its clearcut mor al values, for its firm dis tinction between good and evil, will no doubt applaud Soldier Blue, which does not hesitate to Identify the United States Army as the brutal, bestial, stupid destroy er of essentially decent, hon orable American Indians in the 19th century. The rest of us may have some doubts. But not about the sentiments, which I suspect are justnor about the impulses behind the adaptation of so patently po litical a theme.

title: Wife of French Premier Dies in Automobile Crash
description: SAINTJEANDELUZ, France, Aug. 12 (UPI)Mrs. MarieAn toinette ChabanDelmas, wife of Premier, Jacques Chaban Delmas, was killed today in an automobile accident near this resort town in southwestern France.

title: Iraqis and Syrians Reaffirm Opposition To Egyptian Efforts at Mideast Accord
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 12 Iraq denounced the United Arabi Republic in unusually harsh terms today and Syria reaf firmed her doctrine that guer rilla warfare was, the only way to put an end to the Zionist and imperialist aggression aeainst the Arabs.

title: John Mandia, an ExDancer With City Ballet, Dies at 45
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug 12 John Mandia, a former dancer with the New York City Ballet, died. of a heart attack here yes terday. He was 45 years old and lived at 176 East 95th Street in New York.

title: BRUSSELS; (In Belgian francs)
PRICES ARE DOWN ON LONDON BOARD
description: Stock prices moved generally lower in London yesterday in a continuation of the recent dull trading trend.

title: Books of The Times
description: It seems thoroughly decadent to admit it, but the appeal of these two books on the Pueblo affair depends on the excite ment they generate as sea stories in the vein of The Caine Mutiny, The Cruel Sea, and all the rest of those tales in which a miniature society, working under a rigid but simplified social contract, is threatened with ex tinction, but comes through. Here in the

title: 7 ARABS RELEASED FROM GREEK JAILS
description: ATHENS, Thursday, Aug. 13 (Reuters)The Greek Govern ment today released seven Arabs sentenced to various prison terms for terrorist ac tivities in Greece.

title: HYMAN SOBILOFF, FILMMAKER, DIES
description: Hyman J. Sobiloff, an in dustrialist, film producer, poet and philanthropist, died of a heart attack at his summer home in Montauk, L.I. He was 57 years old and had lived at, 67 East 77th Street.

title: F.B.I. Finds Crime Rate Has Risen 148% in Decadel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 The Federal Bureau of Investi gation reported today that every American's risk of be coming the victim of a serious crime had more than doubled in the last decade.

title: No Safeguard for SALT
description: The Senate's 52to47 vote yesterday against halt ing Safeguard expansion, coming on the heels of Pres ident Nixon's money bill vetoes, would seem to be a victory for an Administration policy that spends too much on defense and not enough on education and housing. But the real issue in the new authorization bill, which would extend antiballistic missile (ABM) defense beyond the two sites approved last year by a 50to50 tie vote, is not finances but the security of the nation and the world.

title: Senate RollCall Vote On CooperHart Curb
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (AP) Following is the rollcall vote by which the Senate rejected today an amendment by Sena tors John Sherman Cooper and Philip A. Hart to forbid spend ing $322million to expand the Safeguard antimissile system to new sites:

title: Daughter Says Nixon Foresaw War Protests
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 (UPI)  The campus demon strations last spring after United States troops were sent into Cambodia did not surprise President Nixon, his daughter Mrs. David Eisen hower said today.

title: Johns Hopkins Post Filled
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 12 Donald E. Blanchard, vice pres ident of Knox College, Gales burg, Ill., has been appointed vice president for administra tion at the Johns Hopkins Uni versity. Mr. Blanchard will succeed Robert F. Kerley, who was named last month as vice chancellor for administration at the University of California, Berkeley.

title: New Look at the F.T.C....
description: Miles W. Kirkpatrick, nominated by President Nixon as new chairman of the Federal Trade. Commission, displays commendable civic spirit in his willingness to leave the critics in the grandstand and show what he can do on the playing field. As head of an American Bar Association panel which last year severely criti cized the work of the F.T.C. and recommended aggres sive new leadership, he in effect wrote his own job description. His service on the A.B.A. study group gives him a detailed knowledge of the commission's strengths and failings, which should prove uniquely helpful in his new assignment.

title: Sarah Stevens Engaged to Wed R. Michael Wall
description: GLOUCESTER, Mass., Aug. 12Mr. and Mrs. George Stevens have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Sarah Towle Stevens, to R. Michael Wall, son of Mrs. Thomas S. Wall of Fair field, Conn., and the late Mr. Wall.

title: Young Musicians Finance Flight to Swiss Fete
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 After eight months of button selling and fundraising con certs, including a perform ance on the White House lawn, the District of Colum bia Youth Orchestra will be flying across the Atlantic to morrow to St. Moritz, Switz erland.

title: Nixon to Fly to Louisiana For Desegregation Parley
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12In an effort to dramatize his repeated pledges to cooperate with the South on school de segregation this fall, President Nixon will fly to New Orleanson Friday for an unusual pri vate meeting with members of seven state advisory com mittees on public education.

title: Louis Is Unable to Attend Tribute to Him in Detroit
description: DETROIT Aug. 12 (AP) Joe Louis, former world heavy weight champion, remained in Denver, afflicted with an emo tional disorder, but his spirit was in Detroit tonight, where about 8,000 persons came to pay tribute to one of their city's most revered heros.

title: LEPRE TEAM GAINS IN FOURBALL GOLF

description: PARIS, Aug. 12Maurice Frere, Belgian banker and economist, died yesterday in Turkey, according to word re ceived in Brussels tonight. He was 80 years old.

description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 12Mayor Lindsay 7 charged todaythat leaders in Washington were engaged in a futile attempt to combat crime through cheap methods.

description: It was more of the same yes terday on the American Stock Exchange as prices continued to slump and volume dropped to its lowest level in almost four years.

title: GONZALES GAINS IN CANADIAN OPEN
description: TORONTO, Aug. 12 (UPI)  Pancho Gonzales, fatigued by his overnight flight from Los Angeles relied on his powerful service today to turn back a determined John Sharpe from Toronto, 119, 64, in first round play at the $23,200 Roth mans Canadian open cham pionships.

description: Beck Industries, Inc., a di versified retailing company that recently failed to complete a debt offering, announced yesterday the sale of one sub sidiary and the rescinding of two recent acquisition transac tions as part of a program to revise its debt structure and raise more working capital.

title: ExPolice Chief Sentenced
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Aug. 12 (UPI)A Superior Court judge today sentenced a former police chief from Texas to five years to life on burglary charges. Wayman Dial, 35 years old, former chief of the San Marcos (Tex.) Police Depart ment was arrected Jan. 11 at the home of a wealthy woman in an exclusive residential area near Beverly Hills.

title: Monetary Policy Outlined
description: DENVER, Aug. 12 (Reuters) George W. Mitchell, a member of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that present mone tary policy issues were weight ed toward the timing of eco nomic stimulus and not the maintainance of antiinflation ary restraint.

title: Three Saigon Dailies Seized
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 12 (UPI)The Govern ment today confiscated editions of three Vietnameselanguage daily newspapers for alleged violations of the newspaper, code. Tin Sang, Dan and Anh Sang were seized for printing articles harmful to the national security.

title: Infants Home to Expand
description: The Infants Home of Brom lyn, 1358 56th Street, will ex pand its classrooms and thera peutic nursery and school for the treatment of emotionally disturbed children from the ages of 3 to 9, Samuel Ruch man, the president, announced Yesterday. The institution has been treating only children of preschool age. The new class rooms will permit the enroll ment of 25 additional nunils.

title: In The Nation: Tackling a Phenomenon Called TV
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 It may well be that the House gave such thunderous approval to limiting campaign spending on television because members thought it would help protect them from rich challengers. It may also be that the Democratic Congress is moving this bill along because it clears the way for television debates between the Presidential contenders in 1972. Even so, the reform bill is a good day's work that will have far more important ef fects than these temporary and limited matters.

title: Two Banks in City Discuss a Merger
description: The Kings Lafayette Bank, a $200million Brooklynbased in stitution, and the Republic Na tional Bank of New York, with assets of $177million, are hold ing very preliminary merger discussions, they disclosed yes terday.

description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Aug. 12 (AP)Foster Bibron, 196 pound Australian heavyweight champion, stopped Fred Wil liams of Brooklyn, 191, after eight rounds tonight.

description: Closed (annual holiday).

title: 50 Bronx Children Hospitalized In Outbreak of Viral Meningitis
description: More than 110 cases of viral meningitis, a nonfatal disease of the nervous system, have been reported this year by public and private health officials. The city Department of Health said that the total probably represented the largest number of cases reported at one time since the department first be gan keeping figures on the dis. ease in 1959.

title: A Correction

description: Divorce can be a rocky road financially not only for a husband who pays alimony and child support but also for a wife. She generally finds that she must live on quite a bit less than for merly.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 12 Total inventories held by man ufacturing and trading compa nies rose by $350million in June, although manufacturers reduced their stocks during the month for the first time since September, 1967.

title: Young Texans Win in Soccer
description: DEWSBURY, England, Aug. 12 (Reuters)  Two goals by Steve King gave the Texas (Longhorns, a junior soccer team from Dallas, a 21 victory over Thornhill Athletic tonight in the first match of their four week tour of Britain.

description: The police raided what they described as an afterhours club at 247 West 46th Street, near Eighth Avenue, early yesterday. They arrested 66 persons and confiscated quantities of drugs, liquor, and gambling materials.
