description: LOS ANGELES, AUG. 14 (AP) Jim Henry of University of Indiana and Capt. Micki King of the Air Force and Long Beach, Calif., successfully de fended their National Amateur Athletic Union diving titles to night.

title: Col. George McNally, 64, Dies; ExChief of White House Unit
description: BETHESDA, Md., Aug. 14Col. George J. McNally, retired, chief of the White House com munications system, died Tues day after a heart attack at the National Naval Medical Center here. He was 64 years old.

LeVan of East Macungie, five miles southwest of here.

title: Sports of The Times
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y.Mrs. Catherine DiFrenza, a middleaged brunette from Astoria, Queens, sank three freethrows in a row one sunny morning, the last one beautifullyarched overhand shot that fell through the hoop like a stone. Did it go in, did it go in? cried Mrs. Di Frenza, and when someone said, Did it ever, didn't even touch the backboard, she said, Are you sure you aren't just saying that to make me feel good?

title: Mine Act to Be Checked
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (AP) The investigative arm of Con gress  the Government Ac count Officewill review all aspects of the enforcement of the coal mine health and safety act, Senator Harrison A. Wil liams Jr., Democrat of New Jersey, announced today.

title: Flynt of Deerfield
description: Every person who cherishes the American heritage is in debt to a littleknown lawyer, Henry Flynt, who died the other day. After a visit to Deerfield, Mass., forty years ago, he decided to restore the town's inn to the excellent hostelry it had once been. As he worked on that project, he and his wife became pos sessed by the vision of recreating Deerfield in its pristine state as an early eighteenthcentury village on the New England frontier. Others joined them in the task and gradually the old Deerfield that now beguiles visitors from all over the world took renewed form: the long main street of handsome houses, the fine antique furniture and authentic fabrics and wallpapers, the serene gardens. What John D. Rockefeller Jr. did for Williamsburg the Flynts did on a smaller scale for Deerfield.

title: JOEL '
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 (UPI)The Sedurities and Exchange Commission has temporarily suspended Martin J. Joel Jr., doing business as Martin J. Joel & Co., a New York broker dealer, after finding violation of Federal securities law.

title: Bridge:

title: U.S. Officials Feel Charges by Israelis Have Political Aim
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 High United States officials, chary of concluding that the Egyptians violated the Mid dle East standstill ceasefire by moving missies toward the Suez Canal, see political mo tives behind Israel's publiciz ing of charges of such a vio lation. The feeling in some high quarters here is that Israel was seeking to rally world opinion and perhaps even tually to persuade the United States to provide her with advanced military equipment  such as more Phantom F4 aircraft or electronic devices  to counterbalance the wea ponry that the Soviet Union has sent to Cairo.

title: BIG BOARD GAINS IN LIGHT TRADING
description: The stock market staged a modest advance yesterday to post its first gain in a down ward week. Trading remained relatively slow at 7.85 million shares as advances outpaced declines by a narrow margin on the New York Stock Ex change.

description: A patrolman was returning lost, 5 yearold boy to his Greenwich Village apartment Thursday night when the child remarked: My mommy has grass.

description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 14 Israeli jets bombed and strafed Jordanian Army posts opposite the Beisan Valley for about 45 minutes today, the military command announced.

title: Harlem Group Links Litter to Lax Enforcement of Parking Laws
description: A lax enforcement of park ing rules in Harlem is part of the reason why garbage has littered the streets there for the last three decades, accord ing to residents.

title: RAHIM AND M'NAIR GAIN SEMIFINALS
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L.I., Aug. 14His name is Haroon Rahim, he is 20 years old, dark, trim, handsome, and the most excit ing product to reach this coun try from Pakistan since the first shipment of jute.

Closed Jersey Bank's Property Sold
description: EATONTOWN, N. J., Aug. 14 The buildings and property of the insolvent Eatontown Na tional Bank were sold here to day for near)y $2million to two other Monmouth County banks that will open tomorrow to Eatontown depositors.

description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Aug. 14 (AP)Char Col Gal became the first 1970 champion of the Illi nois State Fair colt stakes to day, winning the $23,750 3yearold filly trot in a four horse extra heat.

description: City welfare officials esti mated yesterday that 775,000 adults and children among the working poor would be eligible for the city's new food stamp program, in addition to most of the 1.1 million people who receive welfare aid.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14 The Food and Drug Adminitra tion reinstated, today its total ban on cyclamates, the artifi cial sweetening chemicals that had been found to cause a can cer in rats.

title: Reagan Gets Antibusing Bili
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 14 (UPI)The California Legis lature approved today and sent to Gov. Ronald Reagan a bill prohibiting a public school from busing a child for racial or any other reason without pa rental consent. Mr. Reagan has indicated he supports the con cept of the measure, and he was expected to sign it. He has said he is opposed to forced busing.

title: Production of Cars Registers Advance InWeek to 40,854
description: DETROIT, Aug. 14 (AP)With more plants starting up on building 1971 model cars, United States automakers sharply increased their produc tion schedules this week.

title: The New Federalism Now
description: The essence of the New Federalism, President Nixon explained to the nation's Governors gathered at their annual convention last year, is to help regain control of our national destiny by returning a greater share of control to state and local governments and to the people.

title: ... and Its Impact on Education
description: President Nixon has tried to justify his veto of the Education Appropriation Bill on educational as well as antiinflationary grounds. Specifically, he has charged that the additional $126 million allocated to districts with large numbers of Federal employes perpetuates a wasteful political subsidy and that many other edu cational programs require reform before getting more Federal support.

title: HardWorking Judge
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14Judge June Lazenby Green arose this morning at 6:45 and went for a swim with her husband, John, in their enclosed, heated pool, as she does almost every morning. Then, as he prepared break fast and drove during their 40mile trio from their home in Arnold, Md., near the Severn River, to their of flees in Washing ton, she read le gal briefs in the case before her court. The routine has been followed by the 56yearold judge every working day for the two years she has been on the bench.

title: Chuvalo to Fight Tonight
description: SARAJEVO, Yugoslavia, Aug. 14 (AP)George Chuvalo, the Canadian heavyweight, will fight Mike Bruce of Springfield, Mass., here tomorrow.

title: Jane Flynn Is Engaged To Marry Peter Jones
description: FALLS CHURCH, Va., Aug. 14Lieut Col. Richard J. Flynn Jr., U.S.M.C., retired, and Mrs. Flynn has an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jane Flynn to Peter P. Jones. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. J. Carleton Jones of Baltimore.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President flew to New Orleans with his top advisers to discuss school desegregation.

title: Taipei Jails Manila Newsmen in Sedition
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Aug. 14A military tribunal today found two brothers guilty of spread ing Communist propaganda through their Chineselanguage newspaper in Manila and sentenced them to detention in a reformatory for political reeducation.

title: City Police in Copter Pursue LowFlying Plane in Jersey
description: A police helicopter chased wildly dipping and diving single engine airplane over Manhattan last night, sometimes flying as low as 200 feet, about 17 stories above the ground.

title: Mideast Talks Must Go On
description: It would be an unspeakable tragedy if the momen tum for peace talks in the Middle East, built up painstakingly and with sacrifices by both sides, should now be destroyed by violations  or accusations of violationsof the weekold standstill ceasefire.

title: Jordan Reports Attacks
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 14 The Jordanian military corn mand reported two Israeli air raids and a shelling attack across the Jordan River today. It said that a soldier had been killed and seven soldiers end civilian wounded.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: In regard, to the Aug. 4 sky scraper blaze, it seems that there are some answers and questions on the problem of this type of fire.

title: Jailed Guerrilla Chiefs Confer, Raising Hope of Deal
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 14 (UPI)The police an nounced today that they had allowed four captive guerrilla leaders to confer privately in prison, raising hopes that a deal might secure the release of a United States aide and a Brazilian held hostage by the Tupamaro guerrillas.

title: British Board Finds Rise In Tea Price Unjustified
description: LONDON, Aug. 14A general eightcentapound rise in the price of tea by British sup pliers in April was found un justified in a report issued to day by the Prices and Incomes Board.

title: BANK EXAMINERS RELY ON SURPRISE
description: The examination of a bank is always begun without prior notice and in a manner which will preserve the element of surprise. Hotel or other accom modations should be arranged so that advance notice will be avoided....

title: Miss Bergmann And a Lawyer Marry in Dallas
description: FALMOUTH, Mass., Aug. 14Miss Nancy Jane Berg mann, an elementaryschool teacher in Garland, Tex., and Michael Vance Killough, lawyer in Dallas, were mar ried here this afternoon. The Rev. Richard S. Crowell per formed the ceremony in St. Barnabas Episcopal Church.

title: ExNASA Head Named By General Electric Co.
description: The election of Thomas O. Paine as a vice president was announced yesterday by the General Electric Company.

title: British Seize Bombs Linked to Ulster

title: 17 POLICE ACCUSED ON MOONLIGHTING
description: Seventeen New York police men  including one: captain, two sergeants and five detec tivesare facing departmental charges of moonlighting with out permission for a private investigating concern.

title: Chicago Police Face New Sniping Wave

The street warfare was the latest in a series of nearly nightly attacks on police men in Negro neighborhoods here.

description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 14 (AP)  An interview with Bob by G. Seale, the Black Panther leader, scheduled for showing Monday night, has been can celed by a Philadelphia sta tion, which says it is incon sequential and irrelevant.

title: Miss Westchester, a 16Foot Laboratory, Will Study Pollution in Sound
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., Aug. 14Christened with two bottles of dirty water from the Hudson River and Long Island Sound, the Miss West chester, a 16foot Boston Whaler, was officially com missioned here this afternoon as Westchester County's float ing pollution laboratory.

title: A List of Recently Published Fiction and Nonfiction
description: Artistes and Admirers, a comedy in four acts by Alexander Niko layevich Ostrovsky, translated by Elisabeth Hanson, introduc tion by Lawrence Hanson (Barnes & Noble, paperbound, $2.50).

title: Occidental Oil Co. Shows Profit Drop In Second Quarter
In Path of Mine, All Butte, Mont., May Move
description: BUTTE, Mont.Citizens of this centu copper cen ter are thinking of moving their town off what has been called the richest hill on earth to make way for a huge open pit mine that each year seems to chew its way closer to traditional business district

title: Judge Rejects Plea to Stop Nerve Gas Ship, but Storm Forces a Delay
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 14A Federal district judge let the Government go ahead today with its plan to sink 418 con crete containers holding lethal nerve gas rockets in the Atlan tic Ocean 240 miles off the coast of Florida.

title: New York's Outfielders, After Confusion on One Play, Straighten Things Out on the Next
Japan, 25 Years After Surrender, Builds Protective might
description: TOKYO  Twentylive years after Japan surrendered to the victorious allies, her leaders are engaged in an effort to strengthen an army, navy and air force with weapons, de signed to protect only the is lands of Japan herself, that do not include nuclear bombs.

title: Janet Binder, Vassar Alumna, Is Betrothed to Rex S. Wignall

He is the son of Mrs. Rex Wiley Wignall of Laguna Beach and the late Mr. Wig nall, who was president of Chaffey College in Alta Loma.

title: Hard of Hearing Spend Summer With Normal Buddies
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 14The buddy system has been helping children who are hard of hearing to live normal lives with children who do not have that handicap.

title: REV. GEORGE LAUGEL; SET UP 85 MISSIONS
description: TENAFLY, N. J. Aug., 14 The Rev. George Laugel of the (Society of African Missions, who served in Nigeria from 1915 to 1933, died Wednesday in Holy Name Hospital in Tea neck. He was 83 years old and lived in the Provincial House of the order here.

title: Ralph Dighton Dies at 55; Aerospace Writer for A.P.
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 14 (AP) Ralph Dighton, a science aerospace writer for The Asso ciated Press, died of cancer yesterday at Valley Pres. byterian Hospital in suburban Van Nuys. He was 55 years old.

title: Hinson and Stockton Lead P.G.A. Tourney by Stroke With Even Par 140's

title: 14 G.I.'S WOUNDED IN CLASH IN VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 14 (UPI)Fourteen United States soliders were wounded today when enemy troops opened fire on a unit trying to rescue four soldires who had been wounded by a booby trap, military spokesmen reported.

title: Miss Margaret Willers Is Affianced
description: Miss Margaret Esther Willers and Robert Creighton Toomey, graduate students at the Sloane Institute of Hospital Administration at Cornell University, plan to be married next June.

title: Victory Star Wins $106,770 Yonkers Futurity in Race Marred by Accident
Taylor Caidwell's Husband
description: BUFFALO, Aug 14. (UPI)Marcus Reback, husband of Taylor Caldwell, the novelist, died yesterday in Buffalo Gen eral Hospital. He was 81 years old. Mr. Reback was his wife's business manager and also han dled her contracts through their firm of Reback & Reback. He was born in Kiev, the Ukraine, and came to the United States in 1910. The couple were mar ried in 1931.

title: AL FATAH SEEKS HELP OF NONPALESTINIANS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug 14Al Fatah, the strongest Arab commando group, appealed to day for nonPalestinian Arabs to loin its ranks.

title: Sister Mary Milroy Dies
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., Aug. 14 Sister Mary Virginia Milroy of the Dominican order, teacher more than 45 years at Mount St. Mary Academy, died Wednesday at the age of 75.

title: Plain Brown Wrappers Are Out
description: A few people still leaf through the pages furtively, glancing from side to side to see if anybody is watching them. And then there was the man from Ohio who hid his copy under five other books before he took them to the cashier in a bookstore.

title: CONED AGAIN CUTS VOLTAGE HERE 5%
description: Hot and muggy weather pushed the power demand in New York City and Westches ter County to near the sum mer's peak yesterday and forced Consolidated Edison and five other utilities in the east ern part of the state to reduce voltage 5 per cent and to ap peal to large users to reduce their consumption of elec tricity.

title: VANO. I. MURADELI, SOVIET COMPOSER
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 14  Vano Ilych Muradeli, a Soviet com poser and music official who during the Stalin era was sharp ly attacked for formalistic writing, died today, in Moscow. His age was 62.

title: ExConvicts Store Burglarized Of Merchandise Worth $1,000
description: The Fortune Store, a non profit shop in Greenwich Vil lage run by exconvicts with merchandise made by excon victs, was burglarized yester day.

title: Canada Financing Computer Industry
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 14The Ca nadian Government will help finance a $56million computer industry to be established in Canada by Control Data Cor poration of Minneapolis, it was announced here today.

title: Johnson Calls Texan A Future President
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Aug. 14 (UPI)Former President Lyn don B. Johnson predicted to night that Lieut. Gov. Ben Barnes of Texas would some day be President.

title: Topics: The Environment and Technology Assessment
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. To save the environment. America will have to make far better use of its technology. Technology assessment in a new form can provide a way to do so.

title: In a Former Biafran Town, Palm Wine Flows Again
description: IFAKALA, Nigeria, Aug. 12The shabby infirmary that houses the sickest people in this Ibo bush town has fewer patients now than it has had in years, and most of Ifakala's young army veterans have left their hiding places to come back home.

title: Article 1  No Title
MISS STACY GAINS JUNIOR GOLF FINAL
description: RYE, N.Y., Aug. 14Hollis Stacy of Savannah, Ga., and Janet Aulisi of WeSt Caldwell, N.J., will meet in the final round of the 22d annual United States Golf Association junior girls golf championship to morrow.

title: Atkinson Says He'll Rejoin Jets, Citing Responsibility to Team
description: Al Atkinson, the middleline backer who retired 10 days ago with a verbal attack on Joe Namath's absence from training camp, will rejoin the New York Jets.

title: Executive Changes
description: Fred S. Crane has been named vice president, operations, for Martin Marietta Corporation's cement and lime division.

title: Calley CourtMartial Postponed; Other Inquiries Started by Army
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Aug. 14 (UPI)  The courtmartial of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr., charged with murdering 102 Vietnamese civilians at Songmy in 1968, was postponed indef initely today.

title: Antiques: Regency Furniture Is Courted
description: English Regency and early Victorian furniture are get ting to be as important as the standard 18thcentury models in the shops where high fashion antique furniture is featured.

title: Finding Identity, Black Nuns Put Soul Into Religious Life
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Aug. 13Sister Juanita Shealey, dressed in a long brown and yellow dashiki, took a sip of wine from a silver chalice, then passed the chalice to the nun standing directly behind her.

title: World War's End Marked
description: FALL RIVER, Mass., Aug. 14 (UPI)Special ceremonies were held today on the main deck of the U.S.S. Massachusetts to mark the 25th anniversary of the end of World War II in the Pacific. Japan surrendered Aug. 14, 1945.

title: France, His Literary Birthplace, Bans Film of Henry Miller Book
description: PARIS, Aug. 14 (AP)France, which first recognized Henry Miller's literary voice, has banned a movie, taken from one of his books, that Customs officials in New York have found acceptable for dis tribution.

title: Edward E. Anderson Dies; Discount Corporation Aide
description: Edward Ewen Anderson, re tired director and senior vice president of the Discount Corpo ration of New York, discount ers of bank and trade accept ances, and trustee of the East River Savings Bank, died Thursday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived here and in East. Hampton, L. I. and Delray, Fla.

title: New Zealand Polo Team Plays at Fairfield Today
description: The New Zealand polo team which has been touring the East will play Fairfield today at the Fairfield County Hunt Club in Westport, Conn., at 3 P.M.

title: Q:
description: Questions of literary interest should be addressed: Queries Editor, The New York Times Book Review, Times Square, New York, N. Y. 10036, and accompanied by a stamped, selfaddressed envelope. The editor will publish those of greatest interest. Others are answered by letter.

title: From the Mail Box
description: Only Eight Lines?

title: Miss Barbara Stewart Sanders Bride of Frank Van Wie Penick
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Aug. 15  Miss Barbara Stewart Sanders and Frank Van Wie Penick, who are computer programers, were married here this afternoon at the Greenfield Hill Congregation al Church.

title: Tricia H. Levine, Richard Bellsey Are Wed Here
description: Miss Tricia Harrison Levine, daughter of Joseph E. Levine, the motion picture producer, and Mrs. Levine of New York and Greenwich, Conn., was married here last night to Richard Alan Belisey, an art director with the J. Walter Thompson Company.

title: Middle Brother Best
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Aug. 15Ch. Tirvelda Middle Brother, a 5yearold Irish setter, was named by Maxwell Riddle as best in show at the 27th annual Finger Lake's Kennel Club show at Cor nell University today.

title: Soviet Assails Bruce's Stand
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 15 (AP)The Soviet newspaper Pravda today accused David K. E. Bruce and his United States negotiating team at the Paris peace talks of stubbornly con tinuing deafness to the known realistic proposals of Hanoi and the Vietcong.

title: Bridal for Dena Parsons
description: NEW HYDE PARK, L. I., Aug. 15The marriage of Miss Dena Parsons, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lou Parsons of Little Neck, Queens, to Jerry Goldman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Goldman of New Hyde Park, took place here tonight in Temple Emanuel. Rabbi Andrew J. Robins performed the cere mony.

title: The folklore look
description: This year the clothes that children will love are madeinAmerica fashions that speak of many lands. Folklore is leaping out of chil dren's books and into their clothes. They like the natural look in fabrics and gay traditional decorations. Fashionable young knees will never, never be bared; they will be covered with pants (even the smallest boys demand long ones), short skirts with tights or midis. Boots and clogs are a must.

title: Pop
description: WEASELS RIPPED MY FLESH: The Mothers of Inven tion (RepriseBi zarre MS 2028). This ap pears to be a collection of miscellaneous Mothers per formances left over from re cording sessions and live concerts from 19671969. Since eclecticism is the very stuff of which Frank Zap pa's music is made, the wide variety of styles, methods, and general musical hilarity does not sound as creatively fragmented as one might ex pect.

title: Pakistani Leader Postpones National Assembly Elections
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 15 President Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan announced today that Pakistan's first general elections on the basis of direct adult franchise would be post poned to Dec. 7 from Oct. 5 be cause of disastrous floods in East Pakistan.

title: SST Engine Is Tested; Debate on Perils Rages
description: A full scale mockup of the jet engine for America's controversial supersonic pas senger plane has taken its position alongside a full scale mockup of the airliner at a Boeing plant in Seattle.

title: Who Makes Music and Where
V.F.W. Withdraws Convention, Citing Lindsay Draft. Remarks
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 15 (AP) The Veterans of Foreign Wars decided today to with draw its 1972 convention from New York City because of re marks by Mayor Lindsay on draft resisters.

title: In Publishing, the Word Is Trouble
description: Along with the rest of the econo my, the publishing trade has been suffering a moderatetosevere case of business dyspepsia thus far in 1970. Though the symptoms are the familiar ones, they exhibit the special aches of a volatile, creative and fiercely competitive industry.

title: Credit Cards ignite Explosion In SalebyMail
description: The manofthehouse opens his front door on a sunny morning on his way to work, his credit cards snug his wallet in case of any unforeseen financial need during the day.

title: Guyana Seeks 51% Control in Mineral Exploitation
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Aug. 15  Prime Minister Forbes Burnham said today that his Government proposed to have not less than 51 per cent par ticipation in exploitation of national resources, especially minerals and forestry.

title: Saratoga Entries
City Bank, Also a School
description: In addition to being one of the largest commercial banks in New York, the First National City Bank also is one of the largest training instiutions in the metropoli tan area.

title: Jane Rosen Betrothed
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Aug. 15Mr. and Mrs. Philip Rosen have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Jane Ellen Rosen, to Elliot Keith Mathias, son of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Mathias of Baldwin.

title: Chargers Subdue Giants, 30 to 27
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. I5The Giants and the Chargers met tonight for the first time in his tory, with a lot of empty seats staring down at them in San Diego Stadium.

title: BULLS BEAT KNIGHTS FOR FIRST TIME, 277
description: HARTFORD. Conn., Aug. 15 The Long Island Bulls, oper ating under their new coach. Allan Webb, trounced the Hart ford Knights, 277, tonight in an Atlantic Coast Football League exhibition game. It was the first time the Bulls heat the Knights after six straight defeats.

title: Decade of Change in South Gives Negroes High Hopes
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C. Robert Gilmore, a heavyset auto mechanic with dark brown skin, smiled broadly and relaxed on the hard wooden bench in the Southern Railway south station. He was on his way back to Philadelphia after a visit with relatives, and he was as happy, as an explorer who had just found a new world.

title: Letter
description: To THE FINANCIAL EDITOR:

title: DAYAN CAPTURES TRADER HORN TROT
description: YONKERS, Aug. 15Dayan snapped a threerace losing streak by capturing the $25,000 Trader Horn Trot before 29,734 harness racing devotees at Yonkers Raceway tonight.

title: BERKELEY TO VOTE ON CURB OF POLICE
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. 14A proposal inspired by the Black Panther party that would turn Berkeley's police over to neigh borhood control has qualified for a place on the November ballot.

title: The Camera as Bank Dick or, Caught in the Act
description: ANY critical commentary on an exhibition of photographs which are not shown be cause they are particularly beautiful or important but be cause they resist convention al esthetic criteria is pat ently gratuitous. Not invalid, mind you, merely gratuitous; and since as a critic I have consistently affirmed the le gitimacy of chance and acci dental art, I can only hope for a little quid pro quono blesse oblige, after all.

title: Jones Gains Pole Position for Watkins Glen Race
description: WATKINS GLEN, N.Y., Aug. 15Factory teams representing Ford's Mustang and American Motors Javelin will fight it out here tomorrow in what, mathe matically, could be the deciding race of the TransAmerican Championship of the Sports Car Club of America. The title could go to Ford, the winner in 1966 and 1967, if one of the two Mustangs wins and the Javelins finish out of the money. The twohour race, ninth of the 11event TransAmerican series for small sedans, will be run over the 2.3mile road course of the Watkins Glen Grand Prix circuit in the Finger Lakes district of upstate New York.

title: Power vs. Pollution: Need It Be A Headon Collision?
description: Power versus of environ ment is the issue of the '70's, Jerome Kretchmer, New York City's Environmental Protection Administrator, said last week as he Warmed for the battle.

title: Four Boardwalk Stores Burned in Wildwood, N. J.
description: WILDWOOD, N.J., Aug. 15 (AP)Fire urned a part of the boardwalk here today and fire men reported they were ham pered by a lick of wafer pressure.

title: Scott H. Reiniger Jr. Weds Mary Gilbert
description: BAY SHORE, L. I., Aug. 15 Miss Mary Louise Gilbert and Scott Hale Reiniger Jr., seniors at Rollins College, were married here today. The ceremony in St. Peter's Epis copal Church was performed by Canon Sydney R. Peters, assisted by the Rev. Allen J. Edmiston.

title: Ford Fund Awards $7Million For Birth Control Work
description: The Ford Foundation has an nounced that it had awarded grants totaling $7,139,603 to United Stales and foreign uni versities and social agencies for research and development of birth control methods and for the training of personnel in volved in birth control work.

title: SINKIANG APPEALS FOR ETHNIC UNITY
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 15 Chinese Communist authorities have expressed new concern about Sovietdirected subver Sion in Sinkiang, China's vast, western frontier region.

title: Texas Flag Law Challenged
description: DALLAS, Aug. 15 (AP)Judge Joe E. Estes dismissed this week in United States Dis trict Court a suit challenging Texas law making it a crime to insult the flag. He ruled that states were allowed to regu late conduct concerning the flag of the United States.

title: Defective Dropped After Police Trial On Bribery Charge
description: Detective Tobia L. Spina has been dismissed from the police force after a departmental trial on charges of conspiring to take $5,000 in illegal reward money from the Montgomery Ward Company.

title: Expo Sets Record for Day
description: OSAKA, Japan, Aug. 15 (AP) A record high of more than 692,000 people braved scattered rains and strong winds from a typhoon to visit Expo '70 to day. Exposition officials re ported. The number of visitors reached 692,602 at 9 P.M., an hour and a half before the fair was to close for the day. As of yesterday, attendance since the fair opened March 15 stnnd at 47,143,018. The fair closes Sept. 13.

title: Many States Are Adopting Stiff Laws to Curb Terror Bombings
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 Tough new laws and regula tions are being proposed and accepted in many states to combat a national increase in terror bombings.

title: Alaska Seafoods To Go Abroad
description: SEATTLE, Wash.  Whit neyFidalgo Seafoods, Inc., has announced plans to serve new markets in the Orient and in Europe with Alaska seafoods shipped in by air. The salmon packer and sea foods processor has leased a new quickfreezing and cold storage plant at the Anchor age International Airport from the Greater Anchorage Development Corporation.

title: RECALL BID STIRS TACOMA COUNCII
description: TACOMA, Wash., Aug. 15 The most acute of the many crises that have erupted from Tacoma's polarized City Coun cil since last November is shaping up for Monday and Tuesday over a movement to recall five of its nine members from office.

title: ROBERT R. BROWN, 47, RCA STAFF WRITER
description: Robert. R. Brown, a senior executive staff writer for the RCA Corporation, died Friday in Doctors Hospital. He was 47 years old.

title: Auto Makers and Oil Industry Get the Lead Out
description: One of the most controversial and far reaching changes in automotive history is about to take place as the auto industry prepares to roll out its 1971model cars next month.

title: FULBRIGHT EXPLAINS COMPLAINER ROLE
description: HOT SPRINGS, Ark., Aug. 15 (AP)  Senator J. W. Fulbright, AitanSas Democrat, explained yesterday his role as a com plainer against national policy as a defense of the system of checks and balances in the na tional Government.

title: Penn Central Calls on Buses
description: The Penn Central announced yesterday that service on its Waterbury branch was being maintained with buses this weekend while the railroad in stalled floodgates at Ansonia, Conn.

title: Wagner at Bayreuth
description: BAYREUTH, Germany.

title: Down the Canal Apiece From Capital Traffic
description: WASHINGTON  Twice a day on week ends and holidays, a 19thcentury scene springs alive in GeorgetoWn when two mules on the towpath pull an oldtime canal barge up the shaded Chesapeake and Ohio Canal.

title: GENETICIST FINDS NEW VITAMIN USE
description: BAR HARBOR. Me. Aug. 14There is a growing list of in herited diseasessome so newly described that pediatricians do not know that they may be de tected in many mysteriously ill infantsthat can often be suc cessfully treated with massive doses Of vitamins, a geneticist reported this week.

title: DELAY ON TALKS HINTED BY ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 15 (Reut ers)A ranking official said to day that Israel was considering whether to slow the next stage of the MiddleEast peace plan as she awaited Washington's reaction to her allegations of Egyptian violations of the week old ceasefire.

title: Miss Stacy Beats Janet Aulisi By 1 Up to Keep Junior Crown
description: RYE, N. Y., Mpg. 15Hollis Stacy of Savannah, Ga., won the 22d annual United States Golf Association junior girls golf championship today.

title: Next Year  If There Is a Next Year
description: THE other day I dropped into the Metropolitan Mu seum of Art to see the 19thCentury America show of paintings, sculpture and decorative arts; and, through a natural sequence of ideas, thought of the recently concluded Newport Music Festival. The artists have it better than the musicians. Here was the mighty Metropolitan Museum throwing its resources behind a project that brought to the public eye a repre sentative series of works by major and minor American artists, and in the process creating a most attractive, nostalgic and valuable exhibition. There is nothing corn parable in music. The equivalents of the Peales, Bier stadts, Eakins, Homers, Binghams and Churches would be composers like Gottschalk, Fry, Heinrich, MacDowell, the Harvard group. But their music is almost never heard, and there is no organization dedicated to bringing it to the public ear.

title: C. Fred Eshelman Jr. Weds Miss Colegrove
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Aug. 15In the Greenville Com munity Church here this after noon, Miss Katherine Reed Colegrove, a junior at Fair leigh Dickinson University, was married to C. Fred Eshelman Jr., who is with the Chemical Bank in New York. The ecumenical cere mony was performed by the Rev. Charles C. Martin of the Presbyterian Church in New town Square, Pa., and the Rev. Edward R. Oehling of St. James Roman Catholic Church in Springfield, N. J.

title: St. Bernard Named Dog Hero of the Year
description: A 180pound St. Bernard, Polar Blue Samaritan von Barri, more familiarly known as Grizzly Bear, from Denali, Alaska, is the dog hero of the year. On Wednesday, his owners, Mr. and Mrs. David Gratias, will receive the KenL Ration gold medal that is awarded annually to the hero.

title: U.S. Business:
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., Aug. 15Scientists have found it economically feasi ble to use the peels and cores of apples and potatoes and the skins and seeds of grapes and tomatoes as cattle feed.

title: Recruiting Found Off at Colleges
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 8  Nationally, accounting and master of business ad ministration graduates have been affected least by a de cline in college recruiting activities, says the Univer sity of Tennessee.

title: AmountofDonations To Fresh Air Fund Off From Last Year
description: Contributions in response to the appeal for the Fresh Air Fund by The New York Times have neared the halfmillion dollar mark but are still $300, 000 short of the 1970 goal of $800,000.

title: Didn't Write It for Radicals!'
description: PLACE this article against a windowpane. You're in for a treat. You have just, wit nessed, in scientific terms, the worth of a newspaper. when seen in the light of day. Ain't much, is it?

title: Exhibitions
description: THE BROOKLYN MUSEUM COMMUNITY GALLERY  Eastern Parkway at Wash ington Avenue, Brooklyn. Images In Color, more than 100 color photos by four photographers. To today. Hours, 10 to 5, weekdays; 1 to 5, Sunday.

description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 15Miss Katharine Daley, daughter of Arthur Daley, sports columnist for The New York Times, and Mrs. Daley, was married in a garden cer emony at the home of her parents here this afternoon to Paul Francis F,ennelly, son of Mr. and Mrs. Earl L. Fen nellv of Frackville, Pa.

title: Soap Box Derby Is Run
description: AKRON Ohio, Aug 15 (AP) Thirteen year old Samuel Gupton of Durham, N. C., best ed 259 other boys in the 33d annual AllAmerican Snap Bnx Derby here today to win $7,500 college scholarship.

title: U. S. Teachers Recruited for Jobs in Australia Face Adjustments in Life and Work
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 11  Mrs. Patricia Steward still glows over the redcarpet treat ment that she and her husband, Lester, received when they ar rived from Arizona a few weaks ago to teach in a rural Aus tralian town.

title: Bronx Policeman Is Seized After Brawl at Queens Bar
description: An offduty patrolman ac cused of pistolwhipping a man in a brawl outside a Queens bar was arrested on a charge of felonious assault early yes terday and was suspended from the force.

title: LORRAINE VICTOR Pa Y.R.A. REGATTA
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Aug. 115Albert R. Pierce 3d, sailing the Shields Class sloop, The resa, and Marvin Kapilow, at the tiller of his Etchells22, Lorraine, were winners of 8.7 mile races on Long Island Sound today during the sea son's 26th Yacht Racing Asso ciation championship regatta.

title: James Neumeister Weds Miss Brooks
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., Aug. 15  Miss Martha Anne Brooks and James Walter Neumeister, May graduates of CarnegieMellon University were married in Christ Epis copal Church here this after noon by the Rev. Mark Sean Sisk.

Arkansan Named to Head Federal Meat Inspection
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (UPI) Dr. Kenneth McEnroe, a consultant for several big Arkansas chicken growing and processing concerns, has been named to a sensitive Govern ment consumer protection post.

title: Syndicate Buys Nijinsky For Record $5.4Million
description: Charles W. Engelhard, the former bomber pilot whose world includes platinum, diplo macy and thoroughbred horses, syndicated his unbeaten 3yearold colt, Nijinsky, yesterday for a record $5.44million.

title: Law
description: ST. LOUISBeing the Attorney General has always entailed so many headaches that it obvious ly irks John N. Mitchell that he has one that didn't trouble any of his predecessorsthe contro versy over the subpoenaing of newsmen's notes.

title: L. I. Hospital Benefit's Goal Is 600 Guests for Dance
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 15When the phone rings in the Hamptons these days, the caller may well be one of the almost 100 committee members who are selling $100acouple tickets to the Aug. 23 cocktail dance at the Nyack Boys School here, which will benefit Southamp ton Hospital.

title: TOP STARS DRAWN TO DOW JONES OPEN
description: Sam Snead and Julius Boros will be part of the formidable field being assembled for the Dow Jones open Aug. 24 to 30 at the Upper Montclair (N. J.) Country Club.

title: Iris A. Gussow Is Bride of Bruce Klatsky
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Aug. 15  Miss Iris Ann Gussow sand Bruce 3. Klatsky, 1970 honor graduates of Western Reserve University, were married here this evening at the Westchester Reform Temple. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Jack Sterns Jr.

title: Inflation Soars In Scandinavia
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (Reuters)  Scandinavian countries are undergoing the fastest rates of consumer price inflation in the indus trial world, according to International Monetary Fund statistics released here.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Kings May Rise and Fall, but The Monarchist League Reigns On
description: LONDON  The official prayer for 1970 of The Monarchist League, which has its headquarters in London and its supporters wherever aristocracy needs a friend, goes like this:

title: When Children Meet Unexpected Warmth In Such a Cold Place
description: KULUSUK, Greenland  The Eskimo children are a deep suntanned color with bright pink cheeks and large dark, Ori ental eyes. Both my children are blond and very fair, and soon the Eskimo youngsters become curiously aggressive, touching them, tugging gently at their pale hair. My son asks what to do. I suggest he touch them in return. Within moments everyone is grinning broadly  an unexpected discovery of warmth in such a cold place.

title: Susan Fletcher, Debutante of '67, Becomes a Bride
description: SEWICKLEY, Pa., Aug. 15 Miss Susan Anne Fletcher and Randolph Post Eddy Jr. were married here this after noon in St. Stephen's Epis copal Church by the Rev. John Guest.

title: Long Island Bulldog Best At Wachusett Club Event
description: HARVARD, Mass., Aug. 15Ch. Westfield Flying Colors, a red and white bulldog from Huntington, L. I., owned by Charles and Virginia Westfield, was named best in show at the Wachusett Kennel Club's 23d fixture on the grounds of the Bromfield High School today in a field of 883 dogs. It was the bulldog's third top award. He also scored at Kenilworth and Rochester. On the way to the top he took his eighth group. As usual, he was shown by Westfield.

title: Suspect, Seized in Threat To Blow Up United Plane
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 15 (UPI)A man accused of threatening to blow up a United Air Lines plane unless he was paid $10,000 was arrested near his home in suburban Carson yesterday.

title: Conservationists Urged to Plead 9th Amendment'
description: Conservationists have been urged in Natural History mag azine by a law professor to use the Ninth Amendment of the Bill of Rights as a weapon to combat abuse of the envi ronment.

title: Barbara L. Muckerman to Be a Bride
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 15Dr. and Mrs. Richard I. C. Muck erman have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Barbara Lee Mucker man, to 2d Lieut. Alfred Joseph Fisher 3d, U.S.A., son of Mr. and Mrs. Fisher Jr. of Grosse Pointe Mich. An early 1971 wedding is planned.

title: SLUGGER'S NO. 27 TIES GAME IN 9TH
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 15 (UN) Lee May drove in five runs tonight with a pair of homers and a oneout 14thinning single that sent Bobby Tolan home with the run that gave the Cincinnati Reds a 54 vic tory over the Philadelphia Phillies.

title: COLT TAKES DASH BY HALF A LENGTH
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 15General admission was $1, a hot dog cost 10 cents, soft drinks sold for five cents and a glass of draft beer was 15 cents. It was a oneday return to the old days, a promotional stunt at Liberty Bell race track de signed to take the customers back to yesteryear.

title: F. GUSTAV MOELLER OF SWEDEN IS DEAD
description: STOCKHOLM, Aug. 15F. Gustav Moeller, one of the developers of Sweden's wel fare state, died today following a short illness. He was 86 years old.

title: NEGRO CAMPAIGNER SLAIN IN MISSISSIPPI
description: WEST POINT, Miss., Aug. 15 (AP)Johnny Thomas, a Clay County antipoverty worker and active in a black candidate's campaign for Mayor, was shot and killed here today.

title: J. ROBERT M'NEIL
description: PINEHURST, N. C., Aug. 15 J. Robert McNeil, a retired vice president and general sales manager of Atlanta Products Corporation, Trenton, N. J., died here yesterday of cander. Mr. McNeil was 62 years old and had lived in Lawrenceville, N. J., before moving here last year.

title: Rahim and Gardner Gain Grass Court Tennis Final
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 15Some youngsters grow up with a basket or a putting green in their backyard. Haroon Rahim had a grass tennis court to share with 14 brothers and sisters in Pakistan. Small wonder then that the 20yearold Rahim, the topseeded foreigner, reached the final of the National Amateur Grass Court Championships today at the Meadow Club.

title: DRUG USER THREATS TOLD BY GREEN BERET
description: FORT BRAGG, N. C. Aug. 15 (UPI)  Capt. Jeffrey Mac Donald, a Green Beret doctor accused of killing his pregnant wife and two daughters here last February, testified at his military hearing today that drug users he had treated threatened his life, his attorney said.

title: Fascell Asks Dumping Ban
description: W ASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP) Representative Dante B. Fas cell, Democrat of Florida, has called for national and inter national measures to prohibit garbage dumping in oceans. The United States and other nations, he said last Tuesday, are dumping oil, sewage, gar bage, dry cleaning fluids, radio active wastes, chemical ef fluents, pesticides and chemical warfare agents.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Washington officials predicted yesterday that the talks between Israel and the Arabs would begin soon, probably this week, despite the current Israeli charges that Egypt had violated the Middle East ceasefire. The officials added that although many missile installations were shifted by Egyptian and Soviet technicians just before the ceasefire, the United States did not have proof that the truce had been deliberately violated. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Field of Travel
description: THE 92d ANNUAL Canadian National Exhibition opens Thursday in Toronto.. It will close Sept. 7. Princess Mar griet of the Netherlands has been invited to officially open the two and onehalf week show. She was born in Cana da during World War II, and this year marks the 25th an niversary of the liberation of the Netherlands with the help of Canadian troops.

title: U.S. Bicycle Racing Championships Wheel Into Town Thursday for 4Day Run
description: New York City will be come the center of American bicycle racing during the Na tional championships to be held here Thursday through Sunday.

title: Air Search Fails to Find Children Lost in Closet
description: MIAMI, Aug. 15 (AP)Lona Collins, 11 years old, and her brother Roger, 8, were reported missing and an allnight search force in cluding one helicopter, one airplane, 35 sheriff's depu ties, 10 volunteer Civil De fense radio operators and assorted police dogs.

title: Son for Mrs. Galanis
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. John Galanis of 985 Fifth Avenue on July 16 in New York Hospital. Mrs. Galanis is the former Miss ChandraCarol Houston, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Woodruff Houston of Westfield, N. J. The child, who is named Jason Wood ruff, is a grandson also of Mrs. Stella Galanis and Peter John Galanis, both of Ipswich, Mass. The infant's father is a general partner in Takara Partners, investment securi ties.

title: Dr. W. R. Brown Jr., Consultant, Weds Jacqueline Tollon Cannon
description: Miss Jacqueline Tollon Can non, daughter of Mrs. Alan McDowell of Pennsauken, N.J., and George Woodward Cannon of Erie, Pa., was married here yesterday to Dr. William Robins Brown Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Brown of Shawnee Mission, Kan. The Rev. Alan B. Mac Killop performed the cere mony in the Episcopal Church of the Resurrection.

title: ISRAEL STILL HOLDS ALGERIAN OFFICIALS
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 15 (Reuters) Israel continued today to hold two top Algerian officials, lead ing to speculation here that they might be used in a prisoner ex change.

title: Celebrations Start Today Honoring Marcus Garvey
description: Celebrations will be held in Harlem today on the eve of Marcus Garvey Day, honoring the man who popularized black nationalism among black masses.

title: Yonkers Entries
Chuvalo Knocks Out Bruce In 2d Round of Yugoslav Bout
description: SARAJEVO, Yugoslavia, Aug. 15 (AP)George Chuvalo, the Canadian heavyweight cham pion, knocked out Mike Bruce of Springfield, Mass., tonight in the second round or a sched uled 10round bout.

title: Scientists Laud Findings of Oceanographic Ship
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Aug. 15In 12 voyages over the last two years, the Glomar Chal lenger has returned so much fundamental knowledge about the floors of the seas and the geology of the earth that her scientific contributions already rank in a class with Darwin's H.M.S. Beagle. She has now even revived speculation about the legendary lost continent of Atlantis.

title: 2 Britons Discern a Sardine Syndrome, Linking Recent Violence to the Pressure of Overpopulation
description: LONDON, Aug. 15 Two British social biologists, differ ing with other scientists as to the origins of tension and ag gression, contend that recent violence is essentially a re sponse to overpopulation.

title: New England Suffers 2d Cutback
description: BOSTON, Aug. 15New England recently suffered its second Naval cutback in two months, with the Boston Naval Shipyard announce ment of a layoff of 1,400 workers at the end of 1970.

title: MOST HAPPY FELLA TAKES ADIOS PACE
description: MEADOW LANDS, Pa., Aug. 15 (AP)Stanley Dancer kept Most Happy Fella in front all the way to win a raceoff with Columbia George tonight and take the fourth running of the Adios Pace at The Meadows.

title: Cheer the Lonesome Traveler; The Life of W. E. B. Du Bois. By Leslie Alexander Lacy. Illustrated by James Barkley. 183 pp. New York: The Dial Press. $4.95. (Ages 12 to 16)
description: Saunders Redding once wrote that the publicationof The Souls of Black Folk perhaps fixed that moment in history when the American Negro be gan to reject the idea of the world's belonging to white people only.. to think of himself... as a potential force in the organization of society. That statement not only describes the significance of W. E. B. Du Bois's most famous hook, it also pinpoints the author's contribution to America and the American black man.

title: Arsenal Ties Everton, 22, in Soccer
description: LONDON, Aug. 15 (Reuters) Everton, the defending cham pion, was held to a 22 tie to day by Arsenal, the holder of the European Fairs Cup, as the English soccer season got un derway.

title: Reader's Report
description: They're not the same people as we are, broods the hero of this freewheeling jape as he pedals his bicycle around Man hattan in search of the truth.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: Burger Proposals on Judiciary Challenged

title: Dirty Is a State of Mind
description: WHAT kind of man would write a twohour show, without in termissions, chock full of scenes of what people apparently want to see today (nudity, fornication, homo sexuality, lesbianism, switchhitting, group gropes) interspersed with scenes of what people think they should see today (blasts against the war in Vietnam, air pollution, water pollution, urban blight, computerized conformity), call it The Dirtiest Show in Town, direct it himself, open it Off Off Broadway at Cafe La Mama, switch it to Off Broad way at the Astor Place Theater and sud denly find himself with the hottest show in town with a top ticket of $10?

title: Miss Donna Jean Hartley Married
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 15  Miss Donna Jean Hartley and Gwynn Crowther 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Crowther Jr. of Sherborn, Mass., were married this af ternoon. The Rev. Sydney R. Pinch performed the cere mony in the First Presbyter ian Church of New Canaan.

title: 3,000 Paid Off at Defunct jersey Bank
description: EATONTOWN, N. J., Aug. 15Nearly 3,000 depositors moved in a slow, twisting line into the building of the defunct Eatontown National Bank today to receive Fed eral Deposit Insurance Cor poration checks that covered most of their deposits.

title: The Nation
description: NEW ORLEANS It is un fortunate that no one thought in 1254, when the Supreme Court set school desegregation in motion, to keep a record of all the last rounds, moppingup exercises, and final assaults on Southern school segregation that were sure to come in the years, decades andwho knowsgen erations ahead.

title: PITTSBURGH TESTS FOR MENINGITIS
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 15Eight children, four to 14 years old, went swimming in a port able pool at St. Clair Village, a housing development here, and later apparently developed a mild form of meningitis. As a result, the Allegheny County Health Department closed all nine of the city's portable swim ming pools this week.

title: Year's Outlook for Cotton Crop Is Favorable
description: The supply of cotton in the crop year that began Aug. 1 will approximate that of a year ago and it is ex pected the price of the staple will remain firm for the com ing year.

title: CITY BRIDGE TEAMS LOSE IN SPINGOLD
Hughes Wins Award
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 15 (UPI)  The Hughes Aircraft Company has obtained two Navy contracts totaling $34.3 million for engineering work on shipboard weapons and missile systems.

title: On Wall Street, Some Fail, All Worry
description: Behind the polished glass and granite facades reflecting the heat of the August sun on Wall Street these days lingers a malaise that is pe culiar for the summer dol drums. It is an uneasiness bred of the long bear market, the slow trading volume of the dog days and renewed concern about the state of the securities industry.

title: GROTE LOSES GAME
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 15  A passed ball by Jerry Grote on a ninthinning strikeout with the bases full, one out and the New York Mets one run ahead, gave the Atlanta Braves two runs and a startling 32 victory over Toni Seaver tonight.

title: Harness Drivers Often Follow in Sons Tracks
description: An unpracticed observer expects the love of parents and children to bc constant and equal; but this kindness seldom continues beyond the years of infancy; in a short time the children become rivals to their parents; benefits are allayed by reproaches, and ,gratitude debased by envy.

title: Ruff Puffs, Vietnamese Militia, Hunt Enemy by Night
description: GIABINH, South Vietnam, Aug. 8  At night, the Ruff Puffs of this village in Trang bang district move out on pa trol, garbed, like the Vietcong, in black pajamalike clothing or in shorts, but armed with American M16 rifles.

title: Princess Anne is 20
description: LONDON, Aug. 15 (AP)Princess Anne celebrated her 20th birthday today aboard the royal yacht Britannia en routs to Balmoral Castle in Scotland.

title: Observer: Looking for an Old Tormentor
description: LONDON, Aug. 15  Charles Dickens was one of those un fortunates whom highschool English teaohers used to teach us to hate, and perhaps still do. Why a child should have to sub mit to A Tale of Two Cities at the onset of puberty is one of those mysteries fathomable only by the pedagogical mind, but for years this was the case.

title: U. S. Marine Gets 5Year Term For Murder of 15 Vietnamese
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, Aug. 15 (AP)An 18yearold United States marine was con victed today of the murder of 15 South Vietnamese women and children in a village south west of here last Feb. 19. He was sentenced to five years in prison.

title: Tennessean Seeks Help for T.V.A.
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 15The Tennessee Valley Au thority has paid into the United States Treasury $823 million Within 10 years. That includes repayments of pow er appropriations and divi dends.

title: KENTUCKY U. ADOPTS STIFF CONDUCT CODE
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Aug. 15The University of Kentucky board of trustees has adopted a more stringent code of student conduct as the result of burning of the R.O.T.C. building after a campus demonstration last May 5.

title: Dodgers Beat Cubs Before 132 Loss
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 15 Billy Williams collected four hitS, including his 34th homer, to pace the Chicago Cubs to a 132 triumph over Los Angeles today after Tom Haller's sacri fice fly accounted for the tie breaking run in the Dodgers 97 openinggame victory.

title: Personality:
description: ELK GROVE TOWNSHIP, Ill.  United Air Lines and its parent holding company, UAL, Inc., have recruited Irving Roth, formerly of the Civil Aeronautics Board, as a vice president and assistant to the senior vice president of finance and property of the airline, and vice presi dent of financial relations of the holding company.

title: MINNESOTA LOSES LEADS IN 2 GAMES
description: BOSTON, Aug. 15 (UPI)Billy Conigliaro's tiebreaking single in the day game and homers by Carl Yastrzemski, Reggie Smith and George Thomas in the night contest enabled the Boston Red Sox to take two games from Minne sota, 53 and 117, and run the Twins losing string to nine.

title: Governor Plays Drum and Cavorts in Surf at 6Riis ParK
description: Governor Rockefeller beat out a samba rhythm on an African drum, cavorted in the surf and helped youngsters build a sand castle during a meetthepeople campaign tour of Jacob Riis Park in Queens yesterday.

title: Ball Scheduled For Centenary Of Yacht Classic
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 15Yachtsmen and international visitors will be honored at the 100th anniversary America's Cup Race Ball at Chateau SurMer, the former Wetmore mansion here, on Sept. 12. The races begin on Sept. 15.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: AFRICAN EXPLAINS THE WITCH DOCTOR
description: An African professor of re ligion told a group of 50 Ameri can teachers of African studies here last week that the popu lar image of a witch doctora man clothed in terrifying gar ments and masks, exorcising sick people, casting spells and forecasting the futurewas an invention of foreign writers.

title: Army Schedules a Hearing On Songmy Murder Charge
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Aug. 15 (UPI)  The Army announced today that the initial pretrial hearing in the case of Specialist 4 Robert W. T'Souvas, who is charged in the Songmy massacre, would be held Aug. 26.

title: WIDE SEA CLAIMS BACKED BY LATINS
description: LIMA, Per Aug. 11Four teen Latin American and Car ibbean countries have declared that all nations have the right to claim as much of the sea and seabed near their coasts as they deem necessary to protect their offshore wealthpresent and potential.

title: CARPENTER FIRST IN BLUE JAY RACE
description: SAYVILLE, L. I., Aug. 15Mike Carpenter of the Quanna towigg Yacht Club, Springfield, Mass., and Roz Whipple of the Manhasset Bay Y. C. were win ners today in the races to de termine the qualifiers for to morrow's competition in the Blue Jay Class national cham pionship.

title: Gov. Williams Scores Campus Inquiry
description: JACKSON, Miss., Aug. 15 (AP)Gov. John Bell Williams charged today that during an inquiry this week into disorders at Jackson State College the President's Commission on Campus Unrest had shown that it was pointedly biased and had encouraged racial animos ity.

title: The Opinion Makers Battle For the Screen
description: THE overriding issue in communications today reduces itself to a sin gle question: How to get access to the television screen? It's going to be the dominant issue for years, as evidenced in Senate hearings on the right of Congress to have automatic TV time for reply to the White House. And with the recent rulings of the Federal Communica tions Commission, petitions and court fights are virtually certain to bloom.

title: Laos: Partial Peace Now Seems Possible
description: SAIGONThe coining of the monsoon rains has once more halted the Communist offensive in Laos by making the supply trails from North Vietnam im passable. By the dreary pattern that the seasons impose upon the war, the time was at hand last week for the government troops and the United States Air Force to reconquer what they lost before the rains.

title: Miss Sheila McConville Is Married
description: ROCHESTER, Aug. 15Miss Sheila Emma McCon ville and Robert. Bellarmine Fane were married this after noon by Msgr. Leslie Whalen in Our Lady of Lourdes Roman Catholic Church in Brighton.

title: Rodeo Cowboy Is Pro in Richest Sense
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo.He is very tired now. Not even a good night's sleep helps.

title: Hunts Point First Stop for New Museum Exhibit
description: Dozens of youngsters from the slums of the Hunts Point section of the Bronx discovered yesterday afternoon how the same design forms were used in children's fingerpainting, baroque sculpture and Far East ern tapestries.

title: Against the Evidence
description: When the dapper gambler Herman Rosenthal strode out of the Hotel Metropole on 43rd Street into a hail of bullets, the case became a 1912 cause clbre that propelled District Attorney Charles S. Whitman into the Governor's chair on the highroad, he hoped, to the White House. Andy Logan's engrossing study shows how in exorably Whitman squeezed every drop of political capital out of the prosecution and al most certainly sent an innocent man to the chair.

title: ... How to Make Things Better
description: Two objectives are vital to reform of the nation's military high command. One is to improve the qual ity of the Pentagon's military advice to the Secre tary of Defense and the President. The other, equally important, is to provide the Secretary with an inde pendent capability for evaluating that advice.

title: Need for Pentagon Reform...
description: A decade that began with the Bay of Pigs and is ending with 400.000 American troops still bogged down in Vietnam has raised disturbing questions about the quality of top Pentagon advice and the way crucial military decisions are made. These matters now have been starkly illuminatedand drastic pro posals made for changein a Presidential panel's exhaustive study of the country's high command and the Defense Department which, it notes, have lost the confidence of a significant segment of the American public.

title: A Bit of a Peeve With a Pet Sculptor
description: LONDON.

title: Advertising Man Breaks New Ground
description: I know about as much about the building business as you know what's going on at the Vatican. I know how to spell the word house.

title: Yankee Records
Memories of Morgan
description: E. M. Forster and my father be came close friends at King's College, Cambridge, where as undergraduates they were both members of a secret society of intellectuals called The Apostles. I do not know why the two of them remained lifelong friends. They were opposites, for my father was a scientist, buried all day in his laboratory, reserved you might have said, with not much time for family life and no small talk. Morgan (as Forster was known to everyone) came to stay with us in Edinburgh, where my father was professor, two or three times a year between the wars, when we were childrenthere were three of us. He joined us most summers for a family holiday in some isolated farmhouse on the rainy shores of the Western Highlands. He also came and went, but less frequently, among the other Apostles of his timethey would all be 91 if they were alive today.

title: Television This Week
description: TODAY SUNDAY, AUGUST 16

title: DEMOCRATS SCORE FUND BILL VETOES
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 15The economic committee of the Democratic Policy Council said today that President Nixon's veto of education and housing spending bills simply has no economic justification as a needed measure against infla tion.

title: Miss Ann Hemelright Fiancee of D.F. Sexton
description: WAVERLY, Pa., Aug. 15The engagement of Miss Ann Hernelright to David Farrington Sexton, son of Mr. and Mrs. Dorrance Sex ton of New York and Lake ville, Conn., has been an nounced by the prospective bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Frank E. Herne!right of Waverly and Ocean Reef, Fla.

title: State Vehicle Chief On Tour to Explain Safety Proposals
description: The State Motor Vehicle Commissioner is traveling across the state to explain his department's proposed new regulations to set strict er standards for mechanics carrying out official inspec tions. If approved, the regu lations would become effec tive Jan. 1, 1972.

title: Miss Virginia Anson Bride of R.H. von Behr
description: COLORA, Md., Aug.15Miss Virginia Monroe Anson and Robert Hans von Behr were married here this after noon at Mount Pleasant United Methodist Church by the Rev. William French.

title: Cabinet Crises, Italian Style
description: ROMEAt the end of Italy's third formal Cabinet crisis in the last 13 months, a mathe matically minded political analyst figured out how much time the country had spent without effec tive government. His tally showed that the comings and goings of premiers and ministers had taken up 199 days in the last 400.

title: Sharon Walsh Keeps Title In U.S. Grass Court Tennis
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 15 (AP)Sharon Walsh of San Rafael, Calif., won the United States girls 18andunder grass court tennis championship to day for the second straight year, defeating Eliza Pande of Palo Alto, Calif., 64, 75, at the Philadelphia Cricket Club.

title: Point of View:
description: The public, if it wishes to be complacent, can consider the Penn Central crisis a healthy incident in the scal ing down of the railroad in dustry made necessary by the rise in use of automobiles, airplanes, buses and barges. It would do better to realize that the Penn Central signals the need for a real reorgan ization  reorganizing the whole structure of the in dustry, not just changing numbers on balance sheets.

title: Bailey Sees Senatorial Primary in Connecticut on Wednesday as a Close Contest
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 15John Bailey, the chairman of the Democratic party in Connecti cut, considered the primary election in his party next Wednesday to select a candi date for the United States Sen ate and said:

title: Criminals At Large
description: In the preDepression dec ade, the imprint of Chelsea House appeared on many vol umes of popular fiction, in cluding detective novels by some of the lesser writers of those pulpy years. The firm vanished from the scene in the early 1930's. Now it has been revived  and we can wel come another book in our genre under its imprimatur: THE ALPINE AFFAIR ($4.95) by JeanFrancois Vignant (a pseudonym for French diplo mat Jean Beliard).

title: Meat Imports Following Plans
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP)Despite a sizable jump during June, meat imports for the year appear to be follow ing a revised projection set by the Nixon Administration six weeks ago.

title: Student Weds Miss Whitney
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 15  The marriage of Miss Claudia Whitney, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Oliver Hills Whitney of Brooklyn Heights, New York, to Guenter Frank enberg took place here today.The bridegroom, son of Mr. and Mrs. Wilhelm Franken berg of Hoexter, West Ger many, was graduated summa cum laude last year from Bowdoin College, where he was a Fulbright scholar, and is studying for a doctorate in international law at the University of Munich in West Germany.

title: David Eisenhower Helps Lay the Keel of Carrier
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., Aug. 15 (AP)Dwight David Eisen hower 2d etched his name on a brass plate today and declared the keel of the nation's newest nuclearpowered aircraft car rier, which will be named for his grandfather, truly and fairly laid.

title: The French Think He's Good When He's Bad
description: SURPRISE. Alain Delon, of all those gangster films, gangster friendships, and a principal in one of France's most sensational murder cases, doesn't look tough at all. In fact, he looks like a slightly dissipated 16yearold boy as he bounces around his suite in the Pierre Hotel in a pink body shirt (twice unbuttoned) and tight brown hiphuggers. He is medium tall and slim as a reed, much less imposing than he appears on the screen. And all those slicked down George Raft hoodlum hairdos that he al ways wears in the movies have been re placed by a longish, fluffy style that curls into his collar. But two things, thank goodness, haven't changed: Those watery blue eyes, which are to France what Paul Newman's are to the United States.

title: FLOYD IN 2D PLACE
description: TULSA, Okla., Aug. 15Dave Stockton, who said he found it good mental exercise, scored a 66 today and gained a three stroke lead with a 54hole aggregate of 206 in the Pro fessional Golfers Association championship.

title: Women's Golf Tourney Draws 60 Champions
description: More than 60 players rep resenting clubs throughout Massachusetts will compete Tuesday in the fifth annual Tournament of Women Golf Champions at the Haverhill (Mass.) Golf and Country Club.

title: Miss Cynthia Russell Married To Herbert Lloyd Shultz Jr.
description: NAVESINK, N. J., Aug. 15 The marriage of Miss Cyn thia Russell to Herbert Lloyd Shultz Jr. took place in All Saints Memorial Epistopal Church here today.

title: Garage Growth In City Raising Planning Issues
description: The desire of many renters of office space for parking facilities inside new office buildings is presenting builders with the need to make hard and costly business decisions and some planners in city government with the sense that city regulations May need revision.

title: ALCATRAZ INDIANS SHORT OF WATER
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 15The occupation of Alcatraz Is land entered its ninth month today with the Indians and the Federal authoritiES locked in another confrontation.

title: BRITISH CHARGE 6 IN BOMBING PLOT
description: LONDON, Aug. 15The po lice charged six men today) with a bombing plot following the seizure of sizable caches of explosives in a series of raids in southwest London Thursday and yesterday.

title: Beverley Anne Robinson Is L. I. Bride
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Aug. 15 Miss Beverley Anne Robin son, daughter of Mrs. James Sadler Wilkie and John Thomas Robinson, was mar ried here this afternoon in Christ Episcopal Church to John Frothingharn Forbes. He is a son of Mr. and Mrs. John Low Forbes of Wellesley, Mass. The Rev. Michael Shir ley performed the ceremony.

title: Margaret Blair Is Bride Of Charles Ives Tyler
description: HYANNIS PORT, Mass., Aug. 15Miss Margaret Oliv er Blair, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alexander Blair, was married here this afternoon at the home of her parents to Charles Ives Tyler, a grand son of the late Charles Ed ward Ives, the composer.

title: DUBOIS'S WIDOW GRANTED U.S. VISA
description: The Department of Justice has reversed itself and notified the widow of W. E. B. DuBois that she may visit the United States next month.

title: PLUMB GREY NEXT IN 1116MILERACE
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 15 (AP)James Cox Brady's Top Round, the favorite, scored her first stakes victory of the year today by beating 12 op ponents in the $29,450 Margate Handicap at Atlantic City Race Course.

title: Tom Clark Is Striving to Speed Justice
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 13  He is still a resourceful man, still fascinated by the law; he is still counted on the progressive side of his profession, too, though it is three years since he sat on the high court and signed his name to the deci sions that made the Warren era.

title: EMPLOYES OF U.S. DROP STRIKE BAN
description: DENVER, Aug. 15Delegates of the American Federation of Government Employes deleted the nostrike clause from their constitution this week but re elected John Griner, their mod erate president, by a wide mar gin.

title: Barbara Sohm Engaged
description: CLIFFSIDE PARK, N. J. Aug. 15Mr. and Mrs. Wil liam Sohm have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Ann Sohm, to Gary Peter Di Cle mente, son of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore Di Clemente of Fairview, N. J. Miss Sohm is an alumna of the Academy of the Holy Angels. Her fiance a graduate of Virginia Poly technic Institute, is national account representative for the Remington Rand Division of the Sperry Rand Corpora tion.

title: Bold Ruler Undergoes Operation for Tumor
description: PARIS, Ky., Aug. 15 (AP)Bold Ruler, the foremost rac ing sire in the world for the last seven years, returned to Claiborne Farm today after an operation to remove a tu mor from his upper nasal passage.

title: SALT: Some Ground Has Been Broken
description: VIENNA  The Vienna phase of the SovietAmerican negotiations on the possible limitation of the nuclear arms race has ended, as expected, without bringing an agree ment, and United States sources even declined to make predictions that such an agreement will be reached in Helsinki, where the talks are to continue between Nov. 2 and Christmas.

title: MUTINY TRIUMPHS IN RESOLUTE SAILING
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Aug. 15Howard Seymour's Mutiny captured Resolute Class honors today as 66 boats sailed with the Port Washingtonl Yacht Club in the Cow Bay area, Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound competi tion.

title: Table for High Tide for Waters Adjacent to New York
IN, AGENCY PLANS POLLUTION STUDY
description: GENEVA, Aug. 15  The World Health Organization will start in December a collection of reports showing the average monthly rate of air pollution in heavily industrialized areas.

title: C'mon, Gang, Come as You Are
description: STOCKHOLM.

title: Keydata, TimeSharing's Phoenix
description: Three years ago the whis pered mention of the words time sharing at any popu lar Wall Street watering hole was enough to attract a horde of investment bank ers offering to buy the speaker the best drink in the house and give him a million dollars. few auestions asked.

title: HOFFMAN SCORES IN 100MILE RACE
description: BLOCK ISLAND, R. I., Aug. 15Thunderhead, a 48foot cut ter owned and skippered by Paul Hoffmann of Mamaroneck, N. Y., was confirmed today as the overall winner of the Storm Trysail Club's Gover nor's Cup East race from Larch mont, N. Y. to Block Island.

title: Luxury Line Cruise Passengers Getting U.S. Bonus
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP) The Government is paying as much as $400 per passenger in Federal aid to finance luxury cruises aboard ocean liners to such exotic ports as Hong Kong, Tahiti, Jamaica and Bora.

title: Three Generals Assigned
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP) Gen. Ralph E. Haines Jr. has been named commanding gen eral of the Continental Army Command, succeeeding Gen. James K. Woolnough, who will retire, the Army said this week. General Hainei will be replaced as commanderinchief, U. S. Army, Pacific, by Gen. William B. Rosson, deputy commander of U. S. forces in Vietnam. General Rosson's post will be taken by Lieut. Gen. Frederick C. Weyand, who has been nom inated for his fourth star.

title: Bonn Looks To East Bloc After Moscow Treaty
description: BONNFor years, German pol iticians have been telling each other that the key to the Ger man problem lies in Moscow. By this, they meant that the So viet Government was chiefly re sponsible for the hardships of division burdening this nation ever since World War II.

title: DR. LUDWIG V. CHIAVACCI
description: Dr. Ludwig V. Chiavacci of 27 West 86th Street a neuro psychiatrist, died Friday in Mount Sinai Hospital.

title: Saudis Hail Truce And Express Hope For Era of Stability
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 15 Saudi Arabia said this week that the Middle Eastern cease fire could be decisive, and voiced hope for an era of sta bility and tranquility in the re gion.

title: Volume and Prices Drop on Amex and Counter
description: I should have taken an other week's vacation.

title: Coins
description: MEET Me in St. Louis will mean more than the tle of a song for collectors this week when they converge on the Gate way to the West for the 79th anniversary convention of the American Numismatic Association. Headquarters for the event is the ChasePark Plaza Hotel in Forest Park.

title: Troops Reported Sealing Off 2 Crimea Towns in Epidemic
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 15 (Reuters) Two Crimean towns have been sealed off by troops be cause of cholera deaths there, according to unofficial reports from travelers. The reports, which identified the towns as Kerch and Yevpatoriya, could not be officially confirmed.

title: Hook Warns of Disaster
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 15The current move toward col lective political action on the nation's college campuses is an invitation to educational dis aster, Dr. Sidney Hook warned tonight.

title: Lebanese Reported Kidnaped
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 15The Government. reported to day tat Israeli troops kidnapped two Lebanese civilians from the border village of Al Dhahir Wednesday night after blowing up three houses there.

title: Canada's Group of 7
description: CANADA on Sept. 18 will honor the fiftieth anniversary of the founding of the Group of Seven, a body of artists whose common interest was the Canadian landscape.

title: ExRepresentative Is 100
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP) Former Representative Mau rice H. Thatcher celebrated his 100th birthday today. The Ken tucky Republican still practices law and retains an active inter est in conservation, philan thropy, genealogy and writing poetry. He represented a Louis ville district from 1923 to 1933.

title: Most Wanted Man Caught
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP) F.B.I. agents captured Ed mund James Devlin, one of the nation's 10 most wanted fugi tives, on a street in downtown Manchester, N. H., tonight. Devlin, 37 years old, is charged along with two other men with taking more than $100,000 in the armed holdup of a Norwalk, Conn., bank Jan. 9, 1969.

title: Rosemary H. Jackson Planning Marriage to Joseph P. Wells
description: NORTH HAVEN, Conn., Aug. 15Richard S. Jack son and Mrs. Werner Muen sterberger of New York have made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Rosemary Herrick Jackson, to Joseph P. Wells, son of Dr. and Mrs. Richard D. Wells of Pittsburgh. The wedding is planned for December.

title: Drag Racers Will Open Meet At Center Moriches on Frida
description: DoubleA fuel dragsters, fuel funny cars and super stock drag racers will make up the three major classes of competition at the Sum mer Nationals drag meet this weekend at New York National Speedway Center Moriches, L.I. This is the larg est meet of the year on the schedule of the American Hot Rod Association. The meet will offer $100,000 in cash and other awards.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Kick and Giggle

title: Grant, Sparkman Victors in Sailing Off Indian Harbor
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 15  James B. Grant's Shields sloop, Blue Belle; Palmer D. Sparkman's Soling, Lulu, and Theodore Fuller's Luders16, Brush, won 6.5mile races off Indian Harbor on Long Island Sound today in the 29th cham pionship regatta of the season for Yacht Racing Association fleets based East of Rye.

title: JETS ARE ROUTED BY FALCONS, 337
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Aug. 15 In perhaps the most en couraging development for Giant fans since Allie Sher man's dismissal as coach, the New York Jets were routed to night by the AtlantaFalcons, 337, for the second worst ex hibition loss in the club's 11year history.

title: Don't Play Dead Before You Have To; By Maio Wojciechowska. 115 pp. New York: Harper & Row. $2.95. (Ages 12 to 16)
description: An unlikable kid named Byron, 14, sits down one evening to start straightening out 5yearold Charlie, for whom he's been hired to sit. Two stories unfold in Byron's mono logues and letters: of growing af fection for his charge; of trying to sort out what life is and what ex actly he's to do with it.
