description: ACROSS

title: ... Confused Intelligence...
description: On top of all that, the panel reported, the quality of Joint Staff officers leaves much to be desired and even worse problemsanalyzed in detail in a classi fied reportexist in the Defense Intelligence Agency (D. I. A.).

title: Business Index Fell in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activ ity fell to 371.9 from 378.6 a week earlier. A year ago was 361.5

title: Paschal, Driving a Javelin, Wins NASCAR Casey 200
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Aug. 15 (AP)Jim Paschal, impervious to the mud, drove his 1970 Jave lin to a sevenlap victory in the second annual NASCAR Grand American Casey 200 today at the North Carolina State Fair grounds track last night.

title: ElectricCar Research Surges in the Antipollution Age
description: The electric carthe dow agers delight of 60 years agois trying once again to challenge Its vulgar rival, the complicated, noisy, dirtybut more efficientinternal combustion engine.

title: Adventure Aloft: Sailplaners Offer Sightseeing Flights
description: WURTSBORO, N.Y.Fly you high, fly you low, anywhere you want to go! A milliondollar thrill for a fivedollar bill!

title: U.S. IS CONFIDENT ON MIDEAST TRUCE AND EARLY TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15United States officials voiced confidence today that the Mid dle East ceasefire would not break down, and they predicted that substantive ArabIsraeli talks would begin soon, prob ably in the coming week.

title: MISS RAWLS'S 69 EARNS GOLF LEAD
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 15 (AP)Betsy Rawls, playing in a long sleeved turtle neck pullover to protect her from the sun, card ed a threeunderpar 69 today for a twoday total of 138 and a twostroke lead after the sec ond round of the Buckeye In vitation golf tournament.

title: Pierce Sails Theresa to Shields Class Victory
description: The rowing championships of the National Association of Amateur Oarsmen will have an international flavor next week end on the Cooper River course at Collingswood, N.J. West Ger many, New Zealand, Australia and Canada have entered crews.

title: Women's Rights Bill: A Boon or a Threat?
description: WASHINGTONIs it a pro tection for women, or a form of discrimination against them, that in Utah they are forbidden by law to hold any job that requires them to carry anything that weighs more than 15 pounds, which is less than the weight of an average sixmonthold baby?

title: BLIGHT EPIDEMIC PERILS CORN CROP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15An epidemic of a new strain of plant disease is sweeping the American corn farms with potentially devastating results.

title: Mideast 3: No Guerrilla CeaseFire
description: BEIRUT  In Beirut coffee houses and dusty Amman offices last week, Arab guerrillas were giving all corners the message of the moment: La waqf itlak al nar  No to the ceasefire. The continuing guerrilla raids on the first days of the Suez truce made clear that their intention was to violate the ceasefire, and to keep violating it, as an Al Fatah man put it in Amman. Their hope was to create enough tumult to cause the ceasefire to break down.

title: Weather Outlook: MidAugust to MidSeptember
description: These charts, based on information supplied by the U.S. Weather Bureau, show for the next 30 days expected departures from normal temperatures and from normal precipitation. Normal temperatures for this period for five key cities are as follows: New York, 72.3; Chicago, 68.2; Denver, 67.9; San Francisco, 63.2; Anchorage, 52.7.

title: Ban on TV Cigarette Ads Could Halt Free Spots Against Smoking
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 The antismoking messages on television that are generally thought to have brought about part of the downturn in ciga rette sales will be reduced to insignificance or taken off the air entirely next year when tobacco commercials are banned from broadcasting, unless the Federal Communications Com mission orders otherwise.

title: Eileen R. Kohl Plans Nuptials
description: SCARSDLE, N. Y., Aug. 15Dr. and Mrs. Schuyler G. Kohl have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Eileen Ray Kohl, to Eric Roger Kaufman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Solomon Kaufman of New York. The wedding is planned for next month.

title: Protection Is Key To New Trade Bill
description: WASHINGTON  The House Ways and Means Committee last week approved the most exten sive rewriting of the nation's foreign trade law in at least eight years and possibly in the whole postwar perioda rewrit ing weighted heavily on the side of protectionism.

title: RODRIGO GOMEZ
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 15 (AP)  Rodrigo Gomez, a former executive director of the Inter national Monetary Fund, died of a heart attack yesterday after undergoing surgery. He was 72 years old.

title: Booming Burglar Alarm Industry Finds That Fear of Crime Pays
description: In New Orleans, the police department has an alarm on its property room to keep stolen items from being stolen again. A police spokesman declines to say what kind it is, lest felony be compounded.

title: August Full Moon
description: There is a full moon tonight, the August full moon, and though it is the last summer full moon by one way of reckoning  the next one will be the Harvest Moon, only a week before the autumn equinox  it still has midsummer roundness and midsummer glow. It is so summermellow, this August full moon, that it almost gives the lie to the katydids that certainly will be adding their monotonous rasp to the insect chorus in the night. The katydids are announcing that summer frays away, that frost is coming.

title: Art Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Teacher Weds Miss Phillips,
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Aug. 15Miss Heather Storm Phillips, former instructor in sociology. at Wells College, and Forrest Godfrey Read 3d,s professor of English at the University of North Carolina, were married here this afternoon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Douglad McMillen, friends of the brideethom.

title: $100,000 in Travel Checks Lost by American Express
description: Negotiable American Express travelers checks totaling $100, 000 have been missing since last Thursday from the company's subbasement vault area at 65 Broadway, the police reported yesterday.

title: Folsom Heads Officials Of E.C.A.C. Basketball
description: C. Clarke Folsom, a colle giate basketball official for the past 14 seasons, has been named Supervisor of Basket ball Officials for the Eastern College Athletic Conference. He succeeds John Nucatola, who resigned recently to be come Director of Officials of the National Basketball Asso ciation.

title: Aviation Agency Hunts 48,000 Small Planes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP)The Federal Aviation Administration says it is trying to track down some 48,000 small aircraft.

title: To Treat A Disturbed Person, Treat His Family
description: BOTTLED UP by neurosis, this family is shown under the benign gaze of Dr. Nathan Ackerman, grandpa of family therapy. Today more and more fam ilies go to the therapist as a unit rather than as individuals. Latest technique (if the family can stand it): calling in the neighbors to help with the cure. (The family pictured here is actually composed of professional models.)

title: Hustled, HarriedBut Happy
description: TANGIER, Morocco  I was pushed, shoved and herded from the ship and swallowed by the swarms of Arabs mill ing about the dock. Hey, Miss, you want good hotel? No? You want taxi or maybe black market money? You no like hash, I get you pot. I carry suit case for you, O.K.?

title: Home Improvement
description: SQUARE carpet tiles that can be pasted down with a special adhesive, or with a doublefaced adhesive tape, have been available for some time now but one company has re cently introduced a new in novation  carpet tiles that come in a Moorishshaped outline, instead of in squares.

title: Bondsman for Rap Brown To Lose Motel and Car
description: SNOW HILL, Md., Aug. 15 (AP) The Howard County prosecutor has seized a bail motel and a 1970 Cadillac to pay for the $10,000 bond that H. Rap Brown forfeited when he failed to appear for his riot and arson trail.

title: Bridge
description: ALMOST all bridge experts are well above average in intelli gence. A few have an I.Q. well above 150, soaring into the genius level where measurement becomes inac curate. Two of the men who would be on any short list of the world's most intelligent bridge players were in opposition recently on the dia gramed deal in a tournament in Deau ville, France, and the result was a fine battle of wits.

title: Physicist Weds Susan Gordon
description: NEW LONDON, N. H., Aug. 15Miss Susan Brooks Gor don, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank H. Gordon of Scarsdale, N. Y., and Georges Mills, N. H., was married here this afternoon to Gene Dubois Venable, son of Mr. and Mrs. John D. Venable of West Orange, N. J.

title: Mideast 2: Nasser Sees Things Going His Way
description: CAIRO  President Nasser has long been convinced that the United States holds the key to a nonmilitary Middle East set tlement because of its political and economic influence over Is rael and its role as Israel's prin cipal arms supplier. Last week it appeared to Egyptians that for the first time the American key was being used.

title: The Paper Folds in Oshkosh
description: OSHKOSH, Wis., Aug. 15 (AP)The Paper, one of Wis consin's three morning newspa pers, announced today that it Iwould cease daily publication land become a twiceaweek, free newspaper. The Paper, with a circulation of 23,581, be gan publication in 1967. Eco nomic reasons were cited for its demise.

title: Critical Look At the Regulatory Agencies
description: WASHINGTONIn its report last year to President Nixon on the weaknesses of the Federal Trade Commission, the Amer ican Bar Association stated: If the proposals in this report are ever to be implemented, and if the F.T.C. is to fulfill the role we believe it can play, it must have the continuous vigorous support of the President and Congress. The first important manifestation of that support should be the appointment of a commission chairman with ex ecutive ability, knowledge of the tasks Congress has entrusted to the agency, and sufficient strength and independence to resist pressures from Congress, the Executive Branch, or the business community that tend to cripple effective performance by the F.T.C.

title: Nancy Elizabeth Dotterer Is Bride
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 15Miss Nancy Elizabeth Dot terer, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Charles S. Dotterer, was married here today to Lin coln Pierce Field, son of Mr. and Mrs. Spencer Field of Milton, Mass.

title: Governors They Talk But Does Anybody Listen?
description: OSAGE BEACH, Mo.  The widely held theory that the whole is always equal to the sum of its parts sometimes collapses when applied to the exercise of political power.

title: Football Opponents of Rutgers Find Pellowski a Punishing Foe
description: Would a man who admitted ly likes to punish people, but who has worked for four of the last five summers at a camp for braindamaged children, be thought a schizophrenic? Prob ably so, unless one considers that the people Mike Pellowski likes to punish are opposing football players who also would like to do the same to him.

title: Sports Today
Parts of 6 Tennessee Laws Held Unconstitutional
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 15 A panel of three Federal judges has ruled that parts of six state, criminal statutes, under which 22 persons, includ ing University of Tennessee students, were arrested Jan. 15, are unconstitutional.

title: In The Nation: Every Day in Every Way, Etc.
description: WASHINGTONIn a survey of world leaders, Dr. Gallup has found that an overwhelm ing majority of them believe that life for most people in the world is improving. A lot of Americans, who hadn't known, should be relieved to hear this.

title: JOHN H. RATH
description: CRANFORD, N. J., Aug. 15John H. Rath of 7 LaSalle Ave nue, former head of the ac counting department of the Western Electric Company in Kearny, died yeSterday at the Alexian Brothers Hospital in Elizabeth. He was 80 years old.

title: Survey by UNESCO Criticizes Schools Educational Wastage
description: PARIS, Aug. 15Half the world's schoolchildren either do not get a seventhgrade edu cation or repeat one to three grades along the way, accord ing to a survey carried out by the Nnited Nations Education al, Scientific and Cultural Or ganization.

title: Veterans Hail Daily News
description: HOLLYWOOD, Fla., Aug. 16 (AP)The Americanism Media Award was presented to The New York Daiy News by the Catholic War Veterans at the concluding session of the group's 35th annual convention here today The News was hon ored for more than 100 articles last year on American history and for others that the veterans organization said encouraged respect for the American Flag.

title: Small Dailies Show Gain
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 15 (AP)Small daily newspapers in the Middle West made larger ad vertising gains in the first half of 1970 than papers of larger circulations, the Inland Daily Press Association said this week. Dailies averaging a 12, 000 circulation showed a 4.9 per cent increase of retail line age over 1969, the association said, while dailies averaging 27,000 gained 2.9 per cent in retail advertising.

title: Students Bar Protest Plan
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 15 (AP)After three hours of debate the 23d annual congress of the Na tional Student Association voted down early today a proposal calling for nonviolent civil dis obedience and for paralyzing Washington, D. C., May 1 unless the Vietnam war was ended. The vote was 150 to 134.

title: Judy Gay Macdonald Is Married
description: KENILWORTH, III., Aug. 15 Miss Judy Gay Macdonald, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Malcolm R. Macdonald Jr. of Wilmette, was married at the Holy Comforter Episcopal Church here today to James Rulon Young Rawson, son of Dr. and Mrs. Rulon W. Raw son of Short Hills, N. J.

title: Minor Leagues
Bombs at 2 Stores Injure 16 in Suburb of Columbus
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 15 (UPI)Bombs exploded almost simultaneously in two depart ment stores in suburban White hall tonight and 16 sticks of dynamite were found in a third store in the vicinity, according to the police. At least 16 per sons were injured.

title: HEAT AND SMOG ENGULF THE CITY
description: Heat, humidity and smog made yesterday unpleasant for those New Yorkers who had no airconditioning units and were unable to leave the city or get to the beaches.

title: U.S. Equestrian Team's Work At Shows in Europe Is Lauded
description: GLADSTONE, N. J., Aug. 15The performance of the United States Equestrian Team in this year's tour of European shows was highly satisfactory to Bert de Nem ethy, the coach of the squad for the last 15 years.

title: KAVALEK IS LEADING IN U.S. CHESS OPEN
description: BOSTON, Aug. 15At the end of the sixth roundthe halfway markLubomil Kava lek of Washington, a former champion of Czechoslovakia, led the 71st annual United States Open Chess Champion ship as a result of his victory last night over John Graves of Oakland, Calif., at the Parker House.

title: Trenton Community Aiding in House Sales
description: A community of upper middleincome homeowners ?? Trenton is taking upon itself the task of selling homes in the neighborhood.

title: CHURCH CREATES APARTMENTS HERE
description: In the face of government red tap and the alleged apathy of a number of churches and synagogues on the West Side, an Episcopal church at 26 West 84th Street has begun its own program to renovate seven di lapidated apartment houses with city funds.

description: TODAY

title: CUELLAR, ORIOLES, SUBDUES A'S, 7 TO 1
description: OAKLAND, Aug. 15 (UPI)Mery Rettenmund drove in three runs with his 14th homer and two singles and Andy Etche barren batted in two with three singles and a walk today to lead the Baltimore Orioles to a 71 victory over the Oakland Athletics.

title: A Jungle In the House
description: The ancient Romans began the year with March, which seems more sensible because the weather was bound to start improving. Thus begins this amiable, often humorous, and thoughtprovoking book.

title: Lifeguards Strike Briefly At Upstate Park Facilities
description: Lifeguards struck at swim ming facilities of the Palisades Interstate Park Commission and the Taconic Park Commission yesterday morning, but voted to return to work early yesterday afternoon, the union represent ing them reported.

description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 15 (UPI) Police Chief James F. Ahern of New Haven, a member of the President's Commission on Campus Disorders, rebuked Governor Williams today for his criticism of the commis sion.

title: Agnew Said to Have Urged Reagan for Vice President
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 15 (AP)Spiro T. Agnew once suggested that Gov. Ronald Reagan accept the vicepresi dential nomination at the 1968 Republican national conven tion, Mr. Reagan's former pri vate secretary says in a book published today.

title: Mets Records
Article 7  No Title
Polanski, Tynan And Macbeth
description: DIRECTOR Roman Po lanski and writer Kenneth Tynan have been secretly brush ing up their Shakespeare. So much so, in fact, that they have decided to get together and make a movie out of Macbeth. Theirs will not be the first cinematic version of the Bard's tale of those mur derous, mismated malcon tents, but Polanski and Ty nan promise that it will be one of the most unorthodox. Though they are skimpy on the details of just how it will differ from previous produc tions, the boys have already completed their adaptation and it should go before the cameras on location in Eng land in October.

title: Church in the Philippines Plans Resettlement Village for Poor
description: MANILA, Aug. 15The hier archy of the Roman Catholic Church here plans to establish a milliondollar resettlement project for poor squatters in the Manila area.

title: Trash Mountain Urged. For City Grand Slalom
description: City Council President San ford D. Garelik proposed yes terday that the city dispose of millions bf tons of refuse by turning it into a ski mountaina mile long and 2,500 feet high.

title: Article 4  No Title
INQUIRY IS ASKED ON BISTATE UNITS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15A new effort to get Congress to look into the affairs of inter state agencies, including the Port of New York Authority, was started today by Represen tative Benjamin S. Rosenthal, Democrat of Queens.

title: Advertising:
description: When Frank J. Shake speare Jr. took over as di rector of the United States Information Agency, after a long career in broadcasting, people familiar with that Government operation ex pected there would be a new emphasis on television to help sell the American way of life.

title: 5 Enter L.I.U. Dorm And Shoot Student; 2d Man Is Wounded
description: Five young men entered a Long Island University dormi tory Friday night and shot a student, then crossed the street and shot another man who was sitting on his stoop, according to the police, who could give no reason for the shootings.

title: FRONTON PLAYERS FORM U.S. GROUP
description: The formation of the United States Fronton Athletic Associa tion, Inc., dedicated to the de velopment and competitive pro motion of fronton sports in the United States, has been an nounced by Richard C. Squires, president.

title: Israeli Pilot Repatriated After Leg Is Amputated
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. I5An Is raeli Phantom pilot whose leg was amputated in Egyptian captivity was repatriated to day.

title: PLASTIC SURGEONS END WORLD PARLEY
description: In an effort to pool the knowledge and techniques of surgeons throughout the world the American Academy of Facial Plastic and Reconstructive Sur gery held its first international symposium at the Waldorf As toria Hotel last week bringing together 700 doctors including almost 200 from foreign coun tries.

title: Offices to Provide Data on Benefits FOr Elderly Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15The establishment of information of fices in local communities to in form the elderl poor of econo mic and social services avaiwble to them was recommended this week by the National Council on the Aging.

title: Young Painter Is Teaching the Elderly
description: That Joseph Breed Jr. teaches painting probably would not surprise the G.I.'s who served with him three years ago at Tonsonnhut Air Base in South Vietnam.

title: One Emerges a Little Scorched, But...
description: THERE are movies about violence, and then there are violent mov ies. Performancethat perfect, poisonous cine matic floweris a violent movie. Thematically, its violence is of two kinds, literal and, if you will, socialpsychological, these being the respective styles of the two main characters the sadistic, perfectionist gangster's thug played by James Fox and the endlessly elusive, polymorphous re tired rock star played (or, rather, incarnated) by Mick Jagger. Furthermore, it has a script (by codirector Donald Carmel!) drenched in a sort of romantic essence of violence and a fantastic job of cinematography (by codirector Nicholas Roeg) whose relentless, flashing, jarring virtuosity is guar anteed to give you a headache, if not a case of mai de mer. It is not a movie for everybody, but it is a very exciting movie and, for those who do not necessarily include sweetness and light in their definitions of beauty, even a very beautiful one, as well.

title: Sihanouk Aides to Be Tried
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 15 (AP)The Government an nounced today that 32 people would be tried in absentia for treason on charges of com plicity with Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the deposed Chief of State. The defendants will in clude Prince Sihanouk's wife, Monique, and Penn Nouth, pre mier in Prince Sihanouk's exile government in Peking. The trial will begin on Monday.

title: Fishers Island, State Anomaly, Renews Suffolk County Links
description: FISHERS ISLAND, L.I., Aug. 15Sea gulls settle here in winter and society in summer. Their forces are joined occa sionally by deer who swim here from the eastern Connecticut shore, a couple of miles to the north, and by Long Island town and county officials who travel) two hours by boat to make their annual pilgrimage as they did this week.

title: Flight to Pluto to Open Doors Here
description: Future space programs are pushing the development of longlife materials and sys tems.

title: Penn State Announces Home Football Sellouts
description: Penn State football is as sured of another perfect sea son in 1970at least at the box office.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: THE spate of statistics showered at midmonth on an emotionally drained business community mayor may notmean an end to the yearlong business down turn. They speak with greater certainty to the chang ing nature of the slowdown. The consumer, whose faltering confidence and inability to keep pace with rising prices led the way to reduced business activity, has begun buying again. The businessman, who refused for many months to believe that a downturn was hand, is continuing to cut back.

description: Ca. Donald Barthelme? How come?

description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 15 (UPI)The grin spread, wrap ping a wrinkle or two around the eyes, and a hand moved along the side of the jaw to the china familiar gesture.

title: Suzanne C. Neil Becomes Bride Of P.L. Sheridan
description: OAK BLUFFS, Mass., Aug. 15Miss Suzanne Chamhliss Neil, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Franklin Neil of the adjacent Martha's Vineyard community of East Chop and Flanders, N.J., was married here today to Philip Lee Sheridan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert E. Sheridan of Colum bus, Ohio.

title: Fanfreluche Wins at Saratoga; Missile Belle 11th in Field of 12
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 15Fanfreluche, a speedy visitor from Canada, raced off with the honors in the $59,100 Alabama Stakes today. The daughter of Northern Dancer had the riding guidance of Canadianborn Ron Turcotte in the 114 mile test for 3yearold fillies, in which she opposed 11 rivals.

title: A life led as a work of art
description: There has never been a little mag azine like The Little Review, which was borp in Chicago in 1914 and died in Paris in 1929. Between those two prophetic dates it managed to publish for the first time so many beautiful.

title: Major Changes For Post Office
description: Among the various devices credited to Benjamin Franklin is the Post Office emblem a Colonial postrider in full gallophe is said to have designed while serving as Post master General from July, 1775, to November, 1776, under the Continental Congress. Last week, Mr. Franklin's emblem was replaced by a new one (see right).

title: U.S. and Canada Weigh Problem of Alaskan Oil
description: The tanker Manhattan, con queror of the Arctic, is now plying the warmer waters of the Persian Gulf but the de bate still flourishes on whether her pioneering ef fort has really opened up the iceclogged arteries of the Northwest Passage to com mercial shipping.

title: Theodorakis: I Am a Symbol Of Power
description: HE is more Zorba than Anthony Quinn ever could have imagined. But more Zorbamore Greekin the real sense, not in the travel folder fantasystyle of Quinn's over blown caricature.

title: Pilgrim's Issue On November 21
description: THREE hundred and fif ty years ago, come Dec. 21, a band of dis sident Protestants ended a perilous journey from Plymouth, England, setting foot on a huge gran ite rock in a new and un known land. The boulder, left on the shore more than likely by the retreating ice cap that had covered the area centuries before, is our Plymouth Rock, celebrated as the point at which the Pilgrims established the first permanent British commu nity in New England, the second British community in North America. (The first British settlement was estab lished in Jamestown, Va., in 1607. Both were pre dated by Spain's establishment of a colony, now St. Augustine, Fla., more than 400 years ago, the first permanent Eu ropean settlement in what is now the United States.

title: Ford and Al Jackson To Pilot Sandlotters
description: Whitey Ford, a product of local sandlot baseball, will make his debut as a manager at the Yankee Stadium to morrow night by leading the Junior Yankees in an allstar sandlot game against the Junior mets.

title: A Love Letter From Tokyo
description: PERHAPS theater be gins where the possi ble leaves off. There is a passage in Golden Bat, the warm and mothlight and altogether winning Japanese rock en tertainment that is now liter ally leaping over the heads of customers at the Sheridan Square Playhouse, in which the effect produced is out of all proportion to any pos sible excuse for it.

title: Major League Baseball
description: American League

title: FACTORY TO MOVE TO A SMALL TOWN
description: SAN MARCOS, Tex., Aug. 15 Traffic, tax, transportation and pollution problems have led a small manufacturing plant's employes to vote to move to a small town where their bigcity salaries will reach somewhat further.

title: Livestock Data
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP)The Agriculture De partment has prepared a color slide series that may be useful to livestock groups, farm organizations and others interested in United States grades for slaughter steers.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Plans for a 38story office tower in the financial district have been quietly set aside by Lehman Broth ers and two partners in the face of high construction costs and a slumping rental market.

title: Florida G.O.P. Candidate Lists Spending at $1Million So Far
description: JERSBURG, Fla., Aug. 15Jack M. Eckerd, who con trols a $184million complex of drug and department stores and aspires to be Governor of Flor ida, has reported spending nearly $1million while seeking the Republican nomination. The figure is 25 times more than the highest reported expendi ture of any previous Florida G.O.P. candidate for any office.

title: Pendleton's Jewel Takes Best in Show
description: EASTON, Md., Aug. 15  A 4yearold Maltese, Ch. Pendle ton's Jewel, owned by Mr. and Mrs. Norman White of Youngs town, Ohio, was named best of 1,003 dogs at the Talbot Ken nel Club's show on the grounds of the Elks Club today.

title: Nigeria Will Oust or Retire Her ProBiafran Employes
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Aug. 15 (Reuters)Nigeria will dismiss or retire all Government em ployes who backed the Biafran secessionist movement.

title: Political Conservation Group Is Campaigning for 13 Congressional Candidates
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15When Marion Edey was a polit ical science major at Reed Col lege in Oregon, she wrote her senior thesis on the Federal Wildlife Service, concluding that it was exterminating coy otes and other predators be cause of pressure from sheep ranchers and, in the process, upsetting the ecology in the West.

title: Sodding Seems Simple Enough
description: SOD OR SEED?. This is one of the major questions homeowners face. There are advantages to both methods. From an economic point of view, seeding is a far less expensive way to establish a lawn than sodding. Sod ranges between 10 to 15 cents'per square foot and if installation is re quired, add another 15 to 20 cents per square foot.

title: U.N. TEAMS MAN 3 MIDEAST LINES
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 15The renewal of the Middle Eastern ceasefire has focused new attention on the United Nations observer offi cers who report on violations.

title: MISS ROST SCORES IN HUNTER CLASS
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., Aug, 15 At 13 years of age, Robin Rost probably is the most ver satile junior rider in the East, switching from Western, to ponies, to hunters, to jumpers with equal facility.

title: Job Changes:
description: William L. Lurie has been elected a vice president of the General Electric Com pany.

title: GRETEL II, FRANCE WILL SAIL FRIDAY
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 15Sparring sessions will give way to slugging matches on the America's CUD scene next week.

description: IRBID, Jordan, Aug. 15The Israeli Air Force struck an al ready ruined and deserted Jor danian Army headquarters here yesterday in what appeared to be a warning attack.

title: SCHOOL FUND CUT THREATENS POOR

title: Sluggish Housing Market Is Pervasive in the Suburbs
description: ESSEX, Conn.From the townhouse district on Man hattah's East Side through the Outer boroughs and the nearby suburbs into the spa cious exurban reaches 100 miles and more from Times Square, the market in home sales is uniformly sluggish.

title: Hirohito, 25 Years After Surrender, Prays for Peace
description: TOKYO, Aug. 15Bells tolled, at noon today throughout a nation bursting with prosperity, and some citizens bent their heads in silent prayer while others went about their busi ness, either not knowing or not caring that 25 years ago this day Japan surrendered in World War II.

title: Janice Copenhaver Wed to Per Jonas
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., Aug. 15 The Rev. Dr. Charles Leon ard Copenhaver, senior min ister of the Reformed Church of Bronxville, and Mrs. Copenhaver invited the en tire congregation (3,200 mem bers) to the wedding at the church this afternoon of their only daughter, Miss Janice Bernice Copenhaver, to Per Erwin Jonas, and to the re ception that followed in the church cloisters.

title: Eastern Europe Displays Nationalist Tendencies Under the Soviet Aegis
description: WARSAWGeneral de Gaulle should take a trip through East ern Europe. In almost every capital he could exclaim: I told you so.

title: Group to Study Molten Salt
description: OAK RIDGE, Tenn., Aug. 15  Twentyone companies nationally  six industrial companies and 15 electric utilitieshave formed an in dependent group to evaluate molten salt reactor technol ogy as a possibility for com mercial nuclear power.

title: Hanoi Accuses Japanese
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 15 (Reu ters)North Vietnam today ac cused Japan of continuing on the path of aggression pursued by the bloodthirsty Japanese fascists in World War II. In an article marking the 25th an niversary of Japan's defeat in the war, the official Hanoi daily Nhan Dan said the United States has revived Japanese militarism.

title: Elizabeth A. Heath Prospective Bride
description: SUMMIT, N.J., Aug. 15The engagement of Mrs. Elizabeth Ann Heath, to H/3 Elizabeth Ann Heath, to H/3 Lee Robert Muth Jr., U.S.N., has been announced by her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Donald P. Heath: The future bride groom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Muth of Harrisburg, Pa.

title: Sea and garden meet
description: To everything? it was said in Ecclesiastes, there is a sea son. And summer is just aboUt the ultimate for blending the things of the soil and the sealobster and crab and shrimp and parsley, tarragon, chives and, when available, fresh chervil. These are the ingredients for a seafood salad with the mixture of fresh seasonings that French menus refer to as fines herbes. Although parsley, tarragon and chives are relatively well known in America, chervil is not. It rarely can be obtained outside home gardens. Fortunately, it is not absolutely essential to the excellence of this seafood salad.

title: Eastern Asks More Routes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 (AP) Eastern Airlines has asked the Civil Aronautics Board for a series of new routes to Mex ico. They include the addition of Atlanta and Acapulco to the airline's present route be tween Washington, New Or leans and Mexico City.

title: KEYON TAKES LEAD IN TITLE SAILING
description: SAYVILLE, L. I., Aug. 15Doug Kenyon of Webster, Mass., with a fourth and two second place finishes, took the lead to day in the series to determine the Flying Dutchman Class Re gional championship.

title: TOKYO
description: A HODGEPODGE of the brash and the fastidious. All the 20thcentury neon and westernization that you notice first glance becomes, at a closer look, a counterpoint to the old and picturesque sights and sounds of every avenue and alley. Sandwiched between two steelandglass skyscrapers stands an ancient Shinto shrine. The honking of automobile horns alternates with the tinkling of a bicycle bell that the noodle man rings as he peddles his wares.

title: Miss Mary Ellen Keeffe Wed In Capital to Stephen Sawyer
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15Miss Mary Ellen Keeffe, who spent nine years as a Roman Catholic nun, and Stephen Leslie Sawyer were married here this afternoon at Georgetown's Holy Trinity Roman Catholic Church.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONBy a typical Washington anomaly, the Coun cil on Environmental Quality, which formally set up in busi ness only last March. was re quired to produce its initial annual report last week.

title: Rudel and Soloists Join in Animating A Salute to Mozart
description: With Julius Rudel conduct ing and with solo contributions by Hans RichterHaaser, the German pianist, and Theodore Weis, trumpeter of the New York Chamber Orchestra, the Mostly Mozart Festival con cert at Philharmonic Hall on Friday night offered an agree able mix of works by Mozart and Haydn.

title: Cameras Helping Children Learn to Read
description: Deborah Hires is 9 years old, a secondgrade pupil in Brook lyn's predominantly black Bed fordStuyvesant section. She says little and when she walks down the street she glues her self to one side of her com panion.

title: Benjie on His Own; By Joan M. Lexau. Illustrated by Don Bolognese. Unpaged. New York: The Dial Press. $3.95. (Ages 4 to 8)
description: Six years ago Joan Lexau and Don Bolognese produced Benjie, about a shy Harlem boy who lived with his grandmother in a one room apartment. It had the stamp of gen uineness, with living, believable chil dren. Now Benjie has returned, old enough to have started school and to feel ashamed that his Granny in sists on bringing him there and back.

title: W. E. Riddleberger Weds Moira Carney
description: IRVINGTON, N. Y., Aug. 15The marriage of Miss Moira Gae Carney, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Edward M. Carney of Irvington and Madison, Conn., to William Ernest Riddleberger, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Riddle berger of Lewistown, Pa., took place here this morn ing in the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception. The Rev. Thom as Leonard performed the ceremony.

title: Parsons: Tight Money, Regulators and Falling Stocks
description: DETROIT  Tight money, tumbling stock prices and most of all a tougher stance by Federal regulatory agen cies closed a chapter in the saga of Donald H. Parsons last week.

title: The World
description: JERUSALEMMore than 100, 000 religious Jews massed at the Wailing Wall last Tuesday night to begin their solemn lamenta tions over the destruction of the Temple, according to the rabbin ical calendar, exactly 1,900 years ago. By week's end there were nonobservant Jews as well join ing in a more secular lament, over what they regard as the threatened destruction of the figurative temple of modern Israel.

title: Medicine
description: Cholera, a disease previously confined to relatively primitive countries, was revealed last week to have struck the southern resort area of the Soviet Union. As a result, some cities on the Black and Caspian seas were preventively quarantined.

title: Tupamaros Wage a Grim Battle
description: MONTEVIDEO  For the past few years the stunts and tactics of the Tupamaros Uruguay's urban guerrillashave earned them a reputa tion in Latin America for whimsy and wit as well as bloodletting. The Tupamaros have purloined secret tiles from businesses and court houses to turn up evidence of wrongdoing by Government officials to embarrass them. They have occasionally killed policemen, but usually only in gunfights started by police.

title: ... Circumventing the Law...
description: Theoretically, under the 1958 amendments to the National Security Act, the Secretary of Defenseas a designee of the CommanderinChief, the President exercises direct command of the nation's combat forces, all assigned to unified theater commands. The individual services and their chiefs of staff are sup posedly removed from the chain of command.

title: New York
description: When the prison was first con structed in 1840 a few blocks from its present site, New York ers of the time thought it re sembled an ancient Egyptian burial crypt  a tomb. So they called it Me Tombs.

title: Wyoming Fire Airlift
description: CODY, Wyo., Aug. 15 (UPI)Helicopters airlifted 225 fire fighters into the rugged moun tain country of the Shoshone National Forest today to con tain a forest fire that had de stroyed more than 1,000 acres. The fire, situated about 30 miles west of Cody, was termed by the authorities as the worst in Wyoming in four years.

title: Dominican Leader Begins New Term Today as Slayings Rise
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Domin ican Republic, Aug. 15Syste matic assassination of young political radicals by Dominican security forces has been going on for several weeks here as President Joaquin Baraguer pre pares to begin a second fouryear term tomorrow.

title: Police Infiltrators Assist in Raid on HighStakes Private Gambling Club in Hotel Penthouse Here
description: A few minutes after a blonde and a longhaired young man sat down early yesterday at a table with 18 other people to play blackjack with $1,000 worth of chips each, the police broke up the game with a raid on a private illegal club atop the Shelton Towers Hotel.

title: JOHN A. WAGNER
description: MERRICK, LI., Aug. 15John A. Wagner, editor of the house organ of Todd Shipyards Corporation, died last night at his home, apparently of a heart attack. He was 46 years old and lived at 1868 Horatio Ave nue.

title: Israeli Yachtsmen Retain World Crown in 420 Class
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 15 (UPI)Israel won the David Tweed Cup, emblematic of the 420 Class world yachting champion ships today, defeating France in the final race in winds gust ing to 17 knots.

title: K.R. LaVoy Jr. And Mrs. Ely Wed in Jersey
description: BAY HEAD, N. J., Aug. 15 Mrs. Lucilla Carmichael Ely of Upper Montclair, widow of Hanson E. Ely 3d, and Ken neth R. LaVoy Jr. of Mont clair, were married here to day in All Saints Episcopal Church by the Right Rev. Frederick J. Warnecke, Bishop, of the Episcopal Diocese of Bethlehem, Pa.

title: Black humor more black than humorous
description: A coat of black humor covers multitude of sins in Bruce Friedman's third novel. The writing in The Dick is deadpan, a fashionable euphemism for flat and clumsy. The action is pinned together with de pendent clauses of the meanwhile, back at the ranch variety. Again and again, in a single paragraph, the plot will suddenly desert its pace and chronology to pursue a situation to a punchline. The language is an awk ward basic English, the Gee, fellers schlemiel appeal that is Jerry Lewis's trademark.

title: Child to the Charneys
description: A daughter was born to Dr. and Mrs. Alan Norman Charney of New York on Aug. 2 at the New York Ly ingIn Hospital. Mrs. Charney is the former Miss Susan Rae Lamer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Morris Lamer of New York. Dr. Charney is in re sidency at Jacobi Hospital in the Bronx.

title: the travelers world
description: WHEN THE Federal Aviation Adminis tration revised the approach and take off patterns for the three New York City airports a few weeks ago, the re action in the Village of East Hills, N. Y., was immediate and according to pattern, East Hills runs uphill and down on the north shore of Long Island about 20 miles by parkway northwest of Ken nedy Airport, about 2% minutes from touchdown by a jet plane with wheels and flaps down on its final approach to runway 422.

title: Garbage Piles Up in Sydney As Workers Go on Strike
description: SYDNEY, Aug. 15Garbage piled up in Sydney streets to day after 1,600 municipal em ployes struck for more pay.

title: $5,867,000 Is Realized at Spa Sales
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 15  The FasigTipton yearling sales reached a gross figure of $5,867,000, making it the second highest in the his tory of the local vendue.

title: Warsaw Fights Traffic Congestion in Its Restored Old Quarter
description: WARSAW, Aug. I5Warsaw, rebuilt from ruins after World War II, is acting to preserve its most historic sector from a postwar scourgetraffic con gestion.

title: A Report from the Combat Zone
description: THE Wars of the Roses were waged for 30 years, so perhaps I should not complain. My Battles With the Lawn have lasted a mere 23.

title: 670 IN JAILS HERE TO GO TO OSSINING
description: Governor Rockefeller yester day approved a recommenda tion for the removal of 670 New York City prisoners to the Ossining Correctional Facility to help relieve overcrowded conditions in city jails.

title: Czech Leaders at Rally
description: PRAGUE, Aug. 15 (Reuters) Gustav Husak, the Czechoslo vak party leader, and President Ludvik Svoboda today watched Soviet troops carrying out mili tary exercises in Czechoslo vakia and then attended a friendship rally with them.

title: Shirley H. Griggs Is Married In Wilmington to Bruce Bradley
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Aug. I5The wedding here today of Miss Shirley Hopkins Griggs, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John E. Griggs, to Bruce Edmund Bradley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Truman Bradley of Pelham Manor, N.Y., com bined tradition with modern day informality. The Rev. David Kaminsky performed the ceremony in the West minster Presbyterian Church.

title: Nixon Flies to Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., Aug, 15 (UPI)President Nixon flew today to Camp David, the Presi dential retreat in western Mary land, for an overnight stay.

title: When Josef Wants a Martini, Make Sure He Gets Extra Gin
description: MR. BERNARD, please check at the Trans World Airlines information coun ter in the departure lounge. The sum mons resonated from the loudspeakers in London Airport at about 3 o'clock one recent afternoon. Josef Bernard, a curlyhaired 26yearold New Yorker who was returning home from a year in Europe. went to the information desk. Flight 703 was ready for boarding at Gate 13, they told him.

title: New and Recommended
description: FICTION

title: ARABS UNITY PLAN SUFFERS SETBACK
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 9An ambitious program for a uni fied Arab offensive against Israel has suffered a crippling setback as a result of President Gamal Abdel Nasser's accept ance last month of the United States peace initiative in the Middle East.

title: Mild medicine for a serious sickness
description: Samuel Lubell, the pollster, ven tures in his latest book to tell us what ails us and what to do about it. As public opinion analysis, the book is useful, but as prescription it's an aspirin tablet. When Lubell tries to take up the responsibilities of doctor of society, he just fusses around in his personal medicine cabi net of opinions.

title: No Flying in The House; By Betty Brock. Illustrated by Wallace Tripp. 139 pp. New York: Harper & Row. $3.95. (Ages 8 to 11)
description: What child hasn't wondered, Who are my true parents"? Annabel, 6, has honest cause for wonder, for she doesn't remember her parents and their whereabouts is a mystery. She is being very well taken care of in Mrs. Vancourt's big, com fortable house, but the one who really mothers her is a little dog, only three inches high and three inches long, named Gloria. Gloria is wise, fiercely protective, she knows 369 tricks, and she can talk. Inshort, Gloria is a fairy.

title: Lindsay Fills Five Vacancies On Board of Higher Education
description: Five new members were ap pointed yesterday to the 21 member Board of Higher Edu cation by Mayor Lindsay.

title: Lebanon Sanctions Communists
description: BEIRUT, Aug. 15 (AP)The Lebanese Communist party was given official au thorization today to operate freely  the first sanction in its 50 years of existence. In terior Minister Kamal Jam blatt, announcing the decision, said it was meant to rein force democratic liberties and freedoms.

title: A look back at the Weimar Republic The Cry Was, Down With was System
description: TO understand their own troubled times, to find comfort and guid ance, men and women always look to the past. The American Revo lutionists turned to 17thcentury Eng land, the militants of 1793 drew in spiration from revolutionary episodes in Roman history, the 19thcentury decadents were fascinated by the de cline of the Roman Empire. Such immersion in the past is only partly motivated by a thirst for knowledge; at least equally strong is the desire to find proofs and arguments to support political beliefs already held. As Ana tole France said about one of his heroes: He looks in the history books only for the sottises which he al ready knows. But the invocation of the spirit of the past is no less inter esting for the mythmaking involved.

title: COAST HYDRO RACE GOES TO WISHNICK
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Aug. 15 (AP)Bill Wishnick of Ncw York piloted his twinenginc Boss O'Nova an average of 63 miles an hour today to capture the $5,000 Hennessey Cup Race and clinch the American Power boat Association offshore na tional division championship.

title: Yonkers Results
SUIT FOR $8.5MILLION CHARGES POLLUTION
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 15 (AP)An $8.5million antipollution suit has been filed in Circuit Court against the National Lead Company on behalf of 350 workers who say they became ill as a result of emissions from the firm's titanium plant.

title: French to Consider Bill To Legalize Prostitution
description: PARIS, Aug. 15 (AP)A group of Gaullist members of Parliament will begin work on a bill next month that could bring back the houses of prostitution banned in France since 1946

title: Woman Pro Treated Like One of the Boys
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Aug. 15 (AP)  Professional football's first woman player got into a game for three plays to night and on the very first one the 122pound school teacher was clobbered by a 235pound linebacker.

title: A Partial Lunar Eclipse Will Be Visible Tonight
description: A partial lunar eclipse will begin tonight and be visible over most of North and South America, a Hayden Planetarium official said yesterday.

title: Jerusalem Arabs Moves Show Insecurity During Truce Period
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 15Arab residents of East Jerusalem set into motion, from the first news of the ceasefire last weekend, a series of symbolic gestures to dissociate themselves from the Israeli municipal government.

title: World Bank Will Double Aid for Transportation
description: The World Bank is plan ning to double its program of loans and credits in the transportation sector in 1970 74, compared with the pre vious fiveyear period: High ways will get the lion's share.

title: Hirohito No Longer a SemiDivine Emperor, but a Secure One
description: TOKYO, Aug. 15  Twenty five years ago this noon the faltering, highpitched voice of a single man touched the lives of every one of his nearly 80 million countrymen, by telling them that he had decided toi accept the Allied powers del mand for the unconditional suri render of Japan.

title: Chess
description: WITH a powerful repeat perform ance, 17yearold Kenneth Rog off of Rochester, N. Y., captured first place in the fifth annual invitation United States junior cham pionship.

title: Soil Fumigants Solve Problems
description: MANY lawns are invaded by weeds such as annual bluegrass (Poa annua) which the common selective herbicides will not con trol. Others have been destroyed by insects or disease. If these are the rea sons why a new lawn is planned, con sider the use of a soil fumigant. Many of the problems can be reduced if the soil is sterilized before seed is planted or sod laid.

title: JOHN WAYNE AIDS CALIFORNIA G.O.P.
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 15California Republicans are using yet another big name from Hollywood this year In an effort to strengthen their holds on both houses of the state legislature.

title: Hickel Defends Washington Planning
description: Secretary of the Interior Walter 3. Hickel has come out punching, rhetorically, against big corporation's disparage ment of the city planning of Washington, D.C.

title: A Priest Speaks From Underground
description: DANIEL BERRIGAN, S. J., the ecu menical pimpernel of the peace movement, was present in Los Angeles last weekin voice and spirit if not in underground flesh. His play, The Trial of the Catonsville Nine, was performed with grace and fire by New Theater for Now at the Mark Taper Forum, the brain of the Music Center theatrical complex. Any F.B.I. agents in the audience, hoping to seize Berrigan and transport him to Federal prison to serve the threeyear sentence he is currently avoiding, might well have come away enlightened even if emptyhanded. [Last Tuesdaytwo days after the play closed Berrigan was, in fact, apprehended by FBI agents in Rhode Island.]

title: Radio
description: 88:30 A.M., WPAT: Adventures in Judaism. Gateway to Amer ica, featuring the voices of Zero Mostel, Molly Picon and Nora Bayes in songs and stories from AmericanJewish literature.

title: Not for the Airports This Time
description: WHEN it comes to trying to reach a critical judg ment on contemporary African artand by this I mean African African, not American Africanthe critic is subject to multiple confusions. If an African artist is trying to emulate European standards, how much allowance must you make for the technical awkwardness and the stale avantgardism that would make the work unacceptable from a European or Ameri can artist but are inevitable in the process of African art's catching up with the twentieth centurynot to mention its having entered this century in one jump across all the other centuries that separate us from the modes of tribal life? Or if the artist is trying to continue a native tradition of which he feels himself genuinely a living part, then how can an American or European observer be pre sumptuous enough to ten him where he succeeds or fails?

title: Hanoi Newspapers Give Much Space To Nonwar Topics
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Aug. 15 (Agence FrancePresse)De spite the war, Hanoi's news papers devote much of their space to sports literature, painting and food.

title: Recordings
description: IF you had never heard Glenn Gould play Bach in person, his recordings of The WellTempered Clavier would surely be too good to believe. Those re markably candid explanations in print of how he and friendly engineers work over the tapes, snipping out a nicely accented couple of notes here and grafting them to the fugal flesh of an intri cate passage there, might pre dispose the listener to suspect that the live Glenn Gould would be just another excel lent musician.

title: KIIHNKE, BUNGERT CAPTURE DOUBLES
description: DUESSELDORF, West Ger many (Reuters), Aug 15Chris tian Kuhnke and Wilhelm Bun gert gave West Germany an un expected 21 lead over Spain today, by winning the doubles in their Davis Cup interzone tennis final.

title: Visiting Teachers Praise U.S. Students
description: Impressions of the United States by teachers from abroad who saw this country for the first time indicate that there were few surprises except for a feeling that the average Amer ican is far more friendly at home than when he is traveling abroad.

title: Calendar of Horse Show Events
description: Today  Monmouth County, Wolf Hill Farm adjacent to Mon mouth Park Race Track, Ocean port, N. J. Championships in all divisions. 8:30 A.M.

title: Mrs. Andrea Anderson Is Remarried
description: Mrs. Andrea Harron An derson of New York was married here yesterday after noon to John Sculley 3d, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Sculley Jr. of St. James, L. I., and Bailey's Bay, Bermuda. The bride's parents are Mrs. Phyllis West Harron of Shel ly Bay, Bermuda, and Essex, Conn., and Hal Ingham Har ron of Lausanne, Switzer land.

title: In Memoriam
description: ACKERGussleThroughout the 10 years you've been gone you grow deeper & deeper In our hearts and thoughts. Your loved Ones

title: Headliners
description: For four months the Rev.. Daniel Berrigan was hidden from the F.B.I. by friends in various places. He published artieles and gave interviews, saying that he was evading arrest because he refused to submit to a system that he contendedwas conducting an illegal war. He surfaced dramatically twicein at Cornell University where he had been a chaplain; and again earlier this month at a church in Philadelphia. But list week Father Berrigan, the fugitive priest of the peace movement, was finally caught. F.B.I. men posing as bird watchers found him at a friend's home on Block Island off Rhode Island. Opening the door, the 49yearold Jesuit and poet said to the agents: You may wonder who I am. I'm Daniel Berrigan. Then he Went off to join his younger brother, the Rev. Philip Berrigan; who had. been caught and jailed in April. The brothers Berrigan Were among nine Catholic war protesters convicted of destroying draft, files with homemade napalm in Catonsville, Md.

title: Ellsworth Buck Is Dead at 78; House Member From 1944 to '49
description: CRIVITZ, Wis., Aug. 15Ellsworth B. Buck, a former United States Representative from New York and president of the New York City Board of Education in the nineteen forties, died yesterday at his ranch here. He was 78 years old and also lived at 245 Bene dict Road, Dongan Hills, S.I.

title: YACHT RACE COES TO NIGHTINGALE
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 15 Stephen Nightingale of Noro ton Yacht Club sailed Red Dob to victory off Riverside Y.C. to day in the first race of the 17th annual Long Island Sound Lightning Class championship for fleets from City Island to The Race.

title: Spotlight:
description: In Milwaukee, they call the company MAGIC. Truly, there may be something magical about the Mortgage Guaranty Insurance Corpora tion of Milwaukee, which was started in 1957 by a local lawyer there named Max H. Karl who didn't have much capital, but who had unbounded faith in the op portunity for a private corn pany that would guarantee mortgage lenders against loss.

title: LAYER AND TAYLOR ADVANCE TO FINAL
description: TORONTO, Aug. 15 (AP)Roger Taylor of England and Rod Laver of Australia ad vanced today to the final of the $23,000 Canadian open ten nis championship.

title: Paid Blood Donors Opposed
description: BOSTON, Aug. 15 (AP)The medical director of the Massa chusetts Red Cross blood pro gram has asked the national Red Cross organization to set up a nationwide system of vol unteer donations, and phase out all commercial blood banks. Dr. Allan Klirnan said Thurs day that his proposal was (patients to protect donors and patients from careless labora ?? ??

title: ANTITANK SYSTEM DESIGNED BY BONN
description: BONN, Aug. 15West Ger man technologists are develop ing a technique of laying anti tank minefields with rocket launchers that some Defense Ministry strategists believe may mark the end of conventional tank warfare. Other strategists are skeptical about the system.

title: Behind the Scenes at Newport
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 15A bill for $236, Heritage's towel bill, arrives at the Florida yacht's Vernon Court Camp. Charlie Morgan Jr. signs the outgoing $236 check with a quick. unconcerned flourish.

title: Fred Doubles Singleton Family Name
description: When Ken Singleton, the New York Mets outfielder, was growing up in a one family stucco house at 409 Seneca Avenue in Mount Vernon, N.Y., he played stickball, a game at which most New York, young sters show proficiency.

title: The Queen was sold into slavery
description: It is hard to classify this exceed ingly valuable book, nor perhaps is there any necessity to do so. It deals with the transshipment on a slaver of an early 19thcentury West Afri can Queen Mother to Bahia in Brazil:

title: Wyoming Fire Controlled
description: CODY, Wyo., Aug 15 (UPI)Firefighters, most of them air lifted into the rugged moun tains two at a time by helicop ter, today got under control a fire that had destroyed nearly 1.00 acres of timber and grass land in three days in the Sho shone National Forest.

title: Barbara E. Jones Is Married in Park
description: Miss Barbara Elizabeth Jones, a programeranalyst with Donaldson Lufkin & Jen rette Inc., investment bank ers here, and Lawrence Henry Cooke Jr., an economist with the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, were married here yesterday in Central Park.

title: DOLPHINS DEFEAT BENGALIS, 20 TO 10
description: MIAMI, Aug. 15 (AP)Bob Griese's passing punctured Cin cinnati for two early touch downs tonight and the Miami Dolphins beat the Bengals, 2010, before 60,460 fans in the Orange Bowl.

title: T.V.A. Plan Aims To Limit Pollution At Alabama Plant
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 15 The Tennessee Valley Au thority has decided to design and install sulphur dioxide re moval equipment on a 500,000 kilowatt generating unit at its Widows Creek Steam Plant in northeast Alabama.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: On High Road to Lechdhu
description: HALKIRK, Scotland Creeping through the dark, rambling halls of Lochdhu Lodge, the bittersweet odor of peat burning in the draw ingroom fireplace evoked memories.

title: Janet Sue Gage Engineer's Bride
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Aug. 15  Miss Janet Sue Gage was married here this after noon to Thomas Peter Schweitzer in the Hitchcock Presbyterian Church.

title: Police Complain to F.A.A. About Stunting Pilot Here
description: The police filed a formal complaint yesterday against a Bronx man who, they say, put a singleengine plane through some wild maneuvers over Manhattan on Friday night. The complaint was, made to the Federal Aviation Administra tion because two New York City police helicopter pilots found that they had no jurisdic tion over the light plane when they followed it. to Teterboro Airport in New Jersey.

title: NEW YORK TEAMS WIN RELAY RACES
description: New York teams won all three championship races at the Amateur Athletic Union's na tional relay championship track meet yesterday on St. John's University's allweather track.

title: Arab Command Changes
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 15 (Reu ters)Informed sources said to day that Gen. Mohammed Faw zi, the Egyptian War Minister and commander of all Arab troops on both fronts with Is rael, had relinquished command of the eastern front.

title: Along the Straw Hat Trail
description: CENTRAL PARKThe New York Shake speare Festival. Tues., King Henry VI, Part 1; Wed., Thurs. King Henry Vi, Part 2; Fri., Sat., Richard 111.

title: State Official Is Arrested In Albany on Bribe Charge
description: ALBANY, Aug. 15An offi cial of the State Motor Vehicles Department was arrested today on a felony charge of accepting a bribe.

title: Dance
description: SPEAKING professionally, a critic makes an ideal, if not a practice, of be ing pretty much of a cold fish. If the man is any good at all he will be deeply involved, concerned and committed to the art he is serving. But the out come of any particular eve ning is of small concern to him. Of course, if he is human (and a surprisingly high per dentage of critics are) he wants this promising young playwright to be successful, and he may well glory in the expressive majesty of that veteran pianist, but generally speaking, not too much is at stake.

title: Marine Art Is Riding Wave of Success
description: Commissioning has as sumed a new proportion in boating.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  There has been much hot talk on both sides all year but last week, in the space of three days, it suddenly and rather starkly became clear how much is riding on the quite different interpretations by a Republican President and a Democratic Congress as to whoand whatis responsible for the inflationary malaise gripping the nation.

title: On firstname terms with Stalin
description: Joseph is Joseph Vissarionovich Djugashvili, known to the Czarist secret police and to his fellow Bolshe viks as (among other names) Koba, Soso andthe name by which he became known to the world and to historythe Man of Steel. Stalin.

title: EGYPTIANS CHARGE BAGFUL OF TRICKS
description: CAIRO, Aug. 15The eighth day of the 90day Middle East ceasefire ticked away today. with efforts toward indirect ne gotiations of the conflict stalled by Israeli accusations of move ments of Egyptian antiaircraft missiles into the Suez Canal combat zone.

title: DR. KING'S GROUP SHOWS NEW MOOD
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 15 (UPI)The mood of the Southern Christian Leadership Confer ence has taken on a militancy far different from that in the early days of civil disobedience under the late Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Greenland: They Don't Bother Taking a T.H.I.
description: NARSARSSUAK, GreenlandOn a hot humid, polluted August day in. New York, when thoughts of overheated radi ators and sweaty steering wheels filled my head, I thought of a nearfreezing paradise that could relieve me of my pressures andchill me to the very bone. A place like, say, Greenland. The fan tasy took hold for a moment, but then I was honked back into reality by an irate motorist. The twomonth (July and August) tourist season in Greenland had already begun, anyway, and the impera tive need for advance reservations seemed to preclude my going there.

title: Dance Programs
description: Today

title: Lindsay Tankoos Wed in Darien To Gregory James Geelhood
description: DARIEN, Conn., Aug. 15St. Luke's Episcopal Church was the setting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Lindsay Tankoos to Gregory James Geelhood, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth Louis Geelhood of North brook, Ill., formerly of Darien.

title: Jonathan Colby Of Yale Marries Susan E. Rinks
description: GROSSE POINTE FARMS, Mich., Aug. 15Miss Susan Elbridge Hinks, who received a Master of Arts in teaching degree this month from Yale University, was married in Christ Episcopal Church here this afternoon to Jonathan Elbridge Colby, a senior at the Yale Law School. The ecumenical ceremany was performed by the Rev. Arnold Fenton, rector of Christ Church, and the Rev. James Smith, Roman Catholic chaplain at Yale.

title: Article 1  No Title
Scientists Honored
description: PAPUA and New Guinea is host this month to the 42d Australian New Zealand Associ ation for the Advancement of Science (ANZAAS), at Port Moresby.

title: Mary Rose Conway Planning Nuptials

Y., Aug. 15An International gath ering of scientists and business men concerned with atomic en ergy in effect told an increas ingly hostile public this week that it would have to choose between airconditioners, dish washers, television sets and garbage disposals on the one hand and, on the other, greater responsibility for the effectsnotably environmental pollu tionof increased power de mands.

Y., Aug. 15Miss Rebecca MacMillan Fox, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ed ward Whiting Fox, was mar ried at her parents home here this morning to Thomas Jerome Leach, son of the Rev. and Mrs. Wilbur Cleon Leach of New York. description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Aug. 15Mr. and Mrs. Frank W. Hall have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Suzanne Louise Hall, to Brian Chafin, son of Mr and Mrs. Everett W. Chafin of Copake, N. Y. A wedding next July is planned.

title: NEW RUSSIAN AIDE IN CHINA FOR TALK

title: One revolutionary impulse
description: It comes as something of a sur prise that the similarities among these four books are greater than the differences. All four treat the same subject  the revolutionary impulse in black Americans, its causes and its possible cures. Though two of thebooks, Black Nationalism in Ameri ca and The Rediscovery of Black Nationalism, put the subject into a wider historical context than the oth ers, all four pursue the same thesis, which states in essence that through out their history in America, black people have manifested varieties of nationalist sentiment. The books could scarcely have been more com plementary had that been the intent of their editors (two of whom, Bracey and Brisbane, are black).

title: ?? of Thanks
description: WAGERSamuel. The Wager family wishes to express their deep appreciation and thanks to all their relatives and friends for their many kindnesses and the beautiful tributes to their beloved husband, father, grandfather, and brother, the late Sam Wager.

title: CHAMOUN ENTERS RACE IN LEBANON
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 15Lebanon's noisy presidential election campaign gained deci bels yesterday when Camille Chamoun, President during the 1958 civil war, announced his candidacy.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 15 The Nixon Administration has been around long enough now so that, if you don't mind get ting in a fight, you can gener alize about its personality.

title: MORE NATURAL GAS IS SOUGHT FOR USE IN EASTERN STATES
description: The utility commissioners of eight Eastern states have ap pealed to Secretary of the In terior Walter J. Hickel to re plenish the nation's dwindling reserves of natural gas by fos tering a more rapid of develop ment of new supplies.

title: Trailer Hitch Rules Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (UPI)The Department of Transportation has proposed new rules to require that ball andsocket hitches on cars tow ing trailers be equipped with couplings and safety chains meeting certain minimum speci fications. The proposed rules would also require auto makers to advise car buyers about the types of trailer hitches avail able and recommend ways to attach them.

description: CAMBRIDGE JUNCTION, Mich., Aug. 16 (UPI)Charlie Glotzbach profited from Cale Yarborough's misfortune today and won the Yankee 400mile stock car race at Michigan In ternational Speedway, his first major NASCAR victory in two years.

description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 16Steel mills report sluggish order entry but surprisingly heavy shipments.

description: CROTON, N.Y., Aug. 16 A band of New York State troopers waded into the shal low waters of the New Cro ton Reservoir last night to ar rest 57 young persons on as sorted drug charges as the youths were gathered around campfire on a small pinewood ed island under a full moon.

description: LONDON, Aug. 16 (AP)Air Chief Marshal Sir Norman H. Bottom ley, Deputy Chief of the Royal Air Force Staff for most of World War II and adminis trative director of the British Broadcasting Corporation from 1948 to 1956, died Thursday at the age of 79.

title: ALASKA GOVERNOR FACES CLOSE VOTE
description: ANCHORAGE, Aug. 16Gov ernor Keith H. Miller is thought to be in serious trouble as Alaska faces its most important election in 12 years of state hood on Aug. 25.

description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Aug. 16 The chief political adviser of Mayor Lindsay of New York called here today for the estab lishment of a new political center to restructure the na tion's priorities and revitalize whatshe termed a failing style of politics and government.

title: GAS OVERCOMES 7 IN BROOKLYN FLAT

description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 16 (AP) Johnny Bench, the National League's runsbattedin leader, drove in three runs and Tony Cloninger, the winning pitcher, added a homer as the Cincin nati Reds, defeated the Phila delphia Phillies, 42, today.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: The current discussions about increasing the generating ca pacity of Consolidated Edison Company consider expansion only within the distribution area of the company. This limitation is shortsighted. Pro jections of the Northeast Regional Advisory Commission to the Federal Power Commis sion show an increase in peak demand for the New York City Load Area from 7.35 billion watts in 1970 to 21 billion watts in 1990.

title: More Landing Rights for El Al In U.S. to Be Asked by Israel
description: Israel will seek to open nego tiations with the United States next winter to obtain landing rights for El Al, Israel's state owned airline in American cities besides New York, accord ing to the president of El Al.

title: AUSTRALIAN PACT AIDS BOSTON PORT
description: The ancient port of Boston celebrated a milestone last week in its recovery from years of decline as an inter national trading center. The Massachusetts Port Authority announced an agreement with Associated Container Trans portation to open a fortnightly service to Australia and New Zealand next April.

title: Motorcyclist Runs Down Suspect in Ohio Bombing
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 16 (AP)A motorcyclist who braved pistol fire to run down a gunman was credited today with bringing to an end a robbery attempt in which bombs were set off in two department stores, apparent ly as diversions for robbery, the police said.

title: Personal Finance: Property Seizures
description: Beverly Laprease is poor. She has a sick husband and 10 children. They all live on welfare in upstate Syracuse.

title: F.B.I. ENTERS HUNT FOR ANGELA DAVIS
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., Aug. 16 (UPI)A Federal fugitive war rant was issued today for An gela Davis, the former college philosophy instructor wanted on murder charges in connec with a courthouse gun battle here that left four men dead, including a judge.

description: Leonard Bernstein saw the Kennedy White House as a place of casualness and maj esty, creativity and joyful lust for life

description: The brokerage firms of T. L Watson & Co. and Hoppin Brothers & Co. announced yes terday that they will combine their facilities under the name of Hoppin, Watson & Company

title: Mrs. Meir Backs Reliance On U.S. in Peace Efforts
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 16 Premier Golda Meir tonight defended her Government's reliance on the United States in the current Middle Eastern peacemaking efforts against increasing impatience with Washington's apparent reluc tance to accept purported Israeli evidence of ceasefire violations by the United Arab Republic.

title: POLICE SHIFT STUDY PLANNED IN NEWARK
description: NEWARK, Aug. 16 (UPI)A committee of Newark City Councilmen has been formed to investigate last week's police department transfer of 170 men by Police Director John L. Redden.

description: Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, called on Mayor Lindsay yesterday to hold pub lic hearings before deciding on Consolidated Edison's con troversial application to more than double the capacity of its Astoria plant.

title: Mud Baths Included in an Airlines Tour
description: Airlines have always dreamed up packaged vaca tions. One can eat one's way for two weeks, tour wine regions or whiskey distil leries, go to the theater or listen to music, or shoot dice or elephants. They have all sorts of vacations to distract you to exhaustion or rest you to the point of boredom. Now Pan American World Airways has a new pack age. For the wo man (or man) who wants to return from a vacation feel ing and looking like a new woman (or man), the airline has a tour to any one of Italy's 13 stateowned spas. The spas are scattered geo graphically from Merano, tha Anctrian horder down to Cassano, in the in step, and Santa Cesarea, in the heel of the Italian boot.

title: 3 Nonswimmers Among 6 Saved as Boat Sinks Here
description: Ten minutes after the owner of a 24foot cabin cruiser en tering the Harlem River fro the Hudson yesterday com mented that he would hate to be swimming in the filthy water below, an explosion on his boat forced him and his five passen gers to abandon ship near West 156th Street at 8:30 A.M.

title: JONES'S HOME RUN IN 6TH DECISIVE
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 16Jim Mc Andrew restored a bit of despe rately needed equanimity to the New York Mets today by pitch ing a fivehit 21 victory over the Atlanta Braves, as Cleon Jones provided the winning margin with a sixinning home run off Jim Nash.

title: ARMY WINS FIGHT OVER NERVE GAS; SHIP GOES TO SEA
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16Three days of legal maneuver ing to stop the Army from sinking 418 concrete vaults full of deadly nerve gas into the sea collapsed here this afternoon.

title: STATE TO BACK CITY ON AUTO SCOFFLAWS
description: The New York State Depart ment of Motor Vehicles is all set to go this winter on a new program to stop city scofflaws from renewing their auto li cense registrations, a spokes man said yesterday.

title: PAKISTANI SERVES 27 ACES IN MATCH
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 16After squandering a lead of 2 sets to love for a second straight week, topseeded Ha roon Rahim_of Pakistan held on for a fiveset victory over John Gardner today in the final of the national amateur grass court tennis championships.

title: Sports of The Times
description: SPRING VALLEY, N. Y.Dave Stayer, a 30yearold social worker from Long Island, tells the story about his first and only ski weekend with such dry good humor that those who have heard it before smile through the compli cated parts in anticipation of the high points: Stayer care fully advising the tour company that I won't be responsible for all the deaths I cause... from the shock of seeing me come down the slope"; Stayer signing waivers, and Stayer actually getting to the top of a slope with skis and poles n hand.

title: JOBLESS RATE HITS 15,7% FOR YOUTHS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The current economic slowdown bearing out fears widely ex pressed two months ago, has had strong impact on young people this summer. Their un employment rate for June and July rose to 15.7 per cent, the highest amount in six years and up sharply from 12.8 per rent in the glimmer of 1969.

title: Dispute Arises Between Correction Commissioner and Senator Dunne on Inquiry Into Tombs Conditions
description: A State Senator and the city's Commissioner of Cor rection differed sharply yes terday over the proposed ap pearance of Tombs inmates before the Senator's legislative committee.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: For nearly tour hours in yesterday's early morning stillness, a procession of 350 giddy insomniac bicyclists coasted over asphalt and cobblestones on a tour of Manhattan's parks and archi tectural landmarks.

title: British Hooligans Stage Weekly Rampage
description: LONDON, Aug. 16The po lice used snatch squads and other new techniques to curb youth rampages at soccer games yesterday, but juvenile violence and vandalism occurred throughout Britain.

title: Mrs. Macklin Cunningham; Cited by Hirohito in 1968
description: Jeannette Todd Cunningham, who was given an award by Emperor Hirohito of Japan in 1968 for extending hospitality to Japanese graduate students in the United States, died in Charlotte Hungerford Hospital in Torrington, Conn., yesterday. She was 71 years old.

title: BLAIBERG DAUGHTER SCORES TRANSPLANT
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug. 16Miss Jill Blaiberg, 22yearold daughter of the South African heart transplant patient Philip Blaiberg, had some harsh things to say today about the operation and the people in volved, including Dr. Christiaan N Barnard.

title: ECUADOR REDUCES CURRENCY VALUE
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Aug. 16The Government devalued the sucre from the official rate of 18.42 to 24.75 to the dollar this afternoon. The expected de valuation which will take ef fect tomorrow had already caused the sucre to lose almost half its buying power in recent weeks.

title: Brewers Top Indians, 43, On Gil's 9thInning Single
World Racing Record For 6 Furlongs Set
description: RENTON, Wash., Aug. 16 (AP)The world thorough bred horse racing record for 6 furlongs was broken at Longacres race track today when Turbulator, a 5yearold bay gelding won the distance in 1:14.

title: Sweetner Pact Sought
description: TOKYO, Aug. 16 (AP)The Ajinomoto Company, a food and chemical producer, said today it had applied to the Japanese government for per mission to conclude a cross licensing agreement with the G.D. Searle Company of the United States. The agreement would cover a new artificial sweetner to be made from dipeptide, an amino acid. Com mercial production isn't ex pected for one or two years, the company said, as extensive toxidity tests must be made.

title: Film: Reality Stalks Young Innocents
U.S. Skipper Wins Title,
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 16 (AP)William Campbell of Beach wood, N. J., won the single handed catrig title in the 420 Class world sailing champion ships today. The American finished second in the final race but his overall perfor mance based on three of the four races earned him the title.

title: TRIBAL EXHIBITION AROUSES PROTESTS
description: GALLUP, N.M., Aug. 16At dawn today, Coal Avenue in Gallup, an Indian trading center of 14,000 population, bore a distinct resemblance to Bourbon Street in New Orleans on the morning after Mardi Gras.

description: The Mets and Yankees meet tonight in the eighth annual Mayor's Trophy Game for the benefit of sandlot baseball. The game, at Yankee Sta dium, begins at 7 P.M.

title: AntiCommunist Council Prepares a Voting Index on Congress
description: CULPEPER, Va., Aug. 10Here in the soft, lush Virginia countryside two hours by car southwest of the Pentagon, lights are burning late each night at the offices of the American Security Council.

title: Home Stretch for Congress
description: After an exceptionally dilatory session last year, the 91st Congress this year has been reasonably pro ductive. When the House of Representatives recessed Friday for nearly a month, it had acted on a lengthy list of important measures. The Senate remains session because its prolonged debates over Vietnam, Cambodia and the Carswell nomination to the Supreme Court have used up time which otherwise could have been devoted to ordinary legislative tasks.

title: Wincingly Cold Ice Cream: Only at the Hot Beach

description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 16Brazil goes to the meeting of world coffee consuming and producing countries, which will begin discussing quotas tomor row, almost free of the burden of her surplus.

title: Cardinal Cooke Back Home
