The Cardinal is vicar of Ameri can Roman Catholic soldiers throughout the world. He said a mass for peace on Friday, in Berlin, at the ninth anniversary of the building of the Berlin Wall.

title: Kennedy Archives Illuminate Cuba Policy
description: The John F. Kennedy Mem orial Library has opened to scholars and researchers the first selection of its 15 million pages of documents and manu scripts, including transcripts of 300 oralhistory interviews with such figures as Nikita S. Khru shchev, Mike Mansfield and a White House upholsterer.

title: Dr. R. I. Keimowitz Weds Hazel Kahn
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Aug. 16 The marriage of Miss Hazel Greta Kahn, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harry H. Kahn, to Dr. Robert I. Keimowitz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Kei mowitz of Middletown, N. Y., took place here this after noon in Temple Ohavi Zedek. Rabbis Max B. Wall and Moshe V. Goldblum offici ated.

title: Unions Threatening Strikes Despite Government Pleas
description: LONDON, Aug. 16  Two months after the British elec tions, the new Conservative Government faces a dispute with millions of trade union ists that threatens to engulf the country in economic tur moil.

description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 16 (AP)Betsy Rawls, with a strong putting game, shot a par n in the final round today tc score a onestroke victory it the Ladies Professional Gall Association Buckeye invitation. with 210.

title: Laird Assails Senate Move To Curb ABM Deployment
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP) Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird today criticized a Sen ate proposal that would provide funds for the antiballistic mis sile program but that would limit the locations of the mis siles to two sites already chosen.

title: CHICAGO DETECTIVE, SHOT IN SNIPING, DIES
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 16 (UPI)Police Detective James A. Al fano Jr., who was shot by sniper fire Thursday night out side a South Side Hotel that has been taken over by street gangs, died tonight at Billings, Hospital. He was 30 years old and the father of two children.

title: PROFIT OF I.B.E.G. FELL IN QUARTER
description: The International Basic Econ omy Corporation reported slightly lower secondquarter earnings although firsthalf re sults were at record levels, ac cording to the unaudited midyear statement issued by Don ald E. Meads, chairman, over the weekend.

The yardage is 6,304 yards. Fullam and Mills took the low net prize with a 32. 3264.

title: Radio
George M. Shook, Editor Of Jersey Observer, 75
description: HOBOKEN, N. J., Aug. 16George M. Shook, former editor of The Jersey Observer in Hobo ken, died last night at St. Mary's Hospital here after short illness. He was 75 years old and lived at 739 Bloomfield Street here.

title: Clear Way for Farm Unionism
description: A pact between Cesar Chavez,. the Paul Bunyan farm labor, and the International Brotherhood of Team scers holds out the happy prospect that Mr. Chavez's fledgling farm union can move beyond California's newly organized vineyards without having to fight off a rearguard attack by the huge truck union.

title: Fire Interrupts Game as Redskins Halt Patriots, 4521
description: NEWTON, Mass., Aug., 16 (AP)  Sonny Jurgensen threw four touchdown pass es today, three to Jerry Smith, as the Washington Redskins trounced the Bos ton Patriots, 4521.

title: AsT hey Say, It Depends Upon Your Point of View
description: A number of interviews in the John F. Kennedy Me morial Library's oralhistory program disclosed consider able discrepancies in individ ual recollections of the same event.

title: Arnie's Cheering Army Is Put to Rout
description: TULSA, Okla., August 16Dave Stockton admitted after winning the Professional Golfers Association title to day that some of Arnold Pal mer's Army of fans had made me mad.

title: Herbert M. Dawley,90, Dies; Jersey Actor and Director
description: CHATHAM, N. J., Aug. 16 (AP)Herbert M. Dawley, an actor and director, died at the Glenside Nursing Home in New Providence yesterday. He was 90 years old and lived at 42 Center Street.

title: Cleveland Orders Trucks
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 16 (UPI) The White Motor Corpora tion has announced receipt of an order from the city of Cleveland for 40 diesel trucks to be used for rubbish collec tion.

title: HUNTER LAURELS TO CASTLE WALK
description: OCEANPORT, N.J., Aug. 16Holly Fuller's Castle Walk cap tured two classes today at the concluding session of the four day Monmouth County horse show. One earned the 6yearold bay gelding a championship. The other fell short.

title: THREAT IS REPORTED ON BRAZILIAN'S LIFE
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 16 (UPI)An ultimatum warn ing that a kidnapped Brazilian diplomat would be executed unless the Uruguayan Govern ment released 183 prisoners apparently caused a setback today to preliminary negotia tions between the police and the guerrillas.

title: Suspect in Arson Accused of Trying To Burn Out Rival
description: The police said yesterday that they had caught a man as he was trying to set fire to a business rival's office in the garment district. The office was on the ground floor of a tenement at 456 Ninth Avenue at 35th Street, where 55 people were sleeping.

title: Foreign Banks Crowded in Irish Shutdown
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 16One of the sights of Dublin these days is the long queues of Americans and Irish to be seen outside the Bank of America, the First National City Bank, the American Ex press, London's Thos. Cook & Son, Ltd., and the Cana dianowned Bank of Nova Scotia.

title: Music: Downbeat Shifts to JazzRock
description: After a little more than year as a jazz room focusing on mainstream and tradition al groups, Downbeat, at 42d Street and Lexington Avenue, has shifted its musical sights to jazzrock and has opened UD a small dance floor.

title: Brandt Aide Arrives Here
description: Egon Bahr of West Germany Chancellor Willy Brandt's closest adviser, arrived in New York City yesterday, for consul tations with American officials on West Germany's new nonag gression pact with the Soviet Union. He is scheduled to meet in Washington with President Nixon's foreign policy adviser. Henry A. Kissinger, and other Government officials.

title: Louis Trella, 52, Headed Jersey Parkway Authority
description: CLIFTON, N. J., Aug. 16 (AP) Louis Trella, Commissioner and Secretary of the New Jer sey Parkway Authority, died at his home here today at the age of 52.

title: Blue Collar Workers of Warren, a Detroit Suburb, Fight to Keep Negroes Out
description: WARREN, Mich., Aug. 16Detroit's white suburban noose, as some like to call it, runs along Eight Mile Road, and no where is it tighter than in Warren.

title: US. MAKES OFFER TO GIVE UP ABM'S IF SOVIET DOES SO
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 The United States has offered to give up its antiballistic mis sile defense system entirely if the Soviet Union would agree to limit the number of its huge SS9 offensive missiles and abandon its own missile de fenses, a Nixon Administration source reports.

title: FATAH LEADER VOWS TO PREVENT ACCORD
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 16, (Reuters)Yasir Arafat, lead er of Al Fatah commando or ganization, pledged today that any Middle East peace settle ment would be foiled by guer rilla force.

title: Chess:
description: The 18man allgrandmas ter international tournament in Buenos Aires excited Argentine buffs because bf the participation of the Unit ed States ace and former na tional champion, Bobby Fisch er.

title: Week's Votes by Area's Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16Following are the votes of delegations from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major rollcalls in Congress during the week ended yester day:

title: Hulk Loaded With Nerve Gas Begins Her Last Voyage
Air Show Site Is Chosen
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (UPI)Dulles International Air port, in northern Virginia about 25 miles from Washington, has been chosen as the site of the first United States Internation al Air Show in June, 1972.

title: Who Are The Nation's Governors?
description: LAKE OF THE OZARKS, Mo. In this remote, luxury resort, with treeshaded villas, white Cadillacs and fortyfoot yachts at their disposal, the nation's governors probably should not have been expected to do any work. The surroundings at their annual conference held here last week are hardly conducive to grappling with the great is sues confronting societythe deterioration of urban areas, the distortion of national pri orities, the thin base of popular support on which all levels of government now rest andthe resulting need for both opening the voting booths wider and assuring government authority to act once decisions have been democratically reached.

title: Those Nixon Cufflinks Weren't Lost After All
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP)President Nixon's cuff links were pulled off in handshaking crowd in New Orleans, but he didn't lose them.

title: 2 Senate Candidates Attack Defoliant Use in War
description: Two New York Congressmen yesterday condemned the use of defoliants by American armed forces in Southeast Asia.

title: Battle Between Regents and Faculty Rocks University of Texas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Aug. 15The University of Texas is strug gling to regain its footing in the aftermath of an internal battle marked by a bitterness that has shocked even sea soned campus observers.

title: MOVIE WILL USE NEW 3D PROCESS
description: A license for the first feature film production in the holo gram process, a method where by a threedimensional effect is achieved without viewer glass es, has been granted to the Laser Film Corporation of New York by the Holotron Corpora tion, a subsidiary of the E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co. and the Battelle Memorial Institute.

title: Heat+Humidity Equals Miserable Day
description: It was a miserable day in New York yesterday. The tempera ture was in the nineties for the fifth day this summer and the air was polluted and humid.

title: THRIFT UNITS GAIN PAYMENT SERVICE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 The $170billion savings and loan industry is well on its way to gaining the right to offer full checking account service to its 45 million depositors.

title: BAHNSEN LIMITS ROYALS TO 6 HITS
description: A lot of G.I.'s spend their days off watching baseball games, but the only one who spent yesterday pitching the New York Yankees to a 51 victory over the Kansas City Royals was Specialist Stan Bahnsen of Fort Dix. N. J.

title: Lutz Conquers Gorman In Buckeye Net Final
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 16 (AP)Bob Lutz of Los An geles won the Buckeye tennis champion ship today with a fourset victory over Tom Gorman of Seattle.

title: ICKX, IN FERRARI, WINS IN AUSTRIA
description: ZELTWEG, Austria, Aug. 16 (AP)Jackie Ickx of Belgium won the Austrian Grand Prix today as Ferraris scored a one two triumph in Formula One auto racing for the first tme in two years.

title: Snow Falls Near Melbourne
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Aug 16 (Reuters)  Snow fell less than 10 miles from Melbourne today the coldest August day in the city since 1872. The maximum temperature was 43.2 degrees Fahrenheit, compared with an August average of 58 degrees.

title: RAIN INTERRUPTS ZONE CUP SINGLES
description: DUESSELDORF, Germany, Aug. 16 (AP)West Germany stood on the verge of challeng ing the United States for the Davis Cup after Christian Kuhnke won the first two sets from Spain's Manuel Orantes today before rain halted their interzone final tennis match.

title: Nixons Back in Wasington
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP) President and Mrs. Nixon re turned to Washington this aft ernoon following an overnight stay with officials and family friends at Camp David in the Catoctin Mountains of Mary land.

title: IRAQKURD ACCORD IS SAID TO FALTER
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 6There are signs that the agree ment between the Kurds of northern Iraq and the Baathist regime is faltering.

title: Tenants to Get Interest On Security Payments
description: As of Sept. 1, landlords in apartment houses of six or more units must pay in terest on security money that tenants have deposited with them, Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz said yes terday.

title: L.I.U. to Arm Some Security Guards
description: The dean of students at Long Island University's main campus in downtown Brooklyn has ordered some security guards to carry guns following the shootings of a student and a neighborhood resident near the university residence hall at 190 Willoughby Street on Fri day night.

title: 2 L. I. Banks Plan Merger
description: The Seaside Bank, West hampton Beach, L. I., would be merged into the Long Island Trust Company under merger plans submitted to the New York State Banking Depart ment, it was disclosed in the department's weekly bulletin yesterday.

title: MISSING PERSONS: 3 QUARTERBACKS
description: Quarterbacks were still con spicuous by their absence in National Football League pre season games Saturday night

title: Brooklyn Boy Drowns on L.I.
description: NORTH SEA, L. I., Aug 16 A 15yearold boy drowned here last night when he stepped into deep water while clam ruing with his father, Joseph Guarneri. The body of the boy, Dominick Guarneri of 1374 68th Street, Brooklyn, was re covered a few minutes later at about 6:30 P.M., by the police. A friend, Peter Amato 26, of 371 Bay Ridge Avenue Brooklyn, tried unsuccessfully to rescue the Guarneri youth the police said.

title: U.S. MINORITY AID FAULTED IN STUDY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The Nixon Administration's chief black capitalism program has been criticized in a Harvard University study as inadequate for minority economic devel opment of anysort.

title: W. HIGHLAND BEST AT ANNAPOLIS K.C.
description: SANDY POINT, Md., Aug. 16 A West Highland white ter rier from Stockton, N.J., cap tured bestinshow honors today over an entry of 1,515 at the Annapolis Kennel Club's 19th allbreed event.

title: Sports Today
description: Yankees vs. Mets, Mayor's Trophy Game, at Yankee Stadium, 161st Street and River Avenue, 7 P.M. (RadioWHN, WJRZ, WNBC FM, 7 P.M.)

title: Campaigning in Connecticut
description: Since 1955, Connecticut law has provided for state wide primarieswith a hitch. To force such an election a candidate first has to win 20 per cent of the vote at his party's state nominating convention, a feat extremely hard to perform in the face of machine control, usually exercised in the name of party unity. Until this year no candidate ever succeeded in up setting the convention applecart. Now that tradition has been happily broken in both parties.

title: New Books
description: A Cry of Bees, by Melissa Hardy (Viking. $5.95). An 8yearold girl grows up in a boarditig house full of eccentric ladies.

title: You Can Buy Loquats or Dine on Dolphin at Los Angeles Farmers Market
description: LOS ANGELESA trip to the market for Angelinos and cooks from as far away as San Diego and Santa Bar bara usually means a visit to the Farmers Market, situ ated at 6333 West Third Street, in the heart of this city.

title: SENATORS ARGUE ON BANK HOLDING
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16A sharp battle has broken out within the Senate Banking and Currency Committee over a key provision in the pending bill to regulate onebank hold ing companiesa provision de signed to prohibit tiein sales by banks and their affiliates.

title: NASTASE SUBDUES ROCHE IN HAMBURG
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, Aug. 16 (AP)Ilie Nastase of Rumania upset topseeded Tony Roche of Australia, 36, 75, 61, 64 today in the semifinals of the German open tourna ment.

title: Anita B. Saffer Married Here
description: Miss Anita Beth Saffer, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Sidney Hugh Saffer of Hamp ton Bays, L. I., was married here yesterday afternoon to Steven Robert Corvin, son of Mrs. Gerda Corvin and the late Dr. Alfred T. Corvin of New York.

title: HEATH FACES FIGHT ON WAGE DEMANDS
Books of The Times
description: Certainly, Bruce Jay Friedman and Kings ley Amis may belong in the same review together if only because each, in his own way, has made such a singular contribu tion to the modern comic novelFriedman with the black comedy of Stern and A Mother's Kisses, Amis in Lucky Jim and a slew of others. But In The Dick and The Green Man, each has left his old routines behind. And to tell the blunt truth of the matter, I read Mr. Friedman's novel fully expecting to devote this entire col umn to it; found myself both disappointed and without much to say, picked up The Green Man for a latenight browse (never in the past having been that great an Amis fan), and found it altogether spellbinding and impossible to stop reading even long after bedtime. So here we are with two wildly different sorts of books and not shred of connective tissue.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
U.S. to Shift 54 Phantom Jets to Bases in South Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug 16  The United States plans to shift a wing of 54 Phantom F4 fighterbombers from Ja pan and station them perma nently in South Korea, accord ing to wellplaced American sources.

title: French Sailors Secret Weapon: Food
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 16 France's 30man America's Cup squad took to the hills today for a final rest before its challenger series against Australia.

title: The Nader Settlement
description: The outofcourt settlement of Ralph Nader's suit against General Motors for invasion of privacy concludes this landmark case on a positive note. The New York Court of Appeals had affirmed that Mr. Nader had a cause of action, but litigation could have tied up talents and the courts for years. Instead, the proceeds of the $425,000 settlement will be used, after expenses are deducted, for continuous legal monitoring of G.M. by Mr. Nader in safety, pollu tion and consumer relations.

title: News Summary and Index
description: An Administration official was reported yesterday to have told a group of news paper editors of a United States offer to give up the American antimissile defense system if the Soviet Union would follow suit and agree to limit its huge SS9 missiles. The offer was made in the justcompleted Vienna phase of the SovietAmerican arms limitation talks. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: DONOHUE IS SECOND FOR JAVELIN TEAM
description: WATKINS GLEN, N. Y. Aug. 16A Chevrolet Camaro, driven by Vic Elford of England, won Camaro's second Trans American race of the season today. About 40 minutes of the twohour endurance event were run in treacherously wet con ditions that came with a rain shower.

title: 13 Die in Collision in Turkey
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Aug. 16  Thirteen persons were killed and 15 were injured today when an Iranian truck collided with a bus and another truck on the AnkaraIstanbul highway near here.

title: Kings Point Graduate Comes Back as Dean
description: A 1963 graduate of the United States Merchant Ma rine Academy at Kings Point, L. I., has returned as assist ant dean for recruiting and counseling; with the rank of commander in the maritime service.

title: Liner in Hudson Gets Parking Ticket
description: A once luxurious cruise ship whose peeling paint is a mocking reminder of a year as a derelict without a berth tied up between two Hudson River piers over the weekend and received a parking ticket

title: Angel, Kalkun Also Win in Stratford Shoals Race
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Aug. 16 Richard Evans's Escales from the Norwalk Yacht Club cap tured the August Heckscher Memorial Trophy today as overall winner in the Hunting ton Yacht Club's 32d annual Stratford Shoals overnight race.

title: E. H. HILLIARD JR., 47, A CONSERVATIONIST
description: DENVER, Aug. 16Edward Hobbs Hilliard Jr., a business man active in conservation groups, was killed yesterday in a mountainclimbing accident in western Colorado. He was 47 years old.

title: BONDS FACE WEEK OF DULL ACTIVITY
description: The bond market, which has been spending August assessing the JuneJuly drop in interest rates, will have a quiet week to ruminate. Then it will have to get busy.

title: NEW ZEALAND TEAM WINS ON POLO TOUR
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 16  A touring New Zealand polo team  aided by one American  scored today its sixth victory in eight starts since arriving in the United States by beating the Fairfield County Hunt Club, 137.

title: Miss Casals and Mrs. Court Advance to Women's Final of Toronto Tourney
description: TORONTO, Aug. 16 (Canadi an Press)Rod Laver of Aus tralia won the men's singles final at the Canadian open ten nis tournament today, defeat ing Roger Taylor of Britain 60, 46, 63. Laver twice broke the Briton's service in the third set.

title: U.S. Red Cross Worker Found Stabbed in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam Aug. 16A 21yearold Amer ican Red Cross worker who arrived in Vietnam only two weeks ago was found dead of stab wounds early today in her quarters at Cuchi, 20 miles north of Saigon.

title: Twins Beat Red Sox On Homers to End Losing String at 9
description: BOSTON, Aug. 16 (UPI)Brant Alyea, Harmon Killebrew, George Mitterwald and Cesar Tover hit home runs today to help the Minnesota Twins snap a ninegame losing streak with a 96 triumph over the Boston Red Sox.

title: Federal judges Unruffled by Reversals of Rulings
description: Over lunch in the 28th floor cafeteria of the United States Court House at Foley Square a few years ago, a judge turned to his compan ion and said, The only time I'd be concerned about being reversed is if they said, Well, you dumb jerk.

title: CLUB POOR PLAY SEEN AS A FACTOR
description: Philip J. Iselin, the president of the Jets, predicted yesterday that Joe Namath, the reluctant quarterback, will rejoin the team, possibly tomorrow, for next Sunday's exhibition game with their New York rivals, the Giants. at Yale Bowl.

title: WILLIAMS EXCELS AS CUBS WIN, 52
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 16 (UPI)Billy Williams, playing in his 1,103d consecutive game to tie for third place on the major league record list, sparked two uprisings with a double and single today to lift the Chicago Cubs to a 52 triumph over the Los Angeles Dodgers. Joe Sewell, an infielder with the Cleveland Indians in the nineteentwenties.

title: WELFARE REFORM BACKED IN A POLL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16The Nixon Administration has taken a professional public opinion survey to determine the extent of voter support for the President's controversial welfare reform program.

title: British Troops Rescue Belfast Flood Victims
description: BELFAST, Northern Ire land, Aug. 16 (Reuters)British peacekeeping troops in Belfast today laid aside their weapons to rescue hun dreds of families affected by what were believed to be the worst floods ever experienced here.

title: Raises Put Some Lindsay Aides Salaries Above State and Federal
Wife Proves Her Point After Shaky Start in Pro Debut
description: ORLANDO, Fla., Aug. 16 (AP)  A nervy little school teacher from Tampa, Fla., be came the first woman to play in a professional foot ball game last night. On her first play she was thrown to the turf by a 235pound line backer who said later she was making folly of a man's name.

title: Flemings Beat Grunthers In FatherSon Net Final
description: KEARNY, N. J., Aug. 16Alan and Peter Fleming of Short Hills, N. J., defeated Arnold and Doug Grunther of Milburn, N. J., 46, 62, 64, today in the final of the east ern clay courts fatherson doubles championships at the Arlington Players Club.

title: Missing California Militant
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 16For most of her 26 years, Angela Yvonne Davis has pursued a deep interest in books, a vocation that, tn other times and places, might have led to virtual an onymity outside academe. In stead, she has become a fig ure in the major issues divid ing a troubled American society. And this week end, she was be ing sought for murder in con nection with the gun battle outside a courthouse in San Rafael earlier this month that took the lives of four persons, including a judge.

title: Louise Stolman Becomes a Bride
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 16The marriage of Miss Louise Bertram Stolman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Stol man of Hollywood, to Andrew R. Doctor took place at the Doral Hotel here today. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Theodore Doctor of Jamaica Estates, Queens, New York. Rabbi Samuel Z. Jaffe performed the ceremony.

title: Court Abuse of Migrants Charged in South Jersey
description: BRIDGETON, N. J., Aug 16 Antipoverty lawyers have charged that hundreds of mi gratory farm workers have been jailed in southern New Jersey this summer without ever seeing a judge.

title: 350 Pedal With Gusto Through Sleeping City
DESIGN PACT SET FOR NEW SUBWAY
description: Mayor Lindsay announced approval yesterday of an $11.6 million design contract for the long awaited Second Avenue subway.

title: Deborah Lucey Is Wed in Jersey
description: PERTH AMBOY, N. J., Aug. 16Miss Deborah Anne Lucey, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James J. Lucey, was married here this afternoon to Howard Samuel Kroop, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis L. Kroop. The ceremony was performed at the Lucey home by Rabbi Barry Dov Schwartz.

title: Women's Lib Wooed by Publishers
description: Less than a month after publication, Sexual Politics by Sate Millett, a manifesto of the new feminism, has sold upward of 15,000 copies and is in its fourth printing. The paperback rights have been sold for $75,000. It is also a BookoftheMonth Club alternate selection for November.

title: A Family Who Built a Real Dumb House in Banal Environment
description: BARNEGAT LIGHT, N. J.At the northern end of this 18milelong ribbon of sand called Long Beach Island is the Borough of Barnegat Light, where, as might be expected, the summer homes document the changing fashions of the lad20 years.

title: Lebanon Legalizes Commando Chief's Party in Preelection Move
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 16Lebanese authorities in a pre election maneuver, yesterday legalized the political party run by George Habash the left wine Arab commando chief.

title: Ulster: Britain Takes the Bit
description: Britain's Conservative Government has finally ac cepted clear responsibility for carrying out reforms and enforcing equality in Northern Ireland even if this should require abolition of home rule in that volatile province. The Tories hitherto had said only that they supported the reforms, rather than insisting on their prompt implementation, as the Labor Government had done.

title: Slippers Set for Sept.
description: Henry Testa will produce Jose Alcarez's The Emerald Slippers, described as a fan tasy for children of all ages, which opens at the Gramercy Arts Theater on Tuesday, Sept. 1. Because it is directed toward children, the production will have a 7 P.M. curtain, Tuesdays through Fridays. Saturday and Sunday performances will be at 11 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: JOHN SYME, EXAIDE OF JOHNSMANVILLE
Giants Flop on Late, Late Show; Fumbles Erase a 20Point Lead
Bathers at Orchard Beach Battle Police Over a Rule
description: About 50 policemen battled 200 angry bathers at Orchard Beach in the Bronx last night) in an incident that began when a man sat on a promenade rail, inn.

title: Home and Contractor Shine in London Season
description: LONDON, Aug. 16When the contemporary history of British drama is finally writ ten  and even now the scholars must be sweating at it  the role of the Royal Court Theater cannot pos sibly be underestimated.

title: Hadassah Appeals to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 The president of Hadassah, the largest Zionist organization in the United States, tonight ap pealed to the Nixon Adminis tration to exercise its influence to gain removal of Soviet mis siles that Israel said had been installed in the canal zone.

title: Vast IronSand Deposits Yield Belated Assets to New Zealand
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Aug. 16Recent technical ad vances have made the vast de posits of iron sand along the coasts of New Zealand, which have long laid idle and have been a source of intense frustra tion, a major asset both for domestic purposes and as an export commodity.

title: Bridge:
description: BOSTON, Aug. 16The fa mous team headed by George Rapee of New York was elim inated from the Spingold knockout team championship at the Boston Sheraton last night. This secondseeded group, whose roster lists Ed gar Kaplan of New York, Norman Kay of Philadelphia, Sidney Lazard of New Or leans, Eric Murray and Sam Kehela of Toronto, won the Vanderbilt Cup earlier this year, but bowed here to a group of young experts from the New York area.

title: GARDNER DISCERNS A WIDE DISCONTENT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16 (AP) John W. Gardner said today there was an electric charge of discontent in the nation that he hoped to galvanize toward a constructive reform path with a new political action group, Thp Common Cause.

title: Advertising: Bounty for Elusive Viewers
description: When Cyrano de Ber gerac is shown over WOR TV on Sept. 5, it will mark the third time this summer that a minimum commer cial movie will be seen.

title: DARTS SOCCER TEAM WINS DIVISION TITLE
description: The Washington Darts of the North American Soccer League bowed to the Kansas City Spurs, 31, in Kansas City last night, but nevertheless clinched the Southern Division title of the league when they defeated the St. Louis Stars, 50, in St. Louis Saturday night.

title: Bonus Voted on Savings Bonds
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 16With almost no notice, Congress has just voted a bonus of about $250million a year to millions of the nation's small savers.

title: Bands of Hippies, Soviet Style, Roam Isolated Regions
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 16Roving bands of dropouts from Soviet society, living in selfisolation in Siberia and other parts of the country, have become a source of concern here.

title: Tigers Down Angels, 7.1, As Ike Brown, Cain Star
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Aug. 16 UPI)Ike Brown, utility man, it a tworun homer to spark Fourrun Detroit first inning today and the Tigers went on to defeat the California Angels, 71, behind the fourhit pitching of Les Cain. rookie.

title: Miss Laginestra Wed To Robert McCarthy
description: FRANKLIN LAKES, N. J., Aug. 16In the Most Blessed Sacrament Roman Catholic Church here today, Miss Carolyn Grace Laginestra and Robert Edward McCar thy, students at Fairleigh Dickinson University, were married by the Rev. Joseph Doyle.

title: PACT WITH 3 PAPERS RATIFIED BY MAILERS
description: Members of Mailers Union No. 6 yesterday ratified a new threeyear contract with The New York Times, The Daily News and The Long Island Press

title: 15 G.I.'s Spend a Day Cutting Generals Photo
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (Reuters)  Fifteen service men were ordered to cut a photograph of their com manding general from 10,000 copies of an Air Force base newspaper because a ser geant objected to the way it had been trimmed, according to a letter made public here today.

title: BRITISH GIRL WINS IN MERTON TENNIS
Observer: The 257Hour Day
description: LONDONIn England they have this curious day. It is called Sunday, but it is not to be confused with the day Ameri cans call Sunday. The American Sunday, to cite one distinction, is only 72 hours long, while the English Sunday is of variable length, though never shorter than 257 hours.

title: Second Poseidon Is Fired, Without Russian Spectators
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Aug. 17The submerged submarine James Madison fired today her second Poseidon missile but this time the Russians missed the show.

title: Harlem Parade and Dance Mark Birthday of Garvey
description: A parade through Harlem and a dance at the Renaissance Ballroom last night marked the birthday of Marcus Garvey, one of the first American Negroes to call for establish ment of a separate black na tion.

title: Public Ownership Set
description: Axelrod & Co., a member firm of the New York Stock Exchange and a specialist on the American Stock Exchange, will become the second pub licly owned Big Board member in history as a result of a merger disclosed yesterday.

title: MRS. COURT CAPTURES CANADIAN NET TITLE
description: TORONTO, Aug. 17 (Cana dian Press)  Mrs. Margaret Court of Australia defeated Rosemary Casals of San Fran cisco, 68, 64, 64, tonight to win the women's singles title at the Canadian open tennis championships. Mrs. Court re ceived $800 and the loser $400.

title: NATE HASELTINE, 59, WRITER ON MEDICINE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 17 (AP) Nate Haseltine, one of the nation's leading medical report ers, died of a stroke yesterday. He was 59 years old and lived in Arlington, Va.

title: MRS. PRATT GAINS IN SENIOR TENNIS
description: NARRAGANSETT, R. I., Aug. 17 (AP)The defending cham pion, Mrs. Betty Rosenquist Pratt of Maitland, Fla., led the advance of seeded players to day through the opening round of the national senior women's tennis championships on the Point Judith Country Club's grass courts.

title: Pathet Lao Envoy Views Talks With Government as Stalemated
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug 17 (Agence FrancePresse)  Talks between Government represen tatives and an envoy from the Communistled Pathet Lao have reached a stalemate, according to the envoy, Prince Tiao Souk Vongsak.

title: RAILROADS TO ASK RATE RISE OF 15%
description: Eastern and Western rail roads reached agreement in Chicago yesterday to ask the Interstate Commerce Commis sion for authority to increase their freight rates by 15 per cent.

title: 2 Drug Units Set at Harlem Hospital
description: Harlem Hospital center agreed yesterday to establish two narcotics programs in response to demands by an antidrug group that took over part of the hospital and oc cupied it for the last 25 days.

title: Sanitation Day In Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 17 (Reuters) A number of Moscow markets were closed today for a clean up as part of a drive to pre vent the spread of cholera. Officials said the cleanup should take one or two days in markets. Stores were closed for what is known here as Sanitation Day.

title: There Are a Lot of People Willing to Believe Fat Is Beautiful...
description: For years they've been the butt of comedians jokes. They can't get certain jobs, they can't always find clothes to fit, and they are constant ly being told they're un healthy. Then, when they turn on their television sets to try to escape from it all, they're bombarded with com mercials that say things like: Cigarettes are like women  the best ones are thin and rich.

title: Falcons Shift Small From a Linebacker To Defensive Tackle
description: JOHNSON CITY, Tenn., Aug. 17 (AP)John Small, the At lanta Falcons No. 1 draft choice from The Citadel, was shifted from linebacker to defensive tackle today by Coach Norm Van Brocklin.

title: The New York Times (by Larry Morris)
Swiss to Help U.S. Trace Illegal Funds
description: GENEVA, Aug. 17Switzer land and the United States have agreed on a draft legal aid treaty under which the Swiss Gov ernment will help track down money hidden in Swiss banks by agents of organized crime.

title: With the Rains, Eritrean Revolt Against Ethiopia Ebbs
Vatican City Announces Stiff Curbs on Motorists
description: ROME, Aug. 17 (Reuters)  The Vatican City State today announced a clamp down on traffic offenses beginning Sept. 1, including the use of breathalizers to help police detect drunken drivers.

title: Reported U.S. Court Nominee Stirs Unusual Protest in Alabama
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 17  Re ports of the Nixon Administra tion's plans for filling a new and important Federal judgeship. In Alabama have spawned an unusual coalition of protest.

title: DEFICITS AT LTV MOUNT SHARPLY
description: LingTemcoVought, Inc., the conglomerate that has been un loading some of its acquired in terests, reported yesterday secondquarter loss of almost double that of a year earlier, and a far larger loss for the first six months.

title: 12 HURT IN MELEE AT PARK CONCERT
description: Several hundred youths hurled rocks and botles at po licemen on the periphery of rock n roll concert in Central Park last night in what the po lice described as an unprovoked attack.

title: ABORTIONS PROVIDED AT MILITARY BASES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (UPI) United States military base hospitals around the world must provide abortion and sur gical sterilization services ft all armed forces personnel and their dependents regardless of state or local laws, the Defense Department said today.

title: Deliverers'Union Threatens a Strike At 4 Papers Here
description: The president of the News paper Deliverers Union warned yesterday that members would strike one or more of the city's four major daily newspapers at midnight tomorrow unless their contract dispute was settled by that time.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: HALKIRK, ScotlandRain, and a great deal of it, was needed to swell the shrunken Thurso River and bring spawning salmon upstream from the sea, but the rain did not come.

title: LEBANON MINISTER WINS PRESIDENCY
description: BEIRUT. Lebanon, Aug. 17The Minister of the Economy, Suleiman Franjieh, was chosen by Parliament today to be President of Lebanon by a one vote margin on the third ballot, after which tumult erupted on the floor of the house.

title: Buffalo Youth Dies in Fire And Explosion in Cottage
description: BUFFALO. Aug. 17A Buf falo youth died early today in an explosion and fire in vacant cottage on the city's East Side, and his brother was found 15 minutes later suffer ing from severe burns.

title: State Mall,Rising in Albany, Becomes a Campaign Issue
description: ALBANY, Aug. 17  One night last winter in the re laxed atmosphere of a dinner here, Governor Rockefeller accepted a phrase that had been leveled at him as criti cism by Democratic politi cians.

title: ISRAEL TO RELEASE TWO ALGERIAN MEN
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 17Israel has decided to release two prominent Algerians taken off a British airliner in transit through Lydda airport last Fri day, according to informed sources here.

title: SILVER STOCKS HELD ADEOUATE FOR NOW
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (Reuters)A Silver Users Asso ciation report said today that present world silver stocks, plus future production, will be adequate to meet industrial needs for 10 to 15 years.

title: Dr. Frederick Lascoff,  69, Dies; OldTime Yorkville Apothecary
description: Dr. Frederick D. Lascoff, owner of a Yorkville pharmacy that specializes in rare drugs and oldtime remedies, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hos pital. He was 69 years old and lived at 125 East 72d Street.

title: City Ordered to Explain Caribia Ban
description: A State Supreme Court justice directed the city yester day to explain why it refused to grant a permit for the cruise ship Caribia to tie up at a city pier.

title: Chicago Gang Leader Hunted as Detective Dies
description: CHICAGO, Aug..17The po lice searched today for a black street gang lead& in the slay ing.of Detective James A. Al fano, who died last night 71 hours after being shot from am bush in a Negro neighborhood.

title: Fur Union Joins Conservation Move
description: The union that represents vir tually all of the fur workers in the United States reached an agreement with the World Wildlife Fund yesterday to no longer cut, fashion or fabricate skins of such endangered species as leopards, cheetahs, ocelots and jaguars.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The construction of missile sites and the deploying of additional weapons closer to the Suez Canal by the Soviet Union and Egypt is continuing, according to a charge made yesterday by Israel's Foreign Minis ter, Abba Eban. Mr. Eban said that further evidence is being sent to the United States that would remove all doubt that the cease fire agreement in the Mideast is being vio lated. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: ERVIN ASKS MEASURE ON WOMEN'S RIGHTS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17Sen ator Sam J. Ervin Jr. proposed today a substitute for the pend ing equal rights amendment that would specifically exempt women from compulsory mili tary service and also insure the continued validity of most other laws that treat men and women differently.

title: B52'S RAID ENEMY SOUTH OF THE DMZ
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam. Aug. 17 (AP)  B52 bombers struck the northern quarter of South Vietnam today in an at tempt to thwart what some allied officers said might be a big enemy offensive.

title: Taste of the Future
description: New Yorkers are slowly getting to know the joys of streets without autos. The banning of traffic on Fifth Avenue for four successive Saturdays proved so delightful to pedestrians and so generally harmless to merchants that Saturday closings have now been tried out twice on Lexington Avenue and on Eighth Street in the Village, with oneday experiments sched uled for thoroughfares in Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island.

title: Italian Company to Make Movie About Tate Murder
description: ROME, Aug. 17 (UPI)  An Italian film company an nounced today that it would begin work Aug. 27 on a movie about the Sharon Tate murder case, to be called The Night of the Flowers.

title: Westchester Art Center Keeps Community Lively
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 17The door stays open and the children are free to come and go as they please. Mostly they come and stay, and about 501 of them have spent almost every, weekday this summer painting, modeling and building in a former florist shoo here that has become a community art workshop.

title: SMITH'S 76 TAKES SENIOR GOLF EVENT
SOUTHERN RAILWAY ASKS TO USE BARGES
description: The Southern Railway asked the Interstate Commerce Com mission yesterday for permis sion to transport coal by barge on the Ohio and Tennessee Rivers.

title: It All Depends on Where You're Sitting if You're Going to Have a Chance to Catch a Ball
RICHMOND BUS PLAN APPROVED BY JUDGE
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 17 (AP)Federal District Judge Robert R. Merhige Jr. approved an in terim desegregation plan of operation today for Richmond's schools that he described as not a unitary system, but the begin ning of the end of a dual sys tem.

title: Political TV Packager Counts Ratings in Votes
description: YOU cant do a ,lob if you don't believe in the guy. You can't. I mean you don't have to love him. But you do have to believe in what he's doing. No matter what anybody says, you can't sell a corn modity without it being good commodity. You have to have something to sell.

title: WELFARE FAMILIES WIN CASE IN NASSAU
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Aug. 17 (UPI) Nassau County Attorney Morris H. Schneider said to day that 15 welfare families might remain temporarily in former Air Force barracks the county owns in Uniondale L.I.

title: Garden at Modern Art Opens Free at Night
description: The 13foot high iron gate to the garden of the Museum of Modern Art was swung open last night on creaking hinges to welcome the public in a new program of free eviening admission.

title: Too High a Farm Ceiling
description: In two working days last week the Agriculture Department mailed out $2.1 billion in checks to farms for complying with Government acreage allotments that limit the output of cotton, feed grains and wheat.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION ROSE DURING WEEK
New Yablonski Inquiry
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 17 (UPI) United States Attorney Rob ert Krupansky said today that a new Federal grand jury would be impaneled tomorrow, Ibut would not begin an hives tigation of the Yablonski mur ders util sometime in Septem ders until sometime in Sep tember. The previous grand jury attempted to learn the source of an alleged fund used to finance the murder of Joseph A. Yablonsky, United Mine Workers official, and his wife and daughter in their Clarks ville, Pa., home last Dec. 31.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (UPI) The Defense Department to day listed the following men from the New York area as among those killed in South east Asia:

title: JAMES F. LYNCH
description: GREENWOOD LAKE, N. Y., Aug. 17 (UPI)James F. Lynch, for many years librarian of The Wall Street Journal, died at his Greenwood Lake home yester day after a long illness. He was 79 years old.

title: Engelhard Unit and Agau Reach Antimony Agreement
description: The Phillip Brothers division of Englehard Minerals and Chemicals Corporation and Agau Mines, Inc., in collabora tion with the United States Antimony Corporation an nounced yesterday that they have entered into an agreement whereby Phillip shall be the ex clusive agent for the sale of antimony ores and byproducts of United States Antimony.

title: COMMANDOS'
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 17Yasir Arafat, the main Arab commando chief, met with Iraqi leaders in Baghdad yes terday after saying in Amman that his men would turn Jor dan into another Hanoi and that any Middle East peace would be foiled by our gun barrels.

title: Fleisher, Unable to Play, Takes Up Baton
description: Leon Fleisher, once Amer ica's most respected young pianist, a former prodigy who made his debut at age 7, will walk out on the stage of Philharmonic Hall for another debut next Monday.

title: Kompong Thom Reinforced
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 17 (Agence France  Presse) Two hundred Cambodian troops who were trained in South Vietnam were moved by helicopter today to the be leaguered provincial capital of Kompong Thom.

title: Grain Futures Prices Reach Limit Highs
description: It was a day to remember yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade as all grain futures rose to limit highs, propelled by the threat of a serious blight to the nation's corn crop.

title: Minneapolis Building Hit
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 17A thunderous explosion early to day ripped the old Federal Office Building, headquarters for military inductions in the Minneapolis area.

title: Teacher Unity Imperiled As 2 Groups Clash Again
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 17The longheld dream of a merger between the American Federa tion of Teachers and the Na tional Education Association, the two largest teacher organ izations in the country, appears to have been shattered.

title: Sunnyside Resumes Boxing
description: David Melendez and Ricky Ortiz, both now residents of New York, will meet in a scheduled 10round fight for the Puerto Rican welterweight championship at Sunnyside Garden, Queens, Sept. 10. The match will be part of the first boxing program at Sunnyside in a year.

title: PRIMATE OF POLAND ASKS FOR SACRIFICE
description: WARSAW, Aug 17Stefan Cardinal Wyszynski, the Roman Catholic primate of Poland, said here last night that personal sacrifices were needed if the Polish nation was to survive.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: FLORIDA BUILDINGS IGNITED BY NEGROES
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., Aug. 17 (UPI)Despite Sheriff Ed Stack's plea to cool it, Negroes set fire, to several buildings in Broward County tonight and resumed their rock throwing sprees. Sheriff Stack made his appeal today after widespread sniping, firebomb ing and looting over the week end.

title: Pay Up, Performance Down
description: The City of New York faces a crisis in skilled man power, concluded the Brookings Institution in a recent study of municipal employment problems here. Its ability to get and keep expert people to run its pro grams is inadequate. Another study by the Institute of Public Administration also recommended handsome salary increases for all top municipal administrators.

title: STOCKS CUT LOSS IN LATE REBOUND
description: Stock prices eased yesterday as the DowJones industrial average slipped 1.78 points to finish at 709.06 after being down more than 4 points in earlyafternoon trading.

title: Delegates at Crime Parley Hear Warning by U.N. Aide
description: KYOTO, Japan, Aug. 17 (Reuters)  An international congress on crime prevention opened here today with a warning that crime is quickly becoming as accepted part of life.

title: Auerbach Tries, but Russell Won't Bite
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Aug. 17Once you have coached Bill Russell and have won as many championships because of him as did Arnold (Red) Auerbach, it's difficult to let the oast fade away.

title: Vietnam Veteran in Jersey Is Too Short to Join Police
description: NEWARK, Aug. 17 (AP) A 5foot6,inch civilian is find ing that although he had what it took to win a Bronze Star in Vietnam, he does not have what it takes to become a New ark policeman.

title: Mayor Offers Warlike Plans, With a Grin, to Get Aid for City
description: Mayor Lindsay had a couple of suggestions yesterday on how the city could get more, aid from the Federal and state governments.

title: RALPH R. FORAN
description: NORTH PLAINFIELD, N. J., Aug. 17Ralph R. Foran, for mer director of quality research for Merck & Co., manufacturing chemists in Rahway, died yes terday in Muhlenberg Hospital, Plainfield. He was 76 years old and lived here. He retired after 30 years service with Merck.

title: BUILDERS IN JERSEY EXPAND SHUTDOWN
description: New Jersey building contrac tors reported yesterday that they had halted work on 205 projects valued at nearly $500 million to protest what the builders called inflationary de mands by operating engineers.

title: JANITOR JIM SNAPS MEAT PACING MARK
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Aug. 17 (AP)Janitor Jim, a 3yearold gelding owned by Dean Butts of Decatur, Ill., set a world's pacing record today as he won the Illinois State Fair colt stakes for 3yearold pacers.

title: White Motor to Merge; Axelrod Plans LinkUp
description: White Consolidated Indus tries, Inc., and the White Motor Company, two large industrial companies based in Cleveland, announced yesterday that they had agreed in principle to merge.

title: Advertising: Lacoste Crocodile Explained
description: When two Volkswagen drivers pass each other at night, they blink their lights as a sign of recognition. When two owners of Louis Vuitton luggage cross paths at an airport, they nod dis creetly for the same reason. And when two women wear ing a Lacoste dress meet at a party, they recognize each other as sisters under the skin rather than as immedi ate enemies.

title: JARRING CONFERS WITH ARAB AIDES
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 17  Secretary General Thant's special representative for the Middle East, Dr. Gun nar V. Jarring, continued to day to press for preliminary agreements that would allow peace talks to begin.

title: Prof. Harry A. Overstreet Dies; Author and Lecturer Was 94
description: FALLS CHURCH, Va., Aug. 17Harry Allen Overstreet, the writer and lecturer, died at his home here today. He was 94 years old and had been ill for several months.

title: OIL SPILL IN GROTON STIRS CONTROVERSY
description: GROTON, Conn., Aug. 17 (AP)  Oilremoval operations con tinued today as local conserva tionists prepared to fight the dumping of oilsoaked sand in a salt marsh here.

title: Miss Sarah Meade Parker Is a Bride
description: RYE, N. Y., Aug. 17Christ's Episcopal Church was the setting here last Sat urday for the marriage of Miss Sarah Meade Parker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Stevenson Parker, to Alan Houghton McCord, who is with the art department at McCannErickson, Inc., the advertising agency in New York.

title: LONG FOREIGN TRIP BY CHOU EXPECTED
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 17 Premier Chou Enlai of Com munist China is expected to make an extensive tour abroad this year that will take him to the Middle East, Africa and Europe.

title: Study on World War II Gas
description: KEIL, West Germany, Aug. 17 (UPI)Scientists began an alyzing samples of water from the Baltic Sea today to check whether German poison gases have escaped from canisters; dumped there at the end of World War II.

title: Fladassah Establishes College For Disadvantaged in Israel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17Hadassah, the Women's Zionist Organization of America, has established a community col lege in Israel, the first of its kind there.

title: INTEREST RATES CLIMB ON BONDS
description: The bond market yesterday failed to pass a key test, and interest rates moved decisively higher.

title: LevitinKrasnov, Dissident, Released by the Russians
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 17, (Reu ters)  A dissident intellectual arrested nearly a year ago has been released and the case against him has been dropped sources close to dissidents said today.

title: Repeal of Clause On Car Insurance Asked by Sargent
description: BOSTON, Aug. 17 (AP)Gov. Francis W. Sargent submitted special message to the Legisla ture today asking for the repeal of a section of the nofault auto insurance bill. This sec tion requires insurance com panies to renew indefinitely all car policies with few excep Lions.

title: Transport News and Notes
description: General Motors announced yesterday that several models of its 1971 cars, which will make their bow this fall, will be equipped with maintenancefree lead acid batteries that will not reauire the addition of water.

title: Subway and Bus Fares in London Increase Again
description: LONDON, Aug. 17Some commuters picketed stations or refused to pay for tickets today as subway and bus fares here went up, but most of Greater London's seven million strap hangers reacted with character istic apathy to the increase in the cost of their daily trips.

title: SCHWEICKART '
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission censured today Schweickart & Co., a New York brokerdealer, for violations of the financialreporting and rec ordkeeping provisions of the Federal securities laws.

title: U.S. Payments Deficit Narrows in Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17The United States balance of international payments, with the figures remaining extreme ly difficult to interpret, ap parently showed a small im provement in the second quar ter of this year, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: LOCAL PANAMA VOTE IS HAILED AS A MODEL
description: SAN MIGUELITO, Panama. Aug. 17  Over 50 per cent of the 28,000 eligible voters in this special district cast ballots for localgovernment leaders yesterday in Panama's first of ficial election since the mili tary seized power in a coup d'etat in October. 1968.

title: In Memoriam
description: LaPETINAAndrew. Happy birthday Andy,. we miss you.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President met with a delegation from the U. S. Catholic Conference studying problems of white ethnic minorities. Mr. Nixon also met with officers of the White House Correspondents Association and News Pho tographers Association. The President also had brief ap pointments with Lawrence Linn of the National Security Council staff; Jack R. Bailey, president of the National League of Postmasters and Brimmer Ehrler of the Na tional Association of Post masters; delegations of the American Association of Re tired Persons, and members of the Justice Department who have worked on the D.C. crime bill.

title: Egypt Maintains Silence
description: CAIRO, Aug. 17 (Reuters)The Government today main tained silence in the face of new Israeli allegations that Egypt had violated the cease fire again by expanding an anti aircraft missile system in the area of the Suez Canal.

title: Crusader on Jail Reform Heads Inquiry on Tombs
description: In a recent speech to a group of law students, State Senator John R. Dunne contended that 5 per cent of the state correc tions budget was spent on rehabilitating prisoners, while 95 per cent was spent to keep men behind bars.

title: PEKING PLEDGES AID TO SIHANOUK REGIME
description: Special to The New York Times HONG KONG, Aug. 17 Communist China has agreed to provide free military aid to the Cambodian government in exile of Prince Norodom Siha nouk, Cambodia's ousted head of state.

title: Explosions Are Set Off in Omaha and Minneapolis
description: OMAHA, Aug. 17A police man was killed early today, the victim of an apparent booby trap set in a vacant house on the predominantly Negro Near North Side.

title: U.S. Aids Alien Workers Drawn to Virgin Islands
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 After years of neglect, the thou sands of alien workers who are vital to the economy of the United States Virgin Islands have drawn attention from the Federal Government.

title: CHARLOTTE BOARD LOSES BUSING PLEA
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Aug. 17 The CharlotteMecklenburg School Board lost another battle today in its fight to de lay implementation of a school desegregation plan that calls for extensive crossbusing of students when the school term opens Sept. 9.

title: OKKER WINS FINAL IN HAMBURG TENNIS
description: HAMBURG, Germany, Aug. 17 (UPI)Tom Okker of the Netherlands won the West Ger man tennis championship to day by beating Ilie Nastase of Rumania. 46. 63. 63. 64.

title: L.I.U., in a Reversal, Forbids Its Guards to Carry Firearms
description: The administration of Long Island University's Brooklyn center yesterday reversed al decision that had allowed sev eral armed guards to patrol the campus since last Friday, when a student and a neighborhood resident were shot at the uni versity residence hall.

title: Storm Rakes Coast Of North Carolina And Leaves 3 Dead
description: CAPE HATTERAS, N. C. Aug. 17 (UPI)A severe tropi cal depression moved up the Eastearn Seaboard today, wash ing ashore a body and damag ing several resort towns.

title: Article 1  No Title
Miss Davis Just Misses Capture by Police in Raid
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 17The search for Angela Davis widened today after the authori ties reportedly just missed apprehending her in Birming ham. Ala., over the weekend.

title: PRICES IN LONDON GENERALLY DROP
Music: Moderns'
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 17Contemporary Music, outside the academic cloisters to which it has been condemned by the culture industry in this country, is generally to be found, when at all, on its Mack and breathing heavily.

title: Executive Changes
description: Z. D. Bonner, director of corporate development, Gulf Oil Company, has been named president of the newly formed Gulf Oil Chemicals Company, which Will handle Gulf's worldwide chemicals business.

title: Andre Captures First Race In Finn Gold Cup Regatta
description: CASCASI, Portugal, Aug. 17 (AP)  Robert Andre of the United States won the opening race today in the 15th Finn Gold Cup world champion ship.

title: Nassau Disappointed
description: NASSAU, Bahamas. Aug. 17 (AP)The Bahamas Gov ernment sent a note to England today asserting disappoint ment over the parent coun try's lack of help in blocking United States plans to.. dump nerve gas 150 miles from this island nation.

title: Soviet Launches Seventh Unmanned Spacecraft for Exploration of Venus
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 17The Soviet Union today launched an unmanned spacecraft to ward Venus.

title: U.S. INVESTIGATORS CALLED ILLTRAINED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (UPI)The House Government Operations.Committeesaid to: day that the Federal Govern ment failed to provide adequate training for most of its 50,000 investigators.

title: A CANOEIST LEAVES S.I. FOR CALIFORNIA
description: Fritz T. Sprandel, 26 years old, of Allentown, Pa., left by canoe from Staten Island yes terday, headed for Los Angeles by way of the Panama Canal.

title: Speech Scored by Tass
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 17 (AP) Tass, the Soviet press agency, said today that Mr. Agnew's speech shows that the United States is going to keep its troops in Vietnam for an in definitely long time. It said Mr. Agnew virtually admitted that the Saigon regime is kept in power by U. S. bayonets.

title: JAPANESE TO GET NONPOLLUTING CAR
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Aug. 17Wallace L. Minto, an engineer and scientist who invented al nonpolluting, Freonpowered, engine, announced today that he had signed a multimillion dollar contract for its mass production and use in Datsun automobiles manufactured in Japan.

title: 113 Deaths in Pakistan
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Aug. 17 (Reuters)Cholera has caimed 113 lives in three floodstricken districts of East Pakistan, ac cording to official reports reaching Dacca today. Of the victims, 88 died in the Kushtia area, 105 miles northwest of Dacca. There were 20 deaths in Rangpur and five in Rajshahi district last week.

title: Cambodian Ballet Just Practices
description: PNOMPENH, CambodiaThe Royal Cambodian Ballet, whose graceful mime dancers trace their legendary origins to the sea foam churned up at the creation of the uni verse, is facing an uncertain future as Cambodia moves from kingdom to republic.

title: Two United States Probes
description: The United States had made two Venus probes. The last was the Mariner 5 spacecraft, which flew 2,400 miles past Venus in 1967. It was preceded by Mar iner 2, which passed 21,500 miles from the planet in 1962.

title: Market Place:
description: Drexel Harriman Ripley, Inc., an investment banking and brokerage house with a large number of investment institutions and wealthy in dividuals among its clients, has taken a big new look at the investment outlook and concludes that better days are in sight for the stock marketexcept for some In dustries and companies that have been traditional invest ment favorites.

title: Books of The Times
description: To the great number of Americans who bought and read his biographies and other books, Andre ?? must have seemed the quintessential French writer: stylish, rational, aphoristic, balanced, without ex cesses humane and withal very genuine.

title: Saigon Political Posters Display Twisi
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam, Aug. 17"Americans Go Home, the posters say in Vietnamese.

title: Miss Rose Ella King Is Married
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 17Miss Rose Ella King, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. W. L. G. King, was married here Satur day to John Youie Woodruff, of Edison, N. J., associate di rector of the New Jersey Residential Manpower Center at Camp Kilmer, N. J., and former Olympic 800meter track champion. The Rev. Paul Beattie performed the ceremony in All Souls Uni tarian Church.

title: Police Are Defended on Moonlighting
description: The president of a Wall Street security company that employed offduty policemen to make investigations, take fin gerprints and write reports said yesterday that he believed that the moonlighting charges, brought against the men last! week were a great injustice!

title: Ashe to Tour Africa
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Aug. 17 (Reuters)Arthur Ashe, United States tennis star, will visit six African countries from Oct. 20 through Nov. 6, the United States Information Service an nounced here today. Ashe will conduct clinics and play exhi bition matches in Ghana, Kenya, Tanzania, Zambia, Uganda and Nigeria.

title: BARBITURATE USE WORRIES BRITAIN
description: LONDON, Aug. 17The Brit ish Government, worried about the increasing use of barbitu rates with intravenous injec tions, has asked treatment cen ters and local police offices for details on the extent of misuse.

title: Marshall Canfield Webb Weds Miss Emily Elizabeth Wadhams
description: Miss Emily Elizabeth Wad hams and Marshall Canfield Webb, whose fathers were classmates at Yale and who knew each other vaguely as children, were married on Saturday, a year after they bumped into each other in Europe.

title: Air Link to Boston Resumed
description: CONCORD, N. H., Aug. 17 (AP)Airline service to Boston from the cities of Laconia, Man chester and Berlin, in this state was resumed today by Execu tive Airlines. Executive is re placing flights discontinued last Thursday by Airspur of New York. Airspur dropped the serv ice because of financial pron lems.

title: PENTAGON CRITICIZED ON BUYING METHODS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP) A Federal watchdog agency says the efficiency with which the Pentagon spends billions each year may be suffering seriously because it has failed to develop and retain a com petent and highly motivated procurement staff.

title: Dr. Cecil L. Rice, ExHead Of Westbury Schools. Dies
description: Dr. Cecil L. Rice, who re tired last year as Superintend ent of Schools in Westbury, L. I., died yesterday while on a camping trip to Alaska. He was 65 years old and lived in Ridge Manor. Fla.

title: F.P.C. Asks Approval of Con Ed's Astoria Plan
description: The Federal Power Commis sion has recommended to Mayor Lindsay that the Con solidated Edison Company be allowed to proceed promptly with the controversial expan sion of its Astoria plant.

title: U.S. WILL RETAIN OIL IMPORT QUOTA; REJECTS TARIFFS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17The Nixon Administration has aban doned all consideration of shift ing oil import controls from quotas to tariffs, it was dis closed today.

title: Sutherland's Yacht Wins
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 17Leroy Sutherland of the Newport Beach (Calif.) Yacht Club won the first race of the Luders 16 international championship series today at the Chicago Yacht Club. Ben Hromadka of Hawaii was second, with Daniel Killeen of New Orleans third.

title: LARSEN IS LEADING IN U.S. CHESS OPEN
description: BOSTON, Aug. 17  Grand master Bent Larsen of Den mark, took the lead in the 71st annual United States Open Chess Championship at the end of the seventh round by defeat ing Lubomil Kavalek, a former Czechoslovak champion, at the Parker House here last night. Kavalek had posted six success ive victories up to then.

title: Insurer Reports Gains
description: The Eastern Life Insurance Company of New York reported yesterday that its net income from operations for the six months ended June 30 rose to a record of $304,597, or 18 cents a share, compared with $181,695, or 11 cents a share, in the like period last year. Net premium income increased 25 per cent to $5,630,643 from $4, 513,374 the year before.

title: Commissioner Sworn In
description: Mayor Lindsay swore in Jo seph R. Erazo yesterday as Commissioner of the Manpower and Career Development Agen cy. He succeeds Cyril Tyson, who resigned the $35,000ayear post to accept a fellowship at Harvard University.

title: Roundup: Hannan Shows Educated Arm in 1Hitter
description: Jim Hannan, despite an academic career that included studies at Notre Dame, the University of Pennsylvania Fairleigh Dickinson and New York University on the way to a master's degree in eco nomics, didn't seem very smart three years ago.

title: Dividend Dropped On Common Stock By Bank in Detroit
description: DETROIT, Aug. 17The Bank of the Commonwealth in De troit, the flagship of a chain of banks once dominated by Donald H. Parsons investor group, announced today that common stock dividends would be eliminated for the rest of the year.

title: Libby Warns of Coast Peril
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 17 (UPI)Dr. Willard Libby, a Nobel prizewinning scientist from U.C.L.A., predicts a major eco logical disaster for Los Angeles sometime this fall. Dr. Libby said yesterday that a pollution crisis, caused by extreme amounts of hydrocarbons in the air, might cause several hun dred deaths in the Los Angeles area.

title: VOLUME TUMBLES AS AMEX DECLINES
description: Prices and volume continued to drop yesterday on the Amer ican Stock Exchange in the slowest trading in more than three years.

title: Atlanta Fires Called Arson
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 17 (AP)Firebombs touched off three blazes today that damaged busi nesses in a predominantly Ne gro section of the city, arson investigators said.

title: LOUIS H. RUBENSTEIN, CLOTHING MAKER, 77
description: Louis H. Rubenstein, former president of the Infants Home of Brooklyn and founder and president of Le Mont Clothing and Driggs Pants Company, men's clothing manufacturing concerns, died at Mount Sinai Hospital yesterday after a long illness. He was 77 years old and lived at 275 Central Park West.

title: Israel Requires Shots
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 17 (AP) Israeli health authorities an nounced today that anticholera vaccinations would be required for Arabs from the occupied territories who planned to cross into Jordan. The new regula tions also call for persons crossing from Jordan into Israel to get anticholera vaccinations at least six days before they make the crossing.

title: Dutiful Defeats Forward Gal by Length and a Half in Adirondack at Saratoga
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 17William Haggin Perry's Dutiful, despite a ragged start, took the $29,850 Adiron dack today by the convincing margin of a length and a half. Opposing eight other 3yearolds in the sixfurlong sorint. Dutiful responded to the guid ance of Laffit Pincay to go be tween rivals in the stretch and overtake the Aisco Stable's For ward Gal, the runnerup. Next, by another halflength, came the favorite, George D. Widen er's Patelin.

title: Joanna Beals Plans Nuptials
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N. Y., Aug. 17Miss Joanna Jane Beals and Mark John Cape celatro, 1970 graduates of Wells College and Colgate University, respectively, plan to be married in the spring.

title: WILLIAM C. MICHEL, EXFOX OFFICER, 75
description: FALLS VILLAGE, Conn., Aug. 17William C. Michel, retired executive vice president of 20th CenturyFox, died today. He was 75 years old and lived on Belden Street.

title: Sports of The Times
description: NEW PALTZ, N. Y., Aug.. 17By one of the trees near the front of the long drive way, three no trespassing signs were posted. Up, near the big white woodand stone home, a tan Scout had a 1FP license plate. Nearby, a tan Chrysler sedan had a 2FP license. And on the screened porch, Floyd Patterson, in green china slacks and and a whiteT shirt, glanced toward the road where thin purple flowered bushes swayed in the warm breeze.

title: Three Copters Lost
description: SAIGON, Aug. 17 (Reuters) The United States command reported today the loss of three UH1 helicopters in Laos but did not state why the helicop ters had been there.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: James Knox Holman's Aug. 12 letter is a depressing docu ment. It weighs Israel and the Arab states in the scales of economic values and Israel Is found wantingsomething of luxury the United States cannot afford.

title: BIG JAKARTA PARADE HAILS INDEPENDENCE
description: JAKARATA, Indonesia, Aug. 17 (Reuters)  Indonesia today celebrated the 25th anniversary of its independence from the Netherlands with a huge parade through the streets depicting economic progress in the last three years.

title: Anybody Here Seen Sweeney?
description: IRVINE, Calif., Aug. 17 (UPI) Walt Sweeney, allpro offen sive guard, failed to appear ford, practice at the San Diego Charg ers training camp today and said, he planned to retire.

title: SUIT ON OCEAN HILL IS REJECTED AGAIN
description: A Brooklyn Supreme Court justice yesterday rejected second challenge to the au thority of the chairman of the recently elected school board for the new District 23, which includes the controversial OceanHill Brownsville demon stration district.

title: Western Union Here is Hit by a OneDay Strike
description: Western Union employes re turned to work early today. ending their oneday strike, which distributed service in the metropolitan area served by 3,000 union members.

title: Barbara R. Inselman Engaged To Wed Lawrence P. Temkin
description: Miss Barbara Ruth Insel man, a doctoral student in psychology at Yale, and Law rence Paul Temkin, a thirdyear medical student there, plan to be married in June.

title: A Solution to Staggeringly High Cost of Custom Fashion
description: While other stores have discontinued or speverely lim ited their custom work, Aber crombie & Fitch is stepping it up. We have a room full of Italian tai lors, explained Eugene Fracchia, buyer of sportswear and dresses for the store's second floor. When their tailors aren't doing alterations or making safari clothes, they do what Mr. Fracchia calls assorted fashion things for customers  often using the hand loomed fabrics the buyer picks up on his annual forays to Europe. Mr. Fracchia called the prices for custom clothes, which involve two fittings, staggeringly high. Never theless, he said some people manage to save money on the deal. One woman, for in stance, bought a pair of pants in Paris for $145 and had them copied five times at Abercrombie's for $95 a pair.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Houston Astros, at Shea Stadium, 126th Street and Roose velt Avenue, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8:05 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 9, 8 P.M.) (RadioWJRZ, WNBCFM, 7:55 P.M.)

title: Yanks Trounce Mets, 94, Before Croivdof 43,987 in Mayor's Trophy Game
description: The Yankees won New York's annual meeting of the baseball clans last night by bombing the Mets, 94, with the same fiend ish delight the Mets used to take when their fortunes were reversed.

title: O.E.C.D. in Japan Survey
description: PARIS, Aug. 17 (Reuters)The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development in a survey of the Japanese economy, said today that, even if a high rate of economic growth was maintained, Japan's current balanceofpayments surplus would probably be be tween $2billion and $2.5bil lion in 1970, with a further increase in the first half of next year.

title: EBAN SAYS EGYPT IS STILL BUILDING SUEZ MISSILE SITES
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 17For eign Minister Abba Eban charged today that the United Arab Republic and the Soviet Union were continuing to con struct missile sites and to de ploy weapons close to the Suez Canal.

title: Namath Passes His Physical and Will Join Atkinson at Jets'
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 17Joe Namath the actor again be came Joe Namath the football player tonight when he walked out of the Jets team physician's office and was cleared to return to the team tomorrow.

title: M'EVOY'S PAR OF 71 TAKES JUNIOR MEDAL
Turkey Takes Measures
description: ISTANBUL, Turkey, Aug. 17 (Reuters)The Turkish Health Ministry has stopped all leave for medical personnel and in stituted anticholera measures in big cities and border areas, it was announced today.

title: Bridge:
description: BOSTON, Aug. 17Youth got the better of experience in the early stages of a Spin gold knockout match between two New Yorkdominated teams today in the summer nationals of the American Contract Bridge League at the Boston Sheraton Hotel. A young group lea by Steve Altman paced Alvin Roth's experienced foursome by 77 international match points after 32 deals of a scheduled 64.

title: President Is Elected By Container Concern
description: The election of Richard T. Norton as president of Global Terminal and Container Serv ices, Inc., was announced yesterday.

title: Nets Get Cougars'
description: The New York Nets of the American Basketball Asso ciation yesterday acquired Bill Bunting, a forward, from the Carolina Cougars for an undis closed amount of money and 1971 draft choice.

title: Jersey Unemployment Rate Is 6.2%, Highest Since 64
description: TRENTON, Aug. 17 (AP)New Jersey's unemployment rate has reached its highest point in six years, the State De partment of Labor and Industry reported today.

title: Article 2  No Title
Goldberg Proposes Limit to Campaign TV Spending
description: Arthur J. Goldberg called on Governor Rockefeller yesterday to agree to limit campaign spending for television and radio even before a proposed Federal limitation takes effect

title: ClevelandCliffs Puts Four On Board of Detroit Steel
description: The Detroit Steel Corpora tion said yesterday that four of its directors had resigned to make room for four representa tives of the ClevelandCliffs Iron Company, which recently obtained majority control of Detroit Steel through a tender offer.

title: State Hazards Listed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 (AP)The survey listed the follow ing other New York City metro politan water systems as poten tially hazardous:

title: Phelps Adjusts Tube Prices
description: THe Phelps Dodge Tube Com pany, a subsidiary of Phelps Dodge Industries, announced yesterday that it would adjust base prices for tubular products to a copper base of 60 cent pound from 63 cents a pound, effective today. Published prices for copper water tube and re lated products are being sim ilarly adjusted subject to pub lished quantity discounts.

title: Jane M. Silverstein Is Betrothed
description: ?? ?? has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Irving J. Silverstein of New York and Monroe, N. Y., of the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Jane Madeline Silver stein, to Michael I. Schneider, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Schneider of Tenafly, N. J.

title: BOMB TIED TO I.R.A. INJURES 2 IN LONDON
description: LONDON, Aug. 17A bomb that the police thought had been set by members of the Irish Republican Army or their sympathizers seriously injured a young couple here last night as they carried it from a movie.

title: U.S. Judge Orders Workers to Return In A.T.&T. Dispute
description: Judge Marvin E. Frankel of Federal District Court ordered back to work last night oper ators and maintenance person nel of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's long lines division who had walked off the job late yesterday in New York and other states across the country.

title: Suffolk School Post Filled
description: ALBANY, Aug. 17Dr. John H. Gibbon has been named director of the Suffolk State School for the Mentally Re tarded in Melville, L. I. His ap pointment to the $35,000ayear post was announced by Dr. Alan D. Miller, Commissioner of Mental Hygience.

title: WATERBURY POLICE SEIZE 37 IN RAMPAGE
description: WATERBURY, Conn., Aug. 17  The police in this in dustrial city were watchful today after a weekend of dis turbances in which 37 persons were arrested.

title: Hunt for Capital Mayor Is a Dilemma for Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 President Nixon, who is try ing to improve his political image among Negro voters, is also preparing to replace Walter E. Washington, the black Mayor of the District of Columbia.

title: Lebanon's Tough New President
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 17 Suleiman Franjieh, Leba non's new President, is de picted by acquaintances as model Middle Eastern coun try gentleman.

title: W. GERMANY GAINS CHALLENGE ROUND
description: DUESSELDORF, Germany Aug. 17 (AP)  Christian Kuhnke needed only two min utes to complete a 63, 63, 75 victory over Manuel Orantes of Spain today and send West Germany into the Davis Cup challenge round against the United States, the defenders, in Cleveland on Aug. 29 through 31.

title: U.S. Report of Water Hazard in Suburbs Disputed
description: Some water district officials in the New York metropolitan area disputed the findings of the Federal survey that was disclosed yesterday Indicating potential hazard in their water supplies.

title: Savings League Scores Proposed Regulations
description: The United States Savings and Loan League asserted yesterday that the Federal Home Loan Bank Board would endanger the stability of the $170billion industry it regu lates if it adopted proposed regulations to give savers a greater voice in the manage ment of their associations.

title: Senate Refuses to Require Laird to Report on Buying
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 The Senate defeated today, 43 to 22, legislation that would have required the Pentagon to tell Congress whether it was following the new flybefore youbuy policy.

title: Agnew Assails Plan to Set A Troop Withdrawal Date
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17Vice President Agnew charged today that a Senate proposal for a fixed withdrawal of Amer ican troops from South Vietnam was a blueprint for the first defeat in the history of the United States.

title: Boy Loses a Hand in Fall From Brooklyn IND Train
description: An 8yearold boy's left hand was severed yesterday after he fell beneath the wheels of a northbound IND A train In Brooklyn, the Transit Authority renorted.

title: FEDERAL PROJECT IN READING GAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17 Two months after Dr. James E. Allen Jr. was dismissed as United States Commissioner of Education, the seed that he planted for a national reading program has begun to take root.

title: SALT and the Senate
