title: Goller Increases His Lead In Camp Perry Rifle Meet
description: I CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 19 (UPI)  Marine Warrant Of ficer Robert L. Goller of Key ser, W.Va., continued his tor rid shooting today and took sixpoint lead in the national high power rifle championships.

title: Katherine W. Steinback Betrothed
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Aug. 19Mr. and Mrs. John Er win Steinback have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Kathe rine Whelan Steinback, to Robert Henry Hodge Jr., son of Dr. and Vrs. Hodge of Kansas City, Mo. An October wedding is planned.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In the early years of the 21st century, so the historians will claim, there appeared in North America a number secret radical organizations dedicated to the suppression women. The most violent of them all was The Florence League. Members of The Florence League never traveled in groups of less than 11, and always wore helmets like those worn by professional football players before that game was banned. As one such group (called a team in their secret jargon) menacingly rolled down a street toward a 24hour day care center, the leader (called quarterback) would in variably shout, Pat Pa linkas, and the team would respond, Pat it, hell, let's smash it.

title: Executioner Defeats Raise Your Glass by 6 Lengths in Sanford at Saratoga
Prague Two Years After
description: Two years after the invasion that ended Czecho slovakia's sovereignty, the Kafkaesque situation which Czechs and Slovaks alike now find themselves is grimly summarized in the Prague joke that theirs is the most neutral country in the world: It does not ever intervene in its own internal affairs.

title: ShortInterest Positions Show A Rise of 10.2% on Big Board
description: Shortinterest positions change on Aug. 14 were 10.2 earlier, the exchange reported shortinterest positions on last Friday amounted to 20,075, 218 shares, an increase of 1,855,998 shares from the re vised July figure of 18,219,220 shares.

title: Good Appointment at State
description: On his experience in both diplomacy and administra titin, John N. Irwin 2d is well qualified to be Under Secretary of State, one of the most challenging second level jobs in Washington. As Assistant Secretary Defense in the Eisenhower Administration, he was deeply involved in international negotiation on military alliances, arms control and disarmament.

title: Follow That Boom, Boom, Boom to African Sculpture
description: Arthur B. Hunter, a black artist in a green and gold dashiki:

title: Army to Drop Charges Against Songmy Soldier
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Aug. 19 (AP)The Army an nounced today it was drop ping charges against S. Sgt. Kenneth L. Hodges, one of 12 men charged in the killings at Songmy.

title: Astros Are 94 Victors as Mets Make 4 Errors
description: Imagine the original New York Mets in all their inept splendor, but without the charm, and you'll have a fair impression of how the Mets performed at Shea Stadium yes terday in a 94 loss to the Houston Astros.

title: SUBWAY SUSPENDS REDLIGHT PASSER
description: The Transit Authority an nounced yesterday that it had suspended a subway motorman for running his southbound IRT local through a red signal just below. 103d Street on Tuesday morning.

title: Mozart and Rodgers Coexist at the Salzburg Festival
description: SALZBURG, Austria, Aug. 16Music and The Sound of Music dominate Salzburg, and Mozart and Julie An drews, to say nothing of Her bert von Karajan, are its de ities. The visitor to Salzburg will never fail to be reminded of Mozart.

title: Enough to Make Any Grandchild Proud
description: All he wants to do is go yummie yummie at the pretty girls, scolded a plump, sixty ish woman about her grand son. The 12yearold voyeur grinned. The pretty girls lined up in the broiling sun on the Boardwalk at Coney Island yesterday weren't ex actly teenagers. They were competing for the Most Glam orous. Grandmother Contest, sponsored by the Coney Is land Chamber of Commerce.

title: CORN SYRUP PRICES INCREASED BY C.P.C.
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, N.J., Aug. 19 (AP)The Corn In dustrial Division of C.P.C. International, Inc., said today it was immediately raising its corn svruo and starch orices.

title: GOLDBERG URGES A BAN ON FISHING
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y., Aug. 19 Arthur J. Goldberg urged the state today to ban commercial fishing in lakes and streams that are consistently above dangerous levels of mercury contamination.

title: Bus Driver Is Stabbed By Angry Passenger
description: YONKERS, August 19A driver for the Club Transit, Inc., bus lines was repeatedly stabbed tonight, the police said, by. a passenger who be came enraged when the driver of the exactfare bus refused to change a quarter for him.

title: New Ford Comet Will Have an Optional V8 Engine
description: LAS VEGAS, Aug. 19A new small Comet, a dressedup version of the Ford Motor Company's successful Mav erick, will be sold by Ford's LincolnMercury dealers for 1971. The car will be in deal er showrooms on Sept. 11.

title: U.S. Forecasts Renewed Economic Upswing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The Commerce Department, in a new midyear assessment of the economy, forecast today renewed upswing in the rest of 1970 and in 1971.

title: .. Afrikaner Justice Revisited
description: A sequel to one of the most bizarre courtroom epi sodes ever enacted will begin Monday in South Africa. Twenty Africans, five of them women, will go on trial in Pretoria, charged with terrorist activities aimed overthrowing the white minority Government.

title: Brittany. Spaniel Started His Life As Ugly Duckling
description: The Brittany is a dog of paradoxes. He's a spaniel, but looks like a small setter. He's the only member of the spaniel family that doesn't flush his gamehe points it. He's an excellent upland hunter, but he's also a natu ral retriever. So it is no sur prise the owners of the topwin ning Britt in the United States should have start ed off uninterest ed in showing but in hunting. Their first experiences at shows wasn't in the con formation rings but obedi ence trials.

title: CORN LEADS RISE IN GRAIN FUTURES
description: Corn called the tune yes terday in commodity trading, driving futures prices upward in active but orderly trading.

title: Astoria Plant Given Yes and No Votes By 2 State Agencies
description: The State Public Service Commission has urged Mayor Lindsay to approve the Con solidated Edison power plant expansion in Astoria. But at the same time the Commis sioner of the State Environ mental Conservation Depart ment, Henry Diamond, has said that the proposed plant would seriously jeopardize plans to meet air quality standards.

title: Observer: Gummer Gurton's Gibbet
description: LONDON, Aug. 19Everyone knows, of course, that the United States has had a Vice President for years, but how many of us are aware that Eng land once had a Vice King and might still have one today but for the notoriously short temper of Henry VIII?

title: Army Captain Appointed To Cabinet Post in Cuba
description: MIAMI, Aug. 19Premier Fidel Castro has appointed Capt. Serafin Fernandez Rod diguez as Cuba's Domestic Trade Minister, normally a ci vilian post.

title: rock FETE LOSES CAPITAL STADIUM
description: Promoters of the canceled Powder Ridge Rock Festival, who announced Tuesday that they would present a new con cert in Washington on Aug. 25, learned yesterday that they have been denied use of the Robert F. Kennedy Stadium there.

title: European Allies Seek to Help Finance U.S. Troops
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 19  The United States allies in the North Atlantic Treaty Organize tion, led by West Germany, have been working since spring on a financeassistance pro gram that would keep United States forces in. Europe or at least limit the number of troops withdrawn.

title: Books of The Times
description: To New Yorkers, William Zeckendorf, his sudden fall from financial grace not withstanding, will always be Mr. Real Estate. He was supersalesman, faster than a speeding foreclosure, borrowing millions with a simple handshake, able to leap from sale to leaseback and back again.

title: Pirates Release Pena
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 19 (AP) The Pittsburgh Pirates said tonight that Orlando Pena, a righthanded relief pitcher, had been given his uncondi tional release. Pena, who joined the Pirates about six weeks ago, had a 21 wonlost record and two saves. The Pi rates recalled Fred Cambria, a righthander, from Columbus of the International League.

title: Light Into the Tombs...
description: A story made no less disquieting by its dreary familiarity is unfolding in the legislative hearings on the Tombs. The inquiry by State Senator John R. Dunne into conditions in the troubled Manhattan House of Detention has exposed far more than cus todial brutality and terrible overcrowding.

title: AUSTRALIAN TO HEAD FORD'S UNIT THERE
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 19 The first Australian to head a major automobile manufac turing company in this country has been appointed by the Ford Motor Company.

title: CAHILL IS URGED TO AID MIGRANTS
description: BRIDGETON, N. J., Aug. 19 Three organizations that are aiding migratory farm workers in southern New Jersey urged Gov. William T. Cahill today to end what they said was apathy by the state toward the miserable destiny of the laborers.

title: For the Palestinians, Another Uncertain Hour
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 18 The crackle of small arms fired aimlessly into the night, the digging of shelters in the refugee camps and the wary movement of Jordanian troops; girding the city all seem to foreshadow another tragic epi sode in the history of the Pal estinians.

title: Canadiens sign Bill Collins
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 19 (UPI)The Montreal Canadiens of the National Hockey League signed today the former Minnesota North Stars wing, Bill Collins.

title: PEAK IN ACTIVITIES SET BY WORLD BANK
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The World Bank reported today rec ord lending activity and record earnings in the fiscal year ended last June 30.

title: Pentagon Aide to Resign
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP) Dr. Yuanli Wu will resign as Deputy Secretary of Defense for Policy Plans and National Security Council Affairs and return to his old post as pro fessor of economics at the Uni versity of San Francisco, the Pentagon said today. Dr. Wu will be back at his post for the coming school year. He had served in the Defense Depart ment since June 5, 1969.

title: $1Million in LSD Is Seized in Raid After Mail Check
description: Customs agents seized more than $1million worth of LSD yesterday and arrested a 26yearold Manhattan man who they said was a key figure in the smuggling of illegal hal lucinogenic drugs.

title: Laker Rookie Sidelined
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 19 (UPI)Ernie Killum, second round draft choice of the Los Angeles Lakers, was sidelined today with a dislocated left foot and will be forced to miss :the  start of the Natipnal Basketball Association club's practice next month.

title: Insiders Stockholdings
Israeli Planes Strike At Bases in Lebanon
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 19 (AP)The Israeli command said its planes attacked Arab guer rilla bases in Lebanon today. It was the second Israeli in cursion into Lebanon reported in as many days and the third in five days.

title: 4 TIED FOR THE LEAD IN U.S. CHESS OPEN
description: BOSTON, Aug. 19  Grand master Bent Larsen of Den mark drew his ninthround game with the New York star and defending champion, Pal Benko, in the United States Open Chess Championship at the Parker House here last night.

title: N.A.A. C.P. Cites Bias in Buffalo Building Trades
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 19The Na tional Association for the Ad vancement of Colored People announced today that it planned to file a suit to stop all state and Federal construction in the Buffalo area until alleged racial discrimination was eliminated from the building trades here.

title: Rev. Dr. Frederick Harris, 87, Senate Chaplain 24 Years, Dies
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP)  The Rev. Dr. Fred erick Brown Harris, who served for 24 years, a record, as chaplain of the Senate, died yesterday. He was 87 years old.

title: Witness Says She Loves Manson and All Mankind
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 19Linda Kasabian, in her 18th day on the witness stand, com pleted her testimony here today by professing still to love Charles M Manson as I do alll mankind.

title: MIUCAS TESTIFIES AT PANTHER TRIAL
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 19 Lonnie McLucas testified today that he had fired a shot into the body of Alex Rackley be cause he believed him to be already dead and feared end ing up in the same position Rackley was in.

title: Casals Drops Israeli Trip
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 19 (Reuters) Pablo Casals cannot come to Israel to perform in the Israel Festival because his doctors have advised him that the trip would be too strenuous, festi val officials said today. Casals, who is 93 years old, lives in San Juan, P.R.

title: Lawyer Here Is Appointed Under Secretary of State
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 The White House today named John N. Irwin 2d, a prominent New York lawyer and former Assistant Secretary of Defense under the Eisenhower Admin istration, to be Under Secre tary of State.

title: Upstate G.I. Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (UPI)The Defense Department an nounced today the names of seven men killed in action in Southeast Asia. They included Pfc. Walter L. Redding, Army, Naples, N. Y.

title: INDUSTRY LINKUP IN E.E.C. IS URGED
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 19 (Reu ters)Compames in the Euro pean Economic Community are incapable of competing, with giant American corpora tions under present conditions, its executive commission warned today.

title: Board Refuses to Hear Nonsaluters of the Flag
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Aug. 19 (AP)The Monmouth County Board of Freeholders said yesterday that it would not allow citizens to speak at its public meetings if they did not take part in flag cere monies at the beginning of each session

title: SENATE DEFEATS NEW BID TO LIMIT ABM EXPANSION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The Senate today defeated by 53 to 45 the third and apparently final challenge this year to the Administrationsponsored Safe guard antiballisticmissile sys tem.

title: OIL ISSUES IGNITE SPURT IN MARKET
Son of U.S. Aide Arrested At Airport on Drug Charge
description: The son of a State Depart ment agriculture expert was arrested yesterday morning at La Guardia Airport on a charge of trying to smuggle hashish into the United States.

title: DR. WILLIAM BINKLEY, HISTORIAN OF TEXAS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 19 (AP)Dr. William Campbell Binkley, scholar on Texas history, died here today. He was 81 years old.

title: Cornfeld Cancels Trip Here; Hopes to Hold Geneva Talks
description: GENEVA, Aug. 19 (AP)In a lastminute change of plans, Bernard Cornfield said today he hoped to reach a reconciliation with Sir Eric Wyndham White in Geneva instead of New York.

title: Disastrous Trade Bill
description: The House Ways and Means Committee has for mally approved, by a vote of 17 to 7, a trade bill that would impose import quotas on textiles, shoes, oil and, in all probability, a long list of other products. If adopted and signed, this bill would represent a giant step back to protectionism for the United States.

title: POLICE KILL NEGRO IN A FLORIDA CITY
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Aug. 19 (UPI)The police shot and killed a Negro today and arrested 19 persons on riot charges, capping four nights of racial violence that has spread to four South Florida cities.

title: Student Group Elects Head
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 19 (UPI)David M. Ifshin, a 21yearold past president of students at Syracuse University; was elected president of the National Stu dent Association today. Mr. If shin has been an active sup porter of a plan by Rennie Davis, a defendant in the Chi cago conspiracy trial, to hold massive antiwar demonstration in Washington next May.

title: Screen: Sex, Violence and Terror
RATES REASSESSED IN BOND MARKETS
description: With different parts of the credit markets moving in dif ferent directions, the August reassessment of interestrate leVels continued yesterday in an atmosphere rife with ru mors.

title: RollCall Vote in Senate On Expansion of ABM
Knicks Change Schedule
description: The New York Knickerbock ers announced yesterday that the sites of the preseason games with the Baltimore Bullets had been changed to Baltimore on Saturday, Sept. 26, and Mem phis on Tuesday, Sept. 29.

title: Hussein Reported Seeking to Placate Guerrilla Chiefs
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 19Informants close to the throne said today that King Hussein had begun a campaign to calm irate commando leaders while trying to persuade their follow ers to accept an eventual peace ful settlement of the Arab Israeli dispute.

title: MITCHELL WARNS ON RACE BALANCE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19Attorney General John N. Mitchell said today that shifting school desegregation decisions had made yoyo's out of some students in the South, and he expressed the hope that the Su preme Court would not impose racial balance requirements during the coming school year.

title: Goodell Acts to Shed Renegade Image
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 Senator Charles E. Goodell opened a drive today to show New York Republicans that he is not a party renegade.

title: Children of Retarded Mothers Learn Well in a Wisconsin Study
description: LONDON, Aug. 19  Shortly after a group of mentally re tarded women gave birth, their infant children were given in tensive training programs at the University of Wisconsin. By the age of 3, the children began to read and learn arith metic.

title: Governor Names Halberg to Assist In City Campaign
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday the appoint ment of Herbert B. Halberg, former Commissioner of Marine and Aviation in Mayor Lind say's administration, as special New York City field coordin ator for the Governor's bid for reelection.

title: A Veto Well Vetoed
description: In helping to override President Nixon's veto of the education appropriation bill, Congressional Republi cans have commendably served the country, though with some damage to their party's campaign strategy. Sixteen Republican Senators, including the minority leader, and 77 Republican Representatives voted against the Administration's proclaimed effort to hold the line against a dangerous budget deficit. That will not make it easy this fall to blame inflation on spendthrift Democratic Congress, as G.O.P. leaders had every apparent hope of doing.

title: Pornography Report Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP)  The President's Commission on Pornography has postponed the release of its final report until midSeptember, but Dr. W. Cody Wilson, the commis sion's executive director, said today that the panel's outlook had not changed, despite criti oism from the White House and Congress. He said the delay would give commission mem bers more time to review the report, which was to be re leased late this month.

title: AGE SHAPES VIEWS AT KENT PARLEY
description: KENT, Ohio, Aug. 19  The elders talked of a minority of troublemakers, of better com munications, of nonlethal wea ponry and of the problems of large universities as the Presi dent's Commission on Campus Unrest opened hearings here today, and the young spoke of guns and death.

title: Drug Aid Sought at Jersey Hospital
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J. Aug. 19  Parents, businessmen and community workersshaken by the death of a star high school basketball player here this week, apparently from an acute heroin reaction  met today with the administrator of Engle wood Hospital to ask for beds there for the treatment of addicts.

title: State's Oldest House Is Being Restored
description: The dilapidated frame house by the junkyard in East Flatbush is as swaybacked as Barney Google's horse and even older, and it has had many a near miss with the bulldozer.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Israel yesterday made public photo graphs purporting to show an Egyptian mis sile buildup just after the start of the Mid dle East ceasefire. A senior staff officer termed the new situation very serious for us. The Israeli Foreign Ministry, replying at the same time to American reservations about the evidence, said it was certain of the precision and seriousness of our infor mation. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Boy, 5, Beaten Senseless By Playmate With Bottle
description: The Bronx police arrested a 9yearold boy last night and charged him with beating his 5yearold playmate into un consciousness with a bottle during an argument.

title: State Orders Chlorination Of Ground Water Systems
description: ALBANY, Aug. 19 (AP)The State Health Department's ordered today the chlorination of all public water supply sys tems in the state that use around water as their source.

title: DuBridge Resigns as Nixon's Science Adviser
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19Dr. Lee A. DuBridge resigned today as science adviser to President Nixon and was re placed by a computer special ist 23 years his junior, Dr. Edward E. David Jr. of Sum mit, N. J. Dr. DuBridge, who is 68 years old, told a news conference at the White House that he wanted to retire because for a long time I've had a horror of remaining in any job beyond reasonable retirement age.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: In A Report on New York City's Options for Cable Tele vision Franchises the Urban Technology of the Vera Insti tute of Justice has encouraged community oriented C.A.T.V. programing. However, a re lated area, the provision of C.A.T.V. service to low income neighborhoods and families is completely ignored in the report.If C.A.T.V. were purely consumption good it would be justifiable to permit lower in come families to choose be tween C.A.T.V. service and other consumption; the broader community's interests would be adequately served through direct income redistributions, e.g., public welfare. However, as the Vera report strongly implies, C.A.T.V. is not purely an individual consumption commodity.

title: Bridal Planned By Miss Gamble
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Aug. 19Miss Elizabeth Ann Gamble plans to be married Sept. 4 in. St. Louis to Terry Thomas O'Connor, a special agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, from which his father, Carl O'Connor of St. Louis, Mo., retired as a special agent after 20 years of service. The future bride's father, Joseph H. Gamble, is an F. B. I. special agent in charge of the Internal Se curity Division in New York.

title: FOSTER IN FRONT IN THISTLE SERIES
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 19  Kent Foster of Cincinnati held a 4 point lead for the 25th anniversary Thistle Class national championship today after four races had been com pleted in the weeklong regat ta being sailed on Long Island Sound off Cedar Point Yacht Club. Two races remain in the serise.

title: Miss Gabor Is Too Upset To Perform at Her Matinee
description: Zsa Zsa Gabor, the actress who was robbed at gunpoint of jewels valued at more than $600,000 early yesterday morn ing, did not appear in yester day's matinee performance of Forty Carats at the Morosco Theatre.

title: Columbia George Is Favored at 65 In Pace Saturday
description: YONKERS, Aug. 19  Most harness racing observers are in agreement that the difference between Columbia George and Most Happy Fella, clearly this season's outstanding 3yearold pacers, is indeed small. Each colt has the blood line, speed, stamina and gameness that make a champion. In seven meetings this year, Most Happy Fella enjoys a 43 advantage over Columbia George.

title: HADASSAH ADOPTS A RECORD BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19Hadassah, the women's Zionist organization of America, today adopted a 197071 budget of $12.5million for the support of its social service and medical institutions in Israel and for programs in this country.

title: Tropical Storm Speeding Toward Isle of Martinique
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Aug. 19 (UPI)A tropical storm that has been named Dorothy churned to life in the Atlantic today and sped toward the Caribbean isle of Martinique wiith 70mileanhour winds.

title: Film Festival in Venice Gets Off To Unaccustomed Quiet Start
description: VENICE, Italy, Aug. 19The 31st International Film Festival, which opened here tonight, is short on celebri ties, protest and even en tries, and the presentation of three films made especially for Italian television is seen as a sign of the direction in which the underfinanced lo cal industry is heading.

title: Cogan, Berlind to Absorb Key Part of Hayden, Stone
description: The business of Hayden, Stone, Inc., a major brokerage, house in financial distress, will be divided between Cogan, BerH lind, Weill & Levitt, Inc., and Walston & Co., Inc., under the terms of an agreement dis closed yesterday.

title: Ibo's Job Hunt Fruitless In City Biafrans Ravaged
description: PORT HARCOURT, Nigeria, Aug. 14  Joseph, a 34yearold Ibo, finally summoned suf ficient courage the other day to return to Port Harcourt, where he had worked as a welder be fore the Nigerian civil war.

title: Bridge
description: BOSTON, Aug. 19A team of five players who are prom inent in New York tourna ments captured the Spingold knockout team title in the American Contract Bridge league's summer nationals at the Boston Sheraton Hotel early today. They did it by defeating the world cham pion Dallas Aces.

title: Dryer Surfaces as Defensive Star
description: BROOKVILLE, I. I., Aug. 19  Fred Dryer thinks the training season is too long. He'd limit it to two weeks of drills and three weeks of exhibitions and then he'd open the gates and start the season.

title: Theater: Early O'Neill
Tarr Predicts Drop in Draft
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (UPI) The Selective Service direc tor, Curtis W. Tarr, expressed hope today for a 1971 draft of fewer than 163,000, the total expected for this year.

title: U.S. Will Terminate a Contract For Failure to Hire Negroes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (UPI)  The Government be gan today its first enforcement action against a contractor for failing to comply with the so called Philadelphia Plan aimed at training Negroes and other minority workers for construc tion jobs.

title: New Police Force in Capital Guards Embassies
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The new blue car cruising in north west Washington carried no printed legend but had seven large red lights on its roof, an extra radio antenna and a spe cial license plate. Inside were two officers wearing sunglasses and with gold braid on the right shoulder of their white shirts.

title: Nixon and Rogers Messages on Germ Warfare Ban
description: With a view to receiving the advice and consent of the Senate to ratification, I trans mit herewith the protocol for the prohibition of the use in war of asphyxiating, poison ous or other gases, and of bacteriological methods of warfare, Signed at Geneva June 17, 1925. I transmit also the report by the Secretary of State which sets forth the understandings and the pro posed reservation of the Unit ed States with respect to the protocol.

title: F. P. C. AUTHORIZES CON ED TO BUILD STORM KING PLANT
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 The Federal Power Commis sion, for the second time in five years, has authorized the Consolidated Edison Company to build a controversial pumped storage hydroelectric power project at Storm King Mountain on the Hudson River near Cornwall, N.Y.

title: Reorganization Action Filed
description: Leasing Consultants, Inc., announced yesterday it has filed a voluntary petition for an arrangement with creditors under Chapter 11 of the United States Bankruptcy Act. The company said revised figures issued by the new management showed a negative net worth figure on a realistic basis of about $3million as of Feb. 21.

title: BATTLE REPORTED NEAR PNOMPENH
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Thursday, (UPI) Aug. 20 A military spokesman said that a force estimated at 3,000 North Vietnamese regulars launched a heavy attack early today against the outer defenses of Pnompenh. He said casualties had been heavy on both sides.

title: Miss Willa Israel Prospective Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. David Israel of New York have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Willa Harriet Israel, to Alan Paul Fein baum, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Feinbaum of Franklin Square, L. I.

title: Personal Finance
description: If you have bills to pay, you probably do as most peo ple do: you let them pile up until the middle or the end of the month.

title: Curb on Riot Troops Beaten
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP) The Senate rejected 87 to 2 today an amendment that would have required Presidential ap proval to load the weapons of National Guardsmen on domes tic riot duty. Only Senator Eu gene J. McCarthy, Democrat of Minnesota, who proposed the amendment, and Senator Ed ward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, voted to impose the restriction.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
U.A.R. AND SOVIET GIVEN SAM2 DATA
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 The United States today gave the SoViet Union evidence, which it said was not conclu sive, that Egyptian missile bat teries moved closer to the Suez Canal after the Middle East truce began Aug. 7. But it did not charge Cairo with a truce violation or request the with drawal of any missiles.

title: 10 of 15 Charter Buses Fail to Pass Jersey Check
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Aug. 19 (UPI)State and Fed eral inspectors checked 15 charter buses on the New Jer sey Turnpike last week and found 10 of them to have safety defects.

title: Music: Berkshire Choir
description: The Metropolitan Museum, which seems to be finding more and more ways of ex tending its hospitality to the performing arts, provided a marvelous setting Tuesday night for a splendid concert of sacred and secular music by the Berkshire Boy Choir. The concert was given in the Medieval Sculpture Hall, with the chorus of boys and men ranged on risers placed in front of the magnificent Spanish choir screen installed in the hall several years ago.

title: U. S. WIDENS TEST OF VOTEAT18 LAW
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (UPI)  The Government filed suits against New Hampshire and North Carolina in lower Federal courts today to provide a further test of the consti tutionality of a law extending the right to vote to 18yearolds.

title: With Little Equipment, They Camp Simply, Yet Dine Elegantly
description: PHILADELPHIALast year, William and June Noble drove several thousand miles alone in a small Mercedes Benz on a cookout trip in South America. And only a month ago they returned from roundtrip 7,000mile camping expedi tion to Mexico with four children in a Volkswagen bus. They dined, they said, simply but elegantly and well with minimum of equipment.

title: FIDELITY FUND SUIT WILL BE APPEALED
description: A shareholder suit against Fidelity Fund, Inc., which was exonerated Tuesday of Improp erly conducting portfolio trans actions over a threeyear pe riod, will be appealed, the head of the plaintiff's law firm dis closed late yesterday.

title: CITY INTEREST COST SOARS, BEAME SAYS
description: New York City had to pay more than twice as much for temporary borrowing last year than ever before, Controller Abraham D. Beame said yes terday.

title: State Is Urged to Act to Prohibit Fanciful Names for Meat Cuts
description: ALBANY, Aug. 19 (AP) The Attorney General's office and a consumers group from New York City asked the State Agriculture Department today to outlaw the use of such fan ciful names as London broil and California roast on meat cuts sold in stores.

title: Officials Impressed by Showing Of Saigon Troops Against Foe
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 19Allied officials here say that South Vietnamese ground forces have made a surprisingly good showing in their current offensive against North Vietnamese base areas in the country's northernmost provinces.

title: 7 Believed Dead in Sinking
description: HALIFAX, Nova Scotia, Aug. 19 (UPI)  Seven Portuguese fishermen were believed to have been killed today when Portuguese vessel sank after colliding with a Canadian fish ing boat in fog today 90 miles southeast of St. John's New foundland.

title: Anna Lawson, Harlem Teacher, Dies on Eve of 89th Birthday
description: Anna E. Lawson, who re tired in 1951 as principal of the former Julia Ward Howe Junior High School for Girls, 212 West 120th Street, died Monday in Skaneateles, N.Y., where she lived. She would have been 89 years old Tues day.

title: Peace Decal Off LiMite
description: WICHITA FALLS, Tex., Aug. 19 (UPI)  Security officers at Shepard Air Force Base began today enforcing orders to re move from all base vehicles decals showing the American flag with a peace symbol over print. Any civilian at Shepard with such a decal on his auto mobile will be escorted to the main gate and asked to leave. The orders include books, jack ets and personal belongings of the airmen.

title: BENDIX SEES SALES AND EARNINGS DROP
description: Sales and earnings of Bendix Corporation will be down sub stantially for the fiscal year ending Sept. 30, according to a proxy statement mailed to stockholders announcing a spe cial meeting for voting on a pro posed merger with American Forest Products Cornoration.

title: C.B.S. Profits Dip in Second Quarter
Pawel Jasienica Dies at 61; Polish Writer and Historian
description: WARSAW, Aug. 19 (UPI)Pawel Jasienica, a writer and historian who was singled out by Premier Wladyslaw Go mulka as an instigator of the Polish student riots in March of 1968, died today, the Polish press agency said. He was 61 years old.

title: Soviet Ship Capsizes Near NATO Exercise
description: BONN, Aug. 19A Soviet vessel believed to be equipped with electronic surveillance gear is lying capsized in the North Sea in the vicinity of maneuvers of the North At lantic Treaty Organization.

title: NEGRO's Tactician
description: On a typical night about 10 years ago, Dr. Thomas Wil liam Matthew, then director of the department of neuro surgery at the Coney Island Hospital, was racing to the hospital from his home in Har lem to perform an emergency operation. He was stopped for speeding by a policeman who took his time writing out the ticket, ignor ing the doctor's pleas for haste, and then followed Dr. Matthew to the hospital to make sure he did not speed again.

title: U.S. TITLE ROWING WILL START TODAY
description: COLLINGSWOOD, N. J.; Aug. 19With oarsmen from West Germany, Australia, New Zea land and Canada on the scene since yesterday, all appeared in readiness today for the start of the national rowing championships.

title: MISS WILKINSON WINS 2 MATCHES
description: DARIEN, Conn., Aug. 19Martha Wilkinson of Whittier, Calif., the medalist, won two matches today in the United States women's amateur golf championship at the Wee Burn Country Club.

title: PERRY ACHIEVES HIS 18TH VICTORY
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 19As the Yankees chartered bus, swaying from side to side, approached Metropolitan Sta dium tonight, Ralph Houk turned to no one in particular and asked.

title: NIXON'S STANDING DECLINES IN POLL
TENSION PERSISTS IN SUFFOLK AREA
description: CENTRAL ISLIP, L. I., Thurs day, Aug. 20  The predomi nantly black Carleton Park section of this midisland com munity held a tenuous grip on calm yesterday following a night of gunfire across barri cades.

title: Rickey Left $379,475
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 19 (UPI)The estate of the late Branch Rickey, former baseball execu tive, who died in 1965, was val ued today at $379,475 in St. Louis County Probate Court.

title: DIPHTHERIA FIGHT SEEN AS LONG ONE
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Aug. 19  San Antonio's diphtheria epidemic, which has hit hardest in a MexicanAmerican residential area, may not be completely checked until next spring, health officials said today.

title: 2 Policemen Attacked
description: MIAMI, Aug. 19 (AP)About 400 youths attacked two plain clothes policemen in Bayfront Park yesterday, biting one and throwing a 20gallon garbage can at another, the police said. Three teenagers were arrested after 30 uniformed officers broke up the crowd and closed the park.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Special Committee on Co lonialism10:30 A.M.; Sub committee on PetitionsIm mediately following.

title: HARRISON C. CORNELL
description: YONKERS, Aug. 19 (AP)Harrison Cameron Cornell, an independent radio and televi sion newsman, who made training films for the Navy, died today at a hospital here. He was 52 years old.

title: Tourists'
description: ROME, Aug. 19If every body in Rome did as the Ro mans do, there would not be anybody in Rome.

title: STOCK LIST FIRM ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange were firm yesterday, although they finished below the day's best levels.

title: Goldner Named Director Of Flatbush Action Project
description: Mayor Lindsay announced the appointment yesterday of Sidney J. Goldner as director, of the Neighborhood Action Program in East Flatbush in Brooklyn.

title: L.I. House Tour Planned
description: EAST HAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 19The annual tour of homes here and in nearby Sagaponack for the benefit of Guild Hall, the commu nity's cultural center, will be held from 2 to 6 P.M. on Tuesday. Mrs. Frank Cam pion is chairman for the event, which is entitled Art in the Home. Tickets at $6.50 each are available from the beneficiary, 158 Main Street.

title: CON ED IS PRESSED TO RECOVER FUNDS
description: The city charged yesterday that the Consolidated Edison Company was not trying hard enough to recover for its cus tomers the money the company Says it was overcharged over a 10year period by 13 con tractors who admitted rigging their bids on construction Work.

title: I.R.S. MOVE PERILS WHITE SCHOOL AID
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The Internal Revenue Service announced today that 11 white private schools in Mississippi were being removed from a list of those eligible to receive tax deductible contributions.

title: Flying Teacher and Student Are Killed in Plane Crash
description: PAWLING, N. Y., Aug. 19 (UPI)  A flying instructor and student were killed yesterday when their trainer plane plum meted to earth near the Con necticut state line here.

title: State Farm Aides Named
description: ALBANY, Aug. 19 AP)Governor Rockefeller today ap pointed Russell R. Billings of Hamburg as chairman of the State Agricultural Resources Commission and named Robert V. Call Jr. of Batavia to a seat on the commission.

title: Six Die in Vehicle Blast
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Aug. 19 (UPI)  A school bus con verted into a camping vehicle exploded today in a ball of flames on Interstate 10, killing six of the 10 persons aboard. The California Highway Patrol said fumes from a butane gas tank used to fuel the stove might have ignited. The bus had Texas license plates. A survivor said the persons aboard were from El Paso and Toledo, Ohio.

title: Mercury Found in Ducks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (UPI) The Interior Department said today that mercury had been discovered in all 26 ducks taken as samples from the Lake St. Clair and Detroit River areea in North Dakota and Michigan.

title: CANDIDATES GETTING 2D LINES ON BALLOT
description: ALBANY, Aug. 19  Gover nor Rockefeller and Representa tive Richard L. Ottinger, the Democratic candidate for the Senate, were apparently as sured second lines on the bal lot today when independent parties filed petitions on their behalf.

title: Federation of Teachers Backs Students'
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 19 Longhairs won a victory here today when the American Fed eration of Teachers voted at its national convention to support a student's choice of his own dress and grooming.

title: Chess:
Market Place
description: In the old days, back around 1968, news of a merg er proposal where there was a fairly wide differential in the prices of the stocks in volved was bound to produce all kinds of fireworks on Wall Street.

title: Les Ballets Africains Stresses Acrobatics and Drama in Debut
description: Les Ballets Africains, Guinea's national folk ensemble, which has paid several visits to this country since 1959, came back to town last night at the City Center.

title: World Puppets Add Variety to Fete
description: STORRS, Conn., Aug. 18Hundreds of puppets from three continents have gath ered here this week at the University of Connecticut for what the university office described as a rather un likely event  an interna tional congress of puppets.

title: Flying Tiger Raises Its Holdings In North American Car to 45%
description: Flying Tiger Line, Inc., an nounced yesterday that, as a result of its recent tender of fer to acquire 700,000 shares of the common stock of the North American Car Corpora tion it now owned 45 per cent of the railroadcar leasing com pany's 3,238,000 outstanding common shares.

title: CONSUMER GROUP CRITICAL OF NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19Despite misgivings, the Con sumer Federation of America will neither endorse nor oppose President Nixon's choice of Miles W. Kirkpatrick for the chairmanship of the Federal Trade Commission.

title: Amex Stocks Continue to Gain As Volume Registers a Decline
description: The American Stock Ex change made its second con secutive advance yesterday as advances outnumbered de clines by a narrow margin in slow treding.

title: U.S. ORBITS IKYNET FOR BRITISH FORCES
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Aug. 19 (UPI)Britain's secpnd Sky net military communications satellite rode an American rocket into an accurate orbit today.

title: Charles B. Butman Will Marry Miss Jill Roistacher on Sept.
description: MELVILLE, L. I., Aug. 19Mrs. Melvin Smoley of Mel ville and Dr. Jules Roistacher of New York and Palm Beach. Fla., have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Jill Robin Roistacher, to Charles B. Butman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Simon Butman of Lynn, Mass. The wedding is planned for Sept. 5 at the St. RegisSheraton in New York.

title: DRIVE FOR MISS DAVIS ERUPTS IN VIOLENCE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 19 (AP)A rally of 1,000 persons in Civic Center today to sup port Angela Davis, the black militant, and defendantsin two other murder cases led to clashes of demonstrators and the police.

title: Lincoln Center Survey Finds Affluent Audience
description: A new Simmons research study prepared for Lincoln Center Programs shows that 68 per cent of its readers own stock, 48 per cent own bonds and 41 per cent own mutual funds. And those are certainly good demographics in the mind of Herbert J. Teison, associate publisher of the programs distributed at the Metropolitan Opera House, Philharmonic and Alice Tully Halls and the Vivian Beaumont Theater.

title: YOUTH CONVICTED IN COED'S SLAYING
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Aug. 19 (AP)John Norman Collins was convicted today of firstdegree murder in the slaying of Karen Sue Beineman, an 18yearold freshman at Eastern Michigan University.

title: Taylor Law Is Invoked In Toll Collectors Strike
description: The Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority last night in voked the Taylor Law, which bans strikes by government em ployes, in an effort to end wildcat strike by 547 toll col lectors at its five bridges and two tunnels in the city.

title: Valiant and Intrepid Victors on Second Day of Final America's Cup Trials
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 19An undisguised protest at sea and a thinlyveiled protest ashore that was overruled en uwence. the America's Cup scene today.

title: CLIFFORD KNERR, SHIPBUILDER, 76
description: ROSELLE PARK, N. J., Aug. 19Clifford C. Knerr, treasurer of the Society of Naval Archi tects and Marine Engineers, who spent some 50 years in shipbuilding and ship repair, died yesterday in Rahway Hos pital. He was 76 years old and lived at 402 Locust Street.

title: Rare Mozart Work For Two Pianos Heard at Festival
description: A Mozart work for two pianos that in all likelihood has not been played here before turned up in the Tuesday night pro gram of the Mostly Mozart Fes tival at Philharmonic Hall. It was a Larghetto and Allegro in E flat, rediscovered by Gerhard Croll and published in 1964.

title: Mrs. Allen Wins on Links
description: LAKE PLACID, N. Y., Aug. 19 (AP)Mrs. Philip Allen of Syra cuse won the state senior wom en's golf championship today with a net score of 172 for 36 holes over the par76 Whiteface Inn course.

title: U.S. Official Predicts Increases In Utility Rates Across Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (AP)  Worldwide shortages and skyrocketing prices for fuel oil have hit American utility companies so hard that the result could be acrosstheboard utility rate increases for the nation's consumers, a high Nixon Administration official has said. utility rate increases for the nation's consumers, a high Nixon Administration official has said.

title: M'GRATH FACING A COURT HEARING
description: A State Supreme Court jus tice ordered George F. Mc Grath, City Commissioner of Correction, to appear in his court if prisoners in two of the city's houses of detention con tinue their court boycott, which went into its third day yes terday.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Appropriations; President Nixon signed the $413,054,220 legislative branch appropria tions bill for fiscal 1971.

title: CARMICHAEL WINS AT HAVERFORD NET
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 19Bob Carmichael of Australia, seeded second, gained the quar terfinal round of the 71st Penn sylvania tennis championship by defeating lefthanded Joaquin Loyo Mayo, of the Mexican Davis Cup team, 67, 63, 64, before a near capa city crowd today on the Merion Cricket Club grass courts.

title: Bank Aide Arrested in Jersey In Misapplication of $125,000
description: NEWARK. Aug. 19  The assistant cashier of a bank that last week purchased a branch office of the insolvent Eaton town National Bank was ar rested today and charged with the misapplication of $125,000 of his hank's funds.

title: Newspapers and Drivers Gain Agreement in Principle on Pact
description: The president of the News paper Deliverers Union an nounced a few minutes after midnight last night that the union and the city's four major newspapers had reached agree ment in principle and that a threatened strike had been averted.

title: 85,000 Police Cars Are Recalled By Ford for a Safety Correction
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19The Ford Motor Company is recalling 85,000 police cars for correction of a possible safety defect.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: H.J.Rakov to Wed Barbara J. Streem
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Aug. 19Mr. and Mrs. Harold B. Streem have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Barbara Jane Streem, to Harris Joel Rakov, son of Mrs. Hyman Rakov of New York and the late Mr. Rakov. The wedding is planned for Nov. 21.

title: Tombs Officials Agree With Inmatest
description: Leading officials of the Men's House of Detention in Manhat tan expressed strong endorse ment yesterday of the griev ances being pressed by inmates, adding details of their own but denying there was widespread brutality by guards.

title: 2d Bomb Exploded in Ulster As Soldiers Search Rubble
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Thursday, Aug. 20 A British security patrol escaped injury early today when a bomb went off as the soldier searched through the rubble of a cus toms post blown up earlier by saboteurs.

title: Dodgers Release Pascual
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 19 (UPI)  Camilo Pascual, 36yearold pitcher was released by the Los Angeles Dodgers today after having pitched 14 innings, com piling a 2.56 earnedrun average.

title: Gas Suppliers Warn Heating Bills Will Rise if State Cuts Sales
description: ALBANY, Aug. 19 (UPI)Gas suppliers warned today of higher home heating bills for millions of New Yorkers if the State Public Service Commis sion ordered a cutback on sales to new customers.

title: Catropa Wins Junior Golf By Beating Hill on 19th Hole
description: OSSINING, N. Y., Aug. 19Ferdie Catropa, a 17yearold senior at Notre Dame High School of Bridegport, Conn., won the Westchester Golf As sociation's 47th annual junior championship today.

title: Obituary 1 No Title
description: Announcements of deaths, marriages. births and engagements may be tele phoned to OXford 53311 until 11 P.M. in suburban offices. 9:00 A.M. to 4:30 P.M. Monday through. Friday Newark (201) MArket 33900; White Plains (914) WHite Plains 95300; Hempstead (316) IVanhoe 36660; Commack (516) 5495400; Stamford (203) 3487767.

title: Condors Trade Cremins
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 19 (UPI) The Pittsburgh Condors of the American Basketball Asso ciation traded Bobby Cremins, former South Carolina Univer sity star, to the Carolina: Cou gars today for a future draft choice.

title: Singapore's Chief Drops Visit to Kuala Lumpur in Dispute Over Arrest of 3 LongHaired Malaysians
description: SINGAPORE, Aug. 19Prime Minister Lee Kuan Yew can celed an official visit to Malay sia two hours before his sched uied departure today because of a controversy over police treatment of three longhaired Malaysian youths.

title: REVENUESHARING REVIVED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 19The Nixon Administration plans to renew pressure on Congress to produce some action on its dormant proposal to share Fed eral tax revenue with the oaten.

title: Stockton Among Choices Today In $160,000 Avco Golf Classic
description: SUTTON, Mass., Aug. 19 (AP) Dave Stockton makes his first start as the new Professional Golfers Association champion tomorrow as one of the favor ites in the $160,000 Avco Golf Classic.

title: General Dynamics Posts Filled
description: The General Dynamics Corporation, the conglom erate with a big but falter ing stake in the country's aerospace program, an nounced yesterday a reorgan ization of its defense and space operations to permit a more rapid and effective response to government re quirements.

title: 30 Maoist Revolutionaries Arrested in West Bengal
description: CALCUTTA, India, Aug. 19Kanu Sanyal, the most impor tant leader in West Bengal's Naxalite movement, and 29 oth er Maoist extremists were ar rested today near Siliguri in the Darjeeling district. Arms and ammunition were reported to have been seized.

title: OilOutput Ceiling Is Raised in Texas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Aug. 19Responding again to mounting demand for lowpriced domes tic crude oil, the Texas Rail road Commission today in creased the marketdemand proration factor for Texa; wells in September from 70 to 79.9 per cent of the wells cal culated ability to produce.

title: Mrs. Kopechne Says Kennedy Told the Truth
description: Mrs. Joseph Kopechne, mother of the girl killed in an auto accident with Sen ator Edward M. Kennedy, said yesterday that the con clusion of Judge James A. Boyle that Mr. Kennedy had not told the whole truth left a bad taste in our mouths, and we absolutely reject it. Judge Boyle presided at the inquest.

title: Playboy Bunnies Cite Hoodlum Threat
description: The office of Manhattan Dis trict Attorney Frank S. Hogan is investigating charges that hoodlums have beaten em ployes of the New York Play boy Club in a demand for con cessions from the club's man agement and woman attendants  the Playboy bunnies  a spokesman for Mr. Hogan said yesterday.

title: PENNSY WILL BACK EQUIPMENT DEBTS
description: The trustees of the Penn Cen tral Transportation Company were ordered yesterday by Fed eral Judge John P. Fullam in Philadelphia to affirm their lia bility for some $1.3billion of secured equipment obligationstrust certificates, conditional sales agreements and leasesthe railroad has outstanding

title: RAVEN CLASS LEAD GAINED BY PAGELS
description: BABYLON, L. I., Aug. 19Bill Pagels finished first and third today and took over the lead in a series to determine the Raven Class national cham pion. The skipper from Sayville, L. I., who is the defending title holder, leads Robert Kirtland of Port Washington, L. I., by 2 points.

title: Court Reserves Decision On Discharge for Cadet
description: The case of the first West Point cadet who has ever sought to be discharged from the Army as a conscientious objector was argued in Federal Court yesterday, and Judge Marvin E. Frankel told author ities not to move to dismiss him from the United States Military Academy while he considers the case.

title: Pollution of Resort on Volga Feared
description: An idyllic stretch of the Volga River, rich in historical and cultural associations, is threatened with pollution by proposed oil refinery, accord ing to a Soviet newspaper re ceived here.

title: YOUNG CONDEMNS THE NIXON RECORD
description: Whitney M. Young Jr., ex ecutive director of the National Urban League, yesterday called the record of the Nixon Admin istration uneven, indecisive and flabby.

title: A.A.U. SWIM TODAY DRAWS 11 NATIONS
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 19The national outdoor swimming championships for men and women begin tomorrow. The fourday meet may be the best ever and surely will be the most mod.

title: Leaders of the Warsaw Bloc Are Gathering in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 19The So viet Union's East European al lies arrived here today for summit meeting of the Warsaw Pact, the Soviet bloc's defense alliance.

title: DUFFEY IS VICTOR IN CONNECTICUT
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 19The Rev. Joseph D. Duffey, the boyishlooking chairman of the Americans for Democratic Ac tion, won a convincing victory tonight in the Democratic pri mary election for United States Senator from Connecticut.

title: Ewbank Says Fans Should Consider Appearance by Namath Sunday as Bonus
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 19Coach Weeb Ewbank made it clear today that just because Joe Namath has finally joined the Jets, fans who have paid $7 a ticket to see the Jets play the Giants in. Yale Bowl Sunday should count it a bonus if they see Namath in action.

title: Beggars Walk Picket Line
description: Members of the Brotherhood of Railway and Airline Clerks marked the start of a seventh week of strike action against Northwest Airlines yesterday by dressing up as beggars and picketing the carrier's main ticket office, 537 Fifth Avenue. The idea they were trying to put across was that breadwin ners taking home $75 to $90 week could not afford fancy clothing

title: Executive Changes
description: Hilliard W. Paige has been elected a senior vice president of the General Electric Company.

title: Ashe, Lutz, Richey, Smith On U.S. Davis Cup Team
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 19 (UPI)  Arthur Ashe, Bob Lutz, Cliff Richey and Stan Smith will make up the United States Davis Cup team that will face the team from West Germany here Ault. 29 to 31.

title: City Giving Neighborhoods First Aid
description: The boardedup stores on 207th Street east of Broad way, forlorn as the tattered campaign posters and fading graffiti on their fronts, give mute testimony to how some neighborhood mer chants have found it difficult to hang on in the face of population shifts and com petition from the big shop ping centers.

title: 2 Planes Hijacked
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Aug. 19 (AP}A jetliner bound for San Juan was hijacked today tol Cuba by three mentwo bran dishing hand grenades and one armed with a gunpassengers said when they arrived here after a 14hour flight by way. of Havana.

title: HESBURGH CRITICIZES LAG IN RIGHTS GAINS
description: WOODLOWN, Md., Aug. 19 (AP)The chairman of the United States Civil Rights Com mission charged today that federal and local governments and the majority of citizens were not serious about equal opportunities for minority groups.

title: JULIE MEYER FRANK OF NEW SCHOOL, 73
description: Dr. Julie Meyer Frank, emeri tus associate professor of so ciology and economics at the New School's Graduate Faculty of Political and Social Science, died Tuesday at the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. She was 73 years old and lived at 80 Seaman Avenue.

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating
description: AREA A  Off Barnegat, about 2 or 3 miles, the blue fish and weakfish fishing has turned into an angler's para dise, with the blues running from one to six pounds and the weakfish scaling from one to four Dick Meyers also reported white marlin were being taken in Hudson Canyon, about 80 miles out in deep water. Brielle re ported quite a few tuna of 125 to 150 pounds taken aboard the Jamaica II by Captain David Bogan. The Surf City report said, plenty of blues and weakfish on the surf, a real blitz. They are being taken on lures.

title: Oil Imports and Security
description: How much oil does the United States have to produce domes tically to insure the security of its petroleum supply in the event of military or economic threats? And how much should this security cost the American con sumer? These ques tions are the nub of the oilimport controversy that has raged with a biting furor since 1968 and simmered for a number of years before that.

title: Britain Leads Mexico, 20, In Tennis for Stevens Cup
description: Jaroslav Drobny, a former Czechoslovak Wimbledon win ner who now lives in London, helped Britain take a 20 lead over Mexico in the international senior tennis team eliminations for the Stevens Cup at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills, Queens, yesterday.

title: FOUR SEASONS UNIT DECLARED BANKRUPT
description: LUXEMBOURG, Aug. 20 (AP) The Luxembourg Commercial Court declared bankrupt yester day Four Seasons Overseas, N.V., the financing subsidiary of Four Seasons Nursing Cen ters of America, Inc, which has filed a bankruptcy reorganiza tion petition in the United States.

title: Lesson for Ghana and Others
description: When Ghana returned to parliamentary democracy last September, cynics thought they detected in the creation of a Presidential Commission a vehicle for dominating the civilian Government or even for future reimposition of armypolice rule. The Commission was composed of two Army officers and the head of the National Police. It was to function for three years place of a President, unless the National Assembly decided otherwise.

title: Nasser and Hussein Confer In Egypt on Peace Efforts
description: CAIRO, Aug. 20  King Hus sein of Jordan flew to Cairo today with his top political and military aides for a threeday conference with President Gamal Abdel Nasser on the current efforts for a settlement of the conflict with Israel.

title: Iceland Calls for a Parley To Bar Pollution of Seabed
description: GENEVA. Aug. 20Iceland suggested today an internation al conference to draw up a treaty preventing pollution of the marine environment.

title: LOAN ASSOCIATION SEEKS TO BE BANK
description: A Staten Island savings and loan association has moved to convert its charter to that of a savings bank, becoming the first to take advantage of leg islation effective in July, 1969, permitting such a move.

title: GIVE FUN FOR SOMEONE. GIVE TO FRESH AIR FUND.
Rising Taxes Cut Bonn Church Rolls
description: BONN, Aug. 20Authorities of the Roman Catholic Church and the Evangelical Church said in a statement today that in creasing numbers of people were withdrawing from the) churches following the Federal Government's introduction of a 10 per cent surcharge on in come taxes last month.

title: Court Acquits New Yorker In Chicago. Assault Case
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 20 (AP)A former New York student who was accused of injuring a city prosecutor in a battle between the police and members of the Weathermen was acquitted to day by a jury in Circuit Court.

title: Foyt Wins 200Mile Race
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 20 (AP) A. J. Foyt of Houston won the 200mile late model stock car race today at Wisconsin's State Fair Park in a 1969 To rino. He averaged 98.081 miles an hour on the onemile oval.

title: GEN. BEVERLY DUNN OF ENGINEERS CORPS
description: Brig. Gen. Beverly C. Dunn, Army Corps of Engineers, re tired, who had been chairman of the board of James King & Son, Inc., a construction com pany, died Friday at the St. Albans (Queens) Naval Hospi tal. He was 82 years old and lived at 912 Fifth Avenue.

title: Bruce Stays Away From Paris Talks; Habib Sent Instead
description: PARIS, Aug. 20  After at tending two sessions of what he called a renewed effort to reach a Vietnam settlement, David K. E. Bruce, the new chief American negotiator at the peace talks here, stayed away today from the 80th plenary meeting.

title: Zambia Is Spending $14Million for a 5Day Conference
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Aug. 20 Zambia, which has a gross national product of about $1billion and is hard pressed for funds, is spending more than $14million to build hall and other facilities for fiveday conference of mem bers of the socalled third, world bloc.

title: Agnew Attacks O'Brien and the Democratic Party
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 20Vice President Agnew made a per sonal attack tonight on Law rence F. O'Brien, the Demo cratic National chairman, in making an argument that the Democratic party would spend the nation into bankruptcy and socialism.

title: Sports of The Times
description: On Sunday in Tijuana, the traffic leads out to the Pacific Ocean, where the waves are long and gentle. On a bluff overlook ing the ocean there is a bullring, the only arena within commuting distance of the United States.

title: New Zealand Withdrawal
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Aug. 20Prime Minister Sir Keith Holyoake said today that New Zealand intended to with draw an infantry company of 144 men from South Vietnam before the end of the year. The present strength of New Zea landers is two infantry corn panies, commando troops and an artillery battery, a total of 550 men.

title: Effective F.T.C. Critic
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20,The job of carrying forward the Federal Trade Commis sion's revitalization, which President Nixon promised in a special consumer message last October, has fallen to a reticent lawyer from Phila delphia who calls himself a rather obscure person. That lawyer, Miles Wells Kirkpat rick, easily pas sed muster of the Senate Com merce Commit tee today at a hearing on his nomination to the fivemem ber commission, and Senate confirmation was apparently assured. Upon confirmation, the President will designate aim as chairman to succeed Casper W. Weinberger, now deputy director of the Office of Management and Budget.

title: Kent Witness Thought: It Can't Be Happening
description: KENT, Ohio, Aug. 20I just can't convey the feeling I had seeing those men come over the hill with their helmets and gas masks and guns, Barbara Knapp told the President's Commission on Campus Unrest today, I thought, we're civi lized, this is Ohio. This can't be happening here.

title: Yankees Conquer Twins, 43, as Stottlemyre's TwoRun Triple Breaks Tie
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 20The Yankees won their final game in Minnesota this season, 43, tonight, but Fritz Peterson suffered for the sec ond night in a row.

title: Navy Families Face Breakups in Housing Crisis
description: YAWGOO VALLEY, R. I., Aug. 20  Reorganization of naval forces in the Atlantic Fleet has jammed more sailors and their families into southern Rhode Island than the area can house and many wives and chil dren are paying the price.

title: NEWSMEN BRAWL OVER TV CAMERAS
description: Two television cameramen were injured slightly yesterday in a brawl between union and nonunion camera crews in the offices of Correction Commis sioner George F. McGrath in the Criminal Courts Building, 100 Centre Street.

title: ERIC PATTERSON, 69, UNIVERSITY FARMER
description: FARMINGDALE, L I., Aug. 20Eric Patterson, farm super intendent and associate profes sor of agriculture at the State University in Farmingdale, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home on the campus here. He was 69 years old.

title: NETS POST GUARD FOR RED MACHINE
description: The Cincinnati Reds, the meanest hitters in baseball, will open a fourgame series in Shea Stadium tonight against the Mets, who are in no mood these days for Big Red Machines, little green machines or any machine that has hit 165 home runs in 125 games.

title: Kunstler Wins Travel Plea
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 20 (AP)The United States Court of Ap peals for the Seventh Circuit granted permission today to William M. Kunstler, defense attorney in the Chicago 7 con spiracy trial, to travel to Can ada for a television appearance. Mr. Kunstler is under sentence for contempt of court. He is free on appeal bond.

title: Tough Regimen Yields Fine Violinists
description: ELIZABETHTOWN, N. Y. Aug. 16We Speak Only English Here warned the sign on the girl student's door at the Meadowmount School of Music. No doubt it had been posted out of self defense. Meadowmount. camp near this Adirondacks town where Ivan Galamian is directing the 26th year of his incredibly successful school for violinists, is magnet for the world's finest string talent. At any moment, the girl who had posted the sign might find at her door a fellow fiddler trying to speak to her in Chinese, Dutch or Hebrew.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Subcommission on the Pre vention of Discrimination and the Protection of Minorities 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: MARCOR, INC., CITES DROP IN PROFITS
description: Marcor, Inc., formed through the late 1968 merger of Mont gomery Ward & Co. and the Container Corporation of Amer ica, reported yesterday record sales but continued lower earn ings for the second quarter with the halfyear results down 9.5 per cent.

title: THIEU REPORTS SHIFT IN ARMY COMMANDS
description: SAIGON South Vietnam, Aug. 20 (Reuters)President Nguyen Van Thieu announced a shake up tonight in the South Vietna mese military high command.

title: SENATE ASKS CURB ON WAR PAY GOING TO VIETNAM ALLIES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The Senate voted today to bar the United States from paying larger allowances to allied troops in Vietnam than it pays to American soldiers.

title: DEFICIT ESTIMATE REVISED UPWARD
A.E.C. Says Tests In Nevada Tainted 250 Square Miles
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (UPI) The Atomic Energy Commis sion has reported that bomb safety experiments, most of them conducted in 1958, left the surface soil of about 250 square miles of its Nevada test site contaminated with poison ous and radioactive plutonium 239.

title: POLITICAL BID IRKS A WILDLIFE GROUP
description: The New York State Con servation Council, whose affili ated organizations have more than 350,000 members, objected yesterday to the attempt by two Democratic candidates for statewide office to get a second line on the ballot under the name of the Conservation party.

title: Unified Organization Formed By Two Reformed Churches
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 20 (UPI)Presbyterian and Con gregational church leaders from 75 nations formally voted to day to unite under one world organization of reformed churches.

title: YOUNG POLICEMAN SLAIN IN BERKELEY
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. 201  Ronald T. Tsukamoto, a JapaneseAmerican rookie on the Berkeley police force, was shot dead by an unknown gun man this morning as he wrote out a traffic ticket.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX STAGE A RETREAT
description: The twoday advance on the American Stock Exchange end ed yesterday as prices finished mixed in very quiet trading.

title: Segregation Hearings Set
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP) The Senate Select Committee on Equal Educational Oppor tunity will begin hearings next week on the origin and causes of de facto segregation. The committee chairman, Senator Walter F. Mondale, Democrat of Minnesota, said today that the hearings would begin Tues day and run through Sept. 2

title: HOMES FOR AGED CALLED HORRORS
description: State Senator Roy M. Good man charged yesterday that he had found a chamber of hor rors involving scandalous neg lect, lax code enforcement and questionable financial account ing practices in 18 proprietary nursing homes here.

title: PRICES ARE FIRM ON LONDON BOARD
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange were firm yesterday.

title: Claire Bloom to Appear in Ibsen Plays
description: Two of the theater's lead ing performers will be seen on the New York stage dur ing the forthcoming season.

title: B.O.A.C. Seeks A Bigger Share Of Atlantic Run
description: LONDON, Aug. 20  British Overseas Airways Corporation, the profitable, stateowned air line, served notice today that it wanted a larger share of the lucrative North Atlantic busi ness.

title: M'GRATH CLASHES WITH DUNNE HERE
description: Commissioner of Correction George F. McGrath accused the state yesterday of totally re neging on its addictcontrol program and compounding the overcrowding that has led to inmate disorders at the Man hattan House of Detention for Men.

title: Colombian Court Continues Bobby Moore Theft Inquiry
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Aug. 20 (UPI)  Three Superior Court, judges ruled today that the English soccer star, Bobby Moore, was at unconditional liberty pending further investi gation into a jewelry theft with which he had been linked. Moore had been charged with theft of an emerald and gold bracelet from a store here while en route to the World CUP matches in Mexico earlier this year.

title: Mrs. Benjamin Heller, 42, Killed in Auto Accident
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, L.I., Aug. 20Mrs. Judith Anne Goldhill Heller, a landscape architect, was killed in an auto accident here yesterday. She was 42 years old and lived at 151 Cen tral Park West, New York, and in East Hampton.

title: News Summary and Index.
description: The Israeli Foreign Ministry said yester day that Israel was ready to begin negotia tions with Egypt and Jordan, wanted a site closer to the Middle East than New York and preferred that the foreign ministers of the countries involved conduct the negotia tions. But a spokesman said that the re quests were not absolute conditions. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. President Nixon left this morning for a 28 hour visit to Puerto Vallarta, Mexico. Tomorrow the Nixons will fly to the Western White House at San Clemente for 15day working visit.

title: LAWRENCE S. STERN
description: Lawrence S. Stern, vice presi dent and director of the Ameri can Steel Wool Manufacturing Company, Inc., Long Island City, Queens, died Wednesday at his home, 910 Park Avenue. His age was R4.

title: White Student Group in South Africa Is Moving Away From Politics
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Aug. 20A hardpressed student organization whose members have frequently been in the forefront of campus pro tests against Government poli cies has decided that its salva tion lies in less political, more practical activities.

title: ARTS GALLERY
description: Art finley

title: VESPER OARSMEN WIN IN U.S. FINAL
description: COLLINGSWOOD, N. J., Aug. 20Eight determined oarsmen who have been working out of the Vesper Boat Club of Phila delphia for the. last six weeks and Jim Dietz, the New York Athletic Club star with the build of a basketball player, shared opening honors at the national rowing championships today.

title: Thistle Race Postponed
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 20 The scheduled fifth race in the 25th anniversary Thistle Class national championship regatta was postponed today because of lack of wind on Long Island Sound off Cedar Point Yacht Club. Two races are scheduled to be sailed to morrow.

title: 5 British Sailors Convicted Of Mutiny in Sitdown on Ship
description: ROSYTH, Scotland, Aug. 20 (Reuters)Five British sailors convicted of the Royal Navy's first mutiny in 16 years were sentenced today to terms rang ing from 12 to 21 months in prison.

title: JOHN PATRICK FAY
description: John Patrick Fay, an inter national representative of Horn blower & Weeks Hemphill, Noyes, stockbrokers, died Tues day in SaintNazaire, France, He was 80 years old and lived at 400 East 58th Street.

title: Executive Changes
description: Arthur N. Ryan has been named vice president, administration and business affairs, of the Para mount Pictures Corporation.

title: Federated Purchaser Petition
description: SPRINGFIELD, N.J., Aug. 20 (UPI)  Federated Purchaser, Inc., a distributor of electrical and electronic parts and equip ment, announced plans today to file a petition for voluntary bankruptcy under Chapter 11 of the Federal Bankruptcy Act.

title: Light and Heat
description: To nobody's surprise, the Federal Power Commis sion, which in 1965 approved Consolidated Edison'S proposed electric power plant at Storm King Mountain, has reviewed its work and found it good. The com mission's primary function, after all, is to license the production of power; its interest in the environmental aspects of the project was largely the product of United States Court of Appeals decision setting aside the original license and ordering further consideration.

title: Attack Close to Pnompenh By 1,500 of Foe Reported
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 20A Cambodian bat talion, reportedly outnumbered about 2 to 1, battled today to turn back a Communist force seven and a half miles northeast of this capital. The 700man Government unit fought at Puk Rusey on the eastern bank of the Mekong River across from Pnompenh.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE SHOW 3.1% DECREASE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage in the week ended Aug. 15 were both below the volume in the corresponding week of last year.

title: LOCTITE IN PACT TO BUY SEALANTS
description: Directors of the Loctite Cor poration approved yesterday in principle the acquisition of as sets of International Sealants, S. A., Panama, including its five operating subsidiaries, for about $21.2million in stock and cash.

title: PEKING PROTESTS ACTION BY PRAGUE
description: HONG KONG. Aug. 20. Communist China has protested to Czechoslovakia over the blockade imposed on the Cam bodian Embassy in Prague. The Czechoslovak authorities sealed off the embassy after it had been taken over by supporters of Prince Norodom Sihanouk. Cambodia's deposed Chief of State. who is in exile in Peking.

title: U.S. and Cambodia Sign Military Assistance Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The United States has agreed to provide Cambodia with sub stantial new supplies of small arms and military equipment in an effort to bolster the five monthold Government of Pre mier Lon Nol.

title: Laver and Newcombe Take Colonial Singles Matches
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Aug. 20 (UPI)Rod Laver defeated Roger Taylor, 64, 75, tonight in a firstround singles match of the $22,500 Colonial National invitation tennis tournament.

title: City Curtails 2 Programs Using Consultants
description: Amid charges. that public funds were beng squandered and the Civil Service circum vented, the Board of Estimate yesterday unanimously cur tailed two programs involving the use of outside consultants.

title: U.S. Downs Soviet Five
description: KIEV, Soviet Union, Aug. 20 (AP)The United States Olym pic basketball team defeated the Soviet Union's allstar youth squad, 7153, tonight. The United States now has an 81lost record on its tour of Finland, Poland and the Soviet Union. Its only loss was to the Russian Olympic team in Moscow Tuesday.

title: Borman Confers in Geneva
description: GENEVA, Aug. 20Frank Borman, the former astronaut who is now a special envoy of President Nixon, discussed with officials of the International Committee of the Red Cross today the fate of United States prisoners of war in Southeast Asia, particularly North Viet nam. Mr. Borman arrived here yesterday from Paris and con tinued on today to Belgrade, Yugoslavia, on his global trip.

title: Army Clarifies Function Of New Gas Disposal Unit
description: DENVER, Aug. 20 (Reuters) A $14.6million nerve gas de toxification facility being built at the Rocky Mountain Arsenal here will be used only to deal with gas stored at the site, the Army said today.

title: ROCKEFELLER SEES GAINS ON MERCURY
description: HORSEHEADS, N.Y., Aug. 20 Governor Rockefeller said to day that the known dumping of mercury by industrial com panies into stare waters had shrunk to less than three pounds a day from a high in the middle of May of 71 pounds a day.

title: Bridge
description: While the American Con tract Bridge League con ducted its summer national championships in Boston last week the smaller American Bridge Association, with primarily black membership, was staging its own national tournament in Atlanta.

title: Land Grab in India Brings Little but Furor
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 20The magistrate sat in the shade of an ancient tree, his shirt and shoes off for comfort. The po lice superintendent sat with him, as did several other Gov ernment officialsall waiting in the heavy silence of the scorching afternoon.

title: DR. NATALIE JOFFE, ANTHROPOLOGIST, 55
description: Dr. Natalie Joffe Moir, an thropologist and lecturer at the New York University School. of Continuing Education, died Wednesday of a liver ailment, at Knickerbocker Hospital. She was 55 years old and lived at 209 West 104th Street.

title: U.S. Combat Toll Down
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 20 (AP)  The United States command reported today that 69 Americans were killed in combat last week, 16 fewer than the week before.

title: Ruffels Turns Back Drysdale, Mrs. Curtis Is Upset at Merion
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 20 No. 1 seeded contenders, Mrs. Mary Ann Else! Curtis of St. Louis and Cliff Drysdale, a contract professional, were de feated in the quarterfinal round in their sections of the $15,000 Pennsylvania lawn ten nis championship today at the Merion Cricket Club.

title: Young Campers In Fresh Air Fund Learning Canoeing
description: Youngsters attending the Fresh Air Fund's camping cen ter in Dutchess County, N. Y., have been enthusiastically par ticipating in a new activity there this summercanoeing.

title: Pigeon's Feather Gags Baritone in Rigolette
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 20 (UPI)Louis Quilico, a Cana dian baritone, was rendering a fullthroated version of Rigoletto last night when he suddenly gagged and left the stage retching.

title: Liberation YesterdayThe Roots of the Feminist Movement.
description: We did all those things. I went swimming nude and worse things than that, but we did them privately. They do them publicly and I think that's a mistake, said Dorothy Kenyon, a former Municipal Court judge and still a practicing lawyer at the age of 82.

title: Advertising: Menley Signs Up Della Femina
description: The people at Menley & James Laboratories have just contacted Della Femina, Tra visano & Partners with lovely idea: developing the advertising for a new prod uct in the consumer health field.

title: Newark Utility Is Planning Stock Offer on 1for10 Basis
description: The Public Service Electric and Gas Company announced plans yesterady to raise more than $70million with the sale of 3,270,422 additional com mon shares to stockholders. The Newark utility plans to offer stock to holders on record as of Sept. 16 on a 1for10 basis.

title: CITY TO RESTRICT HIGHRISE HOUSES
'75 Ban on Polluting Cars Approved by Senate Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20A Senate subcommitte has ap proved an air pollution bill that would halt sales of new cars on Jan. 1, 1975, if they did not eliminate 90 per cent of the exhaust contaminants allowed in 1970 cars.

title: Virginia Puder, Michael Harris Marry in Jersey
description: WEST CALDWELL, N. J., Aug. 20Miss Virginia Beth Puder, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert S. Puder of South Orange, was married here this evening to Michael D. Harris of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Harris of Buffalo. Rabbis Eli E. Pilchik and Barry H. Greene performed the ceremony at the Mountain Ridge Country nub.
