title: Opponents See Duffey's Victory As Benefit to T hem in November
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 20Con necticut Republicans and sup porters of Democratic Senator Thomas J Dodd, who is run ning as an independent to re tain his seat, both said the victory of the Rev. Joseph D. Duffey in the Democratic pri mary yesterday would mean more votes for their own candi dates

title: Yiddish Concert Sunday
description: An outdoor festival of Yid dish music will be presented at 7:30 P.M. Sunday in Seaside Parke opposite the Aquarium on Coney Island. It is the third an nual performance sponsored by the Workmen's Circle, Hebrew Actors Union, Local 802 of the Musicians Union and the Park Department. Performing will be stars of the Yiddish theater world and the Workmen's Circle Choir, directed by Eu gene Malek, with an orchestra directed by Sholem Secunda.

title: Soviet to Chute Venus 7
description: MOSCOW, (UPI)  The So viet Union will attempt to para chute the Venus 7 onto the planet Venus around New Year's Day, Tass, the official Soviet press agency said.

title: SIR PETER RUNGE
description: LONDON, Aug. 20 (Reuters) Sir Peter Runge, chairman of the Governmentsponsored Brit ish National Export Council, died here yesterday. He was 61 years old, and had headed the export council since 1968. Be fore that he was vice president of the Confederation of British Industry.

title: Harlem Playground Gets Free Jet From Air Force
description: A Harlem playground re ceived an old jet plane yes terday from the Air Force.

title: A.D.R. Trust Suit Settled by I. B. M.
description: The International Business Machines Corporation has reached an outofcourt settle ment of the antitrust suits brought against it last year by Applied. Data Research, Inc., and Programmatics. Inc.

title: Dr. Eric M. Matsner, 73, Obstetrician, Dies on Coast
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Aug. 20Dr. Eric. M. Matsner, an obstetrician and gynecolo gist who was active in birth control organizations, died a heart ailment yesterday in a hospital here. He was 73 years old and moved recently from Santa Monica.

title: ISRAEL TELLS U.N. SHE IS PREPARED TO BEGIN PARLEYS
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 20The Israeli Government has for mally notified the United Na tions that it is ready to begin negotiations with the United Arab Republic and Jordan on a Middle Eastern settlement, the Foreign Ministry announced today.

title: 4 Killed as Submarines Collide Off French Port
description: TOULON, France, Aug. 20 (AP)  A French submarine and a South African sub marine collided on the sur face tonight off Toulon in the Mediterranean. Four sailors were killed on the French vessel, the French Navy said. Two seamen were reported missing.

title: How to Win as a Dove
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 20 This has not been, and almost cer tainly will not be, a banner year for antiwar candidates or leftist liberals. A few peace candidates have done well, notably Bella S. Abzug who defeated Leonard, Farbstein in the Congressional district encompassing Manhat tan's West Side and Lower East Side, and Ronald V. Dellums, who unseated Repre sentative Jeffrey Cohelan in the Berkeley Oakland district of northern California.

title: First General Terminates Ties With King Resources
description: The First General Resources Company said yesterday that it relationships terminating all contractual relationships with the King Resources Company of Denver.,

title: Benefit Will Help Negroes Running in Southern States
description: WATER MILL, L. I., Aug. 20 An organization that has been raising funds to aid the campaigns of Negroes running for public offices in the South will hold a benefit party Sat urday at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Warren Brandt here.

title: Palisades Bird Habitat Molded To Provide Bronx Zoo Exhibition
description: The Bronx Zoo has carried out a facelifting job on the Palisades in New Jersey to help reproduce a habitat for birds.

title: CITY CUTS GUARD FOR FOREIGNERS
description: Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary announced yesterday that police protection for for eign government interests here would be cut nearly in half, starting at midnight tonight.

title: RealEstate Tax Yield Is Highest in 4 Years
description: The best yield of reales tate tax levies in four years 95.8 per cent of the total amount duewas collected by New York City last year, Finance Administrator Rich ard Lewisohn said yesterday.

title: DR. JOSEF S. SMUL, INTERNIST 59 YEARS
description: Dr. Josef S. Smul, an intern ist for 59 years here until his retirement last March and a specialist in gastroenterology, died of a heart attack in Ellen ville, N. Y., Wednesday, while on vacation. His age was 88.

title: Newsweek Ads to Use Theme of Discovery
description: So you want to sell more magazine advertising? Why not run a series of large and smallspace ads based on discovery theme and geared for a group given the artificial titles of vice presi dents in charge of change?

title: Hiss and A.C.L.U. Fight Law on U.S. Pensions
description: Alger Hiss joined with the American Civil Liberties Union yesterday in challeng ing the constitutionality of the socalled Hiss Act, which prohibits the payment of an nuities to Government em ployes convicted of certain offenses.

title: F.T.C. Nominee Finds No Need For Special Consumer Counsel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Miles W. Kirkpatrick, President Nixon's nominee to be chair man of the Federal Trade Com mission, said today that both he and the commission itself were dedicated to the con sumer interest and that, there fore, he saw no need for cre ating a special consumer coun sel within the agency.

title: Iraqi Plot Reported in Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 20 (AP)The Baath Socialist Gov ernment of Syria has smashed a plot by the rival Baathist fac tion in Iraq to overthrow it, Beirut newspaper, which speaks for the Syrian Baathists, re. ported today.

title: Jet Is Hijacked to Havana By Man Carrying Bomb
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 20 (AP)A Delta Air Lines jet with 82 persons aboard was hijacked to Cuba tonight by a man whom the pilot reported was carrying a bomb.

title: TaxExempt Bond Yields Hit Low Point Since May
description: City and state borrowing costs declined substantially yes terday, reaching their lowest levels since last spring.

title: EXREP. HEISTAND, 81, WAS IN BIRCH SOCIETY
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 20 (AP) Eormer Representative Ed gar W. Heistand, who declared himself on the floor of the House to he a member of the John Birch Society, died yester day of complications attendant to a kidney infection. He was 81 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: The Unembarrassed Muse, a survey of the popular arts in America, is the first volume of Dial Press's ambitious bicenten nial history of America. Its author, Russel Nye, professor of English at Michigan State University, is a prodigious scavenger of the trivial past. Reading his book is like spending an afternoon in a country an tique store. We buy junk and sell antiques, boasts a sign in front of one I saw recent ly, and the motto fits Mr. Nye's book well.) One spies forgotten ob jects out of one's own past, and ex periences little seizures of nostal gia; more edifying ly, one meets the ancestors of those objects, and so learns where the past came from and where it may be heading.

title: Sharon Ruth Trock Is Married on L.I.
description: LAWRENCE, L. I., Aug. 20 The marriage of Miss Sharon Ruth Trock, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold D. Trock, to Preston Jay Doug las took place in the Sephar dic Temple here tonight. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. James Douglas of Great Neck. Rabbi Gilbert Klaperman performed the ceremony assisted by Cantor Mark Ehrlich.

title: Pennsy Chief Gets $165,000 Annually In 5Year Contract
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 20 (AP)William H. Moore, the new president and chief execu tive officer of the Penn Cen tral Transportation Company, gained court approval today for a fiveyear contract that will pay him $165,000 annually to run the United States biggest, railroad.

title: BRAVES DOWN PHILS FOR 3D STRAIGHT, 62
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 20 (AP)Felix Milian drove in two runs with a single and a sacrifice fly and Ron Reed pitched a sevenhitter tonight as the At lanta Braves defeated the Phila delphia Phillies; 62.

title: MRS. NEELD DEFEATS MRS. PRATT, 63, 75
description: NARRAGANSETT, R. L,Aug. 20 (AP)Mrs. Nancy Neeld of Albuquerque. N. M., rallied af ter a rain break in the second set and won the national senior women's tennis championship with a 63, 75, victory over the defending titleholder, Mrs. Betty Roseneuest Pratt of Mait land, Fla. today.

title: WILLIAM HAMM JR., KIDNAP VICTIM IN '33
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 20 (AP)William Hamm Jr., a brewery executive who was once held for $100,000 ransom by the KarpisBarker gang, died today. He was 87 years old.

title: Buckley Asks the Hand He Bites to Feed Him
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20In Senator Charles E. Good ell's mailbox this morning was a letter from James L. Buckley, the New York Con servative party Senatorial candidate, seeking financial help to defeat Mr. Goodell in the November election.

title: Mrs. Baldwin Is Wed To F. A. Severance
description: BEDFORD, N. Y., Aug. 20 Mrs. Frederika Noe Bald win of New York, daughter of Mrs. Buff Noe of New York and Henry M. Noe of Bronxville, was married here today to F. Alexander Sever ance of Greenwich, Conn., son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank A. F. Severance of New Canaan, Conn. Justice of the Peace William F. Banks per formed the ceremony at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Jona than Field.

title: New Nixon Science Adviser
description: President Nixon has gone well outside the main channel of the American scientific establishment selecting Dr. Edward E. David Jr. to succeed Dr. Lee A. DuBridge as the President's science adviser. Dr. DuBridge is one of the most prestigious elder states men of Affierican science; Dr. David, an electrical en gineer for the Bell Telephone Laboratories, is so little known outside his specialized field that he is not even included in Who's Who.

title: FuzzyFoot Rugs Catching Hold
description: Pile fabrics may or may not have a big year in fake furs and other apparel and homefurnishing items, but one of the large manufactur ers of the goods will as sure itself of a profitable season with a pilefabric article selling for $5.

title: Wendy Browne Is Wed To Donald Havens Jr.
description: WATCH HILL, R.L. Aug. 20Miss Wendel Gilbert Browne was married in the Watch Hill Chapel this after noon to Donald Havens Jr., a partner in the New York real estate firm of Havens, Baxter & Associates. Thirtyfive guests attended the Episco pal ceremony performed by the Rev. Alexander Ogilvy and the reception that fol lowed at Channel Mark, sum mer home here of Mrs. Gil bert Goodwin Browne, moth er of the bride.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: Genesis Two, by L. P. Davies (Dou bleday, $4.95). Science fiction.

title: Holders of Stock Grill Nathan's
description: Life was simple, money wasn't so tight and taxes didn't take as big a bite in 1916 when Nathan Hand werker opened his first food stand in Coney Island and underpriced his competition 50 per cent by offering a 5 cent hot dog.

title: S. E. C. PENALIZES RULES VIOLATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The Securities and Echange Corn mission, in an unusually com plex case, charged five broker age firms and 24 individuals to day with violations of various securities laws in connection with the sale, in 1968 and 1969, of the stock of Computer Counseling, Inc., Creative Fi nancing, Inc. and Private Placements. Inc.

title: STATE CUTS BACK SPENDING PLANS
description: ALBANY, Aug. 20 The state is cutting back its spending plans for the current fiscal year by $130million, at least in part as the result of a lag in revenue attributed to a greater softening in the economy than had been ex pected, the Governor's budget office reported yesterday.

title: Socialist Workers File Slate
description: ALBANY, Aug. 20 (AP)The Socialist Workers party to day filed with the Secretary of State its petitions to put five candidates for statewide office on the ballot in the November election.

title: Hnueilings
description: BARONSamuel T., a monument to the memory of the late Samuel T. Baron will be unveiled Sunday, August 23 at Mt. Hope Cemetery at 2 P.M. No postpone ments.

title: ST. JOE MINERALS CUTS ZINC PRICES
description: The St. Joe Minerals Corpora tion announced yesterday that it had reduced the price of zinc from 15.5 cents to 15 cents a pound, effective immediately.

title: Reservations on a Protocol
description: President Nixon deserves two cheers at most for finally sending to the Senate his request for ap proval of the Geneva Protocol of 1925, which seeks to ban chemical and biological warfare. It is bad enough that nine months of intramural wrangling followed the original announcement of the Admin istration's intention at the United Nations last November.

title: JEROME J. THEISE, 49, OF VOICE OF AMERICA
description: ENGLEWOOD, N.J., Aug. 20 Jerome J. Theise, chief of the New York Bureau of the Voice of America, died of a heart attack yesterday at Englewood Hospital. He was 49 years old and lived in Leonia.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: 5 Known Dead and 190 Injured As Storm Lashes Ontario Area
description: SUDSBURY, Ontario, Aug. 20 (AP)A sudden storm battered the Sudbury nickelmining area near Lake Huron with 90mile anhour winds today. Ontario provincial police said five per sons were known dead and thousands were homeless in Sudbury and the nearby com munities of Copper Cliff and Lively.

title: Joan C. Altmann Becomes Bride
description: RYE, N. Y., Aug. 20 James John Fallon,. the as sistant manager of the Na tional Horse Show and the director of riding at Bennett College, and Miss Joan Carolyn Altmann, his assist ant at Bennett, were married here today at the home of the bride's mother and step father, Mr. and Mrs. Eugene Frederick Ross. The cere mony was performed in the presence of the immediate families by Supreme Court Justice Mitchell D. Schweitz er.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: Your Aug. 10 editorial which supports construction of Con solidated Edison's proposed Astoria expansion, fails to analyze correctly what we con sider the most important en vironmental issue to face New Yorkers in years.

title: CON ED PLAN SEEN AS HEALTH PERIL
description: A Federal air pollution scien tist said last night that the increase in just one noxious gas from the proposed addition to Consolidated Edison's plant in Astoria, Queens, would re sult in an increase in respira tory disease that he estimated would cost society $250,000 to $750.000 a year.

title: ATKINSON LAUDS GIANTS OFFENSE
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 20 The New York Giants of fense is one of the best in the National Football League.

title: Princess Margaret, at 40, Mixes Public Tasks With Private Joys
description: LONDON, Aug. 20Prin cess Margaret celebrates her 40th birthday tomorrow, a moody woman struggling to intertwine the traditions of monarchy with the ebullient style of upperclass Britain.

title: Diane E. Thomas Wed in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 20Miss Diane Elizabeth Thomas, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Ed ward R. Thomas, was married this afternoon to Dr. Hous ton Hobson Stokes, son of Mr. and Mrs. William E. D. Stokes Jr. of Lenox, Mass. The Rev. Jerome Kaufman, a Lutheran minister, performed the ceremony in the chapel of the Passavant Memorial Hospital here.

title: License to Portray God Is Poorly Used In New British Play
description: LONDON, Aug. 20  The postcensorship British theater may be sexually saturated, but it has neglected its new free lom where blasphemy is con erned. This omission is now partly repaired by Council of Love at the Criterion, which shows the person of God the Father for the first time on the London stage and presents heaven itself as a motheaten old swindle.

title: MISS WILKINSON GAINS SEMIFINALS
description: DARIEN, Conn., Aug. 20Martha Wilkinson, a 21yearold player from Whittier, Calif., ed three other Curtis Cup team mates into the semifinal round today of the 70th annual United States Golf Association wom en's amateur championship.

title: North Korea Trounced In Peking Table Tennis
description: PEKING, Aug. 20  The news was all over townthe Chinese tabletennis team trounced the North Koreans, who are considered the No. 2 power in world table ten nis.

title: Guards at Tombs Regain Control of Seized 4th Floor
description: Eighty Correction Depart ment guards and other person nel moved onto the fourth floor of the Men's House of Deten tion early yesterday morning and regained command of the cellblocks that 187 inmates had controlled since the rioting there 10 days ago.

title: FILLY SPRINT WON BY BUBBLE CASE
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 20 (AP)Thomas W. Rearden's Bubble Case took the lead at the start and went on to score an upset today in the Kislak Purse at Atlantic City Race Course, defeating six fillies in a sixfurlong allowance race.

title: Rate of Return Is Cleared
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (UPI) The Federal Power Commis sion today granted the South ern Natural Gas Company an 8.5 per cent overall rate of re turn, the highest return it has ever permitted a pipeline com pany to earn.

title: Gilder and Giles, Australia, Win World 420 Class Title
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 20 (UPI)A French crew, Bruno Chaquet and Gaspard Arbona, with no hope of overtaking the Aus tralians, John Gilder and Doug. las Giles, for the title, won the sixth and final race of the world 420 Class yachting cham pionship series to take second place in the overall standings.

title: France and Gretel II Begin Challenge Sailoff Today
description: NEWPORT, R. L, Aug. 20A mimeographed sheet titled Equipage de France pour la premiere regate helped pro duce a pulsequickening rise in yachting interest here today.

title: Whites in Ft. Lauderdale Concerned at Negro Anger
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Aug. 20After five nights of racial disorder, the white peo ple in this sunny city are be ginning to worry about its causes as well as its effects.

title: Lindsay Suggests Voting Plan That Includes Computerization
description: BINGHAMTON, Aug. 20A preferential ballot, in which a voter lists candidates in the order of his choice rather than simply checking the one he likes the most, was urged to day for New York elections on behalf of Mayor Lindsay.

title: Toll Collectors End Strike Here After Gaining Health Provisions
description: The wildcat strike of 547 Tri borough Bridge and Tunnel Au thority officers at five bridges, and two tunnels in the city was ended last night at midnight.

title: ISRAELI PLANES RAID IN NORTH OF JORDAN
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 20 (Reuters) Israeli jets made a 90minute strike in northern Jordan today after reports of attacks by Arab guerrillas from Jordan and Leb anon.

title: Deaths From DDT Successor Stir Concern
description: PINK HILL, N. C., Aug. 19After he planted his nine acres of tobacco this spring, Clarence Lee Boyette came to a store here to buy pesticides. He wanted something to kill the worms that can riddle tobacco leavessomething like DDT, which he had used for more years than he could recollect.

title: GRAIN PRICES CUT BY PROFIT TAKING
description: Gyrations in grain futures continued at a frenetic pace on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: Rev. John F. Stearns Dies; Held Pastorate in Elmira
description: SACO, Me., Aug. 20  The Rev. John F. Stearns of San Clemente, Calif., a former mem ber of the New York State Pro bation Board, died Tuesday in his summer home here. He was 70 years old.

title: Seymour Refurbishing His Office And Increasing Security for Staff
description: United States Attorney Whitney North Seymour Jr., who has expanded his staff to record size and is worried about the security of his of fice in a time of bomb scares and threats of violence, is spending $131,000 to refurbish the office and close it off from the general public.

title: Urban Renewal Comes to Atchison, Kan., Where Federal Aid Is Scorned (and Accepted)
description: ATCHISON, Kan., Aug. 13 Frank Todd is 79 years old, a retired Atchison bank er and a former chairman of the Kansas Republican party, which champions selfhelp and a minimum of Federal spending. Yet he boasts openly that urban renewal, one of the most controver smai of the big The Talk Federal domestic programs, took of this old river Atchison town that was rundown at the heels and made something of it. Urban renewal, known chiefly as a means of re juvenating the core of big cities, is spreading to small communities across the coun try.

title: Market Place.
description: Which market analyst do you read?

title: STANDARD OIL SIGNS FOR GAS DELIVERY
description: The Standard Oil Company) (New Jersey) yesterday an nounced it has signed a long term contract with the Colum bia Gas System. Inc.. covering the delivery of liquefied natural gas to be produced by an af Ifiliate in Venezuela.

title: Welles Putting Film Memories Into a Book With Bogdanovich
description: Orson Welles, whose first film, Citizen Kane, estab lished him at the age of 25 as a cinematic genius, is completing a book about his manyfaceted screen career. He is collaborating with Peter Bogdanovich, who at 31 is following the Falstaffian master's example as author, director and producer.

title: STOCKS ADVANCE THIRD DAY IN ROW
description: The continuing popularity of oil stocks and glimmers of a brighter economy provided the stock market yesterday with its third consecutive advance.

title: Department Store Sales Dip
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales for the latest week declined to an estimated $658 million, 2 per cent below the $671million sales for the cor responding week last year. Total retail store sales for the latest week rose to an esti mated $6.805billion up 4 per cent from the $6.574billion sales for the corresponding week last year.

title: Troyer Sets U.S. Record For HighPowered Rifle
description: CAMP PERRY, Ohio, Aug. 20 (AP)Ronald G. Troyer of An dover, Ohio, won the national highpower rifle championship today by firing a record four day aggregate score of 1,568 points of a possible 1,600 and placing 53 of his 160 shots in the xring.

title: FRANKLIN J. FITZPATRICK
description: Franklin J. Fitzpatrick, grand secretary of the Benevolent and Protective Order of Elks for the last nine years, died Wednes day in Chicago, where he lived. He was 65 years old.

title: The Chef's No Coward About Spices
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: PAPERS HERE GET 2 MORE ACCORDS
description: Newspapers deliverers and stereotypers reached tentative agreements yesterday on new contracts with newspaper pub lishers here.

title: A FORD AIDE FEARS MINICAR COST RISE
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Aug. 20 Inflation and government de mands for safety and pollution equipment could drive up the price of Detroit's new minicars by 35 to 50 per cent in only five years, Lee Iacocca, a presi dent of the Ford Motor Com pany, warned today.

title: Tropical Storm Spares Islands, But Ends Aquanaut Experiment
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Aug. 20 (UPI)Tropical storm Dorothy swept through the St. Lucia Channel today, but both Mar tinique and St. Lucia were spared nearhurricane winds and rains that had been ex pected.

title: Mrs. McElmury Takes Crown In Bicycle Championship Here
description: Mrs. Audrey McEmury rode her bicycle to a decisive vic tory in the women's national roadrace championship yester day in Central Park. Mrs. Mc Elmury, a 27yearold Califor nai housewife, won the United States first gold medal since 1912 in the 1969 world cham pionship at Brno, Czechoslova kia. Yesterday she broke from the 14woman pack in the first of the five laps and led by almost three minutes at the finish.

title: Life Article Questions the Ethics of Senator Tydings
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 20Sena tor Joseph D. Tydings of Mary land, a young, liberal Democrat with a reputation as a tough former prosecutor of errant Congressmen and as a crusader for public disclosure of elected officials financial date, has been accused by Life magazine of failing to meet his own standards of ethical conduct in managing his personal fortune.

title: Lester G. Porter, ExPresident Of BorgWarner Corp., Is Dead
description: HIGHLAND PARK, Ill., Aug. 20 (AP)  Lester G. Porter, president of BorgWarner Cor poration from 1961 until he retired in 1968, collapsed and died yesterday while playing golf. He was 67 years old.

title: StrikeFree Government
description: The postal strike is having its expected carryover moves by unions in other Federal agencies to drop strike prohibitions from their constitutions. The Ameri can Federation of Government Employes, representing more than a halfmillion Federal workers, is the latest dropper of the ban.

title: Black Group Plans Ellis I. Monument to Immigrants
description: The Great Hall on Ellis Is land will be refurbished and turned into a massive monu ment to the 16 million immi grants who passed through there, Dr. Thomas W. Matthew, president of the National Eco nomic Growth and Reconstruc tion Organization, announced yesterday.

title: McLucas, in Testimony, Says He Doubts His Original Belief That Panther Party Ordered Rackley Slain
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug 20 Lonnie McLucas conceded under crossexamination today that he had believed himself to be carrying out orders au thorized by the Black Panther party on the night Alex Rackley was murdered.

title: LARSEN TAKES. LEAD IN U.S. CHESS OPEN
description: BOSTON, Aug. 20  Grand master Bent Larsen of Den mark recaptured the lead in the United States Open Chess Championship by defeating Wil ham Marz of Milwaukee in the 10th round at the Parker House here last night.

title: Egypt Steps Up Criticism of Iraq With Press Attack on President
description: CAIRO, Friday, Aug. 21An Egyptian campaign to iso late the hardline Baathist re gime of Iraq, which is hostile to Cairo's moves for settlement of the conflict with Israel, was intensified today with direct criticism of President Ahmed Hassan alBakr.

title: Educators Urged By Thant to Teach World Allegiance
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 20  Secretary General Thant opened a conference of international educators here to day and asked them to estab lish among their students a new allegiance to the inter national community as a whole.

title: 10 to Go in Bronx Filly Pace; Gilmour Returns Here Tonight
description: YONKERS, Aug. 20At 7:15 o'clock tomorrow night, 10 sophomores will go postward in the $26,660 Bronx Filly Pace at Yonkers Raceway. It will be a onemile event on which there will be no wager ing mainly because of a four ply entry involving the stables of Billy Haughton and Del Cameron.

title: WESTCHESTER C. C. WINS HOFFHINE GOLF
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Aug. 20Westchester Country Club re tained the Hoffhine Memorial Trophy today, winning by 10 strokes with a fourman aggre gate of 291 in the 27th annual golf event at the club's two courses.

title: BREAK IN A MAIN FLOODS BMT LINK
description: An assortment of difficulties headed by a watermain break that caused a fiveandahalf hour disruption of service on the BMT Canarsie line, plagued the subway and commuter rail road lines here yesterday.

title: Joe Namath, the New AntiHero
description: One of the most interesting symbols of America today is Joe Namath, the quarterback of the New York football Jets. Joe is not only in tune with the rebellious attitude of the young, but he doubles it. He defies both the people who hate playboys and the people who hate bullyboys. He is something special: a longhaired hardhat, the antihero of the sports world.

title: Harlem Dance Theater Shows High Promise at Jacob's Pillow
description: LEE, Mass., Aug. 20Barely more than a year old, the Dance Theater of Harlem, founded and directed by Arthur Mitchell of the New York City Ballet, re vealed itself this week at the Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival here as one of dance's most promising ventures.

title: Arctic Island Murder Suspect Released on Bail by U.S. Court
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Aug. 20 Mario Escamilla, who has been accused of committing a murder on a remote Arctic ice island, left here on bail today for his home in California.

title: GOVERNOR NAMES AARONS A JUSTICE
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced two appointments yes terday to fill a Supreme Court vacancy and the other to fill the new position of executive assistant to the Governor.

title: 4 SENATORS SCORE GATEWAY DELAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 The four Senators from New York and New Jersey com plained to the White House today about delays in producing legislation that would create a Gateway National RecreatiOn Area at the entrance to New York harbor.

title: Newcombe Leads for Tennis Prize
description: By a onepoint margin, John Newcombe leads Rod Laver, his fellow Australian, in the race for the Martini & Rossi tennis player of the year award.

title: 3 OUT OF 10 G.I.'S SAID TO TRY DRUGS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20A series of armed forces surveys presented to Congress today shows that about three out of 10 servicemen interviewed have used marijuana or other drugs.

title: MANSON TESTIFIES ON HARASSMENT
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 20Charles M. Manson testified at a hearing today that he had been harassed in jail during his murder trial here.

title: EASING OF CREDIT BY RESERVE SEEN
description: The Federal Reserve System appears to be in the process of shifting its credit policy further in the direction of ease. This was the interpretaton analysts gave yeSterday to banking data that showed a decided accelera tion in the rate of expansion of money and bank credit.

title: Father of Missing Girl Says He Directed Nerve Gas Move
description: WELLS, Me., Aug. 20Brig. Gen. Peter Olenchuk, whose 13yearold daughter has been missing for 11 days under mysterious circumstances, re vealed today that he was the officer in charge of the recent movement of nerve gas to North Carolina.

title: Steelers Trade Jefferson to Colts for Richardson and a High Draft Choice
description: Roy Jefferson, one of the best pass receivers in football, was traded by the Pittsburgh Steelers yesterday to the Balti more Colts for Willie Richard son and a high future draft choice. Richardson also is a wide receiver.

title: National Stock Exchange
NIXON, DIAZ ORDAZ AGREE ON BORDER
description: PUERTO VALLARTA, Mexico, Aug. 20President Nixon and President Gustavo Diaz Ordaz of Mexico announced tonight that they had agreed to a reso lution of all current border disputes and to machinery that would prevent such disputes in the future.

title: Natural Delivery Helps Storyteller Ramble in Song
description: Kris Kristofferson projects casualness the way it should be projected  effortlessly. And yet, as he stands on the tiny stage of the Bitter End, picking his guitar and ram bling through his songs in low, husky voice, the dis cipline behind the casualness becomes increasingly evident.

title: Maryland Draft Board Fire
description: REISTERSTOWN, Md., Aug. 20 (Reuters)An early morning fire damaged a draft board office in this suburb of Balti more today. The Baltimore County police said the blaze was the work of arsonists. The fire did heavy damage to the office and most of its records. The police said that intruders apparently opened file drawers at random, doused them with gasoline and set them afire.

title: Hayden, Stone Quitting Offices Downtown for Skyscraper Horne
description: The headquarters office of Hayden, Stone, Inc., a throw back to another era in Man hattan's financial district, will be abandoned as a result of the brokerage concern's consolida tion with Cogan, Berlind, Weill & Levitt.

title: BUCKLEY OFFERS TV DEBATE PLAN
description: In his first specific proposals for televised debates, James L. Buckley, the Conservative par ty candidate for United States Senator, said yesterday that he would seek a series of state wide forums, rather than re gional ones, to prevent candi dates from tailoring their views by geographic area.

title: Joe Louis Fete Nets $75,000
description: DETROIT, Aug. 20 (UPI)Detroit's tribute to Joe Louis, former heavyweight boxing champion of the world, has netted more than $75,000, a spokesman for the Salute To The Champ organization an nounced today.

title: Top Bid Wins Steeplechase by 9 Lengths at Spa
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 20  Mrs. Ogden Phipps made a return to the winner's circle today after the running of the Saratoga Steeplechase Handicap. Her 6yearold, Top Bid, won the $18,100 feature event on the card, an achieve ment that was appreciated by the players who backed the fa vorites in the crowd of 15,458.

title: Mellon's Colt Captures Noted English Stakes
description: YORK, England, Aug. 20 (AP)Americanowned Mill Reef scored a 10length victory today in the six furlong Gimcrack Stakes for 2yearolds, a race first run in 1846.

title: 4 SWIMMERS SET WORLD RECORDS
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 20For Debbie Meyer, it was old hat. For John Kinsella, Mike Stamm and Alice Jones, it was something new. All four broke world records tonight as the Amateur Athletic Union's na tional outdoor swimming cham pionships began in the Los An geles Swim Stadium

title: Reply to Loyal Opposition Appealed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 The Democratic National Com mittee and the Columbia Broad casting System appealed to gether to the Federal Com munications Commission today to reconsider its ruling that Republicans must have a chance to answer the Democrats loyal opposition broadcast on C.B.S. last month.

title: M'CREARY VICTOR IN MIDGET SAILING
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Aug. 20Jamie McCreary of the Larchmont Yacht Club, with three victories in the fiverace championship division, was awarded the Long Island Sound Junior Yacht Racing Associa tion midget sailing crown today.

title: Dan Sikes Cards a 6UnderPar 66 to Lead Avco Golf Classic by 2 Strokes
description: SUTTON, Mass., Aug. 20 Dan Sikes enjoyed the change in weather as the pro golf tour moved into New England today. Gray skies and intermittent showers replaced the 100 de gree temperature of last week's Professional Golfers Associ ation championship at Tulsa and Sikes took the lead with a 66 in the opening round of the $160.000 Avco Classic.

title: 3 Barred at Prague Statue
description: PRAGUE, Friday, Aug. 21 (Reuters)Czechoslovak police men today prevented three East Germans from placing flowers on the statue of King Wenceslaus in Prague's Wen ceslaus Square. The East Ger mans said they had come to Czechoslovakia especially to mark the second anniversary of the 1968 Sovietled invasion of Czechoslovakia.

title: Newport Preservation Group Plans 25th Anniversary Party
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 20To celebrate its 25th anni versary, the Preservation So ciety of Newport County has planned an informal party at the stables of The Elms, the former Berwind mansion here, on Sept. 6.

title: VOCATIONAL CENTER INVADED BY YOUTHS
description: Four youths were arrested yesterday morning on charges of invading a Board of Educa tion vocational center in Brook lyn, smashing equipment and throwing bricks at teachers and students there.

title: MAYOR FEARS LAG IN CENSUS OF CITY
description: New York is in danger of losing millions of dollars in state and Federal aid because census takers seem to be missing many city residents, Mayor Lindsay said yesterday.

title: Article 3 No Title
Radio
description: 15:30 P.M., WRVR: Just Music: Sylvia Marlowe, Harpsichordist. Suite No. 7 in D, Purcell; Con certo, Rieti; Concerto in D (Opus 21), Haydn; Concerto for Diverse Instruments, De Falls; Sonata for Diverse Instruments, Carter; Pieces for Two Harpsichords, Couperin.

title: PAGELS TAKES TITLE IN RAVEN SAIL SERIES
description: BABYLON, L.I., Aug. 20Bill Pagels of the Wet Pants Association captured his sec ond national sailing champion ship within a week and won his second straight Raven Class series crown today. Pagels was the winner of the Blue Jay Class nationals last weekend.

title: Apollo 14 Tested by Crew
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Aug. 20 (AP)The Apollo 14 astro nauts, Capt. Alan B. Shepard Jr., Maj. Stuart A. Roosa and Comdr. Edgar D. Mitchell boarded their command ship today to rehearse procedures for an important vacuum cham ber test next month. The craft is scheduled to be launched to the moon on Jan. 31.

title: Woman Correction Officer Is Shot During a Mugging
description: A 36yearold woman correc tions officer was shot and seri ously wounded with her own revolver early yesterday during a struggle with a mugger in the foyer of her apartment building.

title: Senators Propose Changes in Nixon Welfare Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20Lib eral Senators of both parties proposed changes today in Pres ident Nixon's welfare reform program, still firmly lodged in the Senate Finance Committee.

title: Neighborhoods: Morrisania Fights Odds to Realize Dream
description: The Morrisania section of of the Bronx refuses to con cede that it is doomed. It bristles with Puerto Rican and black partisans who in sist the area can be saved from the desolation that has swept across Hunts Point in the Bronx and Brownsville in Brooklyn.

title: Suffolk Curb on Detergents Expected
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Aug. 20The Suffolk County. Legisla ture is expected to pass a law barring the sale of certain de tergents within the county be cause of potential danger to the water supply, the chairmen of two legislative committees said today.

title: Puerto Vallarta a Center of Tourism Drive
description: PUERTO VALLARTA, Mexi co, Aug. 17This once se cluded little fishing port has become the centerpiece for an enormous tourist promotion of Mexico's upper Pacific coast and Baia California.

title: In Memoriam
description: BARONSamuel T. In memory of Samuel T. Baron who departed from this life one year ago.

title: 15 on Martinique and Dominica Are Dead in Caribbean Storm
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Aug. 21 (UPI)  Tropical storm Doro thy, showing signs of intensi fying, moved across the open Caribbean today, leaving at least 15 persons dead and hun dreds injured or homeless on the islands of Martinique and Dominica.

title: JOBLESS RATE RISES TO 4.7% FOR STATE
description: ALBANY, Aug. 21  New York State's unemployment rate last month reached 4.7 per cent, the highest figure for July in five years, the State Department of Labor an nounced today.

title: CHILDREN'S TV SHOW GETS $200,000 GRANT
description: A $200,000 grant by the SearsRoebuck Foundation to the Corporation for Public Broadcasting will permit the production of 65 new halfhour programs in the awardwinning daily children's series, Mister ogers Neighborhood. The programs will be produced by National Educational Tele vision.

title: Rhode Island Plans to Hire Blacks in Construction Jobs
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Aug. 21 (AP)Rhode Island signed to day a fiveyear agreement aimed at gaining jobs, 350 im mediately, in the state's build ing trades for minority group members, particularly blacks.

title: Rochester Research Chemist Wins Bike Racing Title Here
description: Mike Carnahan, a 29yearold father of four who classi fies himself as a secondplace man, rode to the men's road title in the national amateur bicycle championships yester day in Central Park.

title: PUERTO RICO SETS SUGAR TAKEOVER
description: The Puerto Rican Govern ment, in one of the most dras tic moves in recent history; has moved to expropriate an esti mated 12,000 acres of sugar cane lands and a mill owned by the Aguirre Company, a lead ing sugar producer in that Car ibbean island.

title: O. C. Torrey Jr. Married in Rye
description: RYE, N.Y. Aug. 21Miss Allegra Standing Mertz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James McClenahan Mertz of Rye and West Pawlet, Vt., was married this afternoon to Owen Cates Torrey Jr., son of Mrs. Torrey of New York and the late Mr. Torrey.

title: Midtown TieStore Clerk Is Found Shot to Death
description: A clerk in a Tie City store at 161 East 42d Street was shot to death last night, apparently during a robbery attempt.

title: Employes of I.O.S. Ask End to Dispute
description: GENEVA, Aug. 21  Em ployes of Investors Overseas Services urged at a meeting today that the factions com peting for control of the limp ing mutual fund complex reach an early settlement.

title: Prisoners of Rhetoric
description: There is a risk, in the wake of this week's public hearings on conditions at the Manhattan House Detention, that Mayor Lindsay and other city officials will become prisoners of their own defensive rhetoric. Incredibly, in the light of the Mayor's own long crusade for prison reform, the city has assumed an attitude of icy hostility toward the hearings.

title: Arteries to New Haven About to Harden
description: Like finding the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow, the Yale Bowl will be a difficult goal for the 71,000 expected at the GiantsJets game there tomorrow. It's the traffic, as those who attended last year remember so well. The usual threehour roundtrip on the highways took six hours or more.

title: Roundup: M'N ally Gathers Statistics on 19th Victory
description: A whole crop of statistics surrounded Dave McNally last night as the Orioles pitching star hurled his club to a 50 victory over the Cali fornia Angels at Baltimore.

title: Police Officer Found Dead, Apparent Suicide in Queens
description: An offduty police lieutenant, Edward Blahnik, apparently shot and killed himself yester day in his car in the Kissena Park area of Queens, according to the police.

title: Timothy T. Sweeps 2 Heats, Takes Review Futurity Trot
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Aug. 21 (UPI) Timothy T., with John Sinipson Jr. in the, sulky, trot ted to an easy victory in the ReView Futurity at the Illinois State Fair today.

title: Ambassador Awaits Decision
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 20  Ambassador Yosef Tekoah of Israel said tonight that he was still awaiting word from his Government on its choice of a negotiator but that he believed the decision would surely not come before Sunday and probably later. He said he saw Dr. Jarring this morning but brought him no message.

title: Ukrainian Five Tops U.S.
description: KIEV, Soviet Union, Aug. 21 (Reuters)A Ukrainian basket ball team beat the United States Olympic training team, 6058, tonight. The Americans led, 3428, at halftime.

title: Jerusalem Is Hewing To Rebuilding Plans
description: JERUSALEM, Aug 21 The moment is awkward for talking about any big new plans, the Mayor said. The Rogers plan and the cease fire and all the negotiating talk, it's all making people nervous about the futureIsraelis and Arabs. Jerusa lem's Mayor Teddy Kollek, normally not reti cent about things going on in his city, was discuss ing the District Town Planning Committee's newly approved master plan to rehabilitate the older quarters of East Jerusalem, the part of the city that was ruled by Jor dan until the sixday war three years ago. The approval of the plan, which caps work under way from almost the first week of the Israeli take over, was made public this week with little fanfare.

title: Corn Futures Register a Drop In an Active Trading Session
description: Corn futures continued to ride a roller coaster yesterday carrying the price levels of all grains with them.

title: NEWISSUE MARKET STAYS IN DOLDRUMS
description: The newissue market con tinued in the doldrums this week as only two companies made first public offerings of their common stock.

title: U.S. FUNDS TO ASSIST SPANISH AMERICANS
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 21Vice President Agnew an nounced a Federal grant and passed on a donation from a Spiro Agnew wristwatch manu facturer today to illustrate what he called President Nixon's interest in the for gotten minorities.

title: MISS WILKINSON GAINS GOLF FINAL
description: DARIEN, Conn., Aug. 21Cynthia Hill of St. Petersburg, Fla., and Martha Wilkinson of Whittier, Calif., will meet in the 36hole final of the 70th annual United States Golf Association women's amateur golf cham pionship tomorrow over the Wee Burn Country Club.

title: Article 1  No Title
City Will Seek Bookies Advice In Setting Up Offtrack Betting
description: The city's new offtrack bet ting corporation is going to the competition  illegal bookiesfor some advice.

title: F.D.A. Is Planning to Ban Sales Of 15 Nasal Sprays for Colds
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21The Food and Drug Administra tion announced today that it intended to remove from the market 15 brands of nasal sprays sold for the relief of colds.

title: Friction Stows Harlem Model Cities Program
description: The $14.5 million Harlem Model Cities program is beset by internal friction and per sonality clashes that have pre vented it from delivering ur gently needed services to the 250,000 people of the upper Manhattan neighborhood.

title: PENN CENTRAL LACKS FUNDS TO MEET LOAN
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 21 (UPI)A spokesman for the Penn Central Co., the parent company of the debtridden Penn Central Railroad, said to day it did not have sufficient cash to meet a $59million loan that matures early next year.

title: Aquanauts Resubmerge
description: ST. JOHN, Virgin Islands, Aug. 21 (UPI)  Five aquanauts who were lifted from their under water home at the approach of tropical storm Dorothy re turned to the bottom of the Caribbean today, assured that the storm would bypass the Vir gin Islands.

title: 2 CITY BANKS CUT RATES  OF POINT
description: Two major New York City banks yesterday reduced the rates they pay on large certi ficates of deposit by Ma of point, capping a round of pro nounced declines in the short term money market this week.

title: LARSEN KEEPS LEAD IN U.S. CHESS OPEN
description: BOSTON, Aug. 21Grand master Bent Larsen of Den mark, the recent winner of the Canadian Open, maintained his lead in the United States Open Chess Championship by de feating Walter Browne, an Australian grandmaster now living in New York, in the 11th said, nexttolast round at the Palmer House here last night.

title: Niarchos's Acumen Built Shipping Empire, Fortune and Legend
description: The world of Stavros S. Niarchos, the Greek shipping magnate, is dominated by big business, riches, luxury, social complications and, above all, by his own presence.

title: Leader of Panthers
description: In the early part of Octo ber, 1966, two young men who had recently left Merritt Junior College in Oakland, Calif., sat in an antipoverty center in North Oakland and wrote out a 10point platform and program for the Black Panther party. When they had finished, one turned to the other and said: We've got to have some kind of struc tune. What do you want to be, chairman or minister of de fense? The other replied: Doesn't make any difference to me. What do you want to be, chairman or minister of defense?

title: DR. ERNEST KLUGER
description: Dr. Ernest Kluger, a general practitioner of 5318 32d Ave nue, Woodside, Queens, died Thursday in Memorial Hospital. He was 63 years old.

title: U. S. BRIEF BACKS 18YEAROLD VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP)  The Justice Depart ment maintained today that Congress had the right to lower the voting age to 18.

title: Phone Rates Increased
description: BOSTON, Aug. 21 (AP)New England Telephone Company filed rate increases with the Massachusetts Department of Public Utilities today that will add from 5 to 60 cents to the average state homeowner's monthly bill. A company spokes man said the increases totaled about $33million, the maxi mum allowable under Supreme Court Justice Paul G. Kirk's ruling giving permission for the increases.

title: Auto Club Suspends Follmer
description: SPEEDWAY, Ind., Aug. 21 (UPI)  George Follmer of Arcadia, Calif., a consistent performer who wound up 16th in the United States Auto Club point standing last year, was suspended temporarily today from competing in any U.S.A.C. races. The United States Auto Club said the suspension was made because Follmer competed in nonsanctioned events with out U.S.A.C. permission.

title: Phoebe C. Schoellkopf Bride Upstate Allegra Mertz,
description: DERBY, N. Y., Aug. 21Miss Phoebe Calkins Schoen kopf, a member of a family that pioneered in the eco nomic development of the Buffalo region, was married in the First Church of Evans here this afternoon to Justin Stillwell White, a senior at the University of Pennsyl vania's Wharton School of Finance and Commerce.

title: SEALE TESTIFIES AT PANTHER TRIAL
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 21Bobby G. Seale denied today ever having seen or heard any thing about Alex Rackley before or during a 12hour visit here the night before Rackley's mur der.

title: Hospital Agency Appoints
description: The appointment of Dr. Stan ley S. Bergen Jr. to a key posi tion was announced yesterday by Dr. Joseph T. English, presi dent of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corpora tion. Dr. Bergen, 40 years old, was named the corporation's senior vice president for medi cal and professional affairs.

title: Topics: America's Neglected Origins
description: TUCSON. ARIZ. A newcomer to the South west from urban New York faces possible crises of identity and conscience. Initial encoun ters with Indian and Chicano civilizations are depressing re minders that William Bradford et al. were guilty of cultural genocide in similar fashion to the conquistadors in Peru and Mexico, white Rhodesians and Afrikaners. Our colonists, while expropriating, evicting and subjugating, also imposed their own image upon peoples symbiotically joined to the land by centuries of occupation.

title: Invasion Anniversary Is Quiet Day in Prague
description: PRAGUE, Aug. 21 (Reuters) The second anniversary of the Warsaw Pact invasion of Czechoslovakia passed with out incident today as citizens of Prague ignored a call for passive resistance to the Gov ernment.

title: Sprague of U.S. Wins Sail
description: CASCAIS, Portugal, Aug. 21 (Reuters) Henry Sprague of Newport Beach, Calif., won the fourth race in the Finn Class Gold Cup world championship yachting series today. Ian Mc Donald Smith of Britain was second and Jorge Bruder of Brazil was third.

title: GILMOUR DRIVES YONKERS WINNER
description: YONKERS, Aug. 21Buddy Gilmour's first driving assign ment at Yonkers Raceway since Oct. 18, 1966 found him bring ing home the winner of the $26,660 Bronx Filly Pace for 3yearolds tonight. Since this was a nonbetting onemile race, for which post time was 7:15 o'clock, a comparative handful of fans was on hand to see Timely News beat Kestrel Flight, Keystone Sophie, Fannie Hail and six other sophomores.

title: Six Overcome by Smoke in Fire On IRT Caused by ShortCircuit
description: One man was stricken with an apparent heart attack and six persons were overcome by smoke when a fire broke out on an IRT subway train at 125th Street and Lexington Avenue last night.

title: JOHN S. STARKIE
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Aug. 21 John Sherman Starkie, who retired in 1963 as president of the Eckley Dental Supply Com pany, died yesterday of a heart attack at Manhasset Medical Center. He was 79 years old and lived at 198 Rockwood Road.

title: SOUTHPAW BUOYS HOPES IN STRETCH
description: The recently seesawing spir its of the New York Mets went into an up cycle last night as Jerry Koosman pitched a 41 victory over the scary Cincin nati Reds before a crowd of 53,320 that included the 2mil lionth Shea Stadium customer of the season.

title: Boston Station Reinstates A TV Program for Blacks
description: BOSTON, Aug. 21 (AP)Say Brother, a program by and for blacks that was dropped last week from WGBH TV's fall schedule, has been re instated, according to Michael Rice. the program director.

title: SPURT RECORDED IN DURABLE GOODS; Orders in July Climbed by $1.9Billion to Highest Level Since October 69; DEFENSE BILLINGS LEAD; Demands Top Shipments for First Time in 4 Months, With Backlog Rising
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21New orders for durable goods rose strongly in July, with de fense orders accounting for most of the increase, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Navy Urged to Stop Firing on Culebra in 5 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21A report to the Governor of Puerto Rico recommends that the Navy stop its controversial firing on the island of Culebra within five years if subStitute targets can be found.

title: CITY'S POPULATION SAID TO BE DOWN BY AS MUCH AS 10%
description: The preliminary 1970 census figures reported to the city ad ministration indicate that the city's population appears to have dropped by nearly 10 per cent since 1960.

title: New Books
description: A Faraway Country: The Continu ing Story of Project Concern, by Dr. James W. Turpin with Al Hirshberg (World, $6.95). A report on the medical organiza tion.

title: STOCK PRICES DIP ON LONDON BOARD
description: Industrial issues drifted low er on the London Stock Ex change yesterday.

title: U.S.MEXICO PACT DETAILS BOUNDARY
description: PUERTO VALLARTA Mex ico, Aug. 21President Nixon completing a 28hour state visit to Mexico today hailed MexicanAmerican friendship and invited President Gustavo Diaz Ordaz to a state dinner in San Diego on Sept. 3.

title: INDIANS DISPLAY ALCATRAZ ARMS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 21A group of Indians who have occupied Alcatraz Island for the last nine months exposed their weapons todayone bow and two toy pistolsand then threw the toy pistols into the waters of the San Francisco Bay.

title: Wool Growers Pin Hopes. on Improved Marketing
description: Hopes are high for an in crease in wool consumption throughout the world as a re sult of steppedup research and marketing programs, A. C. B. Maiden, managing director of the International Wool Secretariat, said in an interview yesterday.

title: Newton and Seale Reunited Briefly
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 21Huey P. Newton and Bobby G. Seale, the cofounders of the Black Panther party, who have been separated by prison bars for almost three years, were briefly reunited today and em braced warmly.

title: Pender to Coach at Army
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Aug. 21 (UPI)  Capt. Mel Pender, a former Olympic gold medal sprinter, was assigned to the United States Military Academy today as assistant track and field coach. Pender will assist Coach Carleton Crowell with the crosscountry squad and the indoor and outdoor track teams.

title: Israelis Charge Egyptians Continue Missile BuildUp
description: JERUSALEM; Aug. 21 (Reu ters)  Israel said today that the United Arab Republic was continuing to build up a sur facetoair missile network within the Suez Canal truce zone, in violation of the Mid dle Eastern military standstill.

title: Brand, Grumet Quits. Brokerage Business
description: Brand, Grumet & Seigel, which had been in the broker age business since 1927, noti fied the New York and Amer ican Stock Exchanges yester day that it had ceased doing business as a brokerdealer and. therefore was no longer a member of the exchanges.

title: Cambodian Rivals Invited
description: LUSAKA, Zambia Aug. 21 (Agence FrancePresse)  Both the Government of Lieut. Gen. Lon Not in Cambodia and the government in exile of Prince Norodom Sihanouk in Peking have been invited to attend the conference of nonaligned lead ers here next month and both have accepted; it was reported in Lusaka today.

title: GIANTS SERIOUS ABOUT JETS'
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Aug. 21 Last year at this time, Fran Tarkenton sat in a parked automobile and talked of re tiring from football, at 29 years of age, because summer camp was so unbearable.

title: MRS. H. L. ZABRISKIE
description: MADISON, Conn., Aug. 21Ars. Ethel Little Zabriskie of Kelsey Place died today after a long illness, two days short of her 89th birthday. Mrs. Za briskie was the widow of Henry Lyles Zabriskie, chief electrical engineer for 30 years of the Diehl Company, Elizabeth, N. J.

title: Repeat Bunuel's Age d'Or
description: Luis Bunuel's 1930 film, L'Age d'Or, which opened the current Paris Cinemathe que program of vintage films at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, will be repeated tomor row night at 9 as a result of the enthusiastic audience re sponse and requests. It replaces the previously scheduled An nie Oakley, starring Barbara Stanwyck.

title: CORONER DETAILS THE TATE KILLING
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 21The Los Angeles County Cor oner testified today that Sharon Tate, who was slain with four other persons at her home last August, was stabbed 16 times, slashed twice and hanged.

title: DR. MANFRED WOLKISER
description: Dr. Manfred Wolkiser, an in ternational lawyer, died Tues day of a heart attack in his home at 7 East 85th Street. His age was 67.

title: Music: The 20th Century
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 21Festivals of contemporary music are sometimes neither very contemporary nor very musical, and only festive in the loosest use of the word.

title: RACE PARLEY OPENED BY BLACK CATHOLICS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21The first National Conference of Black Lay Catholics opened here today with a stated goal of confronting community and institutional prejudice in order to break the wall of racism and dilute the ingrained poisons that threaten to further divide and alienate Americans from one another.

title: Field Leaves Sensations
description: Ron Field has withdrawn as directorchoreographer of Sensations, the musical to be produced by John Bowab andl Charles Celian, because of pressure of other commit ments, The show, which is continuing auditions, will open Oct. 14 at the Theater Four. A new director and the cast are expected to be announced shortly.

title: Kent Student Suggests Officer Gave Signal to Shoot
description: KENT, Ohio, Aug. 21A Kent State University student told the President's Commission on, Campus Unrest today that hel had seen a National Guard of ficer give what appeared to be a signal to fire and then shoot his pistol just before the rifle volley that killed four students here last May 4.

title: Mideast CeaseFire
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21Regardless of whether the Mid dle East ceasefire was actually violated, the general view here is that the Soviet Union and United Arab Republic gained ground both militarily and dip lomatically at the expense of the United States and Israel. The Egyptians and their Soviet advisers apparent ly not only suc ceeded in expand ing missile fortifi cations along the Suez Canal but have also harvested the politi cal dividend of provoking the United States and Israel into divisive dispute just when im portant indirect ArabIsraeli talks are due to begin.

title: Unbeaten Staunch Avenger Wins Arch Ward by Neck
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 21 (AP)Undefeated Staunch Avenger scored his fourth victory today in the $53,400 Arch Ward Stakes for 2yearolds at Arling ton Park. The winner had to go all out to defeat Hook It Up by a neck on the final card of the 72day meeting.

title: Air Traffic Normal At National Airport After Control Snarl
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) The Federal Aviation Admin istration reported that services at Washington National Airport were back to normal after an unexpected foulup when it gave a new air traffic control sys tem a tryout yesterday.

title: Dome Designer Invents Tubular Boat
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21R. Buckminster Fuller, who is best known for his geodes ic dome designs and other architectural innovations, is an enthusiastic amateur sailor.

title: Hyman, at Museum, Gives Moog Synthesizer Concert
description: The increasing viability of the Moog synthesizer as flexible musical instrument was demonstrated by Dick Hyman Thursday night at a concert in the Jazz in the Garden series at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: C. E. Figg Fiance Of Merril Godfrey
description: WARREN, N. J., Aug. 21Mr. and Mrs. Milton L. God frey have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Merril Ann Godfrey, to Charles Edward Figg, deputy executive director of the Fresno (Calif.) Redevelop ment Agency. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Basil D. Figg of East Lansing, Mich.

title: U2 Role Termed Vital In Surveillance at Suez
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 Despite technological advan ces that have made possible spyinthesky satellites, the highaltitude manned U2 airplane remains an invalu able device for intelligence gathering.

title: V.F.W. Names Californian
description: MIAMI BEACH, Aug. 21 (AP) Herbert R. Rainwater of San Bernardino, Calif., was elected today as commander in chief of the Veterans of Foreign Wars at the organization's 71st na tional convention.

title: Tufts Gets $980,000
description: MEDFORD, Mass., Aug. 21 (AP)  Tufts University an nounced today alumni contri butions of more than $980,000 this year, the highest in the school's history. A university spokesman said the figure was twice the amount donated last year.

title: Dabney, Rios Excel Here In U.S. Youth Games Track
description: William Dabney and Armand Rios of New York. turned in outstanding performances yes terday in the preliminary rounds of the track competition of the fourth annual United States Youth Games at Randalls Island.

title: VICTORY ACHIEVED ON THE FINAL LEG
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 21In a dramatic race against blue hulled France and the sixhour time limit, Gretel II of Australia drew first blood today in the America's Cup challenger series.

title: DAN SIKES HAS 74, TRAILS BY 5 SHOTS
description: SUTTON, Mass., Aug. 21Billy Casper was on his way home a year ago after 36 holes of the Avco Golf Classic. But today the Masters champion led at the halfway mark with tworound total of 135.After a second round of 67, five under par, at the Pleasant Valley Country Club, Casper said with a quizzical smile, I guess I made the cut this year. I had 151 last year after start ing with an 80 and missed qualifying for the first time in about 149 tournaments.

title: NearDisaster in Mideast
description: Despite a neartragedy of errors that almost de railed the most hopeful Mideast peace effort since the 1967 war, it now appears that the ceasefire will hold and that talks will open soon  the overriding con sideration.

title: Boy Safe After Fall in Mine
description: MOUNT HOPE, N.J., Aug. 21 (AP)A Rockaway Township boy was rescued today from the bottom of an abandoned 100foot mine hole in which he fell an hour earlier.

title: Article 3  No Title
Enemy Shelling Reported A Mile From Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 21Enemy forces fired mortar shells into Government positions on the west bank the Mekong River last night, just a mile from the capital's royal palace, the Cambodian military command said today. The shelling was the closest to the capital reported since the Cambodian war began four months ago.

title: $112,900 TRAVERS DRAWS 9 STARTERS
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 21Personality and High Echelon, the winners, respec tively, of the Preakness and the Belmont Stakes, will carry the silks of Mrs. Ethel D. Jacobs in the Travers Stakes, the high light of the Spa meeting tomor row.

title: Students in Politics
description: A fascinating critique of the rise and fall and possible rise again of the peace movement has been supplied by one of its chief mobilizersSam Brown, a founder of StudentsforMcCarthy in the 1968 Presidential campaign and coordinator of the Viet nam Moratorium last October.

title: Toyota Chief Sees No Threat From U.S. Minicars
description: The hardnosed American dealers who sell the Japanese built Toyota here were told yes terday that Detroit's new mini cars would not cut into import sales.

title: DRUG PROBLEMS LAID TO PARENTS
description: A policeman active in anti narcotics work and a former addict employed at Phoenix House told a group of East Harlem social workers and teenagers yesterday that apa thetic parents were more to blame for the drug problem than the vushers and suroliers.

title: SCM Corp. Profits Show a Plunge
description: SCM Corporation earnings in the fiscal year ended June 30 plunged to $1,896,000, or 21 cents a share, from $20,639, 000, or $2.37 a share, in the previous year, the company's annual report disclosed yester day.

title: Seoul to Seek Assurances
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 21 Vice President Agnew will be pressed for assurances in con nection with United States plans to withdraw troops from South Korea when he arrives Monday.

title: SENATE BARS PAY FOR SOME FORCES IN CAMBODIA, LAOS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21The Senate took another step today to limit American involvement in Indochina by voting to pro hibit the use of American funds to pay contingents of foreign troops fighting in support of Cambodia and Laos.

title: Sports of tht Times
description: Doug Dale's head mechanic, 25yearold Bill Wester mann. crouched on the grass with a twoway radio in his hands. He's OneA, he's got a wife and a kid and one on the way, he really needs this race. Westermann kept glancing down the empty roadway. If he wins or does real well he can ride on the Army team and train for the 72 Olympics.

title: Books of The Times
description: If you are one of those who sometimes wonder why it is that nonfiction lists are so much more appealing than the fictional listings, you might take a look at John Lord's life of Richard Meinertzhagen. It helps explain the problem. For here is superbly original creation: a picaresque soldier, a resourceful outdoorsman and naturalist, a man with shrewd insights in his field, which was war, a civilized prod uct of high culture who was a coldblooded killer with rifle and knife, a man who strove even to middle age to earn the love of his mother and who did not marry until she died. When I used the word original, meant in life. In fiction he would have been a natural: the precise embodiment of the upper middleclass Victorian Englishman.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The Senate, by a unanimous voice vote yesterday, approved an amendment forbid ding the use of American funds for foreign troops fighting to support the governments of Cambodia and Laos. The provision, if survives a HouseSenate conference com mittee, will prevent the payment of a vol unteer force for Cambodia now training in Thailand. [Page 1, Column 1.]

title: Mrs. Nancy B. Tiffany Is Married
description: OLD LYME, Conn., Aug. 21 Mrs. Nancy Baldwin Tiffany of Lyme and E. Ed ward Manville 3d were mar ried here this afternoon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Robert B. Cooney, their friends. The Rev. Walter Euston, a Congregational minister, performed the cere mony.

title: Egypt Accuses Iraqi Group Of a Conspiracy in Cairo
description: CAIRO, Aug. 21A chill in relations between the United Arab Republic and Iraq became more pronounced today with an accusation by Cairo that an Iraqi group had been carrying out conspiratorial activities here.

title: When She TieDyes, It's Not in the HurryUp American Fashion
description: In Japan, tie dying is not a sudden fad that will be passe tomorrow, and at the new Ernst Reiko shop at 400 East 82d Street, Reiko Ettr man is busily dying fabrics in the three centuries old manner she learned al little girl from her mother in Tokyo.

title: Brooklyn Priest Gives Up In Philadelphia in Theft
description: Fugitive charges against a Brooklyn priest accused of pocketing more than $200,000 from a Philadelphia church were dropped here yesterday after it was learned he had surrendered to Philadelphia authorities.

title: Bridge:
description: The expenses of American representation in interna tional competitiop are large ly met by an annual pair game that is played conti nent wide.

title: Bonn Pleased by Statement
description: BONN, Aug. 21  The Gov ernment of Chancellor Willy Brandt expressed satisfaction today over the communiqu issued by the Warsaw Pact leaders.

title: U.S. TO CONTINUE FLIGHTS AT SUEZ
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 The United States indicated to day that its U2 aircraft would continue highaltitude observa tion flights along the Suez Canal despite Egyptian dis pleasure over these operations, which are designed to monitor the twoweekold Middle East truce.

title: Gain on Big Board Is Best Since Jane
description: Stock prices rose sharply yes terday in an advance that surprised Wall Street observers with its vigor.

title: Redskins Beat Falcons, 2113; Bills Win, 3520, From Eagles
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (UPI) Sonny Jurgensen connected with two early scoring passes and Mike Bass, a cornerback, intercepted for another first quarter touchdown today to spark the Washington Redskins to a 2113 preseason victory over the Atlanta Falcons.

title: Two French TV Newsmen Reported Dead in Cambodia
description: PARIS, Aug. 21 (Reuters)A French television executive said here today that two French television newsmen who were taken prisoner in Cam bodia last month had died.

title: Candidate Drops TimeLike Flyer
description: DOVER, Del., Aug. 21 Pierre Samuel du Pont 4th, Republican candidate for Del aware's seat in the United States House of Representa tives, has stopped distribut ing a campaign brochure be cause of objections from Time magazine.

title: SelfCurb on TV Spending
description: Governor Rockefeller's insistence on buying up as much television time as he can get with the virtually limitless funds at his disposal has torpedoed hope that all the New York candidates for Governor and Senator would agree voluntarily to stay inside the sound limits on TV campaign spending approved by a Congressional conference committee but not yet formally translated into law.

title: MRS. COURT GAINS MERION NET FINAL
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 21Mrs. Margaret Smith Court, the Wimbledon titleholder, scored an exciting victory today in joining Pat Walkden of Rho desia in the women's singles final of the Pennsylvania lawn tennis championships at the Merion Cricket Club.

title: Harry T. Dolan, Lawyer In Condemnations Here
description: Harry T. Dolan, a lawyer who had served for 35 years as spe cial assistant to the United States Attorney General in charge of all Federal condemna tion proceedings in the New York area, died yesterday in his home in the Prince George Hotel, 14 East 28th Street. He had made his home in the hotel since his retirement in 1966. His age was 74.

title: Hundreds Are Left Homeless Following Storm in Ontario
description: SUDBURY, Ontario, Aug. 21 (AP)  Hundreds of homeless people sought shelter in schools, churches and private homes today after a storm killed at least four persons, in jured 150 and caused millions of dollars in damage in four Canadian communities.

title: National Lead Project
description: The National Lead Company said yesterday that it planned to expand its titanium pigment plant in Belgium and to con struct an anticorrosive pig ent facility there.

title: Weather Reports and Forecast
Bullfrog Launching Delayed
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (UPI) The space agency delayed the launching of two bullfrogs from Wallops Island, Va.. today for at least 10 days because tem peratures were too high in the chamber designed to keep them alive in orbit.

title: Australia and New Zealand Dominate Title Rowing Trials
description: COLLINGSWOOD, N..T., Aug. 21Forced to borrow boats be cause their shells had been flown to Hong Kong while their oars had landed in Florida, Australia's sweepswingers, nev ertheless, enjoyed a highly suc cessful showing today.

title: DANIEL D. HALPIN, A TV PIONEER, 64
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Aug. 21 Daniel D. Halpin, a television pioneer and manager of the last football team coached by Knute Rockne at the University of Notre Dame. died in his home at 125 Gates Avenue to day. He was 64 years old.

title: Hall, Indiana Star, Sets World Mark In 400Meter Swim
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 21 Once, Mark Spitz was a prob lem child.

title: Cox, Mrs. Hilton Capture Handicap Shooting Titles
description: VANDALIA, Ohio, Aug. 21 (UPI)  Raymond Cox of Bat tle Creek, Mich., broke 98 at 100 targets from the 23yard line to win the handicap event on the first preliminary day of the 71st annual Grand American trapshooting tourna ment today.

title: CONTINENTAL AIDS DINERS CLUB LOAN
description: Diners' Club, Inc., the big credit card company that this week reported a loss of $29.1 million for the fiscal year ended March 31, has negotiated a $150million refinancing of its bank debt  but only after the Continental Corporation, the giant insurance holding com pany that owns 88 per cent of its stock, guaranteed repayment of the loan.

title: Phoenician City of Iron Age Unearthed in Lebanon
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 21 The ancient Phoenician city of Sarepta has been unearthed halfway between Tyre and Sidon on the coast of Lebanon:

title: Film on Africa at Criterion Was Shown Here in '67
description: Africa Blood and Guts, which opened at the Criterion Theater yesterday, was seen here in 1967 under the title Africa Addio.

title: North Korea Reports Killing
description: TOKYO, Aug. 21 (UPI)The North Korean press agency said today that army sentinels had shot to death an armed spy of the United States aggressor army who infiltrated into North Korea. The report, mon itored here, said sentinels shot the infiltrator when he tried to flee after refusing to heed their orders to stop.

title: Caribia's Removal Is Ordered by Court
description: State Supreme Court Justice Charles G. Tierney directed the owners of the cruise ship Caribia yesterday to remove the illegally parked vessel from a city pier area in the Hudsonl River at 45th Street.

title: Football Transactions
description: AMERICAN CONFERENCE

title: Boggs Warns of a Trade War If Europe and Japan Retaliate
description: PARIS, Aug. 21Representa tive Hale Boggs of Louisiana, a prominent Democratic spokes man on trade problems, warned here today about a possible trade war if Europe or Japan retaliated against the trade bill now before Congress.

title: Lorena Powers Wed in Jersey To Douglas Wood, an Engineer
description: SEA GIRT, N. J., Aug. 21 In the Episcopal Church of St. Uriel the Archangel here this evening, Miss Lorena Ann Powers, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Palmer Powers of Palm Beach, Fla., and Spring Lake, was married to Doug las Duncan Wood, son of Mrs. Jane Wood of Wallkill, N. Y. The Rev. Peter S. Cooke performed the cere mony.

title: Men Now Spotlight of Wig Industry
description: Wigs for men are a hot, new, item in stores across the country  stores that until recently never had con sidered selling men's wigs.

title: Astoria Residents Split Over Con Ed Expansion Plan
description: Residents of the Astoria section of Queens, like public officials, are in wide disagree ment on the plan to expand the Consolidated Edison Com pany plant in Astoria to ease the city's power shortage.

title: CASES OF DIPHTHERIA AT 60 IN SAN ANTONIO
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Aug. 21 (AP)  Confirmed diphtheria cases in San Antonio rose by four today to 60 for the year. Officials said the total could go into the hundreds before the city's epidemic subsided.

title: CrossComplaints By Newsmen Lead To Brawl Arrests
description: Three newsmen were arrested here yesterday, each on the complaint of one of the others, for their alleged roles in the brawl on Thursday at a Correc tions Department news confer ence.

title: U.A.R. Voices Objections
description: CAIRO, Aug. 21The United Arab Republic objects to Unit ed States reconnaissance of the military standstill in the Suez Canal area and considers such activity a very grave matter that could yield intelligence in formation for the Israelis, ac cording to the semiofficial nawspaper Al Ahram.

title: Condors Put 2 on Waivers
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 21 (AP) The Pittsburgh Condors of the American Basketball Asso ciation placed Chico Vaughn, a guard, and Lonnie Lynn, a cen ter, on waivers today.

title: WILLIAM T. M'CULLOUGH
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 21William T. McCullough, former vice president and consultant at Babcock & Wilcox, New York manufacturer of heavy equip ment, died at a hospital here yesterday. He was 76 years old and lived in Scarsdale.

title: Sing Sing Prepares for Tombs Inmates
description: OSSINING, N. Y., Aug. 21Maintenance crews have begun clearing out a cell block and listing repairs needed to handle the transfer of prisoners from overcrowded institutions in New York City to the Ossining Cor rection facility here.

title: Fall River Water Tainted
description: FALL RIVER, Mass., Aug. 21 (UPI)Traces of bacteria have been found in the water supply of some areas of this town and all residents have been urged to boil all water for 10 minutes before using it.

title: U.S. COURT BARS EVICTIONS BY CITY
description: A Federal judge has ordered the city not to evict tenants from two buildings it wants to demolish in the Washington Street Urban Renewal Project in lower Manhattan until it is actually ready to construct new housing there.

title: Highs and Lows
description: Amer Hess Ame Hess pt Am Sugar Atlas Chem Cities Sere Coca Btl NY Con Nat Gas Cont Can wl du Pont

title: Lethal Gas Detected In Georgia in Silage From Blighted Corn
description: GRIFFIN, Ga., Aug. 21 (AP)Farmers are being warned by state agriculture officials about a potentially lethal gas that can be given off by silage made from blighted corn.

title: Fall Elections in Ohio to Test Power of Incumbents
description: AKRON, Ohio  President Nixon's drive to increase sub stantially the number of Repub licans in the House of Represen tatives may find a major obsta cle to success in the increas ing power of incumbency.

title: Chisum Draws Cool Response From Young Buckley Backers
description: EAST MEADOW, L. I., Aug. 21A faithful sidekick urged John Wayne to strap on his sideirons and reestablish him self as bull of the woods at the Jerry Lewis Twin Cinema II here today.

title: MRS. BARBARA LEGGETT
description: Mrs. Barbara Strong Leggett died Wednesday of pneumonia at her home, 944 Park Avenue, at the age of 58. She was the daughter of the late Mrs. Con verse Strong and the late Ben jamin Strong, first Governor of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. Her marriage to John D. Leggett Jr. ended in di vorce.

title: Prosecutor Seeking To Charge Niarchos In His Wife's Death
description: ATHENS, Aug. 21  The public prosecutor of Piraeus said today that he had recom mended that Stavros S. Niar chos, the Greek shipping mil lionaire, be charged with having fatally injured his wife on May 4.

title: LYKES ACQUIRES UNITED FIDELITY; Tender Attracts 90% of Dallas Insurer's Stock
description: The LykesYoungstown Cor poration announced yester day that it had acquired more than 700,000 shares, or about 90 per cent, of the outstanding stock of the United Fidelity Life Insurance Company of Dallas for about $3.5million in cash and $25,250,000 in face value of debentures.

title: New Jersey Man Dies in War
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (UN) The Defense Department an nounced today that Lance Cpl. Charlie W. Taylor, a marine from Pleasantville. N.J., had been killed in the war in Viet nam.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Market Place
description: Put your money on the blue chips.

title: ACCORD IS REACHED WITH STEREOTYPERS
description: The stereotypers early yes terday became the fifth union group to reach a new contract agreement with the city's four major daffy newsnabers.

title: Article 2  No Title
2 Berkey Officers Resign As Directors of Movielab
