description: Benjamin Berkey, president, and Seymour Dunn, vice presi dent and secretary of Berkey Photo, Inc., resigned yesterday as directors of Movielab, Inc., and charged that Movielab was not paying its bills to Berkey. Movielab disputed the charge.

title: CLUB HAS SURPLUS IN WIDE RECEIVERS
description: HEMPSTEAD, LI, Aug. 21 Weeb Ewbank disclosed to day that the Jets were pretty close to two trades that might be consummated after Sunday's exhibition game with their New York rival, the Giants, at the Yale Bowl.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor. On July 29 Assemblyman Peter A. A. Berle held a public hearing to discuss the pro posed construction of a subway route under Central Park and his proposed legislation to amend the public authority law to prohibit open cut con struction in Central Park.

title: Mexico Underground Steam To Run PollutionFree Plant
description: CERRO PRIETO, MexicoOn this broad, dusty plain south of Mexicali, no grimy smog screens out the intense sunlight or blurs the majestic view of the distant Cucapas Mountains.

title: Antiques: For the Writer Who Has Everything
description: John James Audubon's portable desk, just put on display at the NewYork Historical Society, is a fine example of a form often over looked by collectors.

title: Union Miniere Discussing New Venturi in Kinshasha
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 21 (UPI)Union Miniere, S.A., former owner of large copper and cobalt mining properties in the former Belgian Congo, an nounced today that it was ne giotiating with the Government tin Kinshasha on a new mining venture.

title: PHILIPPINE SHIP IS AFIRE IN PACIFIC
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 21 (UPI)  A Philippine ship was afire northwest of here tonight and radioed an SOS that her crew of 40 was unable to con tain the flames.

title: Garage Operator Convicted Of Jeep Attack on Tax Man
description: A federal court jury con victed a Putnam Valley, N. garage operator yesterday afternoon of assaulting a Fed eral tax agent with a jeep as he tried to enforce a delinquent tax levy.

title: PRICES UP AGAIN; RATE OF INFLATION APPEARS TO EASE; Pace Is Half Last Winter's but Officials Still Will Not Term Trend a Victory; JULY INDEX ROSE 0.4%; Orders for Durable Goods Highest Since OctoberRise Here Also 0.4%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21Consumer prices rose again in July but the rate of inflation this summer is apparently only half as great as last winter, the Labor Department reported today.

title: BrooklynBattery Tunnel Getting New Ceiling Tiles
description: A $1,367,000 project to re place missing ceiling tiles in the two tubes of the Brooklyn battery Tunnel is well under way, the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority said yester day.

title: Modest Experiment in Interracial Living
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn.  The East Harlem mothers who got off the 8:39 at the Darien railroad station a few mornings ago, each wearing a pasteon tag that said: Hello, my name is..., looked shy but excited.

title: SAKICHI ISOKAWA
description: OSAKA, Japan, Aug. 21 (AP) Sakichi Isokawa, who was, known as Monjuro Kiritake to thousands of lovers of Bunraku, Japanese puppet theater, died today of liver cancer at the age of 69.

title: Woman Leaves Look to Become Editorial Director of McCall's;
description: The executive editor of Look magazine, Patricia Carbine, has resigned to become editorial director of McCall's, the coun try's biggest women's magazine.

title: CITY ENCOURAGING MORE BIKE RACKS
description: In an effort to encourage people to leave cars at home and ride bicycles to work, the city's Department of Highways began issuing permits this week for bicycle racks in front of buildings.

title: Warsaw Pact Praises BonnMoscow Treaty
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 21  The seven Warsaw Pact nations to day praised the new Soviet West German treaty and pledged their firm intention to step up efforts to strengthen security in Europe.

title: TOLL COLLECTORS RETURN TO WORK
description: Business returned to normal yesterday at the two tunnels and five bridges of the Tri borough Bridge and Tunnel Au thority as toll collectors went back to work after a brief wildcat strike.

title: Reynolds Metals Expands
description: The Reynolds Metals Com pany announced yesterday that it would build a $10million plant in Bristol, Va., to menu facture end pieces for snaptop aluminum beverage cans.

title: ALGERIAN REBELS IN MOVIE CHEERED
description: The ululations of rebel Al gerian women once again re sounded in a New York movie theater and once again they were echoed by the cheers of a mostly youthful audience that has made the film Battle of Algiers something of a cult fetish.

title: KLINE IS WINNER WITH RELIEF HELP
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 21Ron Kilmkowski came in to pitch in the sixth inning after the fire works and Lindy McDaniel entered the game in the ninth before the fireworks.

title: National Guard Receiving RapidFiring Army Rifle
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP) The Army has quietly begun arming the National Guard with its newest rifle, the rapid firing M16, for use in both combat and in putting down civilian disturbances.

title: The $1,000 Large Valise Fades Away
description: Women aren't spending big money on big luggage, said Michael Gordon, presi dent of Koret, as he surveyed a display of his company's new small cases in cut velvet, calf and suede. A set of large luggage by Koret used to cost about $1,000. But every one knows what happens to large valises after a trip in the belly of an aricraft. So the luxury lug gage focus is now turning to carry on pieces. Koret's new cases, priced from about $45 to $95, are also upto date in that most of them are unisex. A man might think twice about the cut velvet versions, but he could hardly fault the suede and calf. The new luggage, rec tangular or tote, comes in three sizes, all of them small enough to bring, aboard the passenger section of a Jet.

title: Israel Reports Cholera Case In Arab Camp at Jerusalem
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 21The Ministry of Health today an nounced that a 30yearold woman living in an Arab refu gee camp in Anata on the out skirts of Jerusalem had con tracted cholera.

title: OldTime Religion Takes on New Tasks
description: ARROWHEAD SPRINGS, CalifThey preach revolu tion, but their biggest sup porters are prosperous busi nessmen and their headquar ters is a luxury hotel at this famed California resort.

title: Composer Marries Mrs. Nina Laurence
description: Mrs. Nina Laurence, daugh ter of Mrs. H. Walter Blu menthal of New York, and Charles F. Sweeney Jr., a composer, were married yes terday afternoon in a civil ceremony at the Kent County Courthouse in Chestertown, Md.

title: Navy, Pointing to Soviet, Seeks 4th Atom Carrier
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 The United States Navy, facing in Soviet naval expansion what it considers the most serious challenge frown another sea power since the German and Japanese buildup before World War II is fighting to build a fourth nuclearpowered aircraft carrier.

title: Liberal Councilmen Call for a Rejection Of Astoria Proposal
description: The City Council's Liberal bloc, reminding Mayor Lindsay, publicly yesterday that they supported him in his reelection campaign, told him that if he kept his campaign pledges he would refuse permits for expan sion of the Consolidated Edison Company's Astoria power plant.

title: Margaret, at 40, Sits for a Somber Portrait
description: LONDON, Aug. 21A som ber and controversial new portrait of Princess Margaret showing her partly blurred before an apparent stark row of bars, was unveiled here today on her 40th birthday.

title: Soviet Ends Hunt for Plane
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 21 (UPI)The Soviet Government offi cially gave up hope today for the crew of the AN22 cargo plane that vanished on July 18 over the North Atlantic and said all 22 persons aboard were presumed dead. The announce ment expressed condolences to relatives of the dead and thanked Western nations for their help in the search. The plane disappeared en route to Peru with relief supplies for earthquake victims.

title: A. A. BARCHIELLI
description: A. A. Barchielli, president and managing director of Moore McCormack Argentine Company, died on Wednesday in Buenos Aires, according to word received yesterday. His age was 59.

title: 3 SIHANOUK AIDES SAID NOT TO EXIST
description: Increasing doubts are being raised whether the three Cam bodian Communist leaders who Prince Norodom Sihanouk says are directing his forces in Cam bodia are alive, or whether they were executed by Prince Sihanouk in 1967.

title: RIEGEL PAPER PLANS PRICE RISE ON OCT. 1
description: The Riegel Paper Corporation announced yesterday that it would raise prices on glassine, greaseproof and specialty pack aging papers by $15 to $20 ton beginning with hsipments Oct. 1.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President met in Mexico with President Gustavo Diaz Ordaz. He re turned to his San Clemente, Calif,. home.

title: State Details Plan To Shift Prisoners; McGrath Objects
description: The state announced plans yesterday to begin shifting 670 sentenced inmates next week to upstate prison cells to ease conditions at the teeming House of Detention for Men in Manhattan.

title: Dr. Theodore Wright, 75, Dies; Leader in Aviation Development
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Aug. 21Dr. Theodore P. Wright a lead er in the development of Ameri can aviation, who served as Civil Aeronautics Administrator from 1944 to 1948, died today of a stroke in Tompkins County Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived at 510 Hanshaw Road.

title: JOHN H. PRINTON, 77, STOCKBROKER, DIES
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Aug. 21 John H. Printon, a partner in the New York Stock Exchange member firm of Vilas & Hickey, died early today in the Hacken sack Hospital following a cere bral vascular accident. He was 77 years old and lived in Ruth erford.

title: Corn Brings Bondage to Many Guatemalan Indians
description: HUEHUETENANGO, Guate mala, Aug. 5The Indian farm ers who hoe the hillsides here in the highlands of northwest ern Guatemala are kept in vir tual bondage by their meager output of corn.

title: ERVIN PROVOKES WOMEN'S GROUP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug 21 (AP)  Women's rights enthusiasts, on the verge of winning a 47yearlong congressional battle, worked today to counter a move they say would cripple their cause.

title: DOW SURGES 15.81 ON RISING VOLUME
description: The stock market scored a stunning advance yesterday as favorable pieces of news fitted suddenly and dramatically into gear.

title: Tigers McLain Pitches Route
description: DETROIT, Aug. 22 (UPI)Jim Northrup keyed a threerun first inning with a runscoring double and later belted his 22d homer and Denny McLain went the distance for the first time this season today as the Detroit Tigers defeated the Milwaukee Brewers, 52.

title: Rhidian Morgan Weds Miss Martha Wheeler
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 22St. Bartholomew's Epis copal Church was the set ting here this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Martha Hale Wheeler, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. William Au gustus Kilner Wheeler, to Rhidian Morrow Morgan Morgan, a 1970 graduate of the Columbia Law School.

title: Virginia Training Plan Working
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 22 About 85 per cent of the 15,000 persons training for jobs in Virginia industry by the Special Training Division of the State Department of Community Colleges since 1966 now are employed in Virginia.

title: Calendar of Dog Show Events
description: Great Barrington K.C. allbreed and obedience, Butternut Basin, Route 23, Great Barrington, Mass.; 1,191 entries; 9 A.M.

title: Miss Lillian Moss Stauffacher Is Bride of Brewster T. Gillies
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 22  In Christ Episcopal Church here at noon today, Miss Lillian Moss Stauffacher and Brewster Towl Gillies, 1968 graduates of Rollins Col lege, were married by the Rev. Franklin K. Robinson.

title: Times Square Finds Erotica Has Impact
description: The steady expansion of shops and theaters spe cializing in erotica in the Times Square area is caus ing concern among investors and owners interested in the district's longterm prospects as a theater and office center.

title: Agnew: Still on The Attack On Nixon's Behalf
description: LOS ANGELES  They called him the Republican party's lightning rod, the target of bolts of Democratic anger and frus tration, the man who, at the President's request, took on the role of White House political spokesman with such vengeance that even some in his own party cautioned against his inflamma tory rhetoric. He was, after all, coming close to accusing im portant leaders of the opposition of harboring sinister  perhaps even traitorous  designs.

title: Ceylon Keeps a Close Watch On Revolutionary Movement
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Aug. 22 The National Security Coun cil of Ceylon, the agency for internal security, is keeping a continuous watch on a new movement known as the Peo nie's Liberation Front.

title: FOSTER CAPTURES U.S. THISTLE TITLE
Miss Ann Clark Tevepaugh Is Bride
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 22Miss Ann Clark Tevepaugh, assistant program editor for the Boston Symphony Or chestra, was married here today to Jerrold Ian Wolf Mitchell, a vice president of the Wellington Management Company,. the investment advisers in Boston.

title: MISS WILKINSON WINS IN U.S. GOLF
description: DARIEN, Conn., Aug. 22Martha Wilkinson, 21 years old, from Whittier, Calif., won the 70th annual United States Golf Association's women's amateur championship today by defeat ing Cynthia Hill of St. Peters burg, Fla., 3 and 2, in the 36 hole final over the Wee Burn Country Club course.

title: The Man Who Beat the System
description: He is inflexible in his aims and relentless in his determina tion. Like a true revolutionary, he has sacrificed the pleasures of society and the comforts of family life. He lives in a fur nished room. He keeps his tele phone unlisted and changes the number every few months. He meets his contacts in public places and in modest restau rants. He is determined to change America, and his work is his life.

title: Bankers Urged to Weigh Charges of Political Bias
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22, (AP) The American Bankers As sociation has been urged to in vestigate banks accused of po litical discrimination against student loanseekers.

title: Is the Art World Heading for a Nervous Breakdown?
description: PERHAPS at no time since World War II has the imminent on set of a New York art season presented as joyless and uncertain a prospect as it does this year. In place PERHAPS at no time since World War II has the imminent on set of a New York art season presented as joyless and uncertain a prospect as it does this year. In place of the usual mood of anx ious optimism, an aura of cynicism, gloom and trucu lence pervades the local art world, which, though traditionally a somewhat hys terical milieu, has rarely ap peared so thoroughly disor ganized and disenchanted. Two obvious causes of this malaise are the expectation of unprecedented political militance on the part of ar tists and the shaky state of the economy.

title: The Week in Finance:
description: AMERICAWATCHERS in such places as Moscow's twoyearold Institute of the U. S. A. must be perplexed at times at the diversity of official opinion in the United States.

title: Andrews, 15, in Star Sloop, Scores on Corrected Time
description: CENTERPORT, L. I., Aug. 22  Fifteenyearold Jonathan Andrews, sailing a Star Class sloop for the first time, won the sixth annual OneofaKind regatta, conducted by the Cen terport Yacht Club today.

title: New FishMeal Producer Also Fights Pollution
description: VERO BEACH, Fla., Aug. 22  New pollutioncontrol equipment that converts fish, crab and shrimp waste into fish meal is expected to be a partial solution to Quebec's sea and bay pollution prob lem.

title: U.S. Gives Saigon More Rice
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 22 (Reuters)The United States will give South Vietnam 150,000 tons of rice worth $25 million under a new agreement signed in Saigon today. The rice is being donated under the Food for Peace program and is the second 150,000ton rice gift this Year.

title: Dissident Priests in Milan Assail Church Leadership
description: MILAN, Italy, Aug. 22Dis sident Roman Catholic priests and laymen in Milan have pub lished a long attack on the leadership of the Church here, charging it with ecclesiastical conservatism and a bias in favor of big business at the ex pense of the poor.

title: Coming Wednesday
description: This is not a war to be fought in the bedroom, but in the city, in the political arena.BETTY FRIEDAN, in a speech last March 20 in Des Plaines, Ill., calling for a 24 hour general strike by women.

title: Integration Delay Asked
description: RALEIGH, N. C. Aug. 22 (AP)Bob Scott, C., of North Carolina, has asked Chief Justice of the United States Warren E. Burger to give favorable consideration to delaying a district court judge's desegregation order for the CharlotteMecklenburg County school system, the state's largest.

title: James Reed to Wed Mary Linda Bopp
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., Aug. 22The engagement of Miss Mary Linda Bopp, a 1970 graduate of Smith College, to James Keel Reed, a senior at Amherst College, has been announced by Mr. and Mrs. Walter S. Bopp, parents of the future bride. Her fiance is the son of Mrs. Fred T. Reed of Woodstown, N. J., and the late Dr. Reed, who was head of the Aerosol Prod ucts Division of E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Co.

title: W. H. Hutson Weds Miss Sweeney
description: MARION, Mass., Aug. 22Miss Susan Varden Sweeney, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert V. Sweeney, was mar ried here today in the Wick enden Chapel of Tabor Academy to William Halsey Hutson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank A. Hutson Jr. of Essex Fells, N. J., and Little Comp ton. R. I.

title: Dance
description: AT THE height of a cock tail party, Jane Dud ley and I were hav ing a serious conver sation about dance. Jane did especially important work in the modern dance movement of the thirities and forties. And these daysshe saidit seemed to her that very little dance reflected social or political issues or even personal emotion. She won dered why the choreograph ers were so negative, what they were retreating from. I argued a little, went home and thought a lot. And these daysshe saidit seemed to her that very little dance reflected social or political issues or even personal emotion. She won dered why the choreograph ers were so negative, what they were retreating from. I argued a little, went home and thought a lot.

title: Anda, Pianist of Madigan Film, Makes His Debut as Conductor
description: Geza Anda is a lucky man.

title: Serkin Will Play 4 Recitals Instead of the 8 Advertised
description: The Judd Concert Artists Bu reau has announced that Rudolf Serkin will play only four of the eight recitals of Beethoven's piano sonatas originally an nounced for presentation at Carnegie Hall next season and advertised on Page 12 of Sec tion 2 in today's New York Times.

title: Rep. Murphy Files to Run On Line of Second Party
description: Representative John M. Murphy, Staten Island Demo crat, filed petitions with the Board of Elections yesterday seeking to place him on the line of the Civil ServiceInde pendents party as well as on that of his own party.

title: Stricter Test Is Urged For Drunken Drivers
description: ALBANY, Aug. 22 (UPI)  State Senator John D. Caemmerer, Republican of Nassau County and chair man of the Senate Commit tee on Motor Vehicles, will propose legislation next year to lower the amount of al cohol in the blood needed to sustain a drunkdriving con viction.

title: The lesser breed is the culprit
description: Gail Sheehy's Lovesounds is an angry book about a wo man whose wifeliness approxi mates disease. Gwyn Meath encounters her husband like a Dutch housewife attacking a filthy floor. She sets out to be Superwife: she lovingly pushes him through law school, she writes his briefs in a prose more scintillating than any he can manage, she bakes her own pies, and, yes, she has a career of her own, a marvelous figure, and much lan in bed. She even has a child, appar ently to convince her friends that she is not, to use that dreaded phrase, a career wo man. In short, she questions none of the old female roles, but she appears to loathe all of them. She even has a child, appar ently to convince her friends that she is not, to use that dreaded phrase, a career wo man. In short, she questions none of the old female roles, but she appears to loathe all of them.

title: PLANE HELPS TO CURB FIRE ON STORM KING
description: CORNWALL, N.Y., Aug. 22Flying a converted World War II torpedo bomber, state forest rangers today dumped thou sands of gallons of catchup colored chemical over a forest fire atop Storm King Mountaim in the Hudson Highlands.

title: Engagements
description: LERNERWENOGRADMr. and Mrs. David Wenograd announce the engagement of their daughter Linda to Mr. Steve Lerner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Lerner on

title: PERCIVAL JACKSON, LAWYER, IS DEAD
description: Percival E. Jackson, an author and a corporation lawyer, who had been active in utility re organizations, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, on a visit to Harwich Port, Mass. He was 79 years old and lived at 20 Farmstead Lane, Brook ville, L.I.

title: Minicomputers Bought
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 22 (UPI)Cincinnati Milacron, Inc. has received an order for 237 of its recently introduced minicomputers from the El dorado Electrodata Corpora tion, Concord, Calif.

title: IRVING JAY FAIN, RIGHTS LEADER, 64
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Aug. 22Irving Jay Fain, an industrialist and retail merchant who was a leader in the field of interna tional trade, Reform Judaism and civil rights, died today in Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston. He was 64 years old.

title: Article 2  No Title
News Summary and Index
description: Senator J. W. Fulbright, chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, of fered yesterday to press for an American guarantee of Israel's 1967 borders if Israel promised not to violate those borders. Mr. Fulbright, in the text of a speech on the Middle East, also called on the United Na tions Security Council to impose a Middle East settlement if talks between Israel and the Arabs failed. [Page 1, Col. 1; Text, P. 22.]

title: Subway Study Unit Head Here Concerned About Riders Panic
description: Alarmed by what he called the human reaction in sub way accidents, the chairman of the Mayor's Subway Service Watchdog Committee said yesterday that public panic may be more of a threat than the equipment failures.

title: Sandra Yarrow Becomes Bride Of William Rueb
description: OLD LYME, Conn., Aug. 22Miss Sandra Ann Yar row, a 1970 graduate of the Catholic University of Amer ica in Washington, and Wil liam Gerald Rueb, a phys icist with the Defense De partment's Harry Diamond Laboratories there, were mar ried here this morning in Christ the King Roman Cath olic Church.

title: Margo Harder Is Bride in Jersey
description: MILFORD, N. J., Aug. 22In the First Presbyterian Church of Milford today, Miss Margo Harder, a descendant of Alfred Vail, inventor and partner of Samuel F. B. Morse, was married to Richard Michael Lawless, who heads R. M. Lawless Real Estate, Inc., in Norwood, Mass.

title: James F. Davis Fiance Of Patricia A. Hewson
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Hewson of the Bronx have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Patricia Ann Hewson, to James F. Davis, son of Lieut. Comdr. Paul L. Davis, U.S.N., retired, and Mrs. Davis of Media, Pa. The wedding is planned for Aug. 7. 1971.

title: Child to the Hoffmans
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Peter A. Hoff man on Aug. 2 at Mount Sinai Hospital. Mr. Hoffman is a principal with Haskins & Sells, certified public ac countants. Mrs. Hoffman, the former Miss Linda Rosen field, is a senior planner for the city's Department of Social Services. The child has been named Trade Lee.

title: Delfour Replaces Noverraz as Cup Skipper for France
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 22 (UPI)Baron Marcel Bich, head of the French America's Cup syndicate, changed his skipper and crew today for Monday's second race in the series against Australia.

title: Cosmos 359 Launched
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 22 (AP)The Soviet Union today launched Cosmos 359, its fifth unmanned earth satellite this month in a topsecret program. The craft, whose purpose was identified only as scientific, was put into an orbit with a high point of 565 miles and a low point of 130 and angled to the earth at 51.5 degrees.

title: WARD WINS RACE FOR PONY CARS
description: TALLADEGA, Ala., Aug. 22 (AP)Bill Ward, an Alabama insurance executive making only the third start in a career that began when he was 35, drove a Mustang to victory to day in the Bama 200 for NASCAR Grand American cars at Alabama International Speedway.

title: Strike Shuts 2 Ohio Papers
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ohio, Aug. 22 (AP)Local 55 of the Stereo typers and Electrotypers Union struck Springfield Newspapers, Inc., last night, leaving this city of 84,000 without its two daily newspapers. The strike shut down the morning Springfield Sun and afternoon Springfield News.

title: Women's Job Curb Lifted
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Aug. 22 (UPI)  A United States dis trict judge has overturned 61yearold Illinois law prohib iting women from working more than eight hours a day at most jobs. Judge Homer Poos ruled that the statute vio lated Federal civil rights laws that ban discrimination on the basis of sex in hiring prac tices.

title: WomanhoodDay'Urged To Counter Women's Lib
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 22 (AP)A mother of eight is promoting Sept. 30 as a na tional Celebration of Wom anhood Daypartly to coun teract the women's libera tion movement's Strike Day on Aug. 26.

title: Court Session to Be Held At San Quentin Tomorrow
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., Aug. 22 (AP)Court will be held Monday for the first time be hind the walls of the 118yearold San Quentin Prison.

title: There...stood the house
description: No woman in her forties can afford to marry the wrong person or the wrong house. May Sarton, the essayist, poet and novelist, hoped she had chosen wisely when she moved some 12 years ago from a bustling life in Cambridge, Mass., to live alone in a house she had just bought in a small New Hampshire village. As furnishings, she brought with her things that were as much memory as articles of comfort and decoration. A few years ago, she wrote a book about her experiences, Plant Dreaming Deep (W. W. Norton & Co.), from which these quotations are taken.

title: Oen Triumphs in Y.R.A. Shields Class and Peet Scores in Etchells22 Group
description: RYE, N. Y., Aug. 22Hans J. Ooen sailed Dainty to his first Shields Class victory of the campaign on Long Island Sound today and E. Chester Peet Jr. won for the second time with the Etchells22 sloop, Cymbal. They triumphed in a fleet of 138, the second largest of the Yacht Racing Association championship sea son that raced in erratic breezes under the sponsorship of the American Yacht Club.

title: Suzanne Belmont Morristown Bride
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Aug. 22Miss Suzanne N. Bel mont, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul N. Belmont of Mantaloking, and Daniel P. McGovern Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. McGovern of Chatham, were married here today in the chapel of the Delbarton School. The ceremony was performed by Abbot Martin Byrne of St. Mary's (Roman Catholic) Abbey here, who was assisted by the bride's uncle, the Rev. Ralph L. Minker, pastor of the Eld brooke Methodist Church in Washington.

title: PORNOGRAPHY CURBS URGED BY MITCHELL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (UPI)Attorney General John N. Mitchell said today that he would continue to seek strong measures to curb pornography.

title: Those Were the Days, My Friend
description: BAR HARBOR, Me.The houses of the very rich seem to have a powerful fasci nation for us common folk. One more has opened here for tourists this sum mer: Sonogee, the sevenacre estate once owned by radio tycoon Arthur Atwater Kent. The mansion and its gardens join Bar Harbor's gallery of reminders of an era of gracious livinggracious, espe cially, for those whose bank statements stretched out into several zeros. The estate is only remaining open, however, through the end of September (9 A.M. to 9 P.M. this month, 9 A.M. to 5 P.M. next).

title: Dorileo Takes $56,350 William Penn by Two Lengths in Liberty Bell Final
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 22Biding his time while the favor ites, Distinctive and Mr. Clinch, battled for the lead, Michael G. Phipps's Dorileo made his move with an eighth of a mile to go and captured the $56,350 William Penn Handicap by two lengths today at Liberty Bell.

title: HIGH COURT GETS INTEGRATION TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP)  The Nixon Administration asked the Supreme Court yes terday to accept for review a, challenge to the Federal Gov ernment's plan for desegregat ing public schools in Mobile, Ala.

title: Korean Bus Plunge Kills 25
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 22 (Reuters)Twentyfive per sons were killed last night when a bus plunged 130 feet over a cliff on the SeoulPusan hiehway about 120 miles south of Seoul. Twentytwo other per sons were injured, some seri ously, the police said.

title: City May Give Exemptions From New Sex Bias Law,
description: The City Commission of Hu man Rights is accepting re quests from hotels and resi dences that serve only one sex and from barbers and hair dressers for exemptions to the new city law barring sex dis crimination in public accom modations.

title: Oak Brook Polo Club Seeks 6th Title Today
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 22 (UPI) Oak Brook, III., will seek its sixth national 20goal polo championship today against the Tulsa Polo Club in the final of the United States Polo Association's 70th annual tournament.

title: PYONGYANG BARS UNIFICATION PLAN
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 22 North Korea rejected today the recent proposal of President Chung Hee Park of South Korea for peaceful steps toward uni fication of Korea and said the proposal was full of falsehood and swindle.

title: Firebirds Vanquish Bulls In Preseason Game, 2314
description: POTTSTOWN, Pa., Aug. 22The Pennsylvania Firebirds, Atlantic Coast Football League defending champions scored in every period tonight to turn back the Long Island Bulls, 2314. It was the Firebirds sec ond straight preseason victory and the first defeat in two starts for the Bulls.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Miss Schrorn Has Nuptials
description: BIRMINGHAM, Mich., Aug. 22  Miss Rebecca Ann Schrom and Robert E. Dewar Jr. were married here this afternoon in the First Presby terian Church by the Rev. Charles Sommers.

title: Foggy Note Wins by Length In Rockingham Handicap
description: SALEM, N.H., Aug. 22 (AP)Frank Turner's Foggy Note won the $21,725 Princess Doreen Handicap today at Rockingham Park before a crowd of 14,504.

title: Dale Fischer Engaged
description: Miss Fischer is a graduate of Boston University and her fiance of Hofstra University.

title: Factorybuilt Houses Strive for Foothold
Vietnam 1: Saigon's Troops Much Improved
description: SAIGONEarly in 1969, when the Nixon Administration was minting the word Vietnamiza tion, top American advisors in South Vietnam would argue that their job was to upgrade the Saigon armed forces enough to defend the people not against the North Vietnamese Army, but rather against the Vietcong.

title: Chicago's Mile Is Enhanced
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 22  The status of the socalled Mag nificent Mile as one of the finest fashion shopping cen ters in the nation is being enhanced by recent develop ments including the an nouncement that Marshall Field & Co. plans a major store there.

title: New Probes to Solve The Mystery of Venus
description: Some of the space age's rich est scientific dividends have been the surprising findings of Soviet and American instrument carrying rockets sent to Venus in the past decade. The excite ment generated by this new in formation explains the wide spread approval from the world's scientific community of the news last week that Mos cow had launched still another unmanned spaceship toward Earth's nearest planetary neigh bor.

title: Article 1  No Title
Indonesian Reaches Soviet
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 22 (AP)Foreign Minister Adam Maiik of Indonesia arrived in Moscow tonight to begin another round of talks on repayment of Indo nesia's $800million debt in the Soviet Union.

title: The Guess Who in Central Park: A Show Worth Staying Up For
description: The Guess Who became the Guess Where on Friday eve ning. For three hours an audi ence of 2,500 sat patiently in the Wollman Rink in Central Park waiting for the Canadian rock group to begin a Schaefer Music Festival performance scheduled for 7:30. Meanwhile, the five members of the group were backstage wondering what had become of their mu sical equipment and amplifiers.

title: Women's Lacrosse Team BritainBound
description: Tonight at 10:20 a group of young women, school teachers and students, will leave Philadelphia Airport for a nineweek tour of the British Isles.

title: Elizabeth Cay Plans Nuptials
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 22Miss Elizabeth Mason Cay, a sec retary in the economic de velopment department of the Atlanta Chamber of Com merce, and Edwin Yarbrough Hines, a stockbroker with White Weld & Co. here, plan to be married in November.

title: Casper's 208 Leads Avco Golf As 4 Players Trail by Stroke
description: SUTTON, Mass., Aug. 22Billy Casper retained the lead in the $160,000 Avco Golf Clas sic today by a stroke with a 54hole total of 208.

title: 47 Seized as Police Raid Alleged AfterHours Clubs
description: The police arrested 47 per sons and said then confiscated a 22caliber pistol and small quantities of alcoholic bever ages and narcotics early yester day in raids on two alleged afterhours clubs on the West Side.

title: An elegiac ending to C. P. Snow's 11novel cycle
description: Each season some novels are touted as literary occasions. The designation generally wears badly. Last Things, however, based upon contemporary happenings, both public and personal, which the author could not have im agined when his novelcycle was be gun in 1940, is a genuine literary event, for with it C. P. Snow has brought to a conclusion the 11novel Strangers and Brothers sequence, which has been 30 years in the mak ing and which is likely to remain one of the major literary documents of our time.

title: Silent Majority Grows By Two in Clay Family
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 22 (UPI)Muhammad Ali, also known as Cassius Clay, feels that maybe he needs a son to help him offset the wom en in his family, whose num ber was increased last night when his wife, Belinda, gave birth to twin daughters.

title: Spotlight:
description: How I miss those crap shooters. Since the specula tors have nearly all left the market, my commissions from issues traded on the American Stock Exchange have fallen almost to noth ing.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: GIBSON'S 2HITTER BEATS PADRES, 70
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 22 (AP)Bob Gibson tossed a twohitter for his six straight victory, leading the St. Louis Cardinals to a 70 decision over the San Diego Padres tonight.

title: Panther Trial: Who Gave The Order For Murder?
description: NEW HAVENEarly in June of last year, a young Black Panther from Connecticut, by way of North Carolina and New Jersey, walked into a Western Union office in Salt Lake City, where he hoped to find a money order that would enable him to finish a trip to the party's na tional headquarters in California. Instead, he found a halfdozen agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation waiting to take him into custody in connection with a murder near here that was ob scure in its motivation and is likely to remain so.

title: GREEN POWER GAINS ETCHELLS22 HONORS
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Aug. 22Woody Greenberg and Dennis Powers's Green Power captured Etcheils22 Class hon ors this afternoon as 83 boats sailed with the Knickerbocker Yacht Club in the Cow Bay Area, Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound compe tition.

title: Inside the Third Reich
description: Albert Speer, Hitler's gifted Min ister of Armaments and War Pro duction, was tried like other Na tional Socialist leaders at Nuremberg in 1946. But unlike his codefen dants he freely admitted his guilt. He took full responsibility for the slavelabor battalions in his factor ies, and for collaborating with the S.S. which provided him concentra tioncamp prisoners. Moreover, he voluntarily assumed a measure of guilt for all of Hitler's measures, in cluding the crimes. Who else is to be held responsible for the course of events, he told his judges, if not the closest associates around the Chief of State?... I have this ob ligation all the more since the chief of government has withdrawn from his responsibility to the German peo ple and to the world.

title: Snead Leads by 7 Shots
description: CLENDENIN, W.Va., Aug. 22 (UPI)Sam Snead scored a one underpar 69 today for a 36 hole total of 134 and a seven stroke lead with one round to go in the West Virginia open golf championship. Kenney Bo wen, a former Marshall Univer sity golfer from South Charles ton, W.Va., was second with a 70 and a total of 141.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: One Corner of the Earth Where Falconry Survives
description: HALKIRK, ScotlandHov ering above the dark moor and above the pointing setter, the two peregrine falcons waited for another dog, a spaniel, to flush the covey of grouse.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: Men and machines have started digging a hole on Second Avenue from which a 50story office tower will soon rise.

title: Press Vet of 1970 Named

description: Under the National Collegiate Athletic Association control plan, the American Broadcasting Company (Ch. 7 in New York) Will televise games on 14 dates. All games will be televised in color.

title: K. D. Archer Weds Barbara E. Clark
description: Miss Barbara Elizabeth Clark, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth B. Clark of Lincoln, Neb., was married here yesterday afternoon to Kenneth Davidson Archer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin A. Archer of Houston. State Supreme Court Justice Myles J. Lane performed the cere mony at the St. RegisShera ton.

title: Son to the Schmollings
description: A son was born at the New Rochelle Hospital on Aug. 5 to Dr. and Mrs. Paul Schmolling Jr. Mrs. Schmol ling is the former Miss Patricia Elaine Sergine of New Rochelle.

Wil liam Haggin Perry's color bearer, ridden by Jacinto Vas quez, covered the course in 2 minutes 1 second, beating the previous mark by threefifths of a second. The achievement, rather unexpected, paid $26 for $2.

title: Bahamas Push Campaign To Meet Tourist Complaints
description: NASSAU, New Providence Island, the BahamasThis picturesque island re sort, which in the 1880's inspired Winslow Homer and in the 1940's was haven for the Duke and Duchess of Windsor, today continues to draw vast hordes of visitors. The Nassau water front still boasts its clutch of cruise ships... its lines of colorful tourist filled surreys... its crowds of bargain hunters stocking up on Daks slacks and dutyfree liquor in Bay Street stores.

title: PACKERS DEFEAT COWBOYS BY 3534
description: DALLAS, Aug. 22 (AP)Green Bay's Dave Hampton bulled across from 4 yards out with 1 minute 54 seconds left tonight and Booth Lusteg kicked the extra point to give the Packers a 3534 preseason vic tory over the Dallas Cowboys before a sellout srowd of 72,389 in the Cotton Bowl.

title: Mao Makes the Trials Run on Time
description: HONG KONG.

title: DEATH OF SHAH'S FOE IN IRAQ IS REPORTED
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 22 (AP)  Gen. Taymour Bakhtiar of Iran, an opponent of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi, has been assassinated while on a hunting trip in Iraq, the news paper Al Nahar reported today.

title: For Young Readers
description: Unlike most artityourself books, this one is common sensical and unpatronizing in tone and conveys essential in formation without over instructing. The book touches not only on the conventional methods of collagei.e., the assembling of diverse materials into a unified composition on a flat surfacebut on such off beat variations as flagand banner making. It also deals imaginatively with three dimensional construction, rang ing from boxmaking  la Jo seph Cornell to the Calder method of using wire to draw in space. not only on the conventional methods of collagei.e., the assembling of diverse materials into a unified composition on a flat surfacebut on such off beat variations as flagand banner making. It also deals imaginatively with three dimensional construction, rang ing from boxmaking  la Jo seph Cornell to the Calder method of using wire to draw in space.

title: CHANGES ARE FEW IN N.C.A.A. RULES
description: The National Collegiate Ath letic Association's Football Rules Committee hardly touch ed the rules this year, making only a few minor changes for the second consecutive season.

title: Letter
description: To THE FINANCIAL EDITOR:

title: Manning and Plunkett Are Top Heisman Candidates
description: Archie Manning of Missis sippi and Jim Plunkett of Stan ford, quarterbacks with con trasting styles, enter the 1970 football season as the most notable candidates for the Heisman Trophy, which is given each year to the out standing college player.

title: U.S. Business:
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 22  In addition to the old bugaboos of imports and labor troub les, small steel producers are becoming increasingly con cerned over what is happen ing to yet another side of their business.

title: 5 AFRICAN DOCTORS QUIT U.S. PROGRAM
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 22 (UPI)Charging that they had never received a meaningful apol ogy from the State Department, five African doctors withdrew yesterday from a medical train ing program at the National Center for Disease Control.

title: Oil: Policy Switch Retains Quotas
description: WASHINGTON  The Govern ment made a decision last week in the politically sensitive area of oil, and there was a more or less automatic assumption that the reason was politicalspecifi cally to help some Republicans.

title: Patty L. Shipman. Bride Of John Severinghaus
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Aug. 22The Scarsdile Congrega tional Church was the set ting this afternoon for the marriage of Miss Patty Lee Shipman, who was graduated this year from Smith College in an accelerated threeyear program, to John Merrill Severinghaus, a student at the Columbia University Col lege of Physicians and Sur geons.

title: FumeFree '75's
description: The Senate subcommittee on Air and Water Pollu tion has approved a difficult but essential target date for introducing lowPollution automobiles: the 1975 models. It is an ambitious timetable for Detroit to meet; it will cost the Federal Government nearly a halfbillion dollars for research, and it will raise the price of new cars by many hundreds of dollars.

title: Vietnam 2: A Quiet Campaign For Seats In Senate
description: SAIGON  They're off and walking in South Vietnam's Sen atorial election, the last signifi cant countrywide balloting be fore the Presidential election in fall 1971.

title: Conservation Group And the Girl Scouts Team Up in Georgia
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 22 (UPI)Georgia conservationists and Girl Scouts joined this week in an effort to save a natural for est area just over the state line in North Carolina from logging by the United States Forest Service.

title: Rise in Pollution Helping to Drive Many Americans to Drink (Bottled Water)
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 22When John Wedburg's mother inlaw came here from Nebraska recently to look over her new grandchild, she talked a lot about how good the water was back home.

title: BODY IS IDENTIFIED AS GENERAL'S CHILD
description: KENNEBUNK, Me., Aug. 22 (AP)The decomposed body of a young girl who apparently had been strangled to death was found hidden in an unused barn here today. The authori ties tentatively identified her as Mary Olenchuk, daughter of Brig. Gen. Peter Olenchuk.

title: Sarah Stanton, Teacher, Wed
description: SOUTH DARTMOUTH, Mass., Aug. 22Miss Sarah Francis Stanton, daughter of Mrs. Newell 0. Mason of Summit, N. J., and Nonquitt and the late Otis C. Stanton, was married here this after noon to Jack Hasted, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Hasted of Hornchurch, Englatid.

title: Job Changes:
description: The Metropolitan Life In surance Company has an nounced the appointment of Chester L. Fisher Jr., as vice president and director of ur ban and environmental af fairs on Sent. 1.

title: Stinebring and Miss Flock Take Trapshoot Doubles
description: VANDALIA, Ohio, Aug. 22 (UPI)  Morris Stinebring of Thawville, Ill., shattered 99 of 100 clay targets in a heavy rain today to win the doubles championship on the second preliminary day to the 71st an nual Grand American transhoot tournament here.

title: HealthforPeace Cut
description: The battle of the budget con tinues in Congress with a heat that rivals the Washington temperature in August.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: EUGENE E. BEST
description: Eugene E. Best, director of curriculum and instruction for the Northern Valley Regional Schools in Bergen, N. J., died Friday of a heart attack in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 39 years old and lived at 34 Charles Place, Old Tappan, N. J.

title: The Most Loathsome Film of All?
description: YOU do not have to be a drug addict, peder ast, sado masochist or nitwit to enjoy Performance, but being one or more of those things would help. Performance is one of that new breed of movies that do not try to win you over by wit, serious ness, humor, plot, charac terization, logic, dialogue or any other such outmoded paraphernalia. Instead, the film is built upif anything so slapped together can be said to be builtfrom shocks piled on shocks. Not sur prises, which are a time honored device; not titilla tions, equally established though somewhat less hon orable; and not even shocks in the sense of bouts of hon esttogoodness indignation. Rather, the film progresses by what I imagine a series of electroshocks to be like, but a shock treatment ad ministered not by a therapist but by a misprogrammed computer.

title: THE BIG TEN ON BROADWAY
Alice Martel Plans Bridal
description: Miss Alice Florence Martel, a programer here with Has kins & Sells, the accounting firm, and Joseph Donald Wes satamper, a principal there, plan to be married in Sep tember.

title: Hansen and Whitney Win Power Boat Regatta Titles
description: BELOIT, Wis., Aug. 22 (UPI) Bruce Hansen of Oshkosh, Wis., and Bernard Whitney of Enfield, Conn., piloted their boats to championships in the finals of the American Power Boat Association's champion ship regatta today.

title: SOUTH AFRICA HIT By BIG DROUGHT
description: CAPETOWN, Sunday, Aug. 22 The South African Army has been called in to help fight what agricultural leaders and economists regard as the country's worst drought in memory.

title: Tropical Storm Abates; Death Toll Rises to 39
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Aug. 22 (UPI)  Tropical storm Dorothy was downgraded to a tropical depression today after killing at least 39 per sons in a deadly sweep across the Caribbean Islands of Martinique and Dominica.

description: ONTARIO, Calif., Aug. 22 (UPI)Mark Donohue of Media, Pa., turned in the fastest lap of the first day of practice over the new Ontario Motor Speed way course today when he drove his Turbo Ford 165.14 miles an hour.

title: YUGOSLAVS SEEK COMPUTER AIDES
description: BELGRADE. Yugoslavia, Aug. 22 (UPI)Yugoslavia's move into the computer age is caus ing some headaches.

title: Recession: A New Style of Life
description: It may be the new car that wasn't bought, or the new furniture or the new clothes, or it may be a whole series of little sacrifices like more tele vision and fewer evenings out, but whatever he has had to give up, the affluent American is no longer the freespending fellow he once was. His life style has changed with the economy.

title: Bicycle Summaries

title: New York A.C. Oarsmen Take Three Events in U.S. Title Rowing
description: COLLINGSWOOD, N. J., Aug. 22Three victories by New York Athletic Club oarsmen and a wellconceived one by a New Zealand unit featured the na tional rowing championships third day of competition on the Cooper River today.

title: Broad Wall Mentioned in Bible Found on Bedrock in Jerusalem
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 22Remains of the broad wall mentioned in the Biblical description of the restoration of Jerusalem's fortifications after the return of the Jews from Babylonian exile have been unearthed by Israeli archeologists.

title: Act of Bravery Clears Way For War Veteran to Marry
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 22 (AP)Roger Penwell's act of bravery has put money in his bank account and cleared the way for him to marry his girl friend, Nancy.

title: Tax Action On Schools
description: In the current phase of the desegregation struggle in the South, the Internal Revenue Service has been under criticism from civil rights groups. The I.R.S. has been granting tax exempt status to private schools if they will declare publicly that they do not have a policy of racial segregation. Critics charge that this leaves too much op portunity for deception on the part of private white academies that have proliferated in the South in reaction to progress in desegregation in the public schools. The I.R.S. has replied that deception would lead to private complaints and litigation and, where justified, revocations of tax exemption.

title: SCARSDALE PLANS HELP FOR YOUTHS
description: SCARSDALE, Aug. 22This community's approach to drug education uses noneducators to talk about many problems besides drugs.

title: Mrs. Court Trounces Miss Walkden, 61, 60, for Pennsylvania Tennis Crown
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 22Mrs. Margaret Court of Aus tralia won the Pennsylvania lawn tennis championship today for the second successive year and the third time since 1962.

title: WAR FOES TO SELL 2 RUSSELL ESSAYS
description: The manuscripts of two ir reverent essays about marriage and education written in 1931 by Bertrand Russell are part of a literary auction planned by Publishers for Peace, a group organized within the book In dustry opposed to the war hi Indochina.

title: 8 PARTIES SEEK PLACE ON BALLOT
description: ALBANY, Aug. 22Petitions that would put at least 12 parties on the state ballot in the November general elections were registered here by yes terday, the filing deadline.

title: Radar Links Balloons Over Pacific
description: A radar system linking bal loons 100,000 feet above the Pacific Ocean with a huge spherical tracker on the weather ship Vancouver has functioned almost flawlessly so far this year, according to a report this week from Can ada's Ministry of Transport.

title: U.S. Ties With Micronesia Strained
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 22 A diplomat specializing in Pacific island affairs at the United States Embassy in Aus tralia has been assigned to the new post of political adviser to the American High Commission er in Micronesia, apparently reflecting concern over deteri orating relations between Wash ington and the United States administered United Nations trust territory.

title: Black American Day Is Voted in California
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 22 (UPI)The Legislature has passed and forwarded to Gov. Ronald Reagan a bill by Assemblyman Willie Brown Jr. designating March 5 as Black American Day in Cali fornia.

title: 4 WORLD RECORDS IN SWIMMING FALL AT A.A.U. MEET
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug, 22 Four more world records fell this afternoon and tonight in the Amateur Athletic Union's national outdoor swimming championships. But the greatest excitement came from four un believable close finishes, includ ing one in which Mark Spitz was upset.

description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Rockefeller and Goldberg Both Name Committees in Campaign
description: Governor Rockefeller named a Senior Citizens Committee and Arthur J. Goldberg, his DemocraticLiberal rival, named a Committee on Women's Rights yesterday to aid them in their campaigns.

title: Miss Sandra Woyke Is Married
description: PENSACOLA, Fla., Aug. 22 Miss Sandra Woyke and Lieut. (jg.) Henry Hopkins Livingston Jr., U.S.N.R., were married here today in the Holy Trinity Chapel of the Pensacola Naval Air Station. The ceremony was performed by Lieut. Comdr. Val Sundt, a Lutheran chaplain.

description: A Northwest Airlines pilot flying a Boeing 707 with 140 passengers and a crew of seven fell unconscious while making a landing approach to Kennedy International Airport yesterday and the copilot took over, land ing the plane safely.

description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Aug. 22 The indictment this week of nine persons allegedly involved in two quickie divorce mills in Alabama has cast doubt on the legality of thousands of divorces attained by outof state couples over the last four years.

description: MIAMI, Aug. 22 The mili tarization of the Cuban Gov ernment, a longdiscernible trend, gained momentum this week with the appointment of three highranking officers to the Cabinet of Premier Fidel Castro.

description: Since last fall, college foot ball's coaching ranks have un dergone all sorts of changesplacid and otherwise.

description: EXCELSIOR, Minn., Aug. 22Miss Janet King, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. William Abbott King, was married at her parents home on Christ mas Lake here today to An drew Randolph Fisher, son of Mr. and Mrs. Andrew Fisher of New York City and Nassau, N.Y.

description: MIDDLETOWN, N. J., Aug. 22 (AP)  The badly decom posed body of what the police described as the apparent vic tim of a gangland slaying was recovered by the Coast Guard about two miles from. Ambrose Lighthouse today.

title: Joan L. Holmes, Mark Sullivan Wed in Jersey
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Aug. 22  Miss Joan Leslie Holmes and Mark Michael Sullivan were married here this afternoon in the Our Lady of Mount Cannel Ro man Catholic Church by the Rev. Charles H. Gascoyne; who also celebrated the nup tial mass.

title: Chinese City Girls Sent to Countryside Turn to Prostitution,
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 22Pros titutes have appeared in Can ton, capital of Kwangtung Province in Communist China. Known as contact girls, they frequent teahouses and public parks, according to travelers arriving here.

description: LAFAYETTE, Ind., Aug. 22 (UPI)A nationwide survey of 2,000 high school students showed 91 per cent of them willing to defer their personal interests stud work for a year on one of the nation's prob lems.
