description: HARRINGTON PARK, N. J., Aug. 22.  The marriage of Miss Barbara Marie Stone to Frank J. Filippone took place here this afternoon in the Community Church. The Rev. Vernon L. Dethmers, the Minister, and the Rev. Wil liam Freeswick, a Roman Catholic priest of Parsippany Troy Hills, officiated.

title: GOVERNOR BEGINS ELECTRONIC BLITZ
description: Rockefeller. He's done a lot. He'll do more.

title: Religion
description: At their semiannual meeting in San Francisco last April, the Catholic bishops of the United States reminded priests that an old church law  Canon 139. discouraging clergy from run ning for public office  was still in effect. The reminder was prompted by yet another phe nomenon of the evolving Ameri can Catholic church: the trans formation, almost overnight, of the Catholic priest from politi cal bystander to political can didate.

title: Miss Judith A. Leahy Wed to John T. Lyden
description: POCANTICO HILLS, N. Y., Aug. 22The marriage of Miss Judith Anne Leahy, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Leahy of Scarborough, to John Terence Lyden took place here this afternoon.

title: TAX WITHHOLDING ON PENSIONS SET
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22El derly persons and others who receive taxable pensions or an nuities will be able to arrange to have their Federal income taxes withheld, beginning next year, the Treasury Department announced today.

title: DISTRICT RECRUITS SLUM TEACHERS
description: Officials of Community School District 13 in Brooklyn, faced with what they say is a critical shortage of teachers qualified to teach in slum schools, have begun a nation wide recruiting program that so far has attracted at least 50 new teachers for the fall.

title: SST: The Dispute Remains Super and Sonic
description: No airplane in history has run into more turbulence before get ting off the ground than the American supersonic transport. It has been damned as a multi billiondollar Government boon doggle, a symbol of runaway technology that will desecrate the quality of human life, and an overpriced flagship for the jetset that will wastefully divert money from the nation's urban prob lems.

title: Eastern Preview Slated To Begin Next Sunday
description: With the opening of collegiate football practice, a team of sports writers from The New York Times will tour many Eastern campuses and preview the coming season.

title: U.S. Says Tydings's Deal Has Been Under Review
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (UPI)  The Government says that, for the last month, it has been investigating a transac tion cited in Life magazine ar ticle involving Senator Joseph D. Tydings, Democrat of Mary land.

title: Nixon Flying Flag at Night
description: WASHINGTON,. Aug. 22 (UPI)The American flag now flies over the White House day atd night instead of from sun rise to sunset. Sources said that President Nixon ordered the practice when Mrs. Nixon discovered that it was legal to fly the stars and stripes at night if it was illuminated. A floodlight has been installed to light up the flag, which is dis played on a pole on the south portico.

title: Niarchos Denies Injuring Wife And Attributes Death to Drugs
description: NICE, France, Aug. 22 (AP) Stavros S. Niarchos, the Greek shipping millionaire, dis puted today the charge of a Greek prosecutor that he had fatally injured his wife Eugenie. Mr. Niarchos said that he would stand by the findings of a Greek medicallegal committee that his wife died May 4 from taking an entire bottle of sleep ing pills.

title: Jeffrey W. Reed Marries Susan Morrison
description: JENKINTOWN, Pa., Aug. 22  Miss Susan Dahl Mor rison and Jeffrey William Reed were married here this afternoon in Grace Presby terian Church by the Rev. Cecil Harding Jones.

title: TWO BILLS WIDEN JOB UNIT'S POWER
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 Senate and House committees have voted to give the Equal Employment Opportunity Com mission much stronger enforce ment powers, including the au thoritv to order an end to job discrimination.

title: Holtzman Hurls OneHitter for His 14th Victory as Cubs Rout Giants, 150
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 22 (UPI)Ken Holtzman pitched a onehit shutout today, giving up a single to Hal Lanier with one out in the eighth inning, and coasted to his 14th victory behind an 18hit attack as the Chicago Cubs routed the San Francisco Giants, 150.

title: Castro, on TV, Aids Marxist Candidate in Chile's Sept. 4 Presidential Election
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Aug. 22Through television and the press, Fidel Castro is effectively stumping in Chile for the elec tion of a Marxist president on Sept. 4.

title: New and Recommended
description: GOING ALL THE WAY, by Dan Wakefield. Salinger comes immedi ately to mind in this novel about two korean vets cutting the silver cord, but Wakefield's comic sense springs from his own talent.

title: A CITY APPEALS DECISION ON BIAS
description: LACKAWANNA, N.Y., Aug. 22A Federal Court decision finding that the City of Lacka wanna had discrimated against Negroes has been appealed to the United States Court of Ap peals for the Second United States Circuit, Mayor Mark L. Balen has announced.

title: Panasiuk Scores Ace
description: BRANTFORD, Ontario, Aug. 22 (Canadian Press)Bob Pana siuk, who set a competitive course record 64 Wednesday, shot the first holeinone to day at this year's Canadian Pro fessional Golfers Association tournament. He aced the 170 yard, par3 10th hole at the Brantford Golf and Country Club with a No. 8 iron.

title: Buckley Gains G.O.P. Allies
description: BLUE POINT, L. I., Aug. 22  Suffolk County Republicans filed petitions this week to place eight of their candidates on a second line of the Novem ber ballot with James L. Buck ley, the Conservative party can didate for the United States Senate seat now held by Charles E. Goodell, their own party's candidate.

title: Rep. Mink Is Sure Winner
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 22 (AP)One of Hawaii's two Congress men will be automatically re elected this fall. Representa tive Patsy T. Mink, a Demo crat, was unopposed at Wednes day's filing deadline.

title: U.S. Urged to Investigate Charges of Jersey Farmers Using State Law Against Migrant Workers
description: TRENTON, Aug. 22United States Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr. urged the Depart ment of Justice today to begin a prompt and thorough in vestigation of charges that South Jersey farmers were un lawfully using the state's tres pass law to prevent antipoverty officials from helping migrant farm workers.

title: Yugoslavia Names Envoy To Vatican, First in 18 Years
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Aug. 22 (AP)President Tito today appointed Vjekoslav Cvrlje as Ambassador to the Vatican, marking the first time in 18 years Belgrade and the Holy See have had full diplomatic relations.

title: Soviet Pollution Fighters Sense Victory in the Battle of Lake Baikal
description: LISTVYANKA, U.S.S.R., Aug. 14Soviet conservationists ap pear on the verge of winning a total victory in their fight to keep Lake Baikalthe world's largest body of fresh water by volume  from becoming an in dustrial cesspool.

title: MISTER DIZ WINS AT ATLANTIC CITY
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 22 (AP)Nathan L. Cohen's Mis ter Diz moved to a fourlength lead round the final turn, then withstood the late surge of Cragwood Stable's Red Reality to win the $29,875 Philadelphia Turf Handicap today at the At lantic City track. The winning margin was 1 lengths.

title: Judith A. O'Connor Bride on L. I.
description: GREAT NECK, L. L. Aug. 22Miss Judith Anne O'Con nor, daughter of Mrs. J. Hotchkiss O'Connor of Great Neck, was married here today to Preston Tate Hayes, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ray W. Hayes of Greeneville. Tenn. The ceremony was performed in St. Aloysius Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Brendan Riodan.

title: Mideast 2: U.S. Goal Is To Get On With Peace Talks
description: WASHINGTON  It was in evitable when the Nixon Ad ministration decided to push for a Middle East ceasefire and a new round of ArabIsraeli ne gotiations that Washington would clash from time to time with Jerusalem. But no one ex pected so loud and strident an argument so soon.

title: Chinese Reds Rebuilding Shattered Youth League
description: PEKING, Aug. 22Like its parent, the Chinese Communist party, the young Communist League is gradually rising from the ashes. Both were destroyed as functioning bodies during the Cultural Revolution, which be gan in 1966.

title: Education
description: Has the grading system failed? asks the current issue of Changing Education, the quar terly journal of the American Federation of Teachers. Sever al articles on that question leave no doubt whatsoever that the magazine's academic contri butors, and presumably its edi tors, believe that giving students grades is wrong and that the system is the enemy of chil dren and good education.

title: CONSULTANTS USE BY STATE SCORED
description: A charge that state agencies are spending too much money on outside consultants was made yesterday by Assembly man Andrew Stein, Democrat of Manhattan.

title: Hiss Seeks Annuity
description: Twenty years have passed since the deeply divisive po litical drama in which a ris ing young State Department diplomat named Alger Hiss was convicted of perjury for denying he gave state secrets to Soviet agents. Mr. Hiss, who spent three and a half years in prison, has struggled ever since to clear his name. Last week, as part of this ef fort, he challenged the con stitutionality of the Hiss Act, passed in 1954 to pro hibit payment of annuities to officers and employes of the United States convicted of certain offenses...

title: Mideast 1: Israelis Critical of U.S. Role On Missiles
description: TEL AVIVThe game diplo mats play got a little rough last week between Israel and the United States. Each capital played according to rules de termined by its own national interests in the ArabIsraeli con frontation, and since the imme diate interests diverged, so did the rules of the game.

title: U.S. AND AFGHANS IN A MAP PROJECT
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, Aug. 22 (AP)Afghanistan is allow ing a United States satellite tracking team to do its work here, a project that officials say will last 18 months and is designed to provide more ac curate maps.

title: Chess
Nicklaus Tops July Poll
description: Jack Nicklaus, the winner of the British Open was an nounced yesterday as the July Hickok professional athlete of the year award. Nicklas polled 208 points, while Johnny Bench, the Cincinnati Reds slugging matcher, was runner up with 100.

title: Agnew Leaves on a Tour To Reassure Asian Allies
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif, Aug. 22President Nixon today for mally dispatched Vice President Agnew on a 30,000mile tour of four friendly Asian allies to assure them that the United States in Mr. Nixon's words, is not withdrawing from Asia.

title: FULBRIGHT FAVORS A U.S. GUARANTEE OF ISRAELF'67LINE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22Senator J. W. Fulbright, a foe of new American commitments abroad, offered today to sup port a bilateral treaty under which the United States would use military force if necessary to guarantee the territory and independence of Israel within the borders of 1967.

title: Three Decades With Horse Shows Group
description: When Kathleen McKegg was hired to work at the Brooklyn Academy of Music in the spring of 1942, she had no idea the job would lead to a career that spanned almost three decades with the American Horse Shows Association.

title: Gourds Are Gorgeous
description: SMALL gourds make strik ing door or table decora tions for fall. Large ones some several feet long  are popular conversation pieces.

title: FISHING INCIDENTS ANGER CANADIANS
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 22Canadi an fishermen suspect that they are being harassed by Soviet trawlers and have been de manding a dramatic protest by their Government.

title: Unser Wins DirtTrack Race
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Aug. 22 (AP)Al Unser, winner of the Indianapolis 500, won a 100 mile USAC national dirt track championship race today at the Illinois State Fair. Carl Williams of Kansas City finished second with Jim McElreath, Arlington, Tex., third.

title: F.T.C. PLANS INQUIRY INTO FOOD SERVICES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP) Whether served up in a fancy restaurant or packaged in a cardboard carryout box, edi bles consumed away from home are commanding a bigger share of the average food budg et, the Federal Trade Commis sion says.

title: Marijuana Clouds the Generation Gap
description: SHOULD anyone still believe that the use of marijuana is spreading because of the Mafia conspiracy or a Communist plot to sap the will of our youth, let me tell of a 40yearold who tried it for the first time this summer. He is a major figure in the advertising world; but despite that fact, he seldom drinks liquor and never smokes cigarettes.

title: Judith Jean Derkash Married To Richard Hadden,Virginia'70
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 22Miss Judith Jean Derkash and Richard John Hadden, June graduates of Mary Bald win College and the Univer sity of Virginia, were mar ried here this afternoon. The ceremony was performed in St. Agnes Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Thomas Guinan, assisted by the Rev. Homer B. Ogle.

title: Maryellen Maher Wed To James Toombs Jr.
description: WYCKOFF, N. J., Aug. 22 Miss Maryellen Maher, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward J. Maher, was mar ried here today to James Raye Toombs Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Toombs of Ridge wood. The ceremony in St. Elizabeth's Roman Catholic Church was performed by the Rev. John Casey.

title: Daughter to R. K. Shermans
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Ronald King Sherman of New York on Aug. 15 at University Hos pital. Mrs. Sherman, the for mer Miss Wendy Kupsick, is a member of the faculty of the Lycde Francaise here. Mr. Sherman is a vice president of the J. Walter Thompson Company, the advertising agency.

title: Containerships Ordered
description: The Hansa Lines of Bremen, West Germany, has ordered two 11,500 deadweightton con tainerships from Lubecker FlenderWerke, shipbuilders of ships will cost $6million each and will be ready for delivery in 1971.

title: James Binch, Business Student, Marries Susan Badgerow May
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 22Miss Susan Badge row May and James Gardner Binch were married here this afternoon at St. Mark's Epis copal Church by the Rev. Grant A. Morrill.

title: Uncle Dick Saw A Good Thing, Made It Better
description: RATON, N. M.There it is, Raton Pass, and extra pressure is required on the accelerator for your car to climb to the nearly 8,000foothigh summit. To the west of the fourlane highway (Inter state 25), along the banks of a tiny, swiftly flowing mountain stream, gleam the twin ribbons of the Santa Fe Rail way's main line, while across the creek, perched precariously on the mountain side, are the ruins and rubble of once thriving towns. west of the fourlane highway (Inter state 25), along the banks of a tiny, swiftly flowing mountain stream, gleam the twin ribbons of the Santa Fe Rail way's main line, while across the creek, perched precariously on the mountain side, are the ruins and rubble of once thriving towns.

title: HULME WINS POLE IN OHIO CANAM
description: MANSFIELD, Ohio, Aug. 22 (AP)Denis Hulme of New Zealand opened a strong bid for his second straight Buckeye Cup CanadianAmerican road racing victory at the MidOhio Sports Car Course near here, winning the pole position in to day's qualifying.

title: New Idea Pays Off For Iowan
description: FOSTORIA, Iowa  Those professors of economics who frequently scorn a business practice by telling their stu dents to leave that to the buggy whip manufacturers should stop and consider Eugene O'Neill before they do it again.

title: Chicken is champ
description: Year in and year out, there is probably no single food served more often than chicken. Countless people for one reason or another have an aversion to lamb or pork or beef or fish and all forms of seafood. And veal is still relatively unknown to many people in this country. One reason for the almost universal appeal of chicken may be its infinitely versatile nature. It harmonizes with countless other foods and flavors. Here are a couple of good summer samples.

title: James Prescott Hyatt Weds Alice Hamilton
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I, Aug. 22 Miss Alice Pinckney Hamilton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frederick Johnson Hamilton of New York and Lloyd Harbor, was married here today to James Prescott Hyatt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Thaddeus Hyatt of Garden City.

title: Virgin and the Gypsy Rescued Him
description: LONDON. HRISTOPHER MILES lives in a small mews cottage in Kensington, together with a preg nant wife and a fat, ginger pussycat. There is a white standup piano, a large num ber of assorted paintings, drawings and glossy photo graphs, and a converted ga rage for a study. The total effect isn't wildly exciting but it's intimate, domestic and sympathetic, and that is a fair enough description of Miles himself.

title: City Councilman Proposes Registry for Blood Donors
description: A central registry for all blood donors in the city would be required under a bill pro posed yesterday by a key City Councilman.

title: Kite Shoots a 68 for 203 To Lead Eastern Golf by 2
description: PORTSMOUTH, Va., Aug. 22 (AP)Tom Kite of Austin, Tex., maintaining a consistent putt ing touch, took a twostroke lead at the end of 54 holes in the Eastern amateur golf tour nament today as he completed his third consecutive underpar round.

title: LINDSAY TO ALLOW CON ED TO EXPAND ASTORIA PLANT, BUT CUTS REQUEST IN HALF
description: A partial expansion of Con solidated Edison's generating plant in Astoria, giving the util ity half of what it had asked, was approved yesterday by Mayor Lindsay.

title: Fans and TV to Pay More to See Merged Pro Clubs Draw New Battle Lines
description: An appropriate motto for pro football would be More. The nation's apparently unquenchable thirst for this sport will be satisfied this season by 371 games, includ ing the Super Bowl contest that returns to Miami; by the addition of 13 Monday night games on national television and by new stadiums in Cincinnati and Pittsburgh that will assure the 50yearold National Foot ball League of an attendance record.

title: Kingsley Amis proves there's life in the old spooks yet
description: Ghost stories usually come in one of three proofs: 100, 80, and watered down. The masters of the pure thing, like Poe and Sheridan Le Fanu, serve their spirits horrible and straight. No apology; little or no explanation. The makers of subtler and mellower blends tend, like Henry James, to introduce the mind into the con coction and leave the reader suspect ing that weird apparitions are the products of repressed psyches rather than of restless souls. (A variant is the tale in which the ghost is brought out not by psychosis but, as in the case of Scrooge, by indigestion and a bad conscience.)

title: The 2c Red Brown
description: STAMP collecting is more than just buying a stamp and mounting it in an album. Of course, for many stamp collect ors, acquisition is important, for empty spaces in an al bum are like a festering sore  they must be eradicated. That is, the empty spot must be covered. This desire on the part of collectors is ad mirable, and pursuit of miss ing items is one facet of the hobby that makes it so inter esting.

title: CHIPPER CAPTURES TWO SHOW TITLES
description: READINGTON, N. J., Aug. 22 Chipper, a 3yearold chest nut gelding, captured the novice and maiden working hunter championships today at the Four Seasons Farm Horse Show with a total of one first place.

title: Ceylon Tea Sales Up
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Aug. 22  Ceylon's upcountry teas, known as UVA teas, are hav ing a boom year. At this week's Colombo Tea Auctions the average price for a pound of tea rose several cents to 29 United States cents. A number of countries, includ ing West Germany and the United States, have increased their tea consumption in the last year, although it has de clined in Britain.

title: A Funny and Incisively Human Housewife
description: DIARY OF A MAD HOUSEWIFE, whose raffish title seems to imply a string of porno fantasy episodes (the plumber, the delivery boy, the house painter, the doctor, the dentist, yes, even the door todoor lady from Avon), hap pily has not much in common with that sort of movie at all. Though it does involve a housewife, Tina Balser (played with enormously fetching awkwardness by newcomer Carrie Snodgress), she is saner than everyone else in the picture. And she trans gresses with only one mana cool, caddish charmer named George Prager (Frank Langella), whom she winds up pegging as a faggot. pily has not much in common with that sort of movie at all. Though it does involve a housewife, Tina Balser (played with enormously fetching awkwardness by newcomer Carrie Snodgress), she is saner than everyone else in the picture. And she trans gresses with only one mana cool, caddish charmer named George Prager (Frank Langella), whom she winds up pegging as a faggot.

title: Friendly Towns Aid Fresh Air Fund
description: A selected group of disad vantaged New York City boys and girls is spending two or more weeks this summer in Dallas, Pa., or Garden City, L. I. under a special higher horizons program.

title: South Africa Ousting Priest For Attacks on Apartheid
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Aug. 22 (AP)A Roman Catholic priest who preached against apartheid has been or dered to leave South Africa by the end of the month.

title: The Blooping Of the President
description: PRESIDENT NIXON's ex temporaneous declara tion that Charles Man son the West Cost cult ist, was guilty of murdering eight persons almost pre dictably has had its tele vision aftermath. The ques tion has been asked whether the President's prejudgment of a person on trial could not have been minimized by cen soring the TV tape recording of the event.

title: Indians Win in 10th
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 22 (UPI) Chuck Hinton singled home Roy Foster from second with the winning run in the 10th inning today to give the Cleve land Indians a 65 victory over the Oakland Athletics.

title: A Dog Lodge Gives HappyEnding Tail To LeftatHomes
description: A question frequently asked by the New York dog owner planning a vacation or a trip out of the, city is, Where can I leave my pup?

title: ART BUYERS FOUND MORE DEMANDING
description: Art buyers in the recently ended auction season demon strated greater respect for fine, quality than in former years, according to a ParkeBernet Galleries report of 19691970 sales that chalked up a record total of $38,524,966.

title: The case of America's last King and the blue urine
description: Blueblooded is the adjective that has been used over and over again to describe the British aristocracy and their sovereigns, for, after all, their genealogical tables are even more splendid than those of race horses and rush them back down the centuries; indeed at one time the British monarchy claimed King David and the House of Jesse in its family tree. It would appear, however, that it is not their blood that is blue, but their urinea much more telling and frightening feature, for it indicates the dread hereditary diseaseporphyria. British monarchy claimed King David and the House of Jesse in its family tree. It would appear, however, that it is not their blood that is blue, but their urinea much more telling and frightening feature, for it indicates the dread hereditary diseaseporphyria.

title: PORTLAND BRACES FOR WAR PROTEST
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 22Lawenforcement officials are attempting to head off a pos sible confrontation between the antiwar movement and 14,000 American Legionnaires who are expected at their national con vention here next week.

title: Science
description: WASHINGTON For half a century and more, American agricultural engineers have been genetically manipulating plants to breed tougher and more pro ductive yields of corn. By the early 1950's the fruition of this research were types of hybrid corn in which perhaps 90 per cent of American fields are planted.

title: Ruth Newman and Donald Ross, Boston Students, Married Here
description: Miss Ruth Elizabeth New man and Donald George Ross, students at Boston University, were married here yesterday by Rabbi Dan Isaac. The ceremony took place at the home of the bride's uncle and aunt, A. M. Rosenthal, managing editor of The New York Times, and Mrs. Rosenthal.

title: ANGELS SET BACK ORIOLES IN 10TH
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 22 (UPI) Jim Fregosi's 10thinning single and the strong relief pitching of Andy Messersmith and Mel Queen gave the Cali fornia Angels a 32 victory over the Baltimore Orioles tonight.

title: Witness in Clay Shaw Case Held on 3 Burglary Counts
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 22 (UPI)Perry Raymond Russo, the star witness in District At torney Jim Garrison's investiga tion of the John F. Kennedy as sassination, was arrested and booked today on three counts of burglary and theft.

title: Canada and Britain Gain Stevens Cup Tennis Final
description: Canada earned the right to oppose Britain today in the final round of the Stevens Cup tennis tournament at the West Side Tennis Club in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Recordings
description: IN his introductory essay to London's new record ing of Gluck's Orfeo ed Euridice (two disks, OSA 1285), the English musicolo gist Arthur Hutchings notes its limitations but concludes that the opera remains unique on account of its own unearthly magic. He also quotes Romain Rolland's claim that the second act is the most moving act in all opera.

title: Egypt Holds U.S. Responsible For Time Lost on Peace Talks
description: CAIRO, Aug. 22The United Arab Republic's press spokes man, Ahmed Anis, said today that the United States had to assume responsibility for time lost in the endeavor to get ArabIsraeli peace talks under way during the 90day cease fire, which entered its third week today.

title: Miss Jane Hamlin Is Married Here To R. J. Schulten
description: Miss Jane Hamlin, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Conde Hamlin of Darien. Conn., and Richard James Schulten, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Spencer Schulten of Darien and New Milford, Conn., were married here yesterday afternoon in the chapel of St. Thomas Episcopal Church by the Rev. Frederick M. Morris, the rector.

title: Senators Turn Back Twins, 54, on Howard's 430Foot 10thInning Homer
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 22 (AP)Frank Howard's 10th inning homer, his second of the game, powered the Washington Senators to a 54 victory over the Minnesota Twins today.

title: Clean Air Cars Line Up for CrossCountry Race
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Aug. 22 They purr and whine, chug and hiss, and they go by names like Miss Purity and The Great Teakettle. They are the experimental and sometimes temperamental automobiles that student engineers plan to drive across the country next week as their way of saying that, with imaginative technology, auto pollution could be reduced drastically.

title: The Merchant's View:
description: August is traditionally a slow month for retailers al though in recent years, it has produced more business than either July or September be cause of backtoschool pro motions. This year August will probably not prove to be a banner month because backtoschool selling has not really caught on.

title: Economic Indicators
5th Ave. Basement Gets Restaurant
description: A new restaurant that opened its doors on the sunken plaza of the General Motors Building at 59th Street and Fifth Avenuelast week will test the theory that restaurants off the street level can succeed in new midtown office buildings.

title: Investors, Holding and Hopeful
description: Hans Marcuse, an execu tive at the Algiers Hotel in Miami Beach, Fla., said last week that his stock portfolio  originally worth about $30,000is down at least 50 per cent.

title: Still Lots of Deadly Gas Awaiting Disposal
description: WASHINGTON  An outcry over possible pollution of the sea subsided last week after an old Liberty ship, laden with 418 con crete coffins of lethal nerve gas, was scuttled and sank into the Atlantic at a point 280 miles off the coast of Florida.

title: Mother of Black G.I. Slain inWar Vows Burial in White Cemetery
description: FORT PIERCE, Fla., Aug. 22 (AP)The mother of a black soldier killed in Vietnam says she is determined to have him buried in a plot given to her in an allwhite cemetery by a 72yearold white woman.

title: Commuter Planes Said to Cut Pollution
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Aug. 22A Rutgers Univer sity study indicates that air pollution in the New York area could be reduced mark edly if downtown commuters who drive used aircraft in stead.

title: The F.C.C. Clarifies That Ruling On TV Time
description: WASHINGTON  Among the prerogatives of the Presi dent, the informal power to com mand the attention of television networks and their vast prime time audiences ranks somewhere close to his constitutional power to command the troops.

title: 9 Fawns Back in Everglade After Rescue by Plane
description: ANDYTOWN. Fla., Aug. 22 (AP)Nine fawns who sur vived a deerlift last spring are back home in the Everglades.

title: BISHOP CHASTISES JESUIT CANDIDATE
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., Aug. 22 (AP)The Roman Catholic bishop of Providence says a Jesuit priest, the Rev. John J. McLaughlin, is running for the United States Senate without having obtained the Bishop's permission, a violation of church law.

title: Fire on Maine Waterfront
description: PORTLAND, Me., Aug. 22 (UPI)Damage was estimated today at $150,000 in a general alarm fire on the city's water front, touched off when a cigarette thrown from a car ignited fuel from an overturned gasoline truck. One fireman was injured.

title: TITLE BICYCLING SHIFTS TO QUEENS
description: A quartermile, sunbaked track in a deserted section of Queens became the center of United States bicycle racing as the 1970 national amateur championships entered their third day of competition yester day.

title: Metroliner Evening Runs Set to Start Tomorrow
description: The Penn Central will add another pair of runs to its pop ular but troubleplagued Metro liner service between New York and Washington, starting tomorrow.

title: As Far as One Can Get From the Stereotype of a Yacht Club
description: HEWLETT POINT, L. I.  To the man in the street, the words yacht club evoke images of urbane men in blazers, ascots and pristine caps awash with gold braid. At their sides, lithe, tanned cou tureclad women sip cocktails while in the distance luxuriously appointed craft ride at anchor.

title: JOSEPH N. BARNED
description: Surviving are his widow, they former Mary Jones; four daugh ters, a sister and seven grand children.

title: Arming to Disarm
description: Four months ago, by an overwhelming 72to6 vote, the Senate urged President Nixon to spur the strategic arms limitation talks (SALT) with the Soviet Union by proposing an immediate mutual moratorium on the deployment of offensive and defensive missiles. The Administration rejected that resolution on the ground that the missile race had to be stepped up if Moscow was to be induced to step it down.

title: Y.R.A. Regatta Summaries
description: ETCHELLS22 CLASS (17 started)1, Mimi and E. Chester Peet Jr.; 2, Spencer J. Leach Jr. and Peter Cooper; 3, James G. McCulloh; 4, Marvin Kapilow; 5, William H. Lynn Jr. and Herbert Hild; 6, C. Stanley Ogilvy; 7, Karl K. Gleeson; 8, Robert Shattuck; 9, Paul Gooding; 10, William F. Blitzer; 11, Orison W. Mac Pherson; 12, George M. lsdale Jr. and C. L. Farrand Jr.; 13, L. Sanford Waters; 14, James F. Fulton; 15, Alex Brainard and Charles Stiassni; 16, E. W. Etchells; 17, Louis D. Piana.

title: Peabody Backs Donahue
description: BOSTON, Aug 22 (AP)For mer Gov. Endicott Peabody has announced his support of the gubernatorial candidacy of Sen ate President Maurice A. Dona hue, who was endozsed by the Democratic state convention but faces a primary race with three others.

title: Observer: Cathedral Shin and Wren Envy
description: LONDON, Aug. 22  The average man has it in him to feel truly inadequate perhaps once every five years. And a terrible feeling it is, particu larly since it almost invariably comes on at a moment already darkened by fatigue and de pression.

title: John Horner Marries Mary A. Straffin
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Aug. 22 Miss Mary Alden Straffin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Philip Douglas Straffin, was married here this afternoon to John Huston Horner, son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman Hor ner.

title: Cleveland Dodge 3d Marries Wendy Anderson in Montreal
description: In the chapel of McGill University in Montreal yes terday afternoon, Miss Wendy Lee Anderson was married to Cleveland E. Dodge 3d by the Rev. John Wright of the Anglican Church of St. James the Apostle, Montreal.

title: 15 AIRLINES SEEK INCREASED FARES
description: Fifteen of the nation's 20 scheduled airlines, complain ing of heavy losses this year, have petitioned the Civil Aero nautics Board for authority to raise domestic fares sharply on Oct. 15.

title: U.S. CHAMBER SEEKS A HEALTH CARE PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (UPI) The United States Chamber of Commerce has announced the establishment of a group of business executives to develop a plan for a better health care system it said it took the action in response to growing concern in business and industry over soaring health care costs.

title: CAMBODIA CLEARS BANK OF MEKONG EAST OF CAPITAL
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 22Cambodian forces Carried out clearing operations along the eastern bank of the Me kong River across from Pnom penh this morning in an at tempt to uncover enemy sol diers left behind after the heavy fighting there two days ago.

title: U. S. CUP SQUAD STILL UNSETTLED
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 22 (AP) A firedup twoman team from West Germany will chal lenge the United States next weekend for the Davis Cup, and it's the defenders who seem to have all the worries.

title: Amex and Counter Stocks Advance
description: Issues on the American Stock Exchange and the over thecounter market last week made their best showing in three weeks as both lists ad vanced in slightly steppedup trading.

title: Surveys Find Geese Abandoning Old Wintering Haunts in South
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP) For centuries, thousands of Canada, blue and snow geese) have filled the North American skies with loud honks and shrill falsetto cries while wing ing southward in their annual miaration.

title: LINDSAY DEFENDS PRISONS RECORD
description: The Lindsay administration, which has differed sharply with the state over responsibility for the conditions that led to dis orders in the overcrowded Men's House of Detention in Manhattan, yesterday defended its record on prison construc tion.

title: Sargent: A Case Study in Alternatives
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 22The financial environment is not what it was in 1964 when Dan Burns saved the Electrada Corporation from bankruptcy. But the rapid turnaround of Electrada and its emergence as the profit table Sargent Industries pro vides a case study in alter natives to bankers and cor porate managers faced with today's liquidity problems.

title: 4 HELD IN SEIZURE AT 15TH ST. BUILDING
description: One of five vacant apart ments seized Friday night by a group of squatters was raided by the police yesterday, and four persons were charged with criminal trespass.

title: What's New in the World of Camera
description: FAMILIES and other small groups can now view snapshots and small prints in en larged form with the same convenience as already en joyed by owners of slide and movie projectors. A new Color Print Viewer recently introduced by General Elec tric projects an enlarged view of conventional 3inch square prints (this is the size produced by most inexpen sive snapshot and Insta matic cameras) onto a 10x10 inch screen at the front of the unit so that a group of people can view the prints simultaneously. Fifty prints can be loaded into the tray at one time, and prints are changed by swinging a lever. As they are viewed, they are restacked in the same order. There is also a storage com partment in the back that will hold 150 additional prints. Weighing about 11 pounds and measuring 14x9x18 inches, this new GE viewer carries a list price of $69.95. Special storage boxes that will bold up to 600 prints and negatives (sorted out in 50print cases) are also avail able for under $6.

title: Australia TieUp Set
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 22 (UPI)  Kaiser Aetna, real estate and land developers, have announced plans for land development in Australia in the Sydney area In partner ship with an Austmlian con cern. A new concern, Kaiser AetnaJennings, will be owned equally by Kaiser Aet na and Jennings, Industries, (Australia) Ltd., a diversified construction company. Initial resources will be $6.7million in cash and properties.

title: Old Bethpage Restores Its Ties With the Past
description: OLD BETHPAGE, L. I.A stone's throw from the bumpertobumper pollution of the Long Island Expressway here is the Old Bethpage Village Restoration, a bucolic throwback to preCivil War days when such evils as environmental blight were still a hundred years or more away.

title: Capes aswirl
description: The cape is on the move. An oldfashioned idea, it is absolutely of the moment because it can go over everything. And its swashbuck ling sweep gives it a most siaphistIcated look.

title: Most Happy Fella Beats Columbia George by HalfLength in Yonkers Pace
description: YONKERS, Aug. 22  Most Happy Fella, who took the first leg of the big four of pacing by beating Columbia George in a raceoff in the Adios Stake at the Meadows last week, beat that same speedster and seven others in the Westchester Pace at Yonkers Raceway tonight.

title: Blaiberg's Widow Defends Her HUsband's Transplant
description: CAPETOWN, Aug 22 (AP)Mrs. Eileen Blaiberg, the widow pf Dr. Philip Blaiberg, said to day she was very, very much in favor of heart transplants no matter what her daughter said.

title: Jersey's Migrants: A Hardly Human Existence
description: BRIDGETON, N. J.This sum mer, about 10,000 black and Puerto Rican migrants followed the sun up the Eastern seaboard to southern New Jersey. Another 10,000 have been driven in daily on rickety buses and trucks from Camden and Philadelphia slums. It is a seasonal migration to gather in the harvestand, ac cording to some, a virtual per petuation of slavery.

title: Ship Strays Inside Limit
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, Aug. 22 (UPI)The Japanese fishing vessel Kiyo No. 51 was on her way to Sitka, Alaska, today un der Coast Guard escort after be ing sighted fishing within the 12mile limit. The ship was ob served Thursday afternoon off Cape Edgecumbe. Coast Guard headquarters here said the sighting was made by an am phibious plane on routine pa trol.

title: Bishop Walsh to Visit Pope
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 22 (UPI)  The Most Rev. James Ed ward Walsh will leave Hong Kong for Rome tomorrow to visit Pope Paul VI. Bishop Walsh, an American was ar rested by Chinese Communist authorities in Shanghai 12 years ago. He was freed last month.

title: PAIUTES FILE SUIT TO PRESERVE LAKE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (UPI) The Pyramid Lake Paiute tribe had filed a Federal Court suit against Interior Secretary Walter J. Hickel and Attorney General John N. Mitchell in an attempt to save its large desert lake in Nevada from becoming an ecological disaster.

title: SURTEES WINNER OF ENGLISH RACE
description: OULTON PARK, England, Aug. 22 (AP)John Surtees of Britain, driving a new Grand Prix car of his own design, won the International Gold Cup race here today, edging Aus tria's ace Jochen Rindt, in a Lo tus by 3.4 seconds.

title: Thailand and U.S. Open New Talks on Pullout
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 22 (AP)Thai and United States officials have begun a new series of talks on American troop reduction in Thailand that will include closing of at least one major air base, informed sources said today.

title: One Small Step Into the Stone Age
description: PORT MORESBY, New Guinea  The bride of 12 had been bought for three pigs. She sat in a thatchroofed circular but In the New Guinea highlands, her grass skirt carefully arranged about her, surrounded by gifts of tarro, sweet corn and sugar cane. The whole village was thereexcept the bridegroom. He was working in a trading post store and would not arrive for three days, but the ceremony went on happily without him.

title: The success story of a failed real estate man
description: Books by and about bankrupt ex millionaires will probably be flutter ing out of publishing houses this year and next the way broken brok ers are supposed to have fluttered out the windows of Wall Street in 193031. Capitalism has evidently advanced; if beaten in the money game, one doesn't jump now, one writes memoirs.

title: What's New in Art
National Rowing Summaries
description: Heavyweight Singles1, Jim Dietz, New York A.C.; 2, Tom McKibbon, Long Beach (Calif.) R.A.; 3, Ed Cerullo, Undine; 4, Jody Trinsey, Maita; 5, Fred Dies, De troit. Time1:12.

title: Close Series Forecast
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 22After yesterday's first match race in America's Cup history between two foreign countries seeking the role of challenger against the United States, Aus tralia's victory over France brought these reactions:

title: Mary Lawler Wed in Suburb
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Aug. 22Miss MaryAlicia Lawler, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. John A. Lawler of Riverdale, the Bronx, was married here this morning to Douglas J. McRae, son of Mrs. John J. McRae of Mil waukee and the late Mr. McRae.

title: Jersey Little Leaguers Gain World Series Spot
description: EASTCHESTER, N.Y., Aug. 22 (UPI)  Craig Kornfeld pitched and batted Wayne, N.J., to a 32 triumph over Dubois, Pa., today, enabling the New Jersey team to win a spot in next week's Little League World Series at Wil liamsport, Pa.

title: From La Jolla to Harlem
description: SAN DIEGO.

title: PANTHER RALLY SET AT NEW HAVEN COURT
description: Huey P. Newton, defense minister of the Black Panther party, announced yesterday that a rally would be held at 10 A.M. Tuesday outside the New Haven Courthouse to protest the legal lynching of Lonnie McLucas, who is on trial now in connec tion with the murder of Alex Racklev.

title: Newspapers Reused In Antipollution Move
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 22 (AP) The CourierJournal and The Louisville Times, as an antipollution measure, will reuse some of the 95 tons of newspapers they circulate daily in the community.

title: CAMBODIAN REBELS SAY THEY'LL FREE 4
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 22 (AP)Prince Norodom Sihanouk sent Word that his National Libera tion Army was freeing four Western newsmen who had been captured in Cambodia, in cluding Robert S. Anson of Time magazine.

title: Excerpts From Lindsay's Statement and the Text of Accord on Power Plant
description: Following are excerpts from a statement by Mayor Lind say on his decision to allow Consolidated Edison to build an 800,000kilowatt power plant in Astoria, Queens, and the text of an agreement between the city and Con solidated Edison.

title: Follmer Barred for Driving in Rival's Race
description: The Continental Champion ship race that George Follmer won on Aug. 1 at Mont Trem blant, Quebec, may turn out to be an expensive outing. Follmer was suspended last week from United States Club competition, and the suspension will prevent him from driving one of Andy Granatelli's cars in the rich Cali fornia 500 on Sept. 6 at the new Ontario (Calif.) Speedway. William J. Smyth, executive director of USAC, said Foll mer was suspended for hav ing participated without USAC permission in the Con tinental, which is sanctioned by the Sports Car Club of America.

title: Personality :
description: John P. Maguire moved in to the presidency of the Con tinental Telephone Company last Monday because of a tragedy. Philip J. Lucier, his predecessor, was killed last month when a bomb explod ed in a company automobile.

title: WASHINGTON'SSQUAD WINS YOUTH GAMES
description: A team of boys and girls from Washington scored 193 points and won the team cham pionship at the fourth annual United States Youth Games at Randalls Island yesterday. The squad from Detroit placed sec ond with 164, followed by New York's 160.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: DISCUSSION GUESTS

title: The Rural America Waldo Peirce Saw
description: WATERVILLE, Me.

SHEARITH ISRAEL Syna gogue, 70th Street and Central Park West, New York, is pictured on one of five Israel stamps to be issued Sept. 7 for the an nual High Holidays, Rosh Hashonah and Yom Kippur. These holidays will usher in the year 5731 for Jews all over the world.

title: In Iowa, the Corn Still Stands But...
description: ELY, Iowa, Aug. 22  It's bad. We haven't seen the worst of it. The weather still could tell the tale.

title: U.S. LAND PURCHASES OPPOSED IN CANADA
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 22A House of Commons committee urged this weekend that the govern ment take effective action against the foreign takeover.

title: Challenger Faces Uphill Fight Against California Congressman
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 22John Parks turned up the huge foot at the end of the long, long leg and pointed to the new half sole on his shoe.

title: Daughter to Mrs. Tsai
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Tsai Jr. of New York And Greenwich, Conn., on July 24, at the Harkness Pavilion. Mrs. Tsai is the former Miss Marlyn Chase. Her husband is presi dent of the Tsai Management & Research Corporation. The child has been named Veron ica Lee.

title: Tourists Are Getting a Foothold On the Antarctic Wasteland
description: PALMER STATION, Antarctica  Two thousand American scientists and Navy personnel of Operation Deep Freeze spend the six months of each austral summer, when it's winter in the United States, conducting experiments and busi ly provisioning bases for the six months of cold, 24hour, winter darkness ahead. Why, they wonder, would civilians spend up to $5,000 each and come 12, 000 miles from the United States to spend a night out in a whiteout, travel in below zero temperatures and lean into 50mileanhour winds?

title: Shipyard Tries Lottery To Reduce Absenteeism
description: Swan Hunter Shipbuilders Ltd., a major British ship yard group, is trying a new approach to the problem of absenteeism. The company has organized a free lottery with weekly prizes of 100 ($240) and a quarterly prize of a small automobile for its 15.000 emnloyes.

title: PICTURE CREDITS
description: 1JOHN ROBATON FROM CAMERA 5

title: Sammy Davis Jr. Is III
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Aug. 22 (UPI)Sammy Davis Jr. was hospitalized with pneumonia when he became ill at Lake Head, 40 miles east of here, where he was on location for a television show. The enter tainer was confined to an oxy gen tent at Sunrise Hospital. He was listed in fair condi tion.

title: Amateur Expertise With Alpines
description: RAISING alpines to perfection is something of an art and no one has a surer hand with these choice (if demanding) plants than Elea nor Brinckerhoff. Her Georgetown, Conn. rock garden has become a mecca for alpine enthusiasts who come to see how she does it, note rare varieties in bloom and revel in the abundance of campanula, gentian and primrose, her favorites.

title: Jobless: The Young, Especially The Blacks, Hard Hit
description: WASHINGTON  In Wichita, Kan., a few days ago, Merlyn Hatcher, employment director for the city, estimated that 75 per cent of the teenagers who searched for jobs this summer were still out of work. In Ta coma, Wash., employment offi cials said that in addition to teenagers they were overrun with exservicemen looking for jobs. In many areas June college graduates by the thousand were reported to be unemployed.

title: $300,000 DowJones Open Starts Thursday at Upper Montclair Club Links
description: CLIFTON, N. J., Aug. 22Money, money, money, golf will reach a high in prize money with the $300,000 Dow Jones open tournament that be gins at the Upper Montclair Country Club here Thursday.

title: Point of View:
description: Each corporation could create its own permanent committee on corporate re sponsibility, to which the board or management would turn for periodic assessment of its policies and practices. The committee's function would not be to determine the business feasibility of corporate decisions, but rath er to question whether the corporation is neglecting the social implications of those decisions.

title: LEEDS LATE RALLY TOPS EVERTON, 32
description: LONDON, Aug. 22 (Reuters) Leeds United, the favorite for the English soccer title, registered a 32 victory over Everton, the defending champ ion, today to become the only FirstDivision club with maxi mum points.

title: Newspaper Aide Named
description: MIAMI, Aug. 22 (UPI)James A. Keeley former research di rector of The Miami Herald Publishing Co., has been named director of a new re search division of Knight News papers, Inc. He will direct ex ploration and development of advanced newspaper technol ogy for the 16paper group.

title: WHITE SOX ROOKIE AGAIN TOPS YANKS
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 22While the Big Red Machine defeated the Mets in New York today, the Chicago White Sox un leashed the Big White Machine against the Yankees and won, 32, behind Bart Johnson's pitching and his runscoring double.

title: Margaret Lindley Wed to Charles Moncy
description: NEWTON HIGHLANDS, Mass., Aug. 22Miss Mar garet Chapple Lindley was married here this noon to Charles Edward Moncy, son of Rear Adm. Peter M. Mon cy, U. S. N., retired, of Wo burn, and Mrs. Moncy of Lanesvllle. The Rev. Duane Breeze performed the cere mony in the Congregational Church.

title: Tickets Still Available For Football at Army
description: With Army's football sea son opener against Holy Cross on Sept. 12 rapidly ap proaching, West Point football fans still have an opportunity to purchase season tickets, it was announced by Col. Gus Dielens, director of athletics. Good seats still are available, including sideline locations for the five home games.

title: SALAMANDERS DIE ALONG LAKE ERIE
description: Hundreds of salamanders, tailed mud puppies, are wash ing ashore dead from an un known cause along a 40mile stretch of the United States and Canadian shorelines of Lake Erie near Buffalo.

title: Food Concern Swells Italy's Exports
description: Italy's exports of food to the United States are ex pected to increase substan tially this year with a new line of packaged products from Italy's largest canned food processor.

title: Alworth's Retirement From Chargers Ends
description: IRVINE, Calif., Aug. 22 (UPI)Lance Alworth re ported to the training camp of the San Diego Chargers today after having an nounced his retirement at the start of the preseason practice.

title: NEW YORK PRO FIVE WINS CHARITY GAME
description: Fred Crawford of the Buffalo Braves and Walt Simon of the New York Nets combined to lead New York pros to a 115 113 victory over Philadelphia before a standingroom crowd of 4,500 yesterday at Fordham University. The basketball game was for the benetit of the Harlem Pro Basketball League and Harlem Prep.

title: In the Country of the Golden Stones
description: LYONS, France  At Villefranchesur Sane I turned off the highway and followed a narrow lane that climbed and twisted and climbed again through sloping vineyards until it reached a tiny, gray stone chapel on top of a hill. I sat on the chapel steps and remem bered the heat and bustle of Lyons, France's second largest city, no more than 20 miles away. But up there in the wine country the cool air smelled of clover, and the only sounds were bird songs.

title: Bruch Defeats Silvester At Discus in Sweden Meet
description: LUND, Sweden, Aug. 22 (AP) Rickard Bruch of Sweden, the European discus throw record holder, defeated the world rec ordholder, Jay Silvester of the United States, today for the third time in meets in Sweden this year.

title: Kirk, Rock and Burt Shoot Up Old Durango
description: DURANGO, Mexico  Known in song and story for centuries as a provincial mining and cattle town, Durango is undergoing a startling transformation. Whitefaced cattle still graze on nearby plateaus, small herds of wild horses roam the valley and doughty miners still bring silver and iron ores out of the ground, but the town has literally gone Hollywood with the growth of its 20yearold movie industry. roam the valley and doughty miners still bring silver and iron ores out of the ground, but the town has literally gone Hollywood with the growth of its 20yearold movie industry.

title: Music Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Not All Love in Tennis, Officials Find
description: Jack Stahr works for a public relations firm. Mike Dunn is in the women's cloth ing business and Jack Pitter heads a fuel oil business in Poughkeepsie. N.Y. Dave Wer chen is a lawyer. Others are doctors, school teachers and stock brokers, but their com mon bond is that they are tennis officials, who sit on the lines or in the umpire's chair, often in the hot sun.

title: Ewbank Avoids Pressure
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 22 For the Jets, the urgency of de feating the Giants in tomor row's exhibition game here at the Yale Bowl isn't as com pelling as it was last year in the first confrontation between the New York antagonists. But the change in psychology por tends a change for the better.

title: OTTO GENTSCH, 90, ASTOR CHIEF CHEF
description: Otto Gentsch, former chief chef of the Astor Hotel and a master of French and classic cuisine and the recipient of many culinary awards, died Thursday at St. Elizabeth's Hospital here. He was 90 years old.

title: Home Improvement
description: MADE of heavy gauge, autobody steel, a home utility cart re cently put on the market is equipped with two large (14inch) ball bearing wheels to simplify pushing it when heavily loaded, and to permit easy rolling over rough ground and obstruc tions. Finished with bakedon yellow enamel, the cart mea sures 34 inches long, 20 inches wide and 9 inches deep. It rests in the level po sition on two legs near the back end, and has a waist high handle with the body designed so that the load is balanced over the wheels. The front end slopes so that when tipped forward the in side is flush with the ground for eacy loading of heavy or awkward items. In addition, it comes with a special leaf bag attachment that increas es its normal 4 cubic foot capacity to 11 cubic feet. Special support rods are fur nished to carry the leaf bag attachment at each corner of the cart and grommet holes permit the bag to be quickly snapped on or removed. Haul ItAll Cart, with Leaf Bag, $24.95. (Garton Toy Compa ny, Sheboygan, Wis. 53081).

title: CALIFORNIA DECREES DEATH FOR BOMBERS
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 22 (UPI)A law that could send a person who sets off a bomb to the gas chamber has gone into effect in California, and Gov. Ronald Reagan said he hoped this would deter per sons from using this most tragic and senseless form of violence.

title: Soviet Plans CheckUp On Pollution of Volga
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 22 (Reuters) The Soviet Union today an nounced a 20day cleanup campaign on the Volga River in its battle against pollution.

title: Explosion in St. Paul Store
description: ST. PAUL, Aug. 22 (A1)A bomb exploded in a rest room of Dayton's, a downtown department store, today, in juring a woman, the police said. It was the second bomb blast within a week in the Twin Cities area. The police said they found a second bomb in the store and defused it. The injured woman was identi fied as Mary Peek, 48 years old, who was listed in satis factory condition at a hospital.

title: REAGAN REBUFFED ON TAX PROPOSAL
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 22 The longest state legislative session in California's history has ended after producing a series of disappointments for conservationists and defeating Gov. Ronald Reagan's proposal for a $1billion shift in state and local taxes.

title: Would You Believe I Was Once A Famous Star? It's the Truth!
description: Look at the eyes. They can be green, blue, brown or black, but they'll be piercing with hypnotic intensity. Most people feel nervous and ill at ease un der Scorpio's steady gaze. You'll have to break the spell and look away first... It's a foolproof identification of the Pluto personality. Scorpio eyes bore deeply into you, mercilessly, as if they're penetrating your very soul. They are.

title: Typhoon Near Japan Abates
description: TOKYO, Aug. 22 (AP)Ty phoon Anita, which killed 20 people, dissolved into a tropi cal storm today as it headed north in the Sea of Japan for a second swipe at land.

title: EXHIBITIONS
description: KODAK GALLERY1133 Avenue of the Americas. More than 80 scenes from National Parks in the U.S. Indefinite run. Hours, 10 to 5:00, Monday through Saturday.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Everywhere in the vicinity of the Mets one hears the same questions: Will they win it again? Why not? What's wrong?

title: 150 Soccer Fans in Belfast Raid Catholic Housing Area
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 22 (UPI)About 150 per sons returning from a soccer match today broke down a gate near a predominantly Roman Catholic housing area and provoked 40 minutes of stone throwing.

title: Dallas Tops Illinois Nine
description: FARMINGTON, N.M., Aug. 22 (AP)Dallas defeated Spring field, III., 10, today in the Con nie Mack World Series. Dallas scored in the bottom of the sec ond when Rick Burley doubled and scored on a single by Larry Ratcliffe.

title: Colleges Prepare for Impact of Rising Cost and More Unrest on Campus
description: Football's varsity set will join the alumni pros in the 1970 pigskin parade this week. It's an earlier start than usual for the col legians, by a week or so. The reason: the National Collegiate Athletic Association's decision to raise the schedule limit from 10 to 11 games. Since in most cases the extra game was scheduled early instead of late, the allowable dates for the start of practice were moved up accordingly.

title: Ghanian Seeks Top Post
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Aug. 22 (UP) Chief Justice Edward Akufo Addo of Ghana announced to day that he was resigning his post to become a candidate the Aug. 31 presidential elec tion.

title: Howard Johnson Builds in Canada
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 22 (CP) The Howard Johnson Com pany of Boston opened its first Canadian restaurant this week in downtown Mont real. A company spokesman said the American concern planned to construct at least 40 combined motor lodge restaurants in Canada over the next 20 years, through its Canadian licensee, Oranger of Canada, Ltd.

title: Inquiry at Kent Leaves Key Issues Cloudy
description: KENT, Ohio, Aug. 21  In three days of public hearings at Kent State University this week, the President's Commis sion on Campus Unrest heard a great deal of contradictory testimony and left many ques tions unresolved. Among them were: what caused the four days and nights of disorder, including downtown window smashing and the burning of an RO.T.C. building; who made crucial decisions on how the National Guard would be used; how dangerous was the situa tion; exactly what happened when four students died in a volley of Guard rifle fire last May 4, and what should be done now? tions unresolved. Among them were: what caused the four days and nights of disorder, including downtown window smashing and the burning of an RO.T.C. building; who made crucial decisions on how the National Guard would be used; how dangerous was the situa tion; exactly what happened when four students died in a volley of Guard rifle fire last May 4, and what should be done now?

title: TexasSized Computer Set?
description: DALLAS, Aug. 22  Tex as Instruments, Inc., appears to be edging into the com putermaking business as one means of promoting the exceptionally rapid growth rate to which management has committed itself.

title: Advertising:
description: In the fastmoving world of magazine journalism, one of the groups making loud noises these days is the youth magazines. Their quest for advertiser dollars and for reader circulation has never been stronger, while their editorial content ranges the gamut of teen age interests from music to fashion.

title: Valiant Beats Heritage by 2 Minutes 49 Seconds in Cup Trial Off Newport
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 22If Happiness is Valiant, as the nametags and banners of that yacht's syndicate insist, then Unhappiness is beginning to look very much like Heritage.

title: Alaskans Fear Boom In Oil Will Mar Land
description: PRUDHOE BAY, Alaska, Aug. 17Fifty huge barges have been edging their way through the, icechoked Arctic Ocean in re cent weeks, hauling supplies to the oil fields here on the North Slope of Alaska.

title: Study of Foreign Languages Declines
description: The heavy emphasis placed on foreign language instruc tion in American schools and colleges for several years after the Russians launched their Sputnik in 1957 is under attack from some educators, students and parents.

title: Coast Priest Is Fighting Police Tactics
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Aug. 22 A 30yearold white Episco pal priest whose parishioners are the hippies, freaks, heads and teenyboppers living near the University of California campus is leading a campaign against the city's police de partment.

title: The FDA Orders a Total Cyclamate Ban
description: WASHINGTONCancer of the bladder has increased sharply among Americans in the last decade. The incidence of the disease has doubled for men and also risen, though not as sharply, among women.

title: Beame Asks Master Plan To Set Up DayCare Centers
description: A Master plan for the estab lishment of daycare centers was proposed yesterday by Con troller Abraham D. Beame.

title: Mrs. Edward C. Green Of Capital Has a Son
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 22A son was born last Saturday to Mr. and Mrs. Edward Crocker Green in the George town University Hospital here. Mrs. Green is the for mer Miss Katharine S. McCaf frey of Baltimore. Mr. Green is a teaching assistant and a doctoral candidate at the Catholic University here.

title: Article 5  No Title
Miss Darrin Wed To James Sanford
description: RIVERSIDE, Conn. Aug. 22  Miss Hannah Lee Darrin, daughter of Ralph M. Darrin Jr. of Old Greenwich and Schenectady, N. Y., and the late Mrs. Frances Darrin, was married here this afternoon in St. Paul's Episcopal Church to James Falconer Sanford. He is a son of Francis F. San ford of New Canaan and Del ray Beach, Fla., and Mrs. John L. Richards of Green wich.

title: Budgetary Cutbacks Take Edge Off Kent State Football Outlook
description: KENT, Ohio, Aug. 22The radio in the assistant coach's office blared the commission testimony to an intense audi ence while across the hall Paul Schlemmer, the sports informa tion director at Kent State Uni versity tried to tell it like it's been.

title: Mayor Urged to Ban Cars Below 59th St. During Day
description: Unhappy over Mayor Lind say's compromise on the build ing of a new power plant in Queens, Citizens for Clean Air called on the Mayor yesterday to demonstrate his goodwill and immediately ban private automobile traffic from the central business districtManhattan south of 59th Street during normal business hours

title: Nobody Except Me Likes It Much  But l Do
description: IN the Brooklyn Museum's Community Gallery, which is more frequently devoted to worthy causes than to worthy art, they are holding just now a show that falls at least 99 per cent with in the former category. Art of the Elders of Brooklyn is an exhibition of arts and crafts by more than 50 senior citizens of the borough who have been enjoying them selves in classes at the Metropolitan Jew ish Geriatrics Center, the Menorah Home and Hospital, the Red Hook Senior Center, and the Tilden Senior Center.

title: Laver, Emerson Advance To Colonial Tennis Final
description: FORT WORTH, Aug. 22 (AP) Rod Laver and Roy Emerson, both of Australia, gained the final tonight of the Colonial national invitation tennis tour nament.

title: Jane Peabody Hamlin Is Bride Of Hilary Francis Russell Jr.
description: SOUTH DARTMOUTH, Mass., Aug. 22  Miss Jane Peabody Hamlin, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Edward Hamlin Jr., was married in St. Aidan's Episcopal Chapel here at noon today to Hilary Francis Russell Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Russell of Manchester, Conn.

title: Msgr. Joseph McCaffrey Dies; Warred on Smut Peddlers Here
description: Mgr. Joseph A. McCaffrey, pastor emeritus of Holy Cross Roman Catholic Church, 331 West 42d Street, who was known as the Bishop of Times Square, died yesterday of a heart attack in Cherry Hill, N. J., where he lived after his retirement in 1968. His age was 80.

title: Webster Goes All Out
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 22  So much has changed for the New York Giants since last summer that they give at least an illu sion of progress as they pre pare for the Jet game to morrow.

title: Connecticut Peace Candidate Shakes Up Democrats
description: HARTFORD  Steadily the votes mounted for the Rev. Joseph D. Duffey. He never dropped behind, and by the end of the evening the Protestant minister, who had been against the war in Vietnam long before that was the vogue, had won the Democratic Senate nomination in Connecticut by a wide margin.

title: Washington : Fulbright's Startling Proposal
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22At first glance, Senator Fulbright coming out for a U. S. treaty guarantee of the State of Israel is a little like Spiro Agnew of fering to take over the editor ship of The New York Times. It is a surprising proposal from a surprising source at a surpris ing time, but nevertheless, it is Worth considering.

title: Concorde Hits 1,000 M.P.H.
description: LONDON, Aug. 22 (Reuters) Concorde 002, the British version of the BritishFrench supersonic airliner, reached its fastest speed so far, 1,000 miles an hour, during a test flight tonight. The French versionConcorde 001  has reached speeds of more than 1,000 miles an hour.

title: DR. GANG TO QUIT HARLEM SCHOOLS
description: Dr. Seymour Gang, a New York educator who as principal of Public School 129 in Harlem raised the reading scores of young slum children well above the average level of other poor children in New York City schools, is resigning after one year as superintendent of School District 5.

title: A Talk With Albert Speer
description: To read Albert Speer's book, to see him on television, or to talk to him, is a profoundly disconcerting experience. One knows he was an early and willing Nazi, as close a friend as Hitler would permit, the inventor of the mass rally settings we remember as the very essence of Nazi style, the designer of in humanly scaled edifices and the most effective organizer of the German war economy. One knows he ac cepted full responsibility and paid the penalty of 20 years in Berlin's Spandau prison.

title: Japan's Autos Up
description: TOKYO, Aug. 22 (AP) Japan produced 464,346 four wheeled motor vehicles in July, down 2.2 per cent from June but up 9.4 per cent from July, 1969, the Japan Auto mobile Manufacturers Associ ation said. The association said the July figure brought to 3,037,152 the number of fourwheeled motor vehicles produced in the first seven months of this year, up 16.8 per cent from the like period a year ago.

title: GUERRILLAS SEIZE EDITOR IN AMMAN
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 22Arab commandos have kid napped Salim alSharif, a prom inent Palestinian editor thought to favor a Middle Eastern settle ment, Jordanian officials re ported today.

title: Mercury Is Found in Ducks From Lake St. Clair
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22One of the most mercurypol luted bodies of water in North America is believed to be Lake St. Clair, which sits between Lake Huron and Lake Erie in the DetroitWindsor, Ont., in dustrial complex.

title: Alison A. Walter Bride of Cleric
description: SEWICKLEY, Pa., Aug. 22 Miss Alison Ann Walter was married here this after noon to the Rev. Richard Knott Martin, rector of Grace Episcopal. Church in George town, Washington.

title: Du Pont to Close Wisconsin Plant
description: BARKSDALE, Wis., Aug. 22 (UPI)I. E. du Pont de Nemours & Co. plans to dis continue operation of the TNT plant and all acid facil ities at its works here at the end of March, 1971.

title: Mrs. Milliken Wed to Charles Young 3d
description: GUILFORD, Conn. Aug. 22  Mrs. Nancy Cooper Mil liken of New York and Sachem's Head was married this afternoon in the Con gregational Church to Charles T. Young 3d of Darien. The Rev. Hal McElwane Helms performed the ceremony.

title: U.S. Migrants to Australia Say They Fled Tension
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 22 (AP)A Government survey has concluded that tension in the United States is the main reason for an increase in the number of Americans migrating to Australia.

title: TREATY ASSAILED IN EAST GERIANY
description: BERLIN, Aug. 22  East Germany's official Communist youth newspaper, Young World, has warned that West Germany plans to use the new Bonn Moscow treaty to undermine the status of Communist East ern Europe.

title: 2 German Guards Defect
description: BERLIN (UPI)Two young East German border guards climbed the Berlin wall with their machine guns last night and asked for asylum, the West German police said today.

title: One Way to Keep Your Weight Down
description: ONE prescription for los ing weight is to be come a pianist for the Newport Music Festi val. Watching some of them in action for the 1970 event, which ended two weeks ago, was in itself exhausting. There were other instrumen talists who rehearsed and per formed above and beyond the call of duty, notably the vio linists Raymond Gniewek and Tony Rapport and the cel lists George Ricci and Leszek Zawistowski. Still, it was a trio of pianists  all quite slim  who bore the brunt of the work, since almost all the unfamiliar music that went into the 24 programs presented within 10 days re quired the services of one of them. They deserve a foot note  fingernote (?)  for their efforts. was in itself exhausting. Miss Julie Ann Robinson Is Married
description: VINEYARD HAVEN, Mass., Aug. 22  Miss Julie Ann Robinson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin M. Robin son of New York, Barbados and this Martha's Vineyard community, was married in a garden ceremony at her par ents home here this after noon to Frederic P. Kistler, son of Mr. and Mrs. George W. Kistler of Allentown, Pa.

title: Q:
description: J.W. writes: A young man asked George Moore if he recommended that the young man become a novelist. Moore said no. The young man asked why, since he had become one himself. Moore said, I didn't have to ask. What is the source of this anecdote?

title: Said Nixon to George Shultz: I Track Well With You
description: WASHINGTON.

title: Robbery Suspect Is Killed, Another Is Caught in Bronx
description: One of two men who the po lice said held up a taxi garage in the Bronx early yesterday was shot and killed as he and his alleged accomplice fled pursuing patrolman.

description: At first blush, this ironically titled novel seems to be about the love story behind the A Bomb. But a Strangelove story it is not. The nuclear scien tists that Thomas McMahon writes aboutvery much at second hand, since he was born

title: Article 3  No Title
German Trawler Burning
description: BREMERHAVEN, West Ger many, Aug. 22 (Reuters)One seaman died today and eight others were missing after their West German trawler caught fire in the North Sea several miles off the coast, the police said.

title: Miss Gardner Is Bride Of Richard Palmer Jr.
description: Mrs. Palmer and a senior at Tarkio College in Missouri.

title: San Antonio's River Walk: Fiestas With a TexMex Touch
description: SAN ANTONIO, TeicOur table is on a restaurant terrace above Paseo del Riothe River Walkwhich borders the horseshoe curve of the San Antonio River as it flows through downtown San Antonio. It is a balmy summer night. We have finished our Texas steaks and half the red wine. Below us, festive sounds and an aura of celebration filter through leafy tops of magnolia, pecan and cypress trees. Somewhere not far away, a guitarist is playing a malaguelia.

title: Miss Carlyle Bodman Is Married
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Aug. 22Miss Carlyle Berdan Badman and James Calvin Hughes Jr., juniors at the Uni versity of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, were married this afternoon. The Rev. Dr.

title: UAW. WITHDRAWS NEWSDAY PETITION
description: The United Automobile Work ers Union has withdrawn its petition to the National Labor Relations Board for the right to represent news, employes at Newsday, the Long Island news paper.

title: Cattle Industry Warned On the Use of a Hormone
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP) A top Food and Drug Admin istration official has warned the cattle industry that use of the hormone DES will be banned if residues of the cancerinciting agent continue to slip into America's beef supply.

title: 12Month School Year Called A Success by Missouri District
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 22An ex periment requiring students to attend school on a yearround basis has been ruled a success and will be expanded through out most of a suburban school district near here.

title: 6 Die in Auto Crash
description: SWEET SPRINGS, Mo., Aug. 22 (UPI)  Six persons were killed and one seriously injured today when a Volkswagen bus slammed into the rear of a parked tractortrailer truck on Interstate 70 near here. Killed were John Sears, 23 years old, of Richmond, the driver of the autobus; William Wiebold, 17, of Baldwin, L. I., Thomas DeSilva, 22, of Levittown, L. I., Michael Herrington of Morro Bay, Calif.; Michael Sandoval of Denver, and an unidentified person.

title: Lynne A. Smee Wed in Jersey
description: NORTHVALE, N. J., Aug. 22Miss Lynne Ann Smee, daughter of. Mr. and Mrs. John Smee, was married here this morning to J. Dennis Kohler, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Kohler of Teaneck.

description: TodayAmerican Hot Rod As sociation summer national drag racing finals at New York Na tional Speedway, Center Mori ches, L. I., 2 P.M.

title: ScienceFiction Bleeps and Corned Beef Hash
description: SANTA FE, N. M. ALL the goodwill, all the theory and all the as pirations in the world will not make an opera, and Luciano Berio's Opera, which had its world premiere on Aug. 13 at the Santa Fe Opera, helps prove the point.

title: Marion Manger Becomes Bride Of John Bertles
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 22Miss Marion Bell Manger, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Julius Manger Jr., was mar ried here this afternoon to John Harrison Bertles, son of Mr. and Mrs. William M. Bertles also of Greenwich.

title: Justice's Son Plans to Marry Judith A. Smith
description: WESTON, Conn., Aug. 22 Mr. and Mrs. Clifford E. Smith of Weston and Free dom, N.H., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Judith Ann Smith, to Potter Stewart Jr., the elder son of Associate Justice Potter Stewart of the United States Supreme Court, and Mrs. Stewart of Wash ington.

title: McCarthy Is Seeking To Rewin House Seat
description: BUFFALO, Aug. 22Rep resentative Richard Max McCarthy, the Buffalo Dem ocrat who tried unsuccess fully to win his party's nomination for the United States Senate, is seeking reelection under the emblem of the newly formed Conser vation party.

title: Captain and 5 Abandon Burning Ship
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 22 (AP)A determined Philippine skipper and five crewmen who had held out to the last abandoned their burning, listing freighter, the Done Jose Figueras, tonight in the Pacific 900 miles northwest of San Francisco.

title: KATHY HARTER GAINS SPOT IN JERSEY NET
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Aug., 22 Kathy Harter of Seal Beach, Calif.; Chris Evert of Fort Lauderdale, Fla.; Lany Kaligas of Indonesia and Pam ela Teeguarden of Los Angeles qualified today for the Marl boro open tennis championship at the Short Hills club.

title: Sponsoring Sisters
description: The sponsors of Wednesday's strike, all women, most of whom will march in the parade that day, include Repre sentative Shirley (I'd rath er be black than female) Chisholm, the New York Democrat;. Ethel Scull, a socialite whose benefit cocktail party in East Hamptonfeaturing an unexpected partly nude woman swimmer  help ed finance the strike; Jeannette Rankin, the former Congresswoman and longtime peace ac tivist; Bella Abzug,, Dem ocratic Congressional candidate from Man hattan; Joan Rivers, the comedienne; Gloria Vanderbilt Cooper, the socialite; Beulah Sand ers, National Welfare Rights Organization; Gloria Steinem, journal ist; Barbara Harris, the actress; Ronnie Eldridge, special assistant to Mayor Lindsay; Carol Greitzer, Manhattan councilwoman; Kate Mil lett, author of Sexual Politics"; Florynce Ken nedy, lawyer; and Elean or Holmes Norton, of New York City's Human Rights Commission.Chisholm, the New York Democrat; Ethel Scull, a socialite whose benefit cocktail party in East Hamptonfeaturing an unexpected partly nude woman swimmer  help ed finance the strike; Jeannette Rankin, the former Congresswoman and longtime peace ac tivist; Bella Abzug, Dem ocratic Congressionalcandidate from Man hattan; Joan Rivers, the comedienne; Gloria Vanderbilt Cooper, the socialite; Beulah Sand ers, National Welfare Rights Organization; Gloria Steinem, journal ist; Barbara Harris, the actress; Ronnie Eldridge, special assistant to Mayor Lindsay; Carol Greitzer, Manhattan councilwoman; Kate Mil lett, author of Sexual Politics"; Florynce Ken nedy, lawyer; and Elean or Holmes Norton, of New York City's Human Rights Commission.

title: In Memoriam
description: JACOBSONJack. In memory of my father who departed on August 23, 1964.

title: Old Boats Never Die in Clayton, N. Y.
description: With the Thousand Islands Museum acting as sponsor, a record total of 103 classic examples of what boats once looked like were paraded, judged and suitably honored last week at the sixth annual antique boat show at Clay ton. N. Y.

title: 3 L.I. Bus Concerns to Use Routes of Shut Down Lines
description: ALBANY, Aug. 22The State Public Service Commission has authorized three Long Island bus companies to take over the routes of two other Nassau County lines that have shut down in protest over refusal of the commission to grant them immediate rate increases.

title: Reader's Report
description: Since William Seabrook's Asylum, I have read enough fictional and nonfictional dis closures of what goes on in a mental institution to qualify as an attendant. I have been on deck for the lobotomy craze, the electroshock era and the dawn of chemotherapy. The best asylum novels, like Ken Kesey's One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest and Jennifer Dawson's The HaHa, are written from the inside looking out. The ones written by the psychiatric establishment tend to operate on the Grand Hotel plan: a list of case histories investigated by a semiautobi ographical healer. Labyrinth of Silence falls into the latter category, and has the struc tural weakness of its ilk. the electroshock era and the dawn of chemotherapy. The ones written by the psychiatric establishment tend to operate on the Grand Hotel plan: a list of case histories investigated by a semiautobi ographical healer. Labyrinth of Silence falls into the latter category, and has the struc tural weakness of its ilk.

title: What Shall It Profit a Theater If...?
