title: Family Is Grateful To Fresh Air Fund After Visit by Boys
description: Mr. and Mrs. Dean McCarthy held a family council before they deceided to invite two Fresh Air Fund youngsters to their home in Westport, Conn., this summer.

title: INTERCLUB SAIL SERIES
description: First RoundRiverside, Conn., Y.C. (Dean W. Matthews. George Scott, Daniel Jack son) defeated Pequot Y.C., Southport, Conn. (James A. Ostheimer, Parker Silver, Brad Dellenbaugh), 2.0 (first race after dis qualification of Pequot; American V.C., (William H. Lynn Jr., Robert Shattuck, James G. McCulloh) defeated Noroton, Conn., Y.C. (Robert Smith, William Howe, Andrew Smith), 20; Greenwich Cove, Conn., Racing Association (Peter Gallo way. Andrew Nelson, Michael Whitehead) drew a bye; Indian Harbor Y.C. (Thomas Hume, David Lindsay, Jeff Neuberth) leads SeawanhakaCorinthian Y.C. (Herbert Gum precht, Michael Dunlaevy, Robert Broege), 1.0.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor:

title: Women Seeking Equality March on 5th Ave. Today
description: With the city's blessing in the form of a proclamation designating today Equality for Women Day, the organizers of the Women's Strike for Equal ity exuberantly announced final plans yesterday for demonstra tions that they said would bring thousands to their parade down Fifth Avenue.

title: S. S. Kresge Profit Up 23.5% in Period
17,697 at Minnesota Ball Park Evacuated Over Bomb Threat
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 25 (AP)The Minnesota Twins announced tonight during a game against the Boston Red Sox that a bomb threat had been received and 17,697 persons watching the game in Metropolitan Stadium were ordered to evacuate the park.

title: Oklahoma Judge Is Injured By Bomb Explosion in Car
description: TULSA, Okla., Aug. 25 (UPI) District Judge Fredrick Nel son, 41 years old, was serious ly injured today by a bomb that exploded as he got into his car in front of his house. Mr. Nelson was seeking his first full term as district judge in Oklahoma's primary today.

title: Bill Rates Register Advances At Treasury's Monthly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25Treasury bill rates advanced at today's auction from last month's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: 24 Injured on Boat Off Ocean City Pier As Engine Explodes
description: OCEAN CITY, N. J., Aug. 25 (AP)  An engine aboard a sightseeing speedboat with 117 persons aboard exploded in Great Egg Harbor Bay tonight but only one person was hos pitalized. Twentythree other passengers were treated and re leased at Shore Memorial Hos pital.

title: Braves Down Mets, 76, With Five Unearned Runs
description: The road to losing pennants is paved with wasted opportu nities, and the New York Mets unwrapped some massive pav ing blocks last night before 48,561 spectators at Shea Sta dium as they lost to the Atlan ta Braves, 76.

title: Mrs. Myers Is Wed to a Lawyer
description: Mrs. Margaret Wistar Frantz Myers, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Gibson Frantz of Princeton, N. J., was married in a civil ceremony in Juarez, Mexico, yesterday to Thomas Dutton Wellington, a New York lawyer. He is the son of Mrs. Herbert Galbraith Well ington of New York and Lo cust Valley, L. I., and the late Mr. Wellington, an invest ment banker and a former governor of the New York Stock Exchange.

title: GIANTS TO START SHINER ON FRIDAY
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Aug. 25was a tale of two quarter backs, Dick Shiner and ?? Davis, in the New York Giants football camp today at C. W. Post College.

title: While Mother Works, the Company Takes Care of the Children
description: FALL RIVER, Mass.Angie Khoury kept her sewing machine going at a steady clip as she talked about how happy her 3yearold son Jimmy was in the day care center across the street.

title: Community Dispute Cuts Service at City Hospital
description: Lincoln Hospital in the South Bronx said yesterday that was terminating its obstetrical and gynecological services be cause 24 of 28 physicians in the department had walked off their posts in a dispute involv ing community groups.

title: Los Angeles Looks Eastward for Plan to Revive Decaying Midtown
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 25Angelenos are turning cast for advice on how to make their downtown grow in an orderly fashion.

title: Nixon Aide Sees Danger In New Defense Cutbacks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25The Nixon Administration has concluded it would be a needless gamble with the national security to cut military spending next year much below the $73.6billion level proposed for this year.

title: Parade Today
description: The Equality for Women parade is scheduled to start at 5:30 P.M. at 59th Street and Fifth Avenue and proceed down Fifth Avenue to Bryant Park behind the main branch of the Public Library between 40th and 42d Streets, where it will end in time for a 7:30 P.M. rally.

title: Market Place:
description: Most investors have a hazy impression that something evil can befall them when the brokerage house they deal with goes under. But unless they have actually been caught in a collapse, they have no clear idea of their liabilities.

title: Five Poles Hijack Trawler
description: RONNE, Denmark, Aug. 25 (Reuters)  Four stowaways and a crewman hijacked a Po lish trawler today and sailed it to Bornholm, a Danish island in the Baltic Sea, to seek po litical asylum, the police report ed. They said the five Poles, aged 17 to 20, told them they locked the captain of the traw ler in a cabin and seized the vessel.

title: MacRae Ross, Lisa E. Schnall Plan to Marry
description: Miss Lisa Elliot Schnall, senior at Pembroke College, and MacRae Lampland Ross, a 1970 graduate of Brown University, will be married in All Souls Unitarian Church here on Sept. 12.

title: L.I. RELIEF ROLLS SHOW SHARP RISE
description: Welfare rolls in Long Island showed an accelerating rise yes terday, attributed in part to economic difficulties, as was the sharp June surge reported in New York City for June.

title: M'GOVERN FAVORS WELFARE CHANGES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP) Senator George S. McGovern disputed today reports that Senate liberals were obstruct ing the Nixon Administration's welfare reform bill. But he urged several revisions, includ ing one for full Federal control.

title: Sex Researchers Are Sued by ExPatient for $750,000
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 25Dr. William Masters and Mrs. Vir ginia Johnson, the sex re searchers, have been sued for $750,000 on the ground that they used the plaintiff's wife to give sexual treatment to two men patients.

title: SOVIET'S AIRLIFT TO PERU HALTED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (UPI)The Soviet Union has quietly ended its airlift of re lief supplies to Peruvian earth quake victims after delivering 21 of the promised 65 plane loads.

title: Midtown Bank Is Robbed
description: A man with a gun concealed beneath a jacket carried over his hand held up a teller at the Fifth Avenue branch of the American Bank and Trust Com pany, at 46th Street yesterday. He escaped with about $1,500.

title: Enlisted Woman, 23, Sues Navy Over Sexual Rights
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 25An un married Navy enlisted woman whose stillborn child was fathered by an enlisted sailor has filed suit against the United States Navy. She charges that its subsequent decision to dis miss her from service because of terminated pregnancy was based on a double sexual stand ard and was therefore, a viola tion of her constitutional rights.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Atlanta Braves, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8 P.M.

title: JAPAN EASES CURBS ON INVESTING THERE
description: TOKYO, Aug. 25 (UPI)The Japanese Government approved today recommendations for li beralizing foreign investment in 323 industries, thus opening 80 per cent of Japan's markets to foreign investment.

title: Vatican Plans Rebuttal
description: ROME, Aug. 25 (AP)The Vatican plans to publish pic tures and interviews to show that Roman Catholic nuns from India are happy and well adjusted in Europe despite al legations that some novices have been maltreated and forced to do menial work, in formed sources said today.

title: 84% in Poll Say They'd Support Qualified Women for Congress
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Aug. 25  Eightyfour per cent of Americans say they would vote for a woman for Congress if she were qualified for the job, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: FORD BALLANTYNE JR.
description: DETROIT, Aug. 25Ford Bal lantyne Jr., a director of the Wyandotte Chemicals Corpora tion and vice president and general manager of its chemi cal specialties group, died here Yesterday. He was 54 years old.

title: Cabby Fatally Stabbed
description: A cab driver was stabbed to death early this morning near Mount Morris Park in Harlem, the police said. They reported that the driver, Irving Willner, 58 years old, of 172 Fifth Avenue, Brooklyn, was stabbed in his cab at Mount Morris Park West, near 121st Street, and lost control of the car, which rolled into a light pole and knocked it down. Wit nesses said that three young men fled from the cab before the driver staggered out and died from his wounds on the sidewalk.

title: ARGUMENTS END IN PANTHER TRIAL
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 25Lon nie McLucas was characterized today by his own attorney as that shnook and by the pros ecutor as Mr. Ready Willing and Able in final arguments before the jury at the end of his 10week trial in Superior Court here.

title: Agnew Finds Seoul Tough In Bargaining on Arms Aid
description: SEOUL, South Korea Wednesday, Aug. 26  Vice President Agnew inspected al lied defense positions south of the Korean demilitarized zone this morning after learning how tough the South Koreans can be at the bargaining table.

title: 14 Hurt as British Airliner Dives to Avoid 3 U.S. Jets
description: HONG KONG, Wednesday, Aug. 26 (Reuters)  A Boeing 707 of the British Overseas Air ways Corporation dived 2,000 feet over the South China Sea yesterday to avoid three ap proaching United States war planes.

title: Mideast Peace Hopes
description: The historic importance of the ArabIsraeli negotia tions just begun at the United Nations extends far beyond the regional conflict that Ambassador Jarring seeks to mediate. Nowhere else in the world is there so much danger that the superpowers could be drawn into a confrontation neither of them wants.

title: CORN FUTURES UP ON HEAVY BUYING
description: Corn, along with other grains, advanced yesterday on the Chi cago Board of Trade after drop ping the day before in a con tinuation of the 7furor created by the disclosure of the corn blight in the Middle West last week.

title: Traditional Groups Prefer to Ignore Women's Lib
description: The traditional organizations that for decades have cham pioned women's rights to vote to work, to be educated and to serve their communities are facing a challenge from movement that many consider bizarre, alien and totally unac ceptable.

title: Harrolds Holds Retailers Should Entertain to Sell
description: Department stores all over the world are suffering a de clining share of the growing consumer market because they are not making shop ping either pleasurable or sufficiently exciting, accord ing to the deputy chairman of Harrods, Ltd., of London.

title: BATTISTA DEMANDS INQUIRY ON CORONA
description: Assemblyman Vito P. Battista called yesterday for a full scale inquiry by the State In vestigation Commission of the condemnation of 69 homes in the Corona section of Queens to build an athletic field and high school.

title: AGENCY MAY EASE CURB ON MERCURY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP) The Interior Department which instigated lawsuits seek ing immediate and total elimin ation of mercury discharges, now says small discharges may be permitted if they prow harmless.

title: CROSSFIRE HITS 6 IN POLICE CHASE
description: Six persons, all of them ap parently bystanders, were wounded in the BedfordStuy vesant section of Brooklyn last night in an exchange of gun fire between two narcotics squad detectives and two al leged drug pushers.

title: Title, $10, Takes Saratoga Sprint as Favored Hasty Hitter Finishes Third
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 25Getting the juinp on her rivals at the start, Title carried the colors of the Clai borne Farm to victory in the feature race at the Spa today. A field of seven competed in the sixfurlong sprint for older fillies and mares, and Title, under the riding of Jorge Velas quez, registered the triumph in 41:10 35.

title: DR. BELLE JACOBSON OF MONTEFIORE LAB
description: Dr. Belle E. Jacobson, found er and director of the Phono cardiography Laboratory at Montefiore Hospital and Med ical Center, the Bronx, died there yesterday after a brief illness. She was 70 years old, and lived at 10 Lawrence Park Crescent. Bronxville.

title: Site of 72 P.G.A. Chosen
description: BIRMINGHAM, Mich., Aug. 25 (AP)The 1972 Professional Golfers Association national championship will be played at Oakland Hills Country Club at Birmingham. Robert D. Rowan, the club president, said yes terday the event would be held Aug. 3 to 6 for a minimum purse of $200,000.

title: Lowering the Prime Rate
description: Sometime this fall, the na tion's largest banks are almost certain to take action to lower the interest rate they charge theif biggest and most credit worthy corporate customers. But it is highly un likely that the change will come prior to midSep tember, when com panies will have to borrow heavily to pay taxes, and almost equally unlikely after Thanksgiving, when loans normally show a strong sea sonal spurt.

title: Jersey Boat Explodes
description: OCEAN CITY, N.J., Aug. 25 (AP)An engine exploded to day aboard sightseeing boat, the Flying Saucer, which is ad vertised as the world's fastest speedboat, and 24 of the 117 passengers were injured, none seriously. Many donned life belts, jumped overboard and were picked up by nearby boats.

title: Dispute Involving Race Arises In Rafferty Election Campaign
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 25A dispute involving race was injected today into the election campaign in which Dr. Max Rafferty is trying to win a term as State Superintendent of Pub lie Instruction against the chal lenge of Wilson Riles. The ef fect was to emphasize for Cali fornia voters that Mr. Riles is a Negro.

title: Catholic Clergy in Brazil Say Priest Was Tortured by Police
description: RECIFE, Brazil, Aug. 25The Roman Catholic bishops and priests of Maranhao state in northeastern Brazil have as serted that a young Brazilian priest was tortured by the police to force him to incrimi nate himself and the work of the church there.

title: 30 Hurt as Amsterdam Police Battle With Hippie Protesters
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands, Aug. 25 (Reuters)About 30 people were injured, three of them by police bullets, in a sevenhour battle between policemen and hippies in the heart of Amsterdam last night.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. At the Western White House President Nixon designated Sept. 13 as the be ginning of National Hispanic Heritage Week and called for special ceremonies to cele brate the contribution of the Spanish to the nation's cul ture.

title: ISIDOR KAPLAN
description: Isidor Kaplan, a textile man ufacturer, died yesterday after a long illness. He was 72 years old and lived at the Essex House.

title: Panel Clears Bill Giving Pollution Curbs Priority
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (AP)  The Senate Banking Committee approved a bill to day giving a priority under the Small Business Act to loans sought for development or use of pollutioncontrol equipment.

title: U.S. Health Aides Discount Cholera Threat to Tourists but Advise Vaccination
description: Cholera, which has brought travel restrictions to the south ern resort area of the Soviet Union, is a severe, often fatal intestinal infection most often spread through contaminated water supplies and treated with, intravenous fluids and anti biotics.

title: TALKS ON MIDEAST BEGIN AT THE U.N.; OPTIMISM VOICED
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 25The first concerted diplomatic effort in more than two decades to bring a formal peace settlement to the Middle East opened at the United Na tions today amid guarded ex pressions of optimism by all the parties.

title: Lindsay Bids Cities Press U.S. for Clean Environment
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 25Mayor Lindsay told the Na tional Municipal League today that there could be a decent environment if Washington de cided to change its priorities.

title: Barcelona Combats Growth Problems
description: BARCELONA, Spain, Aug. 15 Any city of 1.8 million in habitants that manages to keep 60,000 trees along its streets must be doing something right.

title: Clashes in Naples
description: NAPLES, Italy, Aug. 25 (UP) At least 39 persons have been injured in two nights of fighting between policemen trying to trap a motorcyclist and thou sands jamming the heart of the city to see him.

title: Kent State Aide Resigns
description: KENT, Ohio, Aug. 25 (AP)Dr. Robert E. Matson, vice president of student affairs at Kent State University, has re signed to become president of Ricker College in Houlton, Me.

title: Berkshire Theater Survives a Summer of Discontent
description: STOCKBRIDGE, Mass.Po lice Chief William Obanhein, Officer Obie in the movie Alice's Restaurant, stood in the middle of Main Street di recting traffic. As the cars crawled slowly through town, he commented, Traffic is off almost 50 per cent this sum mer.

title: Weeden Shows Profit in Half, In Contrast to Loss a Year Ago
description: Weeden & Co., a brokerage house that specializes over thecounter trading in listed securities, the socalled third market, scored a sharp turnaround in profits in the first half of 1970, posting net income of $1,646,472 in contrast to a net loss of $1,779,928 in the 1969 period.

title: TomatoProduct Duties
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25The Treasury began proceed ings today leading toward im position of countervailing duties on tomato products from Greede on the ground that they are subsidized.

title: Newsmen Reach Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia,Wed nesday, Aug. 26 (Reuters) Two newsmen, Xavier Baron of France and Johannes Duynis veld of the Netherlands, re leased by antigovernment forces near Angkor yesterday, arrived here today and im mediately left for Paris.

title: Lebanese Villagers Demand Protection
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 25  About 300 villagers from southern Lebanon descended on this capital today demand ing Government protection against Israeli attacks. One villager said: If the Govern ment does not give us protec tion, we will bring the war to Beirut.

title: Article 1  No Title
Monday Night Fights
description: New Orleans  Alvin Phillips, New Orleans, outpointed Willie Warren, Corpus Christi, Tex., ?? 10 rounds.

title: Delegates to the Peace Talks
description: The United Arab Republic's representative in the Middle East peace talks here, Mo hammed Hassan elZayyat, has been described as a slow moving, friendly brown bear in hornrim glasses.

title: Above Suspicion
description: Senator Joseph Tydings of Maryland is an outstand ingly able and progressive legislator who has shown much courage and independence in his six years the Senate. He is one of only fourteen Senators who has made public any report on his personal finances.

title: Nixon to Honor Labor At White House Dinner
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 25 (AP)President Nix on issued a Labor Day salute to America's working men and women today and an nounced that he would give a dinner and hold an out door torchlight military cere mony at the White House on Labor DaySept. 7, in honor of labor leaders.

title: VOTES ARE TALLIED IN A.J. PROXY FIGHT
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mo., Aug. 25 (AP) Stockholders of A. J. Industries met today and ad journed for 24 hours to give accountants time to finish their job of counting and verifying proxy statements.

title: Former H.R.A. Aide Is Charged in Theft And Check Forgery
description: A 30yearold former city employe has been arrested and charged with impersonating former Human Resources Ad ministrator Mitchell I. Ginsberg or Ginsberg aides to cash $6,000 in stolen or forged checks.

title: BIG BOARD IS HIT BY PROFIT TAKING
description: The stock market absorbed some heavy profit taking yes terday but rallied late in the session to close slightly high er on some key indicators. Bluechip stocks leveled off while glamour issues continued to soar.

title: LINDSAY RESTATES CORRUPTION EDICT
description: Mayor Lindsay, in a move apparently directed at the Po lice Department, has ordered all heads of city agencies to obey an anticorruption order he originally issued 15 months ago.

title: Roundup: McNally Lands No. 20 for 3d Year in Row
description: On a night of extrainning games, a bomb threat, and ninthinning heroics, Dave McNally plodded along to his 20th victory of the season as the Orioles whipped the Oak land A's, 51, at Baltimore.

title: STAR CLASS SAIL WON BY KNOWLES
description: ROCKPORT, Mass., Aug. 25 Durward Knowles of Nassau, Bahamas, who won the open ing race yesterday for the Star Class North American cham pionship, moved a step closer to the title today, when he, triumphed in the second event.

title: Reconditioned Vacuum Cleaner Returns to Racing Sept. 13
description: Jim Hall is a Texas million aire who can afford to go racing in any style he likes. Yet there is a point beyond which he will not spend his own money (which may ex plain why he is wealthy). So, after the July 12 CanAm at Watkins Glen unearthed a set of problems in his ground effect Chaparral 2Jthe vacuum cleaner  Hall decided against reworking the car and racing it un til he got some sponsorship money to defray the costs. Neither he nor his staff has signed any new sponsors but the primary angel, General Electric, has produced some fresh funds. Result: Hall will race the Chaparral in sev eral of the five remaining CanAins beginning Sept. 13 at Road Atlanta and not, de spite some exuberant press releases, this weekend at Elk hart Lake, Wis.

title: Researchers Induce Mystical Visions Without Drugs
description: Two researchers using psychedelic sounds, lights, pictures and other devices have concluded that ordinary people can have profound re ligious experiences like those of the great Eastern and Western mystics, without the use of drugs.

title: Thieu Seeks Further Aid
description: SAIGON. South Vietnam. Aug. 25 (UPI)  President Nguyen Van Thieu said today that he had asked the United States to increase its economic aid while pulling not American troops.

title: TODAY'S PROBABLE PITCHERS
description: Atlanta at New York (8:05 P.M.)Reed (65) vs. Koosman (8.6).

title: The Welfare Waltz
description: Welfare reform, so desperately needed, has become something of a political waltz in Washington with the Nixon Administration leading, Congress following lamely and the real necessity for forward movement all but lost in the shuffle. In taking key forward steps, as Mayor Lindsay described them in testimony before the Senate Finance Committee, the Adminis tration has also taken some serious backward steps. As a result, the impact of proposed reforms has been considerably diluted.

title: Edwin Wisherd, 69, Dies; Headed Magazine Photo Lab
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 Edwin L. Wisherd, who had re tired last Oct. 27 as chief of the photographic laboratories of the National Geographic Magazine, collapsed and died on a visit to the society's of fices yesterday. His age was 69.

title: Channel 13 to Show B.B.C.'s Civilisation in Fall
FRANK K. HEYNIGER
description: SOUTH DARTMOUTH, Mass., Aug. 25Frank K. Heyniger, director of the Lawrenceville School, Lawrenceville, N. J., and a teaching member of its history department, died yes terday at his summer home here. He was 53 years old.

title: PLAN FOR ROCK SILOS FOR ICBM'S DROPPED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (UPI) The Air Force acknowledged today that it had discarded a plan to put several hun dred Minuteman intercontinen tal missiles into new silos blasted out of solid granite. The plan was determined to be too costly.

title: Senate Votes Debate Limit On End War Amendment
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25 (UPI) The Senate, imposing a limi. tation of six hours on debate today scheduled for next Tues day a vote on its controversial amendment to end the war.

title: Timothy Dow Found Dead, ExRepresentative's Son
description: MOUNT VISION, N. Y., Aug. 25 (AP)Timothy D. Dow, 27 years old, son of former Repre sentative John Dow of Grand view, in Rockland County, was found dead today in a house belonging to his sister in this community near Oneonta.

title: Insect Epidemics Held Way to Cut Pollution
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Aug. 25 (AP)A Government en tomologist urged scientists to explore possibilities for creating lethal epidemics to day among insects by using baits spiked with germs.

title: New Yorker and Two Arabs Are Held in London After Arms Cache Is Found
description: LONDON, Aug. 25A New Yorker and two Lebanese are facing charges here after being arrested at the London Hilton Hotel when the police turned up a cache of arms and ammu nition there.

title: U.S. Tops Soviet Quintet
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 25 (Reuters) The United States beat the Soviet Union's national Junior basketball team, 6764, tonight at Tallinn.

title: Fanny May Results Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25Mortgage prices were essen tially unchanged in this week's auction, the Federal National Mortgage Association announced today.

title: JAPANESE COMPANY STUDIES NEW ENGINE
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Aug. 25The Yanmar Diesel Company of Osaka, one of Japan's largest manufacturing companies, was reported today to have signed a contract to produce a large model of Wallace L. Minto's nonpolluting, Freonpowered engine for use in boats, tractors and auxiliary power plants.

title: Starving the I.L.O.
description: That hardiest of cold warriors, George Meany the A.F.L.C.I.O., has stampeded the United States Senate into a cutoff of funds for the International Labor Organization. The offense of that body, which only last year received the Nobel Peace Prize amid vast acclaim from Mr. Meany and his associates, has been to appoint a Russian as one of the I.L.O.'s five Assistant Directors.

title: Doubts on SST Rising in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 25The ground is shifting under the main Senate supports of the supersonic transport. George P. Shultz, director of the Office of Management and Budget, denies reports that he is pushing a White House review of the $290 million budget request for this yearor that any such re view exists. But the announce ment that Sena tor Robert P: Grif fin of Michigan, the Repub lican whip, will oppose the SST appropriation altogether is taken as a major portent.

title: Soviet Notes Talks
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 26  The Soviet Government newspaper Izvestia said today that yester day's first round of consulta tions at the United Nations was a not unimportant mile stone toward a Middle East settlement.

title: Walkout Ties Up Buses In Western Westchester
description: OSSINING, N Y., Aug. 26A work stoppage by 85 bus drivers in a union jurisdictional dispute halted Westchester Coach Company service today on the western side Of West chester County.

title: Crisis at Lincoln Hospital
description: There is general agreement that Lincoln Hospital is a medical disaster area in urgent need of reclama tion. In this period of doctor shortage when many alternative jobs are available, it requires physicians with special dedication to the needs of the disad vantaged to be willing to work under the handicaps that hinder their every step at Lincoln.

title: Bridge:
description: The New York bridge scene was deprived of one of its most enthusiastic and popular personalities when Stanley Palmer of Roslyn, L. I, died Tuesday following an acci dent.

title: U.N. Trade Unit Picks Chief
description: GENEVA, Aug, 26  Pierre Attilio Forthomme of Belgium was elected president of the United Nations Trade and De velopment Board when it con vened today. The board, the permanent executive body of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development, will meet until Sept. 16.

title: Deal on Parole Fizzles, 2 Convicts Sue Officials
description: Two prisoners who said they returned $4million worth of stolen jewels last fall in re turn for a promise of early parole now want the gems back because they say the deal they thought they had made with state lawen forcement authorities hadn't worked out.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX CONTINUE TO RISE
description: It was another bullish day on the American Stock Ex change yesterday as the list turned in its fourth consecu tive gain in the heaviest vol ume in almost three months.

title: 2 Dead and 30 Missing in Crash Of Helicopter Hit by Enemy Fire
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Aug. 27 (AP)A big United States Army helicopter carrying about 25 persons was shot down yesterday and fell into an American position, the United States command said today. Initial reports said two Americans had been killed, sev en had been wounded and 30 were missing.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Billie Jean King, the country's most successful woman athletic star, says she is never offended by people who tell her she plays tennis just like a man. But she has become increasingly irritated by people who ask her when she's going to settle down and attend to a home and family.

title: LOBBY CAMPAIGN BEGUN IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26Supporters of an amendment seeking equal rights for women began today a fullfledged lobbying campaign on Capitol Hill.

title: Feminist Philosopher Katharine Murray Millett
description: The principal theoretician of the women's liberation movement is a 35yearold former Barnard instructor who lives in a Bowery loft. She swears, one friend says, like a gunnery sergeant, and stands to make $100,000 from a book on how tough it is to be a woman. Kate Millett's first book, Sex ual Politics, was conceived as a doctoral thesis and did, in fact, earn her Ph.D., with distinction, from Columbia University. It also made her a current heroine of the world of instant cul ture, with the attendant book introduction parties, televi sion and radio interviews and meetings with foreign journalists. Woman in the News

title: Television
description: Morning

title: T. D. Kinsman Fiance Of Diana Jill Adelman
description: WESTPORT, Conn, Ang. 26 Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Adel man have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Diana Jill Adelman, to Thomas David Kinsman, son of Mr. and Mrs. David Kins man of Phoenix, Ariz.

title: Alderfer, Beagler for 37 Years, Contends Show Dog Is Superior
description: J. Ralph Alderfer is a beagler. He has had beagles for 37 years. I was 5 years old when my father gave me a dog, he recalled. When I was 12, I had three and was running them in sanctioned trials against professional handlers. I have had some good hounds, but my first really great one was Alderfer's Little Midget. When she worked a rabbit, she ran a close line. My other great field dog was Pin Oaks Cryline Cinder, who had eight generations of champions behind her.

title: ARTICLE INTERESTS CHICAGO 7 LAWYER
description: A lawyer for the Chicago Seven said last night that a magazine article just published was the defense's first informa tion that Federal District Judge Julius J. Hoffman may have twice rejected messages from the jury that it was deadlocked.

title: Briefs Filed in Kopechne Case
description: BOSTON, Aug. 26 (AP)Briefs were filed today in the suit brought last spring by two court stenographers who said they had the sole right to pre pare and sell copies of the Mary Jo Kopechne inquest pro ceedings to news media and other interested parties. The briefs were filed in the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit, where the secretaries, Sidney R. Lipman and Harold T. McNeill, went when their plea was denied in the state courts and the Fed eral District Court.

title: WOMEN TAKE OVER ON THE SEAS, TOO
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., Aug. 26Three women, wear ing colored paper badges on their blouses that proclaimed Eve Power and selfsup port, struck a strong, joyous blow for liberation today by walloping the highpowered males in sailing competition. The occasion was the beginning of the Manhasset Bay Yacht Club's 38th race week and the successful revolutionaries were the winners in the Resolute Class.

title: Esta J. Milchman of N.Y.U. Is Bride
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 26 Miss Esta Jacqueline Milch man and Frederick Alan Rapoport were married this evening in Temple Israel Center by Rabbi Max Gelb.

title: DEMOCRATS URGE CARE ON JUDICIARY
description: Arthur J. Goldberg and all other Democrats running for statewide office in the Novem ber election issued a statement yesterday calling for a distin guished and nonpartisan screen ing panel to interview and ap prove all candidates for the State Supreme Court in Man hattan and the Bronx.

title: Carlton S. Proctor, 76, Is Dead; Engineer on Major Structures
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Aug. 26 Carlton S. Proctor, a retired consulting engineer, who was a leading designer and supervisor of construction of substructures of buildings, dams and bridges, died yesterday in Lawrence Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 21 Northway.

title: Leading Feminist Puts Hairdo Before Strike
description: Betty Friedan was 20 minutes late for her first scheduled appearance in con nection with the Women's Strike for Equality yesterday morning because of a last minute emergency appoint ment with her hairdresser.

title: Wood, Field and Stream

title: Elayne Lerner Wed To Medical Student
description: The marriage of Miss Elayne Lerner to Elliott Grossbard took place here last night at the Fifth Avenue Synagogue. Rabbis Solomon Scharfman and Baruch Silverstein per formed the ceremony.

title: Advertising: Scientific American Is 125
description: Tomorrow, Scientific Amer ican celebrates its 125th an niversary, which isn't too bad a feat in a field as vola tile as magazine publishing.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Special Committee on Co lonialism10:30 A.M.

title: POLICE ESTABLISH CORRUPTION CURBS UNDER NEW UNITS
description: Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary, in a major reorgani zation of the Police Depart ment, ordered yesterday the establishment of special new anticorruption teams in each of the department's major units.

title: London Regrets Closing by India of B.B.C. Office
description: LONDON, Aug. 26  The Foreign Office said tonight that it regretted the decision by the Indian Government to close the offices in New Delhi of the British Broadcasting Corpora tion.

title: BATTISTA ASSAILS RAZING OF HOMES
description: Assemblyman Vito P. Bat tista, Republican from Brook lyn, met with members of the State Commission of Investiga tion for more than an hour and a half yesterday to detail what he alleged were improprieties in the condemnation of 69 homes in the Corona section of Queens to make way for a new high school and athletic field.

title: WHOLESALE INDEX POSTS FIRST DROP SINCE AUGUST, 1968
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26Led by a sharp drop in farm prices, the Government's wholesale price index declined this month for the first time in two years.

title: Theater Group, at Parley, Urged To Be More Locally Oriented
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26The American Educational Theater Association, ending its 34th annual convention today, sought to make itself respon sive to current issues by changing its bylaws to en franchise all members, espe cially students, and to guaran tee equal job consideration for women members.

title: Management Wins 4 Seats On A. J. Industries Board
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mo., Aug. 26 (AP)The battle for control of A. J. Industries, Inc., ended today with the management re taining four of seven board seats.

title: Observer: Paint Me No Flattery
description: LONDON, Aug. 26Down to the National Portrait Gallery to see the new painting of Prin cess Margaret which is causing the great controversy. Well, the press says there is a great con troversy, but the British public is not stampeding the gallery this morning with portrait slashing devices. There are ex actly eight of us in the presence of the controversial canvas; and all are breathing normally.

title: U.S. MEN SWIMMERS WIN 3 GOLD MEDALS
description: TURIN, Italy, Aug. 26 (AP)the United States, although many of its leading swimmers are competing in Japan, fin ished one, two in the three men's finals and took second in the two women's events today on, the opening day of the sixth World University Games.

title: Insiders'
Miss Metcalf Scores Upset In U.S. GrassCourt Tennis
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Aug. 26 (AP)Janice Metcalf of Clare mont, Calif., scored the first upset of United States women's amateur grasscourt tennis championships today at Wil mington Country Club.

title: Article 1  No Title
Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. President Nixon, from the Western White House in San Clemente, Calif., issued a proclamation salut ing the 19th Amendment, which gives women the right to vote. He met with Cardinal Cooke and Francis Cardinal McIntyre.

title: Suspicious Fire Damages B.O.A.C. Terminal Here
description: A fire reportedly of sus picious origin ruined part of British Overseas Airway's Corporation's new $56mil lion terminal at Kennedy In ternational Airport yesterday morning.

title: Holiday on Ice Retains Cool Charm
description: Whoever said that when. you've seen one ice revue you've seen them all also has to figure out how to set Shakespeare to skates. And the family crowd that came to the opening of the 26th Holiday on Ice last night at Madison Square Garden ob viously didn't miss the Bard.

title: LONG AND DOYLE WIN TRAPSHOOT TITLES
description: VANDALIA, Ohio, Aug. 26 (AP)Four titles in claytarget championships were decided to day during shooting at the 71st Grand American trapshooting tournament

title: City Gets Injunction in Lincoln Hospital Dispute
description: State Supreme Court Justice Arnold G. Fraiman signed !restraining order at 11 o'clock ;last night barring community I groups from 'interfering with (patient care and medical serv ices at Lincoln Hospital.

title: Market Place:
description: Placardtoting females pa raded up and down Wall Street yesterday, calling for women's liberation. It was all part of the Women's Strike for Equality.

title: Terrorism Against Policemen Makes Them Wary on the Beat
description: DETROIT, Aug. 26Sniper attacks, terrorist bombings, shootouts and rising assaults against bigcity policemen are causing deep concern among the police about their personal safety and ability to do their job.

title: JUDGES DISAGREE WITH DUNNE PLAN
description: The presiding justices of the Appellate Divisions of State Supreme Court who have juris diction in the New York metro politan area said yesterday that officials had no administra tive authority to implement suggestion that defendants charged with nonviolent mis demeanors bi released pending trial.

title: Attacks on Cabbies Laid to Militants; 7th Death Reported
description: A spokesman for the taxi in dustry charged yesterday that assaults this week in Harlem on cab drivers, one of whom was killed, were part of a pattern by which slumarea militants attempt to terrorize drivers in such areas.

title: Personal Finance
description: Life insurance companies are not exactly broadcasting it, but when you pay for cov erage by the month you may be charged as much as 16 per cent more for the same in surance than if you had paid for it by the year.

title: CHEVRON OIL FINED S1MILLION IN SPILL
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 26A million dollars in fines was imposed on the Chevron Oil Company in United States Dis trict Court here today in a case stemming from massive oil pollution of the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Pound Makes Strong Rally To Ease Earlier Pressure
description: LONDON, Aug. 26 (Reuters) After being under pressure for most of the day, the English pound made a big rally on the foreign exchange market here tonight.

title: AARON'S HOME RUN DECIDES CONTEST
description: The New York Mets played Tuesday night's game in re verse at Shea Stadium last nightand lost again. Taking a 71 lead into the seventh in ning, they saw their margin shrink to 76 going into the ninth, and they were finally beaten, 97, when a tworun homer by Hank Aaron off Gary Gentry gave the Atlanta Braves the lead.

title: News Summary and Index
description: The White House, it was reported yester day, is willing, to send troops for a Soviet American peacekeeping force in the Middle East once an IsraeliArab settlement. reached. The establishment of the force would be contingent on the consent of the Arabs and Israelis. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: SINGAPORE ENDING BRITISH AIR PACT
description: SINGAPORE, Aug. 26  The Government announced today its intention to terminate its aviation landing rights agree ment with Britain when it ex pires in 12 months.

description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 26Gretel II and Intrepid returned from sea today looking very much like the yachts that will battle for the America's Cup.

description: A move by Commissioner of lnvestigation Robert K. Ruskin to force three. New York police men to testify about an al leged payoff list was likened in State Supreme Court yester day to taking a prisoner in a station house and beating his head with a rubber pipe.

title: HARRY E. SEAMAN
description: LIVINGSTON, N.J., Aug. 26 Harry E. Seaman, a super visor in the engineeringinfor mation department at Bell Laboratories in Murray Hill, died yesterday at St. Barnabas Hospital. He was 47 years old and lived at 292 Timberline Road, Mountainside.

title: NEW YORK PHONE REPLACES CHIEF
description: The New York Telephone Company has called in a 48yearold , executive vice presi dent of the parent American Telephone and Telegraph Com pany to help solve its prob lems.

description: BURLINGTON, Mass., Aug. 26A fire bomb was hurled into the town's temporary po lice station last night, and the wooden structure was heavily damaged.

description: Stock prices moved ahead slightly yesterday on brisk vol ume as the market continued to consolidate its recent spectacu lar advance.

description: Corrective measures have been taken in an attempt to avoid a repetition of factors that caused a woman to die and 50 other persons to be overcome by smoke as the af termath to an electrical fire on Aug. 1 in the IRT Lexington Avenue subway tunnel near the Bowling Green station.

title: Arab Guerrillas Seek Other Militants'
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 26 The Arab commando leader ship, which feels a growing sense of isolation in the midst of the current efforts toward a Middle Eastern peace settle ment, is attaching increasing importance to the support of ultramilitants around the world.

title: CARINA CAPTURES JUNIOR TROPHY SAIL
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., Aug. 26Indian Harbor Yacht Club of Greenwich, Conn., gained possession of the Everett B. Morris Trophy today when the 48foot sloop, Carina, the win ner of this year's Newportto Bermuda race, placed first in the Beach Point Yacht Club's 14th annual junior overnight race for the junior distance sailing championship of Long Island Sound.

title: I.C.C. Grants 22 Railroads A 10% Increase in Tickets
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (AP)  The Interstate Commerce Commission approved today a 10 per cent increase in the price of a ticket on 22 railroads, including the financially trou bled Penn Central, which stands to gain $3.3million in addi tional revenues.

title: HOOPER, LOTZ PACE PROAM WITH 66'S
description: CLIFTON, N. J., Aug. 26While everyone was consider ing whether the new $300,000 Dow Jones open would create another golfing millionaire here this week, a standby pro, Herb Hooper, and Dick Lotz, who had his entire set of clubs stolen a month ago, shared preliminary honors in the pro amateur introductory event to day with a 66.

title: BRITAIN REFUSES BAIL IN ARMS RAID
description: LONDON, Aug. 25  Bail was refused today for a New Yorker and two Lebanese held here on charges of unlawfully possessing arms that were re portedly destined for the Mid dle East.

title: The People Next Door Suffers in Shift to Screen
description: Timethe space of only two short yearsand a con scientious, purposeful trans fer from television to the screen have dealt J. P. Mil ler's drama, The People Next Door, a near fatal blow. This is the highly ac claimed story of two neigh boring middleclass families almost split wide open by some generationgap, revela tions involving two young sters. Beamed into the living room, minus frills, from the small home box, it must have been thunderbolt. Not now.

title: Patriotic Pageant Marks Fort Ticonderoga Anniversary
description: FORT TICONDEROGA, N.Y., Aug. 26The 18thcentury cannons boomed, the bag pipes skirled, the flags flut tered and the uniforms pro vided a panoply of patriotic color as John H. G. Pell, presi dent of the Fort Ticonderoga Corporation, officiated yes terday at ceremonies com memorating the 150th anni versary of the purchase of the fort and garrison grounds by William Ferris Pell, his greatgreatgreatgrandfather.

A new blaze threatened mills, homes and recreation fa cilities on the west side of Roosevelt Lake, the huge reser voir behind Grand Coulee Dam. The worst fire remained in the Mitchell Creek area and spread over 40,000 acres in the Wenat chee and Okanogan National Forests.

description: Mrs. Beverly Moss Spatt, who as a member of the City Planning Commission has been a constant thorn in the side of the Lindsay administration, was proposed yesterday for the post of Brooklyn Borough President.

title: EARNINGS DECLINE AT BIG RETAILERS
description: An unhappy blend of lagging sales, rising expenses and in creasing inventory shortages partially attributed to heavy pilferage has inflicted heavy damage on departmentstore profits in the second quarter.

title: If at Third Base You Succeed, Don't Try for Home
For Most Women, Strike Day Was Just a Topic of Conversation
description: For the vast majority of women, yesterday was a day simply to go about one's businesswhether that meant going to a job, attend ing a Broadway matinee, having one's hair done or washing the baby's diapers.

description: NORWICH, N. Y., Aug. 26  Trying to induce local com munities to tackle the nar cotics problem, Governor Rockefeller disclosed today that he had called on local officials to develop narcotics control programs or face the loss of existing state aid for health and mental health programs.

title: Metropolitan Museum Queried By Turks on Smuggled Artifacts

title: MRS M'GRATH DUO WINS BY 2 STROKES
description: JERICHO, L. I., Aug. 26 Mrs. Gordon McGrath of Piping Rock and her sister, Mrs. Jus tine Cushing of Meadow Brook, won the second annual Barbara S. Kirkland Memorial 36hole Pinehurst golf championship today.

title: Attorneys for G.I. Want His Case Tried in Songmy
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Aug. 26 (UPI)  Attorneys for a young soldier charged with the murder of South Vietnamese civilians asked today that legal proceedings against their client be moved from this antiseptic courtroom to Mylai 4. The hamlet is in the village of Songmy, Vietnam, where the al leged massacre occurred on March 16, 1968.

title: FREDERICK E. KING, A LAWYER HERE, 76
description: BASS RIVER, Mass., Aug. 26 Frederick E. King, senior partner in the New York law firm of King & O'Conor, died here Saturday, apparently of heart attack. He was 76 years old and lived in Delray Beach, Fla.

title: Dowling Gives It Old Yale Try In 2d Chance to Make the Pros
description: AMHERST, Mass., Aug. 26 Brian Dowling is one of those college football stars who has found the profes sional ranks hard to crack. A famous Yale quarterback in 1967 and 1968, Dowling is fighting to win a job with the Boston Patriots here after a failure with the Minnesota Vikings last year. It was the first football failure he had ever known. The critical dates coming up for Dowling and about 500 other marginal athletes competing for the 1,040 available jobs in pro football are Aug. 31 and Sept. 7 and 14. On those blue Mondays the squads will be cut to 49, 44 and 40 players each. A job means minimum salary of $12,000, a shot at the action and the future.

title: Federal Crime Insurance Favored by Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 (AP)  The Senate Banking Committee tentatively approved today a program of Federal insurance against burglary and theft in highcrime areas where rates are excessive or policies are unobtainable.

title: Mississippi Banks Assisting Segregated Schools
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 26A coalition of Jackson, Miss., bankers that includes two mem bers of a committee set up by the Nixon Administration to promote support for public schools has granted a $600,000 loan to a group of private seg regated schools.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Virginia Governor Asks Aid For Schools in Integration
description: Gov. Linwood Holton of Vir ginia appealed yesterday for support of public schools this fall. He did so as more deseg regation came to scattered Southern school districts for the first time.

title: Director of Psychiatry Leaves Correction Agency in Protest
description: The director of psychiatry of the city's Correction Depart ment announced her resigna tion yesterday, charging that the department's mental health program for its 12,000 inmates was disgracefully inadequate and impervious to attempts to imorove it. fight for reform, would not comment on her resignation. The Commissioner of Correc tion, George F. McGrath, could not be reached for comment.

title: FREED BISHOP SEES PROGRESS IN CHINA
description: ROME, Aug. 26 (Reuters)The Most Rev. James Edward Walsh, the American bishop who was released last month after 12 years in a Chinese jail, praised China's Commu nist Government today for ban ning all public displays of in decency and immorality.

title: Senate, 62 to 22, Rejects Herbicide Ban for Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26The Senate defeated today two more amendments to the mili tary procurement bill that it has been wrestling with for five weeks.

title: Miss Spinetta To Wed Nov. 7
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26Miss Elissa Celeste Spinetta and David Stephen Ruggieri plan to be married Nov. 7 at Holy Trinity Roman Cath olic Church in Georgetown.

title: GUERRILLAS CLASH WITH AMMAN POLICE
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 26Shooting erupted between Arab commandos and the Jordanian police in the heart of Amman today while the guerrillas were preparing for tomorrow's meet ing of the Palestinian National Council.

title: Screen: Joan Baez and Her Challenge:'Carry It On' Follows Singer and Husband
description: Although the voice and face of Joan Baez are the focal points through almost all of "Carry It On," which opened yesterday at the Little Carnegie, the motivating factor of the film is the imprisonment of her husband, David Harris, for refusing to be inducted in the Army.His arrest is the frame through which this documentary, as a whole, is seen. He appears briefly in the opening sequenceshighly articulate, low-keyed but forceful as he discusses the draft and the nature of democracy in formal and informal settings.But once he is taken away by Federal marshals, the camera turns to Miss Baez as she travels across the country, singing, talking, thinking aloud and anticipating the birth of her baby.As a result, the film works on three levels simultaneously. Superficially, it offers a generous, almost continuous concert by Miss Baez as she sings 13 songs in concert situations, in impromptu accompaniment to ironing or cooking and as over-all background. Fundamentally, it provides a platform for the views of Miss Baez and Mr. Harris. And in between, it reveals something of the person behind the celebrity who is Miss Baez.That all three aspects remain in balance and come through effectively is due to a great extent to the calm, direct, unpretentious tone that flows through the film, a tone that is subtly implemented by the use of black and white photography. Like Mr. Harris, Miss Baez takes a very positive stance in situations in which she feels challenged  facing a conference of young people who sharply question some of her aims, or on Joey Bishop's television show.But after her appearance with Bishop and a subsequent talk with an admiring girl on Bishop's staff, she discusses with a friend the validity of some of the things she said in a fashion that not only reveals how she thinks but also where her own uncertainties enter in."Carry It On" presents a point of view but it presents it with the warts, the questions, and gives the viewer an opportunity to consider the questions. And it shows us a very unusual artist at work  on stage, backstage and at home getting ready. And waiting. Waiting for David. Waiting for the baby. But involved.

title: HENRY D. LLOYD JR., AIDE OF DAILY NEWS
description: Henry D. Lloyd Jr., a direc tor of The New York Daily News and its parent Tribune Company, died of a heart at tack yesterday at his home in Barrington, R. I. He was 62 years old.

title: VATICAN ACCUSES PRESS ON INDIANS
description: ROME, Aug. 26 (UPI)The Vatican newspaper L'Osserva tore Romano today accused the world press of sensationalism in its handling of allegations that Indian priests had sold impoverished peasant girls to West European convents that are short of recruits.

title: Dr. Zakhari Frenkel, 100; Advocated Work for Old
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 26 (AP)Dr. Zakhari Frenkel, author of Prolonging Your Life and Ac five Old Age, died here yes terday at the age of 100, Tass, the official Soviet press agency; announced today.

title: Thuy, Back in Paris, Hints Willingness on Secret Talks
description: PARIS, Aug. 26Xuan Thuy, Hanoi's chief delegate at the Vietnam peace negotiations, re turned here today after a three month absence and appeared open to suggestions for a re newal of secret talks with the United States.

title: The Issue of Equality: Some Women in Public Eye Speak Out
description: They're at the top of their field. Or else they were the first women to crack it. Others have achieved celeb rity status because they are married to famous men.

title: Nation's Foreign Money Reserves Down
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 United States international monetary reserves declined by $263million in July as for eign currency holdings took an other large drop.

title: Chile on the Tightrope
description: Chile is heading for a Presidential election certain to put a heavy strain on one of the few remaining demo cratic systems in Latin America. The outcome could be something without precedent anywhere in the world: the election by democratic, constitutional proc ess of a Marxist, nominated by the Communists and Ills own even more extreme Socialist party.

title: Trenton Race Rescheduled
description: TRENTON, Aug. 26 (AP) The Trenton 200 modified stockcar race, rained out last Sunday, will be run at Trenton Speedway at 3:30 P.M. next Sunday.

title: METAL POLLUTION HELD WIDE PERIL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26A Senate subcommittee heard tes timony today that the health of Americans has been more seri ously endangered by lead, cad mium and other toxic metals in the environment than by the widely publicized threat from pesticides.

title: President Has a Talk With 2 Fellow Golfers
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 26 (AP)  President Nixon talked with two fellow golfers today  Cardinal Cooke of New York and Lawrence Welk, the orchestra leader.

title: LEASCO TO SEEK PERGAMON PRESS
description: The Leasco Data Processing Corporation announced yes terday it would continue to pur sue its bid for control of Per gamon Press, Ltd., the British publishing concern despite the latter's reported loss in 1968 and for the first nine months of 1969.

title: RAPHAEL R. MURPHY, EXCITY MAGISTRATE
description: Raphael R. Murphy, who re tired in 1953 as a city magis trate, after 23 years on the bench, died Tuesday in St. Eliza beth's Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived at 5410 Nether land Avenue, Riverdale, the Bronx.

title: Women March Down Fifth in Equality Drive
description: Celebrating the 50th anni versary of American women's right to voteand the start of a new crusade for equality a crowd of more than 10,000 people, mostly women of all ages, occupations and viewpoints, marched down Fifth Avenue to an enthusi astic rally in Bryant Park last night.

title: Romney Bars Urban Plan Proposed by Nixon Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Urban Develop ment, told a Senate committee today that his department would not follow the recom mendation of  a Presidential panel to withhold Federal funds from suburban communities that bar lowincome housing.

title: Detention of 2 Algerian Officials Is Formally Ordered by Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 26The Israeli Chief of Staff has signed orders for the detention of two Algerian citizens seized Aug. 14 when a British airliner in which they were flying from the Far East to Europe landed In Lydda.

title: She'll Decorate the Boots or Show You the Way
description: Every day, more and more New Yorkers, dressed as in a Ruritanian operetta, with merry peasants and gypsies dash for cabs on Park Ave nue or flounce down subway stairs. The older and richer buy their peasant rigs from name designers at threeor fourfigure price tags. But the in people that is the young are doing their own thing. It's tiedying, knotty ing and embroi dery time in Gotham. What is machinemade is de trop, the loving hands at home look is the rage. The newest expressyourself, doityour self idea is coming from Lat inas, the shoe and clothes boutique that has just opened a branch at 130 East 59th Street. (The original shop is at Madison Avenue and 66th Street.) Latinas's artsycrafty notion involves boots that are meant to be painted or em broidered. To encourage the art, the new store has ac quired the services of Hana Davis, a freelance artist, whom Jacques Kaplan, the furrier, once described as that hippie girl who brings me ideas.

title: The Liberated Woman
description: It is an unfortunate truth that a protest group such AS the Women's Liberation Movement can only make itself heard if it speaks at the top of its voice and resorts to publicityseeking exhibitionism. The suffra gettes of a halfcentury ago, whose great triumphthe nineteenth amendmentwas commemorated yes terday, were often noisy and obstreperous. Their suc cessors of today go on strike, march down Fifth Ave nne and liberate the Statue of Liberty. But the attentiongetting antics do not detract from the sub Stance of the demand for full equality put forward by modern women.

description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: RACE RIOT QUELLED AT A MARINE PRISON
description: CAMP PENDLETON, Calif., Aug. 26 (AP)  Cuards in the Marine Conectional Center quelled a fourhour melee, of ficially termed a race riot, early today.

description: Stanley S. Palmer, a com mercial printer and a prominent bridge player, died Tuesday after an accident at his busi ness premises. He was 43 years old and lived in Roslyn, L.I.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26 The State Department said it had no comment on the report in Al Ahram.

description: Directions for reaching Upper Montclair Country Club, at Clifton, N. J., site of the $300,000 Dow Jones open today through Sunday:

title: TWO NOHITTERS HURLED IN SERIES
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Aug. 26 (AP)  Steve O'Neil pitched a nohitter, the second today, as Wayne, N. J. defeated Valley. field, Quebec, 100, in a first round Little League World Se ries game.

description: GENEVA, Aug. 26 Sir Eric Wyndham White, head of In vestors Overseas Services. Ltd., and Bernard Cornfeld, former head of the mutual funds con cern, tonight had their first meeting since Mr. Cornfeld started his campaign to regain control.

title: ALLEN T. BALDWIN
description: SANDY SPRING, Md., Aug. 26  Allen T. Baldwin, a re tired chemical engineer and longtime resident of Montclair, N. J., died here today at Friends House, a Quaker re tirement home. He was 84 years old. Mr. Baldwin was the father of Nona Baldwin Brown, Sunday correspondent for The New York Times in Washing ton.

A hospital spokesman said the operation was to remove pressure from a nerve in Venturi's hand and wrist.

title: Carmichael Defeats Drysdale by 46, 76, 62 in Marlboro Tennis
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Aug. 26  Bob Carmichael, the Australian now representing France, and Dickie Stockton, lastminute replacement, scored big upsets as the field was completed today for the quar terfinals in the $25,000 Marl boro open tennis champion ships at the Orange Lawn Tennis Club.

title: Plot Against Government In Sudan Reported Foiled
description: CAIRO, Aug. 26 (Reuters)The Middle East News Agency reported today that a plot against the Sudanese Govern ment was foiled last Thursday.

title: How to Cook Dinner and Still Have Time for Cocktails
description: Edward Lowman, who is doctor, likes to cook. And he likes to cook for friends. And his friends like what he cooks. Thus, in 1964, he offered to 300 of those friends a highly personal Christmas gifta collection of his recipes.

title: 3 Killed as U.S. Artillery Fires on American Unit
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 26 (UPI)  American artillerymen shelled a United States unit by mistake killing two G.I.'s and a Vietcong sol dier who had defected, the United States command said today.

title: CARADON TO APPEAL FOR KOREAN'S LIFE
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 26Lord Caradon, the former British representative at the United Nations, arrived here from London today to try to save a South Korean graduate) of Cambridge University who has been sentenced to death on charges of having spied for North Korea.

title: BANKS PREPARING FOR FOOD STAMPS
description: New York's largest com mercial banks are expecting operating difficulties at the be ginning of next week, when 350,000 to 400,000 families will receive their first anthoriza dons to purchase food stamps as the city starts its participa tion in the antipoverty pro gram.

title: School Buses Are Called Perilous by U.E. Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26The National Transportation Safety Board reported today that many children were en dangered by inadequate and inefficient bolting and rivet ing of school bus bodies.

title: Cambodia is Expected To Relax Censorship
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 26 (Agence France Presse)  The Cambodian Government is to end a press censorship committee formed in March, it was learned here today.

title: Boston Arts Festival Is Hitting Stride In Its 3d Year
description: BOSTONJust at 2 P.M. a flatbed truck parks in the shade on a deadend street near the heart of the city and is quickly transformed into a stage on which 10 lively young people perform a rock musical.

title: New London Play Treats Skinheads With Compassion
description: LONDON, Aug. 26Although he was the first playwright to put football crowds and student revolutionaries on the British stage, Peter Terson is not pri marily a social dramatist: and SpringHeeled Jack at the Jeannetta Cochrane theater, his fourth play written for the National Youth Theater Com pany, reveals him again as a poet.

title: Satellite Launching Delayed
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., (UPI)  The launching of a com munications satellite for the North Atlantic Treaty Organiza tion, scheduled for Sept. 30, has been indefinitely postponed be cause of the failure of a similar craft owned by Britain, the Air Force said today. The $10mil lion British satellite, Skynet 2, was lost last Saturday when an onboard rocket motor failed during a firing planned to switch the satellite from a pre liminary orbit to a stationary path.

title: BOEING SCIENTIST ALTERS SST VIEW
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26A Boeing Company scientist, who had been cited as the author of a report that the supersonic transport would make big changes in the environment, said today that further studies had shown that the atmos pheric effects would in fact be negligible.

title: NO. 1 HEROIN RING REPORTED BROKEN
description: An international heroin smuggling ring whose business, exceeded half a billion dollars a year in street sales has been smashed with the arrest of two Americans in Europe, the Fed eral Government announced yesterday.

title: Thai Pullout Discussed By Bangkok and Saigon
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Thurs day, Aug. 27 (Reuters)Thailand has begun nego tiations with the Saigon Government for the with drawal of the 12,000 Thai combat troops serving in South Vietnam, Premier Tha nom Kittikachorn said to day.

title: Manson Trial Hears Testimony On Bloodstains at Murder Scene
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 26The killers of Sharon Tate and four other persons at her home last August apparently used the actress's blood to paint the word pig on the front door of her Benedict Canyon man sion, a jury was told today.

title: Eugenie Begins Run at the Penthouse
description: Inga is at it again, as Eugenie.

title: Newsweek Agrees to Speed Promotion of Women
description: Women employes and mem bers of the top editorial man agement at Newsweek ex changed verbal bouquets yes terday morning as they came together to sign a pledge by the magazine to accelerate its recruitment and promotion of women.

title: Chrysler Art Going To Norfolk's Museum
description: NORFOLK, Va., Aug. 26 (AP)The city of Norfolk and the automobile heir Walter P. Chrysler Jr. an nounced today an agreement that will bring Mr. Chrysler's multimilliondollar art col lection here.

title: 3 Bank Robbery Suspects Seized After 90 Minutes
description: Ninety minutes after the Ca narsie branch of the First Na tional City Bank in Brooklyn was robbed of $10,000 yester day morning, three suspects were arrested and all but $1,000 of the money recovered.

title: Moiseyev Performance Disrupted by Tear Gas
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 26 (AP)Two tear gas grenades were thrown into a crowded down town theater last night, stop ping a performance of a Sovi et dance troupe and sending patrons choking and gagging toward the exits.

title: HORSE SHOW DOUBLE FOR NANCY BAROODY
description: RHINEBECK, N. Y., Aug. 26 Nancy Baroody of Lakeville, Conn., scored a double today when she rode Friar Tuck and Shenandoah Flintstone to pony hunter championships at the Dutchess County Fair horse show.

title: Jersey Girl Jailed in Europe
description: AMSTERDAM, the Nether lands, Aug. 26 (AP)A police judge here sentenced an Amer ican girl today to six weeks in jail for the possession of drugs. The accused, Linda Arcello, 19 years old of East Paterson, N. J., was arrested July 21 and accused of possessing hashish and LSD.

title: World Youth Orchestra Makes Debut
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Aug. 26The World Youth Orchestra, conducted by Erich Leinsdorf, got a stand ing ovation and was widely acclaimed by Copenhagen's music critics after its first Performance here last night.

title: PARILL'S FUTURE AS A JET IS BLEAK
description: Although weeding out con tinued at the Jets camp yes terday, Coach Weeb Ewbank still was confronted by a tan gled quarterback situation.

title: Books of The Times
description: Admittedly, Literary Criticism is a textbook, prepared for use in literature courses, its contents being selected with this particular audience in mind, as the disclaimer on the copyright page puts it. Nonetheless, the publisher has decided to offer it for general publication, in view of what seems to be its interests for the gen eral public What ever is meant by that last, some what cryptic, phrase, I think it was a wise and, from the general public's point of view, gratifying decision to do so. Lionel Trilling is a critic and teach er of extraor dinary repute in intellectual cir cles, and one ap proaches his in troductory essay with great curios ity. Glancing over the table of con tentsthe book is not meant to be a his torical conspectus of criticism, but rather to serve the beginning student of litera ture and criticismone can see immedi ately that its contents ought to be read, they have not been already, by anyone who fancies himself to be the least bit in terested in the literature of Western civil izationif only to observe how alienated from it or how much in revolt against it he may be.

title: Schools and the Law
description: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger's refusal to grant delay in the desegregation of four Southern school districts does not mean that the Supreme Court has now committed itself to a policy of mandatory busing. On the contrary, Justice Burger has been emphatic on the need to have the Supreme Court clarify the intent and limits of its 1954 landmark decision.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Opera

title: BAHNSEN VICTOR ON A FIVEHITTER
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 26The Yankee detachment of the 389th Training Regiment, only five days removed from Fort Dix, overcame the dubious baserun ning tactics of some of their barracks mates and led New York to a 30 victory over Kan sas City tonight.

title: Canadian Fishing Is Hard Hit by Mercury Pollution
description: WHITE DOG, Ontario, Aug. 20Norbert Michaud, a large, rawboned man, sat in his kitchen and made small talk with two women and a child.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: In our exhaustive search for a scintillating panacea to re solve our welfare problems, would appear that we inten tionally deny some centuryold truths which are the only basis for the solutions to the prob lems.

title: Chess:
Brazilian CoffeeQuota Plan Rejected by Consumer Nations
description: LONDON, Aug. 26 (AP)Consumer nations in the inter national coffee talks rejected today a Brazilian proposal for a 48millionbag 197071 coffee export quota.

title: STOCKS MANAGE RALLY IN LONDON
Bridgeport Shines by Standards Here
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.,Aug. 26Mayor Lindsay to the contrary, this city is almost immaculate by comparison with New York City.

title: LAIRD DISCLOSES SOVIET MIRV TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that the Soviet Union had conducted first tests of warheads on its principal intercontinental bal listic missile, the SS11.

title: Martins Dances First Firebird With City Ballet
description: New York City Ballet never does anything by halves. In the spring, no fewer than three principal male dancers were hired, and just before the sum mer season two leading female dancers were injured, insuring a plethora of interesting cast ings.

title: Feld Work Stands Out as Ballet in Park Begins
description: Ballet is a woman, George Balanchine has said. So much for the Women's Lib aspect of last night's opening in Central Park's Delacorte Theater of the freeadmission New York Dance Festival.

title: Filthy Street Contest?
description: Mayor Lindsay and Senator Ribicoff got into wrangle at a Senate hearing this week over whether New York or Bridgeport had dirtier streets. No New Yorker will be surprised to learn that onthespot in spection indicates that a filthy street contest be tween this city and Bridgeport is no contest at allBridgeport's streets are immaculate by comparison with those here.

title: GEORGE G. WINSPEAR
description: PLAINFIELD, N.J., Aug. 26 George G. Winspear, a chem ical engineer who served the rubber industry 25 years, died yesterday at his home, 1415 Martine Avenue, after a short illness. He was 66 years old.

title: Price of Lettuce Doubles As Coast Strike Continues
description: SALINAS, Calif., Aug. 26 (UPI)A strike by the United Farm Workers Organizing Com mittee in the nation's salad howl forced lettuce prices up today by as muchas 100 per cent around the country.

title: Text of the Proclamation
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 26 (AP)Following the text of President Nixon's proclamation on the 50th anniversary of women's suffrage:

title: Forward Gal Captures $84,600 Spinaway Stakes at Saratoga by a Length
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y., Aug. 26Forward Gal, under a persistent ride by Frank Ianelli and aided by a run out of a wellbacked rival, won the $84,600 Spinawpy Stakes today at Saratoga race course.

title: Agnew Says U.S. Aims At Full Pullout in Korea
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Aug. 27Vice Presi dent Agnew told President Chung Hee Park of South Korea yesterday, before traveling on to Taiwan and South Vietnam, that all American troops would be withdrawn from South Korea when that country's armed forces were fully modernized,perhaps In five years or more.

title: 3 DIE AND 7 ARE HURT IN L.I. AUTO ACCIDENT
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 26 (UPI)Three persons died and seven others were injured, one critically, in a twocar Crash at 1:41 A.M. today here at Jeru salem and Holly Avenues.

title: U.S. SAYS IT FAVORS JOINING RUSSIANS TO POLICE MIDEAST
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 26Authoritative White House sources have declared that the United States is prepared to join the Soviet Union in a two nation peacekeeping force to maintain a settlement of the Middle East conflict.

title: Glenn Miller Bus Found
description: The Glen Miller orchestra bus, stolen Monday night from midtown parking lot, was re covered in Greenwich Village yesterday with $5,000 worth of property missing according to the police.

title: Nasser and Arafat Discussing Role of Commandos
description: CAIRO, Aug. 26  Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian com mando leader, conferred with President Gamal Abdel Nasser again today, following a three hour meeting last night, to dis cuss the Palestinian movement in the context of present ef forts for a political settlement with Israel by the United Arab Republic and Jordan.

title: Chain Store Sales Rose During July By Indicated 7.9%
description: Chain store sales in July, based on figures from 28 com panies, indicate a gain of 7.9 per cent for the month. For the year to date, the retail op erators with multiple stores are 8.3 per cent ahead of the level for the corresponding 1969 period.

title: Tekoah Meets Eban
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 26Am bassador Tekoah conferred to day with Foreign Minister Abba Eban about tactics for the indirect peace talks with the United Arab Republic and Jor dan. Foreign Ministry officials said that Mr. Tekoah would probably not return to New York before the weekend, but his precise plans would be decided through in the 22yearold Arab Israeli conflict, even before the cease fire deadline expires Nov. 5.

title: French Town Angry Over Loss Of Ford Plant to Premier's City
description: CHARLEVILLE MEZIERES, France, Aug. 26  Huge bull dozers continued today to level prairie land a few miles out side this northern city of 60,000 people. But the factory for which they had been preparing the land will be built 400 miles to the southwest, a fact that has created a furor in France.

title: Fiesta in Henry Street Blends 3 Ethnic Groups
description: Look at the dragon! little children shouted as a 30foot long papiermache beastie crept down Henry Street yes terday in a parade that sig naled the start of the third annual Lower East Side Fes tival.

title: Major League Baseball
description: National League YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: GEORGE DARE FLECK
description: WINTER HAVEN,Fla., Aug. 26 (UPI)George Dare Fleck, )a pioneer broadcast industry official and editor of the first broadcasting magazine, died here yesterday. He was 88 years old.

title: Wolfson Decries Prison Conditions
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26Louis E. Wolfson, the finan cier who finished a term in a Federal prison last January, told a Congressional subcom mittee today of harassment and mental cruelty, sadistic guards and other conditions that he said he had found in orison.

title: PRICES RETREAT ON SOYBEAN OIL
description: Traders interested in taking profits brought wide price swings into the major commod ity futures pits on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: $3Billion Request By Seoul for Arms Criticized by Laird
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that South Korea's request for $3 billion in military assistance and equipment over the next five years was neither feasible nor realistic, given the pres ent attitudes of Congress.

title: U.S. Speeds Up the Search for a Less Toxic Substitute for DDT
description: The outbreak of pesticide poisonings in the North Caro lina tobacco fields, including several deaths, has led the United States Department of Agriculture to accelerate its search for safer alternatives, to parathion, the highly toxic chemical now being used.

title: Transport News and Notes
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. Aug. 26 (AP)  The captain of a Greek tanker owned by Aristotle Onassis has been charged with failing to report an oil spill in Tampa Bay last week, state of ficials said today. It was the first arrest under Florida's 1970 Oil Spillage Act.

title: jarring Meets Egyptian and Jordanian On Second Day of Mideast Peace Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 26Dr. Gunnar V. Jar ring, the United Nations repre sentative for the Middle East, conferred today with Egyptian and Jordanian delegates as the peace talks here went into their second day despite the tem porary absence of the Israeli representative.

title: NEW CHOLERA CASES REPORTED IN ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 26 (Reu ters)Three more cases of, cholera were diagnosed in Jeru salem today, bringing to 14 the number of cases reported here since the outbreak of the illness. six days ago.

title: Kennedy Is Running Hard Against His 64 Vote Total
description: METHUEN, Mass., Aug. 26  Teddy Kennedy is running against a number.

title: FIRESTONE TIRE SHOWS PROFIT DIP
IRVING GRENADIER, ORTHODONTIST, DIES
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Aug. 26 Dr. Irving Grenadier, an orthodontist with offices here and in the Bronx, died today of a heart attack at his home, 77 Spier Road. His age was 58.

title: ALASKA'S GOVERNOR WINS PRIMARY RACE
description: ANCHORAGE, Aug 26 (UPI)  Gov. Keith Miller won the Republican gubernatorial nom ination yesterday.

title: Executive Changes
description: Fletcher L. Byrom, chairman of the board, Kop pers Company, Inc., has been elected a director of the American Smelting and Refining Company.

title: Roundup: Merritt Equals Rixey's LeftHander Feat
description: Although knocked nut after giving up 14 hits and five runs, Jim Merritt became the first Cincinnati lefthander in 45 years to reach the 20 game plateau last night as the Reds scored a 65 victory over the Phillies at Philadel phia.

title: AMSTERDAM SCENE OF NEW CLASHES
description: AMSTERDAM, Aug. 26Hippies battled with the police for the third consecutive night tonight protesting a ban on their sleeping in Dam Square.

title: Woman Strips in Court And Gets 30 Days in Jail
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Aug. 26A 21yearold Gro ton woman was given a 30 day contempt of court jail sentence this morning after she stripped naked in front of Circuit Court Judge George E. Kinmonth.

title: Troubleshooters Spur Canada's Grain Flow
description: THUNDER BAY, OntarioIt's not like the boom of 196667, when Russian bread was being baked with Canadian wheat, but the flow of grain through the tall, cylindrical terminals here at the head of the Great Lakes has picked up appreciably this year.

title: Heckscher Assails Airport's Expansion As Wildlife Threat
