description: Parks Commissioner August Heckscher charged yesterday that a plan to expand Kennedy International Airport into Ja maica Bay would destroy the city's last nature frontier. fail to solve airlines problems, wreck the bay's famed wild life refuge and doom the pro posed Gateway National Rec reation Area.

title: Park Eases His Position
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 26  President Park, apparent ly reassured by Vice President Agnew, has softened his stiff position on the United States plan to reduce its forces in Korea.

title: 11 Marines Hurt in Brawl
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 27 (AP)Eleven marines were injured in a brawl outside a barracks in the Marine Corps Recruit Depot late last night, a spokesman said today. The injured men 10 whites and one Negrowere treated and released. Ac cording to the spokesman, Ne groes fought whites who the Negroes thought were in an earlier group that had thrown rocks and betties at the Ne groes outside the gates.

title: Shiner to Start at Quarterback For Giants in Steeler Contest
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 27Just because John Unitas, Len Daw son and Bill Nelsen were all shipped away to greater glory by the Pittsburgh Steelers, the football fans in the area tend to quiver a little when any former Steeler quarterback comes back to town.

title: T.V.A. IS PLANNING 4TH APOWER UNIT
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Aug. 27  The Tennessee Valley Au thority board disclosed today plans for a fourth new nuclear power plant.

title: Pollution Pact Signed
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27 The American Cyanamid Company, one of nine industrial concerns charged with air pollution by the New Jersey Environmental Protection Department, agreed today to measures designed to alleviate pollution problems. The company signed a stipula tion involving at Warners plant in Linden, N.J., making it un necessary for the concern to appear at a Sept. 15 legal pro ceeding.

title: To Rural Negroes, Health Center Is Hope
description: HUSHPUCKENA, Miss  Down Mississippi High way 61, past a HEPURSEF carwash and a billboard brandishing an American flag with the admonition: Back It, Don't Buck It, a nameless dirt road leads back to the sunpeeled plan tation shack where James Earl Miller lives.He is three months old a prematurely born infant who now weighs nearly five pounds. He had been runni fied (had diarrhea) once, but to the visiting nurse who stopped in to see him the other day, he seemed to be thriving.

title: PORTLAND AGREES TO PEACE PARADES
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 27City officials and spokesmen for a war protest group an nounced today an agreement that will permit two antiwar parades at the time of the American Legion convention here next week.

title: The Feminine Protest
description: They have marched down Fifth Avenue; they have, at other times, burned bras and written books and pressured Congressmen and made speech es. They are the Women's Lib eration Movement, and what ever that is, almost everyone's heard of it. Wednesday's na tionwide Strike for Women's Equality boasted an ad hoc coalition of sponsors whose affiliations  from the Young Wom en's Christian As sociation to New York Radical Womengave the muchhoped for impression of solidarity and bolstered the idea that there is, indeed, a single movement of women.

title: SEAWANHAKA TIED WITH AMERICAN Y.C.
description: NOROTON, Conn., Aug. 27The SeawanhakaCorinthian Yacht Club of Oyster Bay, L.I., represented by Herbert Gum precht as skipper, and the American Y. C. of Rye, N. Y., with William H. Lynn Jr. sail ing, were tied today with one victory apiece in the final round of the fifth annual Long Island Sound Interclub match race championship series.

title: Agnew Praises Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, Aug. 28 (AP)Vice Presi dent Agnew lauded the South Vietnamese people today for suffering so much in freedom's cause and he pledged again that there will be no lessen ing of American support.

title: Retail Merchants Group Beset By Money and Personnel Woes
description: The National Retail Merchants Association, the Largest trade association in the department store industry, has recently un dergone its severest financial and organizational stress in many years, involving continu ing losses and the resignation of seven vice presidents.

title: Unwise Act in Nigeria
description: In, the seven months since the end of the civil war, Nigeria's Federal Government has handled the for midable problems of national reconciliation and re integration of the former Biafrans far better than most had expected. Unfortunately, however, it is still ad dicted, in peace as it was in war, to pronouncements that appear to violate General Gowon's promises general amnesty and reinstatement of exBiafrans public jobs.

title: Plane Order Withdrawn
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 27 (AP)  World Airways an nounced today withdrawal of its order for three Boeing 747, planes scheduled for 1972 delivery. Edward J. Daley, president of the line, said the decsion was prompted hy un certain prospects in the sup plemental carrier industry, in cluding increasing charter restrictions.

title: CATV Parent Concern Trades Shares for Interest in TimeLife
description: A 100 per cent interest in. Manhattan Cable Television has been obtained here by Sterling Communications, Inc., in an ex change of stock and other as sets with TimeLife Broadcast, Inc.

title: Executives on the Move at Corporations
description: Litton Industries, Inc., the Beverly Hillsbased conglom erate, announced yesterday the election of a woman to its board of directors.

title: Ed Rommel Dies at 72
description: Ed Rommel, who rose from a Baltimore sandlot to become a star. American League pitch er, died after a long illness Wednesday night in Baltimore. He was 72 years old. Obituary on Page 31.

title: $232,268 in Diamonds Missing on Japan Flight
description: Diamonds valued at $232,268 being flown to Japan by Pan American World Airways from Kennedy International Airport in a locked security pouch dis appeared Aug. 19, the police were notified yesterday by air line officials.

title: Trenny Robb Is Bride Of Robert Pforzheimer
description: Miss Marguerite Trenhoim Robb, better known as Trcnny Robb, the model, was married last Sunday to Robert Pforzheimer, a former stu dent at New York University. The Rev. Gerry Wrixson per formed the Protestant cere mony in the woods on the 20acre property the bride has rented for two summers in Rio, N. Y., north of Port Jervis.

title: EAST GERMAN EASING ON BERLIN RUMORED
description: BERLIN, Aug. 27  High ranking officials here and in Bonn said today that East Berlin had been leaking reports to the West that it planned major concessions on Berlin under which the 2.1 million West Berliners could cross the border wall to visit in the East.

title: Seven Arab States Meet to Counteract Cholera Outbreak
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Aug. 27 (Reuters)  Health ministers from seven Arab countries met here today to coordinate meas ures to combat the cholera outbreak in the region.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: SECURITY COUNCIL

title: TrashBasket Thefts Harassing City and Adding to Street Litter
description: The stealing of the city's trash baskets from street cor ners has become so widespread that there are now stretches of 6 to 10 blocks in the heart of Manhattan without a basket.

title: SHARE PRICES DIP ON LONDON BOARD
Coffee Conference In Quota Deadlock
description: LONDON, Aug. 27 (AP)Consumer nations in the inter national coffee talks rejected today a proposal to break the deadlock on export quotas for 197071 as Brazil angrily de nied charges that she was re sponsible for high world coffee prices.

title: ALGERIANS'
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 27 (Reuters) Two representatives of the International Federation of Airline Pilots Associations left today after failing to ob tain the release of two Algeri ans taken off a British airliner during a stopover at Lydda 13 days ago.

title: DOCTORS STAY OUT AT HOSPITAL HERE
description: Despite a court order served on radical groups at Lincoln Hospital yesterday, the 27 doc tors who are boycotting the hospital because of alleged in timidation by the radicals re fused to return to their jobs.

title: Sergei Vinogradov, 62, Dead; Soviet Envoy to Cairo and Paris
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27Sergei A. Vinogradov the Soviet Am bassador to the United Arab Republic, died here today, after a short illness, at the age of 62.

title: SUPPORTERS OF SST WAVER IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The supersonic transport appeared to lose more support in the [Senate today even as the Ad ministration put its star wit nesses in favor of the plane before the Transportation Sub committee of the Appropriations Committee.

title: Article 4  No Title
Article 3  No Title
Japanese Women Triumph
description: OSAKA, Japan, Aug. 27 (AP) Undefeated Japan stretched its winning streak to six games today with a 50 victory over New Zealand on the sixth day of the world women's softball championship. The favored United States, beaten once, topped Australia, 10. The Philippines beat Zambia, 70, and Mexico blanked Canada, 20.

title: Article 1  No Title
Upbeat in Central Park
description: As the summer began the morning line in Central Park looked good for the daily double of Puccini and Philharmonic but nobody was placing bets on the stay ing power of King Henry VI and Richard III. Now, as the summer rounds the last turn, New York is winding up with the greatest season of free entertainment the park's history.

title: Marguerite A. Salomon Is Dead; Helped Dutch Town After War
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 27 Marguerite A. Salomon, who became famous in the Nether lands for a World War II act of generosity, died Tuesday in Unitarian Universalist Home, where she lived. She was 82 vears old.

title: Holy Cross Gets Acting Dean
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Aug. 27 (AP)Holy Cross College an nounced today the appointment of the Rev. Joseph R. Fahey, 34 years old; assistant profes sor of economics for the last two years, as acting dean of the college.

title: ED ROMMEL DIES; PITCHING STAR, 72
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 27 (AP)Ed Rommel, who rose from a Baltimore sandlot to become a star American League pitcher and later was an umpire, died last night after a long ill ness. He was 72 years old.

title: Theater: Historic Staging of Dream
description: STRATFORD ON AVON, England, Aug. 27Once in while, once in a very rare while, a theatrical production arrives that is going to be talked about as long as there is a theater, a production that, for good or ill, is going to exert a major influence on the contemporary stage. Such a production is Peter Brook's staging of Shake speare's A Midsummer Night's Dream, which the Royal Shakespeare Company, introduced here tonight.

title: Drivers Pick Columbia George To Take $102,770 Cane Pace
description: YONKERS, Aug, 27  Stan ley Dancer is taking nothing for granted so far as Most Happy Fella and Saturday night's $102,770 Cane Pace at Yonkers Raceway are con cerned. Before Dancer flew to Indianapolis yesterday morn ing, he took the time to train Most Happy Fella two separate miles at his Egyptian Acres Farm at New Egypt, N. J. They were leisurely trips, the faster being clocked in 2:20.

title: SMUT LAW REPEAL FOR ADULTS BACKED
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP) Repeal of all United States) laws against pornography for adults, along with the enact ment of laws against exposure of children to obscene pictures, were among recommendations reportedly given final approval today by the President's Com mission on Pornography.

title: Boating Outlook
description: The United States Weather Bureau issued this forecast at 7 P.M. yesterday for New York Harbor, Long Island and nearby coastal waterss

title: Ban on FirstStrike Atom Attack Program Withdrawn in Senate
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Proposed legislation to bar the United States from developing missiles capable of making, nuclear first strike against con crete Soviet missile silos was dropped by its Senate sponsor today when defeat appeared certain.

title: Dining In? 2 Recipes Suggested
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: Vatican Weekly Counters Charges on Indian Nuns
description: ROME, Aug. 27 (AP)The Vatican published pictures and interviews today to counter what it described as an un worthy and scandalous cam paign in the press on allega tions that priests in India had sold girls to become nuns in European convents.

title: RAIL TONMILEAGE SHOWS A 0.9% DROP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage last week were both below the volume in the cor responding week of last year.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Surprise and a somewhat hostile response from some quarters were the reactions at the United Nations yesterday to the White House expression of willingness to join SovietAmerican security force in the Middle East. Informed diplomats said Israel would not accept Soviet or even American troops on her borders. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: City Smooths Way for New Food Stamp Program
description: Two municipal agencies and the city's local community cor porations mobilized forces yes terday in an attempt to head off trouble expected Monday when a new foodstamp pro gramaimed at increasing the poor's food money by 30 per centgoes into effect here;

title: Roundup: Gibson Bobs Up In Reach of No. 20 Again
description: Bob Gibson, almost base ball's forgotten man last spring after suffering a mus cle pull, reeled off his seventh straight victory yesterday as the St. Louis Cardinals halted the streaking Giants, 41, at San Francisco.

title: Terrorists Kill Argentine Union Head
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 27A major leader of Argentina's trade union movement was killed by a gunman this morn ing 100 yards from his home in suburban Blegrano.

title: Weekend Fishing and Boating
English Police Seize Arms In 50 Coordinated Raids
description: LONDON, Aug. 27The po lice announced today that they had seized machine guns, other firearms and explosives in 50 simultaneous raids in the Lon don area and throughout Eng land last night.

title: Honeywell Tells of Benefits in Link to G.E.
description: Honeywell, Inc., decided after lengthy studies that the acquisition of the General Electric Company's computer operations provided it with the best opportunity to ex pand its share of the market.

title: Truck Crash Snarls Traffic
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 27 (UPI)  A sevenhour traffic tieup resulted early today in the westbound, lanes of the Connecticut Turnpike when two tractor trailers collided and jacknifed.

title: Intrepid Beats Valiant and Leads in America's Cup Final Trials, 4 to 1
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 27 Eight GO VALIANT stickers appeared on the America's Cup buoy, nine miles at sea today, but once again it was Intrepid that went.

title: J. Sharon Kelly, 67 Debutante, Wed to William M. Kirschner
description: Miss J. Sharon Kelly, daugh ter of Mrs. Lester J. Kelly of New York and the late Mr. Kelly, was married at the Colony Club last evening to William Martin Kirschner, son of Dr. and Mrs. Benjamin Kirschner of Scarsdale, N.Y.

title: NASCAR Race Canceled
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Aug. 27 (UPI)A 150mile NASCAR Grand National race scheduled Sunday at Hilsborough, N. C., was canceled today.

title: MADISON BOMBING LINKED TO A GANG
description: MADISON, Wis., Aug. 27A selfstyled guerrilla group that calls itself the New Year's Gang reportedly claimed re sponsibility today for setting off the bomb that destroyed the Army Mathematics Research Center at the University of Wisconsin Monday, killing research student and injuring three other persons.

title: Jane's Sees Soviet Naval Gain Over U.S., Britain
description: LONDON, Friday, Aug. 28 (Reuters)The United States and British navies are falling below safety limits for their security while Soviet marine power seems to be rising to a flood tide in the nineteen seventies, the authoritative Jane's Fighting Ships reported today.

title: Money and Credit Growth Faster in Last Two Weeks
Marine Tells Court Vietnamese Deaths Were Not Murders
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, Aug. 27 (AP)  A marine private took the stand in his own defense today and denied that the 16 Vietnamese women and children he and his patrol killed last Feb. 19 were mur dered.

title: 2 Tank Cars Explode in Train Derailment Upstate
description: SOUTH BYRON, N. Y., Aug. 27  Two railroad tank cars, each carrying 30,000 gallons of a highly volatile and toxic sub stance known as vinyl chloride exploded a few miles from this farming village today when 28 cars of a Penn Central freight train were derailed.

title: BIG BOARD PAUSES TO CONSOLIDATE
description: The stock market moved yes terday through its third straight session of catch your breath on the heels of a dynamic ad vance that got under way last week.

title: BONDS ARE STEADY ON LIGHT VOLUME
description: The money and capital markets held steady yesterday, resting after their pronounced moves toward higher prices and lower interest rates earlier in the week.

title: Davis Out of Hospital
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Aug. 27 (UPI)Sammy Davis Jr. was released from Sunrise Hospital yesterday after treatment since the weekend for pneumonia. He was forced to delay a six week nationwide concert tour because of the illness.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: There are at least two major weaknesses in Senator Ful bright's recent Mideast pro posals. First, by advocating forced settlement as a last re sort, he ignores the psychologi cal imperative of having the Arab states go on record as accepting, on their own free will, the principle of Israel's ex istence as a state. Forced set tlements tend to create future outlets for emotional rejections of imposed treaties as dic tated solutions.

title: 4 Concerns'
description: The New York Stock Ex change announced yesterday that its board of governors had approved the listing appli cations of four companies, in cluding the Sony Corporation, which will become the first Japanese company listed on the exchange. Trading in Sony's American depositary shares is scheduled to begin on Sept. 17.

title: Exhibition Football
description: TONIGHT

title: A t Metro politan, New Alfresco Refuge
description: The second of two 160 footlong fountains that flank the new and imposing stone stairway to the main entrance of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, was finally turned on yesterday.

title: Fall River Water Curb Ends
description: FALL RIVER, Mass., Aug. 27 (UPI)A ban on using the city's water for human con sumption without first boiling it was lifted today after eight days. The ban had been put into effect because of the presence of a dangerous level of bacteria in the water sup ply. City officials said the bacteria count had been low ered to a safe level.

title: G. I.'s Now Wear a Lot the Army Didn't Issue
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 25WAR, says the metal disk on the necklace of a gungho marine, his face streaked with black and green greasepaint for reconnais sance.

title: Mrs. Roesler's Foursome Wins BestBall Golf on 73
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 27 Mrs. M. Stuart Roesler of Stanwich, Mrs. Harry M. Day of Woodway, Mrs. Carl T. Chadsey Jr. of Round Hill and Mrs. James R. Hand of Sleepy Hollow combined to card a 39, 3473 today at the Stanwich Club to win the bestballof foursomes championship of the women's Westchester and Fair field Golf Association by three strokes.

title: STEVE'S LARK WINS RACE AT SARATOGA
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 27  Steve's Lark, owned by Philip Wise, was rated ex pertly by Bob McDonald in the Promise Hurdle race for 3yearolds today, and won the turf event at a mile and seven eighths. Racing in third place most of the way, Steve's Lark improved just at the right time, at the final jump, and went on to score by 3 lengths over John U.

title: Bemis Guatemalan Venture
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Aug. 27 (UPI)The Bemis Company has announced it is joining Guate malan investors to build a cloth bagmaking factory in Guate mala in which Bemis will have a 49 per cent interest.

title: TOMBS POPULATION REPORTED DOWN 600
description: The city's Correction Com missioner, George F. McGrath, announced yesterday that the population of the Manhattan Men's House of Detention, the Tombs, had been reduced from 1,900 to approximately 1,300 since the riots there two weeks aeo.

title: Rosie the Preacher Arrested in Times Sq.
description: Rosie the Preacher, a fa miliar figure in Times Square, was arrested last night and charged with disorderly con duct when she refused a po liceman's order to move from the corner of Broadway and 49th Street.

title: National Health Insurance Proposed by 15 Senators
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27A bipartisan bill that would cre ate a comprehensive health in surance program for all Ameri cans at an estimated cost of, $40billion a year was intro duced in Congress today by 15 Senators.

title: SILVER
description: Silver futures continued to drop yesterday on the New York Commodity Exchange on no particularly bearish news. The December contract, the larg est with 1,315 sales, dipped to $1.8770 from $1.8960 the day before. The September con tract, with 623 sales, dropped to $1.8230 from $1.8420 an ounce. A total of 3,834 sales was consummated.

title: School Consolidations on Rise
description: RICHMOND, Kan.  Sandy Betz, a 17yearold, redhaired senior about to start her second year at a 20monthold consoli dated school here, paused dur ing enrollment one day last week to tell what the school meant to her:

title: Bich to Take the Helm Of French Yacht Today
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 27Baron Marcel Bich will sail France tomorrow against Gretel II of Australia in the fourth race of their America's cup challenge series.

title: Facts and Figures On Dow Jones Golf
description: Program18 holes today, tomor row and Sunday. In case of tie for first place after final round, a suddendeath play off will follow immediately.

title: 2 in New Zealand Sleep, Government Loses Vote
description: WELLINGTON, New Zea land, Aug. 27 (Reuters)The New Zealand Government tonight suffered its first parliamentary defeat in 40 years because two members of the governing National party slept through a rollcall vote.

title: Redskins Acquire Wright
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI)The Washington Red skins acquired Steve Wright, an offensive tackle today from the New York Giants, who placed him on waivers earlier in the week.

title: Soviet Agrees to Extend Term of Indonesian Debt
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27 (AP)Foreign Minister Adam Malik of Indonesia announced today that the Soviet Union had agreed to grant his nation 30 years to pay off an $800million debt in curred by Sukarno when he was President.

title: Officers Reported Executed For Corruption in Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Aug. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)  The Nigerian Chief of Staff, Brig. Hassan Katsina, said yesterday that a number of Nigerian Army officers had been ex ecuted in a widesweeping anti corruption drive.

title: Mrs. Eisenberg Is Married in Suburbs
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Aug. 27Mrs. Babette Regner Eisenberg, daughter of Rabbi and Mrs. Sidney L. Regner of New York, was married here this evening to Julian K. Melmed. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. David Melmed of Stamford, Conn.

title: Governors to Tour Ireland
description: TRENTON, Aug. 27 (AP)Gov. William T. Cahill an nounced today that he would tour Ireland next week with Governors John Dempsey of Connecticut, Warren P. Knowles of Wisconsin, Warren Hearnes of Missouri and David F. Cargo of New Mexico. The itinerary includes a visit with President Eamon DeValera and other government officials and busi ness and agricultural leaders in. Ireland. The trip is being spon sored by the Irish Agricultural Wholesale Society Limited.

title: Inquiry Calls on Citizens To Report Police Graft
description: Whitman Knapp, chairman of the special commission in vestigating charges of wide spread police corruption in New York, called on the public yesterday to report specific cases of police graft.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL Yankees vs. Minnesota Twins, twi lightnight doubleheader, at Yan kee Stadium, River Avenue and 161st Street, the Bronx, 5 P.M. (TelevisionChannel 11, 5 P.M.) (RadioWHN, 4:55 P.M.)

title: Puerto Ricans Pelt Hoboken Police
description: HOBOKEN, N. J., Friday, Aug. 28  Several hundred Puerto Rican youths hurled bottles and rocks at policemen, smashed several store windows and set trash fires in down town Hoboken last night, fol lowing the arrest of a popular Puerto Rican youth leader.

title: Forest Fires Spreading In State of Washington
description: WENATCHEE, Wash., Aug. 27 (AP)A 39,000acre fire in northcentral Washington burned wildly out of control today and a smaller fire threatened residences of about 800 persons as fire fighters strove to contain the blazes.

title: Troy Marine Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI) The Defense Department an nounced today that Cpl. John C. Hines, a marine, of Troy, N. Y., had been killed in action in Vietnam.

title: Market Place:
description: When the Nixon Adminis tration took up residence in Washington, It was widely assumed that a new cordial ity would crop up between the Government and the fi nancial community. After all, Richard M. Nixon had been a Wall Street lawyer, with of fices at 20 Broad Street, and a law partner named John N. Mitchell, now the Attorney General.

title: Mets Triumph Over Braves, 51, Behind the FiveHit Pitching of McAndrew
description: Having suffered through a couple of agonizing evenings against the Atlanta Braves, the New York Mets rediscovered the simple formula for victory yesterday in broad daylight at Shea Stadium.

title: M'COY TO BE TEACHER IN MASSACHUSETTS
description: AMHERST, Mass., Aug. 27 Rhody A. McCoy, the contro versial former administrator of the Ocean HillBrownsville Demonstration School District in Brooklyn, will join the Edu cation School of the Universi ty of Massachusetts in Septem ber as a parttime lecturer, it was announced here today.

title: U. S. SWIMMERS SET 4 MEET MARKS
description: TURIN, Italy, Aug. 27 (UPI)  The United States swimming team broke four meet records today and picked up eight more medals, five gold, in a dazzling performance at the sixth World University Games.

title: New Queens Vote Ordered For Liberal Party Chairman
description: Supreme Court Justice Moses Weinstein ordered the Queens Liberal party yesterday to hold a new election for county chairman.

title: DR. MARIE C. QUINN
description: SMITHTOWN, L. I., Aug. 27 Dr. Marie C. Quinn, who re tired in 1954 as principal of Public School 42, the Bronx, after more than 40 years as an educator, died yesterday in St. John's Smithtown Hospital. She was 86 years old and lived at 8 Noel Place.

title: TUBE PRICE RAISED BY AMERICAN CAN
description: The American Can Company said yesterday that it planned to increase prices on metal tube by 5 per cent beginning with shipments Oct. 1.

title: WIFE OF A PRINCIPAL IS MURDERED ON L.I.
description: NORTH VALLEY STREAM, L. I., Aug. 26The wife of the principal of a Brooklyn elemen tary school was found dead in her bed in her house here early this morning.

title: BigStore Sales Fell 6%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27The Department of Commerce re ported today that department store sales for the latest week ended Aug. 22 were an esti mated $701million, a decrease of 6 per cent below the $745 million sales for the corre sponding period last year. Total retail store sales for the latest week were an estimated $6, 869,000,000, an increase of per cent above the $6,667,000, 000 sales for the same period last year.

title: No American Mercenaries
description: Defeat of the Senate proposal to increase sub stantially the financial rewards for military service has removed the threat of a reform that would have made a bad situation worse. The obvious intent of the legislation, cosponsored by Senators Barry Goldwater and Mark Hatfield, was to let an all volunteer army in through the back door.

title: Article 2  No Title
Bridal for Karin Ann Lawrence
description: WEST ISLIP, L. I., Aug. 27 Miss Karin Ann Lawrence, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert T. Lawrence, was mar ried here this afternoon in the garden of her parents home to Peter Charles Sieg fried, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles M. Siegfried of New York and Bayport.

title: JOAN WHARTON
description: SAG HARBOR, L. I., Aug. 27 Joan Wharton, former letters editor of Newsweek magazine, died of cancer today at her mother's home here. She was 42 vearg old.

title: U.S. SEEKS CHANGES IN IMPORT OIL LAWS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP)  The Interior Depart ment proposed today changes in regulations to permit the sale of oil import allocations and licenses.

title: Reasor Fulfills Fondest Dream: Outplays Idol on Golf Course
description: CLIFTON, N. J., Aug. 27Sometimes a caddie dreams of the days when he can outscore the champion he admires most. It was one of those days at the $300,000 Dow Jones open that found Mike Reasor, the exbag toter, leading Arnold Palmer by seven strokes. 66 to 73.

title: Karen Chang Plans Nuptials in Honolulu
description: Miss Karen Y. T. Chang, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry K. C. Chang of Hono lulu, will be married in Hono lulu this afternoon to David Russell Liu of New York. He is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Arthur Liu of New York and Honolulu.

title: Quebec Union Office Bombed
description: QUEBEC, Aug. 27 (UPI)A bomb blew out the door and some windows of the offices of the Quebec Federation of Labor here today. The police said the device consisted of a halfstick of dynamite and a detonator.

title: Cinemabilia, in the Village, Traces History of Film
description: Turn into the quiet of Cor nelia Street, a few feet off a bustling intersection of Greenwich Village. Peer a hit. And there at No. 10, behind the Waverly Theater, is Cinemabilia, a small store where walltowall shelves bulge with books, magazines and mementos of the movies, past and present.

title: SESAME STREET IS GOING ABROAD
description: Sesame Street, the widely acclaimed television series for preschoolers, will be seen in English in more than 20 coun tries this year and plans are under way for foreignlanguage versions to be filmed overseas.

title: Advertising: Getty and DKG Seek New Look
description: The new advertising cam paign for the Getty Oil Com pany got under way last month and just this week had its introduction into New York. For those who have been folowing the recently completed change of the com pany's brand name from Fly ing A to Getty and the initial commercial showing the name being marched into town, this campaign will pro vide an understanding of its current approach to the mar ketplace.

title: U.S AIDE CAUTIONS ON TOXIC METALS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27Dr. Jesse L. Steinfeld, Surgeon General of the United States Public Health Service, said to day that the health effects of mercury, lead, arsenic, cadmi um, and other toxic substances in the environment were not a cause for hysteria.

title: Indian Children Find Words by Taking Pictures
description: SUPAI, ArizSixyearold Damon Watahomigie bent forward from the tiny chair in which he was sitting so he could reach the microphone of the tape recorder.

title: Agnew in Cambodia Talks With Lon Not After Saigon Visit
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Fri day, Aug. 28Vice President Agnew flewinto the capital of Cambodia today, presumably to assure the Government of Premier Lon Nol of United States support.

title: MISS WEINER RIDES 2 PONY CHAMPIONS
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 27 Cindy Weiner of Morrisville, Pa., scored an unusual double today when she rode the win ners of both the large and small divisions in the national pony hunter championships.

title: O'DWYER TO HEAD GOLDBERG DRIVE
description: Paul O'Dwyer, a leader of the Reform Democrats in the state, was named New York City campaign manager yester day for the statewide Demo cratic ticket headed by Arthur J. Goldberg.

title: Transplant Success Story
description: A Junior high school teacher in Indianapolis, Louis B. Russell Jr., gained a historic distinction the other day. He became the first man in history to live for two years with a transplanted heart.

title: Nation's Measles Cases for 70 Double Figure for Last 2 Years
description: Measles, a disease that three years ago was thought to be on the verge of eradication, has begun an ominous climb.

title: DR. CHARLES ADLER, HISTORY PROFESSOR
description: Dr. Charles C. Adler, pro fessor of history at Hamilton College, died Monday in Mos cow after a brief illness. He was 47 years old and lived in Clinton. N. Y.

title: South Vietnamese Election Sunday to Test Buddhist Strength
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 27The campaign work ers sat around the table at par ty headquarters. Their leader urged them on and advised that they concentrate on areas where we have support, and forget the others. On the walls were charts of key voting dis tricts, next to the party's sym bol, the Star of Bethlehem.

title: Lefton Campaign Gives Bonuses on Both Ends
description: That ad placed in The New York Times and Philadelphia Inquirer by the Al Paul Lefton Company at the beginning of the year has paid offor has it?

title: HIJACKING FOILED ON POLISH PLANE
description: WARSAW, Aug. 27 (UPI)A 27yearold man with a bomb attempted to hijack a Polish LOT airliner to Vienna yes terday, but the explosive went off in his hands, the Polish press agency P.A.P. said today.

title: WHITNEY DARROW
description: FAIRFIELD, Conn., Aug. 27 Whitney Darrow, former ex ecutive vice president of Charles Scribner's Sons, publishers, died today at the Carolton Convales cent Hospital here. He was 89 years old.

title: Times Erred in Report On Soviet Missile Test
description: Because of an editing error, an article in the New York Times yesterday incorrectly stated that Secretary of De fense Melvin R. Laird had an nounced the first tests of war heads on Soviet SS11 missiles.

title: Books of The Times
description: J. M. Barrie's reputation has so dwindled that Janet Dunbar's study of the man be hind the image suffers from our ignorance of what that image was during his life time. It is startling to read that when the author of Peter Pan was divorced in 1909, a letterwhose 10 signers in cluded Henry James, Arthur Pinero and H. G. Wellswent to the editors of leading newspa pers admonishing them that his work in fiction and the drama has given pleasure of a high order to hundreds of thou sands of readers and spectators wherever the Eng lish language is spoken.... There fore it is hoped that the press, as a mark of respect and gratitude to a writer of genius, will in ab staining from any mention of the case beyond the briefest report of the hearing.

title: Stone Draws Laver As First Opponent In U.S. Open Tennis
description: Allen Stone studied account ing before he decided to be come a tennis professional but the 25yearold Australian doesn't figure to get much of chance at the $160,000 in prize money from the United States Open championships, which begin next Wednesday at the west Side Tennis Club, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Chrysler Shows 2 New Models
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 27The Chrysler Corporation unveiled two new models in the inter mediate and compact price range for 1971 today but showed no.new small cars, which the rest of the industry predicts will be the biggest sellers next year.

title: Chicago TearGas Incident Prompts Protest by Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (Reu ters)The Soviet Union pro tested to the United States to day over an incident in Chicago last night in which tear gas grenades exploded during a per formance of the Moiseyev Dance Company.

title: Survey Details Outsiders'
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Aug. 27The residents of Harlem own almost half the structures in their community but less than a sixth of the total as sessed valuation of the proper ties, according to a study made available here today.

title: Eliot Feld Leads His Early Songs At Dance Festival
description: Lieder are sacred to some people, but Eliot Feld can take them lightly or seriously, de pending on his own puckish ear. In Early Songs he collects gaggle of Richard Strauss's into a ballet of uneven but nearly always inventive flow. The American Ballet Company pre sented the work last night on the second program of The New York Dance Festival at the Del acorte Theater in Central Park.

title: Hurok Plans for Debut Of Bolshoi Opera Here
description: Sol Hurok, the wellknown Importer of musical caviar, is bringing the Bolshoi Opera to New York for its first visit to this country, and he just knows he is going to lose money on it. I'm doing this out of my love and affection for the Bolshoi, not to make Money, the ('2yearold im presario said upon his return from Japan, where he had seen the Soviet company in action and arranged details of the New York visit.

title: MRS. MEIR TO JOIN U.N. CELEBRATION
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 27Pre mier Golda Meir said tonight that she would go to New York late in October to join in cere monies marking the 25th anni versary of the United Nations.

title: More Cases in Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 27 (Reu ters)The number of confirmed cholera cases in Israel rose to 16.

title: AMY LANE, 17, WINS ORCUTT GOLF PRIZE
description: HAWORTH, N.J. Aug. 27For the third year in a row, Amy Lane, 17 years old, of Navesink, N.J., won the 11th annual Maureen Orcutt junior golf trophy at the White Beeches Golf and Country Club today.

title: Johnson Is 62
description: STONEWALL, Tex., Aug. 27 (AP)Former President Lyndon B. Johnson observed his 62d birthday quietly today with only his family and a few close friends at the LBJ Ranch, 65 miles west of Austin..A public celebration of the birthday is scheduled Saturday. Mr. John son also will appear tomorrow night at a seminar on the na tion's economy for 250 invited businessmen and students.

title: LAYER ADVANCES AT MARLBORO NET
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Aug. 27Rod Laver and Mrs. Mar garet Smith Court, the topseed ed players in the $25.000 Marl boro open tennis tournament, advanced to the singles semi finals with brilliantly executed victories today at the Orange Lawn Tennis Club.

title: Mrs. McGrath Posts a 72 In Match Play Against Par
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Aug. 27  Mrs. Gordon McGrath of Piping Rock, posted a 34, 3872 today to win the Women's Long Island Golf Association match play against par tourna ment, 1 up. Second place went to Mrs. Rundlet Blakemore of Piping Rock. Play was over the par 36, 3773, 5,589yard Hunt ington Country Club course.

title: Polio Case in San Antonio
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Aug. 27 (UPI)The first case of para lytic polio in San Antonio since June, I968, was reported today in the midst of a diphtheria epi demic. The 72d confirmed case of diphtheria this year, the 12d this month, was reported today.

title: Denver: The Voices of the West
description: DENVER  Going West in America these days, one is startled by the power and di versity of the nation. Every year it seems a little more crowded, a little more irritable, and a little more ugly than before, but somehow it seems to exist apart from all its man made storms, as elemental and eternal as the sea.

title: COAST TRIAL TOED OF 2D CRIME SCENE
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 27 Los Angeles policemen recalled today at the murder trial of Charles M. Manson the scene they encountered last August at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Leno LaBianca.

title: Copter Toll Put at 30
description: SAIGON, Aug. 27 (AP)Only two Americans were reported today to haVe survived the crash yesterday of an Army Chinook helicopter carrying 27 infantrymen and a crew of five.

title: Premier Hails Economy
description: PRAGUE Aug. 27 (Reuters)Premier Lubomir Strougal said today that the Czechoslovak economy was steadily improv ing. He cited as evidence the strengthening of the Koruna on foreign black markets.

title: U. S. Feelers Reported
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 27Western diplomatic sources here said today that the United States had undertaken feelers with the Egyptian, Jordanian and Israeli Governments about the possibility of a Soviet American force in the area.

title: FILM GUILD VOWS AID FOR CHICANO IMAGE
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 27 (UP1)The Screen Actors Guild promised yesterday to help Chicanos improve their image in American movies.

title: MARVIN LEONARD, BACKED BEN HOGAN
description: FORT WORTH, Aug. 27 (UPI)Marvin Leonard, who built an $835 bankroll into a profitable department store, grubstaked Ben Hogan's first try at pro golf and founded two of the country's top golf courses, died yesterday. He was 75 years old.

title: SHELBY M. HARRISON, RUSSELL SAGE AIDE
description: Shelby M. Harrison, retired consultant in the social sciences and for many years affiliated with the Russell Sage Founda tion here, died yesterday in Midtown Hospital. He was 89 years old and lived at 370 Riv erside Drive.

title: COMMODITIES RISE ON CHICAGO BOARD
description: Corn, wheat and soybeans futures prices bounded upward yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade after having dropped sharply the day before. The rise did not occur, however, until shortly before midday after an early weak opening due largely to reports of good weather in the growing areas.

title: Rockefeller Fetes Latin Beauty to Cries of Viva!
description: Governor Rockefeller rolled out the red carpet yesterday for Miss Universe  Marisol Malaret, who had been Miss Puerto Rico. The Governor's hospitality cost about $15,000 of his own money.

title: Problems Here Driving Many Abroad
description: Pushed by the problems of daytoday living here, and pulled by the promise of more satisfying way of life abroad, many of New York's most capable citizens are giv ing up their jobs, careers, homes and friends to resettle oveseas.

title: Besieged Hospital Head
description: If it were not for militants among the people of the South Bronx, Dr. Antero La cot might not be administra tor of Lincoln Hospital.

title: BEAM QUESTIONS A CITY CONTRACT
description: The legality of the Lindsay administration's granting $4.6million management con tract without public bidding or a public hearing to the Insti tute of Public Administration was questioned yesterday by Controller Abraham D. Beame.

title: Miss Blumenthal's Hunter Gains Lead at Horse Show
description: RHINEBECK, N. Y., Aug. 27 Naomi Blumenthal's Persist ence captured a class over fences and finished second in the hack event to take the lead for the regular working hunter championship today at the Dutchess County horse show.

title: White House Room Painted
description: SAN. CLEMENTE, Calif., Sept. 29 (AP)  Repainting of the White House Dining Room has been completed. The painters took advantage of the absence of President Nixon to get some needed refurbishing done. The announcement was made Wednesday.

title: Job Growth in Suburbs Breeds New Commuter
description: The traditional travelcy cle of the commuterfrom suburb to city and back to suburbis being changed by the movement of industry out of New York City.

title: Head Start Called Divisive by Chief In a Reform Plea
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI)  Head Start and oth er programs strictly for the poor cause social polariza tion and backlash because they exclude the middle class, the new Head Start di rector, Edward F. Zigler, cairl today.

title: Premature Congratulations
description: The $100,000 survey of the city subway system by four foreign transit experts, just initiated by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, would inspire greater confidence if the visiting consultants had been more restrained in their initial praise of the system.

title: India Ponders Nuclear Tools
description: NEW DELHI (UPI)India is considering the use of under ground nuclear explosions for peaceful purposes, but has no plans to develop nuclear weap ons, Prime Minister Indira Gan dhi said today.

title: Bogs Outpoints Finnegan
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Aug. 27 (AP)  Tom Bogs of Denmark retained his European middleweight boxing title to night by outpointing Chris, Finnegan of Britain in a 15 round bout. Bogs weighed 163 pounds, Finnegan 161.

title: ECONOMIC GAUGE FOR JULY SHOWED STRONG INCREASE,
description: WASHIGTON, Aug. 27 The Government's composite in dex of leading indicators of the economy showed last month its first strong rise in more than a year, the Commerce De partment reported today. It was another in a recent series of encouraging economic reports, including those on prices, pro duction, interest rates and for eign trade.

title: DEBUTS AT BALLET IMPRESS AUDIENCE
description: An especially receptive audi ence that knew what it liked and knew its dancers packed the State Theater last night for New York City Ballet program that was marked by a plethora of auspicious debuts.

title: Ethiopians Are Suspicious of Big U. S. Radio Base
description: ASMARA, Ethiopia, Aug. 18 There are no missiles, no nuclear weapons, no heavy ar tillery and no dangerous explo sives of any kind on Kagnew Station, according to a United States Information Service pamphlet distributed here.

title: Khrushchev Is Back Home
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 27 (UPI)Nikita S. Khrushchev, the for mer Soviet leader, left the Kremlin hospital today after a threemonth bout with a heart ailment. A black chauffeur driven Volga carrying his wife, Nina Petrovna, took him to his country home at PetrovoDal neye, 25 miles west of Mos cow.

title: Rockefeller Bars Use of Mafia Term By State Agencies
description: ALBANY, Aug. 27Gover nor Rockefeller directed state law enforcement agencies to day to avoid the use of such words as Mafia and Cosa Nostra when discussing organized crime.

title: Steady Work Agrees With Otis
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 27When Amos Otis saw his for mer manager, Gil Hodges, at the AllStar Game last month, Hodges wished him luck in his job as center fielder of the Kansas City Royals.

title: Unpaid Wages Collected
description: More than $1million in wages due some 13,300 work ers was collected by the State Department of Labor in the first six months of 1970, Gover nor Rockefeller announced yes terday. The WOrkers were re imbursed for minimum wage underpayments, claims for un paid wages, wage supplements or benefits and underpayments on public work projects.

title: Students in Bolivia Seek to Halt Government's Rightist Trend
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Aug. 27Students have taken increas ingly to demonstrating and guerrilla fighting since President Alfredo Ovando Candia elimi nated leftists from his Cabinet earlier this month.

title: If You Don't Like Duck, Order Goose
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated jour stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: SUGGESTION BY ES. ON MIDEAST FORCE RECEIVED COOLLY
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 27The expression of willingness by the United States to join the Soviet Union in forming a security force for the Middle East brought a surprised and somewhat hostile response at the United Nations today.

title: RICHMOND IS DENIED STAY ON BUSING PLAN
description: NORFOLK Va., Aug. 27 (AP)  A Federal judge rejected today the city of Richmond's plea for a stay in carrying out a school desegregation plan calling for extensive busing, but said he did not think racial balance in public schools ought to be required.

title: S.E.C. Charges Companies In Virginia With Violations
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (UPI) The Securities and Exchange Commission filed a complaint today in United States district court seeking to enjoin three Alexandria, Va., companies and two individuals for alleged vio lations of Federal securities laws.

title: Clifford Lewis. 3d Weds Mrs. Bullitt
description: WESTON, Vt., Aug. 27Mrs. Virginia Gibson Bullitt, widow of James B. Bullitt Jr. of Swarthmore, Pa., and Clif ford Lewis 3d of Media, Pa., were married here at noon yesterday in the Londonderry Chapel of St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church.

title: C.A.B. Rejects a Plan On Atlantic Fare Rise
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (AP)The Civil Aeronautics Board rejected today an in ternational airline agreement that would have increased North Atlantic oneway fares by $5 and roundtrip fares by $10.

title: Dr. Giuseppe Cirincione, Professor of Dermatology
description: Dr. Giuseppe Ciriricione, a dermatologist and former pro fessor of dermatology at New York University Medical School, died yesterday at Physi cians Hospital in Queens after a long illness. He was 88 years old and lived at 3521 80th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: JERSEY ADVANCES TO SERIES FINAL
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Aug. 27 (AP)  A fourrun uprising in the fourth inning gave Wayne a 40 victory over Highland, Ind., today and put the Jersey team into the Little League World Series title game.

title: MARK SET IN VALUE OF NEW SECURITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (Reuters)  The Securities and Exchange Commission said to day that new corporate securi ties offered for cash sale in the United States had risen to a record value of $10.5billion in the second quarter from $7.977billion in the first quarter.

title: Judge in Panther 13 Case Allows Guns as Evidence
description: State Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh ruled yester day that a number of pistols, rifles and explosives could be used as evidence in the forth coming trial of 13 Black Panth ers charged here with a con spiracy to bomb public places.

title: Canadian Bill Rate Down
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 27 (Canadian Press)The Government auc tioned today 8150million of 91day Treasury bills at an average price of 98.644 and an average yield of 5.51 per cent, compared with last week's 98.617 and 5.62 per cent.

title: U.S. COMBAT TOLL LOWEST SINCE 66
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 27  The United States command reported today that 52 Americans died in combat in Indochina last week, for the lowest toll in three and a half years.

title: Bruce Attends Talks
description: PARIS, Aug. 27Xuan Thuy, Hanoi's chief delegate to the Vietnam peace talks, who re turned here yesterday after threemonth absence, stayed away from today's session of the negotiations.

title: JEROME S. HESS, 88, LAWYER FOR MEXICO
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 27Jerome Sayles Hess, lawyer who represented the Mexican Government in the United States for more than 50 years, died at his home here today. He was 88 years old.

title: 60 DISRUPT TAPING OF GRIFFIN SHOW
description: Nearly 60 demonstrators dis rupted the taping of the Merv Griffin Show last night in pro test over what they said was not enough use of black jazz musicians on television enter tainment shows.

title: PLAYERS SUPPORT SYRACUSE COACH
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 27 (AP)The 68 members of the Syra cuse University football team, all but two of them white, walked off the practice field today in an apparent symbolic counterboycott to one staged earlier in the year by sus pended black players.

title: Customs House Evacuated
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 27 (AP)The United States Cus toms House, which houses the Department of Agriculture and other Federal agencies, was evacuated shortly before noon today because of a bomb scare. Fire and police units searched the emptied premises after telephone warning and found no explosive device

title: Unueilings
description: LEVINEBenlamin Harris. Tne unveiling of a monument in the loving memory of B. H. Levine will take place on Sunday, 11 A.M., August 30th at Union Field Cemetery, Cypress Hills Ave., Brooklyn. Path 6.

title: Executive Changes
description: Nicholas J. Campbell Jr., president and a director of Esso Europe, Inc., has been elected a director and senior vice president of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey).

title: WOUNDING OF POLICE CALLED DASTARDLY
description: Police Commissioner Howard R. Leary condemned as sense less and dastardly yesterday an apparently unprovoked early morning Queens gunfight in which two patrolmen were wounded and one of the assail ants was killed.

title: Walinsky Says Governor Aids Backers on CivilService Jobs
description: Adam Walinsky, Democratic candidate for State Attorney General, charged yesterday that the Rockefeller adminis tration had filled safetyinspec tor positions through political referrals from union leaders supporting Governor Rockefel ler's reelection.

title: Bridge:
description: The 1971 world team cham pionship for the Bermuda Bowl will be played in Tai wan, and for the first time there will be two teams rep resenting North America.

title: Notre Dame Football Has a New Look
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Aug. 27 Walt Patulski wasn't cer tain what Coach Ara Parse ghian would say. His hair wasn't really that longhe didn't want to look like a football freak with one of those skin cutsand he felt the sideburns would fill out his 6foot 6inch, 250pound frame.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The America's Cup literally lacks a bot tom. Yachtsmen have been pouring mil lions into it for a century, the latest being such diverse types as Marcel Bich of France, the ballpoint baron, and Charlie Morgan Jr., a nice guy from Florida who did finish last.

title: Nixon, Daughter and Aides Fly to Los Angeles for Gala
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 27 (UPI)  President Nixon and 27 Cabinet officials and wives flew here today from the Western White House for dinnerreception followed by an evening of light opera at the Music Center.

title: Benzell Resigns L.I. Post
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Aug. 27Mimi Benzell, former Metro politan Opera soprano, has re signed her post as director of the Nassau County Office of Performing and Fine Arts, but will continue in an advisory capacity in the area of pro graming, County Executive Eu gene H. Nickerson announced today. The reason for Miss Benzell's resignation was given as personal.

title: FATHER WALLACE, EXCHAPLAIN, DIES
description: The Rev. Edward A. Wallace, Roman Catholic chaplain in both World Wars, died Wednesday at Madonna Residence, 1 Pros pect Park West, Brooklyn. He was 85 years old.

title: DUKE POWER BUYS 2 COAL COMPANIES
description: The Duke Power Company announced yesterday that in an effort to guarantee coal sup plies for its power plants it has acquired two coal com panies and has agreed to joint financing of a third mine.

title: Southern Carriers Decry Plea for RailRate Rise
description: Southern railroads believe that the decision by Eastern and Western railroads to seek a 15 per cent freightrate in crease now from the Interstate Commerce Commission is com pletely wrong in timing.

title: Egyptian Complaint Noted
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (Reu ters)  The State Department said today that the United Arab Republic had formally com plained to the United States about what Cairo termed an Israeli violation of the Middle East ceasefire agreement.

title: BRAZIL SENTENCES 11 IN ABDUCTION CASE
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 27A Brazilian Army court sen tenced II persons to prison terms tonight after finding diem guilty of taking part in the kidnapping last September of C. Burke Elbrick, then the United States Ambassador.

title: SUIT FILED HERE ON AGNEW WATCH
description: A California doctor who says he originated the Spiro Agnew watch has filed suits against S. Klein Department Stores, Inc., and a watch company here alleging that they have infringed on his copyright on a caricature of the Vice President by selling their own such watches.

title: Court Aide Warns Of Backlog Crisis
description: The administrative judge of the Manhattan and Bronx dis trict of State Supreme Court warned yesterday of an im pending crisis in the admin istration of justice in the two boroughs because of huge back logs of civil and criminal cases.

title: Court Tells Florida Cemetery to Bury Black G.I.
description: MIAMI, Aug. 27  A Federal District Court here today or dered a cemetery in Fort Pierce to accept for burial the body of a black Vietnam veteran whose coffin had been turned away because of a charter that restricted the cemetery to whites.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: Palestinian Parley Hears Pleas for Continued War
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Aug. 27Arab commandos, their sympathizers and the Governments of Syria and Iraq called today for continued guerrilla raids on Israel. Amid signs disarray within the comman do movement, they convened here for a council of war.

title: Clean Car Race
description: The Clean Air Car Race, for all the suggestion of a stunt about it, is neither a campus caper nor farout demonstration. The contest, featuring 42 vehicles driven by college students and supposedly innocent in varying degree of polluting the air, is sponsored by the Massachusetts Institute of Tech nology and the California Institute of Technology. Representatives of the electric power, natural gas and oil industries have been working closely with the drivers, who left Cambridge Monday.

title: 2d Avenue Subway to Get Just 3 Stops North of 57th
description: The Transit Authority reluc tantly disclosed yesterday that it did not plan to construct a station at 42d Street on the new Second Avenue subway and that there probably would be only three Manhattan stops north of 57th Street.

title: A Givenchy Shop: Not Custom, But...
description: His clothes do not cause a lot of fireworks, but they're the kind that send subtle shivers up the spines of his wealthy admirers. Yesterday there were a lot of shivers at Bergdorf Goodman when the readytowear collection of Hubert de Givenchy was modeled to celebrate the opening of the store's new Givenchy Nouvelle boutique. The 6 foot6inch Frenchman (he stayed in Paris) appeared to have come through again for his fansmost of whom are tall, skinny and over 35. There were few pieces in the collection that weren't elegant, ladylike or masterfully turned out. It's his usual understated Newport look, commented one im pressed observer after the show in the second floor boutique.

title: France's Discount Rate Is Cut to 7.5% From 8%
description: PARIS, Aug. 27The Bank of France lowered its discount rate today from 8 per cent to 7.5 per cent in a move to ease credit restrictions and stimulate the economy.

title: Reasor, Former Caddie for Palmer, Leads Dow Jones Golf by Stroke With 66
description: CLIFTON, N. J., Aug. 27It wasn't Arnold Palmer but one of his former caddies, handsome Mike Reasor, who led with a 66 as the world's richest golf tour nament, the $300,000 Dow Jones open, was launched to day.

title: Swift &
description: Diversification was mainly responsible for the 29 per cent profit increase of Swift & Co. in the third fiscal quarter ended. Aug. 1 and the 31.5 per cent gain realized in the ninemonth period, Robert W. Reneker, president of the world's largest meat packing operation, re ported yesterday.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Panel Backs Subsidy Ceiling
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 27 (UPI) The Senate Agriculture Com mittee tentatively approved to day a Housepassed: ceiling of $55,000 a crop on annual sub sidy payments to big farmers who grow cotton, wheat and feed grains.

title: McLucas Panel Retires 2d Night After Juror Falls Ill
description: NEW HAVEN, Aug. 27A second day of deliberations in the trial of Lonnie McLucas was abruptly halted today when the jury foreman inform ed Superior Court Judge Harold M. Mulvey that one member of the panel was sick.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE AS VOLUME SLIPS
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange moved ahead again yesterday but at a slightly slower pace than earlier in the week.

title: Marion Jordan Will Be Bride Of Chester Lay
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 27Miss Marion Lans ing Jordan and Chester Nim itz Lay, grandson of Mrs. Chester W. Nimitz of Berke ley, Calif., and the late Fleet Admiral Nimitz, have become engaged.

title: PLOHN RECEIVER ASKED BY S. E. C.
description: Charles Plohn & Co. and the First Devonshire Corporation, two financially troubled brok erage houses that were sus pended from membership in the New York Stock Exchange last week, were charged yesterday by the Securities and Exchange Commission with various vio lations of securities laws.

title: PHYSICIAN ASSAILS SLUMPLAN DELAY
description: The city was accused yester day of contributing to the de cay, suffering and misery of thousands of slum residents by delaying for four months the final authorization of a pilot program to train superintend ents to work in Harlem tene ments.

title: Staff of the U.S. Mortuary in Vietnam Works With Care and Reverence
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 27  Helicopters and planes still arrive daily at remote corner of Tansonnhut Airfield carrying the bodies of United States soldiers, sailors and airmen.

title: MAX M. MATSON, 69, A BUSINESS BROKER
description: ASBURY PARK, N. J., Aug. 27Max M. Matson, a business broker of 375 Park Avenue New York and the president of Paul Hardeman, Inc., a construction company, died yesterday appar ently of a heart attack at the Hollywood Golf Club in Deal. He was 69 years old and lived here at 510 Deal Lake Drive and in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: BOILER INSPECTION UNDER WAY HERE
description: Benjamin Altman, the city's Commissioner of Rent and Housing Maintenance, wriggled into a cramped boiler room yesterday in the basement of a decaying tenement in China town.

title: Lewis Hand Morris, 26, Son of Newbold Morris, Dies
description: BERKELEY, Calif.  Lewis Hand Morris, grandson of the late Judge Learned Hand and son of the late Newbold Mor ris, New York political figure and former City Commissioner of Parks, was found dead in his apartment here yesterday after noon. He was 26 years old.

title: 2 BLASTS DAMAGE CAROLINA SCHOOL
description: A North Carolina school scheduled for desegregation was rocked by two explosions early yesterday. Meanwhile at torneys in Virginia and Florida prepared to ask the Supreme Court for stays of integration directives.

title: Soft Drink Additive Is Given a Reprieve
description: The Food and Drug Adminis tration, in response to the wishes of food manufacturers, has approved the special, con tinued use in soft drinks of food additive that the agency declared in January to be no longer generally recognized as safe for use in food.

title: U.S. Lifts Ban on Sale of Oil To Ships Bound for China
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (Reuters)  The State Depart ment said today that the Unit ed States was no longer pro hibiting American oil subsidiar ies broad from supplying fuel to ships of other nations bound for Communist China.

title: Pennsy Asks Court to Allow $45Million Deferral of Taxes
description: Trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company asked the Federal District Court in Philadelphia yesterday to permit them to defer payment of some $45million in state and local property taxes that have become payable since June 21 or will become due by Dec. 31. The railroad went into reorganization un der the Federal bankruptcy laws on June 21.

title: The Race for Clean Air
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 28No properly buttoneddown Detroit executive would probably admit it, but the automobile industry's collaboration in the current crosscountry clean car race hardly implies a dilution of its allegiance to the muchderided gasoline engine. For nearly decade the auto manufacturers have had a collec tion of unconven ?? powered cars that have been trotted out whenever public clamor for fumefree engines reached a new crescendo. The collection was ceremonially dis played in front of the Capitol in Washington once in the John son Administration. Another show was put on a year ago near the Western White House in California.

title: Boy Found Dead in Bathtub
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y., Aug. 28 (AP)An electric radio appa rently fell into a bathtub today, electrocuting Patrick Richmond, 17 years old, who was in the waterfilled tub.

title: KNOWLES INCREASES TITLE SAILING LEAD
description: ROCKPORT, Mass., Aug. 28 Durward Knowles of Nassau lengthened his lead in the North American Star Class champion ship today by winning the fourth race. The former world and Olympic champion now leads Joseph R. Duplin of Win throp, Mass., also a former world champion, 207202.

title: Westport Bill Is Changed
description: Phil Ford and Mimi Hines have canceled their scheduled appearance next week at the Westport Country Playhouse in Connecticut because Miss Hines has been taken ill. The Pro ducing Managers Company has replaced the comedy team with a production of Arthur Miller's The Price, starring Douglas Watson, Joseph Buloff, Billy Miller and Carle Bensen.

title: AUTO PRODUCTION RISES IN WEEK
description: DETROIT, Aug. 28 (AP)The tempo of auto production picked up considerably in the nation's auto plants this week as manufacturers stepped up production schedules of 1971 cars.

title: Quest for Mideast Peace Returns to Rhodes Plan
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 28On the 38th floor of the Secretariat building here formula first employed on the Island of Rhodes more than two decades ago is in use again in an attempt to bring peace to the Middle East.

title: GLAMOUR STOCKS PACE MARKET RISE
description: The stock market, basking in the glow of improved investor confidence, turned strong again yesterday after three days of consolidating its recent ad vance. Numerous glamour is sues scored multipoint gains.

title: FUND WILL AID FIGHT ON DRUNKEN DRIVING
description: A $70,000 grant to help con tinue a study to improve high ways safety has been awarded to Arizona State University by PPG Industries Foundation of Pittsburgh.

title: Israelis Report Killing 13 Guerrillas
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 28  An Is raeli spokesman said today that 13 Arab guerrillas were killed during the night as they at tempted to penetrate Israel from Lebanon and Jordan.

title: Rollei to Make Cameras in Asia
description: BRAUNSCHWEIG, West Ger many. Aug. 28After years of avoiding conflict, Rollei Kam erawerke of Braunschweig has thrown down the gauntlet to its formidable Japanese competi tbrs. At a news conference yes terday, marking the 50th anni versary of Rollei Camera Works founding, its director, Heinrich Peesel, disclosed that his com pany would soon start fighting the Japanese with their own principal weaponlow labor costsby transferring part of its production to Singapore.

title: Thailand Says She'll Withdraw All 11,000 Soldiers in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 Thailand has informed the United States that she intends to withdraw her 11,000man force from South Vietnam, the State Department said today.

title: Wary Police Capture Shifty 7Ft. Intruder
description: A sevenfoot snake was re moved to an A.S.P.C.A. shel ter early today after spend ing several hours locked in topfloor bathroom last night, having first been cornered by a police sergeant who re sponded to a call by residents of the building at 170 West 108th Street.

title: P.B.A. Suggests Patrolmen Draw, Then Ask Questions
description: The Patrolmen's Benevolent Association has recommended that its members draw first and ask questions later, the P.B.A.'s president, Edward J. Kiernan, said yesterday.

title: 26 Are Arrested In Suffolk In Two Narcotic Raids
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Aug. 28State troopers and members of the Suffolk County District At torney's office arrested 26 per sons late last night and early today in drug raids.

title: Youth Arrested in Omaha In Slaying of a Policeman
description: OMAHA, Aug. 28A 16yearold member of an offshoot or ganization of the Black Panther party was arraigned here today on a first degree murder charge and ordared held without bail in the boobytrap killing Aug. 17 of an Omaha policeman.

title: BIG FOUR DELEGATES MEET WITH JARRING
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 28  Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations special representative for the Middle East, held conferences yesterday and today with diplo mats from the Big Four powers in connection with his new round of peace efforts.

title: C.A.B. AIDE URGES AIRLINES'
description: Approval of the merger of Trans Caribbean Airways into American Airlines was rec ommended yesterday by a Civil Aeronautics Board examiner in Washington.

title: A U.S. Bank Opens First Israeli Office
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 28Israel got its first American bank this month.

title: Miss Barbara J. Guldi Betrothed
description: WESTHAMPTON BEACH, L. I., Aug 28Mr. and Mrs. Walter E. Guldi have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Jane Guldi, to David E. Mc Intyre, son of Mr. and Mrs. James W. McIntyre of Ap pleton, Wis.

title: CHLOROFORM USED IN WOMAN'S DEATH
description: MINEOLA, L.T., Aug. 28 An autopsy today determined that Mrs. Joan Holder, 41 years old, who was found dead in bed by her husband in their Valley Stream home yesterday, was asphyxiated and had traces of chloroform in her body.

title: ... New Revenue for the States
description: Contrary to Representative Byrnes, President Nixon's plan to share Federal revenues with the states is no gimmick. It is an essential reform if the Federal system is to survive.

title: Offering by Fidelco Is Only New Issue; Four Are Canceled
description: Although market conditions improved this week, only one company felt that the time was opportune to try and sell its shares to the public for the first time, according to a week ly survey of newissue under writers.

title: PRICES ARE DOWN ON LONDON BOARD
LIEBES IN A MOVE TO PAY ITS DEBTS
description: The first sizable business fail ure in the current, prolonged slump in retailing was an nounced yesterday in San Fran cisco when one of that city's oldest specialty store chains, H. Liebes and Company, filed Chapter XI petition under the Bankruptcy Act in Federal Court.

title: Letters to the Editor of The Times
description: To the Editor: Arthur Goldberg's comments about buying up the private lands in the Adirondack Pre serve [news report Aug. 12] lose some of their political ap peal when held up to close scrutiny.

title: BLASINGAME GAINS FOURHIT TRIUMPH
description: BOUSTON, Aug. 23Another host from the past of the New York Mets  the pitcher special practice is beat ?? them  emerged in the strodome tonight and dealt ?? a painful 21 defeat.

title: Mansfield Urges Inquiries On Rail Freight Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23 (UPI) The Senate Democratic lead er, Mike Mansfield, called today for both a Congressional and Presidential inquiry into higher freight rates proposed by rail roads. The roads are seeking an across the board increase, re ported to be about 15 per cent above current levels, for all commodities.

title: News Summary and Index
description: In the strongest Soviet support given yet to the current Middle East peace efforts, Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Communist party leader, told an audience in Soviet Kazakh stan yesterday that the ArabIsraeli talks must go on without new provocations and subterfuges designed to circumvent or vio late the ceasefire agreement and despite the opposition of some Arab militants. [Page 1, Column 8.1

title: Clingan Criticizes Liberal For Women's Rights View
description: Eldon R. Clingan, the City Council minority leader, yester day chastised a fellow Liberal councilman, Alvin Frankenberg of Queens, for neanderthal at titudes toward the women's equal rights movement.

title: TANNEN'S INJURY POSTPONES TEST
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 28Steve Tannen's heel injury has added to the uncertainty in the New York Jets defensive back field.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
NIXON AIDE SCORES SST TEST DESIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 Dr. Richard L. Garwin, a mem ber of the White House Science Advisory Committee, who has persistently challenged the Nix on Administration's supersonic transport program, said today that the test models now be ing built would cost the Gov ernment up to 40 per cent more than the target $1.3bil lion. But he said the models would still prove useless in re solving questions about the plane's affect on the environ ment.

title: Color Copier Machine Devised
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28A new electrostatic color printer transfers images by shooting powdered inks through the air onto plain paper without contact or pressure. Samuel B. McFarlane Jr., president of Elec troPrint, Inc. Palo Alto, Calif., will receive Pat ent 3,532,422 on Oct. 6. It will complement three pat ents he was granted several years ago for a black and white electrostatic printer. His company, assisted by the Stanford Research Institute under contract, is developing both machines. So far as Mr. McFarlane knows, his is the only electrostatic color print er, and indeed the only color printer that operates on plain paper.

title: SALE OF YEARLINGS BRIDGES THE OCEAN
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 28  A special sale of yearlings conducted simultan eously at Deauville, France, and the Humphrey S. Finney Pavil ion here attracted 150 spectat ors at this end of the opera tion yesterday.

title: South African Area Flooded
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Aug. 28 (UPI)Torrential rains flooded droughtparched rivers in South Africa today, cutting off the coastal city of East London and causing death and destruction over a wide area.

title: Miss McQueen And a Student Are Wed Here
description: The Roman Catholic Church of St. Thomas More was the setting here yesterday for the marriage of Miss Kathleen Suzanne McQueen, a senior at Cornell University, to Harry Tipper 3d, a member of the class of 2 at Cornell's School of Architecture. The Rev. John Calhoon performed the ceremony.

title: Cabbies Mass to Mourn a Slain Driver
FD Capital Fund Charged On Security Law Violations
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday author ized the FD Capital Fund to suspend the redemption of its outstanding redeemable securi ties and to postpone the date of payments for shares sub mitted for redemption, but upon which payment had not been made.

title: Moody, on Record 64, Ties Crampton and Harney for Dow Jones Lead at 136
description: CLIFTON, N.J. Aug. 28 They honored Orville Moody in Oklahoma two weeks ago as the Indian of the Year. Today in the second round of the $300,000 Dow Jones open, the former Army Sergeant, who is threesixteenths Choctaw and was born in Chickasaw, Okla., scored a record eight underpar 64 to share the 36 hole lead at 136 with Paul Harney and Bruce Crampton.

title: St. Louis Fires Injure 14
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 28 (AP)More than a dozen fires, some! of them apparently the work of, arsonists, broke out in the St. Louis area early today, injuring) 14 persons. Twelves of the fires were concentrated in a small area of suburban Maplewood and two adjoining blocks of the city. A few hours earlier in suburban East St. Louis. across the Mississippi River, a fire caused damage estimated at $15,000. Firemen said it was an arson case.

title: PIPELINE CONCERN FORMED IN ALASKA
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 28 (AP)Tile formation of a new corpo ration to build and operate the $900million, 800mile Trans Alaska Pipeline System was an nounced today.

title: Pirates Lose Ellis for Year
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 28 (AP) The Pittsburgh Pirates win ningest pitcher, Dock Ellis, is lost for the rest of the season, the club announced tonight. Dr. Joe Finegold, club physician,] said Ellis had an elbow injury that might require surgery. Ellis's record is 129.

title: Ad Lib Jazz Concert at MUSE Proves a Surprising Success
description: Because the Jazz concerts at MUSE, Bedford Street and Lin coln Plaza in Brooklyn, are played by volunteer groups booked two months in advance, lastminute conflicts between commerce and contributed serv ice are apt to occur. The fort nightly concerts are free.

title: Exploratory Phase Seen in Peace Talks
description: PARIS, Aug. 28  The Viet nam peace talks appear to have entered a new exploratory phase as a result of the ap pointment of David K. E. Bruce as chief United States nego tiator.

title: Johnson Aides Criticize Nixon Policies
description: STONEWALL, Tex., Aug. 28 Two top economic advisers of the Johnson Administration aimed a lowkey attack tonight at the economic policies of President Nixon.

title: DANIEL TROTZKY, 66, LED JEWISH GROUPS
description: Daniel Trotzky, who recently retired as president of Roose velt School in Stamford, Conn., a preparatory board school, and who was a longtime leader in Jewish community affairs, died Wednesday at his home, 27 West 86th Street. His age was 66.

title: U.S. Extends I.T.T. Contract
description: I.T.T. Federal Support Serv ices, Inc., announced yesterday receipt of a fiveyear extension on its contract for support serv ices at the Atomic Energy Com mission's Hanford, Wash., plant. Estimated total cost of the con tract for the period is $75mil lion. The company, a subsidiary of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, has provided such services at Han ford since March 1, 1966.

title: Richey Pitted Against Kuhnke in Davis Cup Today
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 28Cliff Richey, whose tennis record and reputation have been con firmed on slow clay courts, will make his Davis Cup challenge round debut tomorrow amid much speculation. The question remains: Can Richey conquer a fast asphalt surface and the formidable southpaw serve of Christian Kuhnke?

title: 3 Airlines Join to Request Flight Cuts on 15 Routes
description: Trans World, United and American Airlines asked the Civil Aeronautics Board yesterday to let them enter into joint agreement to reduce their flights on 15 major United States air routes. If the re quest is approved, it would be the first time that the Govern ment had permitted the air lines to decide among them selves to reduce competitive flights.

title: Army Finds a War Veteran Is Only 15
description: FORT CARSON, Colo., Aug 28 (UPI)Walter Lee Martin became a soldier when he was 12 years old.

title: A BABCOCK PARTNER PENALIZED BY AMEX
description: The American Stock Ex change announced yesterday that Francis R. Santangelo, a member of the exchange and a partner of L. D. Babcock & Co., had been suspended from membership for 14 days and fined $10,000 for acts detri mental to the interest and wel fare of the exchange.

title: ALBERT SCHANZER, RETIRED JUSTICE
description: Former Justice Albert D. Schanzer, who retired from Special Sessions Court here in 1961, died Thursday in Nassau Hospital, Mineola, L. I., after a short illness. He was 80 years old and lived in East Williston, L. I.

title: Steelers'
10 PLACES IN LA PAZ STRUCK BY DYNAMITE
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Aug. 28Ten dynamite explosions rever berated across La Paz last night in an apparent campaign of guerrilla terrorism.

title: 2 Killed and 4 Hurt in Blast At Army Arsenal in Virginia
description: RADFORD, Va., Aug. 28 (AP) The Radford Army Arsena was rocked early today by an explosion that killed two em ployes, injured four other work ers and caused damage esti mated at $200,000.

title: Maria Langmuir, 66 Debutante, Is the Fiancee of W. S. Herrick
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 28Mrs. Peter Bulkeley Langmuir of Milwaukee and East Chop, Martha's Vineyard, Mass., has announced the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Maria Adams Langmuir, to William Sebring Herrick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Beck with Herrick of Weston, Mass., and East Chop.

title: The Happy Campaigner
