title: Burma's Army Fights ChinaBacked Rebels
description: RANGOON, Burma, Aug. 23 Rebel forces sponsored by the Chinese Communists have made a border region of north eastern Burma a major battle ground, inflicting heavy casual ties on Government forces in three battles since May.

title: Abraham Zapruder Dies
description: DALLAS, Aug. 30 (UPI)Abraham Zapruder, the only person to take motion pictures of the assassination of Presi dent Kennedy, died today of cancer at Presbyterian Hos pital here. He was 66 years old.

title: Packers Overcome Raider Team, 377, In a Ragged Contest
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 30 (AP)The Green Bay Packers raced to a 240 firstperiod lead and went on to trounce the Oakland Raiders, 377, in a ragged National Football League preseason game tonight.

title: CARDS TRIUMPH, 21, ON LEE'S HOME RUN
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 30 (AP) Leron Lee slammed a two run homer today and Steve Carlton pitched a threehitter as the St. Louis Cardinals topped Los Angeles, 21, to sweep the threegame series from the Dodgers.

title: Agnew the Diplomat
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Aug. 30  Top Administration offi cials here at the Presidential compound are, of course, happy with the good news Vice Pres ident Agnew is apparently bringing home from his Asian tour.

title: SIDNEY M. SHELDON
description: Sidney M. Sheldon, a teacher of mechanical drawing and mathematics at Samuel Gom pers Vocational and Technical High School, the Bronx, died Saturday in his home at 1025 Gerard Avenue, the Bronx. He was 65 years old.

title: Ta Wee Heads List For Fall Highweight At Belmont Today
description: Thoroughbred racing returns to Belmont Park today with the $25,000 Fall Highweight Handicap at six furlongs head ing the openingday program of the 42day meeting.

title: U.S. TRIUMPHS, 9080, OVER CUBAN FIVE
description: TURIN, Italy, Aug. 30 (UPI) The United States and the Soviet Union posted semifinal basketball victories at the sixth World University Games today but a new political snag involv ing Israel marred the competi tion.

title: LANCERS AND DARTS TO MEET IN PLAYOFF
description: The Rochester Lancers and the Washington Darts, who both joined the North American Soccer League last year, have triumphed in the Northern and Southern Divisions, respective ly, and will meet in a two game playoff for the league title.

title: French Skipper Says Rules on Safety Were Violated
description: NEWPORT, R.I., Aug. 30Baron Marcel Bich, the presi dent of the French Association for the America's Cup, formally accused the International Race Committee today of dishonor ing him and his 12Meter yacht, France, by allowing last Friday's race to continue under illegal conditions.

title: Sports of
Blight on the Corn
description: Unlike most of the world's population, Americans take it for granted that their farms will produce an abundance of food each yearso much so that farmers receive Federal subsidies to produce less than they might. Against this background, it was a shock this month to learn that the nation's corn crop Is under attack by a virulent fungus, the Southern corn leaf blight, which may cut total yield by 20 to 50 per cent.

title: COLUMBIA OPENS UNIT ON LIBRARY SERVICES
description: An agency for the develop ment of more effective library services for the disadvantaged and handicapped across the country has been established at Columbia University.

title: Namath Makes First Appearance in 2d Period as Vikings Rout Jets, 5221
London's Chinatown Is Busy and Growing
description: LONDON, Aug. 30  Along Gerrard Street, the smell of pickled ginger and roast duck ling seeps from restaurant doors. The men scurry into stores for afternoon games of fantan and mahjongg. A lilting twang of Chinese rock n roll envelops the downtown street.

title: Mets Lose to Astros, 95, and Drop to 3d Place
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 30The be wildered New York Mets sank a little deeper, without know ing exactly at the moment how much deeper, as they lost again to the Houston Astros today, 95.

title: By Jove, the Monocle Has Returned
description: LONDON  The monocle, which enjoyed its highest vogue in the pages of Victo rian novelists, is back in fa vor here.

title: In Selassie's Ethiopia, Muted Voices Urge Change
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Aug. 18Awake, oh people, awake! the darkrobed chorus cries. But everyone sleeps on, and only a nervous figure, symbolizing time, continues to move.

title: BIG BOARD SEEMS HEADED FOR TRIAL
description: The old question as to whether the New York Stock Exchange is subject to anti trust laws appears to be headed for a court trial in Milwaukee.

title: HUNTER STUDIES ROLE OF STUDENTS
description: A special facultystudentad ministration committee has been given the mission of re vamping the facultydominated governing structure of Hunter College by its president, Mrs. Jacqueline Wexler.

title: Justice Margett of Queens To Be Administrative Judge
description: Supreme Court Justice Charles Margett of Queens has been named administrative judge of the Supreme Court for Queens County, the 11th Judicial District.

title: 1,000 AT PROTEST IN PORTLAND, ORE.
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Aug. 30About 1,000 persons turned out today to march through down town Portland in the widely heralded Victory to the Viet namese People parade and to protest the American Legion national convention in progress here.
